无论是心理学家还是哲学家（这篇评论也是专门针对他们的——1959 [1957]:28）都不会难以看出乔姆斯基的批判对于当代心理观点的意义。对于语言学家来说，情况就不那么明显了。首先，布洛赫斯有射击偷猎者的传统，许多人可能很乐意为新人参与这项运动而欢呼，痛打一位大胆在语言学家的保护区内打猎的大牌心理学家；发表这篇评论的布洛赫“对这项建设性破坏的出色工作感到高兴”（Murray, 1980:80）。更重要的是，心理学对大多数布洛赫斯来说基本上是边缘学科。例如，值得注意的是，没有其他语言学家评论过《言语行为》，这本书是在乔姆斯基遭到猛烈抨击的两年前出版的。而乔姆斯基攻击的建设性部分，即真正威胁到布卢姆菲尔德假设的部分，在 1959 年仍然有些不定形。刺激贫乏早已是语言中众所周知的事实（惠特尼曾经观察到，儿童通常“只得到最粗糙、最贫乏的指导”—1910 [1867]:12），但围绕这一观察建立一个积极的计划却是一件新鲜事。

Neither psychologists nor philosophers (to whom the review is also pointedly addressed—1959 [1957]:28) would have had any difficulty seeing the significance of Chomsky’s critique for contemporary views of the mind. With linguists, the matter isn’t so clear. For one thing, Bloomfieldians had a poacher-shooting tradition, and many were probably happy to cheer an up-and-comer’s participation in the sport, thrashing a big-shot psychologist with the audacity to hunt in the preserve of linguists; Bloch, who published the review, “delighted [in] this superb job of constructive destruction” (Murray, 1980:80). More importantly, psychology was largely peripheral for most Bloomfieldians. It is noteworthy, for instance, that no other linguist reviewed Verbal Behavior, which was published two years before Chomsky’s bludgeoning. And the constructive part of Chomsky’s assault, the part that really threatened Bloomfieldian assumptions, was still somewhat amorphous in 1959. Poverty of stimulus has long been a well-known fact of language (Whitney had observed that children generally “get but the coarsest and most meagre of instruction”—1910 [1867]:12), but building a positive program around that observation was something new.

乔姆斯基开篇缓慢。他以刺激贫乏论证结束了对斯金纳的批判，但他对行为主义学习理论的替代线索充其量也只是具有启发性：

Chomsky started slowly. He ended his tanning of Skinner with the poverty of stimulus argument, but his clues for a replacement to behaviorist learning theory are suggestive at best:

所有正常儿童都能以惊人的速度掌握本质上相当复杂的语法，这一事实表明，人类在某种程度上是专门为做到这一点而设计的，具有处理数据或“制定假设”的能力，其特征和复杂性尚不明确。（1959 [1957]：57）

The fact that all normal children acquire essentially comparable grammars of great complexity with remarkable rapidity suggests that human beings are somehow specially designed to do this, with data-handling or “hypothesis-formulating” ability of unknown character and complexity. (1959 [1957]:57)

乔姆斯基补充道

Chomsky adds the invitation that

语言结构的研究最终可能会对这个问题产生一些重要的见解。

The study of linguistic structure may ultimately lead to some significant insights into this matter.

因此，他以某种方式和未知的性格明确表明，现在大门已经打开，任何有勇气追随他的人都可以探索心理结构。这扇门为年轻一代敞开，但对老一代来说，它还没有关闭。自布隆菲尔德在语言和心智方面超越萨丕尔以来，乔姆斯基的评论以最清晰的措辞恢复了心理主义，但它并没有详细阐述乔姆斯基对心理结构的看法和斯金纳的看法之间的本质区别。当他在接下来的几年里阐明这些差异时，这些差异直指布隆菲尔德主义者对科学的描绘，因此，也直指他们自己作为科学家的描绘。

And he thereby—with his somehow and his unknown character—makes it clear that the door is now open, for anyone bold enough to follow him through, on the exploration of mental structure. The door is open for a younger generation, but it is not yet closed on the older one. Chomsky’s review rehabilitates mentalism in the clearest terms since Bloomfield eclipsed Sapir on language and the mind, but it does not spell out in any detail the essential differences between Chomsky’s view of mental structure and Skinner’s view. These differences, when he does spell them out over the next few years, cut to the very bone of the Bloomfieldians’ picture of science; therefore, of themselves as scientists.

与此同时，布卢姆菲尔德派还有比乔姆斯基被剥皮更令人担忧的事情1959 年，莫里斯·哈勒 (Morris Halle) 出版了《俄语声音模式》 (Sound Pattern of Russian)，这一年，行为主义巨龙诞生。

Meanwhile, the Bloomfieldians had more to worry about than Chomsky’s skinning of the behaviorist dragon in 1959, the year Morris Halle published his Sound Pattern of Russian.

莫里斯·哈勒和音素

Morris Halle and the Phoneme

我可以很好地与变革论者相处，直到他们攻击我的挚爱——音素。

I could stay with the transformationalists pretty well until they attacked my darling, the phoneme.

阿奇博尔德·希尔

Archibald Hill

乔姆斯基于 1951 年结识了莫里斯·哈勒。在随后的几年——也是他成长的关键时期——他们“成为了亲密的朋友，交谈无休止”（Chomsky, 1979 [1976]:131）。和乔姆斯基一样，哈勒也是个局外人。虽然他十几岁时就来到美国，后来又在哈佛大学获得博士学位，但他的知识遗产——尤其是“结构主义者”的含义——更多的是欧洲而非美国。当然，他从未在布鲁姆菲尔德的主流中畅游，甚至涉足过。他的博士学位是在伟大的布拉格学派结构主义者罗曼·雅各布森 (Roman Jakobson) 的指导下获得的，他从雅各布森那里继承了心理主义和对意义的某种友好态度（哈勒在这两个领域对乔姆斯基的影响很可能比人们普遍认为的要大得多，尽管乔姆斯基也与雅各布森有大量的直接接触）。他的论文是关于古老的欧洲语言俄语的语音系统；书中没有美洲印第安人的命令，也没有为了描述而描述的冲动，而且它出版时（1959a [1958]）的书名有意向布卢姆菲尔德的部分竞争对手萨丕尔致敬。哈勒在进入语言学领域之前也曾学习过一段时间的工程学，因此他的背景中也有数学学的兴趣，就像乔姆斯基一样，超出了大多数美国语言学家的兴趣。

Chomsky met Morris Halle in 1951. They “became close friends, and had endless conversations” over the next several—extremely formative—years (Chomsky, 1979 [1976]:131). Like Chomsky, Halle was something of an outsider. Although he came to the U.S. as a teenager and later earned his doctorate from Harvard, his intellectual heritage—especially what it meant to be a “structuralist”—was much more European than American. Certainly he never swam, or even waded, in the Bloomfieldian mainstream. His doctorate was under the great Prague School structuralist, Roman Jakobson, from whom he inherited both mentalism and a certain friendliness to meaning (Halle’s influence on Chomsky in both these areas was very likely much more substantial than has generally been appreciated, though Chomsky also had a great deal of direct contact with Jakobson). His thesis was on the sound system of a venerable European language, Russian; there was no Amerindian imperative, no description-for-the-sake-of-description compulsion, and it was published (1959a [1958]) under a title that paid deliberate homage to Bloomfield’s partial rival, Sapir. Halle had also studied engineering for a while before entering linguistics, so there were mathematico-logical interests in his background, as in Chomsky’s, beyond those of most American linguists.

他帮助乔姆斯基在麻省理工学院获得了职位。他还在麻省理工学院建立了一个变革性研究小组，然后建立了语言学博士课程（由电气工程系赞助），最后建立了一个独立的语言学系，他成为该系的首任系主任。他与乔姆斯基一起首次明确挑战了正统派——一篇关于英语重音现象的论文，挑战了布鲁姆菲尔德关于音系独立于其他语法过程的批判性假设（Chomsky, Halle 和 Lukoff，1956 年）。17

He helped Chomsky get his position at MIT. He was also instrumental in establishing first a transformational research group there, then a doctoral program in linguistics (under the auspices of Electrical Engineering), and finally an independent linguistics department, of which he became the first chair. And he joined Chomsky in his first clear challenge to the orthodoxy—a paper on English stress phenomena which challenged a critical Bloomfieldian assumption about the independence of phonology from other grammatical processes (Chomsky, Halle, and Lukoff, 1956).17

最重要的是，至少在 20 世纪 50 年代末的短时期内，当乔姆斯基语言学在辩论中取得进展时，哈勒提出了一个论点。

Most importantly, at least in the short run of the late 1950s, when Chomskyan linguistics was gaining its polemical stride, Halle had an argument.

这一论点对布隆菲尔德纲领的基石——音素——具有极大的腐蚀性，许多语言学家，无论是当时还是现在，都认为它具有绝对的破坏性。对于 20 世纪 60 年代早期新兴的乔姆斯基主义者来说，这一论点——或者，正如萨多克后来（1976 年）所称的，哈勒三段论——具有图腾性，是一个清晰而现实的标志，表明即使是最受尊重、最令人印象深刻、最受喜爱的布隆菲尔德成果，也是由未经烧制的粘土制成的。对于 20 世纪 60 年代早期日渐衰落的布隆菲尔德主义者来说，这一论点恰恰相反，是对科学之美的绝对和毫无根据的敌意的标志，它为这一新运动赢得了他们永恒的敌意。布隆菲尔德反抗运动由此开始。

The argument is highly corrosive to a cornerstone of the Bloomfieldian program, the phoneme, and many linguists, then as now, regarded it as absolutely devastating. For the emerging Chomskyans of the early sixties, the argument—or, as Sadock later called it (1976), the Hallean syllogism—was totemic, a clear and present sign that even the most respected and impressive, the most beloved, of Bloomfieldian results, was made of unfired clay. For the fading Bloomfieldians of the early sixties, the argument was exactly the inverse, a sign of absolute and unwarranted hostility to an object of scientific beauty, and it earned the new movement their undying enmity. The Bloomfieldian resistance movement begins here.

布卢姆菲尔德派不能宣称对这个音素拥有独占所有权。它反音素理论在欧洲喀山和布拉格逐渐成型，大约与在美国成型的时间相同，其影响线相当复杂。但反音素理论是他们的宠儿。乔姆斯基和哈勒像斗牛犬一样追逐反音素理论（他们的学生利斯也是如此，他在 1957 年 LSA 年会上首次介绍了哈勒的反音素论证）。

The Bloomfieldians could not claim sole proprietorship over the phoneme. It crystallized in Europe, in Kazan and Prague, about the same time it was crystallizing in America, and the lines of influence are quite complicated. But it was their darling. Chomsky and Halle went after it like pit bulls (as did Lees, their student, who gave the first presentation of Halle’s anti-phoneme argument at the 1957 LSA Annual Meeting).

哈勒的论证是对布隆菲尔德音系学基石的一次令人印象深刻、极具说服力、不屑一顾的攻击，但它本身既不足以激怒语言正统的捍卫者，也不足以说服一群革命者。然而，它并不是独立的。它伴随着一种优雅的新音系学，哈勒在对“俄语中高度复杂的音系关系模式”的成功处理中展示了这种音系学的优点（安德森，1985：321）。负面论证的保质期很短，无论信念和演说能力如何，如果它们没有积极的计划，就很难获得广泛的认同。事实上，纯粹的负面修辞只要求一种非常弱的认同形式——一种异议的共识，一种认为某事是错误的共同协议，但没有一个明确的纠正方法。爱因斯坦和薛定谔对亚原子行为概率模型的攻击充满激情、雄辩且论证严密，但如果玻尔的成果被推翻，他们也无法提供任何与之相媲美的方案。他们的论证失败了。科学家需要做点什么。哈勒为新一代人提供了一些事可做。

Halle’s argument is an impressive, persuasive, dismissive assault on a cornerstone of Bloomfieldian phonology, but it was neither powerful enough on its own to cheese off the guardians of linguistic orthodoxy nor compelling enough on its own to win over a band of revolutionaries. It was not, however, on its own. It came with an elegant new phonology, whose virtues Halle demonstrated in a winning treatment of the “highly complex patterns of phonological relationships in Russian” (Anderson, 1985:321). Negative arguments have a very short shelf-life, and, regardless of conviction and oratorical prowess, if they don’t come with a positive program, there is little hope for widespread assent. Indeed, only a very weak form of assent is called for by an exclusively negative rhetoric—a consensus of dissent, a communal agreement that something is wrong, without a clear idea of how to put it right. Einstein and Schrödinger, as passionate, eloquent, and sharply reasoned as their attacks on probabilistic models of subatomic behavior were, had no remotely comparable program to offer if Bohr’s work had been overturned. Their arguments failed. Scientists need something to do. Halle gave the new generation something to do.

此外，乔姆斯基和哈勒都坚持认为，这种新的音系学是整体的一部分。如果你喜欢句法，而且很多人都喜欢，那么你就必须学习音系学。

Moreover, this new phonology, Chomsky and Halle both insisted, was part of a package. If you liked the syntax, and many people loved it, you had to take the phonology.

此时，保守派已经惊恐地意识到，他们确实是保守派，乔姆斯基、哈勒、利斯和其他 MITniks（这是一代人对他们的嘲讽）想要将他们推到一边。特雷格和史密斯对布隆菲尔德音系学（实际上是布隆菲尔德音位学；自 50 年代以来，甚至连这个称号都变了）的编纂有一些松散的环节，也许还有一些吱吱作响的滑轮，但他们认为，这是语法必须建立的基础。即使是对这种音系学相当苛刻的斯莱德，也在他的教科书中将其与弗里斯的语法拼接在一起（1959 年），斯托克韦尔在 1958 年也提议将其与乔姆斯基的语法联系起来（Hill，1962c：122）。哈勒的《俄语声音模式》和乔姆斯基 1959 年对哈勒作品的介绍——再次在德克萨斯——完全排除了这种拼接的可能性。要么全有，要么全无。

At this point, it was teeth-rattlingly clear to the old guard that they were, in fact, the old guard, that Chomsky, Halle, Lees, and the other MITniks (as the generationally charged term of derision tagged them) meant to shove them aside. Trager and Smith’s codification of Bloomfieldian phonology (actually, Bloomfieldian phonemics; even the label has changed since the fifties) had a few loose belts, perhaps some squeaky pulleys, but it was the foundation upon which they thought syntax would have to be built. Even Sledd, who was fairly harsh about that phonology, spliced it to Fries’s syntax for his textbook (1959), and Stockwell had proposed hitching it to Chomsky’s syntax in 1958 (Hill, 1962c:122). Halle’s Sound Pattern of Russian, and Chomsky’s presentation of Halle’s work in 1959—again at Texas—ruled this splicing out completely. It was all or nothing at all.

当然，布隆菲尔德派对此无动于衷。整个反音位论证仅基于很少的零碎数据——四个词，在哈勒的原始陈述中（1959a [1958]：22-3），在乔姆斯基更著名的陈述中（1964d [1963]：88-90；1966b [1964]：78-82）——这似乎不足以让二十年的努力付诸东流，而且在哈勒将其用于攻击之前，这些数据就已经存在问题。霍克特大喊，哈勒音系学“彻底破产了”（1968 [1966]：3；1965 [1964]：201-2）。“比‘破产’更糟糕！”特雷格插话说：“一个梦幻般的虚无缥缈之地的产物”（1968：80）。他们觉得音素给他们带来的表现力比它付出的代价要多，他们不愿意因为一个小小的异常而抛弃它。更不合理的是，哈勒音系学也大量借鉴了雅各布森的作品，而布鲁姆菲尔德派与布拉格学派一直存在敌意。但乔姆斯基派认为该论点绝对具有压倒性——主要是因为它嵌入在精心开发和全面的音系学理论中，该理论与他们的句法工作更相符（它被称为生成音系学，与句法转换非常相似）。

The Bloomfieldians, of course, were unmoved. The whole anti-phoneme argument rests on only a very few scraps of data—four words, both in Halle’s original presentation (1959a [1958]:22–3), and in Chomsky’s more famous representations (1964d [1963]:88–90; 1966b [1964]:78–82)—which hardly seems warrant enough to throw out twenty years of effort, and the data was known to be problematic before Halle worked it into his assault. Hallean phonology, cried Hockett, was “completely bankrupt” (1968 [1966]:3; 1965 [1964]:201–2). “Worse than ‘bankrupt’!” Trager chimed in: “a product of a fantastic never-never land” (1968:80). They felt that the phoneme bought them more expressiveness than it cost, and were unprepared to discard it on the basis of a minor anomaly. Less rationally, Hallean phonology also borrowed rather heavily from Jakobson’s work, and the Bloom fieldians had a history of antagonism toward the Prague Circle. But the argument was considered absolutely crushing by the Chomskyans—primarily because it was embedded in a carefully developed and comprehensive phonological theory which fit more closely with their syntactic work (it was called generative phonology and had very close parallels to syntactic transformations).

第一个齐心协力的反击来自弗雷德·豪斯霍尔德 (Fred Householder)，他是转换句法的最早支持者之一，在印第安纳大学教授转换句法，并实施了许多早期创新。但他对这种新音系学划清了界限，在 1965 年出版的带有生成性的新版《语言学杂志》创刊号上发起了一次文质彬彬、恶毒的攻击。

The first concerted counterattack came from Fred Householder, one of the earliest supporters of transformational syntax, teaching it at Indiana and implementing a number of early innovations. But he drew the line at this new phonology, launching an urbane and nasty assault in the inaugural number of the new generative-flavored Journal of Linguistics (1965).

剑桥大学对此作出了立即的反应（首篇文章刊登在同一期刊的下一期），广泛而激烈的反应（Chomsky and Halle，1965）。18这篇文章几乎是 Householder 原批评的两倍长，充斥着隐晦的人身攻击。实际上，更准确地说，应该称其为人身攻击——对男性的攻击——因为 Householder 经常被认为是布鲁姆菲尔德式的愚昧代表（第 103、105、106、107n4、109n6、……页）。Chomsky 和 ​​Halle 认为 Householder 及其同流派不了解语言学家“或者物理科学家”所面临的问题的性质（104）。他们把他假装的谦逊（Householder 经常对 Chomsky 和 ​​Halle 的论点表示困惑）反过来攻击他，暗示他无能（119、127、129n26）。他们像训斥小学生一样训斥他（“再重复一遍显而易见的事情……”——127n24；另见 103、133n27、136）。他注意力不集中（126、127、128n25）。他很困惑（各处）。他甚至不理解萨丕尔关于“音素的心理现实”的经典论文（136；Sapir, 1949b [1933]：46–60）。他总是自相矛盾，“像豪斯霍尔德这样愿意接受不一致的说法——事实上，声称这种不一致是无法消除的——的语言学家……已经放弃了试图找出关于特定语言或一般语言的事实”（106）：他甚至不是在做语言学。这是数字命理学（108）。

The response from Cambridge was immediate (the lead article in the very next number of the very same journal), extensive, and brutal (Chomsky and Halle, 1965).18 It is almost twice as long as Householder’s original critique, and brimming with thinly veiled ad hominems. Actually, it would be more accurate to call them ad homineses—attacks to the men—since Householder is recurrently taken to represent overall Bloomfieldian blockheadedness (pp. 103, 105, 106, 107n4, 109n6, …). Chomsky and Halle suggest that Householder and his ilk don’t understand the nature of problems confronting the linguist, “or, for that matter, the physical scientist” (104). They turn his mock-humility (Householder regularly expresses puzzlement over Chomsky and Halle’s arguments) back against him, implying incompetence (119, 127, 129n26). They hector him like a schoolboy (“To repeat the obvious once again …”—127n24; also 103, 133n27, 136). He is inattentive (126, 127, 128n25). He is confused (passim). He doesn’t even understand Sapir’s classic paper on the “Psychological Reality of Phonemes” (136; Sapir, 1949b [1933]:46–60). He trucks with inconsistencies, and “a linguist, who, like Householder, is willing to accept inconsistent accounts—in fact, claims that such inconsistency is ineliminable—has … simply given up the attempt to find out the facts about particular languages or language in general” (106): he isn’t even doing linguistics. It is numerology (108).

Householder 立刻作出了答复，但答复简短而乏味，只发表了一份两页的政策声明，重申了一些先前的观点，完全忽略了 Chomsky 和 ​​Halle 的论点。Hockett (1968 [1966]:4n3) 认为这个答复已经足够了，Trager 也赞同地引用了 Hockett 的话，并略微责备 Householder 认真对待 Halle 的作品，并首先对其进行了评论 (1968:79, 80)。但 Chomsky 主义者和大多数非 Bloomfield 观察家认为此事已经结束：Chomsky 和 ​​Halle 受到了挑战，他们回应了挑战，并彻底击溃了反对派。19新的音系学由此诞生，而布卢姆菲尔德学派最神圣的财产之一——音素，则被贴上了毫无价值的标签。

Householder answered right away, but briefly and anemically, giving only a two-page policy statement reiterating some earlier points and wholly ignoring Chomsky and Halle’s arguments. Hockett (1968 [1966]:4n3), for one, thought the reply sufficient, and Trager quotes Hockett approvingly, with a slight reproof to Householder for taking Halle’s work seriously enough to dignify it with comment in the first place (1968:79, 80). But Chomskyans, and most non-Bloomfieldian observers, considered the matter closed: Chomsky and Halle had been challenged, they answered the challenge, and completely dumbfounded the opposition.19 The new phonology was here to stay and one of the Bloomfieldians’ most sacred possessions, the phoneme, was tagged as a worthless trinket.

还有更多。

There was more.

招募祖父

Enlisting the Grandfathers

在我看来，传统的分析显然是正确的，而语言学的严重问题不是发明一些新颖的、毫无根据的替代方案，而是提供一个原则基础来解释正确的传统分析。

It seems to me that the traditional analysis is clearly correct, and that the serious problem for linguistics is not to invent some novel and unmotivated alternative, but to provide a principled basis to account for the correct traditional analysis.

诺姆·乔姆斯基

Noam Chomsky

句法结构对布卢姆菲尔德纲领不构成威胁，因此当乔姆斯基出面应战时，在 1958 年德克萨斯会议（几个新兴句法纲领特意组织的竞赛）上必定会感到意外。在论文发表后的所有讨论中，他都非常活跃，特别是在亨利·李·史密斯 (Henry Lee Smith) 介绍了在严谨性或声望方面唯一真正能与转换句法相媲美的音系句法之后（也是他最敏锐的时候）。他自己的演讲基本上浓缩了句法结构，但对其概念更加突出。该论文认为，转换是相对于直接成分分析的重要进步，生成语法是该领域作为一门科学的重要进步，而转换生成语法可以在语义上取得重要进展——所有的胡萝卜都出来了。

Syntactic Structures was no threat to the Bloomfieldian program, so it must have been something of a surprise at the 1958 Texas conference—a deliberately staged contest of several emerging syntactic programs—when Chomsky came out battling. He was very active in all of the post-paper discussion periods, particularly so (and at his sharpest) following Henry Lee Smith’s presentation of the only real competitor to transformational syntax in terms of rigor or prestige, phonological syntax. His own presentation essentially condensed Syntactic Structures, but put more of an edge on its notions. The paper argues that transformations are an important advance over Immediate Constituent analysis, and that generative grammar is an important advance for the field as a science, and that transformational-generative grammar can make important semantic inroads—all the carrots come out.

但乔姆斯基也融入了他的心灵主义关怀（他对斯金纳的评论写于这一时期，但尚未发表），引入了一些对某些布隆菲尔德主义原则有害的数据，并概述了哈勒反对亲爱的音素的论点。他还说，哈里斯关于转换的研究揭示了“现代语言理论的严重不足”——无法解释结构关系，如同一命题的主动和被动版本——而这种不足是由于忽视了“传统语法的一个主要章节”造成的（1962a [1958]：124）。这两个要素，解释和传统语法，成为他接下来几年反布隆菲尔德主义言论的主要主题。

But Chomsky also wove in his mentalist concerns (his review of Skinner was written in this period, but still to be published), introduced some noxious data for certain Bloomfieldian principles, and sketched Halle’s argument against the darling phoneme. He also said that Harris’s work on transformations brought to light “a serious inadequacy of modern linguistic theory”—the inability to explain structural relatives, like active and passive versions of the same proposition—and that this inadequacy was the result of ignoring a major “chapter of traditional grammar” (1962a [1958]:124). These two elements, explanation and traditional grammar, became the primary themes of his anti-Bloomfieldian rhetoric over the next few years.

第二年，他带着一篇专门讨论音系学的论文回到德克萨斯（“讨论非常热烈，非常尖锐。”——乔姆斯基，1979 [1976]：133），明确地表明他的课程是对布卢姆菲尔德语言学的替代，而不是延伸。

The following year he came back to Texas with an exclusively phonological paper (“The discussions were animated and sharp.”—Chomsky, 1979 [1976]:133), establishing unequivocally that his program was a replacement of Bloomfieldian linguistics, not an extension.

然而，反对布隆菲尔德语言学运动的最关键事件是另一次会议，即 1962 年国际语言学家大会，乔姆斯基受邀在最后一次全体会议上发言。那一年的其他四位全体会议发言人都是威严的欧洲人（尼古拉·安德烈耶夫、埃米尔·贝内维斯特、耶日·库里沃维奇和安德烈·马丁内特），这让年轻的乔姆斯基“看起来像是美国语言学的代言人”（Newmeyer，1980a：51；Newmeyer 强调）。他巧妙地利用了这一时机，一方面将自己的工作与布隆菲尔德的纲领形成鲜明对比，另一方面将其与传统语法紧密联系起来，布隆菲尔德主义者喜欢“大肆斥责”（Sledd，1955：399），但在欧洲许多地方仍然受到青睐的无定形前结构主义纲领。更妙的是，整个布卢姆菲尔德计划遭到了猛烈的攻击，该计划让许多欧洲人感到不满。

The most pivotal event in the campaign against Bloomfieldian linguistics, however, was another conference, the 1962 International Congress of Linguists, where Chomsky was the invited speaker at the final plenary session. The four other plenary speakers that year were august Europeans (Nikolaj Andreyev, Emile Beneviste, Jerzy Kuryłowicz, and André Martinet), which gave young Chomsky “the appearance of being THE spokesperson for linguistics in the United States” (Newmeyer, 1980a:51; Newmeyer’s emphasis). He used the moment brilliantly, putting his work, on the one hand, into very sharp relief against the Bloomfieldian program, and, on the other, aligning it closely with traditional grammar, the amorphous prestructuralist program which Bloomfieldians delighted in “grandly berating” (Sledd, 1955:399), but which was still favored in many parts of Europe. Better yet, the whole Bloomfieldian program, which left many Europeans sour, was subjected to a withering attack.

乔姆斯基的论文从这些和其他许多方面也清楚地表明，他的工作不仅仅是一种研究句法的新方法。事实上，这篇论文的大部分内容都致力于音系学问题，以表明布卢姆菲尔德学派在每个人都认为是他们最强的领域是如何彻底管理不善的，以及因此“现代音系学先驱的基本见解在很大程度上已经丢失了”(1964b[1962]:973)。20他的论证范围广泛、令人信服，而且重点突出。乔姆斯基流畅地阐述了众多主题，并引用了大量细节，这些都非常了不起，但这篇论文实际上可以归结为：

Chomsky’s paper, in these and many other ways, also makes inescapably clear that his work isn’t just a new way to do syntax. The bulk of the paper, in fact, is devoted to phonological issues, to showing how thoroughly the Bloomfieldians had mismanaged an area everyone regarded as their strongest, and how, therefore, “the fundamental insights of the pioneers of modern phonology have largely been lost” (1964b [1962]:973).20 His arguments are wide-ranging, compelling, and extremely well focused. The number of themes Chomsky smoothly sustains, and the wealth of detail he invokes, are remarkable, but the paper effectively comes down to:

• 传统语法是正确的，特别是在揭示所有语言所共有的普遍特征方面；

• traditional grammar was on the right track, especially with regard to uncovering the universal features shared by all languages;

• 布卢姆菲尔德的研究尽管取得了一些成果，但却完全走上了错误的轨道——事实上，它扭曲了科学的进程——尤其是它忽视了心理学而强调语言的多样性；

• Bloomfieldian work, despite some gains, is on completely the wrong track—in fact, has perverted the course of science—especially in its disregard of psychology and its emphasis on the diversity among languages;

• 传统语法的唯一真正问题是缺乏精确性；

• the only real trouble with traditional grammar is its lack of precision;

• 幸运的是，在过去的几十年里，通过逻辑和数学基础的研究，技术工具已经变得可用；

• fortunately, in the last few decades, the technical tools have become available, through work in logic and the foundations of mathematics;

• 因此，包含这些工具的转换生成语法正是该领域一直在等待的，它是现代数学与美国结构主义者已经抛弃的旧心理主义和普遍目标的理想结合。

• transformational-generative grammar, which incorporates these tools, is therefore exactly what the field has been waiting for, the ideal marriage of modern mathematics and the old mentalist and universal goals that American structuralists had discarded.

乔姆斯基在 1962 年的演讲中，传统语法的代表人物是前结构主义的威廉·冯·洪堡，他在早期对语言学的探讨中引用了洪堡的言论。“我们不能把语言看作死产品”，他引用洪堡的话，“而应该把它看作生产者。”“儿童的语言学习不是把单词存入记忆中，再通过口齿不清地重复，而是随着年龄的增长和练习，语言能力不断增长。”“这种脑力劳动中恒定而统一的元素……构成了语言的形式。”21 Coseriu (1970:215) 说，这些引文中的发言者不是威廉，而是诺姆、冯·洪堡，乔姆斯基后来也承认了某种“解释许可”（1991a [1989]:7）。这些引文无疑是经过挑选的；正如洪堡论文的标题《论人类语言结构的多样性》所暗示的那样，他至少和萨丕尔一样陷入了统一性和独特性、内在形式和外在实现之间的紧张关系中。但这些仍然是洪堡的话，它们反映了布卢姆菲尔德学派在很大程度上忽视了的、而乔姆斯基正在复兴的重要问题——创造力、语言学习和语言普遍性。乔姆斯基案例的关键在于对洪堡的第一句引文，通过轻微但自然的从生产（Erzeugung）到创造的折射——这正是乔姆斯基在隐藏斯金纳时如此有效地使用的语言特征。

The emblem of traditional grammar in Chomsky’s 1962 address was one of the prestructuralist Wills, Wilhelm von Humboldt, whom he quotes early and at length on the enterprise of linguistics generally. “We must look upon language, not as a dead product” he quotes Humboldt, “but far more as a producing.” And “the speechlearning of children is not an assignment of words, to be deposited in memory and rebabbled by rote through the lips, but a growth in linguistic capacity with age and practice.” And “the constant and uniform element in this mental labour … constitutes the form of language.”21 Coseriu (1970:215) says that the person speaking in these quotations is not Wilhelm, but Noam, von Humboldt, and Chomsky later admits to a certain “interpretive license” (1991a [1989]:7). The quotations are unquestionably selective; as the title of Humboldt’s essay suggests, On the Diversity of Human Language-structure (Über die Verschiedenheit des Menschlichen Sprachbaues), he was at least as caught in the tension between uniformity and uniqueness, between inner form and outer realization, as Sapir. But these are still the words of Humboldt and they reflect important concerns—creativity, language learning, and linguistic universals—that the Bloomfieldians had largely disregarded, and that Chomsky was resurrecting. The linchpin in Chomsky’s case is in the first quotation from Humboldt, through a slight but natural refraction of producing (Erzeugung) to creating—that is, exactly the feature of language Chomsky used so effectively in hiding Skinner.

在其国际代表大会论文的其他已发表版本中（至少有四篇——1962c、1964b [1962]、1964c [1963]、1964d [1963]），乔姆斯基认为两篇 17 世纪的文本是布卢姆菲尔德从语言学中驱逐的传统语法的更好代表，这两篇文本均出自巴黎郊外的 Port-Royal-des-Champs 修道院，分别是《思考的艺术》和《一般与理性语法》。这些书（现在更普遍地被称为《波特-罗亚尔逻辑》（Arnauld and Nicole，1963 [1662]）和《波特-罗亚尔语法》（Arnauld and Lancelot，1975 [1660]））是“一般语法思想”的缩影，布卢姆菲尔德（1933：6）认为这种思想对语言学产生了长期而有害的影响。布卢姆菲尔德有理由抱怨。波特-罗亚尔的语言学著作暗示，所有语言的共同心理结构是美国描述主义的祸根——拉丁语。但乔姆斯基在一般语法中看到了非常有吸引力的东西布卢姆菲尔德所忽视和轻视的观点是：所有语言背后都有一个共同的心理结构。

In other published versions of his International Congress paper (there were at least four—1962c, 1964b [1962], 1964c [1963], 1964d [1963]), Chomsky heralded two seventeenth-century texts as even better representatives of the traditional grammar Bloomfield had banished from linguistics, both from the Port-Royal-des-Champs abbey outside of Paris, the Art of Thinking and the General and Rational Grammar. These books (now more commonly known as the Port-Royal Logic (Arnauld and Nicole, 1963 [1662]) and the Port-Royal Grammar (Arnauld and Lancelot, 1975 [1660]) epitomize the “general grammar idea” that Bloomfield (1933:6) saw as wielding a long and pernicious influence over linguistics. Bloomfield had reason to complain. The Port-Royal linguistic work implied that the common mental structure underlying all language was that bane of American descriptivism, Latin. But Chomsky saw something very attractive in the general grammar idea which Bloomfield had ignored and disparaged: that there is a common mental structure underlying all languages.

此外，除了 Port-Royal 语言学与 Humboldt 共有的明显的心理主义之外，它还展现出一种更具变革性的推理方式，尤其是作为创造力的体现。Chomsky 受益匪浅的一个例子很好地说明了这一点。请看句子 18a–18d。

Moreover, beyond the clear mentalism that Port-Royal linguistics shared with Humboldt, it exhibits a far more transformational style of reasoning, particularly as a manifestation of creativity. One example that Chomsky got a good deal of mileage from illustrates the point very well. Consider sentences 18a–18d.

18

18

看不见的上帝创造了看得见的世界。

a Invisible God created the visible world.

 

 

b 上帝是看不见的。

b God is invisible.

 

 

c 上帝创造了世界。

c God created the world.

 

 

d 世界是可见的。

d The world is visible.

Port-Royal语法认为 18a 是一个包含其他三个命题 18b-18d 的命题，而 18b 是主要命题，18c 和 18d 嵌入其中（Arnauld and Lancelot，1975 [1660]：99）。也就是说，这里的语法以一种非常自然的解释谈论的是核心句子，其相当模糊的“包含”概念看起来像 Harris-cum-Chomsky 的广义转换概念（将一个核心句子拼接到另一个核心句子中）。简而言之，Chomsky 毫不费力地支持了他的观点，即句法结构模型“表达了一种并不新颖的语言结构观点”（1964b [1962]：15）；事实上，它是“传统语法中隐含特征的形式化”，或者反过来说，传统语法是“非明确的转换语法”（1964b[1962]：16）。

The Port-Royal Grammar says that 18a is a proposition which includes the other three propositions, 18b–18d, and that 18b is the main proposition, in which 18c and 18d are embedded (Arnauld and Lancelot, 1975 [1660]:99). That is, the Grammar here is talking, in a very natural interpretation, about kernel sentences, and its rather vague idea of “inclusion” looks like the Harris-cum-Chomsky notion of generalized transformation (which splices one kernel sentence into another). In short, Chomsky has little trouble supporting his position that the Syntactic Structures model “expresses a view of the structure of language which is not at all new” (1964b [1962]:15); in fact, that it is “a formalization of features implicit in traditional grammars,” or, conversely, that traditional grammars are “inexplicit transformational grammars” (1964b [1962]:16).

布卢姆菲尔德语言学（或者，正如乔姆斯基在 1962 年 ICL 演讲中所说的，分类模型）似乎在离开一般语法的花园时犯了两个相互关联且可怕的错误。它忽视了普遍性，避免了解释。当然，这位大师在这里有明确的说法：

Bloomfieldian linguistics (or, as Chomsky took to calling it in the 1962 ICL address, the taxonomic model), it seems, had sinned in two interrelated and horrid ways when it left the garden of general grammar. It neglected universals, and it avoided explanations. The master, of course, has the definitive words here:

我们认为应该具有普遍性的特征可能在下一个可以接触到的语言中缺失。一些特征，例如，将动词类和名词类的词作为单独的词类进行区分，在许多语言中是常​​见的，但在其他语言中却没有。一些特征无论如何都是普遍存在的，这一事实值得注意，也需要解释；当我们掌握了关于许多语言的足够数据时，我们将不得不回到一般语法问题上，并解释这些相似之处和分歧，但这项研究不会是推测性的（就像对莫迪斯泰和保皇党人一样），而是归纳性的。（Bloomfield，1933：20）

Features which we think ought to be universal may be absent from the very next language that becomes accessible. Some features, such as, for instance, the distinction of verb-like and noun-like words as separate parts of speech, are common to many languages but lacking in others. The fact that some features are, at any rate, widespread, is worthy of notice and calls for an explanation; when we have adequate data about many languages, we shall have to return to the problem of general grammar and to explain these similarities and divergences, but this study, when it comes, will not be speculative [as with the Modistae and the Port-Royalists] but inductive. (Bloomfield, 1933:20)

布隆菲尔德学派当然对语言的一般特征甚至是普遍特征感兴趣。不仅萨丕尔，布隆菲尔德和 LSA 也都接受了“语言”这个题目，这很能说明问题。他们没有选择《语言》或《方言》，也没有选择《关于我们想让别人递盐时发出的声音的一堆不相关的事实》。但是，大师无处不在的谨慎，总是提防着另一种语言来破坏他的归纳概括，这导致布隆菲尔德学派避免谈论任何普遍性。事实上，将描述性要求发挥到逻辑的极端意味着不存在普遍性：“语言之间可以存在无限的和不可预测的差异”（Joos，1957：96）。22这就是第一个罪过，忽视普遍性。

Now, the Bloomfieldians were certainly interested in general, even universal features of language. It is telling that not only Sapir, but Bloomfield and the LSA embraced the title Language. They didn’t choose Languages or Tongues, or A Bunch of Unrelated Facts about the Noises We Make When We Want Someone to Pass Us the Salt. But the master’s pervading cautiousness, always looking over his shoulder for another language that could sink his inductive generalizations, had led the Bloomfieldians to avoid all talk of universals. Taking the descriptive mandate to its logical extreme, in fact, means that there are no universals: “languages could differ from each other without limit and in unpredictable ways” (Joos, 1957:96).22 So much for the first sin, ignoring universals.

乔姆斯基引用了朱斯在其 1962 年 ICL 论文中对罪孽的无限表述，以说明布隆菲尔德主义在普遍性问题上的误导；几年前，他曾解释过朱斯的另一个极端观点，表达了布隆菲尔德主义的另一个主要罪孽，“寻求解释是一种幼稚的异常行为，这种行为可能会影响哲学家和神秘主义者，但不会影响那些唯一对‘纯粹描述’感兴趣的清醒的科学家……[这种立场]在发达的科学中几乎得不到支持”(Chomsky, 1962a [1958]:153n25)。23 1962 年，乔姆斯基再次激烈地谈论这个主题，他说语言理论只有一个真正的优点，那就是它能解释特定语言的结构，而布卢姆菲尔德对普遍性的厌恶使得解释完全无法实现。

Chomsky cites Joos’s without-limit expression of sin in his 1962 ICL paper to illustrate Bloomfieldian misguidedness on universals; a few years earlier, he had paraphrased another Joos extremity, expressing the other primary Bloomfieldian sin, “that the search for explanations is a kind of infantile aberration that may affect philosophers and mystics, but not sober scientists whose only interest is in ‘pure description’ … [a position] which can find little support in well-developed sciences” (Chomsky, 1962a [1958]:153n25).23 Returning to this theme with a vengeance in 1962, Chomsky says that there is only one real virtue to a theory of language, it explains the structure of specific languages, and the Bloomfieldian aversion to universals made explanation completely unattainable.

雅各布森 (Jakobson) 的作品最能说明这一目标，他的作品涉及一种语音普遍性理论：一组有限的特征，可以描述人类语言中所有可能的音素差异，就像一组有限的原子可以描述所有可能的化学物质一样。化学物质的存在可以通过原子的组合可能性来解释。现在，雅各布森的清单（原则上被哈勒 (Halle) 的声音模式所采纳）包括发音和声学特征，布鲁姆菲尔德 (Bloomfield) 派大多也赞同这些特征。但是，语言可以无限且不可预测地相互差异的极端描述主义与可以以任何有意义的方式被视为普遍的清单完全对立。如果任何两种语言之间的差异是不可预测的，那么它们同样也是无法解释的。

Jakobson’s work, as the best illustration of this goal, involved a theory of phonetic universals: a finite inventory of features that characterizes all the possible phonemic differences in human languages, just as a finite inventory of atoms characterizes all possible chemicals. The existence of a chemical is explained by combinatory possibilities of atoms. Now, Jakobson’s inventory (adopted in principle by Halle’s Sound Pattern) included articulatory and acoustic features that, for the most part, the Bloomfieldians subscribed to as well. But the extreme descriptivism of the languages-can-differ-from-each-other-without-limit-and-in-unpredictable-ways position is completely antithetical to an inventory that could be considered universal in any meaningful way. If the differences between any two languages are unpredictable, they are likewise unexplainable.

或者说，乔姆斯基在国际大会上的论证就是这样的，而通过这一论证，几乎所有推翻布隆菲尔德语言学的必要因素都已具备：它忽视了思想；它未能认识到语言习得和创造力是语言学的基本问题；它的音系学是错误的；它扭曲了语言学对普遍性的探索；它关注分类学，而它应该关注解释。但布隆菲尔德语言学还有一个问题。它是无可救药的经验主义。

Or, so went Chomsky’s argument at the International Congress, and, with that argument, almost all the essential pieces were in place for unseating Bloomfieldian linguistics: it ignored the mind; it failed to recognize language acquisition and creativity as the fundamental problems of linguistics; its phonology was off base; it perverted linguistics from the search for universals; it was concerned with taxonomy when it should be concerned with explanation. But there was one more problem with Bloomfieldian linguistics. It was irredeemably empiricist.

理性的乔姆斯基

The Rational Chomsky

经验主义坚持认为，至少就认知结构而言，心灵是一张白板，是空的、无结构的、统一的。我看不出有任何理由相信这一点；我看不出有任何理由相信小指比人类大脑中涉及高级心理能力的部分更复杂；相反，这些部分很可能是宇宙中最复杂的结构之一。

Empiricism insists that the mind is a tabula rasa, empty, unstructured, uniform at least as far as cognitive structure is concerned. I don’t see any reason to believe that; I don’t see any reason to believe that the little finger is a more complex organ than those parts of the human brain involved in the higher mental faculties; on the contrary, it is not unlikely that these are among the most complex structures in the universe.

诺姆·乔姆斯基

Noam Chomsky

乔姆斯基从他的 Port-Royal 祖父那里学到了其他东西，即他们的认识论，在国际大会发表演讲后的几年里，他的主要项目之一就是支持他们的知识和思想观点。这些观点通常被归类为理性主义，但长期以来一直处于严重失修状态。他们的守护神是笛卡尔，怀特海定义了普遍的漠视理性主义，说“我们不再保留 17 世纪的物理学，就像我们不再保留 17 世纪的笛卡尔哲学一样”（1929:14）。这是过时的哲学。它在认识论竞赛中的长期对手，在很大程度上由于维也纳学派的成果而处于领先地位。经验主义是流行的。

Chomsky took something else from his Port-Royal grandfathers, their epistemology, and among his main projects in the few years after his International Congress presentation was championing their views of knowledge and the mind. Those views, usually bundled up in the word rationalism, had long been in a serious state of disrepair. Their patron saint is Descartes, and Whitehead had defined the general disregard for rationalism by saying “We no more retain the physics of the seventeenth century than we do the Cartesian philosophy of [that] century” (1929:14). It was passé philosophy. Its perennial opponent in the epistemic sweepstakes was, largely due to the work stemming out of the Vienna Circle, on top. Empiricism was au courant.

复述这些术语：

To rehearse these terms:

经验主义：所有知识都是通过感官获得的。

Empiricism: all knowledge is acquired through the senses.

理性主义：没有任何知识是通过感官获得的。

Rationalism: no knowledge is acquired through the senses.

当然，在认识论的历史上，没有人买过（或试图出售）这两种立场；它们所起的唯一作用就是在各种辩论中充当稻草人。英国经验主义是一个松散的哲学流派，其成员各不相同，但通常包括洛克、休谟、贝克莱和密尔。他们所持的立场更符合第一种定义，而不是第二种定义，还有其他几位杰出的思想家，如伊壁鸠鲁、阿奎那和艾耶尔。柏拉图、笛卡尔、斯宾诺莎和莱布尼茨是反对传统的杰出代表。但即使是对这些思想家最随意的阅读，也会清楚地发现，这里唯一有用的定义是模糊的，而不是离散的，量词应该经过调整，以反映真正的信念：

Nobody in the history of epistemology, naturally, has bought (or tried to sell) either position; the only function they have served is as straw men in various polemics. The members of the loose philosophical school known as British Empiricism—a school with a varying roll, but which usually includes Locke, Hume, Berkeley, and Mill—held positions that fall more fully within the first definition than within the second, along with several other eminent minds, such as Epicurus, Aquinas, and Ayer. The opposing tradition is ably represented by Plato, Descartes, Spinoza, and Leibniz. But even the most casual reading of any these thinkers makes it clear that the only useful definitions here are fuzzy rather than discrete, and that the quantifiers should be tempered to reflect genuinely held beliefs:

经验主义：大多数知识是通过感官获得的。

Empiricism: most knowledge is acquired through the senses.

理性主义：大多数知识不是通过感官获得的。

Rationalism: most knowledge is not acquired through the senses.

然而，即使经过这样的调整，我们仍然必须牢记，知识指的是数学、语言和击打内侧快速球等领域，而不是你六年级老师的名字或你把车钥匙放在哪里。但这些定义是可行的。

Even with this tempering, however, we have to keep in mind that knowledge refers to domains like mathematics, language, and hitting an inside fastball, not to the name of your sixth-grade teacher or where you left the car keys. But the definitions are workable.

回到乔姆斯基，他对理性主义的迷恋与他参与 50 年代末认知心理学的兴起密不可分。行为主义在 60 年代初受到重新审视，部分原因是乔姆斯基最近对斯金纳的严厉批评，而行为主义在很大程度上依赖于经验主义。对于认知心理学来说，经验主义的最大问题是，更复杂的心理功能看起来不像是从一张白纸上产生的。新生的认知主义者认为它是“一个完全错误的认识论基础，从中无法看到更高级的思维功能”（Bruner，1988：91）。此外，布鲁纳指出，认知主义者可以从相关领域日益增长的理性主义中获得勇气，“可以说，当时的冯·诺依曼、香农、纳尔逊·古德曼、诺伯特·维纳和精力充沛的年轻人诺姆·乔姆斯基等人物都在大声而令人信服地发表这样的主张。”事实上，年轻力壮的乔姆斯基不仅在 60 年代中期出版的《句法理论面面观》和《语言与心理》等书中明确表达了他的理性主义观点并以大胆的论据为后盾，他还用圣勒内的话说，给另一本书取名为《笛卡尔语言学》，以确保这一观点不会被忽视。

Getting back to Chomsky, his attraction to rationalism goes hand-in-glove with his involvement in the late fifties emergence of cognitive psychology. Behaviorism was undergoing reconsideration in the early sixties, in part because of Chomsky’s recent excoriation of Skinner, and behaviorism rests heavily on empiricism. The big problem with empiricism for cognitive psychology is that the more sophisticated mental functions don’t look like they could arise from a blank slate. The nascent cognitivists believed it to be “a hopelessly wrong epistemological base from which to view the higher functions of the mind” (Bruner, 1988:91). Besides, Bruner says, pointing out that cognitivists could take courage from the growing rationalism in related fields, “There were, so to speak, such nearby figures as Von Neumann, Shannon, Nelson Goodman, Norbert Wiener, and the vigorous young Noam Chomsky who were making such claims loudly and convincingly.” The vigorous young Chomsky, in fact, not only made his rationalism explicit and backed it up with bold arguments in mid-sixties books like Aspects of the Theory of Syntax and Language and Mind, he entitled another book adjectivally after Saint René, Cartesian Linguistics, to make sure the point couldn’t be missed.

乔姆斯基的理性主义是激进的。理性主义在剥离其稻草人地位后，提出了一个不容置疑的主张，即某些心理能力是心智启动工具包的一部分。理性主义最好的表述之一来自莱布尼茨，他将心智比作“一块有纹理的大理石”，他说学习本质上是一种“发现这些脉络、通过打磨和切除阻碍其出现的东西来清理它们”的劳动（1949 [1705]：45–46）。对于乔姆斯基来说，在他最严谨的理性主义表述中，我们心灵大理石中的一条遗传脉络使我们能够培育出一种语言。没错：培育一种语言，就像我们培育出胳膊、腿或肾脏一样。

And Chomsky’s rationalism is radical. Rationalism, stripped of its straw-man status, makes the unobjectionable claim that some mental capacities come as part of the start-up kit of the mind. One of the best formulations of rationalism is by Leibniz, who compares the mind to “a block of marble which has veins,” and who says that learning is essentially a “labor to discover these veins, to clear them by polishing, and by cutting away what prevents them from appearing” (1949 [1705]:45–46). For Chomsky, in his starkest formulation of rationalism, one of these genetic veins in the marble of our minds enables us to grow a language. That’s right: grow a language, just as we grow an arm or a leg or a kidney.

这一主张的一个突出部分是，这种发展只能发生在人类大脑中；这并不是说我们在数量上比其他物种对符号的掌握更为复杂，就像我们比猿类拥有更复杂的拇指、更好的声音控制或更敏锐的音韵辨别一样，而是我们拥有一个质量上不同的“精神器官”。对许多布卢姆菲尔德主义者来说，理性主义已经够糟糕了，但再加上物种特异性，就让乔姆斯基看起来好像把人类置于自然世界之外。正是这种说法最终让他们相信，他的语法电梯并没有一直开到顶层。

A prominent subcomponent of this claim is that such growth could take place only in human brains; it is not that we have a quantitatively more sophisticated command of symbols than other species, the way we have, say, a more sophisticated thumb than apes, or better vocal control, or more acute phonological discrimination, but that we have a qualitatively different “mental organ.” To many Bloomfieldians, rationalism was bad enough, but topping it off with species specificity made it look as if Chomsky was placing man outside the natural world. It was claims of this order that finally convinced them that his grammatical elevator didn’t go all the way to the top floor.

语言成长的立场实际上很有说服力，乍一看似乎很荒谬，但它是刺激贫乏论的自然结果。正如乔姆斯基在《言语行为》一书中所言，人类相关的先天禀赋可能并不比通用的数据处理或假设制定能力更具体（但肯定不会更不具体），指导视觉成长的认知属性也指导语言成长：对于视觉皮层，它们处理“水平”、“垂直”和“前面”等数据；对于语言能力，它们处理“名词”、“动词”和“句子”等数据。或者，正如乔姆斯基在 60 年代开始有力阐述的那样，语言能力本身是一种高度具体的心理器官，具有自己独特而独立的特征，名词、动词和句子等东西不仅存在于数据中，而且是基因预先连接到大脑中的。但无论哪种情况，理性主义都是解释的必要部分，必须抛弃严格解释的（稻草人）经验主义心灵哲学。

The grow-a-language position is actually quite compelling, absurd as it looks at first pass, and follows rather naturally from the poverty of stimulus argument. It might be, as Chomsky suggests in his review of Verbal Behavior, that the relevant innate endowment of humans is no more (but certainly no less) specific than general-purpose data-handling or hypothesis-formulating abilities, that the same cognitive properties which guide the growth of vision also guide the growth of language: for the visual cortex, they handle data like “horizontal” and “vertical” and “in-front-of”; for the language faculty, they handle the data like “noun” and “verb” and “sentence.” Or it might be, as Chomsky began forcefully articulating in the sixties, that the language faculty is itself a highly specific mental organ with its own special and independent character, that such things as noun and verb and sentence are not just in the data, but genetically prewired into the brain. But, in either case, rationalism is a necessary part of the explanation and a strictly interpreted (strawman) empiricist philosophy of mind must be discarded.

理性主义和经验主义对于我们故事的后半部分非常重要，当时认识论基础在生成解释的争论中再次受到审视，但目前，中心点是它们说明了布隆菲尔德和乔姆斯基的分歧迅速加深到何种程度。在大多数老派看来，一种新的语法方法在不到十年的时间里迅速发展成为一种新的语言学方法、一种看待人类的新方法和一种新的科学方法；新的，完全相反的。他们感到困惑和愤怒。

Rationalism and empiricism are very important for a later part of our story, when epistemological foundations came back under scrutiny in the generative-interpretive brouhaha, but, for the moment, the central point is that they illustrate just how deep the Bloomfieldian-Chomskyan division rapidly became. What looked to most of the old guard like a new way to do syntax mushroomed in less than a decade into a new way to do linguistics, a new way to look at human beings, and a new way of doing science; new, and completely inverse. They were baffled and enraged.

当乔姆斯基的理性主义变得清晰时，许多布鲁姆菲尔德派的骆驼已经倒下，但这对霍克特来说却是最后一根稻草。1964 年，霍克特在 LSA 发表主席演讲时，称赞《句法结构》是该领域“仅有的四项重大突破”之一，将其与琼斯在亚洲学会的演讲和索绪尔的《课程》相提并论，直到 1966 年，他还在研究生成语法 (1965 [1964]:185)。但在乔姆斯基的理性主义变得无可避免地清晰之后，霍克特开始猛烈抨击“新中世纪哲学家诺姆·乔姆斯基的推测”(1967:142-44)。霍尔借用了霍克特的主题（但拼写更华丽），加入进来，抨击乔姆斯基“威胁要否定四个世纪以来取得的所有进步……[并且]将我们对语言的理解拖回到中世纪无知和蒙昧的状态”（1968:128–29）。特雷格 (Trager) 针对大多数布卢姆菲尔德主义者将神秘主义等同于理性主义的现象，谴责乔姆斯基是“十多年来干涉和中断语言学作为人类学科学之一的发展的邪教领袖，对人类学的其他几个领域产生了不良的副作用”（1968:78）。天塌下来了。天塌下来了。

Many Bloomfieldian camels had collapsed by the time Chomsky’s rationalism became explicit, but that was the last straw for Hockett. In 1964, giving his presidential address to the LSA, Hockett was hailing Syntactic Structures as one of “only four major breakthroughs” in the field, placing it in the company of Jones’s Asiatic Society address and Saussure’s Course, and as late as 1966 he was working in generative grammar (1965 [1964]:185). But after Chomsky’s rationalism had become inescapably clear, Hockett began fulminating about “the speculations of the neomedieval philosopher Noam Chomsky” (1967:142–44). Hall, playing on Hockett’s theme (but with fancier spelling), joined in to rail about Chomsky “threatening to negate all the progress achieved over four centuries … [and] dragging our understanding of language back down to a state of mediaeval ignorance and obscurantism” (1968:128–29). Trager, keying on the mysticism most Bloomfieldians equated with rationalism, condemned Chomsky as “the leader of the cult [that has] interfered with and interrupted the growth of linguistics as one of the anthropological sciences for over a decade, with evil side-effects on several other fields of anthropology” (1968:78). The sky was falling. The sky was falling.

埋葬布卢姆菲尔德人

Burying the Bloomfieldians

年轻的语言学家真的会用我的名字来吓唬他们的孩子吗？

Is it really true that young linguists use my name to frighten their children?

弗雷德·豪斯霍尔德

Fred Householder

在早期关于行为主义、音素和理性主义的争论中，乔姆斯基和哈勒吸引了该领域一些最优秀的年轻人才来到电子研究实验室，这是麻省理工学院的一个兼收并蓄、资金充足的分支机构，也是乔姆斯基语言学的孵化器。这个小组——包括利斯、波斯特尔、卡茨、福多尔、爱德华·克里马和杰伊·凯泽——很快就建立了非常密切的思想联系，并开始敲定转换语法的细节。正如福多尔回忆的那样，

In and among these early polemics about behaviorism, the phoneme, and rationalism, Chomsky and Halle attracted some of the best young minds in the field to the Research Laboratory of Electronics, the eclectic and very well funded branch of MIT which was the incubator of Chomskyan linguistics. The group—including Lees, Postal, Katz, Fodor, Edward Klima, and Jay Keyser—quickly formed very close intellectual ties and began hammering out the details of transformational grammar. As Fodor recalls,

说对这种语言学感兴趣的人全都在麻省理工学院，这并不夸张。这并不完全正确。还有其他人。但有一段时间，我们几乎是所有人。因此，交流非常活跃，我想我们分享了研究方法的总体情况，不仅是语言学，还有行为科学研究。我们或多或少都是本土主义者，或多或少都是心灵主义者。有很多方法论的对话是没有必要的。人们可以直接讨论实质性问题。所以，从这个角度来看，这非常令人兴奋。

It’s not much of a hyperbole to say that all of the people who were interested in this kind of linguistics were at MIT. That’s not quite true. There were others scattered around. But for a while, we were pretty nearly all there was. So communication was very lively, and I guess we shared a general picture of the methodology for doing, not just linguistics, but behavioral science research. We were all more or less nativist, and all more or less mentalist. There was a lot of methodological conversation that one didn’t need to have. One could get right to the substantive issues. So, from that point of view, it was extremely exciting.

这次会议也非常成功。该小组在许多非常棘手的问题上取得了迅速进展，特别是在布卢姆菲尔德派最薄弱的领域——句法和语义学。我们都知道，成功是令人兴奋的，而该小组最明显的性格特征就是自大：他们年轻、聪明，正在与本世纪最优秀的知识分子之一合作，研究一种新颖且极具前景的理论。“在那种情况下，”卡茨指出，“每个人都很自然地认为他们拥有上帝的真理，并确信他们所做的事情将彻底改变世界，我们都这么认为。”

It was also very successful. The group made rapid headway on a number of very thorny issues, particularly in the Bloomfieldians’ weakest areas, syntax and semantics. Success, we all know, is heady, and the group’s most definitive character trait was cockiness: they were young, they were bright, and they were working on a novel and immensely promising theory in collaboration with one of the finest intellects of the century. “In a situation like that,” Katz notes, “it’s quite natural for everyone to think they have God’s Truth, and to be sure that what they’re doing will revolutionize the world, and we all thought that.”

事态发展迅速蔓延。每个人都在走廊上发言，参加同一个座谈会，并在论文发表前很久就看到了彼此的论文。他们还看到许多从未发表过的论文，臭名昭著的地下出版物仍然是麻省理工学院工作的特色：论点和分析在油印（现在是电子版）地下流传，从未正式公开，但出现在重要作品的笔记中。这种情况很自然地激怒了（并且激怒了）任何试图遵循该理论但未能接入正确分发网络的人。24

Developments spread rapidly. Everyone spoke in the hallways, attended the same colloquia, and saw each other’s papers long before they reached publication. They also saw many papers that never reached publication at all, the notorious samizdat literature that still characterizes work at MIT: arguments and analyses circulated in a mimeograph (now electronic) underground, never making their way to the formal light of day but showing up in the notes of important works that did. This situation, quite naturally, infuriated (and infuriates) anybody trying to follow the theory but failing to hook into the right distributional network.24

这些准出版物中最著名的自然是乔姆斯基的巨著《语言理论的逻辑结构》 （1975a [1955]），尽管发行量极其稀少且已过时，但它在《句法结构》中仍被引用了十几次。尽管仍然是纲领性的，但它比乔姆斯基发表的论点更加详细、论证更加严密、数学密度更高，并且给人的印象是他的模型的基础已经牢固确立。它看起来像是冰山一角，而句法结构只是其中的一角（事实上，参见 Halliday 在 Lunt，1964 [1962]：988 中的评论）。乔姆斯基的《英语语法片断》是他第三届德克萨斯会议论文的油印笔记，也被广泛引用，而 Halle 的《关于言语声音的七篇布道》则可通过 IBM 获取，这本书极具福音意义。不过，大多数引用不过是剑桥流传的备忘录。

The most famous of these quasi-publications was naturally Chomsky’s massive Logical Structure of Linguistic Theory (1975a [1955]), which is cited a dozen times in Syntactic Structures despite extremely modest and dog-eared circulation. Though still programmatic, it is far more detailed, far more closely argued, far more mathematically dense than Chomsky’s published arguments, and it gave the impression that the foundations of his model were firmly in place. It looked to be the iceberg of which Syntactic Structures formed the tip (see, in fact, Halliday’s remarks in Lunt, 1964 [1962]:988). Chomsky’s A Fragment of English Grammar, the mimeographed notes for his Third Texas Conference paper, was also cited widely, and Halle’s suitably evangelical Seven Sermons on Sounds in Speech, was available through IBM. Mostly, though, the citations were to little more than memoranda floating around Cambridge.

在正式出版的出版物中，该计划的轮廓越来越清晰。除了《句法结构》之外，最重要的早期出版物是利斯对它的评论。乔姆斯基夸大其词，他说利斯“基本上是他们（布鲁姆菲尔德派）的杀手。他就是他们派来谴责这、那和其他事情的人。他们听说麻省理工学院正在酝酿这种异端邪说，他就来帮他们处理这件事。”但利斯来到剑桥（从事一个机器语言项目）时，有着坚定的结构主义信念、在布鲁姆菲尔德社区的良好声誉以及对抗性的个人风格。他发现乔姆斯基的作品引人注目，并实际上成为了他的第一个博士生。25从某种程度上说，利斯是一位阐释者，他的评论对乔姆斯基的关键原则和解决方案进行了相当细致的说明，但这也是反对布卢姆菲尔德派的第一声响亮的枪响。这篇评论用人们熟悉的“我们在做科学而你不是”的战斗口号，将乔姆斯基的工作与该领域的其他工作进行了鲜明的对比：转换生成语法是化学，而语言学中的其他一切都是炼金术。利斯的论文也是对新兴的乔姆斯基范式的重大贡献。它于 1960 年出版，名为《英语名词化语法》，正如本菲评价博普的《词形变化系统》时所说的那样，它是“第一部完全充满新语言学精神的著作”（Hoenigswald，1986：177）。几乎是瞬间，它就成为了该项目的典范——如何进行转换句法分析的模板、哈雷声音模式的完美补充、新音系学的模板。

In the publications that did issue formally, the program took clearer and clearer shape. The most important early publication, next to Syntactic Structures, was Lees’s review of it. Chomsky overstates the case wildly when he says that Lees “was basically their [the Bloomfieldians’] hit man. He was the guy they sent around to denounce this, that, and the other thing. They heard about this heresy brewing at MIT, and he came down to take care of it for them.” But Lees came to Cambridge (to work on a machine language project) with firm structuralist convictions, with a good standing in the Bloomfieldian community, and with a confrontational personal style. He found Chomsky’s work arresting and effectively became his first doctoral student.25 Lees was in part an expositor, and his review provided a rather careful account of Chomsky’s key principles and solutions, but it was also the first resounding shot in the campaign against the Bloomfieldians. Using the familiar we’re-doing-science-and-you’re-not war cries, the review put Chomsky’s work in very sharp relief against the rest of the field: transformational-generative grammar was chemistry, everything else in linguistics was alchemy. Lees’s dissertation was also a major contribution to the emerging Chomskyan paradigm. It came out in 1960 as The Grammar of English Nominalizations, and was, as Benfey said of Bopp’s Conjugationssystem, “the first work to be totally imbued with the spirit of the new linguistics” (Hoenigswald, 1986:177). Almost instantly, it became an exemplar for the program—a template for how to do transformational syntactic analysis, the perfect complement to Halle’s Sound Pattern, a template for the new phonology.

卡茨也非常有影响力。他与福多尔合作，为乔姆斯基的事业贡献了一篇极其重要的论文，即《语义理论的结构》（Katz and Fodor，1964b [1963]），这篇文章首次明确提出了转换语法如何适应语义，然后他与波斯特尔（Katz and Postal，1964）合作写了一本书，将这些建议更贴近转换语法的核心，并促成了该理论的下一个重大技术进步，即深层结构的概念。

Katz was also very influential. He teamed up with Fodor to contribute an extremely important paper to the Chomskyan enterprise, “The Structure of a Semantic Theory” (Katz and Fodor, 1964b [1963]), an article which made the first explicit proposals on how transformational grammar could accommodate semantics, and then he teamed up with Postal (Katz and Postal, 1964) on a book which brought those proposals closer to the heart of transformational grammar and precipitated the next major technical advance in the theory, the notion of deep structure.

但剑桥大学发表的论文并不局限于正面的提议。许多都是攻击性的，例如乔姆斯基对斯金纳的猛烈抨击、他在 1958 年德克萨斯会议上的吵闹表现、他在国际大会上对布卢姆菲尔德描述主义理论基础的攻击、哈勒对音素的攻击以及乔姆斯基和哈勒对豪斯霍尔德的联合抨击。但弟子们胜过了他们的师傅。最著名的论战是波斯特尔的《构成结构》（1964 年），这是一篇带有负面色彩的范本，或者说否定性的范本——不是在新计划中工作的模板，而是用来消灭反对派的模板。这是一个有条不紊、严密推理和尖锐的论点，其大意是，所有结构主义句法都会崩溃为乔姆斯基的短语结构符号，因此明显不如转换分析。这本书以残酷著称，以至于波斯特尔的一位同事将其描述为

But the publications streaming from Cambridge were not restricted to positive proposals. Many were attacks, following the lead of Chomsky’s keel-hauling of Skinner, and his obstreperous performance at the 1958 Texas conference, and his International Congress attack on the theoretical underpinnings of Bloomfieldian descriptivism, and Halle’s attack on the phoneme, and Chomsky and Halle’s joint pummeling of Householder. But the disciples outdid their masters. The most famous polemic is Postal’s Constituent Structure (1964), something of a negative exemplar, or an exemplar of negativity—a template not for working in the new program, but for eviscerating the opposition. It is a methodical, closely-reasoned, and withering argument to the effect that all varieties of structuralist syntax collapse into Chomsky’s phrase structure notation, and consequently are decidedly inferior to transformational analyses. The book’s reputation for brutality is so firm that one of Postal’s colleagues describes it as

对所有主要语法学家的诽谤：布洛赫（波斯特尔曾师从他）、霍克特、西德·兰姆和肯·派克。他说，直接成分分析完全是低劣和不充分的。所以，他早年的性格……好吧，他只是一条疯狗。

a character assassination of all the major players in syntax: Bloch [under whom Postal had studied], and Hockett, and Sid Lamb, and Ken Pike. Immediate Constituent analysis, he said, was all hopelessly inferior and inadequate. So, his personality in the early days was … well, he was just a mad dog.

这种疯狂的评价有些苛刻，也许反映了波斯特尔在会议上的表现，或者他后来的《音系理论面面观》（1968 [1965]），但它确实抓住了贯穿全书以及波斯特尔关于转换生成语法的几乎所有其他作品的不可阻挡、不可改变的绝对确定性基调；人们会觉得试图与波斯特尔讲道理是没有意义的。他只会提出另一个论点。如果这不管用，他会再找一个，再找一个。这种态度充斥着麻省理工学院，并导致许多乔姆斯基主义者产生了 Bar-Hillel (1967:542) 在 Katz 身上所谴责的“自命不凡和傲慢”的风格——他们有所有的答案，而其他大多数人都被误导了。这种态度甚至让最有同情心、最温和的语言学家感到困惑和恼火。例如，埃纳尔·豪根（Einar Haugen）是布卢姆菲尔德时期最开明、最宽容的语言学家，他称乔姆斯基的纲领是“一项伟大的进步”，但他哀叹道

The mad-dog assessment is a little harsh, perhaps reflecting Postal’s conference performances, or his later Aspects of Phonological Theory (1968 [1965]), but it does capture the unstoppable, unalterable tone of absolute certainty that pervades the book, and virtually everything else Postal wrote on transformational-generative grammar; one gets the sense that there is just no point trying to reason with Postal. He’ll just come up with another argument. If that doesn’t work, he’ll find another, and another. This attitude suffused MIT, and gave rise in many Chomskyans to the “pretentious and cavalier” style that Bar-Hillel (1967:542) deplored in Katz—they had all the answers and most everyone else was hopelessly misguided. The attitude bewildered and aggravated even the most sympathetic, smooth-tempered linguists. Einar Haugen, for instance, as catholic and openminded a linguist as there was in the Bloomfieldian period, called Chomsky’s program “a great advance,” but lamented that

一旦开始与提倡这种新方法的人进行讨论，就会发现其中存在某种教条主义……我希望那些如此热情地追求这种新形式的人能够理解向其他人提出自己的想法时遇到的一些问题，以便其他人能够心甘情愿地接受它们。（Dallaire 等人，1962：41）

once one begins to have discussions with the people who advocate this new approach, one discovers a certain dogmatism … and I wish that somehow the people who are so enthusiastically pursuing this new form, would understand some of the problems in presenting their ideas to other people, so that those others could accept them willingly. (Dallaire and others, 1962:41)

对于许多人来说，其结果与乌里尔·魏因赖希（Uriel Weinreich，布卢姆菲尔德时期另一位广泛而慷慨的独立主义者）在《与卡茨先生的争论》中得出的结论一样：既然他的对手已经完全放弃了“学术公平竞争的一般条件”，那么这个论点就必须被放弃（1968：287）。

The result, for many, was the one reached in “On Arguing with Mr. Katz” by Uriel Weinreich (another broad and generous independiste from the Bloomfieldian period), that, since his opponent has completely abandoned “the ordinary conditions of scholarly fair play,” the argument simply has to be abandoned (1968:287).

但印刷品中浮现的对抗只是会议上喧嚣的回响，基调是由乔姆斯基在《句法结构》出版后的第二年出席第三届德克萨斯英语语言分析问题会议而定下的——回想起来，这次会议意义重大，几乎值得用如此繁琐的标题。这次邀请背后的动机及其在布卢姆菲尔德学派社区中的结果都存在争议。一些分析家认为，会议组织者邀请乔姆斯基是为了让乔姆斯基得到应有的惩罚（Newmeyer，1980a：46；Anderson，1985：314）；其他人则认为组织者比较仁慈（Murray，1983：184）。26一些布鲁姆菲尔德派人士显然认为，年轻而鲁莽的乔姆斯基已被取代；其他人在离开会议时公开表示对新纲领或至少是其句法表示同情。但这次会议的重要性并不在于它对根深蒂固的范式成员的影响（尽管它显然有助于争取至少一名布鲁姆菲尔德派人士的支持，罗伯特·斯托克韦尔（Robert Stockwell），他曾经是音系句法学的爱好者）。相反，它在该领域的年轻人中反响很好，乔姆斯基在会议上的表现在日益壮大的年轻转型主义者中占据了神话的显著地位，特别是在会议论文集出版之后（Hill, 1962c [1958]）：

But the antagonism that surfaced in print was only a dull echo of the clamoring at conferences, the tone being set by Chomsky’s featured appearance, the year after the publication of Syntactic Structures, at the Third Texas Conference on Problems of Linguistic Analysis in English—an event, in retrospect, almost significant enough to warrant a title so cumbersome. Both the motive behind this invitation and its results in the Bloomfieldian community are subject to some dispute. Some analysts suggest that the conference organizers invited Chomsky to give him a deserved comeuppance (Newmeyer, 1980a:46; Anderson, 1985:314); others find the organizers more benign (Murray, 1983:184).26 Some Bloomfieldians apparently came away persuaded that the brash young Chomsky had been put in his place; others left the conference openly sympathetic to the new program, or at least its syntax. But the importance of the conference was not in its impact on the members of the entrenched paradigm (though it clearly helped to enlist at least one Bloomfieldian, Robert Stockwell, an erstwhile fan of phonological syntax). Rather, it played very well to the youth of the field, Chomsky’s performance at the conference occupying a substantial role in the mythology formed among the growing cadre of young transformationalists, particularly once the proceedings reached publication (Hill, 1962c [1958]):

我们在这里看到了其他地方所没有的语言学历史记载：乔姆斯基，这个坏孩子，与该领域的一些巨人较量，让他们看起来像是语言学入门课程中困惑的学生。（Newmeyer，1980a：35，1986a：31）二十七

Here we see linguistic history documented as nowhere else: Chomsky, the enfant terrible, taking on some of the giants of the field and making them look like confused students in a beginning linguistics course. (Newmeyer, 1980a:35, 1986a:31)27

不过，布隆菲尔德派并没有完全被这个可怕的婴儿激怒，他们邀请乔姆斯基在次年再次出席会议，当时乔姆斯基发表了一篇关于生成原则在音系分析中的应用的论文。这次第二次出席是比 1958 年会议更具决定性、更具分裂性的社会学事件，因为乔姆斯基以哈勒的俄语研究成果为武器，攻击了布隆菲尔德派的理论主场——音系学。28乔姆斯基在 1962 年国际大会上的表现也发挥了类似的作用；会议记录再次记录了争论，乔姆斯基再次似乎正确地阐述了大多数观点。会议激发了转型主义者（当然，他们集体出席），各种出版的版本在剑桥以外引起了极大兴趣。

The Bloomfieldians were not entirely outraged by the terrible infant, though, and invited Chomsky back the following year, when he gave a paper on the application of generative principles to phonological analysis. This second appearance was a more decisive, and divisive, sociological event than the 1958 conference, since Chomsky attacked the Bloomfieldians on their theoretical home court, phonology, armed with Halle’s work on Russian.28 Chomsky’s performance at the 1962 International Congress served a similar role; again the proceedings document contention, and again Chomsky appears to take most of the points soundly. The conference galvanized the transformationalists (who were, of course, present en bloc), and the various published versions sparked a good deal of interest outside Cambridge.

但乔姆斯基一直非常谨慎地对待他的公开辩论，他从来都不是一个热衷于参加会议的人。大部分前线宣传都落在了其他支持者身上，尤其是学生，他们以“传教士的热情”投身于这一事业（Newmeyer，1980a：50，1986a：42），霍尔顿为这一现象提供了一个非常有用的例子：

But Chomsky has always been very careful about how and where his public disputations occur, and he has never been a very avid conferencegoer. Most of the frontline proselytizing fell to other partisans, particularly students, who took up the cause with “missionary zeal” (Newmeyer, 1980a:50, 1986a:42), a phenomenon for which Holton offers a very useful illustration:

科尔特斯不是，而是他留下来负责墨西哥的人，在他一转身，就试图迅速取得胜利，并开始屠杀阿兹特克人。（1988:35）

It was not Cortéz but the men he had left in charge of Mexico who, as soon as his back was turned, tried to press the victory too fast to a conclusion and began to slaughter the Aztecs. (1988:35)

虽然这并非霍尔顿的真正观点，但他的类比表明，一项新科学计划的开始往往伴随着思想灭绝的一面，而乔姆斯基语言学的出现就是一个典型的例子，尽管说乔姆斯基在屠杀发生时转身离开是相当夸张的。攻击的程度往往如此过分，以至于很难相信他们会被一致宽恕，但他和哈勒强烈鼓励他们的学生加入战斗。他们也将自己的工作与对布隆菲尔德的一切的拒绝密不可分。引导学生走向光明的很大一部分就是引导他们远离黑暗。定义一种方法最有效的方法之一是反对其他事物或其他人——那些人正在/曾经做的事情是完全错误的，我们不会犯同样的错误。奥斯托夫和布鲁格曼痛斥了比较主义者。博厄斯和萨丕尔痛斥了拉丁化传教士。布卢姆菲尔德派习惯于大肆批判传统语法，甚至将其拟人化为一个粗鲁无礼的陈旧人物，即菲迪奇小姐，一个象征性的女教师，他们经常以轻蔑困惑的态度引用她的观点作为某些语法观察的来源，而他们想将这些观察视为琐碎而置之不理，或者引用他们想嘲笑的态度。

While it is not exactly Holton’s point, his analogy suggests that there is frequently an aspect of intellectual genocide to the onset of a new scientific program, and the emergence of Chomskyan linguistics is a textbook example, though it would be a considerable stretch to talk about Chomsky’s back being turned while the slaughter went on. The level of the attacks was often so excessive that it is difficult to believe they were uniformly condoned, but he and Halle strongly encouraged their students to enter the fray. Too, they had coupled their work inseparably with a rejection of all things Bloomfieldian. A big part of guiding their students toward the light was steering them away from the darkness. One of the most efficient ways to define an approach is in opposition to something, or someone, else—what those guys are/were doing is hopelessly misguided, and we’re not going to commit the same errors. Ostoff and Bruggmann beat up on the comparativists. Boas and Sapir beat up on the Latinizing missionaries. The Bloomfieldians took their habit of grandly berating traditional grammar so far as to personify it into a crusty old cipher, one Miss Fiddich, a symbolic schoolmarm whom they regularly cited with contemptuous bemusement as the source of some grammatical observation that they wanted to dismiss as trivial or of an attitude that they wanted to ridicule.

乔姆斯基和哈勒都否认在介绍之前工作，但他们当时的学生回忆起布鲁姆菲尔德派的课程，走廊里被戏称为“坏人课程”，值得注意的是，麻省理工学院以外的转换语法贡献者——例如查尔斯·菲尔莫尔、埃蒙·巴赫和卡洛塔·史密斯——远没有李斯、波斯特尔、卡茨、贝弗、乔姆斯基和哈勒那么喜欢争论。在城堡里，气氛是我们反对他们。异教徒被迅速送上了火刑柱。这是罗宾·莱考夫的回忆，他是 60 年代早期到中期哈佛语言学的学生（后来成为重要的生成语义学家），他经常热情地观看这场大屠杀：

Both Chomsky and Halle deny any excesses in their presentation of previous work, but their students of the period recall classes on the Bloomfieldians that hallway banter labeled “Bad Guys Courses,” and it is noteworthy that contributors to transformational grammar from outside MIT—Charles Fillmore, for instance, and Emmon Bach, and Carlota Smith—were far less polemical than Lees, or Postal, or Katz, or Bever, or Chomsky and Halle. Inside the citadel, the mood was us-againstthem. Infidels were rushed to the stake. This recollection is from Robin Lakoff, a Harvard linguistics student in the early-to-mid-sixties (and later an important generative semanticist) who was a frequent and enthused spectator to the carnage:

我清楚地记得非转型主义者在麻省理工学院演讲的那些日子，在早期，该领域仍将自己视为在充满敌意的世界中为生存而战。麻省理工学院的圈子里，人们不是试图讨好、安抚、寻找联系点，而是经常采取血腥手段。他们通过明显的公开攻击来表达观点；让冒犯者屈服的问题或反例在之后的几周或几个月里被津津有味地重复。（R. Lakoff，1989：967-68）

I remember well the times that non-transformationalists would speak at MIT, in those early years when the field still saw itself as fighting for survival in a hostile world. Rather than attempting to charm, conciliate, find points of connection, the circle at MIT regularly went for blood. Points were made by obvious public demolition; the question or counterexample that brought the offender to his knees [was] repeated for weeks or months afterwards with relish. (R. Lakoff, 1989:967–68)

在另一个海岸，早期皈依者罗伯特·斯托克韦尔 (Robert Stockwell) 在那里开设了商店，维多利亚·弗罗姆金 (Victoria Fromkin) 记得，“位于圣莫尼卡的兰德公司每周举办的研讨会更像是攻占冬宫，而不是学术讨论” (1991 [1989]:79)。

On the other coast, where an early convert, Robert Stockwell, had set up shop, Victoria Fromkin remembers that “the weekly seminars at the Rand Corporation in Santa Monica more resembled the storming of the Winter Palace than scholarly discussions” (1991 [1989]:79).

最狂热的两位革命者是李斯和波斯特尔。李斯是最早的，也是最华丽的。他是一个直率的人，他使用一种旨在震惊和激怒他人的风格，现在他用他特有的直率描述这种风格为“在会议上站起来骂人愚蠢”。这些策略使他成为变革主义者中的传奇人物，但并没有让他赢得另一方的喜爱；豪斯霍尔德在评论李斯的《英语名词化语法》时谨慎地开头评论说，李斯“以可怕的学术争斗者和贬低者而闻名”(1962:326)，这可能是他的对手使用的最温和的词语。

The two most fervent revolutionaries were Lees and Postal. Lees was the earliest, and the most flamboyant. A very direct man, he employed a style calculated to shock and enrage which he now describes (with characteristic bluntness) as “getting up at meetings and calling people stupid” These tactics made him a legend among the transformationalists, but they did not endear him to the other side; Householder cautiously begins a review of Lees’s Grammar of English Nominalizations with the remark that Lees “is noted as a redoubtable scholarly feuder and cutter-down-tosize” (1962:326), probably the mildest terms used by his opponents.

波斯特尔甚至更不受布鲁姆菲尔德派的喜爱。和李斯一样，他在个人场合中热情和蔼，对反对意见也相当宽容。但他在思想上野蛮的名声是当之无愧的，这深深植根于他在会议上的公共风度，尤其是在早年。他的故事数不胜数，大多数都遵循相同的场景。波斯特尔坐着读完一篇匿名的、相对无害的描述性论文，该论文对一种鲜为人知的语言的音位系统进行了分类。他站起来，以“这篇论文与人类语言研究毫无关系”之类的话开头，然后开始提出一连串论据，详细说明它的无用之处——经常对所使用的具体数据和框架提出十几个不同的反驳。这些表现以思想上的精确和修辞上的恶毒而闻名。一次针对乔斯的长篇大论是如此残酷，以至于语言学会会议记录中都删除了它（Hill，1991：74），从他随意地将对手的立场归类为“经验上和逻辑上毫无内容的言论”（霍克特）和“实质上空洞的断言”（格里森）以及“遭受某种智力分裂症的折磨”（整个布卢姆菲尔德计划）中可以看出他的风格（分别见 1968 [1965]：4、5、6）。这是（描述性任务）：

Postal was even less loved by the Bloomfieldians. Like Lees, he is warm and genial in personal settings, and quite tolerant of opposing viewpoints. But his reputation for intellectual savagery is well-deserved, rooted firmly in his public demeanor at conferences, especially in the early years. The stories are legion, most of which follow the same scenario. Postal sits through some anonymous, relatively innocuous, descriptive paper cataloguing the phonemic system of a little-known language. He stands up, begins with a blast like “this paper has absolutely nothing to do with the study of human languages,” and proceeds to offer a barrage of arguments detailing its worthlessness—often making upwards of a dozen distinct counter-arguments against both the specific data used and the framework it is couched in. The performances were renowned for both intellectual precision and rhetorical viciousness. One tirade against Joos was so ruthless that it was stricken from the record of a Linguistic Society meeting (Hill, 1991:74), and some sense of his style is apparent in the casualness with which he categorizes his opponents’ positions as “empirically and logically contentless remarks” (of Hockett) and “substantively empty assertions” (of Gleason) and “tortured with a kind of intellectual schizophrenia” (of the whole Bloomfieldian program) in his published counterattacks (respectively, 1968 [1965]:4, 5, 6). And this (of the descriptive mandate):

我们不能与只想对言论进行分类的人争论。人们有权做他们想做的事。然而，我们可以问，这是否有权被称为“语言学”；它是否有权声称自己是一个重要的研究领域。（Dallaire 等人，1962：10）

One cannot argue with someone who wishes only to classify utterances. People have a right to do what they want. We can ask, however, whether this has the right to be called ‘linguistics’; whether it has the right to claim to be a significant field of inquiry. (Dallaire and others, 1962:10)

在这种情况下，彻底的蔑视并不罕见。伊赛亚·柏林 (Isaiah Berlin) 谈到 30 年代牛津哲学家的类似轻蔑和自鸣得意时说：“这是徒劳和愚蠢的，我毫不怀疑，这让其他人很恼火。”但他补充说：“我怀疑那些从未被这种幻想迷惑过的人，即使是短暂的，也不知道真正的智识幸福”(1980:115)。当时是麻省理工学院研究生的阿诺德·兹维基 (Arnold Zwicky) 正是用这些词句回忆当时的情绪。他说，这种恶毒的情绪是由一种强烈的信念所驱动的，即乔姆斯基的计划正在迅速接近真理：

Complete and utter dismissiveness is not unusual in these circumstances. Of a similar contemptuousness and smugness among Oxford philosophers in the thirties, Isaiah Berlin says, “This was vain and foolish and, I have no doubt, irritating to others.” But, he adds, “I suspect that those who have never been under the spell of this kind of illusion, even for a short while, have not known true intellectual happiness” (1980:115). Arnold Zwicky, an MIT graduate student at the time, recalls the mood in exactly these terms. The viciousness, he says, was propelled by an intense conviction that Chomsky’s program was closing rapidly in on the Truth:

其中有些行为带有一种圣战的色彩，有些人觉得他们必须改变人们的想法，这很重要，任何能做到这一点的手段，包括嘲笑，都是合法的。

there was a kind of holy war aspect to some of this, a feeling that some people had that they had to turn people’s minds around, and that it was important, and that any device that did this, including ridicule, was legitimate.

弗雷德里克·纽迈耶 (Frederick Newmeyer) 在这些事件的尾声时进入该领域，他认为乔姆斯基派的对抗策略总体上是有益的，因为这些对抗向整整一代语言学家表明，语言和科学足以激起人们的热情，也清楚地表明布隆菲尔德派的纲领处于守势，事实上，是在撤退 (1980a;50f; 1986a:42)。不过，他的观察中还是带有一种歉意的语气：“即使是支持该理论的本科生，也会因为无情地批评那些年龄足以做他们祖父母的语言学家而让他们的老师感到尴尬”(1986a:40)。波斯特尔也对他们的立场表示了一些同情：

Frederick Newmeyer, who entered the field just at the tail end of these events, finds the overall effect of the Chomskyans’ confrontational tactics to be salutary, because the encounters showed an entire generation of linguists that language and science are important enough to arouse the passions, and because they showed clearly that the Bloomfieldian program was on the defensive; indeed, on the retreat (1980a;50f; 1986a:42). Still, there is a somewhat apologetic tone in his observation that “even undergraduate advocates of the theory embarrassed their teachers by ruthlessly lighting into linguists old enough to be their grandparents” (1986a:40). Postal, too, shows some empathy for their position:

这确实是一种心理上痛苦的情况，因为 [布卢姆菲尔德语言学] 本身就是一种革命性的语言学，它宣称自己是研究语言的科学方法，而传统语言学是不科学的，从而获得了优势。他们自己也曾相当有力地践踏他人，树敌颇多，做了很多不愉快的事情。现在，砰的一声，在他们真正就位后不久，他们突然受到攻击，而且是以一种他们无法理解的方式。他们被告知他们不科学。这对他们来说一定是一场噩梦。

It was really a psychologically painful situation, because [Bloomfieldian linguistics] was itself a revolutionary linguistics that had gained its ascendancy by proclaiming that it was the scientific way to study language, and that traditional linguistics was unscientific. They had, themselves, trampled on people rather forcefully, made a lot of enemies, did a lot of unpleasant things. Now, bang, not very long after they were really in place, they were suddenly being attacked, and in a way that was incomprehensible to them. They were being told that they weren’t being scientific. That just had to be a nightmare for them.

事实确实如此。他们的反应是恐惧和持久的怨恨。但天已塌下来。早在 1963 年，较为冷静的布隆菲尔德派就开始承认失败 (Wells, 1963:48)。到 60 年代中期，所有人，无论是朋友还是敌人，都清楚“语言学家和心理学家都没有对语言做出他们五年前所做的事情” (Saporta, 1965:100)；就在《句法结构》出版十年后，1967 年 LSA 夏季会议上的“绝大多数论文”都“牢牢地处于转换生成领域” (Hill, 1991:89)。而布隆菲尔德派毫不夸张地说，已经成为新一代人的笑柄。 1964 年，语言研究所编写了一篇对《语言》杂志目录页的戏仿文章，其中包括各种滑稽和残酷的内容，以及亨利·李·史密斯 (Henry Lee Smith) 对乔治·特雷格 (George Trager)所著《如何出版与灭亡》一书的评论。

It was. They reacted with horror and lasting bitterness. But the sky had fallen. As early as 1963, the more dispassionate Bloomfieldians were beginning to admit defeat (Wells, 1963:48). By the middle of the decade it was clear to everyone, friend and foe alike, that “neither linguists nor psychologists [were] doing to language what they did as recently as five years ago” (Saporta, 1965:100); just ten years after the publication of Syntactic Structures, “the great majority of the papers” at the 1967 LSA summer meeting “were now firmly in the Transformational-Generative area” (Hill, 1991:89). And the Bloomfieldians had become, quite literally, jokes to the new generation. A parody of a table of contents page from the journal Language was compiled at the 1964 Linguistic Institute, including, among other burlesques and cruelties, an entry for a review by Henry Lee Smith of a book attributed to George Trager, How to Publish and Perish.

第四章

深层结构之美

CHAPTER 4

The Beauty of Deep Structure

隐性的和谐比明显的和谐更佳。

The hidden harmony is better than the obvious.

赫拉克利特

Heraclitus

总体而言，随着句法描述的深入，看似语义的问题越来越多地落入其范围

In general, as syntactic description becomes deeper, what appear to be semantic questions fall increasingly within its scope

诺姆·乔姆斯基

Noam Chomsky

传播信息

Spreading the Word

乔姆斯基的工作很快波及了邻近的学术领域。自然，最早的波及领域之一就是心理学。行为主义者和布卢姆菲尔德主义者自 20 世纪 50 年代初就开始聚在一起，后者最终决定无视大师的警告。在康奈尔大学和印第安纳大学等语言学重镇，混合会议和研讨会层出不穷，出版物不断增加，一个崭新的词“心理语言学”也应运而生。几乎所有这些工作都共享实证主义的科学哲学，并致力于将刺激和反应作为语言行为建模的主要组成部分，即言语。乔姆斯基首先通过与剑桥新兴认知社区的对话、座谈会和合作非常直接地采取行动，然后通过他对言语行为的猛烈抨击，在某种程度上间接地采取行动，对清除实证主义和刺激反应模型产生了巨大影响。在乔姆斯基发表评论的一年内，《计划与行为结构》问世，成为新心理学的旗舰教材（Miller、Galanter 和 Pribram，1960 年）。这本书深受乔姆斯基的影响，不仅体现在语言章节中，该章节复述并阐述了《句法结构》的主要论点，还体现在对行为主义的全面攻击中，热情地引用了乔姆斯基的《剥龙皮》。

Chomsky’s work very quickly rippled into neighboring academic ponds. One of the first, naturally, was psychology. Behaviorists and Bloomfieldians had been getting together since the brink of the fifties, the latter finally deciding to disregard the warnings of the master. There were hybrid conferences and seminars at linguistic strongholds like Cornell and Indiana, a growing stream of publications, and a shiny new word, psycholinguistics. Almost all of this work shared a positivist philosophy of science and a commitment to stimuli and responses as the principal components for modeling language behavior, parole. Chomsky, first very directly, through conversations, colloquia, and collaborations with the emergent cognitive community in Cambridge, then somewhat indirectly, through his deadly assault on Verbal Behavior, had a huge impact in clearing away the positivism and the stimulusresponse models. Within a year of Chomsky’s review, Plans and the Structure of Behavior came out as the flagship text of the new psychology (Miller, Galanter, and Pribram, 1960). It was heavily influenced by Chomsky, not just in its chapter on language, which rehearsed and propounded the major arguments of Syntactic Structures, but in its general attack on behaviorism, enthusiastically citing Chomsky’s skinning of the dragon.

次年，心理语言学这门交叉学科的第一本阅读集问世，其中收录了乔姆斯基的四篇文章，全部摘录自《句法结构》（表面上看，这本书与心理语言学关系不大，但到了 60 年代，人们开始通过乔姆斯基后来明确的心理主义来解读它），以及哈勒、乔治·米勒和其他来自剑桥的乔姆斯基同志的论文。尽管包括了一些行为主义前十年的工作，明显是乔姆斯基式的对行为主义理论的谴责，称其普遍未能“解释语言的一些最明显的事实”（Saporta，1961：v）。心理语言学尽管起源于行为主义，但却完全以认知为导向，深受乔姆斯基的影响，尤其是他与米勒合作撰写的《数学心理学手册》（Luce 等，1963）的基石章节——埃里克·万纳称其为“圣经”。他说：“即使是现在，这些章节在我看来仍然是该领域最清晰的基础陈述”（1988：143）。而心理学总体上不仅有乔姆斯基对行为主义的腐蚀性攻击，使他们脱离经验主义的浅滩，还有他的语言学的积极灯塔，引导他们进入新的、更丰富的水域；他的“语言论证表明，一项活动可以受到规则的约束，但同时又具有无限的自由和创造性”（Neisser，1988：86）。乔姆斯基理所当然地成为了认知科学史上一位伟大的革命英雄（Gardner，1985；Baars，1986；Hirst，1988）。

The following year, the first book of readings in the crossbred discipline of psycholinguistics came out, and it included four pieces by Chomsky, all extracted from Syntactic Structures (not, on the surface, a book much concerned with psycholinguistics, but by the sixties being read through the lens of Chomsky’s later explicit mentalism), as well as papers by Halle, George Miller, and other Chomsky comrades from Cambridge. It also began, despite including some of the behaviorist work of the preceding decade, with the distinctly Chomskyan condemnation of behaviorist theories for their endemic failure “to account for some of the most obvious facts of language” (Saporta, 1961:v). Psycholinguistics, despite its behaviorist origins, became entirely cognitive in orientation, deeply influenced by Chomsky, especially in his collaborations with Miller on the cornerstone chapters of the Handbook of Mathematical Psychology (Luce and others, 1963)—“holy writ,” Eric Wanner calls them. “Even now,” he says, “these chapters seem to me the clearest foundational statement of the field” (1988:143). And psychology in general had not only Chomsky’s corrosive attack on behaviorism to steer them from the shoals of empiricism but also the positive beacon of his linguistics to guide them into new and richer waters; his “linguistic arguments had shown that an activity could be rule governed and yet infinitely free and creative” (Neisser, 1988:86). Chomsky shows up, deservedly so, as a full-chested revolutionary hero in histories of cognitive science (Gardner, 1985; Baars, 1986; Hirst, 1988).

乔姆斯基对英语研究的影响更加分散，但同样迅速。美国结构主义者对文学和写作研究者几乎没有什么贡献；除了蔑视。布卢姆菲尔德的作品严重依赖声音，很少系统地扩展到像句子这样大的单位，并且天生对意义感到紧张。这些特点本身就足以让写作者、修辞学家和文学评论家望而却步，而这些人花大量时间研究书面文本，对句子、段落和论述非常感兴趣，并对意义充满热情。布卢姆菲尔德的作品充其量只能让英国人感到冷漠和空手而归。但它的呈现方式也让他们充满敌意。布卢姆菲尔德的作品经常伴随着对传统语法的强烈攻击，而传统语法是这些人唯一能找到有深度的文本和句子分析的地方。疏远几乎是彻底的；由于规定和描述等问题，双方经常爆发激烈甚至不愉快的冲突，英语系的人想要追求规范甚至理想，以便让小约翰正确地说话和写作，而语言学家则坚持认为约翰已经能说一口流利的语言，科学家的唯一职责就是描述语言从他嘴里或（原则上）从他笔下出来的方式。在英语大师们眼中，布卢姆菲尔德派就像非利士人。ASP 伍德豪斯以典型的、典型的势利抱怨道：“对他们来说，凡事都是对的。”语言学家的反应就像黑猩猩在水坑的另一边挥舞着他们的科学生殖器，就像霍尔的《别管你的语言！ 》（1950）中感叹的争论一样。

Chomsky’s effect on English studies was more diffuse, but equally rapid. American structuralists had little to offer people studying literature and composition; little, that is, except scorn. Bloomfieldian work was heavily sound-based, rarely extended in any systematic way to units as big as sentences, and was congenitally nervous about meaning. In themselves, these characteristics were enough to discourage composition folk, rhetoricians, and literary critics—people who spend a great deal of time with written texts, who are very interested in sentences, paragraphs, discourses, and who fret passionately about meaning. At best, Bloomfieldian work left the English people cold and empty-handed. But its presentation also left them hostile. Bloomfieldian work was regularly coupled with strident attacks on traditional grammar, the only place where these people could find text-and-sentence analyses of any depth. Alienation was almost complete; noisy, often nasty skirmishes broke out regularly over such issues as prescription and description, the English department types wanting to pursue norms, or even ideals, that they could use to make little Johnny speak and write correctly, while the linguists insisted that Johnny already spoke his language fine and that the only role for a scientist was to describe the way language came out of his mouth or (in principle) off his pen. The Bloomfieldians looked like Philistines to the English gurus. “With them,” sniffed A.S.P. Woodhouse in a typical, and typically snobby, complaint, “whatever is is right” (1952). Linguists responded like chimpanzees waving their scientific genitalia from the other side of a watering hole, as in the exclamatory polemics of Hall’s Leave Your Language Alone! (1950).

当时的气氛并不好。但英国人非常想从科学家那里得到一些他们能用的东西。所以乔姆斯基让他们梦想成真。他从句子开始，他的工作源自哈里斯的话语研究；他承诺帮助破解意义；他拥抱英语教授书架上的传统语法。他找到了一个现成的市场。斯托克韦尔、李斯和波斯特尔做了一些营销，发表了几篇精心策划的论文，并出席了会议，将布卢姆菲尔德的缺点与变革性和生成性的优点进行了对比。但这几乎没有必要：乔姆斯基和斯托克韦尔在 1958 年的德克萨斯会议上遇到了一位英语教授保罗·罗伯茨，他几乎跳进了他们的怀抱，在接下来的几年里出版了几本书和文章，罗伯茨 (Roberts) 经常与乔姆斯基 (Chomsky) 密切合作 (Roberts, 1962:viii; 1964:vii)。罗伯茨对布隆菲尔德方法论颇有好感，因此他没有参与李斯或波斯特尔的负面论战，但他在英语圈内大肆宣扬乔姆斯基方案的优点 — — “这种语法是传统语法的明确和严谨” (1963:334) — — 不久，英语界便出现了一片哗然，声称“不使用诺姆·乔姆斯基的杰出著作”就无法面对语法 (Catwell, 1966:xix)。1

The atmosphere was not good. But the English folk very much wanted to get something they could use from the scientists. So Chomsky was a dream come true for them. He starts with the sentence, his work devolved from Harris’s discourse studies; he promises to help crack meaning; and he embraces the traditional grammars on the English professors’ shelves. He found a ready market. There was a little marketing, a few well-placed papers and conference appearances by Stockwell, Lees, and Postal contrasting Bloomfieldian vices with transformational and generative virtues. But it was barely necessary: Chomsky and Stockwell met one English professor, Paul Roberts, at the 1958 Texas conference, and he practically leapt into their arms, publishing several books and articles over the next few years, often with Chomsky’s close cooperation (Roberts, 1962:viii; 1964:vii). Roberts had some allegiance to Bloomfieldian methods, so he didn’t engage in the negative polemics of Lees or Postal, but he sang the virtues of Chomsky’s program far and wide in English circles—“this grammar is traditional grammar made explicit and rigorous” (1963:334)—and, very shortly, there was an English choir raising the roofbeams with claims that it was impossible to confront grammar “without using the brilliant work of Noam Chomsky” (Catwell, 1966:xix).1

乔姆斯基对哲学的影响又有所不同，但最为成功。从乔姆斯基职业生涯一开始，甚至在他接触心理学之前，他就与许多重要人物建立了联系。在宾夕法尼亚大学，乔姆斯基选修了尼尔森·古德曼的几门课程，古德曼极力推荐他加入哈佛研究员协会，并因此与奎因、奥斯汀和巴-希勒尔等人建立了联系，这些联系中既有赞同的，也有反对的。例如，巴-希勒尔是哈里斯在语言学中首创、乔姆斯基倡导的语法形式化方法的热情支持者。他的支持对乔姆斯基对生成理论的追求起到了重要作用。当然存在一些差异（其中一些差异在乔姆斯基早期的一篇论文中可见一斑，该论文对巴-希勒尔对哈里斯——乔姆斯基，1955b；巴-希勒尔，1954 的批评提出了质疑），但这些差异反映在对语言及其模型的共同假设背景下。另一方面，奥斯汀不同意其中的大部分背景，但他对句法结构印象深刻，并将其纳入他的期末讲座。乔姆斯基发现奥斯汀的一般、普通语言意义方法非常中肯。奎因对逻辑实证主义的著名批评以及他对简单性在科学中的作用的补充认可激发了乔姆斯基，尽管乔姆斯基强烈反对奎因的行为主义语义观念。

Chomsky’s impact on philosophy was different again, but the most successful of all. There were important contacts from the very beginning of Chomsky’s career, preceding even his contacts with psychology.
