At the University of Pennsylvania Chomsky took several courses with Nelson Goodman, who strongly recommended him for the fellowship which he took up with the Harvard Society of Fellows and which in turn brought him into contact with, among others, Quine, Austin, and Bar-Hillel—contacts which were a fertile mixture of agreement and disagreement. For instance, Bar-Hillel was an enthusiastic supporter of the formal tack on syntax pioneered in linguistics by Harris and championed by Chomsky. His support was instrumental in Chomsky’s pursuit of generative theory. There were certainly some differences (a few of them visible in an early Chomsky paper that takes issue with Bar-Hillel’s criticisms of Harris—Chomsky, 1955b; Bar-Hillel, 1954), but they were reflected against a background of shared assumptions about language and its models. Austin, on the other hand, disagreed with much of that background, but he was nevertheless quite impressed with Syntactic Structures, incorporating it into his final lectures. And Chomsky found Austin’s general, ordinary-language approach to meaning very congenial. Quine’s famous criticism of logical positivism stimulated Chomsky, as did his complementary endorsement of the role simplicity played in science, though Chomsky disagreed rather violently with Quine’s behaviorist semantic notions.

但是，与对心理学和英语研究的影响不同，哲学领域并没有立即掀起人们对乔姆斯基的兴趣风暴。在 1960 年重要的国际逻辑、方法论和科学哲学会议上，乔姆斯基是“语言学的解释模型”部分的特邀发言人，他的著作至少早在普特南 (1975 [1961]:85-106) 时代就开始在严肃哲学中发挥作用。但人们的兴趣逐渐增长，直到 60 年代中期他坦率的理性主义出版物发表后才达到显著水平。到 70 年代初，吉尔·哈曼 (Gil Harman) 可以说“没有什么比乔姆斯基的语言理论对当代哲学的影响更大了”(1974: vii)，这在很大程度上是因为其认识论含义。

But, unlike the impact on psychology and on English studies, there was no immediate storm of interest in philosophy. Chomsky was the featured speaker of a section on “Explanatory Models in Linguistics” at the important 1960 International Conference on Logic, Methodology and Philosophy of Science, and his work began playing a role in serious philosophy at least as early as Putnam (1975 [1961]:85–106). But interest grew gradually, and it only reached significant levels after his frankly rationalist publications of the mid-sixties. By the early seventies, Gil Harman could say “nothing has had a greater impact on contemporary philosophy than Chomsky’s theory of language” (1974: vii), in large measure because of its epistemological implications.

乔姆斯基之所以在哲学界享有盛誉，不仅是因为他是相关学科的领军人物，而且因为他是哲学界中的一员，因为他是曾经被否定的心理理论的最有力的倡导者，他的论点使理性主义再次受到尊重。

Chomsky has become well known in philosophy, then, not just as the leading figure in a related discipline, but as one of their own, the most forceful advocate of an erstwhile-discredited theory of mind, and his arguments have made rationalism respectable again.

与此同时，在语言学领域，乔姆斯基理论正在经历非常重大的变化。句法结构之后的几年，尤其是随着研究人员的增加，出现了大量的活动——李斯的名词化研究、哈勒的音系学研究、卡茨和福多尔以及波斯特尔将语义学融入转换模型的研究。所有这些活动的核心是促使和提出诺姆·乔姆斯基是推动变革语法研究的先驱。虽然不是所有早期的变革语法学家都会同意李斯的自嘲式评价：“当时我们都追随乔姆斯基的脚步”，但没有人会否认他的工作推动了一切和所有人。2

Meanwhile, back in linguistics, Chomskyan theories were undergoing very substantial changes. The post-Syntactic Structures years, particularly with the increase of researchers, saw a great deal of activity—Lees’s work on nominalizations, Halle’s work in phonology, Katz and Fodor and Postal’s work splicing semantics into the shifting transformational model. At the heart of all this activity, prompting and proposing and promoting, was Noam Chomsky. While not every early transformational grammarian would agree with Lees’ self-deprecating assessment that “we all rode on Chomsky’s coat tails then,” none would deny that his work was driving everything and everyone else.2

进入伟大的unNoam

Into the Great unNoam

诺姆不是人类。他是天使。

Noam is not a human being. He’s an angel.

[乔姆斯基]极其不诚实……既古怪又让人尴尬。

[Chomsky is] uncommonly dishonest … a crank and an embarrassment.

马丁·佩雷茨

Martin Peretz

既然我们已经看到了他非凡的崛起，但在我们深入探讨这场崛起的巅峰之作《句法理论面面观》所引发的争论之前，也许我们应该简要地介绍一下乔姆斯基的个性。也许不应该：我们处在危险而神秘的领域；人们的观点确实多种多样，从凯泽的天使到佩雷茨的暴躁魔鬼，两端都有明显的聚类，而且两个极端都有动机，我当然没有特别的能力来解开他性格中那些几乎同等比例地支持崇拜和妖魔化的因素。唯一值得安慰的是，很少有人对乔姆斯基的个性有特别的了解。哈伊·罗斯是乔姆斯基的学生、同事和对手，在麻省理工学院语言学系与他一起工作了二十多年，他说他几乎完全不了解这个人的个性：

Now that we have seen his phenomenal rise but before we look into the war which grew out of the crowning document of that rise, Aspects of the Theory of Syntax, perhaps this is the place for a brief excursus on Chomsky’s personality. Perhaps not: we are in dangerous and enigmatic territory; opinions really do range from Keyser’s angel to Peretz’s cranky devil, with significant clusters at both ends, and there really is motivation for both extremes, and I certainly have no special competence for the job of disentangling the elements of his character that have sponsored, in almost equal proportions, devotion and demonization. The one consolation here is that very few people do have special competence on Chomsky’s personality. Háj Ross, who was his student, his colleague, and his opponent, who worked under him and with him for more than two decades in the MIT linguistics department, says he is almost completely in the dark about the man’s personality:

乔姆斯基真是个神秘人物。我不知道他为人如何……

Chomsky is a real mystery man. What he’s like as a person, I don’t know ….

在大学之外，他们从未有过任何个人接触。当有人来找诺姆时，他们会在他的办公室里见面，甚至从未一起吃午饭或做其他事情。你永远不会去乔姆斯基的家里参加聚会或做其他事情，即使是在工作人员、教职员工之间……

There was never any personal contact outside of the university. When people came, they would meet Noam in his office, never even go to lunch or anything. You never go to Chomsky’s house for a party or something, even among staff members, faculty members ….

我对乔姆斯基知之甚少，也不知道乔姆斯基的心在哪里。

I know very little about Chomsky, where Chomsky’s heart is.

甚至凯泽的评价也更多地与乔姆斯基看似超凡脱俗的智力水平有关，而不是他的个性；佩雷茨的评价则更多地与政治分歧有关，而不是个性。在我们故事中涉及的人物中，哈勒可能是唯一一个知道乔姆斯基心意的人。但有一些相当极端和不可避免的特点几乎影响了我们故事的方方面面，值得注意。我们已经看到了几个特点——特别是他巨大的智力和雄辩的天赋——仅凭这些品质就足以引起一些人的崇拜，另一些人的强烈嫉妒。至少还有三个特点需要特别注意。

Even Keyser’s assessment has to do more with the seemingly extra-anthropic level of Chomsky’s intelligence than with his personality; Peretz’s, more with political differences than with personality. Of the people involved in our story, probably Halle is the only one who knows where Chomsky’s heart is. But there are some rather extreme and inescapable characteristics which contribute to virtually every aspect of our tale and which call for some notice. We have already seen several—in particular, his immense intellectual and eristic gifts—and these qualities alone are enough to trigger worship from some quarters, bitter jealousy from others. At least three more call for some specific attention.

首先，他的亲切：乔姆斯基是一个不知疲倦地讲课、长时间工作、每年出版几本书的人，他愿意花几个小时与任何有兴趣与他交谈的人交谈。有时等待的时间很长——他的日程表提前几个月就排满了——但他会耐心、友善地、恰到好处地向语言学家、普通人、大学生解释他的想法，向其他人的学生、记者、导演和蜡烛制造商，与他们仔细探讨他们的想法。人们成群结队地来到麻省理工学院看望他。他的语言学课程通常报名人数很少，每周都在演讲厅举行，以容纳数十名访客，他办公室外的椅子总是温暖的。对于研究生，他总是乐于助人。他指导过的几乎所有论文（超过六十篇）以及许多他没有正式参与的论文，在许多大学里，都包括对他为这项工作付出的时间和思想的衷心感谢。3他详细地回复任何人、任何事的来信。他无偿分享想法。他对各个层次的学术探索有着令人钦佩的承诺。

First, his graciousness: Chomsky, a man who lectures tirelessly, who works long, hard hours, who publishes several books a year, will spend hours with absolutely anyone who is interested in talking with him. Sometimes the wait is a long one—his calendar is booked months in advance—but he will patiently, kindly, and in exactly the right level of detail, explain his ideas to linguists, to lay people, to undergraduates, to other people’s students, to journalists and directors and candlestick makers, and carefully explore their ideas with them. People come to MIT in droves to see him. His linguistics classes, which usually have quite small enrollments, are held in a lecture theater to accommodate the scores of visitors every week, and the chairs outside his office are always warm. To graduate students, he is ceaselessly helpful. Virtually all the theses he has supervised (well over sixty), and a large number he has had no official role in, at a wide range of universities, include heartfelt acknowledgments of the time and thought he has given the work.3 He answers letters, from anyone and everyone, about anything, in great detail. He gives away ideas for free. He has a deeply admirable commitment to scholarly exploration, at all levels.

第二，与优雅相反的是他的脾气：乔姆斯基可以肆无忌惮地诋毁他人，而且他经常这样做。他发表的评论可能极其轻蔑，他的私人评论可能达到令人吃惊的蔑视程度。他有许多具体的蔑视对象，但最普遍的是每一位语言学家——通常用“领域”这样的集合名词来概括——他们对语言和语言学的看法与他大相径庭。例如，他经常谈到语言学的不成熟，将其与“更成熟”的科学进行对比，这些言论的上下文总是暴露出该术语背后的分歧意图。他的意思并不是简单地说语言学处于比物理学或化学更早的发展阶段，语言学家只需解决问题方法论问题并达成其他科学工作者已经实现的经验共识。他还认为语言学家是爱发牢骚、不讲道理、脾气暴躁的青少年。他承认，有“少数非常严肃的人”（或者，用他独特的说法，是“该领域的极少数人”）——他们碰巧同情乔姆斯基的目标——但语言学家中的其他人几乎在智力、情感甚至道德上都是幼稚的。4在某种程度上，这似乎反映了需要在“我们和他们”甚至“我和他们”的思想氛围中工作。在某种程度上，这是一种错觉。他的计划非常成功，但他似乎总是感到四面楚歌。在某种程度上，这只是一种傲慢而已。

Second, the curious counterpole to graciousness, his spleen: Chomsky can, and often does, sling mud with abandon. His published comments can be extremely dismissive, his private comments can reach startling levels of contempt. He has many specific objects of scorn, but his most general one is every linguist—often wrapped together in a collective noun such as “the field”—who holds opinions about language and linguistics which depart significantly from his. He often speaks, for instance, about the immaturity of linguistics, contrasting it with the “more mature” sciences, and the context of these remarks invariably betrays the forked intentions behind the term. He does not mean simply that linguistics is in an earlier developmental stage than physics or chemistry, that linguists have only to solve methodological problems and reach empirical consensuses that workers in those other sciences have already achieved. He also means that linguists are whiny, irrational, petulant adolescents. There are, he allows, “a few quite serious people” (or, in one of his peculiar locutions, “a tiny majority of the field”)—who happen coincidentally to be sympathetic with Chomsky’s goals—but virtually everyone else in linguistics is intellectually and emotionally and even morally callow.4 In part, this seems to reflect the need to work in an us-and-them, or even a me-and-them, intellectual climate. In part, it is delusion. His program is hugely successful, yet he always seems to feel embattled. In part, it is just flat arrogance.

第三，回到乔姆斯基的积极、极其积极的一面，他的同情心：乔姆斯基显然非常感动，也非常关心被压迫的人，尤其是当他自己的政府或其代理人践踏他们的时候。事实上，上面引用罗斯的话有点太突然了。他说他不知道乔姆斯基的心在哪里，“只知道他的心是为那些被肮脏的政治压迫的人服务的。他为这样的人努力工作。”他为这样的人努力工作。从 60 年代中期开始，正当生成语义学开始腾飞时，他用尽语言学所能获得的每一分注意力和力量，反对越南战争、对战争负责的领导人和支持他们的知识分子。在当时的气氛下，这意味着

Third, returning to the positive, extremely positive, side of Chomsky, his compassion: Chomsky is clearly very moved by, and very moving on, the downtrodden, especially when his own government or its agents have done the treading. The quotation from Ross above, in fact, was cut off a little too abruptly. He says he doesn’t know where Chomsky’s heart is, “except that his heart is for people who are oppressed by nasty politics. He works very hard for people like that.” He works very hard for people like that. Beginning in the mid-sixties, just as generative semantics was starting to take wing, he opposed the war in Vietnam, and the leaders responsible for it, and the intellectuals supporting them, with every ounce of attention and strength he could wrest from his linguistics. What this meant, in the climate of the time, was

每周有几天晚上在教堂里向六七个听众演讲，这些听众大多无聊或充满敌意；或在某人的家里，那里可能聚集着几个人；或在大学会议上，讨论越南、伊朗、中美洲和核武器等话题，希望参加者的数量可能超过组织者。（Chomsky，1987：54-55）

speaking several nights a week at a church to an audience of half a dozen people, mostly bored or hostile, or at someone’s home where a few people might be gathered, or at a meeting at a college that included the topics of Vietnam, Iran, Central America, and nuclear arms, in the hope that maybe the participants would outnumber the organizers. (Chomsky, 1987:54–55)

他有着与同情心相匹配的勇气，随着反战运动的兴起，他走到了抗议的最前线，领导游行，参与公民抗命，被捕，并不可避免地成为了尼克松的敌人名单（“还有其他语言学家获得过这样的荣誉吗？”博林格钦佩地问道—1991 [1974]：28）。5他的政治兴趣并没有减弱，他为之倾注的精力也没有减弱，这深深地侵蚀了他的语言学。他投入政治活动的时间几乎迫使他完全放弃了他在音系学、数学建模和语言学史方面的工作，“几乎不再阅读这些内容”（Chomsky，1982a：57）。他的政治演讲活动与他的语言学活动相匹配，尽管后者比他早了 15 年，但他政治著作的庞大书目几乎与他的语言学和哲学著作的庞大书目一样长（Koerner and Tajima，1986）。

He had the courage to match his compassion, and as the anti-war movement gathered some steam, he moved to the forefront of the protests, leading marches, engaging in civil disobedience, getting arrested, and inevitably, ending up on Nixon’s enemy list (“Has any other linguist received [that] accolade?” asked Bolinger admiringly—1991 [1974]:28).5 His political interests have not subsided, nor has the energy he pours into them, which eats deeply into his linguistics. The time he allocates to political activism has forced him almost completely to abandon his work in phonology, in mathematical modeling, and in the history of linguistics “up to the point of barely reading about them” (Chomsky, 1982a:57). His political speaking engagements match his linguistic ones, and the huge bibliography of his political writings is almost as long as the huge bibliography of his linguistic and philosophical writings, despite the fifteen-year head start of the latter (Koerner and Tajima, 1986).

他举止优雅，言辞犀利，表现出极大的同情心和勇气。他工作努力。他聪明。他辩论有力。我们能说的就这么多了；谁能知道他或任何人的心在哪里？

He acts graciously, he spouts invective, he displays great compassion and courage. He works hard. He’s smart. He argues compellingly. That’s about as much as we can say; who can tell where his, or anyone’s, heart is?

但这些特点是显而易见的，而且由于乔姆斯基的巨大成就，这些特点被大大放大了。早在 1970 年，即《句法结构》出版后不到十五年，他就在剑桥大学出版社的《现代大师》丛书中出版了自己的专著，与爱因斯坦、弗洛伊德和马克思的作品并列（Lyons，1970a）。该书将书名从“诺姆·乔姆斯基”简化为“乔姆斯基”，目前已出版第三版，是该系列中唯一这样做的书籍（Lyons, 1991），并且还有数十本其他纪念书籍加入其中——其中有好几本只以他的名字作为标题，以及诸如《论诺姆·乔姆斯基》、《对乔姆斯基的思考》、《乔姆斯基的思想体系》、《挑战乔姆斯基》、《乔姆斯基更新》、《乔姆斯基式的转变》，甚至还有一部戏剧《诺姆·乔姆斯基讲座》 ——这还不包括数百本以更笼统的术语假设、教授、攻击或歪曲他的观点的书籍。6事实上，乔姆斯基是有史以来引用量最大的人之一——再次与弗洛伊德和马克思齐名，远远超过爱因斯坦——他的作品被引用了成千上万次。根据科学信息研究所的数据，过去七年美国学术期刊的十大引用量如下（Kesterton，1993）：

But these characteristics are clear, and they are dramatically magnified through the tremendous stature Chomsky has achieved. As early as 1970, not even fifteen years after the publication of Syntactic Structures, he was given his own monograph in the Cambridge University Press Modern Masters series, alongside Einstein, and Freud, and Marx (Lyons, 1970a). That book, stripping its title down from Noam Chomsky to just Chomsky, has now gone into its third edition, the only one in the series to have done so (Lyons, 1991), and it has been joined by dozens of other celebrations—several more with only his name as title, along with such entries as On Noam Chomsky, Reflections on Chomsky, Chomsky’s System of Ideas, Challenging Chomsky, The Chomsky Update, The Chomskyan Turn, even The Noam Chomsky Lectures, a play—not counting the hundreds of books which assume or teach or attack or mangle his notions in more general terms.6 Chomsky, in fact, is one of the all-time citations kings—again in the company of Freud and Marx, and a long way beyond Einstein—with thousands upon thousands of references to his work. According to the Institute for Scientific Information, the Top Ten list for U.S. academic journals over the past seven years looks like this (Kesterton, 1993):

1. 马克思

1. Marx

2.列宁

2. Lenin

3.莎士比亚

3. Shakespeare

4.亚里士多德

4. Aristotle

5.圣经

5. The Bible

6.柏拉图

6. Plato

7.弗洛伊德

7. Freud

8.乔姆斯基

8. Chomsky

9.黑格尔

9. Hegel

10.西塞罗

10. Cicero

乔姆斯基是唯一一个有活力的人，更不用说在思想舞台上活跃的人了。

Chomsky is the only one with a pulse, let alone an active role on the intellectual stage.

这种地位意味着，他眉毛的每一次摆动都会在语言学界掀起波澜。作为最温和的例子，他的政治关切产生了一点影响，吸引了有社会意识的学生学习语言学，并激励他通过不断的榜样影响了其他人。但他的仁慈和脾气却产生了更为直接的后果。他有朋友，也有激烈的朋友。他也有敌人，也有激烈的敌人。他尖刻的辩论风格让模仿者陷入尴尬的极端，在这方面，他有很多模仿者，既为他辩护，又攻击他。最近，詹姆斯·麦克洛斯基想知道为什么“音系学家、形态学家和语义学家都能在礼貌的分歧中生存和合作，而句法学家似乎更喜欢愤怒、辩论和人身攻击”(1988:18)。当然，句法本身并不会引起派系冲突，可能有几个答案，但其中一个，毫无疑问是最重要的一个，是诺姆·乔姆斯基。他的举止定义了这个领域，不仅是因为他取代了布卢姆菲尔德派、压制了生成语义学家并轻蔑地驳回了偶然的攻击者，从而伤害了一些人的感情，还因为他为达到这些目的所采用的论证风格，因为他用这种论证风格吸引、训练和激怒了那些人，因为自上世纪 50 年代末以来，这个领域就弥漫着一种枪手心态。

This stature means that virtually every twitch of his eyebrow sends off waves of influence in linguistics. His political concerns, as the mildest example, have had a small influence, attracting socially conscious students to linguistics, and inspiring others through his ceaseless example. But his graciousness and his spleen have had far more immediate consequences. He has friends, vehement ones. He has enemies, vehement ones. His withering polemical style has led emulators to embarrassing extremes, and he has many emulators on this score, both defending him and attacking him. Recently, James McCloskey wondered why it is that “phonologists, morphologists, and semanticists can all survive and cooperate in courteous disagreement, but syntacticians seem to thrive on a more robust diet of anger, polemic, and personal abuse” (1988:18). Certainly there is nothing inherently factionalizing about syntax, and there may be several answers, but one of them, and unquestionably one of the most significant, is Noam Chomsky. His demeanor has defined the field, not just because he hurt some feelings by displacing the Bloomfieldians and quashing the generative semanticists and contemptuously dismissing stray attackers, but because of the style of argument he uses to those ends, and because of the people he has attracted and trained and provoked with that style of argument, because of the gunslinger mentality that has suffused the field since the late fifties.

布卢姆菲尔德派被驱逐后，他对社会学领域的巨大影响首先从他的追随者对《方面》的解读开始，这个过程以生成语义学家对他们前任领袖的看法转变为典型。罗宾·莱考夫回忆道，一开始，他们“都觉得他们对乔姆斯基的忠诚比职业承诺更深——近乎崇拜”。但是“一旦人们不再把乔姆斯基当成偶像”，一旦他昔日的追随者沦为他可怕言论的受害者，“他就被重新塑造成恶魔、敌人”(1989:963, 970)。

The first ripples of his tremendous influence on the sociology of the field, once the Bloomfieldians were dispatched, began with his followers’ exegesis of Aspects— a process epitomized by the shift in perspective the generative semanticists had toward their former leader. At the outset, they “all felt they owed an allegiance deeper than professional commitment to Chomsky—it verged on worship,” Robin Lakoff remembers. But “once Chomsky was seen not to be an idol,” once his erstwhile devotees fell on the receiving ended of his terrible rhetoric, “he was recast as satanic, the Enemy” (1989:963, 970).

这个过程始于对Aspects 的核心概念——深层结构的探索，这看起来十分简单。

This process began, innocently enough, with the exploration of Aspects’ central notion, deep structure.

追寻隐藏的和谐

Stalking the Hidden Harmonies

深层结构至少可以追溯到 Port-Royal-des-Champs 修道院。Port-Royal 派（主要是 Antoine Arnauld）是 Modistic 使命的最后阶段，他们正在寻找语言之下的某种东西，某种更深层、更深刻的东西，那种确定的语言。但他们更深层、更深刻的东西看起来非常像拉丁语，还带有逻辑，这种组合只会让 Bloomfieldians 发出轻蔑的笑声。拉丁语作为美洲印第安语言的描述工具是如此的失败，以至于它的存在本身就足以招致 Bloomfieldians 的蔑视，但逻辑这种人为的东西甚至更糟糕。对于布隆菲尔德来说，逻辑就是一致性和规范性的代名词，是令人憎恶的“试图将逻辑标准应用于语言的学校传统”的可憎部分（1933:6），哈里斯警告说，将语言强行塞入“一张普罗克拉斯提斯之床，并……将一套逻辑范畴强加于所有语言”，会掩盖语言之间的差异，这是危险的（1951 [1947]:2）。再加上心理主义（逻辑是“所有心理活动的规则”——Arnauld and Nicole，1963 [1662]:20），整个项目看起来可悲地误入歧途；因此，寻找普遍性只是布隆菲尔德计划中另一个非常遥远的未来项目（1933:20）。甚至萨丕尔也曾惆怅地说过，挖掘语言“伟大的基本平面图”是一项“有朝一日”才能完成的任务（1949a [1921]:144）。

Deep structure goes back at least to the Port-Royal-des-Champs abbey. The Port-Royalists (chiefly, Antoine Arnauld) were at the tail end of the Modistic mission, looking for something underneath language, something deeper, more profound, that determined language. But their deeper, more profound somethings looked an awful lot like Latin, with a side order of logic, a combination plate which got little more than a disdainful chuckle from the Bloomfieldians. Latin had been such a dismal failure as a descriptive tool for Amerindian languages that its presence alone was enough to earn the Bloomfieldians’ scorn, but logic, something artificial, was even worse. It was synonymous with consistency and prescription for Bloomfield, an odious part of the hated “school tradition, which seeks to apply logical standards to language” (1933:6), and Harris warned of the dangers of obscuring the differences among languages by forcing them all into “a single Procrustean bed, and … imposing on all of them alike a single set of logical categories” (1951 [1947]:2). Throw in mentalism (logic being the “rules for all activities of the mind”—Arnauld and Nicole, 1963 [1662]:20), and the whole project looked piteously misguided; the search for universals was therefore yet another project in Bloomfield’s program for the very distant future (1933:20). Even Sapir had said wistfully that spading up “the great underlying ground-plans” of language was a task for a long-off “some day” (1949a [1921]:144).

但乔姆斯基击溃布隆菲尔德派的主要武器之一，就是利用了他们未能洞察语言本质的缺陷。除了几项清剿行动（乔姆斯基对赖希林和乌伦贝克的反击、莱科夫对霍克特的反击、麦考利对霍克特的攻击、波斯特尔对所有支持成分结构的人的攻击、波斯特尔对布隆菲尔德音系学的攻击、波斯特尔对马丁内特的攻击、波斯特尔对迪克森的反击……）之外，7到 1965 年，溃败已近乎彻底。从深处看，语言卷土重来，势如破竹。这种回归的标志、印记和交付就是《句法理论面面观》 ，这是乔姆斯基对《句法结构》所引入或引发的发展的精彩总结。在当时的行话中，《句法结构》是《旧约》；《面面观》是《新约》。

But one of the principal weapons in Chomsky’s rout of the Bloomfieldians was exploiting their failure to look underneath language, and, aside from a few mopping-up operations (Chomsky’s counterattack on Reichling and Uhlenbeck; Lakoff’s counterattack on Hockett; McCawley’s attack on Hockett; Postal’s attack on everyone who endorsed constituent structure; Postal’s attack on Bloomfieldian phonology; Postal’s attack on Martinet; Postal’s counterattack on Dixon …),7 the rout was all but complete by 1965. Looking underneath language was back, with a vengeance. The sign, seal, and delivery of this return was Aspects of the Theory of Syntax, Chomsky’s magnificent summary of the developments introduced or incited by Syntactic Structures. In the argot of the day, Syntactic Structures was the Old Testament; Aspects, the New.

这些称谓在许多方面都很恰当，尤其是句法结构的语义推测如何预示着体貌的技术发展。这种类型学最明显的例子是早期模型的核心句——一个角色不确定但与含义明显相关的概念——体貌将其转化为语义门户，即深层结构。新模型的其他几个元素也为句法结构的精神注入了活力，但毫无疑问，深层结构是新模型的关键。对于任何给定的派生词，它是词语出现的点，是词语之间限制得到强制执行的点，是指定主语和宾语等语法关系的点，也是纳入某些抽象词素以触发模型示例性转换的后期应用的点。所有这些特征都有非常明确的语义联系。例如，单词是意义的单位，而确保颜色词（如green ）修饰具体词（如eggs）而不是抽象词（如ideas）的规则是一种防止语法产生无意义的方法。主语和宾语，无论它们是什么，都是命题意义的明确信号（ Fideau bit the cat 的意思与The cat bit Fideau 的意思完全不同），抽象词素区分句子类型，如问题和命令，以及否定和肯定断言。方面实现了句法结构对可靠和有启发性的语义程序的承诺。

The designations are apt in many ways, especially in how the semantic speculations of Syntactic Structures prefigure technical developments in Aspects. The clearest case of this typology is the early model’s kernel sentence—a notion with an indeterminate role but clearly relevant to meaning—which Aspects reincarnates as the semantic portal, deep structure. Several other elements of the new model also put flesh to the spirit of Syntactic Structures, but deep structure was, unquestionably, the crux of the new model. For any given derivation, it was the point at which the words showed up, at which restrictions between words were enforced, at which grammatical relations like subject and object were specified, and at which certain abstract morphemes were incorporated to trigger the later application of the model’s exemplary transformations. All of these characteristics have very clear semantic links. Words, for instance, are units of meaning, and rules which ensure that a color-term such as green modifies concrete words (like eggs) but not abstract ones (like ideas) is a way of preventing the grammar from generating nonsense. Subject and object are, whatever else they may be, clear signals of propositional meaning (Fideau bit the cat means something very different from The cat bit Fideau), and the abstract morphemes distinguish among sentence types, like question and command, as well as between negative and positive assertions. Aspects fulfilled the promise of Syntactic Structures for a responsible and revealing semantic program.

Aspects中的语义解决方案的形式简单、直观，因此在这两方面都极具吸引力。它提供的集成模型非常漂亮。其核心是句法结构的生成引擎，它产生了一个深层结构。深层结构为语义成分提供信息，解释含义。它还为转换提供信息，将其变成表层结构。反过来，表层结构又为音系成分提供信息，解释声音。派生将它们联系起来。

The shape of the semantic solution in Aspects is simple, intuitive, and therefore, on both counts, extremely attractive. The integrated model it served up was beautiful. At its heart the generative engine of Syntactic Structures hummed, producing a deep structure. The deep structure fed the semantic component, accounting for the meaning. It also fed the transformations, which turned it into a surface structure. The surface structure, in turn, fed the phonological component, accounting for the sound. The derivation linked them.

虽然存在着大量的本轮，也存在着巨大的空白，但总体轮廓足以让早期的乔姆斯基主义者感到乐观，即使不是傲慢。他们在短短几年内就制定出了一个优雅的框架，实现了至少自斯多葛学派以来所有语言学工作的最终目标。他们正式将声音和意义联系起来。

There were epicycles, lots of them, and there were large gaps, but the general outline was compelling enough to warrant the optimism, if not the arrogance, of the early Chomskyans. They had, in a few short and feverish years, hammered out an elegant framework which accomplished the ultimate goal of all linguistic work from at least the time of the Stoics. They had formally linked sound and meaning.

但《旧约》和《新约》对句法结构和体貌的隐喻在几个重要方面是完全错误的。乔姆斯基的第一本书具有《新约》的清晰度、单义性，甚至在某种意义上具有叙事驱动力。《体貌》则没有那么直接。

But the Old Testament/New Testament cryptonyms for Syntactic Structures and Aspects are exactly wrong in a few important respects. Chomsky’s first book has the clarity, univocality, even, in a sense, the narrative drive, of the New Testament. Aspects is far less direct.

《句法结构》是一场独角戏。到 1965 年，转换语法已彻底转型 — — 增、减、置换。虽然该理论很大程度上仍是乔姆斯基的，但它显示出通过委员会折射的迹象。《形态》比《句法结构》更全面、含义更深刻、技术上更详细。但它的边缘也更模糊，断言也更谨慎。这种谨慎在《形态》模型的核心假设 Katz-Postal 原则中表现得最为明显，该原则认为转换对语义没有影响。阿斯派克斯对这一原则的认可在正文中是强有力的（如果有的话，有迹象表明它可能还不够——1965 [1964]：158-59），但这一认可伴随着一个散漫的注释，暗示另一方面，它可能“有点太强烈了”（1965 [1964]：224n5）。阿斯派克斯的释经学潜力更接近旧约中的先知书，而不是新约中的先知书，后代语言学家在其中找到了支持各种观点的证据。8

Syntactic Structures is a one-man show. By 1965, transformational grammar had been thoroughly transformed—added to, subtracted from, permuted. While the theory was still very much Chomsky’s, it showed signs of refraction through a committee. Aspects is more comprehensive, deeper in its implications, and much more detailed technically than Syntactic Structures. But it is also blurrier around the edges, and more cagey in its assertions. This caginess is nowhere more apparent than with the central hypothesis of the Aspects model, the Katz-Postal principle, which says that transformations have no semantic impact. Aspects ‘endorsement of that principle is forceful in the main text (if anything, there are indications it might not go far enough—1965 [1964]:158–59), but the endorsement is accompanied by a discursive note hinting that, on the other hand, it could be “somewhat too strong” (1965 [1964]:224n5). Aspects’ hermeneutical potential is much closer to the prophetic books of the Old Testament than the New, and subsequent generations of linguists have found support in it for an amazing range of positions.8

《Aspects》中产生的最初两种立场——生成语义学和解释语义学——实际上可以追溯到正文中关于卡茨-波斯特尔假设的主张与其注释之间的矛盾：乔姆斯基说它可能太弱，但又说，也许它太强。生成语义学支持太弱的立场；解释语义学支持太强的立场。双方都把《Aspects》视为他们的定义性文献；乔姆斯基则视为他们的精神领袖。

The first two positions to grow out of Aspects—generative semantics and interpretive semantics—can in fact be traced to exactly that tension between the main text’s claims about the Katz-Postal hypothesis and its but-then-again note: Chomsky says it is perhaps too weak, and then again, well, perhaps it is too strong. Generative semantics went with the too-weak position; interpretive semantics went with the too-strong position. Both sides took Aspects as their defining document; Chomsky, as their spiritual leader.

深层结构的必然性

The Inevitability of Deep Structure

如果不赋予语义考虑绝对关键的作用，那么发展普遍的句法理论将是荒谬的。

It would be absurd to develop a general syntactic theory without assigning an absolutely crucial role to semantic considerations.

诺姆·乔姆斯基

Noam Chomsky

有多种方法可以解读转换语法的早期历史，但最有启发性的方法之一是借助约翰·戈德史密斯和杰弗里·哈克提出的两种形容词灯，即分布和中介。戈德史密斯和哈克 (1991) 表示，分布语言学程序主要旨在获得正确的符号序列（声音和单词）。中介程序主要旨在绘制声音和意义之间的关系。

There are several ways to read the early history of transformational grammar, but one of the most revealing ways is by the light of two adjectival lamps that John Goldsmith and Geoffrey Huck propose, distributional and mediational. A distributional linguistics program, Goldsmith and Huck (1991) say, is one that aims primarily at getting the sequences of signifiers—the sounds and the words—right. A mediational program aims primarily at charting the relations between sound and meaning.

这些是倾向，不是绝对的，它们可以以任何比例出现。但是，在程序中，一种倾向往往提供驱动力，而另一种倾向则被严重忽视。我们已经看到，布卢姆菲尔德派一直专注于分配问题，对中介问题非常谨慎，以至于他们将其排除在外。莫迪斯泰派则走得太远，他们采取了相反的政策，认为对声音的所有兴趣都是不科学的和亚语言的。

These are orientations, not absolutes, and they can come in any proportions. But one often provides the driving genius in programs where the other is badly slighted. The Bloomfieldians, we have seen, were relentlessly preoccupied with distributional concerns, and so wary of mediational ones that they ruled them out of the field. The Modistae went so far in the other direction that they followed the reverse policy, ruling all interest in sound as unscientific and sublinguistic.

从这些术语来看，从句法结构到句法理论方面的转换语法的历史，是从分配目标到中介目标的戏剧性转变。故事的英雄，大调解人，是深层结构。

Read by the light of these terms, the history of transformational grammar from Syntactic Structures to Aspects of the Theory of Syntax, is a dramatic move from distributional goals to mediational goals. The hero of the story, the grand mediator, is deep structure.

麻省理工学院及其周边地区耗费了大量变革性能量，用于消除阻碍深层结构形成的障碍。记得，关于变革的最早研究出现在哈里斯对话语模式的研究中，以及乔姆斯基以一种特别宿命的乐观态度看待的背景下：

A great deal of the transformational-generative energy expended in and around MIT was used to dismantle the obstacles blocking the formulation of deep structure. The earliest work on the transformation arose, remember, in Harris’s investigations of discourse patterns, and in a context that Chomsky viewed with a peculiarly fatalistic sanguinity:

我记得自己还是学生时对语言学很感兴趣——这些问题很有趣，但我们都在想十年后我们会做什么。假设你已经对每种语言都做了音位分析。假设你已经对每种语言都做了 IC（直接成分）分析。这很有趣。就像填字游戏一样。它很有挑战性，很难。但十年后它将结束。这就是这个领域的样子。看起来它基本上已经结束了。

I remember as a student being intrigued by [linguistics]—the problems were fun and everything—but we were all wondering what we were going to do in ten years. Suppose you’ve done a phonemic analysis of every language. Suppose you’ve done an IC [Immediate Constituent] analysis of every language. It’s fun to do. It’s like a cross-word puzzle. It’s challenging and hard. But it’s going to be over in ten years. That’s the way the field looked. It looked as if it were essentially over.

就在那时，哈里斯有了这个想法，他想通过观察话语结构来做一些新的事情。他尝试利用语言分析的特点来进行话语分析。

Well, at that point, Harris had this idea of trying to do something new by looking at the structure of discourse. He tried to use the features of linguistic analysis for discourse analysis.

然而，将标准的布隆菲尔德程序应用于话语并非易事，因为它们主要依赖于整个语料库的频繁重现以及大量的分布数据。例如，[p ¬ ] 和 [p h ] 都是同一个英语音素 /p/ 的成员的论点，依赖于在多种环境（如pit、tip和stipple）中发现每个音素的多次出现。{-d}、{-t} 和 {-əd} 都是同一个英语词素 {-PAST} 的实例的论点，依赖于包含大量过去时动词的语料库（特别是像barred、rushed和dated这样的动词）。但话语单位——句子，比音素或单词更重要。即使在很长的语料库中，相同的句子类型也很少出现，甚至根本不会出现。

Applying standard Bloomfieldian procedures to discourse was no easy task, however, since they depend crucially on frequent recurrence throughout a corpus, on lots of distributional data. For instance, the argument that [p¬] and [ph] are both members of the same English phoneme, /p/, depends on finding many occurrences of each, in a number of environments (like pit and tip and stipple). The argument that {-d}, {-t}, and {-əd} are all instances of the same English morpheme, {-PAST}, depends on a corpus which includes a lot of past tense verbs (in particular, verbs like barred, rushed, and dated). But the units of discourse, sentences, are a mother crew than phonemes or words. The same sentence type recurs rarely, if at all, even in very long corpora.

因此，哈里斯需要一个工具来规范他所分析的文本，将其简化为基本句型的核心。他需要转换。

So Harris needed a tool to normalize the texts he was analyzing, to reduce them to a core of elementary sentence types. He needed transformations.

一旦他有了自己的转变，尽管存在着根深蒂固的语义疑虑，他还是清楚地看到它们可以在语法中发挥中介作用：

Once he had his transformations, despite very deep-set semantic qualms, he saw clearly that they could serve a mediational role in grammar:

意义是一个评价问题，不能直接归入结构语言学或转换理论所发展的科学类型。不过，出于各种目的，我们可能建立一些实际的意义评价；而对于大多数这样的评价，转换将具有特殊的地位。许多句子彼此转换，但意义大致相同……这是一个直接的印象。……转换在多大程度上以及在何种意义上保持意义不变是一个有待研究的问题；但我们已经知道足够多的知识，使转换成为一种在语义受控条件下降低句子复杂性的可能工具。（Harris，1970 [1957]：449-50）

Meaning is a matter of evaluation, and cannot be fitted directly into the type of science that is developed in structural linguistics or in transformational theory. Still, for various purposes it may be possible to set up some practical evaluation of meaning; and with respect to most of those evaluations, transformations will have a’ special status. That many sentences which are transforms of each other have more or less the same meaning … is an immediate impression. … To what extent, and in what sense, transformations hold meaning constant is a matter for investigation; but enough is known to make transformations a possible tool for reducing the complexity of sentences under semantically controlled conditions. (Harris, 1970 [1957]:449–50)

这种在语义受控条件下运作的冲动甚至充斥在术语中。在去除表面变化之后，文本的精华就是哈里斯所说的“内核”，而内核的概念如果没有意义，则是不连贯的。内核句子不可能包含句法本质，因为根据定义，转换会改变句法。它也不可能是形态本质，因为转换会添加和删除形态素；也不可能是音系本质，因为转换会改变声音模式。哈里斯的内核是话语的语义、命题本质。9

This impulse to operate under semantically controlled conditions even suffuses the terminology. The distillate of a text, after the surface variations are boiled away, was what Harris called kernels, and the notion of a kernel is incoherent without some recourse to meaning. The kernel sentence could not contain the syntactic essence, since transformations, by definition, alter syntax. Nor could it be the morphological essence, since transformations add and delete morphemes; nor phonological, since transformations alter sound patterns. Harris’s kernels are the semantic, propositional essence of the discourse.9

乔姆斯基的早期体系直接源于哈里斯的工作。最明显的是术语方面的，但也有更微妙的义务：特别是内核和转换的概念在某种程度上具有语义特权。但正是乔姆斯基和他的老师之间的差异标志着向深层结构迈出的重要一步。最关键的区别是，乔姆斯基的语法不是文本的分析工具。哈里斯希望他的转换用于机器翻译和自动信息检索等实际目的（1970 [1956]：388；[1959]：458ff）。乔姆斯基希望它们能够模拟母语人士头脑中的语言知识，他非常明确地表示，他的方法的一个核心特征是“对‘理解’的概念进行令人满意的分析”（1957a：87），直接获得意义，而内核至关重要。他的早期语法将意义视为三重奏，分布在三个分析层次上——短语结构、核心和转换——但核心是支点：

Chomsky’s early system grew directly out of Harris’s work. The most obvious debt is terminological, but there are subtler obligations: in particular, the notion of kernel and transformation as somehow semantically privileged. But it is the differences between Chomsky and his teacher that mark the important steps toward deep structure. The most crucial difference is that Chomsky’s grammar is not an analytic device for texts. Harris wanted his transformations for such practical purposes as machine translation and automated information retrieval (1970 [1956]:388; [1959]:458ff). Chomsky wanted them to model the linguistic knowledge in a native speaker’s head, and he is very explicit that a central feature of his approach is “to provide a satisfactory analysis of the notion of ‘understanding’” (1957a:87), to get directly at meaning, and the kernel was vital. His early grammar treats meaning as a triplet, distributed over three levels of analysis—phrase structural, kernel, and transformational—but the kernel was the fulcrum:

为了理解一个句子，必须知道它起源的核心句子（更准确地说，是这些核心句子背后的终端字符串）和每个基本成分的短语结构，以及给定句子的转换（或派生）发展历史。因此，分析“理解”过程的一般问题在某种意义上可以归结为解释如何理解核心句子的问题，这些被认为是基本“内容元素”，现实生活中通常更复杂的句子就是通过转换发展形成的。（1957a:92）

In order to understand a sentence it is necessary to know the kernel sentences from which it originates (more precisely, the terminal strings underlying these kernel sentences) and the phrase structure of each of these elementary components, as well as the transformational [or derivational] history of development of the given sentences. The general problem of analyzing the process of “understanding” is thus reduced, in a sense, to the problem of explaining how kernel sentences are understood, these being considered the basic “content elements” from which the usual, more complex sentences of real life are formed by transformational development. (1957a:92)

乔姆斯基和他的早期合作者们强烈地直觉地认为，所有真正的语义动作都发生在内核及其周围。10这位善于辩论的招聘者利斯 (Lees) 尽可能直白地表达了这种直觉，他建议在乔姆斯基语言学中实施一项“有效的研究计划”，将句子意义问题简化为核心意义问题，并“尽可能对某些明显的语义概念进行句法分析”(1962 [1960]:7)。

Chomsky and his early collaborators had a strong intuition that all the real semantic action took place in and around the kernel.10 Lees, the polemical recruiter, expressed the intuition as plainly as possible, proposing an “effective research program” within Chomskyan linguistics to reduce the problem of sentence-meaning to a problem of kernel-meaning, and to provide “a syntactic analysis for certain apparently semantic notions, wherever possible” (1962 [1960]:7).

不过，这个项目有两个重大问题，需要对句法结构语法进行重大改造：（1）内核在语义上不够丰富，无法完全代表句子的含义，（2）转换会改变含义。这两个问题都很容易看出，很容易理解，一个示例就足以说明这两个问题，即我们的 Cormorant-Island 句子对：

There were two big complications to this project, though, which required a major remodeling of the Syntactic Structures grammar: (1) kernels were not rich enough semantically to represent fully the meaning of sentences, and (2) transformations changed meaning. Both complications are easy to see, easy enough that one example illustrates both, our Cormorant-Island sentence pair:

1

1

a 鸬鹚岛上的每个人都说两种语言。

a Everyone on Cormorant Island speaks two languages.

 

 

b 鸬鹚岛上的每个人都说两种语言。

b Two languages are spoken by everyone on Cormorant Island.

句子 1a 是句子 1b 的核心，但它不能完全代表 1b 的含义；当 1b 为假时，它可能为真。将 1a 和 1b（被动）联系起来的转换会改变含义。因此，Lees 提出的研究计划有两个互补的工作，即加强核心并精简转换。

Sentence 1a is the kernel of sentence 1b, but it doesn’t fully represent the meaning of 1b; it can be true when 1b is false. The transformation relating 1a and 1b (Passive) changes the meaning. So, Lees’s proposed research program had two complementary jobs, to beef up the kernel and to slim down the transformation.

第一阶段始于卡茨和福多尔的《语义理论的结构》（1964b [1963]），这是最早试图构建与乔姆斯基的句法框架相吻合的明确语义理论的尝试。这篇论文以及卡茨的各种配套文章，都是一次自觉的尝试，试图在语义学上做乔姆斯基在句法上做的事情，探索异常、歧义和冗余等问题。第一个问题只是提供一种明确的方式来表示意义。Katz 和 Fodor 基本上用两个组件来实现这一点——一本词典和一组语义解释规则。词典包含按句法行为和语义内容指定的词汇条目。例如，bachelor的含义（更具体地说， bachelor的一个含义）表示为 [+名词，+男性，+人类，-已婚]。11句法特征 [+ 名词] 规定bachelor可以参与名词短语（跟在限定词后面、带形容词、接受关系从句等）。其他特征确保了其语义行为：例如，[+ male] 使 2a 变得毫无意义，[—married] 使 2b 变得多余，等等。

The first stage came with Katz and Fodor’s “The Structure of a Semantic Theory” (1964b [1963]), the earliest attempt to construct an explicit semantic theory that dovetailed with Chomsky’s syntactic framework. The paper, along with sundry companion pieces by Katz, was a self-conscious attempt to do for semantics what Chomsky had done for syntax, exploring such issues as anomaly, ambiguity, and redundancy. The first problem was just to provide an explicit way of representing meaning. Katz and Fodor did it with essentially two components—a dictionary and a set of semantic interpretation rules. The dictionary contained lexical entries specified as to syntactic behavior and semantic content. The meaning of bachelor, for instance (more specifically, one meaning of bachelor), was represented as [+noun, + male, + human, –married].11 The syntactic feature, [+ noun], specified that bachelor could participate in a noun phrase (follow a determiner, take an adjective, accept a relative clause, and so forth). The other features ensured its semantic behavior: [+ male], for instance, is what makes 2a nonsense, [—married] makes 2b redundant, and so on.

2

2

Logendra 是一位体态丰满的单身汉。

a Logendra is a buxom bachelor.

 

 

b Logendra 是单身汉，而且也没有结婚。12

b Logendra is a bachelor, and he’s not married either.12

这些说明符的使用提供了意义的符号，而短语结构规则的使用则提供了语法的符号，为语义解释规则铺平了道路，例如，语义解释规则可以将 [- male] 形容词（如buxom）修饰 [+ male] 名词（如bachelor）视为不合逻辑的推论。也就是说，Katz 和 Fodor 为《句法结构》中蓝图设计的语法屋提供了一个新的侧翼。但是，就将句子意义简化为核心意义的计划而言，主要计划仍然存在缺陷。转换仍然会改变意义。

The use of these specifiers provides a notation for meaning, and something like the use of phrase structure rules provides a notation for syntax, paving the way for semantic interpretation rules that would, for instance, identify a [– male] adjective like buxom modifying a [+ male] noun like bachelor as a non sequitur. Katz and Fodor, that is, provided a new wing for the grammatical house blueprinted in Syntactic Structures. But insofar as the program went of reducing sentence-meaning to kernel-meaning, the primary plans were still flawed. Transformations still changed meaning.

卡兹和福多尔 (1964b [1963]:515) 表示：“如果我们能够认为转换永远不会改变含义，那在理论上将是最令人满意的。”他们进一步指出，他们无法采取这一立场的主要原因之一是转换的表述方式。卡兹很快就着手这项工作，重新表述了棘手的转换。他邀请了当时首屈一指的语义学家波斯特尔与这位首屈一指的句法学家联手。他们的书《语言描述的综合理论》采取并捍卫了 (大多数) 转换保持含义不变的坚定立场。这个立场是生成语义学的核心，也是乔姆斯基更为著名的“两步走”——卡兹-波斯特尔假说的基础。

“It would be theoretically most satisfying,” Katz and Fodor said (1964b [1963]:515), “if we could take the position that transformations never changed meaning.” One of the main reasons that they couldn’t take that position, they further noted, was the way transformations were formulated. Katz wasted no time getting to this job, reformulating the troublesome transformations. He enlisted Postal, the premier semanticist of the period teaming up with the premier syntactician. Their book, An Integrated Theory of Linguistic Descriptions, adopted and defended the very strong position that (most) transformations held meaning constant. This position, central to the story of generative semantics, was the one that led to some of Chomsky’s more famous two-stepping in Aspects, Katz-Postal hypothesis.

早期理论中改变含义的转换最明显的例子是句法结构中 T not的使用，它将像 3a 这样的句子变成了它们自己的否定（3b）。

The clearest example of a transformation which altered meaning in the early theory is Syntactic Structures ‘use of Tnot which turned sentences like 3a into their own negation (3b).

3

3

Nirm 亲吻了大卫。

a Nirm kissed David.

 

 

b Nirm 没有亲吻大卫。

b Nirm did not kiss David.

毫无疑问，句子 3a 和 3b 意味着不同的东西；因此，T 的操作不会改变含义；因此，3b 的核心句子不能表达其含义。不过幸运的是，Lees (1968 [1960]:19) 和 Klima (1964 [1959]) 都偶然发现了一种可以让 Katz 和 Postal 的工作变得容易得多的方法。他们出于独立的、句法动机的原因建议，短语结构规则应该生成一个抽象标记NEG，这个标记随后会触发转换。这一创新的原因对于我们的目的并不重要，但 Katz 和 Postal 抓住了它的潜在效果，急切地指出它大大改变了语义图景 (1964:73f)。他们注意到，句子 3a 和 3b 所包含的字符串不再相同。NEG提议不影响 3a，但 3b 现在派生自类似 3c 的字符串。

Unquestionably, sentences 3a and 3b mean different things; therefore, the operation of Tnot alters meaning; therefore, the kernel sentence of 3b cannot represent its meaning. Fortunately, though, both Lees (1968 [1960]:19) and Klima (1964 [1959]) had happened on a device that would make Katz and Postal’s job much easier. They had suggested—for independent, syntactically motivated reasons—that the phrase structure rules should generate an abstract marker, NEG, a marker which then triggered the transformation. The reasons for this innovation aren’t important for our purposes, but Katz and Postal seized on its potential effects, eagerly pointing out that it changes the semantic picture substantially (1964:73f). The strings underlying sentences 3a and 3b, they noticed, are no longer identical. The NEG-proposal does not affect 3a, but 3b now derives from a string like 3c.

3 c NEG Nirm 亲吻 David

3 c NEG Nirm kissed David

内核变得更丰富（因为它包含NEG），转换变得更贫乏（因为其应用范围仅限于带有标记的句子），并且含义变化问题礼貌地消失了（因为 3b 和 3c 含义相同）。十三

The kernel was richer (since it contained NEG), the transformation poorer (since its range of application was restricted to only those sentences with the marker), and the change-of-meaning problem went politely away (since 3b and 3c mean the same thing).13

事实上，Lees 和 Klima 提出了一整套论据来抵消转换的语义效果。例如，Chomsky (1957a:90f) 注意到，转换为 4a–4c 这样的句子提供了一种方便的句法语义类型。

Lees and Klima, in fact, provided an entire class of arguments for neutralizing the semantic effect of transformations. Chomsky (1957a:90f), for instance, had noticed that transformations supplied a convenient syntactico-semantic typology for sentences like 4a–4c.

4

4

尼姆 (Nirm) 本可以亲吻大卫。

a Nirm could have kissed David.

 

 

b 尼姆可能亲吻了大卫吗？

b Could Nirm have kissed David?

 

 

c Nirm 可能亲吻了谁？

c Who could Nirm have kissed?

句子 4a 是核心；4b 是将 T q（将助动词移到句子前面的变换）应用于 4a 而产生的；4c 是将变换（T w）应用于 4b 而产生的，该变换插入句首 wh 词、移动could并删除宾语。请注意，乔姆斯基的 T q和 T w不仅改变了狭义的含义（例如，T w丢失了信息，即被吻者的身份），而且还改变了句子的功能。句子 4a 断言，4b 请求确认（或否定），4c 请求具体信息。

Sentence 4a is the kernel; 4b comes from applying Tq (a transformation which moves the auxiliary verb to the front of the sentence) to 4a; 4c comes from applying to 4b a transformation (Tw) which inserts a sentence-initial wh-word, moves the could, and deletes the object. Notice that Chomsky’s Tq and Tw not only alter meaning in the narrow sense (for instance, Tw loses information; namely, the identity of the kissee), but they change the function of the sentence. Sentence 4a asserts, 4b requests confirmation (or disconfirmation), and 4c requests specific information.

灵光一闪。Katz 和 Postal (1964:79–117) 在《综合理论》中极力主张对短语结构规则进行一些平行的修改，这样 4a-c 的核心就不再相同了。14句子 4a 具有其始终相同的核心，但 4b 现在来自 4d；4c 来自 4e。

The light bulb went on. Katz and Postal (1964:79–117) argue very forcefully in Integrated Theory for a few parallel changes to the phrase structure rules such that the kernels of 4a-c are no longer the same.14 Sentence 4a has the same kernel it always had, but 4b now comes from 4d; 4c, from 4e.

4

4

d Q Nirm本可以亲吻David

d Q Nirm could have kissed David

 

 

e Nirm 本可以亲吻 wh + some + one

e Nirm could have kissed wh + some + one

效果再次是从转换中夺取并给予内核。转换失去了它们的应用范围（T q现在由 Q 的存在触发；T w由 wh 的存在触发），以及它们改变含义的能力，而内核在句法和语义上变得更加明确。Katz 和 Postal 对祈使句施展了类似的魔法，提供了一个触发相关转换的 IMP 标记。早期的理论会从相同的底层来源推导出 5a（断言）和 5b（命令），而 Katz 和 Postal 为 5b 提出了一个看起来像 5c 的来源。

The effect once again is to rob from the transformation and give to the kernel. The transformations lose their range of application (Tq being triggered now by the presence of Q; Tw, by the presence of wh), along with their power to change meaning, and the kernels become syntactically and semantically more explicit. Katz and Postal work similar magic with imperative sentences, supplying an IMP marker which triggers the relevant transformation. Where earlier theory would derive both 5a (an assertion) and 5b (a command) from the same underlying source, Katz and Postal propose a source for 5b which looks like 5c.

5

5

a 你吃鸡。

a You eat chicken.

 

 

b 吃鸡！

b Eat chicken!

 

 

c IMP 你吃鸡。15

c IMP you eat chicken.15

再次，语义职责从转换转移到内核。

Once again, semantic duty is transferred from the transformation to the kernel.

然而，在内核丰富的道路上还有更大的障碍。具有显式语义反射的转换，如 T not和 T q，是转换不保留含义这一策略的明显例外：每次操作时，它们影响它们所操作的结构的含义，并且它们以完全相同的方式影响含义。因此，它们可能通过各种调整而不是底层触发来处理。例如，Katz-Postal 提案通过允许对它们执行不同类别的语义规则来排除一整类转换（广义转换；如下所述）；类似的操作可以适应明显改变含义或功能的一小类规则。

There was a larger obstacle in the path of kernel enrichment, however. Transformations with an explicit semantic reflex, like Tnot and Tq, are clear exceptions to the policy that transformations don’t preserve meaning: every time they operate, they affect the meaning of the structure they operate on, and they affect the meaning in exactly the same way. As such, they might have been handled by a variety of adjustments other than underlying triggers. For instance, the Katz-Postal proposal excepted one entire class of transformations (generalized transformations; discussed below) by allowing the operation of a different class of semantic rules for them; similar maneuvers could have accommodated the small class of rules which clearly altered meaning or function.

规则通常对意义是中性的，但在少数情况下会产生语义影响，这是一类更令人头疼的问题。在这方面，真正可怕的是被动转换。它是早期乔姆斯基计划的修辞支柱——经常用来举例说明转换语法的分布和中介优点——它通常会保持意义的核心不变。但并非总是如此。

Rules which are generally neutral to meaning and yet have semantic repercussions in a few scattered cases are a much bigger class of headache. The real terror in this regard was the passive transformation. It was a rhetorical mainstay of the early Chomskyan program—trotted out regularly to exemplify both the distributional and mediational virtues of transformational grammar—and it usually left the kernel of meaning intact. But not always.

这个问题从一开始就众所周知。《句法结构》中关于转换无法保持意义不变的唯一讨论正是集中在这种情况上——被动转换与量词的相互作用，这又让我们回到了 Cormorant-Island 句子（为方便起见再次重复）。

The headache was well known from the beginning. The only discussion in Syntactic Structures on the inability of transformations to hold meaning constant centers on precisely this situation—the interaction of the passive transformation with quantifiers, returning us once again to our Cormorant-Island sentences (repeated again for convenience).

1

1

a 鸬鹚岛上的每个人都说两种语言。

a Everyone on Cormorant Island speaks two languages.

 

 

b 鸬鹚岛上的每个人都说两种语言。

b Two languages are spoken by everyone on Cormorant Island.

当然，在正常解释下，句子 1a 描述的是岛上每个人都懂两种语言的情况，但并未明确说明这两种语言是什么；每个人都可能懂两种截然不同的语言。弗雷德可能懂巴斯克语和韩语，而威尔玛懂基库尤语和迪尔巴尔语。这可称为不同两种解释。句子 1b（同样在正常解释下）声称有两种语言，岛上每个人都懂（比如，完全随意地说，英语和夸夸瓦拉语）；岛上的每个人都至少懂这两种语言。弗雷德可能还会说巴斯克语和韩语，但他也必须懂英语和夸夸瓦拉语。威尔玛和她的语言也是如此。这可称为相同两种解释。

Under normal interpretation, of course, 1a describes a situation where everyone on the island knows two languages, but makes no claim about what these languages are; each person could know a completely distinct pair. Fred might know Basque and Korean while Wilma knows Kikuyu and Dyirbal. Call this the different-two interpretation. Sentence 1b (again under normal interpretation) claims that there are two languages such that everyone on the island knows them (say, to be completely arbitrary, English and Kwakwala); each person on the island knows at least that set of two languages. Fred might still speak Basque and Korean, but he also has to speak English and Kwakwala. Ditto for Wilma and her languages. Call this the same-two interpretation.

综合理论处理这些类型的句子（围绕量词范围的有趣现象的例子，如every和all）时非常流畅。Katz 和 Postal 的论点涉及改进语法的语义职责：他们说，它不需要解释句子的“正常”阅读，只需要解释其基本内容，并且他们进一步说，1a 和 1b 的基本内容是相同的；这两个句子的歧义完全相同。两者都描述了相同的两个情况，也描述了不同的两个情况，因此转换只具有低级的文体效果，而不是真正的语义影响。16这种解决方案在乔姆斯基的著作中非常常见，我们将会看到更多。数据的一个方面被偷走（正常读数基本上被宣布为无关紧要），模型有效地处理剩下的部分。

Integrated Theory handles these sorts of sentences—examples of intriguing phenomena revolving around the scope of quantifiers (like every and all)—with smoothness to spare. Katz and Postal’s argument involves refining the semantic duties of a grammar: it needn’t account for the “normal” reading of a sentence, they say, just for its basic content, and the basic content of both 1a and 1b, they further say, is the same; both sentences are ambiguous in exactly the same way. Both describe the same-two situation, and both describe the different-two situation, and therefore the transformation has only a low-level stylistic effect, not a genuine semantic impact.16 This sort of solution is extremely common in Chomskyan work, and we will see much more of it. One aspect of the data is spirited away (the normal reading is essentially declared irrelevant), and the model efficiently handles what is left.

即使卡茨、福多尔和波斯特尔进行了综合和创新，深层结构的形成仍然存在一个非常大的障碍，即广义变换。乔姆斯基亲自解决了这个问题。

Even with all the synthesizing and innovating of Katz and Fodor and Postal, there remained one very substantial obstacle to the formation of deep structure, generalized transformations. Chomsky took on this one himself.

转换的主要功能之一（可以追溯到哈里斯）是处理复合句。对于哈里斯来说，转换可以解开独立子句（提取核心）；对于乔姆斯基来说，转换可以将独立子句拼接在一起（将核心放在一起）。对于这两项工作，转换效果非常好，以至于乔姆斯基在《句法结构》中提出转换存在的第一个论据就是它们处理复合句的简易性。例如，句子 6a 和 6b 可以用 T rel整齐地拼接起来，形成 6c 或 6d。

One of the principal functions of transformations, dating back to Harris, was to deal with compound sentences. For Harris, transformations disentangled independent clauses (to extract the kernels); for Chomsky, they spliced together independent clauses (putting kernels together). For both jobs, transformations worked beautifully, so well that the very first argument Chomsky offers in Syntactic Structures for the existence of transformations is the ease with which they handle compound sentences. For instance, sentences 6a and 6b could be neatly spliced with Trel, forming either 6c or 6d.

6

6

a 猫追赶狗。

a The cat chased the dog.

 

 

b 猫吃了粗粒食物。

b The cat ate the Kibbles.

 

 

c 吃了粗粒谷物的猫追赶了狗。

c The cat that ate the Kibbles chased the dog.

 

 

d 追赶狗的猫吃了粗粒食物。

d The cat that chased the dog ate the Kibbles.

深层结构的问题是显而易见的：无论对底层短语标记进行多少调整和丰富，都无法预测合并另一个句子的语义后果。

The problems for deep structure are obvious: no amount of finagling and enriching of the underlying phrase markers can predict the semantic consequences of incorporating another sentence.

乔姆斯基在《方面》一书中指出，广义变换与单一变换（其余所有变换）完全不同，因此应该将它们完全消除。正如我们从卡茨和波斯特尔的工作中看到的那样，在某一点上改变某些东西会对变换语法产生连锁反应。将 IMP 和 Q 及其同类添加到短语结构规则中需要更改变换（现在仅在特定触发时才适用）。乔姆斯基清除整个变换类需要在其他方面进行一些调整。与卡茨和波斯特尔一样，乔姆斯基转向短语结构规则。例如，他这样更改名词短语规则。

Chomsky argues in Aspects that generalized transformations are a sufficiently different kettle of fish from singularly transformations (all the rest) that they should be eliminated altogether. As we have seen from Katz and Postal’s labors, changing something at one point has ripples in a transformational grammar. Adding IMP and Q and their ilk to the phrase structure rules calls for a change to the transformations (which now apply only when they are specifically triggered). Chomsky’s flushing of a whole class of transformations requires some adjustments elsewhere. Like Katz and Postal, Chomsky turns to the phrase structure rules. He changes the noun phrase rule, for instance, thusly.

7 NP → Det + N + (S)

7 NP → Det + N + (S)

这一简单的变化产生了非常重大的影响。它为基数添加了一个属性，语言学家称之为“递归”，因为它允许短语结构规则循环应用（S 规则引入了 NP，现在可以引入 S，引入 S，NP 又引入 NP，NP 又……）。但对于我们的目的而言，这一变化最重要的影响是它完全摆脱了广义变换。看看规则 7 运行得多么顺畅，以及它与变换的交互多么顺畅。规则 7 生成字符串 6e（包含名词短语“the cat the cat chased the dog”，其中包括句子“the cat chased the dog”）和 6f。

This one simple change has very significant repercussions. It adds a property to the base that linguists call recursion, because it allows the phrase structure rules to apply recurrently (the S rule introduces an NP, which can now introduce an S, which introduces an NP, which …). But the most important effect of the change for our purposes is that it gets rid of generalized transformations altogether. Look at how smoothly a rule like 7 works and how smoothly it interacts with transformations. Rule 7 generates strings like 6e (containing the noun phrase “the cat the cat chased the dog,” which includes the sentence, “the cat chased the dog”) and 6f.

6

6

e 猫 猫吃了 Kibbles 追赶狗

e the cat the cat ate the Kibbles chased the dog

 

 

f 猫追狗吃了狗粮

f the cat the cat chased the dog ate the Kibbles

这两个字符串可能比 Katz 和 Postal 的工作结果更奇怪，但它们涉及的抽象步骤并不比添加 IMP 或 Q 更大，而 Chomsky 的提议摆脱了一整类变换。Chomsky 不需要将 6a 和 6b 拼接在一起的通用变换，只需要一个普通的单数变换来引入代词：6e 是 6c 的基础，6f 是 6d 的基础，相对化变换只是将其替换为cat的第二次出现。

These two strings are perhaps a little more bizarre than the ones resulting from Katz and Postal’s work, but they involve no bigger step in abstraction than adding an IMP or a Q, and Chomsky’s proposal gets rid of an entire class of transformations. Rather than a generalized transformation to splice 6a and 6b together, Chomsky only needs a run-of-the-mill singularly transformation to introduce a pronoun: 6e underlies 6c, and 6f underlies 6d, and the relativization transformation just substitutes that for the second occurrences of the cat.

基础递归是乔姆斯基的一次伟大而又精彩的典型之举。不仅广义变换消失了，留下了一个更加整洁的变换框，而且所有被丢弃的变换都是麻烦的意义改变者。乔姆斯基的举动还消除了卡茨和福多尔与广义变换相匹配的一整类语义解释规则（这一提议有些尴尬——1964b [1963]：514-15），留下了一个更加整洁的语义规则框。事情一直在变得更好，这些改进值得进行术语更改。内核被淘汰了。深层结构开始流行。

Base-recursion was a grand and brilliant and typically Chomskyan stroke. Not only were generalized transformations gone, leaving behind a tidier box of transformations, all the discarded transformations were troublesome meaning changers. Chomsky’s move also, for good measure, eliminated an entire class of semantic interpretation rules that Katz and Fodor had matched to generalized transformations (a proposal that made some embarrassment—1964b [1963]:514–15), leaving behind a tidier box of semantic rules. Things were getting better all the time, and the improvements warranted a terminological change. Kernel was out. Deep structure was in.

乔姆斯基在谈到深层结构时说：“这是自转换语法理论诞生以来，一直激励该理论的基本思想”（1965 [1964]:136）。Aspects模型最终做到了这一点。哈里斯的内核既没有结构，也没有转换弹性，无法充当乔姆斯基所设想的语义控制（卡茨、福多尔和波斯特尔的教唆），而深层结构则兼具。它从短语结构规则中带来了大量信息，并确定了所有可能改变意义的转换。17

“This,” Chomsky said of deep structure, “is the basic idea that has motivated the theory of transformational grammar since its inception” (1965 [1964]:136). And the Aspects model finally got it right. Where Harris’s kernel had neither the structure nor the transformational resilience to serve as the semantic control he envisioned Chomsky’s (Katz-and-Fodor-and-Postal-abetted), deep structure had both. It brought a great deal of information with it from the phrase structure rules, and it determined all of the potentially meaning-altering transformations.17

语义学中有些苍蝇在飞舞，它们很快就会飞出来嗡嗡叫。但简而言之，深层结构是高度加速进化的胜利产物，而《句法理论面面观》则是语言学史上一个丰硕时期的辉煌综合。

There were flies stirring in the semantic ointment, and they would soon come out to buzz. Briefly, though, deep structure was the triumphant product of a highly accelerated evolution, and Aspects of the Theory of Syntax was the brilliant synthesis of a hugely productive period in linguistic history.

模型

The Model

因此，句法成分由产生深层结构的基础和将它们映射到表层结构的转换部分组成。句子的深层结构提交给语义成分进行语义解释，其表层结构进入音系成分并进行语音解释。因此，语法的最终效果是将语义解释与语音表示联系起来，即说明如何解释句子。

Thus the syntactic component consists of a base that generates deep structures and a transformational part that maps them into surface structures. The deep structure of a sentence is submitted to the semantic component for semantic interpretation, and its surface structure enters the phonological component and undergoes phonetic interpretation. The final effect of a grammar, then, is to relate a semantic interpretation to a phonetic representation—that is, to state how a sentence is interpreted.

诺姆·乔姆斯基

Noam Chomsky

转换语法的Aspects模型在蓬勃发展的乔姆斯基学派社区和整个学术界都大受欢迎。我们已经讨论了它的大部分一般特征，或者至少提到了它们，但还有两项技术创新需要一点篇幅：Δ-节点（“delta-nodes”）和单独的词典。就Aspects模型本身而言，第一个发展相对来说微不足道，但它对乔姆斯基后来的工作有影响，这在我们的故事中占有重要地位。第二个发展甚至更重要，因为生成解释的争论在很大程度上与词典的构成有关；它还涉及对三个进一步修改的讨论，即特征符号、词汇插入规则和复杂符号。

The Aspects model of transformational grammar was a hit, both in the burgeoning Chomskyan community and in the academic world at large. We have already discussed most of its general features, or at least broached them, but two more technical innovations require a little space: Δ-nodes (“delta-nodes”) and the separate lexicon. The first development is relatively small potatoes in terms of the Aspects model itself, but it has implications for later work by Chomsky that figures heavily in our story. The second development figures even more heavily, since the generative-interpretive brouhaha was in great measure about the complexion of the lexicon; it also entails the discussion of three further modifications, feature notation, lexical insertion rules, and complex symbols.

乔姆斯基（采纳了卡茨和波斯特尔的建议）提出将 Δ 作为一个“虚拟符号”（1965 [1964]:122），本质上是短语结构规则插入的词汇占位符。后面要讨论的 Δ 节点的关键特征是它们完全是空的——从音系和语义上来说都是零。8 中的字符串说明了它们在Aspects模型中的主要功能：早期理论会从 8a 中得出 8c，而Aspects则从 8b 中得出 8c。

Chomsky proposes (adapting a suggestion by Katz and Postal) the Δ as a “dummy symbol” (1965 [1964]:122), essentially a lexical place-holder inserted by the phrase structure rules. The critical feature of Δ-nodes for later discussion is that they are completely empty—phonologically and semantically null. The strings in 8 illustrate their principal function in the Aspects model: where earlier theory would derive 8c from 8a, Aspects derived it from 8b.

8

8

有人翻了烙饼

a someone flipped the flapjack

 

 

b Δ 翻转烙饼

b Δ flipped the flapjack

 

 

c 烙饼被翻了过来。

c The flapjack was flipped.

在 8b 中，Δ 保持主语位置打开，以便可以将煎饼移入并替换它。这可能看起来像是任意的，因为许多创新单独出现时都是如此，而且它在Aspects的体系中相当小，但它产生了重要的影响。其中之一是语义上的，虽然当时似乎没有讨论过（McCawley，1988.1：81-82）：使用 Δ 而不是someone来表示主语可以消除后者令人不快的语义副作用。例如，句子 9a 和 9b 在前Aspects世界中是转换相关的，但它们显然意味着不同的东西（9a 暗示someone ≠ Chomsky）。

In 8b, Δ holds the subject slot open so that the flapjack can be moved in and substituted for it. This may look arbitrary, as many innovations do in isolation, and it was fairly minor in the Aspects scheme of things, but it had important consequences. One of them, though it seems not to have been discussed at the time, is semantic (McCawley, 1988.1:81–82): using Δ for the subject rather than someone eliminates the unpleasant semantic side effects of the latter. Sentences 9a and 9b, for instance, were transformationally related in the pre-Aspects world, but they clearly mean something different (9a implying that someone ≠ Chomsky).

9

9

a 有人于 1965 年写了《乔姆斯基的视角》。

a Someone wrote Chomsky’s Aspects in 1965.

 

 

b 《乔姆斯基的视角》写于 1965 年。

b Chomsky’s Aspects was written in 1965.

有了语义上为零的 Δ，这个问题就解决了。更重要的是，Δ-节点是接下来几十年大量语法化过程中的薄弱环节。罗宾·拉科夫 (Robin Lakoff) 说，与触发词素和其他抽象词一起，Δ-节点“充当了生成语义学的芝麻开门”(1989:948)，它们在 70 年代末为乔姆斯基打开了一个完全不同的魔法洞穴，他引入了一整套类似的空洞类别。

With a semantically null Δ, that problem is eliminated. More importantly, Δ-nodes were the thin edge of the wedge for a lot of grammaticizing over the next several decades. In concert with trigger morphemes and other abstractions, Robin Lakoff says, Δ-nodes “functioned as an Open Sesame” to generative semantics (1989:948), and they opened a completely different magical cave for Chomsky in the late seventies, who introduced a whole bestiary of similarly empty categories.

然而，在对Aspects进行直接语法重塑时，一项更为实质性和深远的创新是创建了一本独立词典，该词典列出了所有单词及其属性。这个项目涉及大量非常详细的工作，但这里只有三项发展值得关注：特征符号、复杂符号和词汇插入规则。

In the immediate grammatical remodeling of Aspects, though, a far more substantial and far-reaching innovation was the creation of an independent lexicon, a dictionary listing all the words and their attributes. This project involved a great deal of very detailed work, but only three developments call for attention here: feature notation, complex symbols, and lexical insertion rules.

句法结构模型通过短语结构规则将词引入派生过程。一条规则决定单个名词可构成名词短语（NP → N），另一条规则决定flapjack是名词（N → {flapjack ,…}）；句法范畴和词汇项目之间没有正式区别。但这一程序会导致短语结构规则的激增。例如，flapjack与Indira不是同一类型的名词。传统上，二者的区别在于可数名词（离散的东西，可以有多个）和专有名词（在某种意义上是其所命名事物的属性），但这些区别具有分布反射；例如，flapjack可以与限定词、形容词和介词短语一起出现（煎锅上的肥煎饼） ，而Indira则不能（*拿着锅铲咧嘴笑的 Indira）。而milk是另一种名词类型（传统上是物质名词），用于标识非离散实体；在分布术语中，像Indira一样，与flapjack不同，它不能复数化（*milks），但像flapjack一样，与Indira不同，它可以与限定词和形容词一起出现（the cold milk）。所有这些意味着句法结构语法被迫按照 10 条规则对名词进行子分类。

The Syntactic Structures model introduces words into the derivation by way of phrase structure rules. One rule determines that a single noun can constitute a noun phrase NP → N), another rule determines that flapjack is a noun (N → {flapjack,…}); there is no formal distinction between a syntactic category and a lexical item. But this procedure entailed an unwieldy proliferation of phrase structure rules. For instance, flapjack is not the same type of noun as Indira. In traditional terms, the difference is between a count noun (something discrete, of which you can have more than one) and a proper noun (which is in a sense a property of the thing it names), but these differences have distributional reflexes; flapjack can occur with determiners, adjectives, and prepositional phrases (the fat flapjack on the griddle), for instance, which Indira, except in markedly odd circumstances, cannot (*the grinning Indira with the spatula). And milk is another noun type yet (traditionally, a mass noun), one which identifies nondiscrete entities; in distributional terms, like Indira, unlike flapjack, it cannot be pluralized (*milks), but like flapjack, unlike Indira, it can occur with determiners and adjectives (the cold milk). All of this means that a Syntactic Structures grammar is forced to subcategorize nouns along the lines of 10.

10

10

a N c → {烙饼，烤盘，…}

a Nc → {flapjack, griddle,…}

 

 

b N p → {英迪拉,诺姆,…}

b Np → {Indira, Noam,…}

 

 

c N m → {雪,牛奶, …}

c Nm → {snow, milk, …}

（其中 c =数量； p =固有； m =质量。）

(where c = count; p = proper; m = mass.)

情况会变得更加复杂。有些名词在范畴上是不稳定的；例如，牛排可以是可数名词（汤姆正在吃两块牛排），但它也可以是不可数名词（汤姆喜欢牛排）。因此，语法必须多次记录此类名词，因此牛排同时出现在规则 10a 和 10c 中。

It gets more complicated. Some nouns are categorically unstable; steak, for example, can be a count noun (Tom is eating two steaks), but it can also be a mass noun (Tom likes steak). So, the grammar must register such nouns multiply, so that steak occurs in both rule 10a and 10c.

不过，一个单独的词典可以消除这种冗余（更确切地说，是控制它）。词典中并没有单独的规则列出各种名词（以及动词、形容词、副词……），而是以特征符号的形式将flapjack列为[+ count]， Indira列为[+ proprie]，milk列为[+ mass]，steak列为[+ count, + mass]，等等。

A separate lexicon, though, gets rid of this redundancy (more properly, controls it). Rather than a separate rule listing all the various flavors of nouns (and verbs, and adjectives, and adverbs, …), flapjack is listed in the lexicon, by way of feature notation, as [+ count], Indira as [+ proper], milk as [+ mass], steak as [+ count, + mass], and so on.

引入特征符号也使词汇插入规则得到一些改进。在句法结构中，它们只是短语结构规则。在体中，它们是转换。它们也更具表现力，分为两大类：严格的子类别规则和选择规则。第一组规则确保词汇类型的适当分布；例如，可数名词跟在限定词后面，但专有名词不跟（11a 但不是 11b）；或者不及物动词单独出现，但不与宾语一起出现（12a 但不是 12b）。

Bringing in feature notation also allowed for some improvements to the lexical insertion rules. In Syntactic Structures, they are just phrase structure rules. In Aspects, they are transformations. They are also far more expressive, coming in two general types: strict subcategorization rules and selectional rules. The first set of rules ensured the appropriate distribution of lexical types; for instance, that a count noun followed a determiner, but a proper noun did not (11a but not 11b); or that an intransitive verb occurred on its own, but not with an object (12a but not 12b).

11

11

a 厨师翻转了烙饼。

a The cook flipped the flapjack.

 

 

b *英迪拉翻转了烙饼。

b *The Indira flipped the flapjack.

12

12

诺姆消失了。

a Noam disappeared.

 

 

b *Noam 使内核消失了。

b *Noam disappeared the kernel.

第二组规则确保不违反与意义更密切相关的更多约束；例如，认知动词只与可以被认知的事物一起出现（13a 而不是 13b），或者颜色形容词只与具体名词共现（14a 而不是 14b）。

The second set of rules ensured that more constraints with a closer connection to meaning were not violated; for instance, that verbs of cognition appeared only with things that could be cognized (13a rather than 13b), or that color adjectives co-occurred only with concrete nouns (14a rather than 14b).

十三

13

阿瓦希尼人相信了她的母亲。

a Avashinee believed her mother.

 

 

b *Avashinee 相信了她的哈密瓜。

b *Avashinee believed her cantaloupe.

14

14

Naveen 的眼睛是棕色的。

a Naveen’s eyes are brown.

 

 

b *Naveen 的理论是棕色的。

b *Naveen’s theories are brown.

这两种规则类型都被视为句法规则，尽管选择限制更直接地反映了单词的内容（传统意义上，11b 和 12b 不合语法，是句法概念，13b 和 14b 是异常的，是语义概念）。这两种规则类型主要通过乔姆斯基称为复杂符号的东西来执行（绝大多数词汇创新都是乔姆斯基的）。短语结构规则（经过一些修改）现在生成类似 PM-1 的树；其中的分支以特征簇结尾。这些簇是复杂符号。

Both rule types were regarded as syntactic, even though selectional restrictions reflected the content of the words a little more directly (in traditional terms, 11b and 12b are ungrammatical, a syntactic notion, 13b and 14b are anomalous, a semantic notion). Both rule types were enforced primarily through something Chomsky called complex symbols (and the vast majority of the lexical innovations were Chomsky’s). The phrase structure rules (following a few modifications) now generated trees like PM–1; in which the branches terminate in clusters of features. These clusters are complex symbols.

然后，词汇插入规则（即严格的子类别和选择规则）会用词汇表中与它们所含特征兼容的任何条目替换这些集群。Indira是[+proper、+animate、…]，可以替代第一个NP 下的复杂符号；flip可以替代动词复杂符号；flapjack可以替代可数名词。或者，Floyd、break和glass可以分别填充相同的位置。触发这些规则并替换复杂符号后，结果就是像 PM-2 这样的树，即深层结构。

The lexical insertion rules (that is, both the strict subcategorization and selectional rules) then replace these clusters with any entries from the lexicon compatible with the features they contain. Indira, which is [+proper, +animate,…], can substitute for the complex symbol under the first NP; flip, for the verb complex symbol; and flapjack, for the count noun. Or, respectively, Floyd, break, and glass can fill the same slots. After these rules have fired, and the complex symbols have been replaced, the result is a tree like PM–2, the deep structure.

深层结构是短语结构规则和词汇插入规则的产物。它先于所有转换。它代表了句子的语义核心。总之，深层结构是句子结构模型中的一颗璀璨的明星。语言（或者更确切地说，语言知识模型），其句法结构和体貌之间发生了相当根本的变化。

The deep structure, that is, was the product of phrase structure rules and lexical insertion rules. It preceded all transformations. And it represented the semantic core of the sentence. Deep structure, in sum, was the glowing star of a model of language (or, more properly, a model of linguistic knowledge), which had mutated quite radically between Syntactic Structures and Aspects.

早期模型的两种规则类型（短语结构规则和转换）已经互换了部分职责，前者变得更加丰富和强大，而后者变得更加贫乏和受限。短语结构规则仍然定义基本短语类型，但现在它们还通过触发词素帮助定义一些额外的句子类型。这项创新包括监管转换的新工作。问题形成现在只有在 S 规则提供 Q 来触发它时才适用；命令形成需要 IMP，否定形成需要 NEG。更彻底的是，短语结构规则被彻底修改为递归应用，使一整类转换（广义转换）过时。

The earlier model’s two rule types, phrase structure rules and transformations, had swapped some of their duties, the former getting richer and more powerful, the latter getting poorer and more restricted. Phrase structure rules still defined the basic phrase types, but now they also helped define some additional sentence types, by way of trigger morphemes. This innovation included the new job of policing the transformations. Question formation could now only apply if the S rule supplied a Q to trigger it; Imperative-formation needed an IMP, Negative-formation a NEG. More radically, phrase structure rules were overhauled to apply recursively, making one whole class of transformations (generalized transformations) obsolete.

还出现了新的组件和规则类型，有些接管了以前由短语结构规则或转换完成的工作，有些则承担了全新的任务。有一个词典，它对单词进行分类。词典包括一些新设备，如子类别规则和复杂符号的构建块。词汇插入规则出现了，以接管以前由短语结构规则处理的工作（以转换方式）。还有一个语义组件，以及它的语义解释规则。

New components and new rule types also showed up, some taking over jobs previously done by either phrase structure rules or transformations, some taking up completely new tasks. There was a lexicon, which catalogued the words. The lexicon included some new devices, like subcategorization rules and the building blocks for complex symbols. Lexical insertion rules showed up, to take over a job (in a transformational fashion) that was previously handled by phrase structure rules. And there was a semantic component, along with its semantic interpretation rules.

所有这些重塑——将分布语法重塑为中介语法——产生了以深层结构为中心的语言知识概念，如图 4.1所示。18

All of this remodeling—remaking a distributional grammar into a mediational grammar—produced the conception of linguistic knowledge hinging on deep structure, represented in figure 4.1.18

图 4.1 .方面模型。

Figure 4.1. The Aspects model.

这种语法当然比简单的（回想起来几乎是古怪的）句法结构模型（图 3.2）更令人生畏，但它也更完整。短语结构规则生成以复杂符号结尾的树。词典和词汇插入转换协同工作，将一组合法的单词插入树中（替代复杂符号）。这三个组件（构成基础）生成一个深层结构，该结构输入语义组件以产生其含义的表示，并输入转换组件以产生其表面句法结构的表示。

This grammar is certainly more intimidating than the simple—in retrospect, almost quaint—model of Syntactic Structures (Figure 3.2), but it is also more complete. The phrase structure rules generate trees which terminate in complex symbols. The lexicon and the lexical insertion transformations work in concert to plug a legitimate set of words into the tree (substituting for the complex symbols). These three components (constituting the base) generate a deep structure, which feeds into the semantic component to produce a representation of its meaning, and into the transformational component to produce a representation of its surface syntactic structure.

关于该模型，还有一个绝对关键的观点：它严重依赖 Katz-Postal 原则，即转换不会改变意义。如果转换可以改变意义——如果深层结构和表层结构可以意味着不同的东西——那么Aspects模型就被严重削弱了。

And one more, absolutely crucial, point about the model: it rested very heavily on the Katz-Postal principle that transformations don’t change meaning. If transformations could change meaning—if the deep structure and the surface structure could mean different things—then the Aspects model is seriously undermined.

如果图表中的某些元素仍然有点模糊，请不要担心。它们当时也很模糊。图 4.1中的一些箭头和方框只不过是箭头和方框而已，没有明确说明它们的含义。例如，没有人费心去指定语义解释规则是什么，也没有人说语义表示是什么样子。图表的整个右侧都笼罩在晦涩之中，但它预示着晦涩，而左侧则得到了更好的探索。短语结构规则到此时已经得到了很好的研究，转换也是如此。词典和词汇插入规则立即成为人们关注的主题。深层和表层结构在当时的所有论文中大量涌现。富有成效、创新、具有挑战性的工作正在进行中。没有人太担心语义成分缺乏细节。它会到来的，而且，无论如何，卡茨和福多尔已经将语义定义为本质上残留的问题。他们的等式是“语言描述减去音系学和句法学，等于语义学”（1964b[1963]:482），这是在处理了声音和句法学之后剩下的东西，而句法学还没有完成（音系学也没有完成，但那是另一个故事）。19事实上，句法正在扩展，或者用当时的术语来说，它正在变得更深：变得越来越抽象；欢迎神秘的理论内部设备，如触发器、空类别和复杂符号；并且更直接地接受句子的内容，使用特征符号和选择限制，当然还有深层结构。也就是说， Aspects模型中有很多语义动作，但其中大部分发生在图表的句法方面。

If some elements of the diagram are still a little vague, don’t worry. They were vague at the time, too. Some of the arrows and boxes in Figure 4.1 were little more than that, arrows and boxes, with no clear specification of what they meant. No one bothered to specify what a semantic interpretation rule was, for instance, and no one said what a semantic representation looked like. The whole right side of the diagram was shrouded in obscurity, but it was promising obscurity, and the left side was much better explored. Phrase structure rules were pretty well investigated by this point, and so were transformations. The lexicon and the lexical insertion rules were immediately subjects of serious attention. Deep and surface structures bloomed profusely in all the papers of the period. Productive, innovative, challenging work was afoot. And no one was too concerned about the lack of detail concerning the semantic component. It would come, and, in any case, Katz and Fodor had defined semantics as an essentially residual matter. Their equation was “linguistic description minus phonology and syntax equals semantics” (1964b [1963]:482), what was left over when the sounds and the syntax were taken care of, and syntax wasn’t finished yet (nor was phonology, but that’s another story).19 Syntax, in fact, was expanding, or, in the terms of the period, it was getting deeper: becoming increasingly abstract; welcoming arcane theory-internal devices like triggers and empty categories and complex symbols; and embracing the content of sentences much more directly, with feature notation and selectional restrictions and, of course, deep structure. There was a lot of semantic action in the Aspects model, that is, but most of it was happening on the syntactic side of the diagram.

大部分内容都围绕着大中介，即深层结构展开。为了更深入地了解深层结构是如何运作的，我们必须停止对树进行简化，尽管我们可以坚持使用非常简单的示例。查看两个短语结构树，PM-3 和 PM-4。20

Much of it was happening around the grand mediator, deep structure. To get a closer look at how deep structure worked, we will have to stop simplifying the trees a bit, though we can stick to very straightforward examples. Look over the two phrase structure trees, PM–3 and PM–4.20

这两个短语标记分别是句子的深层结构和表层，在正字法上表示为The man has been fired。表层结构捕捉了句法的所有重要分布事实——单词和词缀的序列（英语的一个特点是，过去分词fire，在 PM-4 中表示为序列fire + EN ，其书写和发音与过去时 fired一样）。深层结构捕捉了关于句子的更抽象的事实——即the man不是句子的“逻辑主语”，因为他是动词动作 getting fired 的接受者；另一个人，某人未指定，正在进行射击；这个句子是被动的；动词实际上是及物的，即使它后面表面上没有跟宾语名词短语。

The two phrase markers are, respectively, the deep structure and the surface of the sentence represented orthographically as The man has been fired. The surface structure captures all the important distributional facts of the syntax—the sequence of the words and affixes (it is one of the peculiarities of English that the past participle of fire, represented in PM–4 by the sequence fire + EN, is written and pronounced just like the past tense, fired). The deep structure captures more abstract facts about the sentence—that the man isn’t the “logical subject” of the sentence, since he is on the receiving end of the action of the verb, getting fired; that someone else, someone unspecified, is doing the firing; that the sentence is a passive; that the verb is really transitive, even though it isn’t followed by an object noun phrase at the surface.

当时，无论是在语言学界还是在语言学界，深层结构都受到了最广泛的关注，但是如果没有表层结构，深层结构就不可能存在：正是这种配对使得Aspects模型如此有吸引力。例如，Eric Wanner 回忆道：“在 20 世纪 60 年代中期，深层结构是一个令人兴奋的想法”，但是当他解释这种兴奋时，它取决于这两种结构。“[深层结构] 为直观上有吸引力的概念提供了正式的依据，即句子具有与单词和短语的表面排列不同的底层逻辑形式”(1988:147)。

Deep structure received by far the most attention of the two structures at the time, inside and outside of linguistics, but it is impossible without surface structure: it is the pairing that made the Aspects model so appealing. Eric Wanner, for instance, recalls that “in the mid-1960s, deep structure was an exciting idea,” but when he explains that excitement, it hinges on both structures. “[Deep structure] provided a formal justification for the intuitively appealing notion that sentences have an underlying logical form that differs from the surface arrangement of words and phrases” (1988:147).

人们很容易忽视这样一个事实，即这两种结构在理论中都没有特殊的地位，而许多人确实忽视了这一点。深层结构这一术语的超凡魅力；深层句法关系实际上与语义关系难以区分；语言学界及其周边地区一直渴望在意义和声音之间建立直接的原则性联系；Aspects 模型中唯一潜在的竞争者在意义和语义表征问题上过于模糊；乔姆斯基的言论：“转换规则的一个主要功能是将表达句子内容的抽象深层结构转化为表明其形式的相当具体的表层结构”(1965 [1964]:136)；等等，所有这些，都使大多数人从更宏大的视角来思考深层结构——它是人们期待已久的语法学家的基石，将言语的枯燥材料与思想的黄金领域联系了起来。

It was easy to lose sight, and many people did, of the fact that neither structure has any privileged position in the theory. The charismatic power of the term, deep structure; and the fact that deep syntactic relations were virtually indistinguishable from semantic relations; and the constant longing in and around linguistics for a direct principled connection between meaning and sound; and the vagueness engulfing the only potential competitor in the Aspects model for questions of meaning, semantic representation; and statements from Chomsky like “one major function of the transformational rules is to convert an abstract deep structure that expresses the content of a sentence into a fairly concrete surface structure that indicates its form” (1965 [1964]:136); and much more, led most people to think of deep structure on a much grander scale—as the long-awaited grammarian’s stone that linked the drossy material of speech to the golden realm of thought.

能力与绩效

Competence and Performance

我们不得不得出这样的结论：除了相关功能之外，语言形式可以而且应该作为模式类型来研究。

We cannot but conclude that linguistic form may and should be studied as types of patterning, apart from the associated functions.

爱德华·萨丕尔

Edward Sapir

体貌模型是一个漂亮的模型。但它是什么的模型呢？答案是“能力”，这让我们回到索绪尔在将语言丛林划分为理想化的、因而更易于管理的部分时最重要的区别之一——语言与言语。在两章之前，我们粗略地将这些概念分别归类为语言和言语，或者语法和行为。语言是语言稳定而抽象的模式，言语是其表现形式。对于语言学的工作来说，更重要的是，区别在于“什么是本质的，什么是附属的、或多或少偶然的”（Saussure，1966 [1916]：14）。

The Aspects model is a beautiful model. But what is it a model of? The answer is “competence,” which takes us back to one of Saussure’s most important distinctions in parceling out the jungle of language into idealized, and therefore more manageable, plots—between langue and parole. We roughly identified these notions two chapters back with, respectively, language and speech, or grammar and behavior. Langue is the stable and abstract pattern of a language, parole is its manifestation. More importantly for doing the job of linguistics, the difference is between “what is essential [and] what is accessory and more or less accidental” (Saussure, 1966 [1916]:14).

对于布隆菲尔德派来说，这种区别或多或少与语料库（观察的集合，语言样本的集合）和语法（描述这些样本的规则和表述的集合，语料库中体现的模式的抽象描述）之间的区别相对应。当然，语料库不是言语，但它是言语的代表性样本；语法不是语言，但它是语言的模型。（哈里斯总是有点极端，他将语言定义为“仅仅是[言语]的科学安排”——1941:345。）21他们深受实证主义的影响，非常依赖数据，并且崇尚语料库。如果他们想研究英语，他们就会阅读英语文本，听英语使用者说​​话。例如，弗里斯的两本关于英语的主要著作就是基于写给政府的信件集（1940 年）和电话录音集（1952 年）。

For the Bloomfieldians, this distinction corresponded more or less to the difference between a corpus (a body of observations, a collection of linguistic specimens) and its grammar (a body of rules and representations describing those specimens, an abstract account of patterns manifest in the corpus). The corpus was not parole, of course, but it was a representative sample of parole; the grammar was not langue, but it was a model of langue. (Harris, always a little extreme, defined langue as “merely the scientific arrangement of [parole]”—1941:345.)21 Heavily influenced by positivism, they stuck close very close to the data, and venerated corpora. If they wanted to investigate English, they read English texts and they listened to English speakers. Fries’s two major books on English, for instance, are based on a collection of letters to the government (1940) and a collection of recorded telephone conversations (1952).

乔姆斯基完全没有顾忌超越语料库。例如，为了说明句法关系，他会简单地从脑子里抽出一些例子（比如一个主动句和一个被动句）。当一位略带愤怒的布卢姆菲尔德主义者要求他为这些选择辩护时，他承认对这个问题感到困惑：

Chomsky had absolutely no reservations about straying well beyond the corpus. Illustrating a syntactic relation, for instance, he would simply pluck some examples (an active and a passive sentence, say) from his head. Asked, by a mildly outraged Bloomfieldian, to defend such choices as representative chunks of English, he professed bafflement at the question:

CHOMSKY：动词perform不能与多义词宾语一起使用：一个人可以执行任务，但不能执行劳动。

CHOMSKY: The verb perform cannot be used with mass-word objects: one can perform a task, but one cannot perform labor.

哈彻：如果你不使用语料库并且没有研究过动词perform，你怎么知道呢？

HATCHER: How do you know, if you don’t use a corpus and have not studied the verb perform?

乔姆斯基：我怎么知道？因为我的母语是英语。（Hill，1962c[1958]：29）

CHOMSKY: How do I know? Because I am a native speaker of the English language. (Hill, 1962c [1958]:29)
