不幸的是，在这种情况下，乔姆斯基在他的表演概括中有点过于草率，但当安娜·格兰维尔·哈彻提出一个尖锐的反例“表演魔术”（Hill，1962c[1958]：31）时，他只是稍微受到了惩罚，而且理由充分。尽管乔姆斯基没有提到，但哈彻的反例也来自她的头脑，而不是语料库。由于乔姆斯基和哈彻两人都是英语母语人士，他们大概可以在相当短的时间内提出更有弹性的概括。超越直接的、征求的数据的概念对布卢姆菲尔德学派来说并不完全是新鲜事物。尤其是霍克特，他要求语法超越语料库来预测非抽样话语的结构（1954：34）。但乔姆斯基对语料库的漠不关心实际上对他们来说是可耻的，而他对直觉的严重依赖是方法论风向的一次重大转变。

In this case, unfortunately, Chomsky was a little too rash in his perform generalization, but he is only mildly chastened when Anna Granville Hatcher comes up with an incisive counter-example, perform magic (Hill, 1962c [1958]:31), and for good reason. Though Chomsky doesn’t mention it, Hatcher’s counter-example also comes from a head, hers, not from a corpus. The two of them, Chomsky and Hatcher, because they are native speakers of English, could presumably come up with a more resilient generalization in fairly short order. The notion of going beyond the immediate, solicited data was not completely novel to Bloomfieldians. Hockett, in particular, had required of grammars that they go beyond the corpus to predict the structure of nonsampled utterances (1954:34). But Chomsky’s attendant indifference to corpora was virtually scandalous for them, and his heavy reliance on intuition was a powerful shift in the methodological winds.

转向直觉而非语料库，具有解放作用，打开了廉价数据的广阔天地。但它也改变了大部分数据的性质。特别是，对直觉的重视大大提高了负面数据、非句子的地位（和可用性）。

The shift toward intuition, away from corpora, had the liberating effect of opening up vast worlds of cheap data. But it also changed the nature of much of that data. In particular, the emphasis on intuition significantly raised the status (and availability) of negative data, of non-sentences.

乔姆斯基语言学紧紧围绕语法性概念，即确定语言中哪些噪音序列符合语法，哪些不符合语法。但很难从知情者那里可靠地得出这样的判断。以下面的 siSwati 句子为例（siSwati 是斯威士兰使用的一种非洲语言）：

Chomskyan linguistics hinges tightly on the notion of grammaticality, on identifying which sequences of noises are grammatical in a language and which are not. But it is very difficult to elicit such judgments reliably from an informant. Take the following siSwati sentence (siSwati is an African language spoken in Swaziland):

15 a *Umfati uteka indvodza。

15 a *Umfati uteka indvodza.

西斯瓦特语使用者毫不犹豫地拒绝了 15a，因为它直译为“女人娶了丈夫”，是一个错误的句子。另一方面，他们认为 15b（“男人娶了妻子”）和 15c（“女人被男人娶走”）都完全没问题。

SiSwati speakers unhesitatingly reject 15a, which translates quite literally as “The woman takes a husband,” as a bad sentence. On the other hand, they find 15b (“The man takes a wife”) and 15c (“The woman is taken by the man”) both perfectly fine.

15

15

b 请勿打扰。

b Indvodza iteku umfati.

 

 

c 祈求您庇护我们及眷属。

c Umfati utsatfwa yindvodza.

所以问题就变成了，西斯瓦特语使用者拒绝 15a 是因为它不合语法（如“男人 a 娶妻”），还是因为它在语义上不合常理（如“圆圈是正方形”），还是因为它在语用上不恰当（如“黑猩猩是心脏病专家”）？是西斯瓦特语的句法系统、语义逻辑还是社会因素导致西斯瓦特语使用者拒绝 15a？语言在哪里，言语在哪里？这很难说。语言学家寻找此类数据时，查看自己的母语要安全得多。

So the question becomes, do siSwati speakers reject 15a because it is ungrammatical (like “Man the a takes wife”), or because it is semantically anomalous (like “The circle is square”) or pragmatically infelicitous (like “The chimp is a cardiac specialist”)? Is it the syntactic system of siSwati, its semantic logic, or social factors that make siSwati speakers reject 15a? Where is langue and where is parole? It is extremely difficult to tell. A linguist looking for such data is much safer looking to her own native language.

在哈彻和乔姆斯基的交流中，有两个问题值得讨论。第一个是生成性。乔姆斯基在《句法结构》中说，语法必须“将有限的、有些偶然的观察到的话语语料库投射到一组（可能是无限的）符合语法的话语中”（1957a:15；斜体为乔姆斯基所加）。也就是说，语法决定语料库。第二个问题，对于语言和言语来说更为重要，是乔姆斯基想要访问他自己头脑中的数据，而严格的实证主义方法会禁止这样做。

There are two issues on the table in the Hatcher-Chomsky exchange. The first is generativity. The grammar must, Chomsky says in Syntactic Structures, “project the finite and somewhat accidental corpus of observed utterances to a set (presumably infinite) of grammatical utterances” (1957a:15; Chomsky’s italics). That is, the grammar determines the corpus. The second issue, more important with respect to langue and parole, is that Chomsky wants access to the data in his own head, which strictly positivist methods would prohibit.

记住，他对语言的兴趣是深刻的心理方面的。布卢姆菲尔德学派对他们的语法所模仿的对象几乎不感兴趣，除了语料库所展示的一些抽象模式之外 — — 事实上，像模型、表征以及语言这样的词在他们的作品中几乎不存在。对索绪尔来说，语言学的工作毫无疑问就是研究语言，但是，正如我们在之前看到这种区别时你可能已经感觉到的那样，这个概念在他的著作中还没有成熟，就像史高治认为导致他噩梦的那块土豆一样。尤其是，索绪尔对涂尔干社会学的兴趣使他将语言悬而未决地放在了形式的某个社会领域中。对他来说，使用所依据的系统存在于社会的某个地方，存在于一种模糊的集体无意识中，这种集体无意识在本世纪初被认为具有解释作用。乔姆斯基关心的是“这里”的东西，在我们每个人的头脑中，在一种在本世纪后期被认为具有解释力的认知系统中。

His interest in language, remember, is profoundly psychological. The Bloomfieldians had virtually no interest in what their grammars were models of, beyond some abstract patterns exhibited by corpora—indeed, words like model and representation and, for that matter, langue, were virtually nonexistent in their work. For Saussure, the job of linguistics was unequivocally to study langue, but, as you may have felt when we looked at the distinction earlier, the notion was left halfbaked in his work, like the bit of potato Scrooge thought responsible for his nightmare. In particular, Saussure’s interest in Durkheim’s sociology led him to leave langue hanging in some social Realm of the Forms. The system underlying use for him is “out there” in society somewhere, in a vague collective unconscious of the sort that was regarded as explanatory in the early part of this century. Chomsky is concerned with something “in here,” in our individual heads, in a cognitive system of the sort that is regarded as explanatory in the late part of this century.

这些差异非常重要，因此乔姆斯基创造了自己的术语——最终，能力和其永恒伴侣表现一起出现在了这里。能力是索绪尔语言概念的折射；表现是言语概念的折射。在讲完之前，我们会看到很多这样的术语，但目前关于它们的要点是，它们分别明确地指明了知识和使用的情况，并且它们毫无疑问是心理学的。

These differences were significant enough that Chomsky coined his own terms—which, finally, is where competence comes in, along with its perennial traveling companion, performance. Competence is a refraction of the concept behind Saussure’s langue; performance, a refraction of the concept behind parole. We will see a good deal of these terms before we’re through, but for the moment the important points about them are that they identify clear cases of, respectively, knowledge and use, and that they are unambiguously psychological.

能力指的是我们熟悉的单词two和martinis的正确音位形状；而 performance 指的是这些形状在言语中的表达方式，例如《我爱露西》中tee和martoonies 的发音方式。更广泛地说，能力是某人对其语言的坚实知识，例如主语和动词必须一致、形容词修饰名词、easy可以接一种补语、eager可以接另一种补语等等。在儿童时期习得后，这种能力相对稳定，易于形式化，而且对乔姆斯基来说，这是语言学唯一正确的研究重点。索绪尔的一般、超个人概念language成为了乔姆斯基的超个人能力。

Competence refers to the familiar case of knowing the correct phonological shape of the words two and martinis; performance, to the articulation those shapes get in speech—tee and martoonies in an episode of “I Love Lucy.” More generally, competence is the hard-core knowledge someone has of her language—that subjects and verbs must agree, that adjectives qualify nouns, that easy takes one type of complement, eager another, and so on. It is relatively stable after childhood acquisition, amenable to formalization, and, for Chomsky, the single proper focus of linguistics. Saussure’s general, suprapersonal notion, langue, became Chomsky’s superpersonal competence.

表演就是将知识运用到演讲中。表演相对来说变化多端——受疲劳、兴奋、环境等影响——更难以有意义的方式形式化，而且对于乔姆斯基来说，表演显然不那么有趣。

Performance is the application of that knowledge in speech. It is relatively variable—subject to fatigue, exhilaration, context—more difficult to formalize in a meaningful way, and, for Chomsky, of decidedly lesser interest.

能力和表现之间的差异可能很微妙，就像对同一现象的社会和心理解释之间的大多数差异一样，但它们都是真实存在的，而且，即使除了改变状态的例子之外，还有很多清晰的案例。首先以电视的人工实例为例，想想那些遭受某种创伤的人失去说话能力并在后来恢复说话能力的情况，正好赶上一个重要的结局。他们的英语知识并没有消失。它不会消失在臭氧层中，然后再回来。角色只是因为某种原因难以获得它。能力并没有丧失；相反，他们的表现被打断了。真实的案例很少如此清晰，但类似的事情确实发生过，它们属于神经心理学的范畴。语言学家（至少是乔姆斯基派的语言学家）实际上对他们没有什么可说的。

The differences between competence and performance can be subtle, as are most differences between social and psychological accounts of the same phenomena, but they are real all the same, and, even beyond the altered-states sort of example, there are a wealth of clear cases. Sticking first with the artificial instances of television, think of the situations where people exposed to some trauma lose the ability to talk and regain it later, just in time for an important dénouement. Their knowledge of English hasn’t evaporated. It doesn’t disappear into the ozone, and come back. The characters just have trouble getting at it for some reason. There is no loss of competence; rather, their performance is interrupted. Real cases are seldom so clean, but analogous things do happen, and they fall in the realm of neuropsychology. Linguists (at least those of the Chomskyan persuasion) have virtually nothing to say about them.

或者考虑一下人们在面对不同听众时说话的不同方式，他们在不同语境中使用不同的语域：一种问候语用于女王，另一种用于配偶，另一种用于酒吧里的伙伴。无论一个人说的是“晚上好，殿下”、“你好，亲爱的”还是“怎么了，小伙子？”，都是语域的问题，是一种表演现象。无论这些话语是否符合语法，是问题还是陈述，是否有意义——这些都是抽象知识、能力现象的问题。语域与社会学（更具体地说，社会语言学）有关；语法、句子类型和指称与语言学有关。或者，以一个句子为例，比如 16a。

Or consider the different ways people speak when they address various listeners, the different registers they use in different contexts: one type of greeting for the queen, another for a spouse, another for mates in the pub. Whether someone says “Good evening, Your Highness,” “Hello, love,” or “What’s up, boyo?” is a matter of register, a performance phenomenon. Whether those utterances are grammatical or not, are questions or statements, are meaningful or not—those are matters of abstract knowledge, competence phenomena. Register concerns sociology (more specifically, sociolinguistics); grammaticalness, sentence type, and reference concern linguistics. Or, take a sentence, like 16a.

16a 那匹马跑过谷仓时摔倒了。

16 a The horse raced past the barn fell.

这种荒谬的句子被称为花园小径句，因为它们往往会将人们引向错误的处理方向。人们认为raced 的主语是horse，这种解读完全合情合理，直到最后出现了fell，打破了这种解读。有些人被这种解读弄得如此混乱，以至于他们再也没有恢复过来，并把这个句子当作胡言乱语。但另一种解读完全合情合理；即，将raced视为具有隐含主语，就像 16b 中明确的riden一样。

Such monstrosities are called garden-path sentences, because they tend to lead people in the wrong processing direction. People see raced as taking the horse for its subject, a reading that makes perfect sense until fell shows up at the end and throws that interpretaion out of whack. Some people are so severely discombobulated by that reading that they never recover, and write the sentence off as gibberish. But another reading makes perfect sense; namely, taking raced as having an implied subject, like the unambiguous ridden in 16b.

16 b 骑过谷仓的马摔倒了。

16 b The horse ridden past the barn fell.

人们漫步在花园小径上试图理解 16a 的事实与处理机制有关（大概是，一旦raced可以与作为其主语的马联系起来，人们就不愿意探索它的其他句法潜力）。它可能以某种方式涉及短期记忆，但无论如何，它涉及语言知识以外的其他内容，因此属于表现——在这种情况下，这是一个适合心理学家或心理语言学家而不是中场乔姆斯基主义者的主题。就 16a 涉及能力而言，它与 16b 难以区分。

The fact that people wander down a garden path trying to make sense of 16a has to do with processing mechanisms (presumably, an unwillingness to explore other syntactic potentials for raced once it can be linked up with the horse as its subject). Possibly it involves short-term memory in some way, but, in any case, it concerns something besides linguistic knowledge, and therefore belongs to performance—in this case, a fit subject for psychologists or psycholinguists, not for center-court Chomskyans. Insofar as 16a concerns competence, it is indistinguishable from 16b.

简而言之，说明乔姆斯基语法没有模拟什么比说明它模拟什么要容易得多，这个问题在 60 年代变得很重要，因为自《句法结构》以来，转换语法一直存在一种混乱（事实上，这种混乱在某些领域仍然存在）。卡尔顿·霍奇 (Carleton Hodge) 最直白地阐述了这种混乱，他认为转换语法是围绕着这样一个问题展开的：“如何才能不描述一个句子，而是造出一个句子？”（Hill，1969：38）。也就是说，许多观察家认为乔姆斯基是在推销一种生产模型，一种说话者如何造出句子的表示。

In short, it is rather easier to demonstrate what a Chomskyan grammar does not model than what it does, and this issue became important in the sixties because of a confusion that had dogged transformational grammar since Syntactic Structures (and which, in fact, still persists in some quarters). In the baldest formulation of this confusion, Carleton Hodge characterized transformational grammar as organized around the question, “How does one proceed, not to describe a sentence, but to make one?” (in Hill, 1969:38). That is, many observers thought Chomsky was marketing a production model, a representation of how speakers produce sentences.

这种混乱是很自然的，很大程度上是因为当时人们对“模拟心智”的含义还不甚清楚。乔姆斯基提出他的语法是为了模拟一种心理状态，但许多人却认为它是为了模拟一种心理过程。他强调创造力，而创造力不可避免地带有动态的内涵，但这无济于事。对乔姆斯基来说，创造力的集中体现是语言使用者能够创造和理解新颖的句子，能够说出来，在别人说这些句子时能够理解这些句子，能够写出来，能够阅读这些句子。但困惑的观察者认为生成语法是“解释我们如何产生[句子]的东西”，说明“乔姆斯基教授……对语法的创造方面而非解释方面感兴趣”（Francis，1963：320，321）。

The confusion was very natural, in large part because of the unclarity at the time about what it means to model the mind. Chomsky proposed his grammar to model a mental state, but many people took it to model a mental process. His emphasis on creativity, which has inescapably dynamic connotations, didn’t help matters. For Chomsky, creativity is epitomized by a language user’s ability to produce and understand novel sentences, to speak them and to figure them out when others speak them, to write them and to read them. But muddled observers saw a generative grammar as something “that explains how we produce [sentences],” illustrâting how “Professor Chomsky … is thus interested in the creative rather than the interpretive side of grammar” (Francis, 1963:320, 321).

更有问题的是，乔姆斯基的模型是另一个层面上的过程模型——并不是说它代表了一个过程，而是代表了一种状态，一种用过程术语来表示的了解语言的条件，充满了输入、输出和阶段的所有生产线词汇。在这里，没有一个词比生成词更麻烦；霍奇再次举例说明了这种混淆，他使用句子生成器（Hill，1969：39）作为转换语法的同义词，但就连埃纳尔·豪根也无法弄清楚生成和生产之间的区别（Dallaire 等人，1962：41-43）。它们之间的区别很简单。生成表示一个抽象概念，如描绘、定义和枚举。生产表示一个具体概念，如制造、建造和组装。但是在Aspects甚至核心圈子的成员在这方面犯下一些相当明显的错误之前，这种区别几乎没有得到解决，更不用说明确定义了。22

Even more problematically, Chomsky’s model was a process model on another level—not that it represented a process, but that it represented a state, the condition of knowing a language, in process terms, replete with all the production-line vocabulary of input and output and stages. No single word is more troublesome here than generative; Hodge again exemplifies the confusion by using sentence generator (Hill, 1969:39) as a synonym for transformational grammar, but even Einar Haugen couldn’t make heads or tails out of the difference between generate and produce (Dallaire and others, 1962:41–43). The difference is a simple one. Generate identifies an abstract notion, like delineate, define, and enumerate. Produce identifies a concrete notion, like make, build, and assemble. But the distinction was barely addressed, let alone clearly defined, before Aspects, and even members of the inner circle made some pretty glaring errors on this front.22

那么，生成模型（生成语法不是）表示说话者如何组织和吐出话语。生成语法是一种能力模型，它表示语言使用者头脑中的知识，而不是将知识从嘴里说出来的技巧、策略和突触过程。集合 {1, 2, 3, … } 表示可以在某些情况下使用的一些数学知识，但不是计数一群山羊的实际过程。

A production model, then—what a generative grammar isn’t—represents how speakers formulate and spit out utterances. A generative grammar, a competence model, represents the knowledge inside a language user’s head, not the techniques, strategies, and synaptic processes for getting pieces of it out of her mouth. The set {1, 2, 3, … } represents some mathematical knowledge that can be put to use in certain situations, but not the actual process of counting a herd of goats.

对这一点进行充分阐述后，应该清楚的是，转换语法在语言学之外的成功，很大一部分以及在语言学内部的成功，都是基于一些根本性的误解，这些误解在接下来的几年里不断升级。

With this point sufficiently belabored, it should be clear that a good portion of transformational grammar’s success outside of linguistics, and some of it within, was based on a few fundamental misunderstandings, misunderstandings that were to escalate over the next few years.

关于能力和绩效还有一件事。它们非常方便。再回想一下 Cormorant-Island 的句子：Katz 和 Postal 对他们提出的改变意义问题的解决方案本质上是声称冲突的解读（相同两种解释和不同两种解释）是绩效因素的产物；由于乔姆斯基模型对绩效没有直接责任，因此这些冲突的解读被简单地处理掉了。它们不再是数据的一部分。

And one more thing about competence and performance. They were very convenient. Recall the Cormorant-Island sentences yet again: Katz and Postal’s solution to the change-of-meaning problem they posed was essentially to claim that the conflicting readings (the same-two and different-two interpretations) were the products of performance factors; since a Chomskyan model has no direct responsibility for performance, those conflicting readings are simply disposed of. They are no longer part of the data.

乔姆斯基派认为，这代价很小。在短短几年的狂热岁月中，他们敲定了一个优雅的框架，实现了至少自斯多葛学派以来所有语言学工作的最终目标。他们正式将声音和意义联系起来。这一美妙理论的支点是底层的句法表征，即令人回味的深层结构。它是基础部分的直接输出，是句法结构短语结构规则的强化版。它是转换的直接输入，是早期理论的名义技术手段。对于所有相关人员来说，最重要的是，在卡茨-波斯特尔原则的基础上，它是意义的所在。

Small price to pay, the Chomskyans thought. They had, in a few short and feverish years, hammered out an elegant framework which accomplished the ultimate goal of all linguistic work from at least the time of the Stoics. They had formally linked sound and meaning. The fulcrum of this beautiful theory was the underlying syntactic representation, the evocatively named deep structure. It was the direct output of the base component, a beefed-up descendant of Syntactic Structures’ phrase structure rules. It was the direct input to the transformations, the early theory’s titular technical device. Most crucially for all concerned, with the Katz-Postal principle in place, it was the locus of meaning.

是的，Aspects模型很优雅。它连接了声音和意义。它代表了语言知识。它容纳了美丽的深层结构。但它有漏洞。

Yes, the Aspects model was elegant. It linked sound and meaning. It represented knowledge of language. It housed the beautiful deep structure. But it leaked.

第 5 章

生成语义学 1：模型

CHAPTER 5

Generative Semantics 1: The Model

简单的模仿是不够的，还应该以模型为基础进行开发。

Simple imitation is not enough; one should build upon the model.

昆体良

Quintilian

门徒通常渴望比师父进步，而……运动的领导者有时会发现他不能或不想像周围的人一样快速到达应许之地。

Disciples are usually eager to improve on the master, and … the leader of a movement sometimes discovers he cannot or does not wish to go quite as fast to the Promised Land as those around him.

杰拉尔德霍尔顿

Gerald Holton

天堂里的烦恼

Trouble in Paradise

在那个乐观而挑剔的十年中期，也就是 20 世纪 60 年代，乔姆斯基的世界正如它应该的那样展开。布卢姆菲尔德派被赶到了边缘。有一群精力充沛、聪明、专注的语言学家和哲学家在研究生成语法。各地的年轻语言学家都在争相征求他们的想法。研究生课程正在启动，培养出一批令人印象深刻、供不应求、即将成为有影响力的哲学博士。麻省理工学院是语言研究领域真理和智慧的堡垒，乔姆斯基是公认的知识领袖，《Aspects》是新的经典。

The Chomskyan universe was unfolding as it should in the middle of that optimistic and captious decade, the 1960s. The Bloomfieldians were driven to the margins. There was a cadre of feisty, clever, dedicated linguists and philosophers working on generative grammar. Young linguists everywhere were clamoring for their thoughts. The graduate program was up and running, generating an impressive, indemand, soon-to-be-influential string of philosophical doctors. MIT was a stronghold of truth and wisdom in language studies, Chomsky was the uniformly acknowledged intellectual leader, Aspects was the new scripture.

这部经典著作所编纂、扩展和丰富的核心和定义性关注点在于深入语言的字面表象，探索其地下逻辑规律，找到其深层结构，获得意义。“总的来说，”乔姆斯基告诉部队，“随着句法描述变得越来越深入，看似语义的问题越来越多地落入其范围；并且人们是否或在何处可以在语法和‘逻辑语法’之间划出自然界限并不完全明显”（1964d [1963]：51）。阿斯派克斯不仅赞同体现这一关注点的卡兹-波斯特尔原则，以及该原则伴随的创新，如语义解释规则和触发词素以及对有问题的数据的重新评估，阿斯派克斯还通过在模型中添加基础递归、同时丢弃一整类语义解释规则，从而发明深层结构来强化它。

The central, defining concern of the work codified, extended, and enriched in that scripture was to get beneath the literal surface of language and explore its subterranean logical regularities, to find its deep structures, to get at meaning. “In general,” Chomsky had told the troops, “as syntactic description becomes deeper, what appear to be semantic questions fall increasingly within its scope; and it is not entirely obvious whether or where one can draw a natural bound between grammar and ‘logical grammar’” (1964d [1963]:51). Aspects not only endorses the Katz-Postal principle which enacts this concern, and the principle’s attendant innovations, like semantic interpretation rules and trigger morphemes and reevaluations of problematic data, Aspects strengthens it, by adding base-recursion to the model, discarding an entire class of semantic interpretation rules in the bargain, and consequently inventing deep structure.

每个人都对这项工作感到满意，但没有人感到满意（可能除了 Katz）。毫无疑问，最敏锐的句法学家 Postal 表示他不愿止步于此，他更深入地挖掘表面之下的东西，研究的方向很快就被称为抽象句法，其他几位语言学家也加入了这个项目，其中最著名的是 George Lakoff、Háj Ross 和 James McCawley。他们一起将句法推得越来越深，直到当时语义具有实质内容的程度，它们的深层结构变得几乎与语义表示难以区分；事实上，它们的深层结构是 60 年代中期剑桥最接近显式语义表示的东西。他们相信乔姆斯基的话，创建了一种以逻辑形式为中心的语法。此时，在 1967 年初，该计划转变为生成语义学，乔姆斯基对此感到不满意。他表达了自己的不满，然后，把语义精灵从瓶子里放了出来，在接下来的几年里，他一直试图将它塞回去，尽管遭到了生成语义学家的强烈抵制。

Everybody was happy with this work, but no one was content (with the possible exception of Katz). Postal, the hands-down-sharpest syntactician, expressed his unwillingness to stay put by digging more deeply under the surface, working in a direction which rapidly came to be known as abstract syntax, and several other linguists joined this project—most notably George Lakoff, Háj Ross, and James McCawley. Together they pushed syntax deeper and deeper until, to the extent that semantics had substance at the time, their deep structures became virtually indistinguishable from semantic representation; indeed, their deep structures were the closest things to explicit semantic representations in mid-sixties Cambridge. They took Chomsky at his word and made a grammar in which logical form had a central place. At this point, early in 1967, the program mutated into generative semantics, and Chomsky was displeased. He voiced his displeasure, and then, having let the semantic genie out of the bottle, spent the next several years trying to stuff it back in, against the agitated resistance of the generative semanticists.

但这些只是故事的骨架。还有筋骨和软骨、毛发和兽皮、湿的和干的，还有待讲述。我们可以像所有肉体事物一样，从祖先开始。

But these are just the bones of the story. There is sinew and gristle, hair and hide, wet stuff and dry, yet to tell. We can start, as in all fleshy matters, with the progenitors.

自酿的纷争

Home-brewed Dissension

从 1965 年起，甚至更晚，我们在 20 号楼（麻省理工学院语言学系所在地）的内部发现了一群忠诚的同谋，他们因传教热情和共同目标而团结在一起。一两年后，这件外衣开始解开，到 20 世纪末，气氛已经全面开战。这片土地始终与外界隔绝：没有从伊甸园外引入毒蛇来引诱或腐蚀。任何分歧都必须是自酿的。

As of 1965, and even later, we find in the bowels of Building 20 [the home of the MIT linguistics department] a group of dedicated co-conspirators, united by missionary zeal and shared purpose. A year or two later, the garment is unraveling, and by the end of the decade the mood is total warfare. The field was always closed off against the outside: no serpent was introduced from outside of Eden to seduce or corrupt. Any dissension had to be home-brewed.

罗宾·莱考夫

Robin Lakoff

20 世纪 50 年代末，保罗·波斯特尔 (Paul Postal) 在耶鲁大学朗斯伯里 (Lounsbury) 的指导下，在一次由布洛赫赞助的访问中遇到了乔姆斯基。波斯特尔几乎在一夜之间改变了想法：

Paul Postal, studying under Lounsbury at Yale in the late fifties, met Chomsky on one of his Bloch-sponsored visits. Postal converted almost overnight:

我印象非常深刻，首先是对他思想力量的惊叹，而且似乎这些东西来自不同的星球，因为它基于一种与我以前接触过的任何事物都完全不同的思维方式。

I was very impressed, first with the power of his thought, but also it seemed that this stuff was from a different planet, in the sense that it was based on an entirely different way of thinking from anything I had come into contact with before.

他把自己尖刻的辩论风格融入到了这场新运动中，他的同学杰伊·凯泽 (Jay Keyser) 还记得他反对布卢姆菲尔德派运动的初期传递笔记的过程：

He hitched his corrosive polemical style to the new movement, and his classmate, Jay Keyser, remembers the note-passing beginnings of his campaign against the Bloomfieldians:

我记得坐在那里，听伯纳德·布洛赫讲授形态学假设。布洛赫会说些什么，保罗会给我写一张带有反例的便条。我心里想：“天哪。波斯特说得对。这根本行不通。”

I remember sitting there, listening to Bernard Bloch lecture on morphemic postulates. Bloch would be saying something, and Paul would write me a note with a counterexample. I thought to myself “Jesus. Postal’s right. This is just not working.”

波斯特尔急切地逃离了纽黑文布鲁姆菲尔德式的束缚，在剑桥大学电子研究实验室完成了他的论文，并加入了麻省理工学院的教职员工队伍，在那里他帮助塑造了麻省理工学院的第一代人，当然，还和卡茨一起敲定了深层结构的大部分属性。他还开始工作这一提高抽象性和语义敏锐性的项目让许多语言学家兴奋不已，其中最著名的是乔治·莱考夫 (George Lakoff)。

Eagerly escaping the Bloomfieldian confines of New Haven, Postal finished his dissertation in Cambridge as part of the Research Laboratory of Electronics and joined the MIT staff, where he helped shape the first MIT generation, and, of course, hammered out most of the properties of deep structure with Katz. He also began working on a program of increasing abstraction and semantic perspicacity that excited a number of linguists; most notably, George Lakoff.

乔治·莱考夫第一次接触生成语法是在 1961 年，当时他还是一名麻省理工学院的本科生，选修了乔姆斯基和哈勒的课。他觉得这一切都很枯燥，没有灵感。但当他前往印第安纳大学攻读英语研究生时，他开始自己阅读材料，发现它更引人注目，并着手进行一些非传统的工作，试图将普罗普的《民间故事形态》的原理转化为生成故事语法。1963 年夏天，他回到剑桥与罗宾·托尔玛赫结婚，并遇到了罗斯和麦考利，并在 Victor Yngve 的机器翻译项目中找到了一份工作。卡茨和波斯特尔就在走廊尽头，致力于《综合理论》的研究，他经常与他们交谈。通过定期参加麻省理工学院社区活动，他对语言产生了更直接的兴趣，并回到印第安纳州，在 Householder 的指导下攻读语言学博士学位。次年夏天，他进入了波斯特尔任教的语言学院，并与他重续友谊。因此，当豪斯霍尔德在莱考夫的论文年休假时，他自然而然地回到了剑桥，波斯特尔在那里指导他的论文，而哈伊·罗斯成为了他非常亲密的伙伴。

George Lakoff first encountered generative grammar as an MIT undergraduate in 1961, taking classes from Chomsky and Halle. He found it all pretty dry and uninspiring. But when he went off to do graduate work in English at Indiana, he began to read the material on his own, found it a good deal more compelling, and embarked on some unorthodox work trying to transform the principles of Propp’s Morphology of the Folktale into a generative story grammar. Returning to Cambridge in the summer of 1963 to marry Robin Tolmach, he met Ross and McCawley, and found a job on Victor Yngve’s machine translation project. Katz and Postal were down the hall, working on Integrated Theory, and he spoke with them frequently. Through this regular participation in the MIT community, he became more directly interested in language and returned to Indiana to work on a doctorate in linguistics, under Householder. The following summer he attended the Linguistic Institute, at which Postal was teaching, and renewed his friendship with him. So, when Householder left for a sabbatical during Lakoff’s dissertation year, he naturally headed back to Cambridge, where Postal directed his dissertation, and Háj Ross became his very close associate.

哈伊·罗斯的父亲是核物理学家，祖父是诺贝尔和平奖获得者。他在耶鲁大学读本科，当时波斯特尔对分类学很感兴趣，而布洛赫是当时的理论家。哈伊·罗斯师从两位教授，在校队踢足球，在校园广播电台主持爵士乐节目，毕业后前往麻省理工学院就读日益重要的语言学专业。但他没有。哈伊·罗斯发现他的工作特别不尽如人意，建议他去别处“证明自己”。哈伊·罗斯确实去了。事实上，他去了乔姆斯基的故地，在宾夕法尼亚大学泽利格·哈里斯的指导下完成了硕士论文。哈伊·罗斯回到麻省理工学院，就读现已成为卡梅洛式的、接近“方面”理论的语言学专业。哈伊·罗斯真的去了。作为一流班级中的佼佼者，哈伊·罗斯后来撰写了一篇影响深远的论文。他还开始与拉科夫密切合作，特别是在《邮政》的抽象主义分析流派方面，并赢得了詹姆斯麦考利的友谊。

Háj Ross, son of a nuclear physicist, grandson of a Nobel Peace Prize laureate, did his undergraduate work at Yale, where Postal was chafing at the taxonomic bit, and Bloch was the reigning theorist. He studied under both, played varsity football, ran a jazz show on the campus radio station, graduated, and went off to MIT to enroll in its increasingly important linguistics program. He didn’t. Halle found his work singularly unimpressive and suggested he go off somewhere and “prove himself.” He did. In fact, he went off to Chomsky’s old stomping grounds and completed a master’s thesis under Zellig Harris at the University of Pennsylvania. He returned to MIT to enroll in its now-Camelotian, brink-of-the-Aspects-theory linguistics program. He did. One of the shining stars in a stellar class, he went on to produce a hugely influential dissertation. He also began collaborating closely with Lakoff, particularly on Postal’s abstractionist genre of analyses, and gained the friendship of James McCawley.

詹姆斯·麦考利在他的老师、同事、朋友和对手诺姆·乔姆斯基看来是“该领域最聪明的人之一”。利斯将他列为“我们这个时代最理智、最敏锐的语言学家”。罗斯和莱考夫对他的智慧、敏感、幽默、热情、创造力、教学天赋、音乐才能、烹饪天赋等进行了详尽的描述……他是“生成语法学家的湿婆，转换理论的多面手”（Zwicky 等人，1970：vii），一位重要、多样、具有挑战性的语言学家。他拥有数学背景和浓重的格拉斯哥口音，于 1962 年进入麻省理工学院，凭借清晰的思维和机智的敏捷而迅速脱颖而出。他对音系学的兴趣比对句法学的兴趣更大，他发表了一篇关于日语声调现象的出色论文（1968b [1965]），获得了新语言学系颁发的第二个博士学位。但很快他就发现自己不得不在芝加哥大学教授句法课程。他花了很多时间与两位教授通电话，很快就自学了这方面的知识罗斯和莱科夫是剑桥大学的好友，当时他们在哈佛大学领导一个句法研究小组。

James McCawley, in the estimation of his teacher, colleague, friend, and opponent, Noam Chomsky, is “one of the smartest people to have gone through the field.” Lees places him among “the sanest and most astute linguists of our time.” Ross and Lakoff go on at great length about his intelligence, sensitivity, humor, warmth, inventiveness, pedagogical gifts, musicianship, culinary talents,… He is “the generative grammarians’ Shiva, the many-handed one of transformational theory” (Zwicky and others, 1970:vii), an important, diverse, challenging linguist. With a background in mathematics and a thick Glasgow accent, he entered MIT in 1962, distinguishing himself rapidly for both the clarity of his thought and the deftness of his wit. He was more intrigued by phonology than syntax and produced a brilliant dissertation on Japanese tone phenomena (1968b [1965]), earning the second doctorate awarded by the new linguistics department. But he soon found himself at the University of Chicago having to teach courses in syntax. He very quickly educated himself in the area by spending a great deal of time on the phone with two friends in Cambridge who were directing a syntactic study group at Harvard, Ross and Lakoff.

这四个相对突然、相互贯穿的段落（每个祖先一个）反映了生成语义学的起源。1这些人都被认为是该理论的创始人（尽管用罗斯的话来说，他只是“乔治的助手”）。哈佛大学一位非常杰出的语言学家 Susumu Kuno 了解所有主要人物，并与其中几位密切合作，他说：“我毫不怀疑乔治是该理论的最初支持者和创始人。” Arnold Zwicky 说该理论是 Lakoff 和 Ross 共同提出的。Newmeyer 说该理论是在 Postal 的影响下由 Lakoff 和 Ross 共同完成的。而 Ross 则说：“这基本上是 Postal 的想法。他基本上是设计者。[乔治和我] 就像副手一样，试图充实该理论。”但 Postal 说“McCawley 最先开始谈论生成语义学”，而 McCawley 的论点让他对这一运动产生了兴趣。McCawley 说 Lakoff 和 Ross“把我变成了……生成语义学家。”拉科夫说，这个想法是他自己提出的，但是波斯特尔用了大约三年的时间劝说他放弃了这个想法，直到麦考利说服他这个想法是正确的，当时他正在和罗斯一起研究波斯特尔的一些想法。2

These four relatively abrupt, interpenetrating paragraphs—one per progenitor—mirror the parentage of generative semantics.1 Each of these men has been credited with engendering the theory (though Ross only, in his words, “as George’s sidekick”). Susumu Kuno, a very distinguished Harvard linguist who knew all the principals, working closely with several of them, says “I have no doubt that George was the original proponent and founder of the idea.” Arnold Zwicky says that the theory was the joint issue of Lakoff and Ross. Newmeyer says that it was born out of work by Lakoff and Ross, under Postal’s influence. Ross, for his part, says “it’s basically Postal’s idea. He was basically the architect. [George and I] were sort of lieutenants and tried to flesh out the theory.” But Postal says that “McCawley first started talking about generative semantics,” and it was McCawley’s arguments which first got him interested in the movement. McCawley says that Lakoff and Ross “turned me … into a generative semanticist.” Lakoff says that the idea was his, but that Postal talked him out of it for a period of about three years, when McCawley then convinced him it was correct, while he was working with Ross, on some of Postal’s ideas.2

寓意在于，大多数思想没有父或母，而是有社区。生成语义学在 20 世纪 60 年代中期在剑桥大学诞生——部分与Aspects理论相呼应；部分是对其的反应。乔姆斯基对生成语义学的起源毫无兴趣，他简单地说，“它只是在空中飘荡”，这种解释有很多值得推荐的地方。

The moral is that most ideas don’t have fathers or mothers so much as they have communities. Generative semantics coalesced in mid-sixties Cambridge—partially in concert with the Aspects theory; partially in reaction to it. Chomsky, who is decidedly uninterested in generative semantics’ parentage says, simply, “it was in the air,” and there is much to recommend this account.

随着句法的转换分析变得更加深入和全面，它们越来越多地涉及语义。早在哈里斯（1954 年）时期，就有希望通过形式句法工作进入意义的丛林。《句法结构》做了一些重要的初步调查，到第九届国际代表大会时，乔姆斯基明确指出，句法越深入，就越接近意义。然而，在某个模糊的点上——或者说，在几个不同的模糊的点上，对几个人来说——这个计划开始显得完全错误。人们开始认为，句法不应该过多地吸收语义，而应该探索其自身的语义根源；句法不应该决定语义，语义应该决定句法——语义应该是生成性的，而不是解释性的。在某个模糊的点上，存在生成语义。

As transformational analyses of syntax grew more probing and more comprehensive, they increasingly involved semantics. As early as Harris (1954), there was a promise that formal syntactic work could make inroads into the jungle of meaning. Syntactic Structures did some important preliminary surveying, and by the Ninth International Congress, Chomsky was arguing explicitly that the deeper syntax went, the closer it got to meaning. At some indistinct point, however—or, rather, at several different indistinct points, for several people—this program began to seem exactly wrong. It began to appear that syntax should not be coopting semantics so much as exploring its own semantic roots; that syntax should not be determining semantics, semantics should be determining syntax—that semantics should be generative rather than interpretive. At some indistinct point, there was generative semantics.

但“悬而未决”这个说法太模糊了。有明显的领导者。当乔姆斯基突然开始对这种类型的深度句法工作失去兴趣，而生成语义学在《Aspects》的背景下开始成形时，很明显这些领导者是谁：乔治·莱考夫、罗斯、麦考利和波斯特尔。其他人也有影响力，尤其是罗宾·莱考夫、杰弗里·格鲁伯、查尔斯·菲尔莫尔和几位麻省理工学院的讲师——最著名的是爱德华·克里马、保罗·基帕斯基和大人物诺姆·乔姆斯基。

But “in the air” is far too vague. There were clear leaders. As Chomsky, quite suddenly, began to show less inclination for this type of deep syntactic work, and as generative semantics began to take shape against the backdrop of Aspects, it was obvious who these leaders were: George Lakoff, Ross, McCawley, and Postal. Others had influence, especially Robin Lakoff, Jeffrey Gruber, Charles Fillmore, and several MIT instructors—most notably, Edward Klima, Paul Kiparsky, and the big one, Noam Chomsky.

乔姆斯基说：“早在 20 世纪 60 年代初期，我自己就相信了生成语义学，而且实际上或多或少地提出了生成语义学。”笛卡尔语言学和《语言与心智》中的流行论点支持这一主张。在前者中，例如，他说“实际话语背后的深层结构……纯​​粹是心理的，[并且]传达了句子的语义内容。[它是]思维形式的简单反映”（Chomsky，1966a：35）——这是生成语义学最清晰的表达。但是，天启四骑士——波斯特尔、莱考夫、罗斯和麦考利——与其他人之间存在着巨大的差异。

“I sort of believed [generative semantics] myself back in the early sixties,” Chomsky has said, “and in fact more or less proposed it.” And the popular arguments in Cartesian Linguistics and Language and Mind support the claim. In the former, for instance, he says that “the deep structure underlying the actual utterance … is purely mental [and] conveys the semantic content of the sentence. [It is] a simple reflection of the forms of thought” (Chomsky, 1966a:35)—as clear as articulation of generative semantics as ever there was. But there are large differences of scale between the four horsemen of the apocalypse—as Postal, Lakoff, Ross, and McCawley became known—and everyone else.

尤其是乔姆斯基，他从来没有采用过生成语义学，而且每当他接近支持某种貌似生成语义学的东西时，都会有一个典型的附加条件。在《笛卡尔语言学》中，他说深层结构与思想和意义的关系实际上并不像上面的引文暗示的那么清晰，他只是表达了保皇党人的观点；真正的联系是一个“进一步的、悬而未决的问题”（1966a:100n8）。骑士们没有表达这样的保留意见。罗宾·莱考夫是一位重要的女骑士，她也没有表达这样的保留意见，并成为该运动最具影响力的教师之一，她既不是像其他人那样的布道者，也不是大规模的理论家。而两位重要的理论家菲尔莫尔和格鲁伯则有保留意见；基帕斯基和克里马的保留意见则更多。

Chomsky, in particular, certainly never adopted generative semantics, and everywhere that he comes close to endorsing something that looks like generative semantics, there is a characteristic rider attached. In Cartesian Linguistics, he says the relation of deep structure to thought and meaning in fact is not so clear as the above quotation suggests, that he is just expressing what the Port-Royalists held; the real connections are a “further and open question” (1966a:100n8). The horsemen expressed no such reservations. Robin Lakoff, an important horsewoman who also expressed no such reservations, and who became one of the movement’s most influential teachers, was neither the proselytizer nor the large-scale theorizer that the others were. And two important theorizers, Fillmore and Gruber, had reservations; Kiparsky and Klima had even more.

生成语义学的核心是消除语法最深层次上的句法语义界限——真正的深层结构是语义表征，而不是语义成分的句法输入。实际上，这种消除始于 Postal，尽管 George Lakoff 是第一个提出这一观点的人。

The kernel of generative semantics was an obliteration of the syntax-semantics boundary at the deepest level of grammar—the axiom that the true deep structure was the semantic representation, not a syntactic input to the semantic component. This obliteration, in real terms, began with Postal, though George Lakoff was the first to propose it.

莱科夫的提议

Lakoff’s Proposal

Katz、Fodor 和 Postal 所采取的方法是将语义理论视为解释性的，而不是生成性的。在他们看来，问题在于找出给定的语言句子，并找到一种手段来表达它们的含义。解决这个问题的生成方法可能是找到一种能够生成含义并将这些含义映射到句法结构上的手段。

The approach taken by Katz, Fodor, and Postal has been to view a semantic theory as being necessarily interpretive, rather than generative. The problem, as they see it, is to take given sentences of a language and find a device to tell what they mean. A generative approach to the problem might be to find a device that could generate meanings and could map those meanings onto syntactic structures.

乔治·莱考夫

George Lakoff

迈向生成语义学的第一步是乔治·莱考夫（George Lakoff）在他研究生生涯早期发表的一篇论文，在对卡兹和福多尔（Katz and Fodor）解释语义学进行初步探索后，莱考夫说：“提出生成语义学理论的动机有多种”（1976a [1963]:50）。好吧，这不是一步。这是一次跳跃、一次跳跃和一次跳跃。莱考夫想通过三次猛攻来取代卡兹和福多尔刚刚发表的语义学计划，绕过卡兹和波斯特尔（Postal）尚未证明的该计划与转换语法的整合，并抢占乔姆斯基的“眼中一闪而过的深层结构”。呼。

The first step toward generative semantics was a paper by George Lakoff, very early in his graduate career, which, after some preliminary hole-poking in KatznFodorian interpretive semantics, says “There are several motivations for proposing a generative semantic theory” (1976a [1963]:50). Well, okay, this is not a step. This is a hop, a skip, and a jump. In three lunging moves, Lakoff wanted to replace Katz and Fodor’s just-published semantic program, to bypass Katz and Postal’s still-in-the-proofs integration of that program with transformational syntax, and to preempt Chomsky’s just-a-glint-in-his-eye deep structure. Whew.

他把《迈向生成语义学》这篇论文交给了乔姆斯基，但根据莱科夫的回忆，乔姆斯基“完全反对”他的想法，于是将他送到托马斯·贝弗和彼得·罗森鲍姆那里接受语义学指导。乔姆斯基对这篇论文没有任何印象，只记得 1963 年“每个人都在写这样的论文”——这一言论充其量也难以证实。3贝弗和罗森鲍姆当时在 MITRE 公司，这是剑桥的一个空军研究实验室，很多语言学学生在夏天去那里研究转换。贝弗和罗森鲍姆也不喜欢这样，莱科夫还记得他们之间长达三个小时的激烈争论。没人让步，不过 MITRE 的另一名暑期员工罗斯在场旁观，此后开始了与莱科夫的亲密合作关系。莱科夫印了一些副本，给了罗斯一份，麦考利一份，波斯特尔一份，还把其他几份寄给了他认为可能感兴趣的人。但没有成功。没有人对他的提议抱有太大希望，也没有人采纳。莱科夫不会轻易放弃，但他非常尊重波斯特尔并听取了他的建议。他放弃了生成语义学的概念（或者，也许更准确地说，抑制了它），回去研究新兴的Aspects理论的解释框架。

He took the paper, “Toward Generative Semantics,” to Chomsky, who was, Lakoff recalls, “completely opposed” to his ideas, and sent him off to Thomas Bever and Peter Rosenbaum for some semantic tutelage. Chomsky remembers nothing about the paper except that “everybody was writing papers like that” in 1963—a remark that is, at best, difficult to substantiate.3 Bever and Rosenbaum were at MITRE corporation, an air force research lab in Cambridge where many linguistics students went in the summer to spawn transformations. Bever and Rosenbaum didn’t like it either, and Lakoff remembers a huge, three-hour argument. No one budged, though Ross, another MITRE summer employee, sat in as an onlooker and thereafter began his close, collaborative friendship with Lakoff. Lakoff ran off some copies and gave one to Ross, another to McCawley, another to Postal, and sent a few more off to people he thought might be interested. It was not a success. No one held much hope for his proposals, and no one adopted them. Lakoff does not give up easily, but he respected Postal immensely and took his advice. He abandoned the notion of generative semantics (or, perhaps more accurately, suppressed it), and went back to work in the interpretive framework of the emerging Aspects theory.

暂时跳出年代学来考虑一下词源学，生成语义学到底是什么，至少在技术意义上还不清楚。解释语义学就足够清楚了。解释模型有一些表示句子的结构（深层结构、表层结构、中间结构，这都无所谓），还有一些将这些结构转化为语义表示的方法，还有一些解释语法以提取意义元素的方法。Aspects模型主要依赖于解释语义学。

Stepping out of the chronology for a moment to consider etymology, it’s not exactly clear what a generative semantics is, of course, at least in the technical sense. Interpretive semantics is clear enough. An interpretive model has some structures representing sentences (deep structures, surface structures, intermediate structures, it doesn’t matter), and some way of turning those structures into semantic representations, some way of interpreting the syntax to extract elements of meaning. The Aspects model depends, crucially, on interpretive semantics.

但乔姆斯基在五十年代的开创性工作定义了一个与关键术语“生成语法”相关的相当广泛的概念，这个概念涵盖了音系学、形态学、句法学和（后来卡茨、福多尔和波斯特尔出现的）语义学。4

But Chomsky’s groundbreaking work in the fifties defined a quite sweeping notion in connection with the crucial term—“generative grammar”—a notion which embraced phonology, morphology, syntax, and (once Katz, Fodor, and Postal came along) semantics.4

确实，人们偶尔会谈论“生成句法”，而句法无疑是语法的核心组成部分，与语法的创造性密切相关（Chomsky, 1965 [1964]:136）。但从技术意义上讲，生成仅指一种语法，它“指定无限的格式良好的句子集，并为每个句子分配一个或多个结构描述”和两种或多种解释，即音系解释和语义解释（Chomsky, 1964b [1962]:915）。当然，它从来都不是解释的反义词；事实上，只是为了混淆问题，转换语法中的音系研究是在生成音系学的标题下进行的，它们涉及语法中明确的解释组成部分。

It’s true that there was occasional talk about a “generative syntax,” and syntax was unquestionably the central component of the grammar, linked critically to the creativity of the grammar (Chomsky, 1965 [1964]:136). But generative, in its technical sense, meant only a grammar which “specifies the infinite set of well-formed sentences and assigns to each of these one or more structural descriptions” and two or more interpretations, phonological and semantic (Chomsky, 1964b [1962]:915). Certainly it was never meant as an antonym of interpretive; in fact, just to confuse the issue, the phonological investigations in transformational grammar were conducted under the rubric, generative phonology, and they concerned an explicitly interpretive component of the grammar.

但是，生成性这个词在当时受到高度重视，具有赋予它相邻的任何名词的超凡权威，正是在这个意义上存在着生成音系学（仅仅意味着遵循生成原则的音系学，因此属于生成语法）。部分由于这个词获得了光荣，部分由于乔姆斯基关于描述创造力的松散而有影响力的言论，生成性在非正式语境中被广泛使用，与创造性、生产性和其他动态术语混杂在一起，承担了它们的一些动机意义——这显然是拉科夫在 1963 年所说的生成语义学的一部分。他用它作为解释语义学的反义词（1976a [1963]：50）。但他也保留了该术语的部分技术意义，呼吁“一种能够产生意义并将这些意义映射到句法结构的装置”（1976a [1963]：44）；这与新兴的Aspects模型，它生成句法形式并将其映射到语音和语义结构上。

But the word, generative, was very highly valued at the time, with charismatic authority to bestow on any noun it abutted, and it was in this sense that there was a generative phonology (which meant simply a phonology which adhered to generative principles and which therefore belonged in a generative grammar). Partially as a result of the glory the word was gaining, and partially as a result of Chomsky’s loose and influential talk of describing creativity, generative smudged a good deal in informal contexts, commingling with creative and productive and other dynamic terms, taking on some of their motive senses—and this is clearly part of what Lakoff meant in 1963 by generative semantics. He uses it as an antonym to interpretive semantics (1976a [1963]:50). But he also retained part of the technical sense of the term, calling for “a device that could generate meanings and could map those meanings onto syntactic structures” (1976a [1963]:44); this, in opposition to the nascent Aspects model which generated syntactic forms and mapped those onto phonetic and semantic structures.

那么应该清楚的是，标签中最重要的词不是生成词，而是语义词，而对立的是句法词。5卡茨、福多尔和波斯特尔的作品在意义方面取得了很大进展，但在乔姆斯基的强烈影响下，显然还是让句法占据了主导地位。正如乔姆斯基描述他自己的方法时所说，他的大部分工作都是别人所说的语义；“尽管如此，我还是想把所有这些都归入句法”(1982a:114)。他一直想解决的意义方面，只有那些可以归入句法（或在某些情况下重新定义为句法）的方面。

The most important word in the label, it should be clear then, isn’t generative, but semantics, and the opposition is to syntax.5 The Katz and Fodor and Postal work, for all its inroads into meaning, under Chomsky’s heavy influence, clearly left syntax in the driver’s seat. As Chomsky describes his own approach, much of his work is what everyone else calls semantic; “still, I want to include all that as syntax” (1982a:114). The only aspects of meaning he has ever wanted to tackle are those that can be subsumed under (or, in some cases, redefined as) syntax.

但拉科夫却不是这样。他想让驾驶变得有意义。

Not so Lakoff. He wanted to put meaning behind the wheel.

但是，除了提出生成语义学这个标签，并提出几年后这个标签所带来的一些问题之外，用罗斯的话来说，拉科夫的论文“只适合历史美食家”。尽管几年后类似的模型会如野火般席卷该领域，但我们真的很难看出为什么拉科夫的提议会如此失败。这篇论文在某些地方非常有创意，这一点每个人都能看出来，但它也带有一种语气，一种傲慢的自信，乔姆斯基主义者习惯于在彼此反对布卢姆菲尔德主义者的论战中看到这种语气，但这并不是针对他们自己的内部提议。请记住，论文的前半部分是针对卡茨、福多尔和波斯特尔最近的创新。具体来说，Katz-Postal 原则要求具有相同含义的句子具有相同的深层结构，但 Lakoff 随意举出 1-3 之类的反例，其中 a 和 b 句子本质上都意味着相同的事情，但深层结构却截然不同。

But, aside from proposing the label, generative semantics, and raising some of the issues that engulfed that label several years later, Lakoff’s paper is, as Ross puts it, “only good for historical gourmets.” Nor, even though a similar model a few years later would sweep through the field like a brushfire, is it really very hard to see why Lakoff’s proposal fell so flat. The paper is very inventive in places, which everyone could surely see, but it also takes a tone, an arrogant confidence, that Chomskyans were used to seeing in one another’s polemics against the Bloomfieldians, but not directed at their own internal proposals. The first half of the paper, remember, is directed against Katz and Fodor and Postal’s recent innovations. In particular, the Katz-Postal principle requires that sentences with the same meaning have the same deep structure, but Lakoff casually adduces counter-examples like 1–3, where the a and b sentences all mean essentially the same thing, but the deep structures are quite different.

1

1

a我喜欢这本书。

a I like the book.

 

 

b 这本书令我很喜欢。

b The book pleases me.

2

2

a 我把那块粘土做成了一座雕像。

a I made that clay into a statue.

 

 

b 我用那粘土做了一个雕像。

b I made a statue out of that clay.

3

3

亚斯特泽姆斯基 (Yastrzemski) 将球击向左外场，打出一垒安打。

a Yastrzemski hit the ball to left field for a single.

 

 

b 亚斯特泽姆斯基 (Yastrzemski) 左外场一垒安打。

b Yastrzemski singled to left field.

这些都是Aspects理论的问题，但绝非无能为力；有相当清晰的解决方法，但 Lakoff 并未探索其中任何一个。他说 KatznFodorian 语义学在这里遇到了麻烦，并轻率地建议抛弃整个方法。论文的第二部分，也就是他提出替代方案的部分，对极其模糊的问题具有更大的确定性。例如，Lakoff 谈到了语义法则，以及将思想嵌入其他思想的规则，甚至形式化了一些思想。以这个规则为例，这个规则引入了主语、谓语和宾语——大概（虽然没有具体说明）取代了 Chomsky 标志性的 S → NP + VP 短语结构规则。

These are problems for the Aspects theory, all right, but hardly incapacitating ones; there are fairly clear ways around them, none of which Lakoff explores. He says KatznFodorian semantics run into trouble here, and blithely proposes tossing out the whole approach. And the second section of the paper, the one in which he offers his replacement, has an even larger quotient of certainty, about matters which are obscure in the extreme. Lakoff talks of semantic laws, for instance, and rules for embedding thoughts into other thoughts, and even formalizes a few thoughts. Take this rule as an example, the rule which introduces subjects, predicates, and objects—presumably (though this is not specified) replacing Chomsky’s iconic S → NP + VP phrase structure rule.

T代表思想，所以规则规定，每个思想都必须有一个语义谓词和一个语义主语，但不必有一个语义宾语。哦，还有思想是什么样子的？事实证明，它很像从深层结构底部垂下来的一束束特征；5 是将思想翻译成英文为“菠菜流行起来”；

The T stands for thought, so the rule says that every thought must have a semantic predicate and a semantic subject, but need not have a semantic object. Oh, and what does a thought look like? As it turns out, a great deal like the bundles of features hanging down from the bottoms of deep structures; 5 is the thought rendered into English as “Spinach became popular”;

5 的内容在这里并不是特别重要，只不过 Lakoff — — 聪明、大胆，并且比当时的任何人都更认真地对待生成模型的认知主张 — — 自信地谈论思想，将它们的表现形式写在纸上，而此时，Katz 和 Fodor 才刚刚开始探索用乔姆斯基的术语来说意义可能是什么样子，Katz 和 Postal 才刚刚开始阐明它们如何适应转换语法，Chomsky 才刚刚对深层结构进行最后的递归润色。

The content of 5 is not especially important here, just that Lakoff—brainy, full of chutzpah, and taking the cognitive claims of generative modeling far more seriously than anyone else at the time—is talking confidently about thoughts, plopping representations of them down on the page, when Katz and Fodor have just started to explore what meanings might look like in Chomskyan terms, Katz and Postal just starting to etch out how they might fit into a transformational grammar, Chomsky just putting the final recursive touches on deep structure.

莱考夫这篇充满推测性的论文的最后一部分是“一些未完成的事情”，这意味着语法织布机上的艰苦工作已经结束，只需将一些零散的线索重新编织到乔姆斯基理论（或者，随着这些进展，也许是拉科夫理论）的地毯上。这一部分揭示了莱考夫的很多方面，尤其是他倾向于以最宏大和最全面的眼光看待自己的工作，不断着眼于大局，但其他人并没有对他的案例产生同样的感动。乔姆斯基对此不以为然，贝弗和罗森鲍姆也是如此，罗斯和麦考利很快就忘了这件事，波斯特尔建议莱考夫抑制他的推测，并尝试帮助修改初期的Aspects模型，而不是完全放弃它。他确实这么做了，不久后便着手撰写博士论文《句法不规则性》（1970a [1965]），这篇论文不仅修改了体模型，而且在不破坏体模型的前提下将其延伸到了极限。6

The final section of Lakoff’s highly speculative paper is “Some Loose Ends,” implying that the hard work at the grammar loom was over and a few stray threads need only be woven back into the rug of Chomskyan—or, with these advances, perhaps Lakovian—theory. The section reveals much about Lakoff, particularly the tendency to view his own work in the most grandiose and comprehensive terms, to look constantly at the big picture, but no one else was similarly moved by his case. Chomsky saw little in it, Bever and Rosenbaum ditto, Ross and McCawley quickly forgot about it, and Postal suggested Lakoff curb his speculations and try to help revise the incipient Aspects model, rather than drop it altogether. He did just that, shortly setting to work on his dissertation, Irregularity in Syntax (1970a [1965]), which not only revises the Aspects model, but stretches it about as far as it could go without breaking.6

抽象语法

Abstract Syntax

随着我们研究的不断深入，我们必然会遇到一些无法再定义的原始词语，以及一些非常清晰的原则，以至于不再可能找到更清晰的定义。

As we proceed ever further with our investigations, we come of necessity to primitive words which can no longer be defined and to principles so clear that it is no longer possible to find others more clear for their definition.

布莱斯·帕斯卡

Blaise Pascal

乔治·莱考夫的博士论文是“对波斯特尔语法概念的探索”（Lakoff，1970a[1965]：xii），发表的标题读起来就像是对波斯特尔在转换建模中发现的问题的诊断。有太多不规则之处，这一诊断导致波斯特尔开始研究很快被称为抽象语法的研究方向。它有自己的标签，而且莱考夫谈到“波斯特尔语法概念”，这表明它被视为一个独立的流派，至少在某种程度上是这样，但没有人真正觉得这项工作与所有其他围绕Aspects 的狂热研究不一致。好吧，几乎没有人。主要Postal 的工作重点是将基础的复杂性降低到原始类别的公理最小值，这需要采取一些 Chomsky 显然认为不合适的举措（Newmeyer，1980a：93；1986a：82）。另一方面，Ross 和 Lakoff 认为这项工作非常合适，并开始扩充和阐述 Postal 的提议。

George Lakoff’s dissertation was “an exploration into Postal’s conception of grammar” (Lakoff, 1970a[1965]:xii), and the published title reads like a diagnosis of the problems Postal saw in transformational modeling. There was too much irregularity, a diagnosis that led Postal to embark on the line of research soon known, rather loosely, as abstract syntax. The fact that it had its own label, and that Lakoff talks of “Postal’s conception of grammar,” indicates it was perceived as a separate stream, at least in some measure, but no one really felt the work to be at odds with all the other feverish research surrounding Aspects. Well, almost no one. The main focus of Postal’s work was to reduce complexity in the base down to an axiomatic minimum of primitive categories, which entailed some moves Chomsky evidently found uncongenial (Newmeyer, 1980a:93; 1986a:82). Ross and Lakoff, on the other hand, found the work extremely congenial and began augmenting and elaborating Postal’s proposals.

但再次存在着划分的困难；特别是，这项工作何时变得与乔姆斯基格格不入这一点根本不明显。当然，这种划分是程度上的，围绕着一些技术提案展开，而不是种类上的。波斯特尔的研究论证或方向并没有发生重大变化。乔姆斯基的工作从一开始就趋向于越来越高的抽象，这种趋势在 60 年代初期随着触发词素和 Δ 节点的引入而获得了相当大的势头。7

But again there are difficulties of demarcation; in particular, it is not at all obvious when this work became uncongenial to Chomsky. Certainly the division was one of degree, organized around a few technical proposals, rather than one of kind. There was no sharp change in the argumentation or the direciton of Postal’s research. The trend in Chomskyan work from the outset was toward increasingly higher abstraction, a trend that gathered considerable momentum in the early sixties with the introduction of trigger morphemes and Δ-nodes.7

波斯特尔 (Postal) 着手解决早期理论中日益严重的一个问题，即该理论在一种贫乏的深层规律性概念下运作，导致类别无限制地激增。早期转换研究中的许多工作只是将各种各样的表面类别投射到底层表示上，即使筛选出一些类别，其类别数量仍然令人担忧；例如，利斯 (Lees) 的典范之作《英语名词化语法》 (Grammar of English Nominalizations ) 有数十个底层类别（例如 1968 [1960]:22–23），尽管它只涉及英语句法的一小部分，并使用转换的力量来减少表面类别，这导致沙赫特 (Schachter) 代表性地抱怨说，这种趋势“令人难以置信；事实上，每个词最终都会占据自己的子类别”（1962:137）。对于以简单性和普遍性为荣的方法来说，这种结果并不那么有吸引力。

Postal attacked a growing problem in the early theory, which, operating under an impoverished notion of what became known as deep regularities, witnessed an unconstrained mushrooming of categories. Much work in early transformational research simply projected the wide variety of surface categories onto the underlying representation, and even work that winnowed off some of those categories still had an alarming number of them; Lees’s exemplary Grammar of English Nominalizations, for instance, had dozens of underlying categories (e.g., 1968 [1960]:22–23), though it dealt with only one small corner of English syntax and used the power of transformations to reduce the surface categories, leading Schachter to complain, representatively, that the trend “was staggering to contemplate; it seems likely in fact, that each word would ultimately occupy a subcategory of its own” (1962:137). This consequence was less than appealing to an approach that prided itself on simplicity and generality.

波斯特尔致力于彻底减少这些类别。他在课堂、论文、座谈会以及 1964 年的语言研究所上都认为，形容词实际上是深层结构动词（Lakoff，1970a [1965]：115ff）；名词短语和介词短语源自相同的底层类别（Ross，1986 [1967]：124n9）；代词不是“真实的”，它们是表面语法过程的虚构（Postal，1966a）。所有这些都是乔姆斯基的良好实践，名义上的乔姆斯基本人也乐于使用此类论点。事实上，就在国际大会上发表句法描述变得更深的评论之前，乔姆斯基为astonishing和intriguing 等源自深层结构动词的形容词提供了这个示范性论点：

Postal became committed to the radical reduction of these categories. He argued in classes, papers, colloquia, and at the 1964 Linguistic Institute, that adjectives are really deep structure verbs (Lakoff, 1970a [1965]:115ff); that noun phrases and prepositional phrases derive from the same underlying category (Ross, 1986 [1967]:124n9); and that pronouns weren’t “real,” that they were a figment of superficial grammatical processes (Postal, 1966a). All of this is good Chomskyan practice, and the titular Chomskyan was happy to use such arguments himself. Just before his as-syntactic-description-becomes-deeper remark at the International Congress, in fact, Chomsky offered this exemplary argument for adjectives like astonishing and intriguing which arose from deep structure verbs:

转换语法提供的句子“这是一个有趣的计划”的结构描述将包含“该计划引起了某人（即未指明的人）的兴趣”背后的终端字符串，就像它包含过去时态词素一样；这个事实可能被认为是对所引用的语义特征的解释[它们与特定的人类反应有关]。”（1964d[1963]：51）

The structural description of the sentence “it was an intriguing plan,” as provided by a transformational grammar, will contain the terminal string underlying “the plan intrigued one (i.e., unspecified human)” just exactly as it contains the past tense morpheme; and this fact might be suggested as the explanation for the cited semantic feature [that they are connected with a specific human reaction].” (1964d [1963]:51)

然而，当波斯特尔开始追求这一目标，并且罗斯和莱考夫如此彻底和热情地加入他，以致于它成为一种计划时，乔姆斯基对它失去了兴趣。

As Postal began to pursue this course, though, and as Ross and Lakoff joined him so thoroughly and enthusiastically that it became something of a program, Chomsky lost his affection for it.

罗斯在这些还原论路线上最有效的工作是探索支持邮政未发表的提议的论据，以消除分类助动词和主要动词之间的区别（更准确地说，他通过将其转化为特征符号——Ross, 1969b [1967]）从原则上淡化了这种区别。他认为，助动词只是动词的一种，传统语法通常认为它们是这样，因此不需要像句法结构那样有自己的深层结构类别。这个提议可能引起了乔姆斯基的一些摩擦，因为它与乔姆斯基最著名的分析之一有明显不同。不管有没有摩擦，这个案例都很有说服力。罗斯是转换传统中最敏感的分析家之一，在当时，也是最致力于该原则的分析家之一。因此，虽然他的一些结论与句法结构相悖，但这些论点是乔姆斯基理性的典范。他提出的案例取决于乔姆斯基早期最重要的两个主题，自然性和简单性，以及转换的描述能力。罗斯指出，各种各样的变换一定以某种方式指代 6 中的复合体。

Ross’s most effective work along these reductionist lines was to explore arguments supporting an unpublished proposal by Postal to eliminate the categorical distinction between auxiliary verbs and main verbs (more accurately, he softened the distinction on principled grounds by translating it into feature notation—Ross, 1969b [1967]). Auxiliaries, he argued, were just a species of verb, as traditional grammar usually held them to be, and therefore didn’t need their own deep structure category, à la Syntactic Structures. The proposal may have been a source of some friction with Chomsky, since it departs markedly from one of his most celebrated analyses. Friction or not, the case is very persuasive. Ross is one of the most sensitive analysts in the transformational tradition and, at the time, one of the most dedicated to its tenets. So, while some of his conclusions are at odds with Syntactic Structures, the arguments are models of Chomskyan rationality. The case he offers depends on two of Chomsky’s most important early themes, naturalness and simplicity, and on the descriptive power of transformations. Ross points out that a wide range of transformations must somehow refer to the complex in 6.

具体来说，否定和疑问转换需要参考这个复合体，以解释像以下句子这样的数据。

In particular, negative and question transformations need to refer to this complex, to account for data like the following sentences.

7

7

小精灵买了一些鞋子。

a Pixie bought some shoes.

 

 

b Pixie 没有买一些鞋子。

b Pixie didn’t buy some shoes.

 

 

c Pixie 买了鞋子吗？

c Did Pixie buy some shoes?

8

8

小精灵买了一些鞋子。

a Pixie had bought some shoes.

 

 

b Pixie 没有买鞋子。

b Pixie hadn’t bought some shoes.

 

 

c Pixie 买鞋了吗？

c Had Pixie bought some shoes?

9

9

一个小精灵正在买鞋子。

a Pixie was buying some shoes.

 

 

b Pixie 没有买鞋子。

b Pixie wasn’t buying some shoes.

 

 

c Pixie 买了鞋子吗？

c Was Pixie buying some shoes?

转换必须表达的否定句的概括是，否定元素（n't）出现在时态之后，并且如果存在have或be则为它们之一。对于非语言学家来说，这个论点有点微妙，因为它需要保持几个抽象和几个转换的效果一致，并且因为它需要非常字面地理解顺序推导的概念，但请考虑最复杂的例子 7b。7b 的深层结构字符串是NEG Pixie PAST buy some shoes。第一个转换将NEG移到 PAST之后（即，时态词素之后），生成Pixie PAST NEG buy some shoes。现在开始执行一条称为Do -support的规则，为任何不紧接在动词之前的时态提供一些可保留的东西，然后词缀跳跃将时态和do连接在一起（产生did），经过收缩规则后，您得到 7b。另一方面，如果深层结构中有have或be，则 Do-support 不适用（因为时态（如Pixie PAST be NEG buy some shoes，9b 的深层结构字符串）后面紧跟着一个动词）。同样，问题转换将时态移到句子开头，如果存在 have或be ，则将have或 be 也移到句子开头（如 8c 和 9c）；如果没有have或be ，Do-support 会为时态提供一些支撑（如 7c）。

The generalization for negative sentences which the transformation must express is that the negative element (n’t) occurs after the Tense and either have or be, if either of them is present. The argument is a little subtle for nonlinguists, since it requires keeping several abstractions and the effects of several transformations straight, and since it requires taking the notion of a sequential derivation very literally, but consider the most complicated example, 7b. The deep structure string for 7b is NEG Pixie PAST buy some shoes. The first transformation moves the NEG to after the PAST (that is, after the tense morpheme), generating Pixie PAST NEG buy some shoes. A rule called Do-support now kicks in, giving any tense which doesn’t immediately precede a verb something to hang on to, then Affix-hopping joins the tense and the do together (producing did), and, after a contraction rule, you get 7b. On the other hand, if there is a have or a be in the deep structure, Do-support doesn’t apply (since the tense—as in Pixie PAST be NEG buy some shoes, the deep structure string for 9b—has a verb immediately following it). Similarly, the question transformation moves the tense to the beginning of the sentence, along with have or be, if either is present (as in 8c and 9c); Do-support gives the tense something to hang on to if there is no have or be (as in 7c).

在非语言学家看来，这一切似乎都是很多花哨和不必要的步骤，但这是描述英语使用者对否定和疑问句的一些知识的一种相当优雅的方式——时态和第一个助动词通常密切配合。然而，对罗斯来说，重要的一点是，这些规则需要引用的复合体相对于语法的其余部分看起来非常随意。就体貌模型而言，6 甚至不是一个成分。正如罗斯所说，引用 6 的规则对于体貌来说并不比引用 10 的规则更自然。8

All this frequently looks like a lot of fancy and unnecessary footwork to nonlinguists, but it is a quite elegant way to describe some of the knowledge English speakers have about negatives and questions—that the tense and the first auxiliary verb often work in close concert. The important point for Ross, however, is that the complex these rules need to refer to looks very arbitrary with relation to the rest of the grammar. In terms of the Aspects model, 6 is not even a constituent. As Ross puts it, a rule which refers to 6 is no more natural for Aspects than a rule which refers to 10.8

罗斯的建议（即所有相关规则都指代具有特征 [+ V, + AUX ] 的任何元素，罗斯将这些特征指定为have和be）比乔姆斯基早期的分析自然得多，并且明显简化了基础和转换部分。它比乔姆斯基的分析抽象得多，因为它依赖于词汇特征，并且需要进行一些调整才能指出句法结构分析与任意名词和两个完全不相关的词toast和and 之类的项目的集合一样荒谬，但罗斯的建议无疑属于 60 年代中期转换语法的范畴。事实上，它远没有Aspects 的大部分内容抽象。

Ross’s proposal (that all the rules in question refer to any element bearing the features [+ V, + AUX], which he assigns to have and be) is far more natural than Chomsky’s earlier analysis, and manifestly simplifies both the base and the transformational component. It is considerably more abstract than Chomsky’s analysis, since it depends on lexical features, and there is some nose-tweaking involved in pointing out that the Syntactic Structures analysis is as absurd as a collection of items like any arbitrary noun and the two otherwise completely unrelated words, toast and and, but certainly Ross’s proposal falls within the purview of mid-sixties transformational grammar. Indeed, it is far less abstract than much of Aspects.

罗斯的建议使基础和转换部分都变得更简单、更规则，但抽象语法工作的一个非常受欢迎的副产品是使深层结构（以及整个语法）更加透明地语义化。例如，罗斯的辅助论证包括以下类型的子程序。考虑 11a 和 llb。：

Ross’s suggestion made both the base and the transformational component simpler and more regular, but a very welcome by-product of work in abstract syntax was to make deep structure (and thereby the entire grammar) more transparently semantic. Ross’s auxiliary argument, for instance, included subroutines of the following sort. Consider 11a and llb.:

11

11

黛安娜不需要追逐鸭子。

a Dianna doesn’t need to chase the duck.

 

 

b 黛安娜不需要追鸭子。

b Dianna needn’t chase the duck.

在Aspects模型中，11a 和 11b 具有不同的深层结构（在 11a 中，need是主动词；在 11b 中，need 是助动词）。如果消除类别区别（就像 Ross 所做的那样），那么这两个（语义等同的）句子具有相同的深层结构。9

In the Aspects model, 11a and 11b have distinct deep structures (in 11a, need is a main verb; in 11b it is an auxiliary verb). If the category distinction is erased, as it is for Ross, then the two (semantically equivalent) sentences have the same deep structure.9

也就是说，Katz-Postal 假设几乎统治了抽象句法中的所有工作；事实上，综合理论将该假设与这种启发式方法配对，实际上是抽象句法的蓝图：

That is, the Katz-Postal hypothesis ruled virtually all of the work in abstract syntax; Integrated Theory, in fact, pairs the hypothesis with this heuristic, effectively a blueprint for abstract syntax:

给定一个需要进行句法推导的句子；寻找该句子的简单释义，这些释义不是同义表达的释义；找到这些释义后，构建语法规则，将原始句子及其释义关联起来，使得每个句子都具有相同的底层 P 标记序列。（Katz 和 Postal，1964：157）10

Given a sentence for which a syntactic derivation is needed; look for simple paraphrases of the sentence which are not paraphrases by virtue of synonymous expressions; on finding them, construct grammatical rules that relate the original sentence and its paraphrases in such a way that each of these sentences has the same sequence of underlying P-markers. (Katz and Postal, 1964:157)10

没有人比 Lakoff 更彻底、更敏锐地挖掘了这一启发式方法，他由 Postal 赞助的论文是一座抽象语法宝库。例如，他注意到英语中存在以下类型的词汇空白：

Nobody mined this heuristic more thoroughly, or more astutely, than Lakoff, and his Postal-sponsored thesis is an abstract syntax treasure trove. For instance, he noticed lexical gaps in English of the following sort:

12

12

巴特违反社区准则的行为令人震惊。

a Bart’s transgression of community standards is appalling.

 

 

b 巴特违反社区标准的行为令人震惊。

b That Bart is a transgressor against community standards is appalling.

 

 

c 巴特违反社区标准的行为令人震惊。

c That Bart transgressed community standards is appalling.

十三

13

巴特对丽莎的攻击性令人震惊。

a Bart’s aggression toward Lisa is appalling.

 

 

b 巴特对丽莎表现出侵略性真是令人震惊。

b That Bart is an aggressor toward Lisa is appalling.

 

 

c *巴特攻击丽莎的行为令人震惊。

c *That Bart aggressed Lisa is appalling.

现在，12a-c 构成了早期转换语法赖以生存的数据类型：存在一个清晰的模式，以 12c 为基础，很容易从转换的角度解释这三个句子中的句法和语义相似性（动词transgress将被名词化，根据结构上下文变为名词transgression或transgressor）。但是 13a 和 13b 被排除在外，因为Aspects无法提供共同的深层结构。Lakoff 提出了一个抽象动词AGGRESS，它随后成为 13a 和 13b 的缺失环节（他通过在词典中标记AGGRESS来强制触发名词化，从而阻止 13c“浮出水面”，从而过滤掉Aspects最佳传统中的坏句子——1970a [1965]：58–61）。

Now, 12a-c constitute the sort of data that early transformational grammar thrived on: there is a clear pattern, and taking 12c as basic made it easy to explain the syntactic and semantic parallels in all three sentences transformationally (the verb transgress would be nominalized, turned into either of the nouns transgression or transgressor depending on the structural context). But 13a and 13b were out in the cold, since Aspects couldn’t provide a common deep structure. Lakoff proposed an abstract verb, AGGRESS,which then served as the missing link for 13a and 13b (and he prevented 13c from “surfacing” by marking AGGRESSin the lexicon to obligatorily trigger nominalization, filtering off the bad sentence in the best Aspects tradition—1970a [1965]:58–61).

他在论文中最著名的抽象分析与这一解决方案有关——通过生成语义学中非常有成效的概念，抽象动词——并采用词汇分解的一般标签。Lakoff 注意到，像 14 中的句子是彼此的有效释义。

His most celebrated abstract analysis in the thesis is related to this solution—by way of a notion that came to be very productive in generative semantics, abstract verbs—and takes the general label, lexical decomposition. Lakoff noticed that sentences like those in 14 are effective paraphrases of each other.

14

14

马修杀死了转向架。

a Mathew killed the bogies.

 

 

b 马修导致转向架损坏。

b Mathew caused the bogies to die.

 

 

c 马修导致转向架失去作用。

c Mathew caused the bogies to become dead.

 

 

d 马修导致转向架失去生命。

d Mathew caused the bogies to become not alive.

拉科夫 (Lakoff) 提出了一系列强有力的论据来证明它们之间存在转换关系，即，这四个词都源自同一个深层结构 14d；或者更确切地说，它们都源自 14e（因为抽象动词是语义原语，而不是英语单词；因此用大写字母表示）：11

Lakoff adduced a number of strong arguments for a transformational relation holding between them—namely, that all four derive from the same deep structure, 14d; or, more properly, that all derive from 14e (since abstract verbs are semantic primitives, not English words; hence the uppercase letters):11

14

14

e Mathew过去导致转向架失去生命

e Mathew PAST CAUSE the bogies to BECOME NOT ALIVE

这些抽象分析的大多数论据都是句法的，至少在广义的Aspects句法意义上是如此 — —例如，kill的宾语和die的主语具有完全相同的选择限制（例如，它们都必须是 [+ alive]； bogies可以，rocks不可以）— — 但该案例最有说服力的部分显然来自于它对 Katz-Postal 原则的成功遵循。从相同的底层结构中得出kill和cause to die以及cause to become not alive是一个非常有吸引力的举动，因为正如 McCawley 在 Lakoff 论文的前言中指出的那样，这比将kill视为词汇原子“在语义上更透明”（Lakoff，1970a [1965]：i）。

Most of the arguments for these abstract analyses were syntactic, at least in the expansive Aspects sense of syntactic—that the object of kill and the subject of die, for instance, have exactly the same selectional restrictions (e.g., they both must be [+ alive]; bogies is okay, rocks is not)—but again the most persuasive component of the case clearly follows from its successful adherence to the Katz-Postal principle. Deriving kill and cause to die and cause to become not alive from the same underlying structure is a very appealing move because, as McCawley points out in the preface to Lakoff’s thesis, it is “more semantically transparent” (Lakoff, 1970a [1965]:i) than treating kill as a lexical atom.

乔姆斯基在 50 年代曾预言，“如果我们认真地把意义作为一个标准，我们的分析就会变得异常复杂”（1958:453），不难看出这些分析正是朝着这个方向发展。例如，想想词汇项目的分解，比如，只考虑致命的词汇，屠杀、绞刑和暗杀；保守地说，最后一个词汇项目应该是“以隐蔽的方式，由于政治原因导致 X 死亡，其中 X 相当重要”。或者看一个真实的例子 15b，这是 15a 的建议深层结构字符串（Fillmore，1972 [1969]:15）：12

Chomsky had predicted in the fifties that “if we should take meaning seriously as a criterion, our analyses would be wildly complex” (1958:453), and it doesn’t take much imagination to see that’s exactly where these sorts of analyses were heading. Think, for instance, of the decomposition of lexical items like, just sticking with fatal ones, slaughter, garotte, and assassinate; the last would have to be, conservatively, something on the order of CAUSE X TO BECOME NOT ALIVE FOR POLITICAL REASONS IN A COVERT MANNER, WHERE X IS REASONABLY IMPORTANT. Or take a look at a real example, 15b, a proposed deep structure string for 15a (Fillmore, 1972 [1969]:15):12

15

15

a 我给你另一本书了吗？

a Did I give you the other book?

 

 

b 有一组书你我都知道，该集合的基数是某个数字n，你我刚刚想到了一个包含n - 1 本这些书的子集，现在我请你注意剩下的第 n本书。有一段时间我拥有这本书，现在我请你告诉我，我过去是否做过什么事导致这本书在你手中。

b There is a set of books that both you and I know about and the cardinality of that set is some number n and you and I have just had in mind a subset containing n – 1 of those books and I am now calling your attention to the remaining nth book. There was a time when I had that book in my possession and I am now asking you to tell me whether I did anything in the past which would count as causing that book to be in your possession.

这些极其复杂的深层结构中最著名的是对 16 的分析，Ladoff 和 Ross 在他们的抽象句法讲座中经常使用这些结构，甚至登上了《纽约时报》 （Shenker, 1972）。方面会为这个句子分配一个与 PM-1 非常相似的深层结构，但 Ross 和 Lakoff 为它分配了一个与 PM-2 类似的底层结构（然而，这两棵树都有些省略）。十三

The most famous of these wildly complex deep structures, which Ladoff and Ross used frequently in their lectures on abstract syntax, and which even made The New York Times (Shenker, 1972), is their analysis of 16. Aspects would assign a deep structure to this sentence much like that of PM–1, but Ross and Lakoff assigned it an underlying structure like that of PM–2 (both trees, however, are somewhat elided).13

16 弗洛伊德打破了玻璃。

16 Floyd broke the glass.

值得注意的是，尽管 PM-2 看起来（并且一直被认为是）逻辑上的荒谬，从而削弱了产生它的理论，但它是两位非常优秀、非常敬业的语言学家的严肃提议。Lakoff 和 Ross 意识到它看起来相当愚蠢。Ross 在他的办公室里挂了一个从天花板到地板的移动装置（另一个笑话是将他们的圣诞树放在 Klee 的一幅画后面，作为现代艺术的最新进展——Pop，1970：123）。但他们只是忠实地遵循了Aspects模型和 Katz-Postal 原则的指示，并导致了其不可避免的后果；认真对待意义作为标准正是 Katz-Postal 原则的全部内容，而抽象语法分析不可避免地变得极其复杂。不过，在我们继续之前请注意，至少像 15b 和 PM-2 这样丑陋的东西，因为它们代表意义，所以在任何想要正确理解语义的语法中都是不可避免的。如果kill的含义中确实有很大一部分是“导致不活”，那么这个事实必须在某个地方处理——破碎和“导致不完整”也是如此——即使是在解释语义学中。无论Aspects模型中的语义表示是什么样子（在这项工作进行期间，它们仍未指定），它同样会让人倒胃口。意义是一个复杂的野兽。

It is important to note that PM–2—although it looks, and has been taken, to be a logical absurdity which vitiates the theory that spawned it—is the serious proposal of two very good, very dedicated linguists. Lakoff and Ross realized it looked pretty silly. Ross had a ceiling-to-floor mobile of it hanging in his office (another joke placed their tree just after a Klee painting as the latest advance in modern art—Pop, 1970:123). But they were just loyally following the dictates of the Aspects model and the Katz-Postal principle to their inevitable consequences; taking meaning seriously as a criterion is exactly what the Katz-Postal principle was all about, and wildly complex was unavoidably what the abstract syntax analyses became. Notice before we move on, though, that things at least as ugly as 15b and PM–2, since they represent meanings, are inevitable in any grammar which wants to get the semantics right. If indeed a significant part of the meaning of kill is “cause to become not alive,” that fact has to be treated somewhere—ditto for broken and “cause to become not whole”—even in interpretive semantics. Whatever a semantic representation in the Aspects model looked like (and they remained unspecified while this work went ahead), it would be similarly unappetizing. Meaning is a complicated beast.

还值得注意的是，安娜·维尔兹比卡 (Anna Wierzbicka) 曾在华沙跟随安德烈·博古斯拉夫斯基 (Andrzej Boguslawski) 学习语言学，安德烈·博古斯拉夫斯基是一位严肃的语义学家。就在这些复杂的树不断涌现的时候，她访问了麻省理工学院，对其中大部分工作的简单性感到有些好笑。她一直敦促生成语义学家们坚持他们的工作含义，并真正抽象化。

It’s also worth noting that Anna Wierzbicka, who had been studying linguistics in Warsaw with Andrzej Boguslawski, a serious semanticist if ever there was one, visited MIT just as these complicated trees were proliferating and was somewhat amused at how simpleminded much of the work was. She kept urging the brink-of-generative semanticists to follow through on the implications of their work and get really abstract.

然而，目前的重点比“弗洛伊德打破了玻璃杯”的适当语义表示要简单得多：许多乔姆斯基语言学家发现，围绕弗洛伊德树（PM-2）的论点在后体生成语法的背景下非常有吸引力，它成为了一种典范，是早期转换语法的被动分析的抽象语法等价物。

The important point for the moment, however, is much more straightforward than whatever the appropriate semantic representation of “Floyd broke the glass” might be: many Chomskyan linguists found the arguments surrounding the Floyd tree (PM–2) extremely appealing in the context of post-Aspects generative grammar, and it became something of an exemplar, the abstract syntax equivalent of early transformational grammar’s passive analysis.

逻辑

Logic

正如愚人与智者之间的区别一样，不懂逻辑的语法学家与精通逻辑的语法学家之间的区别也一样。

As the fool is to the wiseman, so is the grammarian ignorant of logic to one skilled in logic.

艾伯特·马格努斯

Albertus Magnus

再看一眼弗洛伊德树就会发现，波斯特尔的还原主义运动正在积聚大量力量——形容词被重新分析为深层动词，形容词短语在深层结构中消失，一些名词也是深层动词，介词和连词是深层动词，介词短语在深层结构中消失，时态是深层动词，量词是深层动词，冠词以转换方式出现，动词短语在深层结构中消失——抽象语法到达了一个方便的小核心深层类别：NPs、Vs 和 Ss。深层结构中有名词短语、动词和句子，其他每个类别都是以转换方式引入的。14

As another glance at the Floyd tree will show, Postal’s reductionist campaign was gathering a good deal of steam—adjectives were re-analyzed as deep verbs, adjective phrases disappeared at deep structure, some nouns were also deep verbs, prepositions and conjunctions were deep verbs, prepositional phrases dissolved at deep structure, tenses were deep verbs, quantifiers were deep verbs, articles arose transformationally, the verb phrase dissolved at deep structure—and abstract syntax arrived at a convenient little core of deep categories: NPs, Vs, and Ss. There were noun phrases, verbs, and sentences at deep structure and every other category was introduced transformationally.14

这个核心非常有吸引力，因为正如 McCawley 和 Lakoff 开始争论的那样，它与符号逻辑的原子类别非常接近：论证（≈ NP）、谓词（≈ V）和命题（≈ S）。此外：深层结构清单的减少意味着短语结构规则的相应减少，现在短语结构规则与逻辑的形成规则同样接近。此外：符号逻辑和转换语法的形式主义也很好地结合在一起。以 17 为例，这是符号逻辑中的一个简单语句。

This core was extremely attractive because, as McCawley and Lakoff began to argue, it was in very close alignment with the atomic categories of symbolic logic: arguments (≈ NP), predicates (≈ V), and propositions (≈ S). More: the reduction of the deep structure inventory meant a corresponding reduction of the phrase structure rules, which now fell into an equally close alignment with the formation rules of logic. More: the formalisms of symbolic logic and transformational grammar also fell nicely together. Take 17, a simple statement in symbolic logic.

17虐待(x, y) &男人(X) &鸭子(y)

17 ABUSE (x, y) & MAN(X) & DUCK (y)

ABUSE是一个二元谓词，因此它接受两个参数 x 和 y，MAN和DUCK是一元谓词，分别接受参数 x 和 y。整个命题的意思与句子 18 的意思基本相同（忽略时态和其他次要复杂因素）。

ABUSE is a two-place predicate that (therefore) takes two arguments, x and y, MAN and DUCK are one-place predicates taking, respectively, the arguments x and y. The whole proposition means, pretty much (ignoring tense and other minor complications), what the sentence 18 means.

18 这个男人虐待了鸭子。

18 The man abused the duck.

这两个实体 17 和 18 在许多重要方面相似，但在其他方面也非常不同。Lakoff 指出，这些差异实际上非常肤浅。因此，我们知道句子在短语结构术语中表示为带标签的树，如 PM-3。

These two entities, 17 and 18, are similar in many important respects, but they also look very different in others. Lakoff pointed out that the differences are actually pretty superficial. So, we know that sentences are represented in phrase structural terms as labeled trees, like PM–3.

但是，正如每个人都意识到的那样，存在一种替代的、完全等价的形式来表示组成结构，即标记括号，如 19：15

But, as everyone realized, there was an alternate and fully equivalent formalism for representing constituent structure, namely, labeled bracketing, like 19:15

19 ((男人) NP (辱骂(鸭子) NP ) VP ) S

19 ((the man)NP (abuse(the duck)NP)VP)S

这样说吧——17 和 19 都是括号字符串，而 19 等同于 PM–3——您可能可以像 Lakoff 和 McCawley 一样清楚地看到结局：使用树形式对 17 进行括号，您会得到像 PM–4 这样的短语标记。

Put this way—17 and 19 are both bracketed strings, and 19 is equivalent to PM–3—you can probably see the dénouement as clearly as Lakoff and McCawley did: use the tree formalism for the bracketing of 17 and you get a phrase marker like PM–4.

瞧：逻辑的形式主义和转换语法是等价的。在转换令人兴奋的后 Aspects时代，从 PM-4 到 PM-3 是一件小事。将 PM-4 定为深层结构，在语义清晰度方面具有巨大优势，这不仅对 McCawley 和 Lakoff 及其论证购买者有吸引力，而且是不可避免的。这种认识——深层结构与符号逻辑（传统的数学哲学意义语言）相吻合——令人振奋地证实了抽象语法正走在正确的轨道上。16

Voilà: the formalisms of logic and transformational grammar are equivalent. And in the transformationally heady post-Aspects days, getting from PM–4 to PM–3 was a trivial matter. Making PM–4 the deep structure, with its great advantage in semantic clarity, seemed not only attractive to McCawley and Lakoff and their argument-buyers, but inevitable. This realization—that deep structure coincided with symbolic logic, the traditional mathematico-philosophical language of meaning—was an exhilarating confirmation that abstract syntax was on exactly the right track.16

从某种意义上说，结果其实并不令人意外。句法范畴可以简化为符号逻辑的基元，这一发现确实是他们计划的必然高潮，但这种必然性已经到了平庸的地步。逻辑源于对单词和句子的观察（单词和句子都是logos的可能翻译），因此，它在致力于简化单词和句子范畴的方法中占据突出地位并不令人意外。抽象句法和符号逻辑的融合并不令人意外，也不应像许多人那样成为影响生成语义的转换体验。

In a sense, the result really shouldn’t have been much of a surprise. The finding that syntactic categories could be reduced to the primitives of symbolic logic is indeed the inevitable climax of their program, but it is inevitable to the point of banality. Logic was born out of observations of words and sentences (both word and sentence are possible translations of logos), so it is less than astonishing that it would come to figure prominently in an approach dedicated to reducing word and sentence categories. The convergence of abstract syntax and symbolic logic should not have been much of a surprise, should not have been, as it was for many, the conversion experience that effected generative semantics.

或许并非如此，但这就好比说，开普勒不应该为哥白尼太阳系与欧几里得的吻合度高于托勒密太阳系而欣喜若狂，或者说，整个理论物理学家学派不应该大肆宣扬弦理论的几何优点，或者，回到语言学，莫迪斯泰人不应该称赞他们的计划忠实于逻辑原理。

Perhaps not, but that’s the same as saying Kepler shouldn’t have been euphoric over the smoother fit of the Copernican solar system to Euclid than the Ptolemaic fit, or that a whole school of theoretical physicists shouldn’t currently be trumpeting the geometrical virtues of string theory, or, coming home to linguistics, that the Modistae should not have extolled their program for its fidelity to logical principles.

逻辑与语言学的关系几乎与几何与物理学的关系一样密切。两者都是形式科学，它们围绕各自的经验相关学科——理解语言和理解物质的科学——展开，它们经常在很长的唯我论时期内出现分歧，但总是会回归，并经常结出新的果实。正如人们所预料的那样，几何和逻辑对于更倾向于形式主义的科学家、理论家和模型建造者（而不是实地工作者和实验者）尤其引人注目，而倾向于形式主义的人往往会把这种关系颠倒过来。例如，霍金称宇宙学为“几何之舞”，爱德华·维滕说“弦理论在其最优秀的方面是，或者应该是一个新的分支几何学是“几何学的产物”（Davies and Brown，1988：95）。但几何学是为探索物理世界而设计的工具，是物理学的工具，“建立在机械实践的基础上……只是通用力学的一部分，它准确地提出并展示了测量的艺术”（Newton，1960 [1686]：xvii）。几何学是一种经验产物，是地球测量中汇编的观察的精华，因此它在组织和预测物质测量的理论中发挥了突出的作用，这并不奇怪。逻辑是一种经验产物，是单词和句子观察的精华，因此它在组织和预测语法的理论中发挥了突出的作用，这并不奇怪。但是，如果霍金和威滕对他们的工作与几何学的关系如此满意，那么拉科夫和麦考利也并不完全是卑鄙无耻之徒。

Logic is, in almost every way, to linguistics as geometry is to physics. Both are formal sciences which play in and around their respective empirical relatives—the sciences of understanding language and understanding matter—often diverging for long solipsistic periods, but always returning, and frequently bearing new fruit. Geometry and logic are especially compelling, as one would expect, for the more formally inclined scientists, for the theoreticians and model builders rather than the field workers and experimentalists, and the formally inclined often get the relation backwards. Hawking, for instance, calls cosmology “a dance of geometries” and Edward Witten says that “string theory at its finest is, or should be, a new branch of geometry” (Davies and Brown, 1988:95). But geometry is a tool devised for the exploration of the physical world, a tool of physics, “founded in mechanical practice and … nothing but that part of universal mechanics which accurately proposes and demonstrates the art of measuring” (Newton, 1960 [1686]:xvii). Geometry was an empirical product, the distillate of observations compiled in earth-measuring, so it is less than remarkable that it functions prominently in theories which organize and predict measurements of matter. Logic was an empirical product, the distillate of word and sentence observations, so it is less than remarkable that it came to function prominently in theories which organize and predict grammaticality. But if Hawking and Witten can be so pleased about the relation of their work to geometry, Lakoff and McCawley are not exactly in shabby company.

也就是说，几何和逻辑不仅仅是抽象和自主的探索工具。它们也是极其重要的验证工具，而与相关形式程序融合的经验程序完全有理由庆祝这种匹配，因为这有力地表明它走在了正确的轨道上。对于抽象句法学家来说，发现他们的合并理​​论“毕竟只是符号逻辑”，是一种极其解放的体验。

Geometry and logic, that is, are not just abstract and autonomous exploratory instruments. They are also extremely important confirmatory instruments, and an empirical program that converges with a related formal program is fully justified in celebrating that match as a strong indication it is on the right track. For the abstract syntacticians, the discovery that their coalescing theory was “just symbolic logic after all,” was an immensely liberating experience.

这本书的吸引力很大一部分在于，它再次体现了乔姆斯基博士的要求。从他的硕士论文开始，它就带有卡尔纳普《逻辑句法》（1937 [1934]；纽迈耶，1988a）的明显印记，从他厚重的《语言理论的逻辑结构》到《方面》（其中深层结构主体是“逻辑主体”），再到笛卡尔语言学（其中深层结构和逻辑形式是同义词），乔姆斯基在整个职业生涯中都在追求符号逻辑。17抽象句法学家认为是时候结束这段求爱了，他们担心这位好心的医生自己缺乏勇气，于是便替他求婚。

A large part of its appeal is that, once again, this work looked like just what Dr. Chomsky ordered. Right back to his M.A. thesis, which bears the unmistakable imprint of Carnap’s Logical Syntax (1937 [1934]; Newmeyer, 1988a), through his massive Logical Structure of Linguistic Theory, through Aspects, where the deep structure subject is “the logical subject,” up to Cartesian Linguistics, in which deep structure and logical form are synonyms—through his entire career, that is—Chomsky was courting symbolic logic.17 The abstract syntacticians thought it was time to end the courtship, and, fearing the good doctor lacked the courage to do it himself, proposed on his behalf.

除了深层结构的语义清晰性、与形式程序的趋同性、解决棘手句法问题的能力以及乔姆斯基程序的自然实现性之外，还有一个因素也极大地促进了符号逻辑对生成语义的吸引力。

There was one more factor—beyond the semantic clarity at deep structure, the convergence with a formal program, the ability to solve tricky syntactic problems, and the natural fulfillment of the Chomskyan program—which contributed enormously to the appeal of symbolic logic for generative semantics.

逻辑到底是什么，以及它如何描述人类获取、管理和延续知识的方式，这一点从未完全清楚，不同的逻辑学家或哲学家给出了不同的答案。但是“在每种观点下，逻辑都经常涉及思维的规律和运作方式”（Bain，1879.1:1），在最强烈的观点（例如保皇党的观点）中，逻辑被解释为思维的规律和运作方式。麦考利明确地采取了这一立场，与逻辑最强烈的表达之一保持一致，即布尔斯的早期逻辑著作《思维的规律》（McCawley，1976b [1968]:136）。简而言之，逻辑使抽象句法学家更接近他们早期的转化乳汁中吞下的心灵主义目标。

Exactly what logic is and what it says about the way humans acquire, manage, and perpetuate knowledge has never been entirely clear, different logicians or philosophers giving different answers.
