But “logic, under every view, involves frequent references to the laws and workings of the mind” (Bain, 1879.1:1), and, in the strongest views (like the Port-Royalists’, for instance), logic is construed as the laws and workings of the mind. McCawley explicitly took this position, aligning himself with one of its strongest expressions, Booles’s early logic book, The Laws of Thought (McCawley, 1976b [1968]:136). In short, logic brought the abstract syntacticians much closer to the mentalist goals which they had swallowed with their early transformational milk.

通用底座

The Universal Base

所有语言的潜在内容都是相同的。

The latent content of all languages is the same.

爱德华·萨丕尔

Edward Sapir

除了维生素 M、心灵主义之外，他们早期的转型乳汁还包括另一种必需的营养素，特别是在乔姆斯基将他的计划与传统语法、维生素 U、普遍性的目标进行了精彩的联系之后，在《方面》中，乔姆斯基将这种营养素与他的语法的一个特定模块，即基本组成部分联系起来：

Along with vitamin M, mentalism, their early transformational milk included another essential nutrient, especially after Chomsky’s tour de force linkage of his program to the goals of traditional grammar, vitamin U, universality, and in Aspects Chomsky associated this nutrient with one specific module of his grammar, the base component:

如果说基础的形式属性将为通用类别的特征提供框架，那么就假设基础的大部分结构是所有语言所共有的。这是一种传统观点的表述方式，其起源至少可以追溯到 [Port-Royal] Grammaire générale et raisonée。（1965 [1964]：117）

To say that the formal properties of the base will provide the framework for the characterization of universal categories is to assume that much of the structure of the base is common to all languages. This is a way of stating a traditional view, whose origins can … be traced back at least to the [Port-Royal] Grammaire générale et raisonée.(1965 [1964]:117)

在《笛卡尔语言学》中，他更强烈地补充道：“表达意义的深层结构是所有语言所共有的，因此人们声称，它是思维形式的简单反映”——1966a:35），毫不含糊地将深层结构和意义带入了心灵主义的普遍基础建议中，几乎提出了生成语义学。好吧，不是那么明确——有明显的“因此人们声称”——但早期的转型主义者也忽略了这种界限，乔姆斯基的建议引起了轰动。它迅速演变成大写的普遍基础假设——声称在某种深层层面上，所有语言都具有相同的生成机制——并成为抽象语法的唯一标志。莱考夫在他的论文（1970a [1965]：108–9）中认可了它，认为它是了解语言普遍维度的一种可能性，到 1967 年，在拉霍亚举行的一次会议上，他对此的热情明显增加（Bach，1968 [1967]：114nl2）。罗宾·莱考夫也在她的论文《抽象句法和拉丁语补语》中以同样充满希望的措辞认可了它，她在论文中清楚地阐述了它对体模型的影响：它将从根本上改变乔姆斯基提出的基本成分，将短语结构规则减少到只有很少的几个（1968：168）。乔姆斯基在体模型中的基本规则几乎只适用于英语语法的片段，莱考夫指出了一种通用方法，可以找到拉丁语和英语的基本规则。她表现出一些开始渗透到抽象句法中的分裂精神，认为这种改变是“一些更激进的转型主义者” (1968:168) 的产物，并将其与“更保守的转型语言学家（如乔姆斯基）” (1968:215n5) 相对立。埃蒙·巴赫 (1968 [1967]) 的贡献——一个有影响力的论点，即一些名词最好作为深层动词来分析——最充分地阐明了通用基础的最大希望取决于抽象句法程序，即找到词汇和短语类别的本质核心。

Somewhat more strongly, in Cartesian Linguistics, he added “the deep structure that expresses the meaning is common to all languages, so it is claimed, being a simple reflection of the forms of thought”—1966a:35), unambiguously bringing deep structure and meaning into the mentalist universal-base suggestion, all but proposing generative semantics. Well, alright, not so unambiguously—there is the telltale “so it is claimed”—but the early transformationalists overlooked the hedge too, and Chomsky’s suggestion caught fire. It rapidly evolved into the uppercase Universal Base Hypothesis—the claim that at some deep level all languages had the same set of generative mechanisms—and became identified exclusively with abstract syntax. Lakoff endorsed it in his thesis (1970a [1965]:108–9) as one possibility for getting at the universal dimensions of language, and by 1967, at a conference in La Jolla, his enthusiasm for it had increased markedly (Bach, 1968 [1967]:114nl2). Robin Lakoff also endorsed it in similarly hopeful terms in her thesis, Abstract Syntax and Latin Complementation, where she spells out its implications for the Aspects model clearly: it would radically alter Chomsky’s proposed base component, reducing the phrase structure rules to only a very few (1968:168). Chomsky’s base rules in Aspects are almost exclusively for fragments of English grammar and Lakoff points the way toward a common-denominator approach for finding base rules which can underlie both Latin and English. Betraying some of the schismatic spirit that had begun to infuse abstract syntax, she identifies this alteration with “some of the more radical transformationalists” (1968:168) and opposes it to “more conservative transformational linguists (such as Chomsky)” (1968:215n5). Emmon Bach’s (1968 [1967]) contribution—an influential argument that some nouns were better analyzed as deep verbs—spells out most fully that the best hope for a universal base depends on the abstract syntax program of finding the essential core of lexical and phrasal categories.

但与通用碱基假说最密切相关的两位人物是麦考利和罗斯。麦考利之所以重要，是因为尽管他不是该提议的主要推广者之一（实际上，他可能从未在文章中将通用和碱基这两个词联系在一起），但他撰写了一篇重要的论文，其中许多人都为通用碱基假说提供了强有力的支持。18罗斯之所以重要，是因为明确声称“碱基是生物先天的”似乎是他提出的（Lancelot 等人，1976 [1968]:258）；因为他反复使用这个假设来呼吁生成语义学（例如，在一篇针对认知心理学家—1974b:97）；还因为他对这一假设给出了最简洁、最著名的表述：

But the two figures most closely associated with the Universal Base Hypothesis are McCawley and Ross. McCawley is important because, although he was not one of the chief marketers of the proposal—may never, indeed, have conjoined the words universal and base in print—he wrote an important paper in which many found strong support for the Universal Base Hypothesis.18 Ross is important because the explicit claim “that the base is biologically innate” appears to have been his (Lancelot and others, 1976 [1968]:258); because of his recurrent use of the hypothesis as an appeal for generative semantics (for instance, in a paper directed at cognitive psychologists—1974b:97); and because he gave the hypothesis its most succinct, best known, formulation:

通用碱基假设

THE UNIVERSAL BASE HYPOTHESIS

所有语言的深层结构都是相同的，直到由同一节点直接控制的成分的排序为止。（Ross，1970b [1968]：260）

The deep structures of all languages are identical, up to the ordering of constituents immediately dominated by the same node. (Ross, 1970b [1968]:260)

罗斯的定义明确地表明了其含义：所有已知语言、所有未知语言、所有可能的人类语言中令人眼花缭乱的语言表达方式，都源自一套共同的基本规则，除了成分内部的排序差异（例如，在英语名词短语中形容词在名词之前，在法语名词短语中形容词在名词之后）之外，其他都源于一套共同的基本规则。事实上，罗斯和莱考夫对这一假设非常有信心，开始研究这样一套规则，这种信心具有感染力。这一主张最吸引人的地方在于它与美国语言学中不可救药的坏蛋形成了鲜明的对比：回想一下，布卢姆菲尔德的主要代表之一曾说过，“语言之间的差异是无限的，而且是不可预测的”（Joos，1957：96）。乔姆斯基主义者认为这种观点极其令人厌恶，并经常引用朱斯的名言作为思想混乱和非科学混乱的缩影。

Ross’s definition makes it inescapably clear what is being said: that the dizzying variety of linguistic expression in all known languages, in all unknown languages, in all possible human languages, derived from a common set of base rules, with the trivial exception of within-constituent ordering differences (acknowledging, for instance, that adjectives precede nouns in English noun phrases, follow them in French noun phrases). In fact, Ross and Lakoff were confident enough in the hypothesis to begin working on such a set of rules, and the confidence was infectious. Not the least of the attractions for this claim was its antithetical relation to the irredeemable Bad Guys of American linguistics: recall that one of the chief Bloomfieldians had said “languages could differ from each other without limit and in unpredictable ways” (Joos, 1957:96). The Chomskyans found this notion repugnant in the extreme, and regularly trotted out Joos’s quotation as the epitome of woolly-mindedness and unscientific confusion.

但是，具有典型科学讽刺意味的是，通用基础假设的推动力实际上很大程度上来自于主导 Joos 评论的天才——关注各种各样的语言。在第一个十年中，绝大多数转换生成研究都是针对英语的，而Aspects反映了这种重视。抽象句法学家在处理外来语言方面的经验当然不及 Bloomfield 派，但他们开始更加慎重地思考如何将生成原则应用于英语以外的领域。Postal 的论文是关于莫霍克语的，McCawley 的论文是关于日语的，Robin Lakoff 的论文是关于拉丁语的，Ross 的论文则涉及广泛的跨语言研究，他们中的大多数人在麻省理工学院师从 GH Mathews，后者教授了其影响深远的希达察语生成语法（1965 年）的部分内容。或许最重要的是，尽管他的工作的全面影响还需要几年时间，但约瑟夫·格林伯格刚刚出版了他的《语言普遍性类型学》第二版（1966），该书调查了许多相当多样化语言的形态和句法模式。19

But the Universal Base Hypothesis, in a typical scientific irony, actually got much of its drive from the genius that ruled Joos’s comment—attending to a wide variety of languages. The overwhelming majority of transformational-generative research in its first decade was on English, and Aspects reflects this emphasis. The abstract syntacticians were certainly not in the Bloomfieldians’ league in terms of experience with alien languages, but they began thinking more deliberately about taking generative principles beyond English. Postal’s thesis was on Mohawk, McCawley’s was on Japanese, Robin Lakoff’s on Latin, Ross’s was widely cross-linguistic, and most of them studied under G. H. Mathews at MIT, who taught portions of his influential generative grammar of Hidatsa (1965). Perhaps most importantly, though the full repercussions of his work were still several years off, Joseph Greenberg had just published the second edition of his typology of linguistic universals (1966), which surveyed the morphological and syntactic patterns of a great many, quite diverse languages.19

现在，由于《体》中勾勒出的基本成分依赖于英语，因此将其普遍化的尝试不可避免地导致了严重的变化。例如，《体》中包括形容词，但 Postal 对 Mohawk 的研究向他表明，并非所有语言都有一类单独的形容词，与动词不同，这直接导致了他的“形容词是深层动词”论证。《体》中包括 V + NP 形式的动词短语，但日语、拉丁语和希达察语无法轻易容纳这样的 VP；其他语言似乎根本没有 VP。《体》中包括助动词；并非所有语言都这样。《体》中包括介词；并非所有语言都这样。《体》中包括冠词；并非所有语言都这样。《体》中忽略了使役动词和起始动词（在抽象语法惯例中分别为CAUSE和BECOME ），它们在英语中通常是隐蔽的；在许多语言中，它们起着非常明显的作用。 （例如，在阿伊努语中有一个使役后缀-re。因此，arpa是“去”，arpare是“送（或，使去）”；e 是“吃”，而 ere是“喂食”。）Aspects 的基础采用了英语的基本顺序；格林伯格非常令人信服地证明了存在几种不同的基本顺序。

Now, since the base component sketched out in Aspects depended on English, attempts to universalize it inevitably led to serious changes. The Aspects base included adjectives, for instance, but Postal’s work on Mohawk had shown him that not all languages have a separate category of adjectives, distinct from verbs, leading directly to his adjectives-are-deep-verbs arguments. The Aspects base included a verb phrase of the form V + NP, but Japanese, Latin, and Hidatsa can’t easily accommodate such a VP; other languages seem to have no VP at all. The Aspects base included auxiliary verbs; not all languages do. The Aspects base included prepositions; not all languages do. The Aspects base included articles; not all languages do. The Aspects base ignores causatives and inchoatives (CAUSE and BECOME, respectively, in the conventions of abstract syntax), which are often covert in English; in many languages, they play very overt roles. (For instance, in Ainu there is a causative suffix, -re. So, arpa is “to go,” arpare is “to send (or, cause to go);” e is “to eat,” ere is “to feed.”) The Aspects base adopted the basic order of English; Greenberg demonstrated very convincingly that there were several distinct basic orders.

问题在于：抽象语法虽然遵循了乔姆斯基的一些一般性评论，但被迫拒绝或修改他的许多具体分析。

The rub, then: while following on some of Chomsky’s general comments, abstract syntax was forced to reject or modify many of his specific analyses.

哪里有摩擦，哪里就有摩擦。

Where there is a rub, there is friction.

过滤器和约束

Filters and Constraints

我们希望对可能的转换规则的形式施加尽可能多的限制。

We would like to put as many constraints as possible on the form of a possible transformational rule.

乔治·莱考夫

George Lakoff

抽象语法向语言字面表象之下的通用语法转变还有另一种反映：重点从特定现象和特定语言的规则转向一般的语法原则。20早期的转换语法痴迷于规则。其座右铭似乎是“发现一个现象，写一条规则；如果有时间，写两条”，而对现象的搜索严重偏向英语。再次，李斯的《语法》提供了最好的例证。这是一本简短的专著，重点关注英语这个繁杂大都市中的一个小社区，它提出了一百多种转换（同时在过程中经常指出需要许多其他规则，而李斯没有时间或没有权力去讨论这些规则），其中大多数都非常具体。例如，一些规则涉及特定的动词或形容词类，一些规则涉及单个单词或词素，一些规则涉及某些重音模式或连接类型，其中很多规则都有特殊的应用条件。以这对转换（规则 20 和 21）为例，它们处理两个特定的删除（Lees，1968 [1960]：103-4）：

The abstract syntax move toward a universal grammar underneath the literal skin of languages had another reflex: the shift in emphasis from phenomena-specific and language-particular rules to general grammatical principles.20 Early transformational grammar was rule-obsessed. The motto seemed to be, “Find a phenomenon, write a rule; write two, if you have time,” and the search for phenomena was heavily biased toward English. Once again, Lees’s Grammar provides the best illustration. A brief monograph, focusing on a small neighborhood in the rambling metropolis of English, it posits over a hundred transformations (while noting frequently along the way the need for many other rules that Lees doesn’t have the time or the mandate to get to), most of which are highly specific. Some rules refer, for instance, to particular verb or adjective classes, some to individual words or morphemes, some to certain stress patterns or juncture types, and a good many of them have special conditions of application attached to them. Take this pair of transformations (rules 20 and 21), which handle two specific deletions (Lees, 1968 [1960]:103–4):

20

20

Nom + X – Nom′ + Pron – Y ⇒ Nom + X + Y

Nom + X – Nom′ + Pron – Y ⇒ Nom + X + Y

 

 

[其中 Nom = Nom′，Nom 是复合句的主语，而 Nom' + Pron 位于该句子中的for短语不定式名词内]

[where Nom = Nom′, Nom is subject of a complex sentence, and Nom’ + Pron is inside a for-phrase Infinitival Nominal within that sentence]

 

 

[其中，that引入了事实名词，for和引入了不定式名词]

[where that introduces a Factive Nominal, for and to introduce Infinitival Nominals]

这些规则的作用目前并不是特别重要（不过一旦你了解了它们所嵌入的机制和假设，就不那么容易嘲笑它们了，）21但有一点我们确实需要注意：对于任何对一般语法原则感兴趣的人来说，这种分析是多么的混乱——从依赖于特定英语单词的存在的规则转变为所有语言的原则是多么的棘手——而抽象语法的决定性举措是走向一般语法原则。

What these rules are up to isn’t particularly important at the moment (though it’s not nearly so easy to make fun of them once you gain an appreciation of the sort of machinery and assumptions in which they are embedded,)21 but there is one point we do need to notice: how incredibly mucky these sort of analyses are for anyone interested in general grammatical principles—how sticky it is to move from a rule that depends on the presence of specific English words to a principle holding of all languages—and the defining move of abstract syntax was toward general grammatical principles.

以原则为导向的语法方法显然无法实现具有如 20 和 21 这样详细变换的令人信服的普遍语法。事实上，“Postal 的语法概念”的公理之一是“变换不得提及个别词汇项目”（Lakoff，1970a [1965]：xii），例如，对于，这个公理在 Ross 对辅助系统的平滑处理中很容易看出。Ross 谴责使用诸如have、be和toast之类的个别词汇项目，他为其分析所引用的核心优点是，它允许将几种变换概括为指代自然类别的项目，而不是看似任意的单词列表。指代具有 [+ 动词，+ 助动词] 特征的一类项目的转换比指代集合{have, be}之类的项目类别的转换更可能在通用语法中找到工作。同样，Lakoff 对AGGRESS之类的假设动词的使用使名词化转换的应用范围更广 — 不要被英语拼写（一种助记惯例）所欺骗。假设动词是抽象的含义，纯粹而简单，没有音系结构，不是特定于语言的词。

A principle-oriented approach to grammar was clearly not going to achieve a very convincing universal grammar with transformations as detailed as 20 and 21. In fact, one of the axioms of “Postal’s conception of grammar” was that “transformations may not mention individual lexical items” (Lakoff, 1970a [1965]:xii) like that and for, an axiom easy to see at work in Ross’s smoothing out of the auxiliary system, for instance. Ross indicts the use of individual lexical items like have and be and toast, and the central virtue he cites in favor of his analysis is that it permits the generalizing of several transformations to refer to a natural class of items rather than to a seemingly arbitrary list of words. A transformation that refers to a class of items with the features [+ verb, + auxiliary] has a much better chance of getting a job in a universal grammar than a transformation that refers to a class of items like the set {have, be}. Similarly, Lakoff’s use of hypothetical verbs like AGGRESS allowed nominalizing transformations to apply more widely—and don’t be fooled by the English spelling, a mnemonic convention. Hypothetical verbs were abstract meanings, pure and simple, with no phonological structure, not language-specific words.

关于一般转换原则的第一部真正重要的著作是乔姆斯基的著作，这并不令人意外。在国际大会演讲中，他提出了对移动规则的限制，以帮助说明解释的充分性。乔姆斯基曾谈到布卢姆菲尔德的描述性要求，称描述语言只是语言之战的一部分，而且是最不有趣的部分，人们可以用无数具体规则（如 20 和 21）来描述语言。语言学的艰难工作在于解释语言，用乔姆斯基的话来说，解释语言涉及限制转换的力量。做到这一点的一种方法是命令，例如 Postal 规定转换不能指代单个单词，以及当时更著名的规定，即转换只能删除“可恢复”的成分，22还有一个更著名的观点，即变换不能改变意义。所有这些都来自形式上的考虑。某些规定（例如，在另一个领域，“平行线不能相交”）只是让系统更好地工作。但另一种方法是通过实证调查：寻找变换根据其定义可以做但似乎没有做的活动。

The first truly important work on general transformational principles was—no surprise here—Chomsky’s. In his International Congress talk, he proposed a constraint on movement rules to help illustrate explanatory adequacy. Describing languages, Chomsky had said of the Bloomfieldian descriptive mandate, is only part of the linguistic battle, the least interesting part at that, and one can describe languages with myriad specific rules like 20 and 21. The tough linguistic work was in explaining Language, and explaining Language, in Chomsky’s terms, involved curbing the power of transformations. One way to do this was by fiat, such as Postal’s stipulation that transformations couldn’t refer to individual words, and a more famous stipulation from the period, that transformations could only delete “recoverable” constituents,22 and a more famous one yet, that transformations couldn’t change meaning. All of these came from formal considerations. Certain stipulations (like, in another arena, “parallel lines cannot meet”), just made the system work better. But another way was by empirical investigation: look for activities that transformations can do, by virtue of their definition, but which they don’t appear to do.

例如，变换可以轻松地将任何成分移动到句子中的任何位置，因此乔姆斯基寻找似乎尚未被利用的移动可能性。

Transformations can easily move any constituent anywhere in a sentence, for instance, so Chomsky looked for movement possibilities that don’t seem to be exploited.

乔姆斯基在国际大会上提出的约束（后来被罗斯称为A-over-A 原则）是一个关于转换似乎无法做到的事情的尝试性建议——将成分从特定位置移动23 —因此，在通用语法中应该将其作为一项禁令内置。这个理由可能看起来很奇怪：如果转换不产生 X，为什么 X 需要被禁止？答案与非常重要的描述能力概念有关。转换是非常强大的描述手段。它们可用于描述几乎任何可以想象的符号序列，包括许多从未出现在人类语言中的序列。假设语言类似于整数系统；如果是这样，那么转换语法将是一种能够描述有理数的理论。你有一个包含分数的理论来描述一个不包含分数的系统。并且这里涉及的不仅仅是经济问题。如果儿童在成为语言使用者时掌握的是转换语法，如果乔姆斯基的刺​​激贫乏论证成立，那么就必须有一些内在的指导方针来指导习得过程并限制语法。必须有一些遗传原则来确保儿童最终掌握的特定语法是描述人类语言的语法：它只描述整数，这样儿童就不会开始说出分数。“无论转换还能做什么，它们都不能将成分移出 A-over-A 公式指定的位置”这一原则限制了语法的描述能力——它排除了分数——因此，支持该语法的理论更有机会解释语言习得。

The constraint Chomsky proposed at the International Congress (later called the A-over-A-principle by Ross) was a tentative suggestion about something transformations don’t seem to do—move constituents from certain locations23—and, therefore, something that should be built-in as a prohibition in universal grammar. The reasoning may look peculiar: if transformations don’t do X, why does X need to be prohibited? The answer has to do with the very important notion of descriptive power. Transformations are extremely powerful descriptive devices. They can be used to describe virtually any conceivable sequence of symbols, including a lot of sequences that never show up in human languages. Let’s say that languages are analogous to the system of whole numbers; if so, then transformational grammar would be a theory capable of describing the rational numbers. You have a theory which includes fractions describing a system which doesn’t contain fractions. And there is more at stake here than economy. If a transformational grammar is what children acquire when they become language-users, and if Chomsky’s poverty of stimulus argument goes through, there have to be some innate guidelines that direct the acquisition process and restrict the grammar. There have to be some genetic principles which ensure the specific grammar a child ends up with is one that describes a human language: that it describes only whole numbers, so that the child does not begin spouting fractions. A principle that says “whatever else transformations can do, they can’t move constituents out of the location specified by the A-over-A formula” restricts the descriptive power of the grammar—it excludes fractions—and therefore gives the theory housing that grammar a better shot at explaining language acquisition.

不幸的是，A-over-A 原则失败了。当乔姆斯基发现该原则在某些情况下做出了错误的预测时，他——迅速、安静且不情愿地——放弃了它，并加上了一句预言性和充满希望的话：“关于这个问题，肯定还有很多话要说”（1964c[1963]:74n16a；1964d[1963]:46n10）。说这句话的人是罗斯。

Unfortunately, the A-over-A principle was a bust. When Chomsky discovered that it made the wrong predictions in certain cases, he—quickly, quietly, and reluctantly—dropped it, adding a prophetic and hopeful “there is certainly much more to be said about this matter” (1964c[1963]:74n16a; 1964d [1963]:46n10). The one who said it was Ross.

事实上，正是对语法一般原则的关注，使得罗斯的论文（在乔姆斯基的指导下）成为语法理论的里程碑。罗斯以六十年代中期麻省理工学院社区中罕见的谨慎和谦虚，以当时转换语法中同样罕见的跨语言敏感性，以及对句法工作中前所未有的抽象普遍性的关注，对乔姆斯基的 A-over-A 原则的主题进行了一系列非凡的变奏，提出了他的句法岛理论。他对岛屿的定义非常抽象，但用比喻来说，它们的长处和短处就是某些成分被水包围，而转换不能游泳。因此，例如，22a 很好（来自 22b），但 *23a 不可以，因为转换不能将成分从“复杂名词短语”岛上移开； 24a 很好（来自 24b），但 *25a 不好，因为转换不能将成分从“并列结构”岛上移开；而 *26a 不好，因为转换不能将成分从“句子主语”岛上移开（没有语法等价物，但请注意 26b 和 26c 实际上是同一类型的深层结构字符串，并且短语结构规则必须生成 26c 才能获得像 26d 这样的语法句子）。

It is the concern with general principles of grammar, in fact, that makes Ross’s (Chomsky-supervised) thesis such a landmark in grammatical theory. With a cautiousness and modesty uncommon to the mid-sixties MIT community, with a cross-linguistic sensitivity equally uncommon to transformational grammar of the period, with an eye for abstract universals unprecedented in syntactic work, Ross plays a remarkable sequence of variations on the theme of Chomsky’s A-over-A principle, coming up with his theory of syntactic islands. His definition of islands is quite abstract, but the metaphorical long and short of them is that certain constituents are surrounded by water, and transformations can’t swim. So, for instance, 22a is fine (from 22b), but *23a isn’t, because transformations can’t move constituents off a “complex noun phrase” island; 24a is fine (from 24b), but *25a isn’t, because transformations can’t move constituents off a “coordinate structure” island; and *26a is bad because transformations can’t move constituents off a “sentential subject” island (there is no grammatical equivalent, but notice that 26b and 26c are effectively the same type of deep structure string, and that the phrase structure rules have to generate 26c in order to get grammatical sentences like 26d).

22

22

a 您认为巴德剥了哪种土豆皮？

a Which spud do you believe Bud peeled?

 

 

你相信巴德剥了哪个土豆

b you believe Bud peeled which spud

23

23

*你相信巴德剥了哪个土豆的说法

a *which spud do you believe the claim that Bud peeled

 

 

你相信巴德剥了哪个土豆的说法吗

b you believe the claim that Bud peeled which spud

 

 

[ “巴德剥了哪个土豆”这个说法是一个复杂名词短语]

[where the claim that Bud peeled which spud is a complex noun phrase]

24

24

a 巴德吃的什么？

a What was Bud eating?

 

 

b 巴德吃什么

b Bud was eating what

二十五

25

*Bud 吃土豆时

a *what was Bud eating spuds and

 

 

b 巴德正在吃土豆，什么

b Bud was eating spuds and what

 

 

[土豆在哪里以及什么是并列结构]

[where spuds and what is a coordinate structure]

二十六

26

*Bud 会吃什么很可能

a *what that Bud will eat is likely

 

 

b 巴德会吃什么可能

b that Bud will eat what is likely

 

 

[花蕾会在哪里吃什么是句子主语]

[where that Bud will eat what is a sentential subject]

 

 

c Bud 吃土豆是可能的

c that Bud will eat spuds is likely

 

 

d 巴德吃土豆是很有可能的。

d That Bud will eat spuds is likely.

罗斯提出他的句法岛理论是指导语言习得的先天机制的一个组成部分，他的工作比当时的类似工作高出一筹。但其他抽象句法学家也在探索类似的限制。特别是，波斯特尔制定了他的交叉原则（1971a [1968]），之所以这样命名，是因为它禁止名词短语以“跨越”另一个具有相同现实世界指称的名词短语的方式进行转换移动，以解释许多语法事实。因此，例如，27a 很好，但 *27b 和 *27c 是不好的，因为当规则被动移动它们时，杰夫和他自己会相互交叉；28a 很好，但 *28b 和 *28c 是不好的，因为杰夫和他自己根据规则艰难移动相互交叉。

Ross suggested his syntactic-island theory as an integral part of the innate mechanism guiding language acquisition, and his work is volcano-and-palm-trees above similar efforts at the time. But other abstract syntacticians were exploring similar restrictions. In particular, Postal worked out his Crossover principle (1971a [1968]), so-named because it prohibited the transformational movement of a noun phrase in a way that “crosses over” another noun phrase which has the same realworld referent, in order to explain a number of grammaticality facts. So, for instance, 27a is fine, but *27b and *27c are bad because Jeff and himself cross over one another when the rule Passive moves them; 28a is fine, but *28b and *28c are bad because Jeff and himself cross over one another by the rule Tough-movement.

二十七

27

杰夫给自己刮了胡子。

a Jeff shaved himself.

 

 

b *Jeff 自己刮胡子

b *Jeff was shaved by himself

 

 

c *他自己被 Jeff 剃了毛

c *himself was shaved by Jeff

二十八

28

a 对于杰夫来说，给自己刮胡子很困难。

a It is tough for Jeff to shave himself.

 

 

b *杰夫剃须很困难

b *Jeff is tough for himself to shave

 

 

c *Jeff 自己很难刮胡子

c *himself is tough Jeff for to shave

从图形上看这一过程（图 5.1），示例 A 中的交叉并不违反 Postal 原则，因为Jeff和A​​ndrew拥有不同的现实世界指称。示例 B 中的交叉（对应于 27b 和 27c）确实违反了该原则，因为Jeff和他自己拥有相同的现实世界指称，因此是被禁止的。

Considering the process graphically (figure 5.1), the crossover in example A does not violate Postal’s principle, since Jeff and Andrew have different real-world referents. The crossover in example B, which corresponds to 27b and 27c, does violate the principle, since Jeff and himself have the same real-world referents, and is therefore prohibited.

同样，波斯特尔原则的吸引人之处在于它允许对单个规则进行更一般化的表述：与被动和强硬移动（事实上还有其他几条规则）的单个条件不同，可以一次陈述一个适用于所有移动规则的单一条件，并且转换本身变得更加一般化。更重要的是——对于乔姆斯基的提议、罗斯的理论和波斯特尔原则而言——李斯的作品所说明的那种规则特定条件恰好错过了语言的一些关键之处。将一堆相同条件的单个陈述附加到一堆不同规则的底部，使一切看起来都是巧合。它使语法变成了一个规则列表，就像一个长长的哺乳动物目录，每个条目后面都包括“这个会哺乳”。让生物学家高兴的是包含哺乳的哺乳动物理论；让转换语法学家高兴的是包含它们不能应用的总体说明的移动规则理论。

Again, the attractive element of Postal’s principle is that it allows much more general formulations of the individual rules: rather than individual conditions on Passive and Tough-movement (and, in fact, several other rules), a single condition holding true of all movement rules can be stated once, and the transformations themselves become much more general. More importantly—for Chomsky’s proposal, for Ross’s theory, for Postal’s principle—rule-specific conditions of the sort illustrated by Lees’s work just missed something critical about language. A bunch of individual statements of the same condition tacked onto the bottoms of a bunch of distinct rules makes everything look coincidental. It makes the grammar into a list of rules just like a long catalog of mammals which includes, after each entry, “this one lactates.” What makes biologists happy is a theory of mammals that includes lactation; what makes transformational grammarians happy is a theory of movement rules that includes an overarching account of where they can’t apply.

图 5.1.邮政交叉原则的图示。

Figure 5.1. Illustrations of Postal’s Crossover principle.

可以从另一个角度来看待这些提议，即执行乔姆斯基在Aspects中称为过滤的功能。在那份遗嘱中，乔姆斯基曾说过，除了描述符合语法的句子的常规工作外，转换还具有清除基本组件错误生成的结构、过滤掉语法上无法实现的深层结构的作用。过滤的概念可能很难理解，但Aspects 的基本组件生成了像 29a 和 29b 这样的结构：

There is another way of looking at these proposals, as performing the function Chomsky called filtering in Aspects. In that testament, Chomsky had said that transformations, in addition to their regular job describing grammatical sentences, also had the job of weeding out structures that the base component erroneously generated, of filtering off deep structures that couldn’t achieve grammatically. The notion of filtering can be tough to grasp, but the Aspects base component generated structures like 29a and 29b:

二十九

29

一只猫 猫追着狗 睡了个午觉

a the cat the cat chased the dog had a nap

 

 

b 猫被袋鼠追赶，狗睡了个午觉

b the cat the kangaroo chased the dog had a nap

由于这些结构来自基本成分，它们必须通过转换成分，而转换成分对 29a 没有任何问题。相对化的转换规则将第二次出现的the cat更改为关系代词which，从而产生一个包含关系从句which chased the dog 的语法句子，29c。

Since these structures come from the base component, they have to pass through the transformational component, which has no trouble with 29a. A transformational rule of Relativization changes the second occurrence of the cat into the relative pronoun which, yielding a grammatical sentence containing the relative clause which chased the dog, 29c.

二十九

29

c 追狗的猫睡了个午觉。

c The cat which chased the dog had a nap.

29b 则不然。相对化需要两个相同的名词短语：它在 29b 中找不到它们，因此无法应用并过滤掉有问题的结构。

Not so with 29b. Relativization requires two identical noun phrases: it doesn’t find them in 29b, so it can’t apply and filters the offending structure off.

岛屿约束和交叉原则的作用完全相同，但更明确。从这个角度来看，移动规则可以做任何它们想做的事情，但如果它们从岛屿上取下某些东西或交叉相同指称名词短语，罗斯和邮政的条件会通过宣布任何违规行为都是不合语法的来过滤掉混乱。

The island constraints and the Crossover principle do exactly the same job, but more explicitly. Movement rules could do whatever they wanted, in this view, but if they pulled something off an island or crossed-over same-referential noun phrases, Ross and Postal’s conditions would filter off the mess by declaring any violation to be ungrammatical.

过滤是后体研究的一个重要方向，它超越了运动限制。Lakoff 的论文是这方面的第一次重要调查，提出了一种例外理论，将部分过滤工作交给了词典。他担心 30a 和 *30b 这样的情形，在这种情况下，原本正常的及物动词拒绝做正常的、充满活力的及物动词通常会做的事情，即被动。

Filtering was an important line of post-Aspects research which went beyond movement constraints. Lakoff’s thesis was the first significant investigation here, proposing a theory of exceptions that gave some of the filtering work over to the lexicon. He was worried about situations like 30a and *30b, where an otherwise normal transitive verb refuses to do what normal, red-blooded transitive verbs usually do, undergo Passive.

三十

30

Jan 和 Mick 很像。

a Jan resembles Mick.

 

 

b *Mick 与 Jan 很像。

b *Mick is resembled by Jan.

回想一下，Lakoff通过标记AGGRESS必须进行名词化来阻止其作为动词出现在表层（将其过滤掉）。好吧，这只是一个更普遍的解决方案的一小部分，在这个解决方案中，他开发了一个规则特征系统——改编了 Chomsky 和 ​​Halle 当时仍处于地下状态的音系学巨著《英语的声音模式》（1968 年）中的一项提议——允许词汇项目“控制”转换的应用。实际上，AGGRESS 在词典中标记为[+名词化]，类似标记为[—被动]，允许好的句子按其应有的方式通过转换成分，但过滤掉坏的句子。24 Lakoff 的规则特征比 Lees 提出的条件更通用，但它们仍然是特定于语言的，与诸如相似之类的单个英语单词相关联，因此并不特别有吸引力。不过，它们的重要优势在于它们有助于使转换更加通用。

Recall that Lakoff kept AGGRESS from showing up in the surface as a verb (filtered it off) by marking it to obligatorily undergo Nominalization. Well, that was only a small part of a more general solution in which he developed a system of rule features—adapting a proposal from Chomsky and Halle’s at-the-time-still-underground phonological tome, The Sound Pattern of English (1968)—which permitted lexical items to “govern” the application of transformations. In effect, AGGRESS is marked [+Nominalization] in the lexicon, resemble is marked [—Passive], allowing the good sentences to make it through the transformational component just as they should, but filtering off the bad ones.24 Lakoff’s rule features were more general than the sort of conditions Lees proposed, but they were still language specific, tied to individual English words like resemble, and for that reason not especially attractive. Their important advantage, though, is that they helped to make the transformations more general.

另一个值得一提的发展是罗斯和波斯特尔的学生戴维·珀尔马特 (David Perlmutter)，他的 (是的，乔姆斯基指导的) 论文探讨了句法中的深层和表层结构约束(1971 [1968])。标题基本解释了珀尔马特在做什么——研究在英语中，在派生两端运行过滤器的必要性。这些过滤器有自己的名字，即输出条件，并且由于它们是语言特定的，因此人们对它们持一种宽容的厌恶态度，这是一种必要之恶，与拉科夫的例外完全相同。珀尔马特是一位抽象句法学家，他与生成语义学并驾齐驱，从未搭上生成语义学的顺风车，但他的输出条件对所有生成语义学家都认可的超转换机制的普遍发展做出了重大贡献。一些生成语义学家提出了他们自己的输出条件，包括罗斯（显然他给了这些条件的名字——1970a [1967]、1986 [1967]、1972a）和拉科夫（1968a）。

One other development bears mention, by a student of Ross and Postal, David Perlmutter, whose (yes, Chomsky-supervised) thesis explored Deep and Surface Structure Constraints in Syntax (1971 [1968]). The title explains pretty much what Perlmutter was up to—investigating the need for filters operating at either end of a derivation, in English. These filters had their own name, output conditions, and since they were language specific they were viewed with a tolerant distaste, a necessary evil of exactly the same type as Lakoff’s exceptions. Perlmutter was an abstract syntactician who trotted alongside without ever hopping aboard the generative semantics bandwagon, but his output conditions contributed significantly to the general growth of extra-transformational mechanisms which all generative semanticists endorsed. Several generative semanticists proposed output conditions of their own, including Ross (who apparently gave them their name—1970a [1967], 1986 [1967], 1972a) and Lakoff (1968a).

表演分析

The Performative Analysis

“我愿意（即娶这位女士为我的合法妻子）”——在婚礼过程中说出。

“I do (sc. take this woman to be my lawful wedded wife)”—as uttered in the course of the marriage ceremony.

“我将这艘船命名为伊丽莎白女王号”——这是他在用瓶子砸向瓶脚时说出的话。

“I name this ship the Queen Elizabeth”—as uttered when smashing the bottle against the stem.

“我将我的手表赠予我的兄弟”——就像根据遗嘱一样。

“I give and bequeath my watch to my brother”—as according to a will.

“我跟你赌六便士，明天会下雨。”

“I bet you sixpence it will rain tomorrow.”

JL Austin 引用的例子

examples cited by J. L. Austin

抽象语法在很大程度上是为了扩大Aspects模型的范围，其中一部分确实符合标签，并且专注于语法（特别是类别减少研究和过滤与约束研究）。抽象语法中大多数其他发展的背后，就像大多数导致Aspects理论的发展背后一样，是意义。这一点在与 Ross 密切相关的另一项发展中表现得最为明显，即表演分析。

Abstract syntax was, in large part, an effort to increase the scope of the Aspects model, and some of it was true to the label and focused exclusively on syntax (in particular, the category reduction research and the filters-and-constraint research). In back of most other developments in abstract syntax, just as it was in back of most developments leading up to the Aspects theory, was meaning. Nowhere is this clearer than in another development closely associated with Ross, the performative analysis.

20 世纪 50 年代和 60 年代，语言学家才刚刚开始放弃鸵鸟游戏，而哲学家们却一直对意义保持着浓厚的兴趣。因此，当语言学家从沙子中抬起头来时，他们看到了一些已经探索了一段时间的人。其中一组探索者是逻辑学家，而莱考夫和麦考利则在他们身后观察着。另一组人是普通语言哲学流派的成员，这引起了罗斯的兴趣，他开始吸收其中的一些见解。

Linguists were just beginning to quit their game of ostrich with meaning in the fifties and sixties, but philosophers had maintained a very strong interest in meaning all along. So, when linguists pulled their heads out of the sand, they saw a few others who had been exploring the terrain awhile. One group of explorers were logicians, and Lakoff and McCawley looked over their shoulders. Another group, members of a school called ordinary language philosophy, intrigued Ross, and he began importing some of its insights.

这些见解至少可以追溯到希腊诡辩家。当希腊人开始研究句子而不是仅仅研究声音和单词时，他们首先注意到的事情之一是，句子有不同的类型——断言、问题、命令等等——而普罗泰戈拉被认为是第一个对句子功能进行分类的人。但在随后的几千年里，很少有研究超越识别这些类型。当转换语法在五十年代注意到不同的句子类型时，它就没再做过什么了。它只是对一些基本类型进行了分类。哈里斯、乔姆斯基、卡茨和波斯特尔都简要研究了一些更基本的句子功能（断言、询问和命令），但这离核心关注点还很远，而核心关注点正是日常语言哲学的切入点。

Those insights go at least as far back as the Greek Sophists. One of the first things the Greeks noticed when they started looking at sentences, rather than just at sounds and words, is that they come in different types—assertions, questions, commands, and so on—and Protagoras is credited with the first typology of sentence functions. But in the intervening millennia very little research went beyond identifying a few of these types. When transformational grammar took notice of different sentence types in the fifties, it did no more. It just cataloged a few of the basic types. Harris, Chomsky, Katz and Postal, all took brief looks at a few of the more basic sentence functions (asserting, asking, and commanding), but it was very far from a central concern, which is where ordinary language philosophy comes in.

日常语言哲学可以说是一场平行运动；事实上，如果相信其创始人之一的说法，那可以说是一场平行革命。JL Austin 不仅毫不含糊地将这场运动称为一场革命，而且相当广泛地暗示它是哲学史上“最伟大和最有益的”革命（1962 [1955]:3）；但他补充说，考虑到哲学史，这并不是一个夸大其词的说法。它源于维特根斯坦，但真正流行起来是在 50 年代，尤其是通过 Austin 1955 年在哈佛大学的 William James 讲座。讲座的标题是《如何用语言做事》，这个标题直指日常语言哲学的主导主题——人们用语言做事——一个极其简单但非常有成效的概念。Austin 的出发点是这样的观察：哲学通常只注意到人们用语言做的事情之一——即断言命题——因此几乎把所有的注意力都放在了真值条件上。但奥斯汀说，人们在说话时也会询问、命令、警告、威胁、承诺、命名、遗赠、打赌，并且通常会做出各种各样的行为，而这些行为中，真值条件要么从属，要么完全无关紧要。奥斯汀将这些言语行为的有效意图称为言外之力，而执行这些意图的句子称为施事句。二十五

Ordinary language philosophy is something of a parallel movement; indeed, a parallel revolution, if one of its founding voices is to be trusted. J. L. Austin not only unequivocally calls the movement a revolution, but hints rather broadly that it is “the greatest and most salutary” revolution in the history of philosophy (1962 [1955]:3); he adds, however, that given the history of philosophy, this is not a large claim. It develops out of Wittgenstein, but really took wing in the fifties, especially through Austin’s William James lectures at Harvard in 1955. The lectures came out as How To Do Things with Words, a title which gets right at the driving theme of ordinary language philosophy—that people do things with language—a ridiculously simple but remarkably productive notion. Austin’s starting point is the observation that philosophy had generally only noticed one of the things that people do with words—namely, assert propositions—and had consequently paid virtually all of its attention to truth conditions. But people also inquire, Austin says, and order, and warn, and threaten, and promise, and christen, and bequeath, and bet, and generally perform a wide variety of actions when they talk, actions in which truth conditions are either subservient or wholly irrelevant. Austin calls the effective intentions of these speech acts illocutionary forces, and the sentences that perform them, performative sentences.25

早期的转换语法和奥斯汀的言语行为理论彼此之间关系不大，尽管它们之间有一些密切的联系——当奥斯汀在哈佛大学做讲座（后来成为《如何用言语做事》）时，乔姆斯基正在写《逻辑结构》；几年后，当奥斯汀病危时，他正在筹划一个关于句法结构的讨论小组。26言语行为概念也在《整合理论》中短暂出现，当时 Katz 和 Postal 在脚注中提到了他们关于祈使触发词素的提议，“可以通过删除至少前三个元素来从“我动词请求 你将主要动词”形式的句子中推导出祈使句”（1964：149n9）。27在列举了该提案在实际实施过程中的一些优点之后，他们补充道：“尽管我们在这里不采用这种描述，但它肯定值得进一步研究。”

Early transformational grammar and Austin’s speech act theory had very little to do with one another, although there were some close brushes—Chomsky was writing Logical Structure at Harvard when Austin gave the lectures that became How To Do Things with Words, and a few years later Austin was planning a discussion group on Syntactic Structures when he fell fatally ill.26 Speech act notions also made a brief appearance in Integrated Theory, when Katz and Postal footnote their proposal for the imperative trigger morpheme with “a case can be made for deriving imperatives from sentences of the form I Verbrequest that you will Main Verb by dropping at least the first three elements” (1964:149n9).27 After listing some of the virtues this proposal has over the course they actually took, they add “although we do not adopt this description here, it certainly deserves further study.”

和他们的许多作品一样，Katz 和 Postal 的隐性表演性暗示在几年后得到了进一步研究。Robin Lakoff 的论文提出并分析了拉丁语中的一些抽象表演性动词 (1968:170–217)，McCawley 也在一篇重要的德克萨斯普遍性会议论文中概述了这一假设 (1976b [1967–68]:84–85)。但众所周知的“表演性提议”显然属于 Ross，属于他的论文“论陈述句”(1970b [1968])。28本文的主要观点是，深层结构简单陈述句的最顶层有一个形式为“我告诉你”的从句，如 PM-5，该从句通常根据述行删除规则被删除。二十九

Like so much of their work, Katz and Postal’s buried peformative suggestion did get further study a few years later. Robin Lakoff’s dissertation proposes and analyzes a number of abstract performative verbs for Latin (1968:170–217), and McCawley also outlines the hypothesis in an important paper for the Texas Universals conference (1976b [1967–68]:84–85). But the “performative proposal,” as it has become known, clearly belongs to Ross, and to his paper “On Declarative Sentences” (1970b [1968]).28 The principal claim of the paper is that the deep structures of simple declarative sentences have a topmost clause of the form “I TELL you,” as in PM–5, which was usually excised by a rule of Performative deletion.29

延伸开来，同样的机制可以处理疑问句、命令句、承诺以及其余的全部言语行为——将“我问你”和“我命令你”等最顶层的从句赋予疑问句、命令句等。30罗斯为分析提供了一系列论据，但仅考虑其中之一，基于反身代词。在英语中，反身代词要求先行词在人称和数（有时还有性别）上一致。在转换语法的机制中，解释 31a 和 31b 的语法性但 *31c 的不语法性的最有效方法是假设底层先行词被删除（如 3 Id）：

By extension, the same mechanism would take care of questions, imperatives, promises, and the entire remaining panoply of speech acts—giving topmost clauses like “I ASK you” and “I COMMAND you” to questions, imperatives, and so on.30 Ross offers a battery of arguments on behalf of the analysis, but consider just one of them, based on reflexive pronouns. In English, reflexive pronouns require antecedents which agree in person and number (and sometimes gender). Within the mechanisms of transformational grammar, the most efficient way to explain the grammaticality of 31a and 31b but the ungrammaticality of *31c is to assume underlying antecedents that get deleted (as in 3 Id):

31

31

a Jery 认为这座沙堡是我和 Debbie 建造的。

a Jery thinks that the sandcastle was built by Debbie and myself.

 

 

b Jery 认为沙堡是 Debbie 和你建造的。

b Jery thinks that the sandcastle was built by Debbie and yourself.

 

 

c *Jery 认为沙堡是 Debbie 和他们建造的。

c *Jery thinks that the sandcastle was built by Debbie and themselves.

 

 

d 我告诉你，杰瑞认为沙堡是我和黛比建造的。

d I TELL you that Jery thinks that the sandcastle was built by Debbie and myself.

31 d 是深层结构，31 a 没问题（因为我和我自己在人称和数上一致）。31b 也一样（因为你和你自己在人称和数上一致）。但 *31c 不行（因为 31d 中任何地方都没有第三人称复数先行词，如they）。简单又干净。而且没有底层的“我告诉你”从句，语法必须给出其他解释，说明为什么 31a 和 31b 是合乎语法的句子，而 31c 不是。

With 31 d as the deep structure, 31 a is okay (since I and myself agree in person and number). Ditto for 31b (since you and yourself agree in person and number). But *31c is out (since there is no third-person plural antecedent, like they, anywhere in 31d). Simple and clean. And without the underlying “I TELL you” clause, the grammar has to come up with some other explanation for why 31a and 31b are grammatical sentences, but 31c is not.

在一系列其他论据的支持下，支持“我告诉你”从句的论据具有一定的力量，罗斯提出的所有事实都与 31a-d 中说明的事实一样，都是句法事实——关于句子中单词的分布和共现的事实——符合最佳、最严格的Aspects传统。但没有人会忽视罗斯的提议增加了深层结构的语义清晰度。如果罗斯没有试图探索奥斯汀对意义的见解，他可能甚至不会注意到 31a-d 中的事实。罗斯的提议将深层结构推向更深层次，走向抽象，走向意义：抽象语法的决定性趋势。用麦考利的话来说，

Bolstered by a phalanx of other arguments, the case for an underlying “I TELL you” clause has a certain force to it, and all of the facts that Ross adduced are like the ones illustrated by 31a-d, syntactic facts—facts about the distribution and cooccurrence of words in sentences—in the best, most rigorous Aspects tradition. But it escaped no one’s notice that Ross’s proposal increased the semantic clarity of the deep structure. Ross likely wouldn’t even have noticed the facts in 31a-d if he wasn’t trying to explore Austin’s insights about meaning. Ross’s proposal pushed deep structure ever deeper, toward abstraction, and toward meaning: the defining trend of abstract syntax. In McCawley’s terms,

自从乔姆斯基提出“深层结构”的概念以来，几乎每一个被假设的“深层结构”（除了那些被证明是错误的假设）都被证明并不是真正的深层结构，而是其下隐藏着一个更抽象的结构，这个结构更适合被称为该句子的“深层结构”。 (McCawley, 1976b [1967]:105)

Since the introduction of the notion of ‘deep structure’ by Chomsky, virtually every ‘deep structure’ which has been postulated (excluding those which have been demonstrated simply to be wrong) has turned out not really to be a deep structure but to have underlying it a more abstract structure which could more appropriately be called the ‘deep structure’ of the sentence in question. (McCawley, 1976b [1967]:105)

麦考利补充道：“这引出了一个问题：是否真的存在‘深层结构’。”

“This,” McCawley adds, “raises the question of whether there is indeed such a thing as ‘deep structure’.”

开场白

The Opening Salvo

我们相信语义可能是生成性的。

We believe semantics may be generative.

乔治·莱考夫和哈吉·罗斯

George Lakoff and Háj Ross

生成语义学出现的下一步（用“一步”这个词不太恰当；这些发展或多或少都是重叠的，而不是连续的）可能看起来很奇怪，这是 McCawley 的问题所提示的。我们刚刚研究了以下论点：深层结构只有几个基本类别，符号逻辑是深层结构的语言，存在一个通用基础，这意味着所有语言都共享一个深层结构的共同核心，深层结构需要抽象动词，包括抽象行为动词，深层结构确实非常深。下一步是放弃深层结构。

The next step (and step is not exactly the right word; these are all more or less overlapping developments, not sequential ones) in the emergence of generative semantics, the one cued by McCawley’s question, may seem like a peculiar one. We have just been looking at arguments that deep structure has only a few essential categories, that symbolic logic is the language of deep structure, that there is a universal base which implies all languages share a common core of deep structures, that deep structure calls for abstract verbs, including abstract performatives, that deep structure is very deep indeed. And the next step is the abandonment of deep structure.

生成语义学从抽象句法中诞生的信号性文献、诞生宣告和第一个重要的挑战是一篇薄薄的油印论文——实际上是一封信——作者是莱科夫和罗斯，题为“深层结构是必要的吗？” (1976[1967])，论文的答案是“否”。

The signal document, the birth announcement, the first important gauntlet, of generative semantics emerging from abstract syntax is a slight mimeographed paper—a letter, really—by Lakoff and Ross, entitled “Is Deep Structure Necessary?” (1976 [1967]) which says no.

1967 年春，罗斯给阿诺德·兹维基写了一封信，概述了他和莱考夫通过电话与麦考利合作所做的工作，以及他们三人对乔姆斯基语言学中句法和语义关系得出的结论。兹维基回忆说，这封信给他“留下了深刻的印象”，而罗斯决定更广泛地传播他们的结论。此时，罗斯与莱考夫的合作已经变成了列侬和麦卡特尼之间的合作，谁写了什么并不重要；两个人的名字都写在信上，重要段落都经过油印，副本很快就传遍了各处。这封信的意义在于，深层结构根本不存在，至少在《Aspects》中是这样定义的。

In the spring of 1967, Ross wrote a letter to Arnold Zwicky outlining the work he and Lakoff had been doing, in telephonic collaboration with McCawley, and the conclusions the three of them had all come to about the relations of syntax and semantics in Chomskyan linguistics. Zwicky recalls being “very impressed” by the letter, and Ross decided to circulate their conclusions more widely. By this point Ross’s collaboration with Lakoff had become a sort of Lennon and McCartney affair, where it didn’t really matter who wrote what; both names went on the letter, the important passages were mimeographed, and copies very quickly made the rounds. The force of the letter is that there can be no such a thing as deep structure, at least as it is defined in Aspects.

罗斯和莱考夫的论证充其量只是粗略的，但这封信对兹维基和它的大多数次要读者来说非常有效——麦考利说，正是这封信让他“从一个修正主义的解释语义学家变成了一个生成语义学家”（1976b:159），而且他并不孤单。莱考夫的《走向生成语义学》一书未能如愿，而这封联名信却引发了一场大火，这并非因为莱考夫和罗斯的论证具有直接的力量，而是因为所有以抽象句法的名义所做的有希望的工作。这封信直接触及了生成语言学中开始弥漫的一种感觉，即深层结构只是一个中转站。毕竟，乔姆斯基曾说过，句法越深，就越接近意义，而抽象句法学家的研究已经变得非常深奥了。看看 1967 年春天，就在罗斯舔着邮票给兹维基寄信的几周前，麦考利已经潜入水下多少俄丈深了：

Ross and Lakoff’s case was sketchy at best, but the letter was very effective, for Zwicky and for most of its secondary readers—McCawley says it’s what turned him “from a revisionist interpretive semanticist into a generative semanticist” (1976b:159), and he was not alone. Where Lakoff’s “Toward Generative Semantics” sputtered, the joint letter sparked, kindling a brushfire not so much because of the immediate force of Lakoff and Ross’s arguments, but because of all the promising work done in the name of abstract syntax. The letter plugged directly into a feeling that had begun to pervade generative linguistics, that deep structure was just a way station. Chomsky had said, after all, that the deeper syntax got the closer it came to meaning and the abstract syntacticians were getting awfully deep. Look at how many fathoms down McCawley was in the spring of 1967, just weeks before Ross licked the stamp and posted his letter to Zwicky:

在一本大型词典的任何一页上，你都可以找到具有极其具体的选择限制的单词，这些单词的语义属性范围似乎不受限制；例如，动词diagonalize要求其宾语为表示矩阵（在数学意义上）的名词短语，形容词benign（意为“非癌性的”）要求其主语为表示肿瘤的动词，而动词devein在烹饪中的用法要求其宾语为表示虾或对虾的动词。（1976a [1967]：67）

On any page of a large dictionary one finds words with incredibly specific selectional restrictions, involving an apparently unlimited range of semantic properties; for example, the verb diagonalize requires as its object a noun phrase denoting a matrix (in the mathematical sense), the adjective benign in the sense ‘noncancerous’ requires a subject denoting a tumor, and the verb devein as used in cookery requires an object denoting a shrimp or a prawn. (1976a [1967]:67)

体素模型中的选择限制被认为是句法上的，但显然，将 [± 肿瘤] 或 [± 虾]句法特征与 [± 及物动词] 或 [± 复数] 相提并论违背了任何传统的句法观念。事实上，Lakoff 和 Ross 引用了这一论点作为反对深层结构的确凿证据。

Selectional restrictions in the Aspects model were considered syntactic, but, clearly, calling [± tumor] or [± prawn] syntactic features parallel to [± transitive] or [± plural] rebels against any traditional notion of syntax. Lakoff and Ross, in fact, cite this argument as damning evidence against deep structure.

一旦麦考利被推到抽象句法到生成语义的边缘，或者被推到这一边缘，他就开始提出更有说服力的反对深层结构的论点，包括一个相当臭名昭著且巧妙的论点，该论点围绕着分别的单词展开，与哈勒的反音素观点非常接近。但他对深层结构最具破坏性的论点并不是一个必须消除深层结构的负面论点。这是一个积极的建议，即没有它人们也可以过得很好。

Once McCawley was pushed over the abstract-syntax-to-generative-semantics brink, or nudged over it, he began to develop more compelling arguments against deep structure, including a rather notorious and ingenious one revolving around the word respectively that follows Halle’s anti-phoneme lead very closely. But his most damaging argument for deep structure was not a negative argument that it had to go. It was a positive proposal that one could get along just fine without it.

McCawley 的积极论证建立在 Lakoff 论文中的一些词汇分解思想之上。Lakoff 曾论证说“kill、die和dead可以表示为具有相同的词汇读物和词汇基础，但具有不同的词汇扩展”（1970 [1965]:100）。也就是说，它们都涉及dead的原始定义（类似于NOT ALIVE），但die还会被标记为经历变换 Inchoative，而kill会进一步被标记为经历 Causeative，从而相当顺利地捕捉到dead意味着不活着，die意味着变得不活着，而kill意味着导致变得不活着。这个建议的吸引人的特点之一是扩大了范围。Lakoff 论证说，这些变换对于语法来说无论如何都是必要的，以解释像hard（如32 中的）等词的语义和句法属性的范围；他只是增加了它们的工作量。

McCawley’s positive argument built on some of the lexical decomposition ideas in Lakoff’s thesis. Lakoff had argued that “kill, die, and dead could be represented as having the same lexical reading and lexical base, but different lexical extensions” (1970 [1965]:100). That is, they would all involve the primitive definition for dead (something like NOT ALIVE), but die would additionally be marked to undergo the transformation, Inchoative, and kill would be further marked to undergo Causative, capturing rather smoothly that dead means not alive, that die means become not alive, and kill means cause to become not alive. Among the attractive features of this suggestion was an increase in scope. The transformations were necessary for the grammar anyway, Lakoff argued, to account for the range of semantic and syntactic properties in words like hard (as in 32); he just increased their workload.

三十二

32

a 这种金属很坚硬。

a The metal is hard.

 

 

b 金属变硬了

b The metal hardened, [i.e., became hard]

 

 

c 泰勒使金属变硬[即使其变硬]

c Tyler hardened the metal, [i.e., caused it to become hard]

McCawley 更进一步，提出了一条新规则，该规则“包括 Lakoff 的起始和因果转换作为特殊情况”（1976b [1967]:159），并将原子谓词收集到子树中，以提供词汇插入。新规则谓词提升，是转换中最简单的规则。它只是将谓词移到树上并将其与另一个谓词相邻，如短语标记 6、7 和 8 所示。31

McCawley went a step further, proposing a new rule which “includes as special cases the inchoative and causative transformations of Lakoff” (1976b [1967]:159), and collects atomic predicates into a subtree to provide for lexical insertion. The new rule, Predicate-raising, was about as simple as transformations come. It simply moves a predicate up the tree and adjoins it to another predicate, as in phrase markers 6, 7, and 8.31

词汇插入可以发生在任何这些短语标记上，从而产生 33 中的任何同义词句。

Lexical insertion could take place on any of these phrase markers, yielding any of the synonymous sentences in 33.

33

33

斯大林导致托洛茨基死去。

a Stalin caused Trotsky to become not alive.

 

 

b 斯大林导致托洛茨基死亡。

b Stalin caused Trotsky to become dead.

 

 

c 斯大林导致托洛茨基死亡。

c Stalin caused Trotsky to die.

 

 

d 斯大林杀死了托洛茨基。

d Stalin killed Trotsky.

此外，词典中kill的条目不再需要体模型的标记语；它可以简单地表达为“作为替换 [a] 子树的变换”（McCawley，1976b [1967]：158），就像 PM-8 中的抽象动词集合一样。kill 的条目可以是图 5.2中的变换。三十二

Moreover, the dictionary entry for kill no longer needs the markerese of the Aspects model; it could be expressed simply “as a transformation which replaces [a] subtree” (McCawley, 1976b [1967]:158), like the conglomeration of abstract verbs in PM–8. The entry for kill could be the transformation in figure 5.2.32

这一提议的影响非常广泛，许多转换论者认为它极具吸引力。尤其是，正如 McCawley 提出该提议的论文标题所承诺的那样，“在转换语法中插入词汇，无需深层结构”，它向语言学家展示了如何在没有Aspects最大吸引力的情况下实现这一点。33 Lakoff 和 Ross 对深层结构的攻击很重要，但几乎完全是腐蚀性的。他们的论点侵蚀了深层结构，却没有提出一个坚实的建议，说明一旦深层结构完全瓦解，该怎么做。他们引用并谴责深层结构的标准之一是它作为词汇插入点的作用，即单词在派生中出现的地方，但他们的驳斥非常简短。“我们认为我们可以证明，”他们说，“词汇项插入到派生的许多点”（1976 [1967]：160）；因此，没有一个特定的位置，没有深层结构，所有词汇项都进入派生。这个大胆的主张之后是一句朝着这种证明可能采取的方向的浪潮，然后他们转向其他问题。充其量，这一举动看起来像是把词汇插入的婴儿和深层结构的洗澡水一起倒掉。这种明显的鲁莽和缺乏积极内容是莱科夫和罗斯的信对《邮政报》几乎没有任何影响的主要原因。即使他同意他们的论点损害了深层结构（他不可能急于接受这一结论，因为他在发展深层结构方面发挥了重要作用），他也没有什么可以深入研究的。

The implications of this proposal are very sweeping, and many transformationalists found it extremely attractive. In particular, as the title of the paper in which McCawley proposed it promises, “Lexical Insertion in a Transformational Grammar without Deep Structure,” it showed linguists how to make do without Aspects’ biggest drawing card.33 Lakoff and Ross’s mimeographed assault on deep structure was important, but it was almost exclusively corrosive. Their arguments ate away at deep structure without a solid proposal for what to do once it had completely dissolved. One of the criteria they cite and then denounce for deep structure is its role as the locus of lexical insertion, the place where the words show up in a derivation, but their dismissal is remarkably curt. “We think we can show,” they say, that “lexical items are inserted at many points of a derivation” (1976 [1967]:160); ergo, that there is no one specific location, no deep structure, where all lexical items enter a derivation. This bold claim is followed by a one-sentence wave in the direction that such a proof might take, and they’re on to other matters. At best, this move looked like chucking out the lexical-insertion baby with the deep-structure bathwater. This apparent recklessness and the lack of positive substance are the main reasons that Lakoff and Ross’s letter had virtually no impact on Postal at all. Even if he agreed that deep structure was compromised by their arguments (a conclusion he could not have been eager to embrace, since he was instrumental in developing deep structure), there was nothing for him to sink his teeth into.

图 5.2 . McCawley 对kill的词汇插入变换（源自 McCawley，1976b[1968]：158）。

Figure 5.2. McCawley’s lexical insertion transformation for kill (From McCawley, 1976b [1968]:158).

当波斯特尔说“生成语义学的推动者是麦考利，我一直认为是他的”时，他主要想到的是词汇插入论证。

When Postal says that “the fomenter of [generative semantics] was McCawley; I’ve always considered it to be his,” it is primarily the lexical insertion arguments he has in mind.

此时，波斯特尔已离开 IBM 前往约克敦高地的约翰·沃森研究中心——实际上，他比麦考利更接近剑桥，但远离学术圈。他一直与莱考夫和罗斯保持联系，但联系不够密切，不足以让他们的零散主张具有说服力。事实上，他对他们论点的回应与四年前对莱考夫单独论点的回应大致相同：这个案例很有启发性，甚至很有希望，但过于粗略，不足以让他放弃从一开始就奠定他研究基础的解释性假设。麦考利的论点更明确、更严密、更积极，最终说服他放弃深层结构，转而研究（并研究）新兴的生成语义框架。

Postal was off at the IBM John Watson Research Center in Yorktown Heights by this point—closer to Cambridge than McCawley, actually, but further out of the academic loop. He had stayed in contact with Lakoff and Ross, but not closely enough to find their patchy claims very persuasive. His response to their arguments, in fact, was much the same as it had been to Lakoff’s solo arguments four years earlier: the case was suggestive, promising even, but much too sketchy to warrant abandoning the interpretive assumptions that had grounded his research from the outset. It was the more explicit, more closely reasoned, and more positive arguments of McCawley that eventually persuaded him to dump deep structure and work in (and on) the emerging generative semantics framework.

随着深层结构的瓦解，以及四位领军人物都开始研究语义学，在我们直接进入生成语义学模型之前，还有一点需要说明：反对深层结构的运动在很多方面都是反对乔姆斯基的运动。罗斯的信甚至没有提到他，也没有提到Aspects，但看看麦考利在质疑深层结构的存在时说了什么：

With the dissolution of deep structure, and the four leading figures all on their semantic horses, there is still one more point to make before we can get to the generative semantics model directly: the campaign against deep structure was in many ways a campaign against Chomsky. Ross’s letter doesn’t even mention him, or Aspects for that matter, but look at what McCawley says when he questions the existence of deep structure:

作为乔姆斯基语言结构概念的另一种解释，我们可以提出，在每种语言中，都只有一个单一的过程系统，将每个句子的语义表征转换成其表面句法表征，而语义表征转换成表面句法表征的中间阶段，没有一个阶段享有乔姆斯基所称的“深层结构”之类的特殊地位。要判断乔姆斯基的语言概念或没有深层结构的概念是否正确，必须至少粗略地确定语义表征必须由什么组成，并在此基础上回答以下两个问题，这两个问题对于在两种语言概念之间做出选择至关重要。（1）语义表征是与句法表征具有根本不同性质的对象吗？还是可以更有效地将句法和语义表征视为基本上属于同一类型的对象？ （2）语义表征和表层句法表征之间的关系是否涉及两种根本不同类型的过程，并被组织成两个独立的系统，对应于乔姆斯基所说的“转换”和“语义解释规则”，还是实际上不存在将话语的意义和其表层形式联系起来的过程？（McCawley，1976b[1967]：105–6）

As an alternative to Chomsky’s conception of linguistic structure, one could propose that in each language there is simply a single system of processes which convert the semantic representation of each sentence into its surface syntactic representation and that none of the intermediate stages in the conversion of semantic representation into surface syntactic representation is entitled to any special status such as that which Chomsky ascribes to ‘deep structure.’ To decide whether Chomsky’s conception of language or a conception without a level of deep structure is correct, it is necessary to determine at least in rough outlines what semantic representations must consist of, and on the basis of that knowledge to answer the two following questions, which are crucial for the choice between these two conceptions of language. (1) Are semantic representations objects of a fundamentally different nature than syntactic representations or can syntactic and semantic representations more fruitfully be considered to be basically objects of the same type? (2) Does the relationship between semantic representation and surface syntactic representation involve processes which are of two fundamentally different types and are organized into two separate systems, corresponding to what Chomsky called ‘transformations’ and ‘semantic interpretation rules’, or is there in fact no such division of the processes which link the meaning of an utterance with its superficial form? (McCawley, 1976b [1967]:105–6)

这段话最清晰、最简洁地表达了生成语义学争论的核心问题，其中四次提到乔姆斯基——没有 Katz，没有 Fodor，没有 Postal，而是团队中设计深层结构和语义解释规则以提出Aspects模型的批判性成员——并且用二元选择的语言明确指出，有一个新来者。

This passage, about the clearest and most succinct expression of the central issues that dominated the generative semantics debates, mentions Chomsky four times—no Katz, no Fodor, no Postal, rather critical members of the team which designed deep structure and semantic interpretation rules to come up with the Aspects model—and spells out explicitly, in the language of binary choices, that there is a new kid on the block.

模型

The Model

在句法中，意义就是一切。

In syntax meaning is everything.

奥托·耶斯帕森

Otto Jespersen

新出现的概念是语法模型，极其简单，如图 5.3所示。

The new kid on the block is the grammatical model, simple in the extreme, given as figure 5.3.

暂且不论“同质的我”这个标签，不难看出这个模型从何而来，或者它为何如此吸引人。在科学的历史潮流中，决定性的忠诚——称之为运动、范式、计划、学派，用行业中任何重叠的集体术语来称呼它们——都是对集合的忠诚，是对思想、程序、工具和愿望的结合。几乎总是有一些领先的观念，一些主题遥遥领先于其他主题，但正是聚合才构成了学派，当聚合开始朝着一个方向涌动时，对许多人来说，这种吸引力是不可抗拒的。1907 年，詹姆斯对实用主义哲学学派的天定命运的热情可见一斑：

Leaving aside the Homogeneous I label for now, it isn’t hard to see where the model came from, or why it was so appealing. The defining allegiances in the historical flow of science—call them movements, paradigms, programs, schools, call them by any of the hatful of overlapping collective terms of the trade—are all to conglomerations, to knots of ideas, procedures, instruments, and desires. There are almost always a few leading notions, a few themes head and shoulders above the pack, but it is aggregation that makes the school, and when the aggregate begins to surge as one in a single direction, the pull is, for many, irresistible. Witness James’s enthusiasm over the manifest destiny of the philosophical school of pragmatism in 1907:

所谓的实用主义运动——我不喜欢这个名字，但显然现在改名已经太迟了——似乎突然凭空而来。哲学中一直存在的许多倾向突然意识到了自己，意识到了它们的共同使命。（1981 [1907]：3）

The pragmatic movement, so-called—I do not like the name, but apparently it is too late to change it—seems to have rather suddenly precipitated itself out of the air. A number of tendencies that have always existed in philosophy have all at once become conscious of themselves collectively, and of their combined mission. (1981 [1907]:3)

正是这种目的论意识弥漫在 60 年代中期的抽象句法学家中，他们感觉自己正在见证一个思想合谋，不可避免地走向这样一个立场：意义和形式通过一小部分转换的相互作用直接相关：简单性和普遍性主张几个原子范畴；这些范畴几乎与符号逻辑的原子范畴完全一致；符号逻辑反映了思维规律；思维是语言的普遍基础。从该计划开始，每个人都感觉到意义是转换彩虹尽头的金罐，而生成语义学，即使还没有到达金罐，似乎也提供了到达那里最有希望的地图。听听罗伯特·利斯（Robert Lees）的无拘无束的兴奋，我们已经很久没有听到他的消息了，他是转换计划开始时就在那里的人：

Precisely this teleological sense pervaded the abstract syntacticians in the midsixties, the sense that they were witnessing a conspiracy of ideas marching ineluctably toward the position that meaning and form were directly related through the interative interplay of a small group of transformations: simplicity and generality argued for a few atomic categories; these categories coincided almost exactly with the atomic categories of symbolic logic; symbolic logic reflected the laws of thought; thought was the universal base underlying language. Meaning, everyone had felt from the beginning of the program, was the pot of gold at the end of the transformational rainbow, and generative semantics, if it hadn’t quite arrived at the pot, seemed to offer the most promising map for getting there. Listen to the unbridled excitement of someone we haven’t heard from for a while, someone who was there at the beginning of the transformational program, Robert Lees:

图 5.3生成语义学（同质 I）（改编自 Postal，1972a [1969]：134）。

Figure 5.3. Generative semantics (Homogeneous I) (adapted from Postal, 1972a [1969]:134).

在最近使用[转换]方法对句法结构进行的研究中，一个有趣但并不令人意外的事实逐渐浮现出来：随着底层语法表征变得越来越抽象，并且随着它们需要关联越来越多样的表达，深层结构越来越像这些表达含义的直接图像！（Lees，1970a[1967]：136）三十四

In the most recent studies of syntactic structures using [transformational] methods, an interesting, though not very surprising, fact has gradually emerged: as underlying grammatical representations are made more and more abstract, and as they are required to relate more and more diverse expressions, the deep structures come to resemble more and more a direct picture of the meaning of those expressions! (Lees, 1970a [1967]:136)34

抽象性方向性的诉求（Postal (1971b [1969]) 将其戏称为“方向性”）有许多值得注意的特点，所有这些特点都体现在李斯的文章中。首先，“事实”一词在文中占据突出地位；转换分析导致语义清晰是一个毋庸置疑的现象，需要解释，就像英语被动语态比主动语态具有更多的形态学一样，需要解释。其次，通常对发现的自然性（如李斯的“并不十分惊讶”）和热情（如他的感叹结尾）相结合。自然性源于大多数转换论者共同的信念：（1）他们走在正确的道路上，（2）语言学研究的意义在于提供形式和意义之间的原则性联系。热情源于结果的巨大前景。

There are a number of noteworthy features to the directionality-of-abstractness appeal—as it was awkwardly dubbed by Postal (1971b [1969])—all of them illustrated by Lees’s passage. First, the word fact appears prominently in them; that transformational analysis led to semantic clarity was an undoubted phenomenon, in need of explanation the way the fact that English passives have more morphology than English actives is in need of explanation. Second, there is usually a combined expression of naturalness to the finding (as in Lees’s “not very surprising”) and enthusiasm for it (as in his exclamatory ending). The naturalness follows from the conviction shared by most transformationalists (1) that they were on the right track, and (2) that the point of doing linguistics was to provide a principled link between form and meaning. The enthusiasm follows from the immense promise of the result.

如果说体貌模型是美丽的，那么生成语义学则是华丽的。语言学者的关注点，只要有语言学者存在，就一直是在声音和意义之间建立联系。在体貌模型中，这种联系就是深层结构。对于生成语义学家来说，深层结构不再像是一种联系。它看起来像一道屏障。正如 Háj Ross 仍然有些欣喜地表达的那样，一旦你打破了深层结构的藩篱，“你就有了树状的语义表征，有了树状的表面结构，有了一套相当同质的规则，可以将一组树转换成另一组树。”声音和意义之间的联系成为整个语法。体貌的语义成分被嫁接到句法结构语法的臀部，只能有限地访问派生词，并提取独特的语义表征。生成语义学从这种表征（“意义”）开始，整个理论机制致力于将其编码为单词和短语的配置，最终编码为声波。作为额外的好处，语义解释规则可以完全被抛弃，它们的作用由转换承担。

If the Aspects model was beautiful, generative semantics was gorgeous. The focus of language scholars, as long as there have been language scholars, has always been to provide a link between sound and meaning. In the Aspects model, that link was deep structure. To the generative semanticists, deep structure no longer looked like a link. It looked like a barrier. As Háj Ross expresses it, still somewhat rapturously, once you break down the deep structure fence, “you have semantic representations, which are tree-like, and you have surface structures, which are trees, and you have a fairly homogenous set of rules which converts one set of trees into another one.” The link between sound and meaning becomes the entire grammar. Aspects’ semantic component was grafted onto the hip of the Syntactic Structures grammar, having only limited access to a derivation, and extracting a distinct semantic representation. Generative semantics started with that representation (“the meaning”) and the entire machinery of the theory was dedicated to encoding it into a configuration of words and phrases, ultimately into an acoustic waveform. As an added bonus, the semantic interpretation rules could be completely discarded, their role assumed by transformations.

众所周知，乔姆斯基声称自己是笛卡尔派的后裔，这也进一步激发了生成语义学的吸引力。罗宾·莱考夫在《Grammaire générale et raisonée》的一篇评论文章中广泛暗示，当与生成语义学并驾齐驱时，Aspects模型看起来就像 Port-Royal 模型的一个苍白影子。她放弃了关于 Port-Royal 纲领的抽象语法等术语，转而关注其语言和思维的概念，认为它们从根本上是合乎逻辑的，关注其对高度抽象的深层结构的使用，甚至关注对起始句的某种类似讨论 (1969b:347–50)。

Chomsky’s claims to Cartesian ancestry, too, as everyone could see, only fed the appeal of generative semantics. Robin Lakoff hinted broadly in a review article of the Grammaire générale et raisonée that when placed cheek-by-jowl with generative semantics the Aspects model looked like a very pale shadow of the Port-Royal work. She dropped terms like abstract syntax about the Port-Royal program, and drew attention to its notions of language and the mind as fundamentally logical, and to its use of highly abstract deep structures, even to a somewhat parallel discussion of inchoatives (1969b:347–50).

但她没必要这么麻烦。乔姆斯基在自己的著作《笛卡尔语言学》中对这一案例的论述更有说服力。

But she needn’t have bothered. The case is even more persuasively offered in Chomsky’s own book, Cartesian Linguistics.

生成语义学是不可避免的。波斯特尔以他击败布鲁姆菲尔德派的坚定、无可辩驳的语气说道：

Generative semantics was inevitable. In the tone of utter, unassailable conviction that he had brought to the Bloomfieldian rout, Postal put it this way:

由于其先验逻辑和概念特性，这种语法理论（生成语义学，或本文称之为同质 I）……是生成语言学家应作为研究框架进行研究的基本理论，只有在经验否定的最强烈压力下，它才应该被抛弃。简而言之，我认为同质 I 框架相对于其在生成框架中的可能竞争对手具有相当特殊的逻辑地位，这一地位使得在没有直接经验否定的情况下必须选择这一理论。（1972a [1969]：135）

because of its a priori logical and conceptual properties, this theory of grammar [generative semantics, or, as the paper terms it, Homogeneous I]… is the basic one which generative linguists should operate from as an investigatory framework, and that it should be abandoned, if at all, only under the strongest pressures of empirical disconfirmation. In short, I suggest that the Homogeneous I framework has a rather special logical position vis-à-vis its possible competitors within the generative framework, a position which makes the choice of this theory obligatory in the absence of direct empirical disconfirmation. (1972a [1969]:135)

但是，正如《同质I》所暗示的，故事远未结束。生成语义学泄露了。这个美丽的模型即将发生一些变异，但这得等上一章左右了。即使是图 5.3在 1972 年也不完全准确，因为如我们所见，除了转换之外，还有其他一些手段。罗斯和波斯特尔的约束并没有改变模型，因为它们是外部的，是定义模型的总体一般理论的一部分。但还有别的东西，罗斯称之为条件盒，一个额外的箱子，里面装满了零碎的 Perlmutterian 管子和粗棉布，用来过滤掉其他语法无法控制的语法恶臭。事实证明，潘多拉魔盒是个更好的标签。生成语义学中的过滤问题导致了一些变异。

But, as Homogeneous I suggests, the story is far from over. Generative semantics leaked. The beautiful model has some mutation ahead of it, but that will have to wait a chapter or so. Even figure 5.3 wasn’t entirely accurate in 1972, since, as we’ve seen, there were also a few other devices beyond transformations. Ross’s and Postal’s constraints don’t change the model, because they are external to it, part of the overarching general theory that defines the model. But there was something else, which Ross called a conditions box, an additional trunk full of odd bits of Perlmutterian tubing and pieces of cheesecloth to filter off the grammatical effluvia the rest of the grammar couldn’t control. As it turned out, Pandora’s box would have been a better label. The filtering problem in generative semantics led to several mutations.

不过，在研究这些变化之前，我们应该先听听乔姆斯基的看法，看看他对所有这些发展的反应。当时，他似乎断然拒绝了生成语义学，现在回想起来，许多人仍然认为他断然拒绝了生成语义学。但别忘了，这是乔姆斯基。事情没那么简单。

Before we look at those mutations, though, we should check in with Chomsky and see what his reaction was to all of these developments. It looked at the time to be a flat rejection of generative semantics, and it still looks to many people in retrospect to have been a flat rejection. But this is Chomsky, don’t forget. Things were not so simple.

第六章

生成语义学2：异端

CHAPTER 6

Generative Semantics 2: The Heresy

当信仰通过否定形成时，它们会得到最清晰、最系统的表达。通过系统地识别什么是虚假的和不可接受的，可以标记出什么是真实的和可接受的界限……通过与异端邪说和异端分子的斗争，正统观念才能最清晰地划定。

Beliefs are most clearly and systematically articulated when they are formed via negativa. The boundaries of what is true and acceptable are marked through a systematic identification of what is false and unacceptable…. It is through battles with heresies and heretics that orthodoxy is most sharply delineated.

莱斯特·库尔茨

Lester Kurz

许多近期的研究都采用了转型主义的立场，例如 Lakoff (1965)…

The transformationalist position is adopted in much recent work, for example Lakoff (1965)…

这个解决方案是由 Lakoff (1965, p. A-15f) 提出的，但是根据他在那里所采用的转型主义理由，这个解决方案没有任何动机……

This solution is proposed by Lakoff (1965, p. A-15f), but on the transformationalist grounds that he adopts there, there is no motivation for it….

我认为，在采取转型主义立场的著作中，现有子规则的范围被大大夸大了。例如，Lakoff (1965)……

The scope of the existing subregularities, I believe, has been considerably exaggerated in work that takes the transformationalist position. For example, Lakoff (1965) …

诺姆·乔姆斯基

Noam Chomsky

乔治和哈吉秀

The George and Háj Show

几乎所有谈论生成语义学起源的人都对拉科夫和罗斯使用了相同的形象，即使只是为了淡化其适用性；用利斯的话来说，“当那两只老鼠玩耍时，猫不在场可能并不那么重要，重要的是这两只老鼠走到了一起。”也就是说，几乎所有相关人员都认为乔姆斯基 1966 年休假访问伯克利与抽象句法在过渡到生成语义学后命运的急剧上升之间存在显著的相关性。这种相关性的原因很明显，而且到目前为止，非常熟悉。这次我让罗斯说：“乔姆斯基非常聪明、才华横溢、辩论速度惊人、工作努力，以极快的速度阅读一切，并记住一切：就是拥有压倒性的智慧”——这些品质对麻省理工学院社区的影响是让它“非常像一个人的表演”。乔姆斯基在麻省理工学院时总是制定议程，六十年代上半叶制定议程就等于制定了转换语法的议程。他离开后，麻省理工学院出现了真空。

Almost everyone who talks about the beginnings of generative semantics uses the same image about Lakoff and Ross, even if only to downplay its applicability; in Lees’s phrasing, “it may well not have been so important that the cat was away while those two mice played, but only that the two had come together.” That is, almost everyone involved sees a significant correlation between Chomsky’s 1966 sabbatical visit to Berkeley and the dramatic rise in the fortunes of abstract syntax as it segued into generative semantics. The reasons for this correlation are clear, and by this point, very familiar. I’ll let Ross say it this time: “Chomsky is extremely intellectual, brilliant, amazingly quick in debate, and hard working, and reads everything, at huge speed, and retains everything: just an overwhelming intellect”—qualities whose effect on the MIT community is to make it “very much a one-man show.” Chomsky sets the agenda whenever he is there, and setting the agenda at MIT in the first half of the sixties was tantamount to setting the agenda for transformational grammar. When he left, there was a vacuum.

拉科夫曾在哈佛大学担任讲师，罗斯刚刚被任命为​​麻省理工学院的讲师，他们有足够的精力、想法和魅力来填补这一空缺，至少在一段时间内是这样。去年，他们在哈佛大学举办了一场非正式研讨会，在研讨会上，他们对抽象语法计划进行了前所未有的深入研究——阐明、阐述和扩充了波斯特尔的提议，麦考利则通过电话不断提供意见。现在，他们都在教授类似的范式扩展课程。他们的学生正在交叉注册。他们的想法在剑桥之外也得到了传播。

Lakoff, who had a lectureship at Harvard, and Ross, who had just been appointed at MIT, had the energy, the ideas, and the charisma to fill that vacuum, at least for a while. They had conducted an informal seminar at Harvard the previous year, in which they mined the abstract syntax program to unprecedented depths—articulating, elaborating, and augmenting Postal’s proposals, with constant telephonic input from McCawley. Now they were both teaching similar paradigm-stretching courses. Their students were cross-registering. And their ideas were getting airtime outside of Cambridge.

所有这些工作都存在着相当多的歧义，拉科夫-罗斯的工作将抽象语法推向了生成语义的边缘。毫无疑问，在拉科夫的话语中，有一种强烈的企图，那就是成为“优秀的小乔姆斯基主义者”，以迎接从伯克利回来的该运动的创始人，“嘿，诺姆！[你的理论]比你想象的还要伟大！”但一个优秀的小乔姆斯基主义者的角色是不确定的：

There is a fair amount of ambiguity about all of this work, the Lakoff-Ross work that pushed abstract syntax over the generative semantics brink. Unquestionably, there was a driving attempt to be, in Lakoff’s phrase, “good little Chomskyans,” to greet the founder of the movement, on his return from Berkeley, with “Hey Noam! [Your theory] is even greater than you already think it is!” But the role of a good little Chomskyan was an uncertain one:

我们总是感到困惑。例如，在我的工作中，我永远无法弄清楚，[乔姆斯基] 会喜欢什么，而他认为哪些东西完全不合常理，他会拼命反对。回到我的论文，我们有过激烈的争吵。（罗斯）

We were always perplexed. I could never figure out, for instance, in my work, which things [Chomsky] would like, and which things he thought were just completely off-the-wall, that he would fight against tooth and nail. Going right back to my thesis, we had terrible fights. (Ross)

也就是说，这种模糊性的一个方面涉及很难确切地知道一个好的小乔姆斯基主义者需要什么，这个概念就像果冻里的鳗鱼一样容易理解。1966 年，几乎任何愿意押注乔姆斯基的反应和转型研究未来的语言学家都会认为罗斯和莱科夫的扩展有相当大的成功几率，尽管肯定不是很大的几率。（另一方面，乔姆斯基确实认可的对Aspects模型的修改，主要由他的学生雷·杰肯多夫 (Ray Jackendoff) 阐述，成功的几率微乎其微；它们与过去五年转型研究的核心原则背道而驰。）

One aspect of the ambiguity, that is, concerns the difficulty of knowing exactly what is required of a good little Chomskyan, a notion about as easy to grasp as an eel in Jell-O. Almost any linguist in 1966 willing to bet on Chomsky’s reactions and the future of transformational research would have given Ross and Lakoff’s extensions pretty good odds, though certainly not huge ones, of success. (On the slippery other hand, the modifications to the Aspects model Chomsky did endorse, chiefly articulated by his student, Ray Jackendoff, would have received miniscule odds; they flew in the face of the defining core of transformational research of the previous five years.)

但是，拉科夫和罗斯对乔姆斯基主义含糊其辞的另一个更微妙的方面涉及非常清楚地了解转换生成语法几乎每个角落都存在的要求之一：愿意——实际上是有动力——就从具体分析的语法细节到语言理论的整体架构等所有事情进行激烈争论。乔姆斯基对科学有着非常激烈的看法，他的学生年复一年地对此津津乐道。回想一下，早期转换学生的阅读清单中的亮点之一是乔姆斯基在 1958 年德克萨斯会议上与布隆菲尔德主义者的斗争记录；另一个是他在 1962 年 ICL 上对布隆菲尔德主义的激烈辩论驳斥；另一个是他和哈勒对豪斯霍尔德的残酷攻击。

But another, more subtle, aspect of Lakoff and Ross’s ambiguity about good-little-Chomskyanism concerns knowing very clearly one of the requirements, evident in virtually every corner of transformational-generative grammar: the willingness—indeed, the drive—to wrangle fiercely about everything from the grammatical nuts and bolts of specific analyses to the overall architecture of linguistic theory. Chomsky has a very agonistic view of science, which his students lap up year after year. One of the highlights of the early transformational student’s reading list, recall, was the record of Chomsky’s battles with the Bloomfieldians at the 1958 Texas conference; another was his fiercely polemical dismissal of Bloomfieldianism at the 1962 ICL; another was his and Halle’s brutalization of Householder.

在强烈鼓励下，Lakoff 和 Ross 参与了对立观点的冲突，自然而然地产生了一些与 Chomsky 的观点截然相反的观点，而且他们的一些具体建议显然带有挑战性。例如，众所周知，Chomsky 对 Postal 认为动词和形容词属于同一类别的说法并不赞同，而 Lakoff 则对此进行了有力的辩论。Ross 对英语助动词的重新分析追随了句法结构的一套规则和 Chomsky 主义第一个十年的典范语言学。“深层结构是必要的吗？”攻击了方面模型最引人注目的成功。

Encouraged strongly to participate in the clash of adverse opinions, Lakoff and Ross naturally generated some notions that were pointedly antithetical to some of Chomsky’s notions, and there was clearly a sense of challenge to a few of their specific proposals. Chomsky was known, for instance, to be unsympathetic toward Postal’s suggestions that verbs and adjectives were members of the same category, and Lakoff argued the case forcefully. Ross’s re-analysis of English auxiliaries went after a set piece of Syntactic Structures and an exemplar of the first decade of Chomskyan linguistics. “Is Deep Structure Necessary?” attacked the Aspects model’s most spectacular success.

不管是否存在歧义，随着乔姆斯基的离去，他们的提议变得更加大胆、更加原创。罗斯推进了他的施动分析。莱考夫详细阐述了他的抽象动词提议，包括量词（许多、所有等），并探索了反对深层结构的论点。他们的课程和他们的提议一样令人兴奋。当时在哈佛大学担任罗曼语教授的德怀特·博林格清楚地记得课堂上的“火花和烟火”：

Ambiguity or no, with Chomsky gone their proposals became more daring, more original. Ross advanced his performative analysis. Lakoff elaborated his abstract verb proposals to include quantifiers (many, all, etc.), and explored arguments against deep structure. And their classes were as exciting as their proposals. Dwight Bolinger, then a Romance professor at Harvard, remembers the “sparkle and fireworks” of the classes vividly:

我参加了不少课程，看着他们两个互相提出想法，听着班上总是充满智慧、有时甚至精彩的评论。有一种语法正在形成的感觉，就好像我们在探索一片刚刚翻开的田地，每个人都在推土机开进之前找回标本。

I attended quite a few sessions, watching those two throw ideas back and forth with each other, and listening to the always bright, sometimes brilliant comments from the class. One had the feeling of grammar in the making, as if we were out exploring a freshly turned field, with everyone retrieving specimens before the bulldozers moved in.

博林格还将这一时期视为“改革派最激烈的时期，对大师的挑战必然由此而产生”。1

Bolinger also views this period as “the time of greatest TG ferment, out of which challenges to the Master were bound to emerge.”1

然而，正如李斯对猫咪消失的比喻所暗示的那样，真空可能是生成语义学发展的充分条件，但不是必要条件。罗斯和莱考夫的结合具有特别重要的意义。有些人觉得他们之间的催化关系非常令人不快，另一些人则觉得它鼓舞人心，但这些反应有一个共同点：罗斯是一个天赋异禀的天真之人，而莱考夫的天赋则更加诡辩、更加肤浅。当时，一段利用这些看法的隐晦对话广为流传：

As Lees’s use of the cat’s-away metaphor suggests, though, the vacuum may have been a sufficient but not a necessary condition for the growth of generative semantics. There was something particularly vital in the combination of Ross and Lakoff. Some found their catalytic relationship extremely grating, others found it inspiring, but there is a common thread to the reactions: that Ross is a tremendously gifted naïf, while Lakoff’s gifts are more sophistical, more superficial. A thinly veiled dialogue à clef which played on these perceptions made the mimeograph rounds at the time:

盖尔：

G:

H，我要证明你的眼睛是紫色的。

H, I’m going to prove that your eyes are purple.

頁面：

H:

你将如何做到这一点？

How will you do that?

盖尔：

G:

你看到这支铅笔了吗？它不是紫色的，也不是你的眼睛。你看到这本书了吗？它不是紫色的，也不是你的眼睛。[此模板上还有 12 个论据。] 所以，我有 14 个论据证明你的眼睛是紫色的。

You see this pencil? It’s not purple, and it’s not your eyes. You see this book? It’s not purple, and it’s not your eyes. [Twelve more arguments on this template.] So, I have fourteen arguments that your eyes are purple.

頁面：

H:

很棒的数据，但是当我照镜子时，我发现我的眼睛不是紫色的。

Great data, but when I look into the mirror, I see that my eyes aren’t purple.

盖尔：

G:

是的，但这就是关于镜子的事实。关于镜子，还有很多我们尚未了解的奇怪而奇妙的事实。

Yes, but that’s a fact about mirrors. There are many strange and wonderful facts about mirrors that we don’t yet understand.

頁面：

H:

谢谢 G 向我解释这一点。

Thank you, G, for explaining this to me.

这段对话对生成语义学的一些元素进行了精辟的分析——它很好地模仿了论证风格——但它在很大程度上忽略了合作中的互利活力。这段对话对莱科夫来说是一种相当严重的不公，尽管这是很常见的；乔治更像是一个骗子而不是科学家。但罗斯显然更糟糕；哈伊是一个语言学的乡巴佬，被大城市的骗子骗了。事实上，罗斯既是一位敏锐的论证判断者，在口才上也（几乎）与莱科夫不相上下。你可以相信杰罗德·萨多克的话。他成为了生成语义学的重要贡献者，他用一个经典的转变故事来描述他的入会过程，罗斯像埃尔默·甘特里一样轻松地进入了厄巴纳：

This dialogue is astute about some of the elements of generative semantics—it parodies the argument style very well—but it misses the give-and-take dynamism of the collaboration rather widely. The dialogue does Lakoff a rather severe, if common, injustice; G[eorge] is far more of a shyster than a scientist. But Ross clearly comes off worse; H[áj] is a linguistic rube being taken for a ride by the big-city con man. In fact, Ross is both an incisive judge of argumentation and (almost) Lakoff’s equal in volubility. You can take Jerrold Sadock’s word for it. He became a significant generative semantic contributor, and he describes his initiation in the terms of a classic conversion story, Ross breezing into Urbana like Elmer Gantry:

1966 年，哈伊·罗斯 (Háj Ross) 造访伊利诺伊大学。当时他正在全国巡回演讲。他在厄巴纳待了四天，几乎不停地讲课。太棒了。他太优秀了，他所做的工作如此复杂、如此整洁，我立刻就爱上了它。我当时就决定了[关于我的论文主题]。我要找到更多的论据并推动这一理论。

In 1966 Háj Ross stopped by the University of Illinois. He was actually on a big tour across the country. He spent four days in Urbana, and he lectured almost nonstop. It was absolutely awesome. He was so good and this work he was doing was so intricate and so neat that I immediately fell in love with it. I decided then and there [about my dissertation topic]. I was going to find more arguments and push that theory.

罗斯并不是唯一一个巡回演讲的人；他和莱考夫开始专心致志地参加会议——争论抽象句法的优点，暗示生成语义学的优点——从加利福尼亚到德克萨斯再到伊利诺斯。他们把讲台当成讲坛。两人中，莱考夫是最有说服力的，从这个意义上说，紫色眼睛的对话反映了他与罗斯的职业关系。这种模仿太过分了——G 只是牵着 H 的鼻子走——但莱考夫显然是联盟中的驱动力。博林格称他们在哈佛的会议是“一种二重唱。乔治是领唱，但哈吉不时地进行和声，以活跃的交流让全班保持警惕”(1991 [1974]:29)，罗斯在这一时期被人们记住主要是因为他的一些技术创新；特别是他的表演假设，以及我们稍后会看到的他的“squishoids”。 （如果你想知道为什么他关于岛屿的伟大工作不是他在生成语义学发展中所做出的最令人难忘的成就之一，那是因为后来的意识形态发展将这项工作与生成语义学分离开来，甚至在某种程度上与罗斯分离开来。）拉科夫的贡献在另一个层面上被人们铭记。他是抽象动词、词汇分解、规则治理和生成语义学最臭名昭著的创新——也是后来才出现的——全局规则的主要先知。他撰写了该运动的主要政策声明《论生成语义学》（1971b），并在每一个转折点上与乔姆斯基对峙。他是最不知疲倦的跨界者，用他从哲学和心理学领域带回来的材料来充实运动。

Ross was not the only one on tour; he and Lakoff began a dedicated round of conference appearances—arguing the virtues of abstract syntax and insinuating the virtues of a generative semantics—from California to Texas to Illinois. They used the lectern like a pulpit. Of the two, Lakoff was the most forceful, and in this sense the purple-eyes dialogue reflects his professional relationship with Ross. The parody goes way too far—G just leads H around by the nose—but Lakoff was clearly the driving energy in the alliance. Bolinger calls their Harvard sessions “a kind of duet. George was the lead voice, but Haj harmonized at intervals in a lively exchange that kept the class on its toes” (1991 [1974]:29), and Ross is remembered from this period principally for a few technical innovations; in particular, for his performative hypothesis and, something we will see a little later, his “squishoids.” (If you’re wondering why his magnificent island work isn’t one of the accomplishments for which his activity in the growth of generative semantics is best remembered, it’s because subsequent ideological developments detached that work from generative semantics, and even, to some extent, from Ross.) Lakoff’s contributions are recalled on another scale. He was the major prophet of abstract verbs, lexical decomposition, rule government, and generative semantics’ most notorious innovation—also reserved for a later appearance—global rules. He wrote the major policy statement of the movement, “On Generative Semantics” (1971b), and confronted Chomsky at every turn. He was the most tireless boundary-crosser, swelling the movement with material he brought back from forays into philosophy and psychology.
