这场争论在公众心目中的著名症状是雷考夫和乔姆斯基在《纽约书评》上的一封信。当时，《书评》刚刚发表了西尔 (1972) 关于乔姆斯基革命的一篇文章。这篇文章虽然揭示了局外人总是比某个领域的先行者落后几年这一常见趋势，但它还是相当公正的，并且很好地概括了乔姆斯基在当时做出的主要贡献、它们对语言学的影响以及它们对其他领域的影响。其中当然有一些赞美，但这种赞扬既不过分也不过分。尽管如此，这还是激怒了雷考夫。他觉得有必要写一封信给编辑 (1973c)，这封信有两个目的。一方面是想要更清楚地阐述最近的转型生成性发展。例如，塞尔曾说，解释语义学和生成语义学之间的争论“完全发生在乔姆斯基创造的概念体系中”（1972:20），但到了 70 年代初期，这一观点已不再完全正确；我们将会看到，争论的依据发生了很大变化。然而，目前最令人感兴趣的是几乎不加掩饰的动机：贬低乔姆斯基。拉科夫指责乔姆斯基在布卢姆菲尔德学派和笛卡尔学派的相似之处上都撒谎。他说，乔姆斯基的转化性工作的重要结果是它的不确证，主要是生成语义学家的否定。他赶走了那些可能有兴趣研究乔姆斯基假设的心理学家。他低估了乔姆斯基早期工作的重要性，并描述了他的目前的研究成果被误导了。莱考夫的几个观点都有道理，但由于是一封简短、非技术性的信件，因此许多观点被混淆和简化，而且无论如何，其中很多观点与塞尔的文章完全无关。这封信只不过是一份怀疑和贬低乔姆斯基的理由清单，如果不是完全无视他的话。这只是一句简单的谩骂，即使是最善意的描述也是毫无根据的。

A mildly notorious symptom of the public dimensions of the dispute is an exchange of letters by Lakoff and Chomsky in The New York Review of Books. The Review had just published an article by Searle (1972) on Chomsky’s revolution. While revealing the familiar tendency of outsiders to be several years behind the work in any field, it is fairly evenhanded and offers a good précis of Chomsky’s major contributions to that point, their implications for linguistics, and their ramifications for other fields. It certainly includes some lionizing, but the praise is neither undue nor excessive. Still, it got under Lakoff’s skin. He felt compelled to write a letter to the editor (1973c), a letter with two purposes. The stated motive is to spell out recent transformational-generative developments more clearly. Searle, for instance, had said that the interpretive-generative semantics dispute was occurring “entirely within a conceptual system that Chomsky created” (1972:20), which by the early seventies was no longer strictly true; as we will see, the grounds of the debate had shifted considerably. It is the barely hidden motive, though, that is of principal interest at the moment: to diminish Chomsky. Lakoff accuses Chomsky of dishonesty both about the Bloomfieldians and about the Cartesian parallels of his own work. He says that the important results about Chomsky’s transformational work are its disconfirmations, mostly at the hands of generative semanticists. He shoos away psychologists who might be interested in examining Chomsky’s hypotheses. He discounts the importance of Chomsky’s early work, and depicts his current work as misguided. Several of Lakoff’s individual points have merit, but the constraints of a brief, nontechnical letter led to many conflations and simplifications, and, in any case, much of it is completely irrelevant to Searle’s article. The letter serves as little more than a catalog of reasons to suspect and devalue Chomsky, if not to disregard him completely. It is simple invective, of which the kindest characterization is gratuitous.

乔姆斯基当然作出了回应 (1973b)。他的信试图澄清他对莱科夫提出的一些问题的立场，并证明他对语言研究的一般方法是正确的，但他面临着与莱科夫相同的篇幅和受众限制，导致类似的混淆。他也以谩骂还击，并大大提高了攻击的声调。因此，信中传达的最强烈的信息是他极度无视莱科夫的才智，甚至无视莱科夫本人。这封信充斥着明显的人身攻击，在贬低对象方面远远超过了莱科夫：

Chomsky, of course, responded (1973b). His letter tries to clarify his position on a number of the issues Lakoff raised, and to vindicate his general approach to the study of language, but he faces exactly the same constraints of space and audience that cause Lakoff problems, giving rise to similar conflations. He also returns invective for invective, and raises the pitch of the attack considerably. As a result, the strongest message that comes across in the letter is his extreme disregard for Lakoff’s intellect, if not for Lakoff’s person. The letter is littered with unsubtle ad hominems, and far outstrips Lakoff’s in the category of devaluing its object:

拉科夫呈现了一幅非常混乱的画面……

Lakoff presents a very confused picture …

完全错误……

is completely wrong…

歪曲了我的事实……

misrepresents my account …

完全误解了他所引用的参考文献……

has thoroughly misunderstood the references he cites …

陷入无可挽回的困惑……

is confused beyond repair …

呈现的是一个完全混乱的版本……

presents a hopelessly garbled version …

就尚未提出的问题讨论了不存在的观点，混淆了

[has] discussed views that do not exist on issues that have not been raised, confused

使所提出的问题面目全非，并严重扭曲了内容

beyond recognition the issues that have been raised and severely distorted the contents

他引用的几乎所有来源。

of virtually every source he cites.

本汇编只是这些诽谤的代表性样本，而非完整清单。拉科夫的信是谩骂，从专业意义上讲，是一种旨在贬低其对象的夸张修辞，尽管在某些段落中，它更接近于普通语言的含义；乔姆斯基的信并没有过多地进行隐晦处理，其谩骂更符合发泄怨恨的常见定义。正如他和哈勒在几年前花更多时间辱骂拉科夫的老师豪斯霍尔德，而不是解决他的论点一样，乔姆斯基现在关注的是拉科夫，而不是他的案子。拉科夫自然被激怒了，尽管在辩论的这个时候，他对乔姆斯基的爱已经所剩无几，他试图发表一篇更长、更恶毒的回应来回应乔姆斯基的回应。编辑们明智地认为事情已经发展得够多了。

This collection is only a representative sample, not a comprehensive list, of the aspersions. Lakoff’s letter is invective in the technical sense of epideictic rhetoric which aims to devalue its object, though it shades toward the ordinary language sense in some passages; Chomsky’s letter does not bother much with shading, and its invective fits the common definition of venting venom much more closely. Just as he and Halle had spent more time abusing Lakoff’s teacher, Householder, than addressing his arguments years earlier, Chomsky now focused on Lakoff, rather than on his case. Lakoff was naturally incensed, though by this time in the debate he had very little love left to lose for Chomsky, and tried to publish a longer and more vituperative response to the response. The editors wisely decided the matter had gone far enough.

同年，生成性与解释性之争进入了更加公开的讨论范围，在《星期日纽约时报》上刊登了超过 40 栏的版面。这篇报道的作者是乔姆斯基的儿时同学 Israel Shenker，虽然在一定程度上歪曲了这场争论，并且将其大大简化，但它合理地概括了当时包括许多语言学家在内的许多人的看法：可悲的是，乔姆斯基未能完成自己的革命，而另一代青年土耳其党人正在将其变为现实。此时，这个主题在热门文章中变得耳熟能详。例如， 《纽约客》曾引用 Janet Dean Fodor 的话说：“乔姆斯基曾经是一个革命者。现在他被迫处于保守派的立场”（Mehta，1971:218），而 Searle 的引发莱科夫-乔姆斯基争论的文章曾评论说，“革命的发起者现在在他所创造的运动中处于少数派地位。生成语法领域的大多数活跃人士认为乔姆斯基的立场已经过时了”（1972:20）。但申克的文章是第一篇专门讨论这一争论的文章，​​其结论与其他文章相同。

The generative-interpretive dispute reached an even more public forum the same year, getting aired in over forty column-inches of the Sunday New York Times. The story, by a childhood schoolmate of Chomsky’s, Israel Shenker, skews the dispute somewhat, and oversimplifies it drastically, but it is a reasonable epitome of how things looked to a good many people at the time, including many linguists: that Chomsky had, rather sadly, stopped short of fulfilling his own revolution, which another generation of Young Turks was now bringing to fruition. By this time the theme was getting familiar in popular articles. The New Yorker, for instance, had quoted Janet Dean Fodor saying “Chomsky was once a revolutionary. Now he has been forced into the position of a conservative” (Mehta, 1971:218), and Searle’s article that spawned the Lakoff-Chomsky exchange had commented on the irony that “the author of the revolution now occupied a minority position in the movement he created. Most of the active people in generative grammar regard Chomsky’s position as having been rendered obsolete” (1972:20). But Shenker’s piece was the first devoted to the dispute alone, and its verdict is the same as the others.

申克尔引用了所有主要参与者的言论，很好地表达了这场辩论：

The debate is rendered nicely by Shenker’s quotations from all the key players:

罗斯：

ROSS:

毫无疑问，乔姆斯基是一位天才，他彻底改变了语言学，开创了前所未有的数学领域，推动了心理学的革命，重新激发了人们对认知和知觉等问题的兴趣。但我认为，他如此坚信自己成长过程中的这种观点的正确性，以至于他看不出这种观点的不足之处。

There’s no question that Chomsky is a genius and has revolutionized linguistics, and created a field of mathematics which didn’t exist before, and helped in the revolution of psychology and the rebirth of interest in problems like cognition and perception. But I think that he’s so committed to the truth of this view he grew up in that he can’t see where it’s inadequate.

邮政地址：

POSTAL:

通过忽略含义（正如乔姆斯基所做的那样），你会得到一个工件。

By ignoring meaning [as Chomsky does] you get an artifact.

拉科夫：

LAKOFF:

由于乔姆斯基的句法不承认上下文，也无法承认上下文，他甚至无法解释“请”这个词……但实际上不可能与乔姆斯基谈论这些事情。他是个天才，辩论时会使用卑鄙的手段。他用尽了书上所有的技巧。

Since Chomsky’s syntax does not and cannot admit context, he can’t even account for the word please…. But it’s virtually impossible to talk to Chomsky about these things. He’s a genius, and he fights dirty when he argues. He uses every trick in the book.

麦考利：

MCCAWLEY:

乔姆斯基认为，有些句子属于语言，而有些单词序列不属于语言——语法学家的任务是编写规则，确定哪些句子属于语言，哪些句子不属于语言。波斯特尔、莱考夫和我说，这不是一个连贯的概念。

Chomsky assumes that there are sentences which belong to the language and other sequences of words which don’t—and the grammarian’s task is to write rules which will determine which belong and which don’t. Postal and Lakoff and I say this isn’t a coherent notion.

最后，

And, getting the last word,

乔姆斯基：

CHOMSKY:

如果这些工作结果证明是正确的，我会很乐意接受他们的部分工作；如果这些工作结果证明是正确的，我会很乐意接受他们的全部工作，并且我认为他们也会这样做。

I’d gladly accept parts of their work if these turn out to be right, and all of it if it is right, and I assume they’d do the same.

Lakoff 认为他的话在这里被错误引用了，15虽然他显然认为乔姆斯基的辩论技巧并不总是光明正大的。其他人可能也觉得没有得到很好的体现。但这里的重点不是这些引文是否准确。它们可能是完全错误的，尽管它们都很符合辩论的气氛和问题。目前重要的一点是，它们表明喧闹声足够大，邻居们都能听到。

Lakoff feels he was misquoted here,15 though it is clearly his opinion that Chomsky’s eristic techniques are not always aboveboard. The others may also feel poorly represented. But the point here is not whether these quotations are accurate. They could be blatantly wrong, although all fit the temper and the issues of the debate quite well. The important point for the moment is just that they indicate the hullabaloo was loud enough for the neighbors to hear.

这篇文章中，乔姆斯基显然处于劣势。文章中唯一可以归类为“他方”的引文来自卡茨，卡茨认为这一切都是无关紧要的形式主义之争，以及贝弗，贝弗只是填补了一些历史细节。事实上，他根本没有任何立场。所有定义标准都是负面的：由于布隆菲尔德的盲目性，他看不到某些含义，他不关注意义，他不关注背景，他的核心方法论缺乏连贯性。他看起来孤立无援，停留在过去。在罗斯的评论中，他充其量看起来有点像爱因斯坦，他在量子物理学方面做出了开创性的工作，但他的古典偏见不允许他从其含义中得出必要的结论。最糟糕的是，在莱考夫的言论中，他看起来像一个脾气暴躁的老弗洛伊德，用尽一切办法排斥和边缘化他以前的追随者——而申克尔所塑造的正是这种形象。标题是“前乔姆斯基信徒严厉批评这篇文章被命名为《向大师说三道四》，尽管只有莱科夫的言论真正严厉，文章的框架是对弗洛伊德及其异端弟子，尤其是陶斯克的讨论，弗洛伊德对他的待遇最为可耻。尽管乔姆斯基刚过四十，最后发言权在他手中，而且发言非常有策略性，但他给人的印象几乎就像一个可怜的老怪人。

Chomsky is clearly outgunned in the piece. The only quotations in the article that could even remotely be ascribed to “his side” in the schism are from Katz, who dismisses it all as an inconsequential squabble over formalisms, and from Bever, who simply fills in some historical detail. Indeed, there is really no impression that he has a side at all. All the defining criteria are negative: he can’t see certain implications because of his Bloomfieldian blinders, he doesn’t attend to meaning, he doesn’t attend to context, his central methodology lacks coherence. He looks isolated and stuck in the past. At best, in the remarks of Ross, he looks something like Einstein, who did pioneering work in quantum physics, but whose classical prejudices wouldn’t allow him to follow its implications to the necessary conclusions. At worst, in the remarks of Lakoff, he looks like a petulant old Freud, using every trick in the book to ostracize and marginalize his erstwhile followers—and it is this image that Shenker fosters. The headline is “Former Chomsky Disciples Hurl Harsh Words at the Master,” though only Lakoff’s remarks are truly harsh, and the article is framed by a discussion of Freud and his heretical disciples, particularly Tausk, whom Freud treated the most shamefully. Although Chomsky is just into his forties, and he gets the last word, and the word is very politic, he comes off pretty much as a sorry old crank.

第七章

战争的变迁

CHAPTER 7

The Vicissitudes of War

当人们开始争论他们最关心的问题时，他们发现每个人都会对自己的兄弟说，拉卡，你这个傻瓜。

And when men did engage in debate about their deepest concerns, they found that each man could say unto his brother, Racca, thou fool.

韦恩·布斯

Wayne Booth

喵啊，喵啊！

Nyaah, nyaah!

乔治·莱考夫

George Lakoff

武器选择

Weapons of Choice

恩培多克勒警告我们，“对于下等人而言，确实有可能因为强有力的证据而拒绝相信他们”（片段 55），但下等人就像美丽和隐形眼镜一样，取决于旁观者的眼光。当对面的科学家拒绝承认其支持者认为令人信服的论据时，他们从定义上来说就是下等人，这就是为什么科学界最常见的指控都是人身攻击的形式——暗示个人的缺陷，如愚蠢、学术不精，而且往往不诚实。人身攻击在科学界比人们通常认为的要普遍得多（暗示，除其他外，诸如x 困惑、y 未能理解问题或z 歪曲了我的观点之类的薄纱实际上有效）。即使是专业期刊枯燥乏味的版面也充满了这样的攻击，它们围绕范式争议而聚集。不难看出原因。最直接的原因是诽谤很容易。霍金说，如果你发现一个观察结果令人不快，“你总是可以质疑进行观察的人的能力”（1988:10）。但当然还有一个更情绪化的原因。当你清楚地看到某件事，坚信它，热情地宣扬它，却发现你的同事把你当成一个廉价的江湖骗子时，人身攻击是一种非常自然的反应。听听阿尔瓦雷斯对奥本海默的推理，他得出了 50 年代原子物理学家所能给出的最严厉的结论：

“For base men,” Empedocles warns us, “it is indeed possible to withhold belief from strong proofs” (fragment 55), but baseness, like beauty and contact lenses, is in the eye of the beholder. When scientists across the way refuse to grant the force of an argument that its sponsor finds compelling, they are base by definition, which is why the most common accusations in science are forms of ad hominems—implications of personal failings, like stupidity, sloppy scholarship, and often, dishonesty. Personal attacks are far more common in science than is generally thought (suggesting, among other things, that thin veils such as x is confused, or y fails to understand the issue, or z misrepresents my position actually work). Even the parched and stolid pages of professional journals are full of them, and they cluster fructiferously around paradigm disputes. It isn’t difficult to see why. Most immediately, mudslinging is easy. If you find an observation disagreeable, says Hawking, “you can always question the competence of the person who carried the observation out” (1988:10). But there is of course a more emotional reason. Personal vituperation is a very natural response when you see something clearly, believe it strongly, propound it fervently, and find your colleagues looking at you like a cheap snake-oil merchant. Listen to Alvarez’s reasoning about Oppenheimer, coming to the most damning conclusion one could offer of an atomic physicist in the fifties:

奥本海默和我经常对同一个问题持有相同的事实，但最终却得出截然相反的结论——他持这种观点，我持另一种观点。奥本海默智商很高。他分析和解释事实的方式不可能是错误的。我智商很高。我不可能错。所以奥本海默一定是不诚实、不守信用——也许是叛国。1

Oppenheimer and I often have the same facts on a question and come to opposing decisions—he to one, I to another. Oppenheimer has high intelligence. He can’t be analyzing and interpreting the facts wrong. I have high intelligence. I can’t be wrong. So with Oppenheimer it must be insincerity, bad faith—perhaps treason.1

在生成-解释辩论中，没有任何政治叛国的指控（尽管这种指控在反建制的六十年代会产生截然不同的影响，甚至可能带来荣誉），但有很多科学叛国的指控——尤其是 x-is-just-a-Bloomfieldian-in-in-the-clomskyan-closing 类型。由于 Bloomfield 已经成为语言学的绝对妖怪，而且生成语义学家和解释语义学家似乎在同一个总体框架内工作，这些指控花了一段时间才浮出水面。它们标志着争论的最后挣扎，明显表明和解完全无望，双方都孤军奋战，双方都不认为对方在做真正的语言学。

There weren’t any accusations of political treason in the generative-interpretive debates (though such charges would have had a much different impact in the antiestablishment sixties, possibly even conferring honor), but there were plenty of charges of scientific treason—especially of the x-is-just-a-Bloomfieldian-in-Chomskyan-clothing variety. Since Bloomfield had become the absolute Bogey Man of linguistics, and since the generative and the interpretive semanticists seemed to be working within the same general framework, it took a while for these accusations to surface. They marked the death throes of the dispute, the obvious sign that reconciliation was completely hopeless, that each side was on its own, that neither side thought the other was doing Real Linguistics.

当分歧仍然围绕着乔姆斯基主义的同一大框架下的几个技术问题时，各种各样的人身攻击占据了主导地位。其中最常见的，就像大多数辩论一样，是稻草人指控：“x 所反对的不是我的真实立场，而是对我立场的讽刺。”指控中隐含着，有时明确地，是故意、欺骗性的扭曲，但制造稻草人是信念的自然副作用。只为弱点而阅读（或倾听）的做法不可避免地会导致对彼此论点的扭曲——麦考利的精彩标题“解释语义学遇上弗兰肯斯坦”抨击卡茨，因为他攻击的不是活生生的生成语义学，而是他拼凑起来攻击的备用部分。

When the differences still revolved around a few technical questions under the same Chomskyan umbrella, a wide variety of ad hominems ruled the day. The most common of them, as with most debates, was the straw man charge: “x is arguing not against my real position, but against a caricature of my position.” Thickly implicit, and occasionally explicit, in the charge was willful, deceitful distortion, but building straw men is a natural side effect of conviction. The practice of reading (or listening) only for weaknesses inevitably leads to distortions of one another’s arguments—McCawley’s wonderful title, “Interpretive Semantics Meets Frankenstein,” jumps on Katz for his attack not on a living, breathing generative semantics, but on the spare parts he has stitched and bolted together to attack.

在科学界，尤其是生成语义学争论中，另一个经常被提及的相关指控是含糊不清。乔姆斯基的麻烦就是例证——他曾说“我读生成语义学论文时从来没有遇到过丝毫问题”——试图解读生成语义学论证：

Another frequent and related charge, in science generally and the generative semantics dispute particularly, is vagueness. Witness Chomsky’s troubles—a man who says “I never had the slightest problem reading papers in [generative semantics]”—trying to decode generative semantic arguments:

充其量，[Lakoff] 论证的逻辑还不清楚……甚至连推测都不够清楚。（1972b [1967]：35）

At best, the logic of [Lakoff’s] argument is unclear… this is hardly clear enough even to be a speculation. (1972b [1967]:35)

除非这些问题得到澄清，否则我认为麦考利的论点毫无根据。（1972b[1967]：48n30）

Until these matters are cleared up, I see no force to McCawley’s contention. (1972b [1967]:48n30)

如果不对这些结构进行分析，我看不出如何能解决这些问题。这种分析确实提出了规则以及潜在的结构，从这个意义上讲，这远远超出了 Lakoff 提出的解决这些问题的方法。（1972b [1968]：82）

I do not see how these questions can be resolved without undertaking an analysis of these structures which does propose rules as well as underlying structures, and in this sense, goes well beyond the approach to these questions that Lakoff presents. (1972b [1968]:82)

在麦考利提出批评的普遍性层面上，我看不出还有什么可说的。（1972b[1968]：80）

I fail to see what more can be said, at the level of generality at which McCawley develops his critique. (1972b [1968]:80)

这份指控自然而然地一式四份传到了乔姆斯基和他的阵营手中：

The charge, naturally, returned to Chomsky and his camp in quadruplicate:

[致乔姆斯基：] 你应该明确说明你在词典中需要哪些新设备……在你的 [“评论”] 讲座中，你随口说你需要在词典中使用某些构词原则，但没有说明这些原则是什么、有多少、什么类型，[或] 它们彼此有何不同。如果没有相当精确的主张，也没有相当精确的主张说明你需要哪些新的语义解释规则，就不可能弄清楚词汇学家假设到底在说什么。（Lakoff，1967：6）

[To Chomsky:] You ought to make explicit just what new devices you would need in the lexicon.… Throughout your [“Remarks”] lectures you remarked in an offhand fashion that you would need certain principles of word-formation in the lexicon, without stating just what these principles would be, how many, what kind, [or] how they would differ from one another. Without fairly precise claims along these lines and without fairly precise claims about what new rules of semantic interpretation you would need, it is impossible to figure just what the lexicalist hypothesis is claiming. (Lakoff, 1967:6)

在许多作者的论文中，有人提出了一种解释性或“表面结构”的语义解释方法……但在我看来，这种方法并不是很清楚。麻省理工学院过去一年多来，最著名的是乔姆斯基和杰肯多夫。（Postal，1988a [1969]：79）

[An] interpretive or ‘Surface Structure’ approach to semantic interpretation … has been posited, not very clearly in my opinion, in a number of papers by various authors at MIT over the last year or so, most notably Chomsky, and Jackendoff. (Postal, 1988a [1969]:79)

“独立动机”的概念在《评论》中非常模糊。（Ross，1973c：212）

The concept of ‘independent motivation’ is highly obscure in [“Remarks”]. (Ross, 1973c:212)

我只能模糊地谈论坏人（解释语义学）的语义结构概念，因为我见过的坏人写的论文通常很少提供任何线索，说明他们认为语义结构是什么样子，或者语义解释规则是什么样子。（McCawley，1973a[1970]：276-77）

I can speak only vaguely of the bad guy [interpretive semantics] conception of semantic structure, since the papers by bad guys which I have seen generally give very little clue as to what they think a semantic structure looks like or a semantic interpretation rule does. (McCawley, 1973a [1970]:276–77)

这一指控的部分动机再次是简单的贬低，暗示思想不清或故意混淆。部分动机也与好斗精神有关，这种精神使人们无法容忍对手和盟友同样程度的不拘小节：同盟者的写作含糊其辞是暗示性的、有前途的或有趣的；敌人的写作则是粗略的、晦涩的或马虎的。其中很大一部分与此类争论中实际上存在的高度模糊性有关。“深层结构是必要的吗？”是一篇模糊的论文，罗斯和莱考夫的同事认为它很有前途和纲领性，而他们的对手则认为它非常单薄。“评论”也是一篇模糊的论文，乔姆斯基的学生认为它很有前途和纲领性，而他的对手则认为它非常单薄。

Some motivation for this charge is once again simple disparagement, implying woolly-mindedness or deliberate obfuscation. Some of it also has to do with a combative spirit that prevents one from tolerating the same level of informality from opponents as allies: a confederate writing vaguely is suggestive or promising or intriguing; enemies are sketchy or obscure or sloppy. And much of it has to do with the high levels of vagueness which are in fact present in such disputes. “Is Deep Structure Necessary?” is a vague paper, which Ross and Lakoff’s colleagues found promising and programmatic and their opponents found very thin. “Remarks” is a vague paper, which Chomsky’s students found promising and programmatic and his opponents found very thin.

当然，也存在一些问题——有些是真的，有些是障眼法，有些是长期的，有些是短暂的。有些需要一点关注，有些则不需要。

There were also, of course, issues—some of them genuine, some smokescreens, some of them lasting, some ephemeral. Some of them require a little attention, some don’t.

例如，乔姆斯基第一次直接反对生成语义学，就是指责它只是对Aspects模型的空洞模仿，而这一指控只是一缕烟雾弹，我们可以很快消除。“人们很容易被误导，”乔姆斯基说，“认为不同表述的理论在经验结果上确实存在差异，而事实上它们是可以相互翻译的——从某种意义上说，只是符号变体而已”(1972b [1968]:69)。2抛开“误导”和“纯粹”中潜在的诽谤，乔姆斯基的意思非常明确：无论两种理论在形式主义、架构等方面看起来如何，如果它们做出相同的经验预测，它们只是表达同一事物的不同方式。事实上，正是围绕这个问题，乔姆斯基创造了“标准理论”这个术语，然后反复论证说，生成语义学只是标准理论的一个符号变体。

Chomsky’s first direct move against generative semantics, for instance, was to charge that it was just a hollow imitation of the Aspects model, and the charge is a whiff of smoke we can dispel pretty quickly. “It is easy to be misled,” Chomsky said, “into assuming that differently formulated theories actually do differ in empirical consequences, when in fact they are intertranslatable—in a sense, mere notational variants” (1972b [1968]:69).2 Moving past the aspersions latent in misled and mere, what Chomsky is saying is quite clear: no matter what two theories look like, in terms of formalisms, architecture, what-have-you, if they make the same empirical predictions, they are just different ways of saying the same thing. It is around this question, in fact, that Chomsky coined the term, standard theory, and then argued repeatedly that generative semantics was a mere notational variant of the standard theory.

卡茨拿起这根棍子，用它来打击生成语义学一段时间，但几乎所有其他人都对这一论点感到困惑；特别是，它怎么可能被视为驳斥生成语义学的理由。符号变体立场最直接的含义是争吵毫无意义，两种理论应该携手并进，就像枕头大战后的特威德尔登和特威德尔迪一样。但如果是这样，生成语义学就会获胜。包括乔姆斯基在内的所有人都同意，生成语义学是迄今为止最漂亮、最简单的理论——这两个标准在理论营销中历来非常成功。

Katz picked up this stick and used it to beat generative semantics awhile, but almost everyone else was completely baffled by the argument; in particular, by how it could conceivably count as a reason to dismiss generative semantics. The most immediate implication of the notational-variants position is that there is just no point in squabbling, that the two theories should go off arm-in-arm, like Tweedledum and Tweedledee after their pillow fight. But, if so, generative semantics wins. Everyone agreed, Chomsky included, that generative semantics was by far the prettiest and simplest theory—two criteria that have traditionally been extremely successful in theory-marketing.

因此，由于乔姆斯基的动机不是支持生成语义学，他投入了大量的注意力来证明，不仅 (1) 生成语义学与标准理论说的是同一件事，而且 (2) 生成语义学错了。几乎每个人，无论是朋友还是敌人，都认为这些说法的结合是不连贯的，而符号变体指控的保质期相当短。它被广泛视为一个笑话（语言学家在十年后仍在笑）。3经过几次发展，在乔姆斯基创造了扩展标准理论这个术语之后，在杰肯多夫对其进行了充实之后，在关于表层结构解释的说法发展到足以被认真对待之后，乔姆斯基的论点就更加清晰了：标准理论是错误的，生成语义学加剧了这些错误，而扩展标准理论则纠正了这些错误。但这些问题当时太模糊了，无法取得任何进展。等到它们变得足够清晰，可以理解时，辩论已经进入了其他阶段。我们可以放心地忽略这里的论点。4

So—since Chomsky’s motivation wasn’t to endorse generative semantics—he devoted a fair amount of attention to showing not only (1) that generative semantics says the same thing as the standard theory, but (2) that generative semantics is wrong. Almost everyone, friend and foe alike, found the combination of these claims incoherent, and the notational variants charge had a fairly short shelf life. It was widely treated as a joke (one that linguists were still chuckling about ten years later).3 After a few more developments, after Chomsky had coined the term extended standard theory, after Jackendoff had put some flesh to it, after the claims about surface-structure interpretation were developed enough to be taken seriously, Chomsky’s argument was a little clearer: the standard theory is wrong, generative semantics compounds these wrongs, and the extended standard theory remediates them. But these issues were too fuzzy at the time to get anywhere. By the time they were sharp enough to make sense, the debate had moved on to other stages. We can safely ignore the argument here.4

不过，下一组论点（以隐喻的方式理解；我们一如既往地处于重叠领域）确实需要引起注意。这些是有关深层结构和正式开启争论的卡茨-波斯特尔假说的交流——这场辩论最令人难忘的问题，以及据称生成语义学已失去其经验主义衣钵的问题。它们当然是真实的问题，但它们是短暂的——原因很简单，因为它们有最明确的解决方案：深层结构被抛弃了，卡茨-波斯特尔原则（强版本）也被抛弃了。

The next set of arguments (taking next metaphorically; we are, as always, in overlapping domains), though, does require some attention. These are the exchanges over deep structure and the Katz-Postal hypothesis that formally opened the dispute—the issues the debate is most remembered for, and the issues over which generative semantics is said to have lost its empirical shirt. They are certainly real issues, but they are ephemeral—for the very good reason that they had the clearest resolutions: deep structure was thrown out, and so was (the strong version of) the Katz-Postal principle.

乔姆斯基的下一个策略是限制性——生成语义学被认为在描述上是肆无忌惮的，而解释语义学则受到负责任的限制——并且取得了巨大的成功。这个争论从未得到解决；事实上，它永远不可能得到解决（Gazdar，在 Longuet-Higgins 等人，1981 年：[690]）。但乔姆斯基完全获胜了。限制性是导致生成语义学因不合理和错误而被嘲笑的主要问题，而乔姆斯基的后 Aspects方法成功地定义了一种新的基于约束的研究流派，决定了 70 年代和 80 年代的大部分语言学。这个问题是真实存在的，尽管它无法得到有意义的解决也给交流带来了相当大的烟雾，其影响仍然很广泛。

Chomsky’s next tack was restrictiveness—generative semantics was said to be descriptively wanton, interpretive semantics responsibly restricted—and it was hugely successful. The argument was never resolved; in fact, it could never be resolved (Gazdar, in Longuet-Higgins and others, 1981:[690]). But Chomsky won the day completely. Restrictiveness was the principal issue which led to generative semantics being laughed from the scene for irrationality and error, while Chomsky’s post-Aspects approach triumphantly defined a new vein of constraint-based research that determined much of the linguistics of the seventies and eighties. The issue is real enough, though its inability to be meaningfully resolved also lent considerable smoke to the exchanges, and its effects are still widespread.

生成语义学家则反驳说，解释阵营对语法等关键概念玩弄不严谨，并把数据掩藏在他们能找到的任何地方。他们说，乔姆斯基和杰肯多夫无法直接处理的东西，只是被放逐到一些行为不端的现象的阴间，与事实玩一场阴暗的骗局。

For their part, the generative semanticists countered with charges that the interpretive camp was playing fast and loose with crucial notions like grammaticality and sweeping data under any rug they could find. What Chomsky and Jackendoff couldn’t handle directly, they said, was simply banished to some netherworld of illbehaved phenomena, in a shady shell-and-pea game with the facts.

布卢姆菲尔德可能在此时被援引。生成语义学家可能很容易指责解释学家的边界调整策略——布卢姆菲尔德曾说，顽固的数据应该“通过简单地将其命名为属于其他科学的领域来妥善处理”（1926:154；1970:129）。布卢姆菲尔德说，它可能看起来像语言学，也可能闻起来像语言学，但如果我们称其为“心理学”或“社会学”，我们就不必再看它或闻它了。乔姆斯基和他的追随者没有援引其他科学，但他们确实改变了他们模型中的边界——主要是能力-表现边界和句法-语义边界——并巧妙地将麻烦的事实留在了另一边。

Bloomfield might have been invoked at this point. The generative semanticists might easily have accused the interpretivists of his border-shuffling gambit—recalcitrant data, Bloomfield had said, should “properly be disposed of by merely naming them as belonging to the domain of other sciences” (1926:154; 1970:129). It might look like linguistics, and it might smell like linguistics, Bloomfield said, but if we call it “psychology” or “sociology” we don’t have to look at it or smell it any more. Chomsky and his followers did not invoke other sciences, but they did shift the borders within their model—chiefly, the competence-performance border and the syntax-semantic border—and conveniently left the troublesome facts on the other side.

事实上，布卢姆菲尔德的指控首先来自解释方面。道尔蒂在一次令人尴尬的“老老师也是这样”的长篇大论中提出了这一点，但实际上并非如此非常清楚它所指控的是什么。他只是召唤了一个方便的幽灵，并且除了辱骂之外，他只关注某些结构主义方法论，他错误地认为这些方法论代表了与那个幽灵有关的黑暗势力。但这个案例实际上非常有力，特别是与那些相反的认识论、经验主义和理性主义有关。布卢姆菲尔德是一个毫无歉意的经验主义者，他所鼓舞和定义的一代人也是如此；乔姆斯基是理性主义的拥护者，但他所鼓舞和定义的第一代人变得越来越经验主义。

The Bloomfieldian charge, in fact, came first from the interpretive side. Dougherty raised it in an embarrassing so’s-your-old-teacher diatribe that really wasn’t very clear on what it was alleging. He just called up a convenient specter and, insofar as he went beyond name-calling, attended narrowly to certain structuralist methodologies he mistakenly took to represent the forces of darkness associated with that specter. But the case was actually very strong, particularly in connection with those flip-side epistemologies, empiricism and rationalism. Bloomfield was an unapologetic empiricist, as was the generation he invigorated and defined; Chomsky was a champion of rationalism, but the first generation he invigorated and defined became increasingly empiricist.

到了这一步，双方只好挥手告别，各自走开，嘴里还不时嘟囔几句“尼亚啊，尼亚啊！”

At this point, the two sides could do little more than wave good-bye and walk away from each other, with some muttering of “Nyaah, Nyaah!” over their shoulders.

深层结构的衰落与瓦解

The Decline and Fall of Deep Structure

如果有人开始在另一根线上工作，就会毁掉整块织物。

He who sets to work on a different strand destroys the whole fabric.

孔子

Confucius

最早反对深层结构的一致论据是麦考利的论证，该论证出现在 1967 年德克萨斯州普遍性会议上的一篇有趣的论文中，并发表在该会议的论文集中，附言对他的立场进行了实质性的修改。5论文主体部分“语义在语法中的作用”（McCawley，1968a）试图将体貌模型延伸到多个方向，特别是在句法中使用索引以及使用逻辑作为语义表达工具方面。大部分讨论涉及关于复数和主谓一致的有趣而微妙的事实，例如 1（其中主语是两个成员的连词，因此是复数，并且两个动词与主语一致，尽管谓语每次只涉及一个成员；霍华德喜欢这部电影，但珍妮却很失望）。

The earliest concerted argument against deep structure is McCawley’s respectively argument, coming in a curious paper delivered at the 1967 Texas Conference on Universals and published in the proceedings of that conference with a postscript substantially modifying his position.5 The main body of the paper, “The Role of Semantics in a Grammar” (McCawley, 1968a), attempts to stretch the Aspects model in several directions, particularly in the use of indices in syntax and the use of logic as a tool of semantic representation. Most of the discussion involves interesting and subtle facts about plurality and subject-verb agreement, such as in 1 (in which the subject is a two-member conjunction, hence plural, and the two verbs agree with the subject, although the predication involves only one member at a time; Howard likes the movie, but it disappoints Jenny).

1

1

a 霍华德和珍妮分别喜欢这部电影和对它感到失望。

a Howard and Jenny like the movie and are disappointed by it respectively.

 

 

b *Howard 和 Jenny 分别喜欢这部电影和对它感到失望。

b *Howard and Jenny likes the movie and is disappointed by it respectively.

然而，尽管有种种延伸，讨论显然属于Aspects模型的（相当广泛的）范围，属于抽象语法类型。但在发表论文和提交论文集手稿之间，麦考利“从一个修正主义的解释语义学家变成了一个生成语义学家”（1976a:159），后记中带有宣言的味道。像任何最近皈依科学等修辞事业的人一样，他迅速开始寻找论据来证明这种转变的合理性，重点关注莱科夫和罗斯的“深层结构是否必要？”这一标题问题。他提出的主要论点（实际上，波斯特尔也参与其中）分别基于索引、量词和单词。乔姆斯基对这一论点的粗暴处理是导致莱科夫在上一章中失去理智的原因之一，我们将在后面讨论这种粗暴处理一会儿。首先，论证。以古老的哈勒三段论为模板，麦考利从以下三个句子开始论证

For all the stretching, however, the discussion falls clearly within the (rather broad) scope of the Aspects model, in the genre of abstract syntax. But between delivering the paper and submitting the manuscript for the proceedings, McCawley turned “from a revisionist interpretive semanticist into a generative semanticist” (1976a:159), and the postscript has the whiff of manifesto about it. Like any recent convert in a rhetorical enterprise like science, he went quickly to work uncovering arguments to justify the conversion, focusing on the titular question of Lakoff and Ross’s “Is Deep Structure Necessary?” The principal argument he came up with (and, actually, Postal had a hand in it as well) is based on indices, quantifiers, and the word respectively. Chomsky’s manhandling of this argument is one of the things that caused Lakoff to blow his cool last chapter, and we’ll get to that manhandling in a moment. First, the argument. Taking the venerable Hallean syllogism as a template, McCawley argued from sentences like these three

2

2

a 拉里和汤姆都爱他们各自的妻子。

a Larry and Tom love their respective wives.

 

 

b 这两个男人分别爱着苏珊和多特。

b Those men love Susan and Dot respectively.

 

 

c 那个男人爱苏珊和多特。

c That man loves Susan and Dot.

Aspects表示这些句子至少需要三个层次的表示：表层结构（就我们的目的而言，我们可以用 2a–c 来表示）、深层结构（3a–c）和语义表示（4a–c）。最后两个句子特别有趣，因为它们都来自非常相似的深层结构，仅在区分索引方面有所不同，这些索引可识别出两次出现的that man是指同一个人还是不同的人，如 3b（底层 2b）和 3c（底层 2c）。深层结构（终端字符串）包括：

Aspects says that these sentences need at least three levels of representation: surface structures (which, for our purposes, we can represent with 2a–c), deep structures (3a–c) and semantic representations (4a–c). The last two sentences are especially interesting since both of them come from very similar deep structures, different only in the distinguishing indices which identify whether the two occurrences of that man refer to the same guy or to different guys, as in 3b (underlying 2b) and 3c (underlying 2c). The deep structures (terminal strings) are:

3

3

拉里爱拉里的妻子，汤姆爱汤姆的妻子

a Larry loves Larry’s wife and Tom loves Tom’s wife

 

 

b 那个男人i爱 Susan 而那个男人j爱 Dot

b that mani loves Susan and that manj loves Dot

 

 

c我爱苏珊，我爱多特

c that mani loves Susan and that mani loves Dot

McCawley 对其各自的语义表示为：

And McCawley gives their respective semantic representations as:

4

4

a (∀x) X ∊ {Larry, Tom} & (x 爱 f(x))，其中 f(x) = x 的妻子

a (∀x) X ∊ {Larry, Tom} & (x loves f(x)), where f(x) = x’s wife

 

 

b (∀x) X ∊ {xi , Xj } &man(x)&(x爱f(x))，其中f( xi )=Susan，f(Xj ) =Dot

b (∀x) X ∊ {xi, Xj} & man(x) & (x loves f(x)), where f(xi) = Susan, f (Xj) = Dot

 

 

c (∀x) X ∊ {X i , X j } & man(x) & (x 爱 f(x))，其中 f(x) ∊ {Susan, Dot}

c (∀x) X ∊ {Xi, Xj} & man(x) & (x loves f(x)), where f(x) ∊ {Susan, Dot}

到目前为止，一切都很好；现在到了棘手的部分。根据 McCawley 提供的（但从未表述过的）规则草图，他的Respectively变换，所有这些现象都可以用一种统一的方式处理。问题是，该规则不能对 3a–c （Aspects 类型的深层结构）这样的结构进行操作。它需要访问全称量词 (∀) 和集合索引。也就是说——这是关键点——要使 McCawley 的Respectively变换起作用，它必须直接从语义表示 (4a–c) 转到表面结构 (2a–c)。因此，生成语义学可以用一条规则完成相同的工作，该规则采用至少两条规则（在两个不同层次之间运行）的方面模型，即一条语义解释规则，从 3a-c 中提取量化事实、功能和谓词关系，以及一个转换（连接-还原），它对集合索引进行处理以从那个男人i和那个男人j中得出那些男人，以及从那个男人i和那个男人i中得出那个男人。

So far, so good; now comes the tricky part. According to the sketch of a rule McCawley offers (but never formulates), his Respectively transformation, all of these phenomena can be handled in a unitary way. The trouble is that the rule can’t operate on structures like 3a–c (Aspects-type deep structures). It needs access to universal quantifiers (∀) and set indices. That is—and this is the key point—for McCawley’s Respectively transformation to work, it has to go directly from the semantic representations (4a–c) to the surface structures (2a–c). Generative semantics therefore can do the same work with one rule that takes the Aspects model at least two rules—operating between two different levels—a semantic interpretation rule which extracts the quantification facts, functions, and predicate relations from 3a–c, and a transformation (Conjunction-reduction) which crunches the set indices to yield those men from that mani and that manj and that man from that mani and that mani.

对于非语言学家和没有接受过逻辑训练的语言学家来说，这个论点可能相当晦涩难懂，但从结构上看，它几乎与哈勒关于音素的激动人心的论点完全相同。哈勒曾说过，布隆菲尔德语法有三个层次，每个层次之间都有一盒规则，他发现一些俄语数据只能用这种三级语法笨拙地处理，每个规则盒有两个相同的规则。但如果中间层次——音素层次——被抛弃，语法重新构建，一条规则就能解决问题。因此，出于简单起见，中间层次必须被去掉。

The argument may be pretty dense for nonlinguists, and for linguists without some training in logic, but structurally it is almost identical to Halle’s galvanizing argument about the phoneme. Halle had said there are three levels in a Bloomfieldian grammar, with a box of rules separating each one, and he uncovered some data from Russian that could only be handled by this three-level grammar in a clumsy way, with two identical rules, one per box. But if the middle level—the phonemic level—was tossed out and the grammar restructured, one rule by itself would do the trick. For reasons of simplicity, therefore, the middle level had to go.

McCawley 表示， Aspects语法有三个级别，其中有一个框他发现，英语中的一些数据只能用这种三级语法笨拙地处理，即每框一个规则，每条规则只能处理一条。但如果去掉中间层（深层结构层），重新构建语法，一条规则就能解决问题（见图7.1）。因此，出于简单的原因，深层结构必须被去掉。

McCawley said that there are three levels in an Aspects grammar, with a box of rules separating each one, and he uncovered some data from English that could only be handled by this three-level grammar in a clumsy way, with two rules, one per box. But if the middle level—the level of deep structure—was tossed out, and the grammar restructured, one rule would do the trick (see figure 7.1). For reasons of simplicity, therefore, deep structure had to go.

乔姆斯基毫无意外地反驳了这一论点，而且反驳得十分正确，但反驳的理由并不明显，比如“先让我们看看这条规则，然后再决定是否能得出什么结论”或“当然，但事实真的表明这里存在一个统一现象吗？（如果是，那就证明它）”。他以一种奇怪而丑陋的方式重构了麦考利的论点，以表达他的反对意见；事实上，这种方式让拉科夫对故意歪曲的指控更加可信。6但这个故事还有一个更离奇的地方：早在乔姆斯基的重构发表之前，麦考利就曾写信给他，反驳他的重构。乔姆斯基不知所措。他回信给麦考利，坚称他的重构是准确的，事实上，麦考利对自己的论文的内容感到困惑。麦考利在论文付印前又尝试了几次，结果都差不多。此外，在乔姆斯基的批评付印前几年，麦考利的论证 (1976b [1967]:121–32) 还有一个更明确的版本。

Chomsky predictably and rightly objected to the argument, but not on any of the grounds which seem fairly obvious—such as “Let’s see the rule before we decide if anything follows from it” or “Sure, but do the facts really show that there is a unitary phenomenon here? (And, if so, prove it.)” He objected by reconstructing McCawley’s argument in a peculiar and ugly way; in fact, in a way that lends credence to Lakoff’s charge of willful distortion.6 But there is a more bizarre element in the story: McCawley had written Chomsky to repudiate his reconstruction long before it was published. Chomsky was nonplussed. He wrote McCawley back, maintaining that his reconstruction was accurate and, in fact, that McCawley was confused about what his own paper says. McCawley tried again a few times before it went to press, with similar results. Additionally, there was also a more explicit version of McCawley’s argument (1976b [1967]:121–32) available several years before Chomsky’s criticisms went to press.

也许乔姆斯基真的看不懂麦考利在说什么——在争论过程中发生了更奇怪的事情——但他对此事的处理表明，乔姆斯基完全不愿意以任何善意来看待他以前学生的作品，而他坚持发表麦考利明确拒绝的误解，从最宽容的解释来看，也表明他明显对和谐解决争论缺乏兴趣。一种不那么宽容的解释——即到目前为止，对许多生成语义学家来说已成为第二天性的解释——更多的是欺骗而不是冷漠。而且，无论是欺骗还是冷漠，乔姆斯基坚持认为他比麦考利本人更能判断麦考利的论点，这至少体现了一种惊人的傲慢。

Perhaps Chomsky genuinely could not see what McCawley was saying—stranger things happened in the course of the dispute—but his treatment of it suggests how completely unwilling Chomsky was to view his former students’ work with any charity, and his insistence on publishing a misconstrual that McCawley explicitly rejected shows, in the most generous interpretation, a distinct lack of interest in harmoniously resolving the debate. A less gracious interpretation—that is, an interpretation of the sort which, by this point, was second nature to many generative semanticists—has more deceit than disinterest about it. And, deceit or disinterest, there was (at minimum) a remarkable arrogance in Chomsky’s insistence that he was a better judge of what McCawley’s argument said than McCawley himself was.

然而，简而言之，这种对哈勒三段论的使用，虽然形式上要弱得多，但与原三段论的效果大致相同。它激起了人们的敌意。那些愿意相信它的人，相信了（尽管并非毫无保留）。那些不愿意相信它的人，不相信。特别是，解释阵营几乎认为“ [各自的]论点已被乔姆斯基有效驳斥”(Wassow, 1976:288)，并认为案件已经结束。在乔姆斯基的误解烟花消退后，除了麦考利，没有人太关注它，这是有充分理由的。7在 McCawley 的领导下，关于深层结构的论据更加​​有力，即无深层结构的词汇插入论据。

The short version, however, is just that this use of the Hallean syllogism, though formally much weaker, had largely the same effect as the original. It stirred up animosities. Those who were prepared to believe it, did (though not without some reservation). Those who were not prepared to believe it, did not. In particular, the interpretive camp felt pretty much that “the [respectively] argument has been effectively refuted by Chomsky” (Wassow, 1976:288), and considered the case closed. No one but McCawley ever paid too much attention to it after the fireworks from Chomsky’s misconstrual died down, and for good reason.7 There was a much stronger class of arguments about deep structure available, again, with McCawley at the helm—the lexical-insertion-without-deep-structure arguments.

图 7.1 .具有深层结构的Aspects模型；不具有深层结构的生成语义。

Figure 7.1. The Aspects model, with deep structure; generative semantics, without.

生成语义学家攻击深层结构的主要策略之一就是声称他们没有特别的责任去构建反驳它的论点，举证责任落在它的支持者身上，而不是它的反对者身上。一个常见的生成语义学论点（或者，也许更准确的说是诽谤）是反对深层结构，“在Aspects中，人们只是假设[深层结构] 包含所有词汇项并先于所有转换；没有给出任何论据”（Lakoff，1971b：281）。McCawley 明确地将这一点与 Hallean 三段论和深层结构的存在联系起来：

One of the principal tactics of the generative semanticists in their attack on deep structure was just to claim they had no particular responsibility to construct counter-arguments against it, that the burden of proof fell on its proponents, not on its foes. A familiar generative semantics argument (or, perhaps, aspersion is more accurate) against deep structure was that “it was simply assumed in Aspects that [deep structure] contained all lexical items and preceded all transformations; no arguments were given” (Lakoff, 1971b:281). McCawley connects this point explicitly to the Hallean syllogism and the existence of deep structure:

乔姆斯基的评论 [1966c:48] 指出，“如果语言学家相信……存在一个符合分类音位条件并由语法的音位规则提供的具有语言学意义的表征层次”，那么他负有举证责任。这同样适用于那些相信在语义和表层句法表征之间存在诸如“深层结构”之类的层次的语言学家。（1976b [1968]:170；McCawley 的省略；另见 1976b [1967]:92–93）

Chomsky’s remark [1966c:48] that “the burden of proof is on the linguist who believes … that there is … a linguistically significant level of representation meeting the conditions of taxonomic phonemics and provided by the phonological rules of the grammar” applies equally well to the linguist who believes that a level such as ‘deep structure’ exists intermediate between the semantic and surface syntactic representation. (1976b [1968]:170; McCawley’s elisions; see also 1976b [1967]:92–93)

但乔姆斯基（以及追随他的麦考利）在这里完全颠倒了——举证责任在哈勒身上。他通过提供一个没有音素（或“音位层次”）也能有效运作的音系学模型来满足这个要求。的确，体貌模型并没有为深层结构提供具体的依据，但由于深层结构是整个社区（当然包括所有新兴的生成语义学家）都认为非常有说服力的理论的关键，体貌模型本身实际上是深层结构的延伸论证。更重要的是，历史的发展使具体的依据变得毫无意义：深层结构只是句法结构模型在合并句子词素、取消广义变换、添加语义成分等之后最终得到的结果。用十九世纪一位古板的牧师和精明的修辞学家、善良的沃特利主教的话来说，深层结构占据了转换语法的基础——就像分类音素占据了结构主义音系学的基础一样——而生成语义学不得不将其取代：

But Chomsky (and, in his footsteps, McCawley) has it exactly backwards here—the burden of proof was on Halle. And he met it, by providing a model of phonology that worked efficiently without the phoneme (or “the phonemic level”). It’s true that Aspects does not offer specific justifications for deep structure, but since deep structure was the linchpin of a theory that the entire community—including, of course, all of the budding generative semanticists—found very compelling, the Aspects model itself was quite literally an extended argument for deep structure. More importantly, historical developments made specific justifications moot: deep structure was simply what the Syntactic Structures model ended up with after incorporating sentence morphemes, doing away with generalized transformations, adding a semantic component, and so on. In the terms of the good Bishop Whately, a stuffy cleric and astute rhetorician of the nineteenth century, deep structure preoccupied the ground of transformational grammar—just as the taxonomic phoneme pre-occupied the ground of structuralist phonology—and generative semantics was obliged to dislodge it:

根据该术语的最正确用法，支持任何假设的“推定”并不意味着（有时人们错误地认为）对该假设有利的概率优势，而是一种预先占据的依据，这意味着该假设必须成立，直到有人提出反对它的充分理由为止；简而言之，举证责任在反对该假设的人身上。（1963 [1846]：112；Whately 斜体）

According to the most correct use of the term a “Presumption” in favor of any supposition, means, not (as has been sometimes erroneously imagined) a preponderance of probability in its favour, but a pre-occupation of the ground, as implies that it must stand good till some sufficient reason is adduced against it; in short, that the Burden of Proof lies on the side of him who would dispute it. (1963 [1846]:112; Whately’s italics)

用乔姆斯基更直白、更简洁的话来说：“提供唯一存在理论的人没有举证责任。”8 Halle 的反音位论证“植根于一套全面的音系学理论，其优雅之处在于俄语中高度复杂的音系关系模式的分析就是例证”（Anderson，1985：321）。McCawley 的论证只是附上了一张附言，而在一个表述得相当清楚的理论（Aspects模型）和一个理论的期票（生成语义学）之间做出选择，两者大同小异，只是少了最迷人的元素，根本就不是选择。

In Chomsky’s blunter, more concise terms: “There is no burden of proof on the person who provides the only theory that exists.”8 Halle’s anti-phoneme argument came “embedded in a comprehensive theory of phonology, whose elegance was illustrated by the accompanying analysis of highly complex patterns of phonological relationships in Russian” (Anderson, 1985:321). McCawley’s respectively argument came only with a postscripted IOU, and the choice between a reasonably well articulated theory (the Aspects model) and a promissory note for a theory (generative semantics), much the same but without its most glamorous element, is no choice at all.

无论麦考利当时对举证责任有何评论，他都深知这一点，因此他着手开发一种不需要深层结构的语法模型，并迅速制定了谓语提升和词汇插入提案，波斯特尔和许多其他人都认为这些提案非常有吸引力。9这项工作标志着迈向明确体貌模型的真正替代方案的第一步。回想一下，体貌中的词汇和深层结构之间的关系是这样的：(1) 几乎所有词汇项目都出现在深层结构中，(2) 所有转换都随后发生（如图 4.3 所示）。McCawley 的谓词提升必然先于至少一些词汇插入规则（因为它将深层谓词收集在一起，并通过将STRIKES LIKE替换为reminders的词汇插入规则将底层字符串（如Jones STRIKES me as LIKE a monkey ）转换为句子（如Jones reminders me of a monkey）。因此，由于某些转换先于某些词汇插入，因此最终的语法不可能包含体貌级别的深层结构。

McCawley, whatever he said at the time about burden of proof, knew better, and accordingly set right to work on developing a grammatical model that could get by without deep structure, rapidly formulating the Predicate-raising and lexical-insertion proposals that Postal, and a lot of others, found so winning.9 This work marked the first real step toward the articulation of a genuine alternative to the Aspects model. Recall that the relation between the lexicon and deep structure in Aspects is such that (1) virtually all lexical items show up at deep structure, and (2) all transformations occur subsequently (as in figure 4.3). McCawley’s Predicate-raising necessarily precedes at least some lexical insertion rules (since it collects deep predicates together and turns underlying strings like Jones STRIKES me as LIKE a monkey into sentences like Jones reminds me of a monkey by a lexical insertion rule that replaces STRIKES LIKE with reminds). The resulting grammar, with some transformations preceding some lexical insertions, could not, therefore, include an Aspects level of deep structure.

生成语义学家将 McCawley 的谓词收集提案视为一个词的思想。不仅在很短的时间内提出了针对许多其他词的并行深度谓词分析，而且很快出现了几个支持词汇分解的巧妙论据。10解释语义学家当然得出了完全相反的结论，并迅速收集了反证。许多论文质疑词汇分解的语义含义，最著名的是杰里·福多尔的《不从死亡原因推导出杀戮的三个理由》 （1970 年），该论文以 5a 和 5b 等结构之间的区别为中心：

Generative semanticists took to McCawley’s predicate-collecting proposal like a thought to a word. Not only were parallel deep-predicate analyses proposed in fairly short order for a number of other words, several ingenious support arguments for lexical decomposition quickly sprang up.10 The interpretive semanticists, of course, reached exactly the opposite conclusion, and quickly gathered counter-evidence. Many papers questioned the semantic implications of lexical decomposition, the most renowned being Jerry Fodor’s “Three Reasons for Not Deriving Kill from Cause to Die” (1970), which hinged on distinctions between such structures as 5a and 5b:

5

5

卢克丽霞于星期六用刀刺伤了他们，导致他们在星期日死亡。

a Lucretia caused them to die on Sunday by stabbing them on Saturday.

 

 

b *卢克丽霞于星期六用刀将他们杀害。

b *Lucretia killed them on Sunday by stabbing them on Saturday.

其他解释语义学论点（主要是乔姆斯基的论点）对词汇分解的支持论据的含义提出了质疑。11乔姆斯基还认为谓词提升是一种颠倒的语义解释规则，而且毫无根据，并攻击词汇分解的一般后果，他说，词汇分解会导致诸如一词的“以非法手段和预谋恶意导致死亡”等丑陋的混乱（1972b [1968]：72）。但对麦考利提议最常见的反对意见是，这些提议没有效力，因为谓词提升的唯一作用是使包含词汇分解的理论更容易理解，而解释语义学家拒绝词汇分解。乔姆斯基用转换语法中最尖锐的术语谴责了谓词提升，称其为临时的，因为“被kill取代的单位不是一个构成要素......它通过本来完全不必要的谓词提升规则成为一个构成要素”(1972b[1969]:142)。12

Other interpretive semantics arguments, mostly by Chomsky, contested the implications of the supporting case for lexical decomposition.11 Chomsky also dismissed Predicate-raising as an upside-down semantic interpretation rule, and unmotivated to boot, and attacked the general consequences of lexical decomposition, which, he said, would lead to such ugly conglomerations as CAUSE TO DIE BY UNLAWFUL MEANS AND WITH MALICE AFORETHOUGHT for the word murder (1972b [1968]:72). But the most recurrent objection to McCawley’s proposals was that they had no force because the only job Predicate-raising did was to make things easier for a theory which embraced lexical decomposition, and the interpretive semanticists rejected lexical decomposition. Chomsky denounced Predicate-raising in the most stinging term of transformational grammar, as ad hoc, since “the unit that is replaced by kill is not a constituent… it becomes one by the otherwise quite unnecessary rule of predicate raising” (1972b [1969]:142).12

也就是说，这个论点毫无意义。生成语义学家已经看到McCawley 的提议让他们有理由处理深层结构；解释语义学家认为没有什么能让他们让步。解释的反应相当奇怪，因为没有人（除了 Katz）想要深层结构。生成语义学家想废除术语，而解释语义学家想保留它。但没有人（除了 Katz）想要在Aspects模型中实际贴上该标签的句法级别。生成语义学家希望它更深，而解释语义学家希望它更浅，这让我们想到了 Katz-Postal 原则。

The argument, that is, got nowhere. The generative semanticists saw enough in McCawley’s proposals to warrant their disposal of deep structure; the interpretive semanticists saw nothing to make them budge an inch. The interpretive reaction was pretty odd, given that nobody (except Katz) wanted deep structure anyway. The generative semanticists wanted to do away with the term, and the interpretive semanticists wanted to hang on to it. But nobody (except Katz) wanted the syntactic level that actually wore that label in the Aspects model. The generative semanticists wanted it much deeper, the interpretive semanticists wanted it shallower, which brings us to the Katz-Postal principle.

卡兹-波斯特原则

The Katz-Postal Principle

科学的巨大悲剧——丑陋的事实扼杀了美丽的假设。

The great tragedy of science—the slaying of a beautiful hypothesis by an ugly fact.

赫胥黎

T. H. Huxley

Katz-Postal 原则则不同：关于该原则的争论和反驳非常成功，双向成功，改变了语言理论。首先，几乎所有人都同意，该假设被推翻了。生成语义学保留了它，但形式明显减弱了；解释语义学拒绝了它（同时保留了它的一些含义）。其次，由于意义保存和转换问题引发的问题，这两种理论都发生了显著变化。十三

The Katz-Postal principle is a different story: argument and counter-argument over the principle were very successful, two-ways successful, in modifying linguistic theory. First, as virtually everyone would agree, the hypothesis was disconfirmed. Generative semantics retained it, but in a clearly attenuated form; interpretive semantics rejected it (while retaining some of its implications). Second, both theories changed markedly as a result of the issues raised by the question of meaning preservation and transformations.13

到了 1969 年——1969 年是重要的一年，当时正值德克萨斯语言理论目标会议召开，所有主要参与者都参与其中——乔姆斯基说卡兹-波斯特尔假设是错误的，他的学生每天都在提出新的数据，他们可以将这些数据编造成完全一样的论据。麻省理工学院的大厅里回荡着“卡兹-波斯特尔原则消亡！”

By 1969—and 1969 was an important year, the time of the contentious Texas Conference on the Goals of Linguistic Theory at which all the major players played—Chomsky was saying that the Katz-Postal hypothesis was false, and his students were coming up daily with new data they could fashion into arguments to exactly the same end. “Death to the Katz-Postal principle!” echoed in the halls of MIT.

“Katz-Postal 原则万岁！”在其他走廊里继续回响，但到了 1969 年，它已不再是旧的 Katz-Postal 原则。它已固化为教条。14走向教条主义——在科学中既不罕见也不一定是有害的（例如，见 Popper，1970 [1965]：55，Feyerabend，1978 [1975]：42）——在转型环境中是非常自然的。从哈里斯最早通过触发词素探索同义词关系、抛弃广义转换和设计深层结构开始，整个转型计划已经发展到（如果不是默认的话）卡茨-波斯特尔原则。乔姆斯基在《方面》、《笛卡尔语言学》和《语言与心灵》等著作中将其从启发式提升为假设；下一个合理的步骤是看看通过非常认真地对待它，人们会得到什么样的语法概念，答案就是生成语义学。

“Long live the Katz-Postal principle!” continued to echo in other hallways, but by 1969 it was not the same old Katz-Postal principle. It had hardened into dogma.14 The step to dogma—neither unusual nor necessarily unwholesome in science (see, e.g., Popper, 1970 [1965]:55, Feyerabend, 1978 [1975]:42)—was a very natural one in the transformational milieu. From Harris’s earliest efforts to explore synonymy relations, through trigger morphemes, the discarding of generalized transformations, and the design of deep structure, the entire transformational program had grown toward, if not assumed tacitly, the Katz-Postal principle. Chomsky had upgraded it from a heuristic to a hypothesis in works like Aspects, Cartesian Linguistics, and Language and Mind; the next reasonable step was to see what conception of grammar one got by taking it very seriously, and the answer was generative semantics.

生成语义学对明显违反其定义公理的最早立场是综合理论立场；也就是说，看似与它相反的例子仅仅是错误分析的结果。要么是错误的转换被错误地表述了，要么是数据没有得到充分理解。综合理论和方面在消除违规方面做得非常彻底，事实上，似乎只剩下一大类麻烦的数据，即量词的相对深层和表层结构位置，而生成语义学家在利用这些错误分析类型的论证驯服它们方面取得了很大进展。例如，6a 的传统推导遇到了麻烦，因为它会从 6b 派生而来，从而导致非同义关系和 Katz-Postal 违规。

The earliest position of generative semantics on apparent violations of their defining axiom was the Integrated Theory position; namely, that seeming counterexamples to it were merely the result of bad analyses. Either the offending transformation had been wrongly formulated or the data was insufficiently understood. Integrated Theory and Aspects had done such a thorough job banishing violations, in fact, that there seemed only to be one major class of troublesome data left, the relative deep and surface structure locations of quantifiers, and the generative semanticists made a good deal of progress taming them with these faulty-analyses sorts of arguments. For instance, the conventional derivation for 6a ran into trouble, since it would derive from 6b, resulting in a nonsynonymous relation and a Katz-Postal violation.

6

6

a 每个人都期望永生。

a Everyone expects to live forever.

 

 

b 每个人都期望每个人都能永生。

b Everyone expects everyone to live forever.

但 Carden (1968) 认为 6a 和 6b 的深层结构来源应该分别类似于 7a 和 7b：15

But Carden argued (1968) that the deep structure sources for 6a and 6b should be, respectively, something like 7a and 7b:15

7

7

我期望每一个人都能永远活下去

a every onei expects onei to live forever

 

 

b 每个人都希望自己能永生

b every one expects every one to live forever

拉科夫 (Lakoff) 对 8a 这样的句子进行了类似的重新分析，其中Aspects源自 8b（违反 Katz-Postal 的句子），但他说 8b 应该来自 8c（维持 Katz-Postal 的句子）。

Lakoff wove similar re-analyses around sentences like 8a, which Aspects would derive from (the Katz-Postal violating) 8b, but which he said ought to come from (the Katz-Postal maintaining) 8c.

8

8

一些律师既受欢迎，又取得成功。

a Few lawyers are both popular and successful.

 

 

b 受欢迎的律师很少，成功的律师也很少

b few lawyers are popular and few lawyers are successful

 

 

c 既受欢迎又成功的律师很少

c lawyers who are both popular and successful are few

但乔姆斯基忙碌的解释学家们不断发现越来越多的此类例子，量词的深层结构位置支持一种解读，而经过某些转换错位后，表层结构位置又支持另一种解读。解释语义学家利用这些论点来证明对 Aspects语义成分的重大革新是合理的，尽管革新非常模糊：深层结构继续为语义成分提供有关语法关系和词汇内容的信息，但表层结构现在为其提供有关逻辑元素（如量词和否定词）的信息。这一变化产生了更强大的语义成分，大多数语言学家对此非常紧张。但未来还会有更多的变化。

But Chomsky’s busy interpretivists kept finding more and more examples of this sort, where the deep structure position of quantifiers supported one reading and, after certain transformational derangements, the surface structure position supported another. Interpretive semanticists used these arguments to justify a major renovation of the Aspects semantic component, albeit a very vaguely adumbrated renovation: the deep structure continued to feed the semantic component information about grammatical relations and lexical content, but the surface structure now fed it information about logical elements (like quantifiers and negatives). This change made for a much more powerful semantic component, which most linguists regarded with a good deal of nervousness. But there were more changes to come.

乔姆斯基（1972b[1969]：180）以他惯常的随意口吻说，语义解释规则必须适用于“深层和表层（或许也包括浅层）结构”。正如他早先暗示表层结构语义规则正在形成一样，他现在暗示，一个新的句法层次，即浅层结构，可能正在形成自己的语义规则补充。16这些规则也没有具体说明。

Chomsky (1972b [1969]:180) says, with his familiar casualness, that semantic interpretation rules must apply “to deep and surface (perhaps also shallow) structure.” Just as he had hinted earlier that surface structure semantic rules were on their way, he was now hinting that a new syntactic level, shallow structure, might be getting its own complement of semantic rules.16 These rules, too, were left unspecified.

将这些空洞的建议以及其他许多建议具体化的任务落到了乔姆斯基的良心人物雷·杰肯多夫 (Ray Jackendoff) 身上。

The task of putting meat on these bony suggestions, and many others, fell to Chomsky’s conscience, Ray Jackendoff.

生成语法中的语义解释

Semantic Interpretation in Generative Grammar

杰肯多夫对[解释语义学]的审美吸引力——或者说缺乏审美吸引力——直言不讳。他承认，如果所有的语义解释都发生在一个单一的层面上，那么画面会更漂亮，但他坚持认为事实与这种假设相悖。

Jackendoff is quite candid about the aesthetic appeal of [interpretive semantics]—or lack of it. He admits that the picture would be prettier if all semantic interpretation took place at a single level, but maintains that the facts militate against such an assumption.

迈克尔·卡克

Michael Kac

早年，李斯被称为“乔姆斯基版的赫胥黎”，这有一定的道理，但这个称呼至少也适用于杰肯道夫。就像 TH 赫胥黎和自然选择一样，杰肯道夫作为少数特权群体的一部分，直接从源头获得了“评论”材料，而且是在大多数领域甚至还没有听说过它之前：

Lees was called “Chomsky’s Huxley” in the early years, with a certain appropriateness, but the phrase holds at least as well of Jackendoff. Like T. H. Huxley and natural selection, Jackendoff had the “Remarks” material as part of a small privileged group, directly from the source, and at length, before most of the field had even heard of it:

我听了讲座。这和读论文不同。讲座内容更加充实。他可能花了大半个学期的时间来讲解这些内容。

I heard the lectures. That’s different from reading the paper. They were more fleshed out. It took him probably the better part of a semester to cover that material.

这两种情况的陈述也都充满活力。杰肯多夫一开始并没有像赫胥黎那样强烈反对，但他同样对这项工作提出了反对意见，乔姆斯基对此感到满意，他目睹了莱科夫和其他人更加敌对的反对意见，乔姆斯基也对此感到满意。（事实上，顽固、挑衅的生成语义学家不断对“评论”提案提出反对意见，很可能让整个解释语义学界有一种共同目标的感觉，而不是破坏他们的决心。达尔文、赫胥黎和胡克之间的信件中也出现了同样的阴谋情谊，他们讨论了对手的一些愚蠢行为。）尽管乔姆斯基不像达尔文那样害怕战斗，但他不愿卷入令人讨厌的公开争论。17杰肯多夫在辩论领域表现出了赫胥黎所有的矜持，不仅抨击罗斯、莱科夫和麦考利（他们只是比他年长几岁的职业专家），还抨击了更为强大的邮政。他还多次展示了巧妙地利用党派科学来取悦他们中最好的人的能力——例如，将他认可的约束称为“复杂 NP 约束”（而不是“罗斯的复杂 NP 约束”），而将他不认可的约束称为“邮政交叉条件”（1968 年）。受欢迎的提议只是提议，不受欢迎的提议则是特定坏人的错误。

In both cases, the presentation was also dynamic. Jackendoff did not begin with as much resistance as Huxley did, but he similarly raised objections to the work, which Chomsky settled to his satisfaction, and he witnessed the considerably more hostile objections of Lakoff and others, which Chomsky also settled to his satisfaction. (Indeed, having the recalcitrant, baiting, generative semanticists constantly raising objections to the “Remarks” proposals likely gave the entire interpretive semantics community a sense of shared purpose, rather than undermining their resolve. The same sense of conspiratorial camaraderie shows up in the letters among Darwin, Huxley, and Hooker, discussing some of their opponents’ blockheadedness.) And, while Chomsky is not as shy of combat as Darwin was, he is reluctant to become involved in nasty public disputations.17 Jackendoff showed all the reserve of Huxley in the area of disputation, tearing into not just Ross and Lakoff and McCawley (who were his professional seniors by only a few years), but into the considerably more formidable Postal as well. He also showed, repeatedly, the subtle ability to play partisan science with the best of them—such as calling a constraint he endorses “the Complex NP Constraint” (not “Ross’s Complex NP Constraint”), and one he doesn’t endorse “the Postal Crossover Condition” (1968). The favored proposals are just proposals, the unfavored ones are errors by specific bad guys.

然而，赫胥黎的角色与杰肯道夫的角色之间存在着重大差异，这就是“良心”的由来。赫胥黎在很大程度上阐述并重新表述了达尔文细致入微的论证，而杰肯道夫则阐述并扩展了乔姆斯基的观点，对一些建议进行了相当形式化的充实，就连坚定不移的忠诚的杰肯道夫也称之为“粗略而程序化的”(1977:xi)。18就好像达尔文在 1858 年向林奈学会提交论文后就放弃了，而赫胥黎自己写了《人类的起源》和《人类的由来》。或者，如果要在这个方面找到一个比赫胥黎和达尔文更好的类比，我们可以简单地用开普勒和哥白尼来类比。就像开普勒的椭圆轨道一样，杰肯多夫为乔姆斯基的一些美丽的空灵提议赋予的形式违背了他自己的审美观念；它很丑陋，但却有效。

There is a major difference between Huxley’s role and Jackendoff’s, however, which is where “conscience” comes in. While Huxley largely explicated and rephrased the meticulously detailed arguments of Darwin, Jackendoff elaborated and expanded Chomsky, putting considerable formal flesh on suggestions that even the unflaggingly faithful Jackendoff called “sketchy and programmatic” (1977:xi).18 It is as if Darwin had quit after his 1858 paper to the Linnean Society and Huxley had written Origin and The Descent of Man himself. Or, fishing for a better analogy than Huxley to Darwin on this front, we might settle briefly on Kepler to Copernicus. Like Kepler’s elliptical orbits, the form that Jackendoff gave to some of Chomsky’s beautiful airy proposals violated his own sense of aesthetics; it was ugly, but it worked.

不管怎样类比，杰肯多夫都是解释语义学的英雄。还有其他人——尤其是阿德里安·阿克马吉安和约瑟夫·埃蒙兹（道尔蒂是一位辩论家，仅此而已）——但除了乔姆斯基之外，没有人在对解释主义辩论的贡献方面能与他相提并论，无论是积极的（支持词汇主义、-句法和后深层结构语义解释）还是消极​​的（诋毁卡茨-波斯特尔原则）。事实上，在某些方面，他的贡献比乔姆斯基更大；当然，他的贡献更持久、更全面、更严格。如果我们回顾一下历史的长远观点，他的英雄主义程度就一目了然了。乔姆斯基的理论发展一般被认为是断断续续的语法理论可以分为四种主要语法模型（有时也称“四种主要理论”，但与乔姆斯基相关的理论数量远超四种）。它们一般被称为早期转换理论、标准理论、扩展标准理论和治理与约束理论。除一种模型外，每种模型都与乔姆斯基的一篇主要著作有关：《句法结构》（或更确切地说，《语言理论的逻辑结构》）与早期理论有关，《方面》与标准理论有关， 《治理与约束讲座》与他最近的模型有关（分别是 1957a、1975a [1955]、1965 [1964] 和 1981a [1979]）。扩展标准理论是个例外，与之相关的主要著作不是乔姆斯基写的，而是杰肯多夫的《生成语法中的语义解释》（1972 年）。19

Whatever the analogy, Jackendoff is a hero in the tale of interpretive semantics. There were others—especially Adrian Akmajian and Joseph Emonds (Dougherty was a polemicist and little more)—but aside from Chomsky, no one else came anywhere close to him in terms of a contribution to the interpretivist side of the debate, both positively (in supporting lexicalism, -syntax, and post-deep structure semantic interpretation) and negatively (in discrediting the Katz-Postal principle). Indeed, in some ways, his contribution was more substantial than Chomsky’s; certainly it was more sustained, more comprehensive, and considerably more rigorous. The level of his heroism is clear if we step back into the historical long view for a moment. Chomsky’s theoretical development is generally said to be punctuated by four main grammatical models (or, sometimes, “four main theories,” though the number of theories associated with Chomsky is exponentially higher than four). They generally go by the names early transformational theory, the standard theory, the extended standard theory, and government-and-binding theory. Each of these models but one is associated with a major Chomsky text: Syntactic Structures (or, more properly, Logical Structure of Linguistic Theory) for the early theory, Aspects for the standard theory, and Lectures on Government and Binding for his most recent model (respectively, 1957a, 1975a [1955], 1965 [1964], and 1981a [1979]). The odd model out is the extended standard theory, and the major text associated with it is not by Chomsky. It is Jackendoff’s Semantic Interpretation in Generative Grammar (1972).19

如果乔姆斯基的核心“评论”提案保持他在 1967 年留下的原样，那么很有可能会很少有语言学家被它们吸引；乔姆斯基反生成语义学三部曲中的另外两篇论文——“深层结构”和“一些经验问题”——在细节上比“评论”要短得多。它们都是重要的论据集合，解释语义学家几乎一致地认为它们对任何形式的生成语义学都是致命的；它们是极其有效的修辞著作，彻底改变了辩论的议程；它们触及了自那以后一直是该领域中心话题的一系列问题。尽管如此，它们只不过是负面批评的目录，只伴随着最隐晦的正面建议。最让生成语义学家不安的是，它们强烈暗示乔姆斯基没有责任对他引入的现象提供正面解释。例如，他将焦点和预设的概念带入了辩论，认为生成语义学不能充分解释它们，但就他自己的模型而言，他只是说“这些概念似乎在本质上涉及表层结构”（1972b [1968]：101）。杰肯多夫（1972：229-78）提出了具体的建议，说明表层结构可能如何参与，以及语义学如何理解它，就像他对当时几乎所有其他棘手问题所做的那样——语法关系、代词、情态动词、否定、量词——甚至在语调意义这个非常模糊的领域取得了一些成功。

If Chomsky’s central “Remarks” proposals had stayed as he left them in 1967, it is a very good bet that many fewer linguists would have been drawn to them; the other two papers in Chomsky’s anti-generative semantics trilogy—“Deep Structure” and “Some Empirical Issues”—are a great deal shorter on details even than “Remarks.” They are both important collections of arguments, which interpretive semanticists, virtually en bloc, regarded as lethal to any form of generative semantics; they are extremely effective works of rhetoric, completely shifting the agenda of the debate; and they touch on a number of issues that have been central topics in the field ever since. All the same, they are little more than catalogs of negative criticisms, attended by only the most allusive positive suggestions. Most disturbingly to the generative semanticists, they carry the strong implication that Chomsky has no responsibility to provide positive accounts of the phenomena he introduces. For instance, he brings the notions of focus and presupposition into the debate, arguing that generative semantics can’t adequately account for them, but where his own model is concerned, he goes little further than the remark “these notions seem to involve surface structure in an essential way” (1972b [1968]:101). Jackendoff was the one (1972:229–78) who offered concrete proposals for how surface structure might be involved, and how the semantics might be able to make sense of it, just as he did for virtually every other thorny issue of the day—grammatical relations, pronouns, modals, negation, quantifiers—even venturing with some success into the very murky regions of intonational meaning.

当他建造出可以完成这些艰巨任务的鲁布·戈德堡装置时，《评论》的主要思想在很大程度上被忽视了。乔姆斯基（除了一些非常粗略的讨论——例如 1972b [1969]:158–62）没有重新审视这些思想，而他的其他学生，尽管对词汇学家这个名字有着图腾般的认同，也没有进一步发展这些思想。甚至杰肯多夫一开始似乎也不愿意接受这些思想。20

While he was building the Rube Goldberg contraption that could accomplish these daunting tasks, the major ideas of “Remarks” were largely neglected. Chomsky (except for very cursory discussions—e.g., 1972b [1969]:158–62) had not revisited them, and his other students, despite a totemic identification with the name lexicalists, had taken them no further. Even Jackendoff appeared reluctant to embrace them at first.20

但他的犹豫与其说是因为尴尬，不如说是因为时间不够。词汇假说和- 语法都是非常复杂的概念，如果认真地探索它们，就意味着放弃杰肯多夫认为更紧迫的项目，即为后深层结构语义学辩护——当然，更紧迫，因为它对生成语义学更具破坏性。在提出这一辩护后，他在《语义解释》中首先转向了冗余规则，这些规则是赋予词汇假说一些形式实质所必需的，然后转向了 -符号，这是赋予该假说一些解释能力所必需的——同时保持强烈反对生成语义学。这些离题的攻击有些让旁观的读者感到厌烦——迈克尔·卡克 (Michael Kac) 在《语义解释》的评论中指责杰肯道夫把他相当的技能浪费在“毫无意义的辩论练习”上，并“故意狭隘”，“想在宗派辩论中得分”(Kac, 1975:30)——但正是这些宗派能量让他的想象力保持旺盛。

But his reluctance had less to do with embarrassment than with a lack of time. Both the lexicalist hypothesis and -syntax are very ramified ideas, and exploring them with any seriousness would have meant dropping the project Jackendoff found more urgent, justifying post-deep structure semantics—more urgent, of course, because more devastating to generative semantics. Once he had offered that justification, in Semantic Interpretation, he turned first to the redundancy rules necessary to give the lexical hypothesis some formal substance, then to -notation, necessary to give the hypothesis some explanatory capacity—all the while maintaining a fervent opposition to generative semantics. Some of these digressive attacks were annoying to readers on the sidelines—Michael Kac’s review of Semantic Interpretation indicted Jackendoff for squandering his considerable skill “in meaningless polemical exercises” and with “deliberate parochialism” and with “the desire to score points in a sectarian debate” (Kac, 1975:30)—but those sectarian energies are what kept his imagination fired.

《语义解释》中详细描述的模型其实很朴实，尤其是与Aspects模型和生成语义学相比，这两个模型在黑板上看起来都很不错。Aspects模型有一个有序的语义组件，它只关注深层结构中的派生（图 4.1）。它的语义规则都是同一类型，并且它们每次派生都会产生一个语义表示。生成语义模型有一个语义组件，它实际上构成了深层结构（图 5.3）。它的语义规则不仅完全相同，而且与它的句法规则相同；即转换。每个派生只有一个语义表示。然而，Jackendoff 的模型几乎可以随心所欲地关注派生。它从一开始就废除了转换语法的指导原则，即每个派生都有一个语义表示；Jackendoff 的派生有四个不同的语义表示。21

The model lovingly detailed in Semantic Interpretation is a pretty homely beast, particularly in light of the Aspects model and generative semantics, both of which look very good on a blackboard. The Aspects model had an orderly semantic component that looked in on a derivation at deep structure, and only at deep structure (figure 4.1). Its semantic rules were all of the same type, and they produced one semantic representation per derivation. The generative semantics model had a semantic component that, to all effects, constituted deep structure (figure 5.3). Its semantic rules were not only all the same, they were also the same as its syntactic rules; namely, transformations. There was only one semantic representation per derivation. Jackendoff’s model, though, looked in on a derivation virtually at will. And it did away with a guiding principle of transformational grammar from the outset, that each derivation has a single semantic representation; Jackendoff’s derivations had four distinct semantic representations.21

此外，Aspects通过消除其中的一个规则类，降低了 Katz-Fodor 语义模型的复杂性。生成语义学完全消除了语义解释规则，将其工作交给了转换。语义解释增加了三类新的语义规则，每类规则都产生自己的语义表示。更糟糕的是，Jackendoff 的模型还包含自 20 世纪 60 年代中期以来进入该领域的其他一些理论工具 — 词汇冗余规则、输出约束、转换条件等。图 7.2给出了语义解释模型（Jackendoff 自己提出的模型）的一个相对保守的图表。Jackendoff 现在这样评价这个模型：“我敢肯定，每个人都认为它很古怪，虽然没有人当面抱怨。[他们一定认为]‘那真是太古怪了。如果语义解释是那样的，那就忘了它吧。’”22

Moreover, Aspects had reduced the complexity of the Katz-Fodor semantic model by eliminating one of their rule classes. Generative semantics had eliminated semantic interpretation rules altogether, giving their job over to transformations. Semantic Interpretation added three new classes of semantic rules, each of which produced its own semantic representation. To make things worse yet, Jackendoff’s model also had several other bits and pieces of theoretical paraphernalia that had entered the field since the mid-sixties—lexical redundancy rules, output constraints, conditions on transformations, and the like. A relatively conservative diagram of the Semantic Interpretation model (the one that Jackendoff himself presents) is given in figure 7.2. Jackendoff now says of this model, “I’m sure everybody thought that it was off-the-wall and weird, although nobody complained to my face. [They must have thought] ‘that is really wacko. If semantic interpretation is like that, forget it.’”22

图 7.2 . Jackendoff 的解释主义语法（改编自 Jackendoff, 1972:4）。

Figure 7.2. Jackendoff’s interpretivist grammar (adapted from Jackendoff, 1972:4).

相反，许多人的想法恰恰相反：如果语义解释是那样的话，它就需要密切关注；它需要被清理，而不是被丢弃。生成语法中的语义解释是一种赞同的修辞，它很少不言而喻。几乎每一个负面批评都会被一个积极的建议所抵消。23

On the contrary, many people thought exactly the opposite: if semantic interpretation was like that, it needed close attention; it needed to be cleaned up, not discarded. Semantic Interpretation in Generative Grammar is a rhetoric of assent which rarely fails to put its money where its mouth is. Virtually every negative criticism is balanced by a positive proposal.23

再次回顾 Katz-Postal 原则

The Katz-Postal Principle Again

过去五年来，转换生成语法显然远未成为人类语言的充分理论。我们这些试图使转换语法发挥作用的人，曾试图用一个又一个的临时手段来修补经典理论：我的例外理论、罗斯对移动转换的限制、罗斯-珀尔马特输出条件、波斯特尔的交叉原则和首语岛限制、杰肯多夫的表面解释规则、乔姆斯基的词汇冗余规则和他的类比成分，等等……这些临时修补尝试中的大多数（如果不是全部的话）都是单一普遍现象的特殊情况：全局派生限制。

It has become clear over the past five years that Transformational Generative Grammar is nowhere near being an adequate theory of human language. Those of us who have tried to make Transformational Grammar work have attempted to patch up the classical theory with one ad hoc device after another: my theory of exceptions, Ross’s constraints on movement transformations, the Ross-Perlmutter output conditions, Postal’s Crossover principle and anaphoric island constraints, Jackendoff’s surface interpretation rules, Chomsky’s lexical redundancy rules and his analogy component, and so on…. Most, if not all, of these ad hoc patching attempts [are] special cases of a single general phenomenon: global derivational constraints.

乔治·莱考夫24

George Lakoff24

乔姆斯基的提议有了一定内容之后，解释语义学就变成了完全不同的野兽，而且更加笨拙。但是，出于同样的原因，生成语义学阵营中也出现了丑化现象。解释学家的研究不断得出与卡茨-波斯特原则相悖的数据，而这些数据对于以整合理论方法重构分析为模型的论证来说太过分了。杰肯多夫和乔姆斯基毫不犹豫地放弃了卡茨-波斯特原则，大大丰富了语义成分。但是，如果没有某种形式的原则，生成语义学就无法理解，而且它没有可以丰富语义成分的概念（不同于语法）。只有两种可能的选择，要么放弃理论，要么以一种保留卡茨-波斯特原则的较弱版本的方式丰富同质化规则系统。除了争论的辩证压力使得向乔姆斯基的新观点屈服变得不可能之外，生成语义学家还认为该观点基本上放弃了对现实意义解释的任何希望。

Interpretive semantics was a very different beast, and a much lumpier one, once Chomsky’s proposals got a little meat on their bones. But there was uglification going on in the generative semantics camp, for much the same reasons. The sort of data that the interpretivists’ research kept turning up against the Katz-Postal principle proved too much for arguments modeled on the Integrated Theory approach of reconfiguring analyses. Jackendoff and Chomsky had no trouble abandoning the Katz-Postal principle by enriching the semantic component substantially. But generative semantics was incomprehensible without some form of the principle, and it had no concept of a semantic component, distinct from syntax, which it could enrich. There were only two conceivable options, abandon the theory, or enrich the homogenized rule system in a way that would preserve a weaker version of the Katz-Postal principle. Aside from the dialectical pressures of the dispute, which would have made surrendering to Chomsky’s new vision impossible, the generative semanticists also saw that vision as essentially abandoning any hope for a realistic account of meaning.

他们中的大多数人都对杰肯道夫的独创性以及他愿意面对数据含义的态度表示敬意，而乔姆斯基显然对数据含义不感兴趣，因为数据已经满足了他的反生成语义学的目的。但是他们认为杰肯道夫的努力只是在一堵墙中无休止地、徒劳无功地打补丁，而这堵墙是为了人为地将意义和结构分开而建的；当Aspects版本的深层结构不够强大时，解释人员就会调用表层结构，然后是浅层结构，然后在每个循环结束时反复调用无名结构层（图 7.2）。

Most of them had a good deal of respect for Jackendoff’s ingenuity, and for his willingness to confront the implications of data that Chomsky apparently had no interest in once it had served his anti-generative semantics purposes. But they regarded Jackendoff’s efforts as an endless, fruitless, series of patches in a wall built to keep meaning and structure artificially apart; when the Aspects version of deep structure wasn’t strong enough, the interpretive crew invoked surface structure, and then shallow structure, and then, recurrently, the nameless structural levels at the end of each cycle (figure 7.2).

生成语义学家认为，正确的做法是承认这堵墙是人为的，承认语义和句法如此彻底地混合在一起以至于对两者进行独立解释都是徒劳的。在承认了这一点之后，语言学的真正任务就是在这堆乱七八糟的东西中找到秩序；卡兹-波斯特原则看起来仍然是这方面的最佳选择，即使是在妥协的形式下，而一种新的规则类型看起来只是为维护它付出的很小的代价。

Generative semanticists felt the right approach was simply to admit the artificiality of that wall, to acknowledge semantics and syntax intermingled so thoroughly as to make autonomous accounts of either futile. Having made this admission, the real task of linguistics was then to find the order in this gumbo; the Katz-Postal principle still looked to be the best bet on this front, even in a compromised form, and one new rule type looked a small price to pay for its maintenance.

这种新的规则类型是由莱考夫引入的，他当时正迅速成为最杰出的生成语义学家，并立即得到了其他三位领导人的认可；而以乔姆斯基为首的解释派则惊慌失措。莱考夫提议 (1970b；1971b：238ff) 结合他称之为全局派生约束（简称全局规则）的手段，将理论带入波斯特尔所说的“同质 II”阶段。简而言之，全局规则认识到某些转换可以改变词语的关系，使得相同派生的深层和表层结构可以支持不同的语义解读；然而，它们禁止这种派生。转换改变含义的派生被排除在理论之外。

This new rule type was introduced by Lakoff, who was rapidly becoming the most prominent generative semanticist, and was immediately endorsed by the other three leaders; the interpretive camp, led by Chomsky, threw up its hands in horror. Lakoff proposed (1970b; 1971b:238ff) to incorporate devices he called global derivational constraints (global rules, for short), moving the theory into what Postal called its Homogeneous II phase. In brief, global rules recognize that some transformations can alter the relations of words such that deep and surface structures of the same derivation could support different semantic readings; however, they outlaw such derivations. Derivations in which transformations change meaning were legislated out of the theory.

借用《逻辑结构》（Chomsky, 1975a [1955]:146）的类比，早期的转换理论可以生成类似下面这 9 个句子：

To take an analogy from Logical Structure (Chomsky, 1975a [1955]:146), early transformational theory allows the generation of sentences like the famous 9:

9

9

无色的绿色思想疯狂地沉睡。

Colorless green ideas sleep furiously.

但语法拒绝了它，因为它没有达到“最高程度（一级）语法性”（1975a [1955]：154）。Katz 和 Fodor 采用了同样的方法，让语义组件无法为其返回任何语义读物。我们之前看过的这种一般攻击计划被称为Aspects术语过滤。

But the grammar rejects it for not achieving “the highest degree (first order) of grammaticality” (1975a [1955]:154). Katz and Fodor adopted the same sort of approach, by having the semantic component fail to return any semantic reading for it. This general plan of attack, which we looked at a little earlier, was known by the Aspects term, filtering.

当句子 10a 这样的句子源自诸如 10b 这样的底层结构（从而违反了 Katz-Postal 原则）时，Lakoff 只是将过滤方法扩展到这些句子；根据全局规则，为了合法，句子 10a 必须源自 10c。

Lakoff simply extended the filtering approach to sentences like 10a when they derive from underlying structures like 10b (and thereby violate the Katz-Postal principle); in order to be legitimate, the global rule stipulates, 10a must arise from 10c.

10

10

少数书籍能被许多人阅读。

a Few books are read by many men.

 

 

b 许多人读书不多。

b Many men read few books.

 

 

c 许多人读的书很少（Lakoff，1971b：238–39）

c Few are the books that many men read (Lakoff, 1971b:238–39)

仅转换规则允许从 10b 或 10c 推导出 10a，但全局规则使 10b ⇒ 10a 推导不合法，并且 Katz-Postal 原则得以维持。本质上，我们拥有的是一个语义输出条件。但有一个问题。该原则以一种令人不舒服的人为方式维持：实际上，通过完全循环的方式。Katz-Postal 原则认为转换不能改变含义，而 Lakoff 认为像 10b ⇒ 10a 这样的推导是不合法的，因为它们涉及含义的转换变化（参见 1971b:240）。

Transformational rules alone permit the derivation of 10a from 10b or 10c, but a global rule makes the 10b ⇒ 10a derivation illegitimate, and the Katz-Postal principle is maintained. Essentially, what we have is a semantic output condition. But there’s a problem. The principle is maintained in an uncomfortably artificial way: indeed, by entirely circular means. The Katz-Postal principle says that transformations can’t change meaning, and Lakoff argues that derivations like 10b ⇒ 10a are illegitimate because they involve a transformational change in meaning (see especially 1971b:240).

Katz-Postal 原则不容违反，因为 Katz-Postal 原则不容违反。

The Katz-Postal principle cannot be violated because the Katz-Postal principle cannot be violated.

因此，从某种角度来看，全局规则承认卡茨-波斯特假设是错误的，因为只有规定才能防止违反，因此，它们使整个生成语义学程序失效。当然，大多数解释语义学家以及一些生成语义学家都是这样看待它的，而乔姆斯基仍然当他说生成语义学“很早就被证明是错误的”时，他心里想的是量词和全局规则。

From one perspective, then, global rules admit the falsification of the Katz-Postal hypothesis, since only stipulation prevents a violation, and, therefore, they vitiate the entire generative semantics program. Certainly that’s the way most interpretive semanticists, as well as a few generative semanticists, saw it, and Chomsky still has quantifiers and global rules in mind when he says that generative semantics “was proven wrong, very early.”

但是，Lakoff 有力地论证说，全局规则是完全非语义的必要规则。特别是，他指出，分裂双方已经采用的许多非转换规则类型（如 Ross 的岛屿约束、Postal 的交叉原则、Perlmutter 的输出条件）具有类似的描述能力。然后，还有在转换语法中大量涌现并在Aspects中编纂的规则的整个一般条件——排序、循环、删除的可恢复性、Katz-Postal 原则——这些规则的具体内容并不重要，但它们构成了一个包含额外转换好东西的多节包。因此，Lakoff 问道，既然“无论人们对生成语义和解释语义的相对优点持何种立场，全局规则都是必要的”（1970b:638n9），为什么不使用它们来保存维持 Katz-Postal 原则所必需的语义现象呢？

But, Lakoff argues compellingly, global rules are necessary for completely nonsemantic reasons. In particular, he points out that a number of non-transformational rule types which both sides of the schism had already adopted (like Ross’s island constraints, Postal’s Crossover principle, Perlmutter’s output conditions) have similar descriptive powers. And then there is the whole panoply of general conditions on rules that had mushroomed in transformational grammar and was codified in Aspects—ordering, cyclicity, recoverability of deletion, the Katz-Postal principle—the specifics of which aren’t important, but which formed a knobby bag of extra-transformational goodies. Therefore, Lakoff asks, since “global rules are necessary, whatever position one takes on the relative merits of generative and interpretive semantics” (1970b:638n9), why not use them to save the semantic phenonema necessary to maintain the Katz-Postal principle?

全局规则，因为它们涉及派生中不相邻短语标记之间的某种直接通信（如上文中“ many men-few books”示例中的深层结构和表层结构），引发了许多复杂问题，这些复杂问题严重导致了生成语义学的衰落，我们将很快对此进行研究，目前尚不清楚 Lakoff 是否除了在多节包上印上名字之外还做了其他什么。但目前，我们可以给他最后发言权，指出全局规则相对于合并几类不同语义规则所带来的美学和概念混乱具有明显的优势：

Global rules, because they involve a sort of direct communication between noncontiguous phrase markers in a derivation (like deep and surface structure in the many men-few books example above), raise a number of complications that contributed heavily to the downfall of generative semantics, which we will investigate shortly, and it’s not clear that Lakoff did any more than stencil a name onto the knobby bag. But, for the moment, we can give him the last word, pointing to a definite advantage of global rules over the aesthetic and conceptual messiness of incorporating several distinct classes of semantic rules:

对于每一种不同的情况，[Chomsky] 不会提出一条不同的规则，而是提出一种不同类型的规则，为语法理论添加一种新类型的理论手段来满足每一种新的全局规则的发现。

For each different case [Chomsky] would propose not a different rule, but a different KIND of rule, adding a new type of theoretical apparatus to the theory of grammar for each new global rule discovered.

遭遇这样的态度真是令人悲伤又奇怪。（1970b：637；Lakoff 强调）

It is sad and strange to encounter such [an attitude]. (1970b:637; Lakoff’s emphasis)

限制性

Restrictiveness

1969 年 5 月 27 日：乔治·莱考夫发现了全球规则。马萨诸塞州剑桥市的超市里，罐头食品被疯狂抢购一空。

May 27, 1969: George Lakoff discovers the global rule. Supermarkets in Cambridge, Mass., are struck by frenzied buying of canned goods.



James McCawley 的“语言学家感兴趣的五月份日期”条目

entry in James McCawley’s

“Dates in the Month of May That Are of Interest to Linguists”

乔姆斯基的反生成语义学运动有几个阶段，每个阶段都为自己的模型定义了一个新的方向。首先，他用“注释”提案破坏了抽象语法，然后他通过推广表面结构影响意义的论点来攻击卡茨-波斯特尔原则，然后，在回应波斯特尔的“最佳理论”时，他攻击生成语义学的描述性。前两种方法——词汇主义和后深层结构语义学——除了他的直接学生外，没有引起任何人的共鸣。但最糟糕的理论论点击中了要害。

Chomsky’s anti-generative semantics campaign had several stages, each one defining a new direction for its own model. First, he undermined abstract syntax with the “Remarks” proposals, then he attacked the Katz-Postal principle by promoting the surface-structure-impinges-on-meaning arguments, and then, in his response to Postal’s “The Best Theory,” he attacked generative semantics for its descriptive wantonness. The first two approaches—lexicalism and post-deep structure semantics—failed to resonate with anyone beyond his immediate students. But the worstimaginable-theory argument hit home.
