乔姆斯基说：“转换语法理论的最大弱点在于其巨大的描述能力，而当我们允许转换之外的其他规则（即其他“推导约束”是指“一种类型的‘推导约束’[全局规则]）……任何可以想象的规则都可以被描述为‘对推导的约束’。问题是：除了标准理论允许的规则之外，还需要什么类型的规则（“推导约束”）？”（1972b [1969]：133–34）25乔姆斯基甚至无法忍受在没有引号的净化作用的情况下使用派生约束这个术语（有时甚至通过添加一对括号来使其更加具有约束力），但总体观点是相当清楚的：除非对这个概念进行一定的严格处理，否则它会使语言理论偏离他所认为的首要目标，即限制性。

“The great weakness of the theory of transformational grammar,” Chomsky said, “is its enormous descriptive power, and this deficiency becomes more pronounced to the extent that we permit other rules beyond transformations (i.e., other sorts of ‘derivational constraints’ [global rules]).… Any imaginable rule can be described as a ‘constraint on derivations’. The question is: what kinds of rules (‘derivational constraints’) are needed, if any, beyond those permitted by the standard theory?” (1972b [1969]:133–34)25 Chomsky cannot even bear to use the term derivational constraint without the sanitizing effect of quotation marks (sometimes even double-bagging it by adding a set of parentheses), but the general point is reasonably clear: unless some rigor is brought to the notion, it drives linguistic theory away from what he regards as its primary goal, restrictiveness.

通常，人们认为描述能力是科学的一种美德，而巨大的描述能力是所有科学美德之母。在某些参数范围内，情况确实如此。像天文学和生物学这样的大型描述科学通过拥有巨大的描述范围而获利，从针尖大小的黑洞到脉冲星，从变形虫到大象。但参数极其重要，因为它们代表了科学的极限。天文学不是研究所有具有质量、重量和速度的物体的科学。它所描述的对象不包括 56 年的雪佛兰。生物学不是研究所有消耗和排泄并具有遗传特征的物体的科学。它所描述的对象不包括 56 年的雪佛兰。语言学不是研究所有可能的符号或符号系统的科学。它所描述的对象不包括 56 年的雪佛兰。

Ordinarily, one thinks of descriptive power as a virtue in science, and enormous descriptive power as the mother of all scientific virtues. Within certain parameters, this is indeed the case. Big-time descriptive sciences like astronomy and biology earn their bacon by having enormous descriptive ranges, from pin-size black holes to pulsars, amoebas to elephants. But the parameters are extremely important, because they represent the limits of the science. Astronomy is not the science of all objects with mass and weight and velocity. The objects it describes do not include ’56 Chevies. Biology is not the science of all objects that consume and excrete and have inherited characteristics. The objects it describes do not include ’56 Chevies. Linguistics is not the science of all possible symbols or symbol systems. The objects it describes do not include ’56 Chevies.

语言学是研究自然语言的科学，有许多符号系统不是自然语言。事实上，想出以自然语言所不具备的方式运作的符号系统极其容易。句子可能按单词长度、元音频率或时间顺序排列。问题可能通过颠倒陈述句中的单词顺序、按字母顺序重新排列单词、调换每两个辅音对或只在说话者靠在 56 年的雪佛兰车上时发出来形成。不受约束的转换语法（例如，李氏的《英语名词化》中概述的语法）可以描述所有这些系统，以及更多系统。埃蒙·巴赫说，转换语法非常强大，以至于“一个不太牵强的类比”来描述语言的方式“将是一种无法描述浣熊和灯泡之间差异的生物学理论”（1974:158）。这种丑陋的情况在生成语法中变得更加可怕，因为它具有认知要求。请记住，从本质上讲，转换生成语法应该是心理学上可信的，描述语言使用者耳朵之间的想法，并且应该特别适合语言习得的问题。如果一个孩子连语言是什么都不知道，如果她与试图了解浣熊却无法区分浣熊和灯泡或 56 款雪佛兰的生物学家处于同样的境地，她如何学习一门语言？

Linguistics is the science of natural languages, and there are lots of symbol systems which are not natural languages. It is extremely easy, in fact, to come up with symbol systems that operate in ways that natural languages don’t. Sentences might be ordered by word length, or vowel frequency, or chronological occurrence. Questions might be formed by reversing the order of words in a declarative sentence, or rearranging them alphabetically, or transposing every second pair of consonants, or only being uttered when the speaker is leaning against a ’56 Chevy. An unconstrained transformational grammar—say, the one outlined in Lees’s English Nominalizations—can describe all of these systems, and many, many more. Transformational grammar is so powerful, Emmon Bach said, that “a not too far-fetched analogy” to the way it describes language “would be a biological theory which failed to characterize the difference between raccoons and lightbulbs” (1974:158). This ugly situation is made all the beastlier in generative grammar because of its cognitive mandate. At its core, remember, transformational-generative grammar is supposed to be psychologically plausible, describing what is between the ears of a language user, and it is supposed to be particularly attuned to the problems of language acquisition. How is a child to acquire a language if she can’t even know what one is, if she is in the same position as a biologist trying to learn about raccoons who is unable to distinguish one from a lightbulb or a ’56 Chevy?

因此，反对巨大的描述能力。因此，乔姆斯基研究了 A-over-A 原则，罗斯研究了岛屿约束，波斯特尔进行了交叉研究。因此，乔姆斯基提出了一个热门问题，即解释学家在 70 年代着手回答的问题——“除了标准理论允许的规则之外，还需要哪些类型的规则（‘衍生约束’）？”

Hence, the opposition to enormous descriptive power. Hence, Chomsky’s work on the A-over-A principle, Ross’s on island constraints, and Postal’s crossover research. Hence, Chomsky’s burning question, the one that interpretivists set out to answer in the seventies—“What kinds of rules (‘derivational constraints’) are needed, if any, beyond those permitted by the standard theory?”

因此，尽管当时很少有人注意到，但拉科夫提出了“全球规则”。

Hence—though very few people noticed it at the time—Lakoff’s “Global Rules.”

乔姆斯基最伟大的修辞胜利在于，他很快就将“全局规则”一词变成“任何可以想象的规则”的同义词，完全颠覆了莱科夫论证的要点，将“生成语义学”一词变成“巨大的描述能力”的同义词，并且——这是乔姆斯基计划的否定定义最有效的地方——将标准理论扩展为“限制性”的同义词。乔姆斯基和解释主义者经常对生成语义学描述手段的整个不断增长的动物园感到恐惧，但在进行比较时却巧妙地忽略了他们自己不断增长的动物园中的大多数。生成语义学家自然感到愤怒，认为整个论点都是障眼法，并大声抱怨乔姆斯基的举动。他们仍然以魔术般的形象回忆起它。正如波斯特尔所说，

Chomsky’s great rhetorical triumph was that, in very short order, he managed to turn the words global rule into a synonym for “any imaginable rule,” completely reversing the thrust of Lakoff’s argument, and the words generative semantics into a synonym for “enormous descriptive power,” and—here is where the via negativa definition of Chomsky’s program was most effective—the words extended standard theory into a synonym for “restrictiveness.” Chomsky and the interpretivists regularly pointed to the whole, growing menagerie of generative semantics descriptive devices in horror, but conveniently ignored most of their own growing menagerie when making comparisons. The generative semanticists were naturally outraged, regarding the whole argument as smoke-and-mirrors logic, and complaining loudly about Chomsky’s move. They still recall it with images of prestidigitation. As Postal puts it,

乔姆斯基有这些——乔治怎么称呼它们？——这些他随时可以从帽子里变出的百搭牌，但不知何故，在谈论限制性时，它们却不起作用。

Chomsky had these—what did George call them?—these wild cards that he could pull out of his hat whenever he wanted, and somehow they didn’t count when it came to talking about restrictiveness.

每当乔姆斯基进行描述性工作时，他需要描述生成语义学通过转换所讨论的事实——通过全局规则将意义与深层结构或其他类型的结构联系起来——他就会诉诸语义解释规则。

Whenever he was doing something descriptive, where he needed to describe facts that generative semantics would talk about in terms of transformations—linking meanings to deep structures, or to other kinds of structures, by way of global rules—Chomsky would appeal to semantic interpretation rules.

他永远不会定义它们。直到今天，他从未赋予这个概念任何内容。他从未说过它们是什么。但他可以拥有任意多的概念。每当他需要时，他都可以从帽子里拿出一个并使用它。现在，当需要将生成语义学与他的框架进行比较时（在限制性方面），那些从未被包括在内。他从未觉得他必须对它们发表任何评论。

He would never define them. He has never, to this day, given any content to that notion. He’s never said what they were. But he could have as many as he wanted. Whenever he needed one, he could pull one out of his hat and use it. Now, when it came time to compare generative semantics to his framework [in terms of restrictiveness], those were never included. He never felt he had to say anything about them.

从理论上看，他不可能逃脱惩罚。但他确实做到了。二十六

It seems, a priori, implausible that he could get away with that. But he did.26

生成语义学家注意到了乔姆斯基的所作所为，但几乎所有其他人都对他的限制性论点信以为真。甚至许多最激烈的批评者也经常在攻击他之余，抨击他把生成语义作为描述性放纵的替罪羊（例如，Hagège，1981：83）。

The generative semanticists noticed what Chomsky was up to, but almost everyone else took his restrictiveness arguments at face value. Even many of his most fervent detractors frequently take time out from attacking him to bash his generative semantics scapegoat for its descriptive licentiousness (for instance, Hagège, 1981:83).

事实上，他在这个问题上的胜利是如此彻底，以至于现在很难理解它的规模，特别是对于那些不熟悉转换语法修辞史的人来说。我们只是非常随意地看待了构成转换生成语法修辞竞技场的诉求，而这种诉求在转换生成语法迅速攀升到语言学的顶峰的过程中发挥了重要作用。其中一项诉求尤其被忽视了，即对简单性概念的高度依赖——作为语言研究的目标、作为理论比较的核心标准以及作为方法论原则。乔姆斯基用来击败布卢姆菲尔德派的评估指标、哈勒反对音素的案例、每天对特定分析、工具和假设的授权——都严重依赖于简单性的价值，在某些情况下甚至完全依赖于简单性的价值。

In fact, his victory on this issue was so complete, that it is now difficult to appreciate its dimensions, especially for anyone unfamiliar with the rhetorical history of transformational grammar. We have only looked very casually at the appeals which constituted the rhetorical aresenal of transformational-generative grammar in its rapid climb to the top of linguistics. One appeal in particular was slighted, the great dependence on the notion of simplicity—as a goal of linguistic research, as the central criterion in theory comparison, and as a methodological principle. The evaluation metric with which Chomsky thumped the Bloomfieldians, Halle’s case against the phoneme, the daily warrants for specific analyses, instruments, and hypotheses—all leaned heavily, in some cases exclusively, on the value of simplicity.

由于简单性在乔姆斯基语言学中具有核心的、几乎决定性的作用，人们会认为（波斯特尔肯定认为）波斯特尔的“最佳理论”案例会非常有吸引力。这是一个直截了当的极简主义论点，即理论手段最少的语法是最简单的，因此也是最受推崇的。基于这些理由，生成语义学毫无疑问胜出。特别是，波斯特尔称同质 I模型是“最佳语法理论“先验可能” (Postal, 1972a [1969]:136)。它一端有语义表征，另一端有表面表征，还有一个相对统一的转换规则组件来解释它们的对应关系；方面理论有三个层次和两套规则。

With the central, virtually defining role of simplicity in Chomskyan linguistics, one would have thought (Postal surely thought) that Postal’s “Best Theory” case would be enormously appealing. It is a straightforward minimalist argument that the grammar with the fewest theoretical devices is the simplest, and therefore, the most highly prized. On these grounds, generative semantics wins, hands down. In particular, the model Postal dubs Homogeneous I is “the best grammatical theory a priori possible” (Postal, 1972a [1969]:136). It has semantic representations at one end, surface representations at the other, and a relatively uniform component of transformational rules explaining their correspondences; the Aspects theory had three levels, and two sets of rules.

不幸的是，波斯特承认，问题出在这儿。他最好的理论无法适应事实，不得不勉强接受拉科夫的新规则类型、全局派生约束。但他声称，结果“同质 II”仍然比Aspects简单得多——更不用说乔姆斯基在同一次会议上推销的模糊的后 Aspects解释主义理论了。

Unfortunately, Postal concedes, there is a rub. His best of all possible theories just can’t accommodate the facts, and it has reluctantly to embrace Lakoff’s new rule-type, global derivational constraints. But the result, he claims, Homogeneous II, is still much simpler than Aspects—not to mention the vague post-Aspects interpretivist theory that Chomsky was marketing at the same conference.

纽梅尔正确地指出，尽管这本应是形式语言学家的有力证据，“生成语义学家的元理论陈述可能没有比波斯特尔的论文《最佳理论》更能削弱人们对该模型的信心了”（纽梅尔，1980a：169；1986a：135）。原因远远超出了许多人认为波斯特尔的标题傲慢自大，也远远超出了纽梅尔本人所指出的罪魁祸首，即将生成语义学从同质 I 转移到同质 II 的新规则类型的特征（或者在纽梅尔看来，缺乏特征）。原因很简单，就是乔姆斯基在辩论中实现了议程的重大改变。

Newmeyer observes, correctly, that despite what should have been an extremely winning case to formal linguists, “probably no metatheoretic statement by a generative semanticist did more to undermine confidence in that model than Postal’s paper, ‘The Best Theory’” (Newmeyer, 1980a:169; 1986a:135). The reason goes far beyond the arrogance many found in Postal’s title, and far beyond the culprit that Newmeyer himself cites, the character (or, in Newmeyer’s view, lack of character) of the new rule-type that moved generative semantics from Homogeneous I to Homogeneous II. The reason, simply put, is that Chomsky accomplished a remarkable change of agenda in the debate.

他发出警告——“转换语法理论最严重的缺陷是其巨大的自由度和描述能力”（1972b [1969]：125）——尽管这一缺陷很严重，但他说，生成语义学通过向转换库中添加全局规则使这一缺陷变得更糟。仅围绕转换（即同质 I）组织的语法“是一种相当无趣的理论”，因为它具有巨大的描述能力；“通过允许更大的自由度，例如，允许使用除转换之外的其他规则来约束派生 [即通过添加全局规则并成为同质 II]，它可以变得更加无趣”（1972b [1969]：126）。到目前为止，该论点并没有为乔姆斯基的立场增加多少分量；事实上，它对他不利。它说转换是不好的，添加更多的规则类型会使任何包含它们的语法变得更糟。因此，体貌比生成语义学更糟糕，因为它有语义解释规则，而后体貌解释主义看起来更糟糕，因为几乎每天都会出现不同类型的语义解释规则。但乔姆斯基并没有就此罢休：“请注意，语言理论变得更加复杂往往是向前迈出的一步……”（1972b [1969]：126）。理论比较的依据发生了巨大变化：简单性被搁置一旁，限制性占据了中心位置，复杂性则紧随其后。27然而，乔姆斯基并不是独自完成这一壮举的。

He raised the alarm—“the gravest defect of the theory of transformational grammar is its enormous latitude and descriptive power” (1972b [1969]:125)—and as grave as that defect is, he said, generative semantics makes it worse by adding global rules to the transformational arsenal. A grammar organized solely around transformations (that is, Homogeneous I) “is a rather uninteresting theory,” because of its immense descriptive power; “it can be made still more uninteresting by permitting still further latitude, for example, by allowing rules other than transformations that can be used to constrain derivations [that is, by adding global rules and becoming Homogeneous II]” (1972b [1969]:126). Thus far, the argument does not add much weight to Chomsky’s position; indeed, it works against him. It says that transformations are bad, and that adding more rule-types makes any grammar that incorporates them even worse. Aspects, then, looks worse than generative semantics, with its semantic interpretation rules, and post-Aspects interpretivism looks worst of all, with distinct types of semantic interpretation rules coming in almost daily. But Chomsky isn’t through: “Notice that it is often a step forward … when linguistic theory becomes more complex” (1972b [1969]:126). The grounds of theory comparison changed dramatically: simplicity was shuffled off into the wings and restrictiveness took over at center stage, complexity at its side.27 Chomsky, however, did not manage the feat on his own.

尽管乔姆斯基经常否认他们的影响，但他的限制性论证之所以成功，最重要的原因还是斯坦利·彼得斯和罗伯特·里奇的一系列论文（1969、1971、1973a、1973b），这些论文提供了数学结果，证明了转换语法几乎完全缺乏区分性；正是在关于彼得斯-里奇结果的一段话中，巴赫对转换语法发表了灯泡和浣熊的评论。具体来说，彼得斯-里奇的结果表明，Aspects描述的语法类别是如此包罗万象，以至于它无法区分任何不加区分的符号串列表（例如，π 的所有小数位，分为任意序列并按其数字乘积的值进行枚举）以及人们用于交流的实际字符串列表（例如，英语）。这些结果形式化了转换理论中存在一段时间的概念，但数学证明非常有力地将它们带回现实。28对转换语法的限制问题促使乔姆斯基、罗斯和波斯特尔开始研究限制问题，而这种担忧一直是Aspects理论的众多担忧之一，但乔姆斯基在目标会议上的敦促，恰逢彼得斯-里奇研究结果的发表，使这一问题成为焦点。缺乏限制性在 70 年代引发了语言理论的某种危机，而生成语义学则成为一头非常方便的驴子，用来拴住描述性挥霍的尾巴。

Although Chomsky frequently dismisses their influence, the single most important reason for the success of his restrictiveness case was a series of papers by Stanley Peters and Robert Ritchie (1969, 1971, 1973a, 1973b), which provided mathematical results demonstrating transformational grammar’s virtually complete lack of discrimination; it is in a passage on the Peters-Ritchie results that Bach made his lightbulbs-and-raccoons comment about transformational grammar. Specifically, the Peters-Ritchie results show that the class of grammars described by Aspects is so all-encompassing that it can’t distinguish between any indiscriminate list of strings of symbols (say, all the decimal places of π, divided into arbitrary sequences and enumerated by value of the products of their digits) and a list of actual strings that people use to communicate (say, English). These results formalize notions that had been present in transformational theory for some time, but a mathematical proof brought them home very powerfully.28 The concern with restricting transformational grammar that led Chomsky and Ross and Postal to work on constraints had been one of many concerns about the Aspects theory, but Chomsky’s urgings at the Goals conference, coinciding with the publication of the Peters-Ritchie results, brought it to the fore. Lack of restrictiveness precipitated something of a crisis in linguistic theory in the seventies, and generative semantics became a very convenient donkey on which to pin the tail of descriptive profligacy.

然而，限制性反驳最令人着迷的方面是，在 1969 年，生成语义学几乎没有表现出乔姆斯基所指责的描述性恣意的迹象。事实上，自《Aspects》以来，生成语义学家在限制转换语法方面所做的工作比解释主义阵营的任何人都多得多。罗斯和波斯特尔都对限制做了极其重要的工作（珀尔穆特也做了，但更局部化）。麦考利重新分析了短语结构规则，使它们充当过滤器，并主张将罗斯的移动限制扩展到词典。罗斯和莱科夫在循环方面做了重要的工作。罗斯和罗纳德·兰加克也提出了限制代词转换应用的平行建议。而乔姆斯基攻击的重点，即莱科夫提出的全局规则，是进一步限制的尝试；扩展的名称是全局派生约束。29实际上，Lakoff 认为，转换语法中几乎所有的严肃工作都涉及约束派生关系的方法。他说，转换约束派生中的两个相邻树。它们的应用是局部的。它们仅适用于并排的两棵树。其他原则和规则——特别是 Ross-Perlmutter-Postal 研究路线，以及规则排序和循环性等转换传统——约束派生中的非相邻树。它们的应用是全局的。它们适用于派生树中的任何一对树（“或者有时是三元组”——Lakoff，1970b：638），无论它们之间的距离如何。

The most fascinating aspect of the restrictiveness counter-argument, however, is that, in 1969, generative semantics showed very few signs of the descriptive wantonness for which Chomsky indicted it. Indeed, since Aspects generative semanticists had done a great deal more to constrain transformational grammar than anyone in the interpretivist camp. Ross and Postal had both done extremely important work on constraints (as had Perlmutter, in a more local way). McCawley had reanalyzed phrase structure rules in a way that made them serve as filters, and argued to extend Ross’s movement constraints to the lexicon. Ross and Lakoff had done crucial work on the cycle. Ross and Ronald Langacker had made parallel proposals for restricting the application of pronominal transformations. And the focus of Chomsky’s attack, Lakoff’s proposal of global rules, was an attempt at further restriction; the expanded name is global derivational constraint.29 In effect, Lakoff argued that virtually all of the serious work in transformational grammar had involved ways of constraining derivational relations. Transformations, he said, constrain two contiguous trees in a derivation. Their application is local. They apply only to two trees standing side by side. Other principles and rules—in particular the Ross-Perlmutter-Postal line of research, but also such transformational traditions as rule ordering and cyclicity—constrain noncontiguous trees in a derivation. Their application is global. They apply to any pair of trees (“or perhaps sometimes triples”—Lakoff, 1970b:638) in a derivational arbor, irrespective of the distance between them.

简而言之，全局规则只是比转换范围更广的派生约束，它提供了给看似不同的转换限制研究贴上标签的重要名义优势。Lakoff 的主要论点是，语言学家应该认识到转换之外的所有额外设备的必要性，并开始将它们作为一类规则进行探索，而不是作为一团临时设备的混合体。Lakoff 呼吁发展一种“全局语法理论”（1970b:638），尽管——这可能是 Chomsky 的限制性论点成功的另一个主要因素——Lakoff 本人从未承担过这一使命。三十

Global rules, in short, are just derivational constraints with a wider province than transformations, and offer the important nominal advantage of putting a label to the seemingly disparate research into the restriction of transformations. Lakoff’s main argument is that linguists should recognize the necessity for all the extra paraphernalia beyond transformations and begin exploring them as a class of rules, rather than as a mixed bag of ad hoc devices. Lakoff calls for the development of a “theory of global grammar” (1970b:638), although—and this is probably the other main factor in the success of Chomsky’s restrictiveness argument—Lakoff never took up the mission himself.30

相比之下，解释主义者对派生约束的研究很少（当然，生成语义学家开始称之为局部派生约束的那些除外）。乔姆斯基（1964b [1962]）以他的 A-over-A 原则开创了这一研究领域，而约瑟夫·埃蒙兹（Joseph Emonds）关于一种新型过滤的重要论文（乔姆斯基监督）1970 年即将上市。但大部分关于限制转换性过滤的研究1969 年，乔姆斯基称缺乏限制性是转换理论“最严重的缺陷”，1970 年，莱考夫敦促用一种全局语法理论来纠正这一缺陷，而生成语义学家已经完成了这一部分。此外，正如波斯特尔指出的那样，解释主义者比他们的替罪羊更有责任“不合理地诉诸过于强大的手段”（1972c:215）——模糊或完全未指定的执行规则、部分勾勒出的语义解释规则和句法特征。

In contrast, the interpretivists had done very little work on derivational constraints (except, of course, the ones generative semanticists began calling local derivational constraints). Chomsky (1964b [1962]) had inaugurated this area of investigation, with his A-over-A principle, and Joseph Emonds’s important (Chomsky-supervised) 1970 dissertation on a new type of filtering was just about to hit the market. But the bulk of the work on constraining the transformational component—in 1969, when Chomsky called the lack of restrictiveness “the gravest defect” in transformational theory, and 1970, when Lakoff urged a theory of global grammar to correct that defect—had been done by generative semanticists. Moreover, as Postal pointed out, the interpretivists were guiltier than their whipping boys of the “illegitimate appeal to overly powerful devices” (1972c:215)—vague or completely unspecified rules of performance, partially sketched semantic interpretation rules, and syntactic features.

然而，在 70 年代初期，情况发生了巨大变化。波斯特尔和珀尔穆特继续前进——提出了新的、有趣的约束，但在另一个完全不同的框架中，即关系语法——罗斯和莱科夫对约束失去了兴趣，而乔姆斯基阵营则全力以赴地承担了语法限制的工作。而且——在一阵自杀式的陌生感中——许多生成语义学家开始热衷于扮演妖怪的角色。在转换语法中最紧迫的问题似乎是限制描述能力，而全局规则被视为最严重的罪魁祸首的环境下，Lakoff 表示“全局规则的真正问题不在于它们太强大，而在于它们太弱”（Parret，1974 [1972]：176；Lakoff 强调），并据此提出了更强大的设备 - 特别是跨派生约束，它不是关联一个派生中的两个不相邻的树，而是关联不同派生中的两个树（并且，随着这些设备的引入，Lakoff 明确表示维持 Katz-Postal 假设不再有意义 - 1975：283-84）。31 Sadock 甚至提出了元跨派生约束（涉及“两个派生和一个现实世界方面”—1974b:604）。这些描述性强的手段的缺陷因术语混淆而加剧。例如，McCawley 引入了泛派生约束这一术语（1982b [1973]:54），并采用外派生约束作为 Lakoff 的跨派生约束和 Sadock 的元跨派生约束的通用术语——这些澄清尝试可能只会助长生成语义学家理论夸张的名声。诸如意义公设、会话公设和句法混合等附加描述手段都进入了生成语义学的视野，但对于它们与跨派生约束甚至派生之间的关系如何或是否相关却知之甚少。总的来说，莱考夫、罗斯以及很多第二代生成语义学家都花费了​​大量的时间和精力在似乎需要更强大设备的数据上；乔治·莱考夫甚至考虑过“这样的疯狂行为，例如对跨派生约束的排序、循环跨派生约束、跨派生约束的例外，以及可能完全消除转换”(1973a[1970]：452)。

The situation changed dramatically in the early seventies, however. Postal and Perlmutter moved on—proposing new and interesting constraints, but in another framework altogether, relational grammar—Ross and Lakoff lost interest in constraints, and Chomsky’s camp took up the job of grammatical restriction with a vengeance. And—in a fit of suicidal strangeness—many generative semanticists warmed up to the role of bogey man. In a climate where the most urgent problem in transformational grammar seemed to be restricting descriptive power, and global rules were painted as the most serious offender, Lakoff said that “the real problem with global rules is not that they are too powerful, but that they are too weak” (Parret, 1974 [1972]:176; Lakoff’s emphasis), and accordingly proposed more powerful devices—in particular transderivational constraints, which relate not two noncontiguous trees in a derivation, but two trees in different derivations (and, with the introduction of these devices, Lakoff became explicit that it no longer made sense to maintain the Katz-Postal hypothesis—1975:283–84).31 Sadock even proposed meta-transderivational constraints (which involve “two derivations and an aspect of the real world”—1974b:604). The liabilities of these descriptively powerful devices were compounded by terminological confusions. McCawley, for instance, introduced the term panderivational constraint (1982b [1973]:54), and adopted extraderivational constraint as a generic for both Lakoff’s transderivational constraint and Sadock’s meta-transderivational constraint—attempts at clarification which probably did little more than contribute to the generative semanticists’ growing reputation for theoretical extravagance. Such additional descriptive devices as meaning postulates, conversational postulates, and syntactic amalgams all entered the generative semantics picture, with very little clarity as to how or if they related to transderivational constraints, or even to derivations. All the whole, both Lakoffs, Ross, and a good many second-generation generative semanticists were spending a good deal of their time and effort mucking around in data that appeared to call for more powerful devices yet; George Lakoff even entertained “such madness as ordering of transderivational constraints, cyclical transderivational constraints, exceptions to transderivational constraints, and perhaps the elimination of transformations altogether” (1973a [1970]:452).

在另一个阵营中，解释语义学家接受了 Lakoff 的呼吁，提出了一种全局规则理论（同时攻击 Lakoff 并避开“全局”一词）。Emonds (1970) 为短语结构规则提供了一种优雅的方式，可以对派生中的每个树进行直接控制（扩展了 McCawley 的一些想法），而 Chomsky (1973a [1971]) 以令人信服的方式发展了 Ross 的约束，以至于它们成为了接下来十年解释主义工作的焦点，并继续成为 Chomsky 计划的关键要素。最明显的解释主义对全局性的探索是 Chomsky (1973a [1971]) 的介绍踪迹约定使变换能够在某一阶段标记句子，以便其他变换（在推导过程中任意稍后）能够知道它们已经应用。32这个惯例是说，一个运动留下一个在音系上无效，但在句法和语义上却很重要的“痕迹”，例如在 11-11a 代表深层结构、11b 代表表层结构，而t标记了名词短语Tyler在它之前的位置，它转换性地移动到了句子的前面。

In the other camp, the interpretive semanticists took up Lakoff’s call for a theory of global rules (all the while attacking Lakoff and shunning the word global). Emonds (1970) worked out an elegant way for the phrase structure rules to exercise direct control over every tree in a derivation (expanding on some of McCawley’s ideas), and Chomsky (1973a [1971]) developed Ross’s constraints in such a compelling way that they became the focus of interpretivist work for the rest of the decade, and continue to be crucial elements of Chomsky’s program. The most obvious interpretivist excursion into globality was Chomsky’s (1973a [1971]) introduction of the trace convention which gives transformations the power to mark sentences at one stage so that other transformations, arbitrarily later in the derivation, can tell they have applied.32 This convention says that a movement leaves behind a phonologically null, but syntactically and semantically important, “trace,” as in the examples of 11–11a representing the deep structure, 11 b the surface structure, and t marking the place where the noun phrase, Tyler was before it moved transformationally to the front of the sentence.

11

11

似乎每个女孩泰勒都喜欢对方

a it seems to each of the girls Tyler to like the other

 

 

b Tyler 似乎在每个女孩看来都喜欢对方

b Tyler seems to each of the girls t to like the other

在非语言学家看来，这种惯例荒谬至极，它意味着，除其他事项外，表层结构在解释派中变得越来越抽象。但踪迹是非常有吸引力的小手段。它们的主要用途是维护深层结构的各个方面（比如Tyler作为to like 的主语的原始位置），以供以后的转换或语义解释规则使用 — — 这是它们明显的全局方面，因为它们允许不连续的树进行通信 — — 但它们也有一些非常有趣的副作用。这些副作用中最著名的是它们对 12b 中缺乏歧义性的解释，而 12a 则相反。

This convention looks to be the height of absurdity to nonlinguists, and it means, among other things, that surface structures were becoming increasingly abstract in the interpretive camp. But traces are extremely attractive little devices. Their principal use is to maintain aspects of deep structure (like the original location of Tyler as the subject of to like) for later transformations or semantic interpretation rules—and this is their clear global aspect, since they allow noncontiguous trees to communicate—but they also have some very interesting side effects. The most celebrated of these side effects is the account they offer of the lack of ambiguity in 12b, in contrast to 12a.

12

12

牙龈出血的墨菲是我希望能够成功的人。

a Bleeding Gums Murphy is the man I want to succeed.

 

 

b 牙龈出血的墨菲是我想要成为的人。

b Bleeding Gums Murphy is the man I wanna succeed.

句子 12a 可能意味着我希望 Bleeding Gums 成功（获得成功），或者我希望继任 Bleeding Gums（以某种方式追随他，也许是成为萨克斯传奇人物）；12b 只能意味着我希望继任 Bleeding Gums。方面模型解释了 12a 的两种不同含义，称它们源自两种不同的深层结构（12c 表示我希望 Bleeding Gums 成功，12d 表示我希望继任 Bleeding Gums）。

Sentence 12a could mean that I want Bleeding Gums to succeed (be successful), or that I want to succeed Bleeding Gums (follow him in some way, maybe as a saxophone legend); 12b can only mean that I want to succeed Bleeding Gums. The Aspects model explains the two different meanings of 12a by saying they spring from two different deep structures (12c when I want Bleeding Gums to succeed, 12d when I want to succeed Bleeding Gums).

12

12

c 牙龈出血 Murphy 是男人 [我希望他能成功]

c Bleeding Gums Murphy is the man [I want the man to succeed]

 

 

d 牙龈出血 墨菲是男人 [我想继承他]

d Bleeding Gums Murphy is the man [I want to succeed the man]

也就是说，体貌模型很好地处理了歧义问题，但它没有提到 12b 这一事实，尽管 12b 在各个方面都与 12b 相似，但它是单义的，必然源自一个深层结构 12d。踪迹理论可以解决这个问题：按照乔姆斯基的惯例，这两个含义的踪迹丰富的表层结构分别是 12e 和 12f。

The Aspects model, that is, handles the ambiguity quite well, but it says nothing about the fact that 12b, similar in almost every respect, is univocal, necessarily deriving from only one deep structure, 12d. Trace theory to the rescue: with Chomsky’s convention, the trace-enriched surface structures for the two meanings are, respectively, 12e and 12f.

12

12

牙龈出血墨菲是男人[我希望他成功]

e Bleeding Gums Murphy is the man [I want t to succeed]

 

 

f 牙龈出血 墨菲是男人 [我想成功t ]

f Bleeding Gums Murphy is the man [I want to succeed t]

通过跟踪块收缩的合理扩展，解释就很清楚了：12e 或 12f 都可以是 12a 的表面结构（因此，它是歧义性的），但只有 12f 可以是 12b 的表面结构（因此，它是单义性的）。33

With the reasonable extension that traces block contraction, then, the explanation is clear: either 12e or 12f can be a surface structure for 12a (hence, its ambiguity), but only 12f can be the surface structure for 12b (hence, its univocality).33

痕迹还有一个非常吸引人的特征。还记得 Jackendoff 丑陋的解释模型吗（图 7.2）？痕迹大大简化了它。Jackendoff 语义组件需要访问深层结构和表层结构之间的推导，才能跟踪何时何地运动变换使成分四处移动。有了痕迹（因为每个运动都会留下一点痕迹），所有这些信息现在都可以在表面结构中表示出来。

And there was one more extremely attractive feature of traces. Remember, Jackendoff’s ugly interpretive model (figure 7.2)? Traces streamlined it considerably. All the access Jackendoff’s semantic component needed to the derivation between deep structure and surface structure was necessary to keep track of when and where movement transformations scooted constituents around. With traces (since every movement leaves a little bit of itself behind) all that information could now be represented in the surface structure.

踪迹理论成为解释学家的一项家庭手工业，是致力于解决约束问题的努力的一部分，但少数生成语义学尝试提出并探索具体的全局规则或条件（如 Lakoff，1971b：238ff，1974；Ross，1972a），却毫无进展，毫无说服力；事实上，Ross 在论文的最后几页放弃了他的全局规则，呼吁采用跨派生解决方案。大多数生成语义学对全局性的调用都是挥手示意：“这里有一些现象，看起来我们需要一个全局规则来处理它们；”没有提供具体的规则。（Postal 是一个光荣的例外——1972b [1970]。）也就是说，这些论点与乔姆斯基早期关于表面结构语义解释规则的论点完全相似，而且颇具讽刺意味。

Trace theory became a cottage industry for interpretivists, part of the dedicated effort to work on constraints, but the few generative semantic attempts to propose and explore specific global rules or conditions (such as Lakoff, 1971b:238ff, 1974; Ross, 1972a), were restless and abortive, betraying little conviction; indeed, Ross discards his global rule in the last few pages of the paper, calling for a transderivational solution. Most generative semantic invocations of globality were hand-waving affairs: “here are some phenomena, and it looks like we’re going to need a global rule to handle them;” no specific rules offered. (Postal was an honorable exception—1972b [1970].) That is, the arguments ran exactly and ironically parallel Chomsky’s early arguments for surface-structure semantic interpretation rules.

跨派生约束的情况更糟。Lakoff 在一篇非常非正式的论文《关于跨派生约束的一些思考》中介绍了它们，但这篇文章并没有提供这种新规则类型的一个例子 (1973a [1970])。然而，对跨派生约束的进一步讨论主要只有两种，同样没有成果：(1) 解释主义者的无分类谴责；(2) 生成语义学家的无理援引。

The situation with transderivational constraints was worse yet. Lakoff introduced them in a very informal paper, “Some Thoughts on Transderivational Constraints,” which doesn’t so much as offer an example of this new rule-type (1973a [1970]). Yet further discussion of transderivational constraints was largely of only two, equally unproductive sorts: (1) uncategorical denunciation, from the interpretivists; and (2) unwarranted invocation, by the generative semanticists.

乔姆斯基阵营简单地将跨派生约束视为对形式语法的彻底抛弃，事实上，它们的引入恰逢生成语义学中对此类兴趣的急剧下降。34当其他理论机制失效时（考虑到他们正在探索的数据，这种情况极为常见），生成语义学家只是诉诸于跨派生约束，几乎没有任何理由，也没有正式指定约束，甚至没有非常仔细地检查其应用。唯一明确提出的跨派生规则是在分裂时期很晚才提出的，其作者很快就否定了它（Gazdar，1977；1979）。

Chomsky’s camp simply wrote off transderivational constraints as the complete abandonment of formal grammar, and, indeed, their introduction coincided with a very sharp decline in such interests within generative semantics.34 The generative semanticists simply appealed to transderivational constraints when other theoretical mechanisms broke down (an extremely frequent occurrence, given the data they were exploring), with very little justification, and without specifying the constraint formally, or even examining its application very carefully. The only explicitly proposed transderivational rule came very late in the schism, and its author quickly repudiated it (Gazdar, 1977; 1979).

然而请注意，我们已经远离了乔姆斯基最初对描述浪费的指责。首先 — — 从他们的角度来看，这是迄今为止最重要的一点 — — 生成语义学家已经大大扩展了他们的数据关注点，涉及大量超出乔姆斯基理论范围的语用（“性能”）现象。但是他们也重新构想或拒绝了转换语法的定义性概念，如能力、性能和语法性。许多人完全放弃了形式理论构建 — — 最著名的是罗斯和罗宾·莱考夫 — — 而其他人则勉强坚持下去。解释语义学和生成语义学在限制性等指标上不再具有可比性；事实上，1973 年的生成语义学在这些指标上不再与1970 年的生成语义学具有可比性，而后者与1967 年的生成语义学有显著不同。

Notice, however, that we have moved a long way from Chomsky’s initial charges of descriptive profligacy. For one thing—and, from their perspective, it is by far the most important—the generative semanticists had expanded their data concerns substantially, involving a great many pragmatic (“performance”) phenomena well outside the bounds of Chomsky’s theory. But they had also reconceived or rejected the defining notions of transformational grammar, like competence, performance, and grammaticality. And many had abandoned formal theory construction altogether—most notably, Ross and Robin Lakoff—while others were barely hanging on by their fingernails. Interpretive and generative semantics were no longer comparable on metrics like restrictiveness; indeed, generative semantics1973 was no longer comparable on such metrics to generative semantics1970, which was markedly different from generative semantics1967.

语法性

Grammaticality

当语言学家列出带有和不带有标记（*、？等）的句子时，他通常不是在报告“语法判断”（尽管他可能会说它们是语法判断），而是在报告关于该句子作为给定上下文条件下给定含义的表达的正常性。做出普遍理解的“语法判断”的能力，即独立于其句法结构或上下文含义对一串单词的“好坏”进行判断的能力，是极其罕见的，并且似乎是双关语构造技巧的伴随物。

When a linguist presents a list of sentences with and without stigmata (*, ?, etc.), he is normally reporting not “grammaticality judgements” (even though he may well say that they are grammaticality judgements) but rather judgements as to the normalness of that sentence as an expression of a given meaning under given contextual conditions. The ability to make “grammaticality judgements” as popularly understood, that is judgements about the “goodness” of a string of words independently of its syntactic structure or meaning in context, is extremely rare and appears to be a concomitant of virtuosity in constructing puns.

詹姆斯·麦考利

James McCawley

当乔姆斯基和他的同僚虔诚地反对生成语义学的描述性混乱时，他们反驳的是一种封闭而有害的描述性禁欲主义。这种反击大部分都是没有重点的，但一些生成语义学家——最著名的是麦考利——直接将其引向了语法性的概念。还记得他告诉《纽约时报》的话吗： “乔姆斯基认为，有些句子属于语言，而有些词序列不属于语言——语法学家的任务是编写规则来确定哪些属于语言，哪些不属于语言。波斯特尔、拉科夫和我说这不是一个连贯的概念”（Shenker，1972 年）。

While Chomsky and his kith were lecturing piously against the descriptive promiscuity of generative semantics, the return charge was of a hermetic and unwholesome descriptive asceticism. Much of this counterattack was unfocused, but some generative semanticists—most notably, McCawley—brought it directly to bear on the concept of grammaticality. Remember what he told The New York Times: “Chomsky assumes that there are sentences which belong to the language and other sequences of words which don’t—and the grammarian’s task is to write rules [that] determine which belong and which don’t. Postal and Lakoff and I say this isn’t a coherent notion” (Shenker, 1972).

尽管他在应用上并不完全一致，但乔姆斯基一直认为语法性是一个技术术语，相对于某些特定的语法而言。35一个句子是合乎语法的，当且仅当存在一个语法，即生成该句子的规则体系。一个句子是否合乎语法，取决于例如体语法或句法结构语法。另一方面，可接受性则取决于特定语境中的特定说话者。如果说话者说这个句子可以，那么这个句子就是可以接受的。

Although he hasn’t been entirely consistent in application, Chomsky has always said that grammaticality is a technical term, relative to some specified grammar.35 A sentence is grammatical if and only if there is a grammar, a body of rules, which generates it. A sentence is grammatical or not relative to, for instance, the Aspects grammar or the Syntactic Structures grammar. Acceptability, on the other hand, is relative to a specified speaker in a specified context. A sentence is acceptable if a speaker says it is okay.

由于语法是语言知识的理想模型，因此语法属于能力理论，并为表现理论所接受。

Since grammars are ideally models of linguistic knowledge, grammatical pertains to the theory of competence, acceptable to the theory of performance.

当然，合乎语法和可接受之间有明显的重叠，但它们是截然不同的概念；例如，合乎语法的句子可能非常非常长，长到某些说话者无法接受，或者它们会让说话者陷入曲折的境地而拒绝接受；而可接受的句子可以像诗歌一样故意不合语法。语法性是相对于抽象语法（“模型”、“理论”）而不是说话者的判断的，这种观点导致一些人对乔姆斯基发出困惑的嘲笑，主要是来自人文主义者和布鲁姆菲尔德派的遗留者，嘲笑诸如“无色的绿色思想沉睡”等理论现象的地位变化——有时在他的框架中是合乎语法的，有时不是。但这种变化在科学中很常见：随着语法的变化，其语法性含义也会发生变化。原子有时是物理学中最小的物质，有时不是，这取决于理论；光有时是微粒，有时是波，有时两者兼而有之；空间有时充满以太，有时没有；有时平静，有时动荡。

There are obvious overlaps between grammatical and acceptable, of course, but they are very distinct notions; grammatical sentences, for instance, can be very, very long, so long as to be unacceptable to some speakers, or they can lead speakers down a garden path so winding that they refuse to accept them, and acceptable sentences can be, as in poetry, deliberately ungrammatical. The position that grammaticality is relative to an abstract grammar (“model,” “theory”), rather than to a speaker’s judgment, has led to some confused ridicule of Chomsky, mostly from humanists and Bloomfieldian holdovers, about such theoretical phenomena as the shifting status of “Colorless green ideas sleep furiously”—sometimes grammatical in his framework, sometimes not. But this sort of drift is very common in science: as the grammar changed, so did its grammaticality implications. The atom is sometimes the smallest piece of matter in physics, sometimes not, depending on the theory; light sometimes corpuscles, sometimes waves, sometimes both; space sometimes full of ether, sometimes not, sometimes peaceful, sometimes turbulent.

生成语义学家越来越多地认为能力-表现区别（语法-可接受区别的基础）是人为的——更糟糕的是，不连贯的——并且随之而来的是拒绝乔姆斯基语法性。罗斯和拉科夫夫妇以某种间接的方式攻击了这一概念，他们列举了语言显然需要的现象（或者，也许更准确地说，说话者显然需要的现象），但完全与语法性无关——诸如“请”和“谢谢”等现象，以及 13a 和 13b 在向人类学学会做讲座时的相对适用性。

The generative semanticists came increasingly to view the competence-performance distinction, on which the grammatical-acceptable distinction rests, as artificial—worse, incoherent—and the rejection of Chomskyan grammaticality came along for the ride. Ross and the Lakoffs attacked the concept somewhat obliquely, by cataloging phenomena clearly required by language (or, perhaps more accurately, clearly required by speakers), but wholly indifferent to grammaticality—phenomena like please and thank-you and the relative appropriateness of 13a and 13b for a lecture presented to an anthropological society.

十三

13

a 通常使用大香蕉叶或者《纽约每日新闻》的旧版来加速排便。

a Defecation is generally expedited by the use of large banana leaves, or old copies of the New York Daily News.

 

 

b *通常使用大香蕉叶或《纽约每日新闻》的旧版来加快制作 2 号。

b *Making number 2 is generally expedited by the use of large banana leaves, or old copies of the New York Daily News.

（R.Lakoff，1973a：301）

(R. Lakoff, 1973a:301)

莱科夫在这里使用星号很能说明问题，因为她将其作为在特定语境中不恰当的标志，而不是不合语法的标志，她反对乔姆斯基语法主义与她对日常语言哲学的兴趣日益浓厚有关，而语境对日常语言哲学来说极其重要。在 70 年代，日常语言哲学对生成语义学越来越重要。从罗斯相当直接地引入奥斯汀关于表演的见解开始，萨多克和戴维森在芝加哥的麦考利的指导下接受了这一见解，在哲学家 HP 格赖斯的会话含义研究对莱科夫、他们的学生和麦考利的影响下，日常语言哲学获得了相当大的发展势头。36正是从这个时期开始，语言学家开始形成一种他们称之为语用学的东西，与所谓的语义学截然不同。对于生成语义学家和一般语言学家来说，后者实际上是“意义”的同义词，直到 70 年代早期到中期，而前者则属于哲学中的外在部分。现在，语义学开始逐渐固化为句子（Cormorant-Island 句子类型）的真值条件和一系列相关概念（主要是释义和蕴涵）的术语。

Lakoff’s use of the asterisk here is telling, since she makes it a signal for inappropriateness in a given context, not for ungrammaticality, and her opposition to Chomskyan grammaticality had much to do with her increasing interest in ordinary language philosophy, for which context is extremely important. Ordinary language philosophy grew more important for generative semantics in the seventies. Beginning with Ross’s fairly direct importation of Austin’s insights about performatives, which Sadock and Davison took up at Chicago under McCawley, it gained considerable momentum under the influence that philosopher H. P. Grice’s conversational implicature work had on both Lakoffs, on their students, and on McCawley.36 It is from this period that linguists began to develop a sense of something they called pragmatics, as distinct from what it called semantics. For generative semanticists in particular, and linguists in general, the latter was virtually a synonym for ‘meaning’ until the early-to-mid-seventies, and the former belonged among the exoterica in philosophy. Now, semantics began hardening into a term for the truth conditions of sentences (of the Cormorant-Island sentences type) and a hatful of related notions (principally, paraphrase and entailment).

语用学……语用学从未固化为任何具体的东西，但它现在几乎代表了语言学中“与意义有关的一切”——特别是与语境影响有关的一切。重复一下 Gerald Gazdar 的粗略公式（1979:2），

Pragmatics,… well, pragmatics never hardened into anything particularly, but it pretty much stands for ‘everything else about meaning’ in linguistics now—in particular, everything related to the influence of context. To repeat Gerald Gazdar’s crude equation (1979:2),

实用主义 = 意义 — 真值条件

PRAGMATICS = MEANING — TRUTH CONDITIONS

当生成语义学家开始深入研究日常语言哲学的数据和含义时，非真值条件意义首次在语言学史上得到了认真的关注，其中很多内容对乔姆斯基的语法性概念造成了严重破坏。三十七

Non-truth-conditional meaning began to get serious attention for the first time in the history of linguistics when generative semanticists began snooping around in the data and implications of ordinary language philosophy, a great deal of which played havoc with Chomsky’s notion of grammaticality.37

不过，反对乔姆斯基语法的主要、最直言不讳的人不是罗斯或拉科夫一家，而是麦考利，他的反感走的是一条略有不同的道路。1970 年，詹姆斯·赫林格 (James Heringer) 对量词否定个人方言进行了一项不同寻常的研究——这对于转换语法来说很不寻常，因为它是通过经验而不是内省来收集数据的。这项研究非常谦虚，但其结果是，他的许多受访者认为 14a（大多数转换主义者认为不合语法的句子）在 14b 中提供的上下文中是可以接受的：

The main, and most vocal, opponent of Chomskyan grammaticality wasn’t Ross or one of the Lakoffs, though. It was McCawley, and his disaffection followed a somewhat different route. In 1970, James Heringer did an unusual study of quantifier-negative idiolects—unusual for transformational grammar in that it gathered data empirically rather than introspectively. The study was very modest, but among its results were that a number of his informants found 14a, a sentence most transformationalists would brand ungrammatical, to be acceptable given the context supplied in 14b:

14

14

a 并非所有申请者都未能通过我们精心设计的测试，是吗？

a All the applicants didn’t fail the test we so carefully rigged, didn’t they?

 

 

b 两位工业心理学家米特和马特对他们的主管，并试图通过允许不称职的人被公司聘用来进行报复。为了最快地做到这一点，他们设计了一个筛选测试，该测试不会筛选掉任何人，并且已经尝试过了。马特刚刚拿回了分数，米特急于确定他们的计划是否有效，于是问了这个问题。（Heringer，1970：295）

b Two industrial psychologists, Mitt and Matt, have a grudge against their supervisor and are attempting to retaliate by allowing incompetent people to get hired by their company. To do this most quickly, they have designed a screening test which doesn’t screen out anyone and have tried it out. Matt has just gotten the scores back and Mitt, anxious to determine if their plan is working, asks this question. (Heringer, 1970:295)

尽管这项研究明确地是关于可接受性的，但麦考利却将其视为对他“长期以来的怀疑……（与乔姆斯基、卡兹等人的说法相反）一种语言的母语人士无法对给定的一串词素或单词在该语言中是否可能做出可靠的判断” (1979 [1972]:218)；简而言之，乔姆斯基的语法性没有心理学基础，或者回到以前的说法，乔姆斯基的两个目标存在着无法弥补的冲突。语法性与心灵主义相冲突。事实上，麦考利认为对语法性的追求是完全错误的：“我不会把它称为语言学” (1979 [1972]:217–18)；更糟糕的是，它是不道德的，属于他所收集的“不值得遵循的思想”之一，“我认为这些思想是有害的，因为它们阻碍了我们对语言功能方式的理解” (1979 [1976]:234)；更糟糕的是，它是个人的尴尬，“当我看到我多少次将句子说成是‘合乎语法的’或‘不合语法的’时，我羞愧地低下了头” (1982b:8)。

Although this study is explicitly about acceptability, McCawley took it as a confirmation of his “long-held suspicion … that (contrary to claims by Chomsky, Katz, and others) native speakers of a language are not capable of giving reliable judgments as to whether a given string of morphemes or words is possible in that language” (1979 [1972]:218); in brief, that Chomskyan grammaticality has no psychological basis, or, reverting to earlier terms, that two Chomskyan goals are in irremediable conflict. Grammaticality runs afoul of mentalism. Indeed, McCawley came to regard the pursuit of grammaticality as completely wrongheaded: “[it is something which] I would not label as linguistics” (1979 [1972]:217–18); worse, it is unethical, belonging to his collection of “ideas not to live by” which “I hold to be pernicious in that they have retarded our development of an understanding of how language functions” (1979 [1976]:234); worse, it is a personal embarrassment, for which “I hang my head in shame at seeing how many times I have spoken of sentences as being ‘grammatical’ or ‘ungrammatical’” (1982b:8).

正如人们所料，麦考利在辩论中对语法性及其相关术语的使用经常令人困惑（因此，他垂头丧气）。例如，他在 1973 年对乔姆斯基《语义学研究》的评论中追溯性地限制了他对此类术语的使用，剥夺了它们的技术意义，并要求读者“将‘不合语法’简单地视为非正式的英语等价词……我当时恰好在谈论这种异常”（1982b：8）。在另一个场合，他说语法性不是应用于词串，而是应用于语义结构、表面结构、所有中间结构、上下文信息和说话者意图的复合体，并添加了明显的生成语义等（Parret 1974 [1972]：250）。但这种混淆在争论中极为常见，而且无论如何，他的反对意见非常明确：语法性是句子相对于脱离语境的语法（乔姆斯基语法）的属性，它不是语言使用者头脑中任何事物的对应特征，因此不利于追求心理上真实的语言模型。事实上，这个论点是典型乔姆斯基论点的变体，麦考利仍然坚持认为他追求的是能力——尽管与他以前的老师所关注的有很大不同（1979 [1972]：220）。

As one might expect, McCawley’s use of grammaticality and its related terms in the debates is frequently confused (hence, the head-hanging). For instance, he retroactively qualifies his use of such terms in his 1973 review of Chomsky’s Studies on Semantics by denuding them of technical significance and asking the reader to “take ‘ungrammatical’ as simply an informal English equivalent for… the kind of anomaly that I happen to be talking about at the time” (1982b:8). On another occasion, he says that grammaticality is something he applies not to strings of words, but to complexes of semantic structures, surface structures, all intermediate structures, contextual information, and the speaker’s intentions, adding a telltale generative semantic etc. (Parret 1974 [1972]:250). But such confusions were extremely common in the dispute, and, in any case, the force of his objection is extremely clear: grammaticality, as a property of sentences relative to a grammar isolated from context (a Chomskyan grammar), is not a feature which corresponds to anything in the head of a language user, and is therefore detrimental to the pursuit of psychologically real models of language. The argument, in fact, is a permutation of a typical Chomskyan argument, and McCawley still insists he is pursuing competence—though a much different variety than the one that concerns his former teacher (1979 [1972]:220).

乔姆斯基对这一论点的回应早已有记录。当他首次提出语法性概念时，一些布鲁姆菲尔德派反对这一概念（尤其是 Hill，1961），他的老导师罗曼·雅各布森也持反对态度；乔姆斯基对他们说了几句话：

Chomsky’s response to this line of argument had been on record for a long time. Some Bloomfieldians objected to his concept of grammaticality when he first proposed it (see, especially, Hill, 1961), as did his old mentalist mentor, Roman Jakobson; and Chomsky had some words for them:

当语言学家看到半语法、异常话语的例子时，他们通常会在构建的语境中设计可能的解释，并得出结论，这些例子并没有说明偏离语法规律。这这种论证方式完全偏离了要点。它模糊了两类话语之间的重要区别：一类话语不需要类比或强加解释；另一类话语则可以根据其与该类中适当选择的成员的关系而得到解释。因此，例如，当雅各布森观察到“约翰打高尔夫球”可以是一个完全清晰的话语时 [见雅各布森，1959：144]，他是完全正确的。但是，当他得出结论说，因此，它与“约翰打高尔夫球”一样完全符合英语的语法规则时，他坚持对“语法规则”概念进行过于狭隘的解释——这种解释使得人们能够标记这两个短语之间的根本区别。（1964a [1961]：385）

Linguists, when presented with examples of semi-grammatical, deviant utterances, often respond by contriving possible interpretations in constructed contexts, concluding that the examples do not illustrate departure from grammatical regularities. This line of argument completely misses the point. It blurs an important distinction between a class of utterances that need no analogic or imposed interpretation and others that can receive an interpretation by virtue of their relations to properly selected members of this class. Thus, e.g., when Jakobson observes that “golf plays John” can be a perfectly perspicuous utterance [see Jakobson, 1959:144], he is quite correct. But when he concludes that it is therefore as fully in accord with the grammatical rules of English as “John plays golf,” he is insisting on much too narrow an interpretation of the notion “grammatical rule”—an interpretation that makes it possible to mark the fundamental distinction between the two phrases. (1964a [1961]:385)

乔姆斯基在这里使用了熟悉的伎俩——特别是称范围更广的雅各布森猜想“太过狭窄”——但他的主要观点显而易见：无论人们能用什么方法来处理“所有申请者都没有通过我们精心设计的测试，不是吗？”和*通常通过使用大香蕉叶或《纽约每日新闻》的旧副本来加快得出数字 2，而Spiro 猜想 ExLax，人们仍然需要以某种方式将它们与更规范的序列区分开来。

Chomsky is up to familiar tricks here—in particular, calling the much broader Jakobson “much too narrow”—but his principal point is inescapably clear: no matter what one can do with All the applicants didn’t fail the test we so carefully rigged, didn’t they? and *Making number 2 is generally expedited by the use of large banana leaves, or old copies of the New York Daily News, and Spiro conjectures ExLax, one still needs to distinguish them somehow from more canonical sequences.

然而，最后，这方面的争论，就像许多关于目标和方法的科学争论一样，归结为信仰问题。乔姆斯基承认，通过将某些部分与其他部分区分开来对语法研究施加的限制必然是武断的（1964a [1961]：385n5），但他愿意接受这种武断，因为这会给他带来更易于管理的数据集。正如霍尔顿（1988：39）所表达的熟悉立场，“我们周围总是有远多于我们能够使用的‘现象’，我们决定——并且必须决定——在科学的任何特定阶段丢弃它们。”当然，这正是布卢姆菲尔德所做的，他通过援引心灵主义，将一些语言现象交给社会学和心理学，而将其他现象完全驱逐。而乔姆斯基也在做同样的事情——他的表现在很多标准上都非常接近布卢姆菲尔德的心灵主义。问题在于，人们可能会抛弃太多数据，最终对自己的业务产生狭隘而毫无成效的看法。人们经常批评布卢姆菲尔德学派，因为他们抛弃了句法，而专注于音素和词素，从而错过了语言中发生的大量事情。生成语义学家认为乔姆斯基也犯了同样的错误，抛弃了语用学。他们认为乔姆斯基的做法排除了有价值的研究途径，有害地将语言学引向了死胡同。

Finally, however, the argument on this front comes down, like so many scientific disputes concerning goals and methods, to a matter of faith. Chomsky acknowledges that the limits one puts on the study of grammar by roping off certain sections from others are necessarily arbitrary (1964a [1961]:385n5), but he is willing to live with the arbitrariness because it buys him a more manageable data set. As Holton (1988:39) puts the familiar position, “we are always surrounded by far more ‘phenomena’ than we can use and which we decide—and must decide—to discard at any particular stage of science.” This, of course, is exactly what Bloomfield was up to when he consigned some linguistic phenomena to sociology and psychology, and banished other phenomena altogether, by invoking mentalism. And Chomsky is up to the same thing—his performance comes extremely close on a number of criteria to Bloomfield’s mentalism. The trouble is that one can discard too much data, and end up with an unproductively narrow view of one’s business. A frequently invoked criticism of the Bloomfieldians is that they discarded syntax, to concentrate on phonemes and morphemes, and missed a great deal of what is going on in language. Generative semanticists saw Chomsky committing the same sort of error by discarding pragmatics. They saw his ropes as excluding valuable avenues of research, perniciously directing linguistics down a blind alley.

地毯鼓起

Rug Bulging

乔姆斯基对于表演不断变化的定义，为他提供了一张足以覆盖喜马拉雅山的地毯。

Chomsky’s shifting definitions of performance provide him with a rug big enough to cover the Himalayas.

乔治·莱考夫

George Lakoff

生成语义学家还认为，乔姆斯基对数据的战略性束缚是另一种邪恶，这反映在前几页波斯特尔的投诉中。生成语义学家认为，除了乔姆斯基犯下的方法论错误之外，他们还认为，乔姆斯基故意、不诚实地试图混淆有关描述力的一切讨论，几乎每个提出这个问题的解释学家都这样做过。最后这句话是多余的：成为一个解释主义者70 年代的一次争论就是为了提出这个问题。每当解释主义者攻击生成语义学过于强大时，整个生成语义学的设备都会被纳入统计——特别是转换、全局规则和跨派生约束。然而，在解释主义者这边，他们只列出了转换和约束（当然，它们不被称为全局规则，并且被认为会降低而不是增加权力）。越来越强大的语义解释规则却明显缺席。而且，由于生成语义学家觉得自己要对一类比解释主义者更广泛的现象负责——能力和表现现象——因此在核算程序中又出现了一个漏洞。生成语义学所涉及的许多事实被简单地忽视、推迟或排除在比较之外。

The generative semanticists also saw Chomsky’s strategic roping-off of data to be evil in another way, reflected in Postal’s complaint a few pages back. Beyond the methodological error generative semanticists believed Chomsky to be committing, they also saw a deliberate and disingenuous attempt to cloud the discussion of everything about descriptive power, a beclouding carried out by virtually every interpretivist who raised the issue. This last phrase is redundant: to be an interpretivist in the seventies was to raise the issue. Whenever the interpretivists attacked generative semantics as too powerful, the entire generative semantic panoply of devices was brought into the tally—in particular, transformations, global rules, and transderivational constraints. On their side of the ledger, however, the interpretivists listed only transformations and constraints (which, of course, were not called global rules, and were held to reduce power, not increase it). Conspicuously absent were the increasingly powerful semantic interpretation rules. And since the generative semanticists felt responsible for a much wider class of phenomena than the interpretivists—phenomena of competence and of performance—there was another loophole in the accounting procedure. Many of the facts that generative semantics addressed were simply disregarded, postponed, left out of the comparison.

也就是说，解释语义学在限制性方面处于极好的修辞地位。它的架构更为复杂，乔姆斯基认为这是它的优势。它可以将许多现象留给语义解释规则，从而基本上免费处理它们。它可以将最麻烦的现象交给表现——充其量是朝着解决方案的方向挥手，例如“评论”的类比规则。正如我们所见，这些策略中的第一个，复杂性，让生成语义学家们大吃一惊。他们不相信乔姆斯基会这样做，也不相信有人会上当，也没有提出任何反驳。另外两个，将数据移入“自由”语义组件或表现的阴间，他们认为同样明显，但至少在这里，他们提请人们注意他们认为非常可疑的论证。

Interpretive semantics, that is, was in an extremely good rhetorical position on restrictiveness. Its architecture was more complex, which Chomsky claimed as an advantage. It could handle many phenomena essentially for free, by leaving them to semantic interpretation rules. And it could relegate the most troublesome phenomena to performance—at best waving in the direction of a solution, such as the analogic rules of “Remarks.” As we have seen, the first of these maneuvers, complexity, caught the generative semanticists rather slack-jawed. They couldn’t believe Chomsky would pull it, or that anyone would fall for it, and offered no counter-arguments. The other two, shuffling data into the “free” semantic component or into the netherworld of performance, they found equally blatant, but here at least they drew attention to what they regarded as very suspect argumentation.

事实上，甚至在乔姆斯基发起限制性攻击之前，拉科夫就在抱怨他使用外卡——从“备注”开始。回想一下上一章中乔姆斯基的类比技巧。乔姆斯基在“备注”中说，如果语法判断正确，那就很好。如果相反，我们可以将它们归因于性能规则，而这不是我关心的。正面，我赢；反面，你输。鉴于乔姆斯基对语法和可接受性的立场，批评/批评类比论证是现象拯救的一个相当标准的例子。但生成语义学家更多地将其视为现象冲洗，乔姆斯基将类比规则的可能性用作一个瓷碗，用来冲洗顽固的数据。在整个辩论过程中，所有的解释主义者都延续了这种策略，将麻烦的数据从他们以能力为中心的视野中移开，并表现出“如果理论创新可以归结为‘表现’，那么它就不需要特别的辩护”的态度 (McCawley, 1982b [1973]:29)。它继续让生成语义学家心烦意乱。

In fact, even before Chomsky had launched the restrictiveness assault, Lakoff was complaining about his use of wild cards—beginning with “Remarks.” Recall Chomsky’s trick with analogy from the last chapter. If the grammaticality judgments go the right way, Chomsky said in “Remarks”, well and good. If they go the other way, then we can attribute them to a rule of performance, and that’s not my concern. Heads, I win; tails, you lose. Given Chomsky’s position on grammaticality and acceptability, the criticism/criticizing-analogy-argument is a fairly standard example of phenomena saving. But the generative semanticists saw it more as phenomena flushing, Chomsky using the possibility of analogic rules as a porcelain bowl down which to wash recalcitrant data. All of the interpretivists continued this tack throughout the debate, shuffling troublesome data out of their competence-centered purview and exhibiting the attitude “that theoretical innovations need no particular justification if they can be relegated to ‘performance’” (McCawley, 1982b [1973]:29). It continued to drive the generative semanticists to distraction.

性能并不是唯一的罪魁祸首。语义解释规则也被引入，不仅是为了处理生成语义学家用转换或全局规则处理的语义现象，还为了处理大量（以前）句法现象。波斯特尔提出了他的交叉原则来解释简单的语法事实，而语法对于乔姆斯基语言学家来说是一个完全的句法野兽。38但 Jackendoff (1972:145–59) 认为，这些数据应该按照语义解释规则来处理，这种解释要求“Himself was shaved by Jeff”这样的单词序列符合语法。（“语法上形式良好”）但语义上异常。这种语义解释规则应用的最臭名昭著的例子发生在 1969 年的德克萨斯会议上，Lakoff 在那里提出了他从 Perlmutter 那里得到的关于西班牙语句子的论点。该论点认为，在某些方言中，15b 是一个合法的句子，表明它源自 15a（西班牙语要求形容词在性别上与它们修饰的名词一致）：

Performance wasn’t the only culprit. Semantic interpretation rules were also brought in, not just to handle semantic phenomena of the sort generative semanticists were handling with transformations or global rules, but for a surprising amount of (formerly) syntactic phenomena. Postal proposed his Crossover principle to explain straightforward grammaticality facts, and grammaticality was a wholly syntactic beast for Chomskyan linguists.38 But Jackendoff (1972:145–59) said that the data ought to be handled by semantic interpretation rules, an account that requires a sequence of words like “Himself was shaved by Jeff” to be grammatical (“syntactically well formed”) but semantically anomalous. The most notorious example of this application of semantic interpretation rules occurred at the 1969 Texas conference, where Lakoff presented an argument he had from Perlmutter concerning respectively sentences in Spanish. In some dialects, goes the argument, 15b is a legitimate sentence, indicating that it derives from 15a (Spanish requires adjectives to agree in gender with the nouns they modify):

15

15

我的母亲是阿尔塔，我的父亲是巴霍。

a Mi madre es alta y mi padre es bajo.

 

 

b Mis padres son rereivamente alta y bajo。

b Mis padres son respectivamente alta y bajo.

 

 

[我的父母分别是高个子女性和矮个子男性]

[My parents are respectively tallfeminine and shortmasculine]

数据明确支持词汇分解（padres来自madre y padre），并明确表明性别一致转换受语义制约（因为形容词与阳性的padres不一致，但与其隐含成分一致）——似乎为生成语义学提供了确凿的证据。乔姆斯基曾宣称性别一致是一种完全语义的现象，由语义解释规则而不是转换规则处理，这一立场意味着 16 完全符合语法，但在语义上却不正常：

The data clearly supports lexical decomposition (padres from madre y padre), and clearly suggests that the gender-agreement transformation is conditioned semantically (since the adjectives do not agree with padres, which is masculine, but with its implied constituents)—seeming to offer solid evidence for generative semantics. Chomsky is reputed to have declared gender agreement to be a wholly semantic phenomenon, something handled by semantic interpretation rules, rather than transformational rules, a position which implies that 16 is perfectly grammatical, but semantically anomalous:

16

16

我的父亲很年长。

Mis padres son alta.

由于性别一致性传统上被视为与人称、数和格等其他“句法”属性相同，因此英语中的一个必然结论是，17a 和 17b 都是合乎语法的，但 17b 在语义上有麻烦：

Since gender agreement had traditionally been treated the same as other “syntactic” properties, like person, number, and case, a corollary claim in English would be that 17a and 17b are both grammatical, but 17b is semantically troublesome:

17

17

a 我的父母给自己买了一辆名叫Moby 的房车。

a My parents bought themselves a motor home called Moby.

 

 

b 我的父母给她买了一辆叫Moby 的房车。

b My parents bought herself a motor home called Moby.

显然，我们无法可靠地重建会议论证，但乔姆斯基在《一些经验问题》中对这次交流进行了评论，他指出“如果 [15a 和 15b 中的事实] 准确，那么性别一致可能只是表面解释的问题，可能类似于共指的确定。这似乎并不奇怪”（1972b [1969]：155n26）。正如预防性、谨慎系词和双重否定都表明的那样，这样的结论实际上非常不自然，但如果它能让他把句法放在培养皿中，远离语义污染，乔姆斯基愿意接受它。三十九

We obviously can’t reconstruct the conference argument with any reliability, but Chomsky did comment on the exchange in “Some Empirical Issues,” observing that “if [the facts in 15a and 15b] are accurate, it would appear that gender agreement may be a matter of surface interpretation, perhaps similar to determination of coreference. This would seem not unnatural” (1972b [1969]:155n26). As the prophylactic would, the cautious copula, and the double negative all indicate, such a conclusion is in fact quite unnatural, but if it allows him to keep syntax in a petri dish, away from semantic contamination, Chomsky is willing to embrace it.39

生成语义学家们对此深感怀疑。无论他们提出什么论据，乔姆斯基都只是平静地将目标移回他们身上。麦考利用这件事来表明乔姆斯基准备对“普遍持有的‘语法性’概念”施加暴力，以及他准备将权力交给语义解释规则（1982b [1973]：89-90），以使语义远离句法；拉科夫用它来说明反证如何将解释学家推向“更加疯狂的立场”（Parret，1974 [1972]：169）。40今天，一个句子符合语法，明天，它就不符合语法，但由于表演规则而可以被接受；今天，一个句子不符合语法，明天，它就符合语法，但在语义上却是异常的。

The generative semanticists were incredulous. No matter what arguments they came up with, Chomsky just calmly moved the goalposts back on them. McCawley uses this incident to demonstrate the violence Chomsky is prepared to commit on the “commonly held conceptions of ‘grammaticality’” and the power he is prepared to give over to semantic interpretation rules (1982b [1973]:89–90) in order to keep semantics away from syntax; Lakoff uses it as an illustration of how counter-evidence can push the interpretivists “to ever crazier positions” (Parret, 1974 [1972]:169).40 One day a given sentence is grammatical, the next day it is ungrammatical but acceptable because of rules of performance; one day a sentence is ungrammatical, the next it is grammatical but semantically anomalous.

对他们而言，解释论者只是认为这些举动是负责任地将数据整理成最合适的堆。对他们来说，生成性语义学家们，由于他们制定的全局规则不明确，数据完全无法控制，看起来是疯子。更糟糕的是：他们正在滑入乔姆斯基拯救该领域的炼金术黑暗时代。

For their part, the interpretivists just regarded these moves as responsibly arranging their data into the piles that would make it most amenable. To them, the generative semanticists, with their ill-specified global rules and completely ungovernable data, were the ones who looked crazy. Worse: they were slipping back into the alchemical dark ages from which Chomsky had rescued the field.

布卢姆菲尔德主义的倒退

The Bloomfieldian Backslide

生成语言学是否遭到反革命地下组织的渗透？

Is generative linguistics infiltrated by a counter-revolutionary underground?

雷·多尔蒂

Ray Dougherty

乔姆斯基对布隆菲尔德学派的击溃是如此彻底，以至于到了 60 年代末，该学派的任何同义词（分类学的、描述性的——甚至是结构主义的，这些词对乔姆斯基的描述和其他人一样好，比某些人更贴切）也都是误导、不科学和愚笨的同义词。因此，这些同义词不可避免地会被用在最新的不科学的愚笨者、生成语义学家身上，而对生成语义学的最后一击是，它代表着倒退到乔姆斯基提出语言学的前科学时代；或者，用道尔蒂的准库恩术语来说，是一场布隆菲尔德的反革命。乔姆斯基在最后的运动中并不活跃，尽管他很可能是它的发起人；麻省理工学院流传出来的许多争论都是从他开始的，他当然赞同生成语义学是布隆菲尔德倒退的案例。41事实上，这个例子非常有力，尽管很难看到像 Dougherty (1974、1975、1976a、1976b、1976c)、Brame (1976)、Katz 和 Bever (1976 [1974]) 和 Ronat (1972 [1970]) 所看到的一样，回归布隆菲尔德主义的某些信条会带来同样多的邪恶。经验主义的邪恶对他们来说是如此不言而喻，以至于似乎没有人感到有负担去解释为什么这种回归是如此灾难性。Dougherty 和 Brame 满足于辱骂；Katz 和 Bever 仔细地展示了生成语义学如何为布隆菲尔德主义认识论的回归打开了大门，然后以不祥的“读者须知”结束了他们的论文。

Chomsky’s routing of the Bloomfieldians had been so complete that by the late sixties any of the synonyms for that school (taxonomic, descriptive—even structuralist, which described Chomsky as well as anyone, better than some) were also synonyms for misguided, unscientific, and blockheaded. So it was inevitable that these synonyms would be sprinkled on the newest unscientific blockheads, generative semanticists, and the final offensive against generative semantics was that it represented a backslide into the prescientific era from which Chomsky had raised linguistics; or, in Dougherty’s quasi-Kuhnian terminology, a Bloomfieldian counterrevolution. Chomsky was not active in the final campaign, though he may well have been its sponsor; much of the argumentation that flows out of MIT begins with him, and he certainly endorsed the generative-semantics-as-Bloomfieldian-backslide case.41 The case is in fact very strong, though it is difficult to see the same amount of evil in a return to some Bloomfieldian tenets that Dougherty (1974, 1975, 1976a, 1976b, 1976c), Brame (1976), Katz and Bever (1976 [1974]), and Ronat (1972 [1970]) all see. The evil of empiricism was so self-evident to them that none apparently felt any burden to establish why the return is so calamitous. Dougherty and Brame are content with name-calling; Katz and Bever show carefully how generative semantics opens the door for the return of Bloomfieldian epistemology, and then end their paper with an ominous “Caveat lector.”

倒退论证有两个主要部分，一个是方法论部分，另一个是哲学部分。该案例的方法论部分既愚蠢又尖刻，主要归功于道尔蒂，他提出了一些令人难忘的问题，

The backslide arguments have two primary components, one methodological, the other philosophical. The methodological part of the case was silly and vitriolic, and belongs mostly to Dougherty, who asked such memorable questions as

那些受过分类学方法论全面训练的语言学家现在怎么样了？那些给他们的老师们的分类学研究带来欢乐的老学生在哪里？那些一边忍受着一系列田野调查方法的痛苦，一边坚持不懈地从一个帐篷到另一个帐篷寻找音素的老学生在哪里？（1974:278）

Whatever became of those linguists who were thoroughly trained in taxonomic methodology? Where are those old students who brought joy to the taxonomic hearts of their old masters? Where are the old students who, while suffering through a sequence of field methods, relentlessly pursued the phoneme from teepee to teepee? (1974:278)

在用许多篇幅长篇大论的篇幅对麦考利 (McCawley)、罗斯 (Ross) 和莱科夫 (Lakoff) 进行批评，并给出诸如“从布洛赫 (Bloch) 等人那里汲取经验”等宽泛的暗示，并将波斯特尔 (Postal) 的作品诊断为可怕的疾病“生成性崩溃-分类学复发”的症状之后，道尔蒂让读者自己去寻找答案。42我们也可以就此打住道尔蒂，把方法论问题留给他。乔姆斯基为语言学增加了一些方法论——特别是强调内省证据和异常数据的价值——但他没有减去任何方法论。而且，无论如何，他认为，数据收集技术和分析工具远不如人们在收集和分析数据后能从中得到的意义重要。

After jumping all over McCawley and Ross and Lakoff for many haranguing pages, and dropping such broad hints as “having cut their eyeteeth on Bloch, etc.,” and diagnosing Postal’s work as symptomatic of the dread disease “Generative Breakdown-Taxonomic Relapse,” Dougherty leaves his readers to find the answers on their own.42 And we can leave Dougherty at this point, too, and leave the methodological issues with him. Chomsky added some methodology to linguistics—in particular, an emphasis on introspective evidence and on the value of deviant data—but he didn’t subtract any. And, in any case, he argued that data-collecting techniques and tools of analysis were far less important than the sense one could make out of the data once it was collected and analyzed.

哲学部分，最有说服力的代表是卡茨和贝弗的（1976 [1974]）然而，“经验主义的衰落与崛起”需要更仔细的研究。正如标题所示，这个案例涉及经验主义，因此涉及术语上的阴阳，并要求对这些术语进行复述：

The philosophical component, represented most cogently by Katz and Bever’s (1976 [1974]) “The Fall and Rise of Empiricism,” requires a little closer examination, however. As the title suggests, the case concerned empiricism, and therefore the terminological yin to its yang, and calls for a rehearsal of those terms:

经验主义：大多数知识是通过感官获得的。

Empiricism: most knowledge is acquired through the senses.

理性主义：大多数知识不是通过感官获得的。

Rationalism: most knowledge is not acquired through the senses.

因此，布卢姆菲尔德语言学属于前者，即经验主义，而乔姆斯基语言学属于后者，即理性主义——很少有人会对此提出异议。布卢姆菲尔德对语言的心理方面表示赞同，他在很大程度上赞同行为主义，一种彻底的经验主义心理学；乔姆斯基专注于语言的心理方面，持有一种彻底的理性主义心理学。布卢姆菲尔德和乔姆斯基对这些忠诚的态度非常明确。然而，生成语义学家却不是这样，这就是争论变得有趣的地方。事实上，卡茨和贝弗从未争论过生成语义学包含经验主义认识论，或者生成语义学家有意采用经验主义：

The case proceeds, then, that Bloomfieldian linguistics falls into the former category, empiricism, and Chomskyan linguistics falls into the latter category, rationalism—points that very few people would dispute. To the extent that Bloomfield nodded in the direction of the mental aspects of language, he subscribed largely to behaviorism, a thoroughly empiricist psychology; Chomsky, who is preoccupied with the mental aspects of language, holds a thoroughly rationalist psychology. Bloomfield and Chomsky are explicit about these allegiances. The generative semanticists, however, are not, which is where the argument gets interesting. In fact, Katz and Bever never argue either that generative semantics entails an empiricist epistemology, or that generative semanticists have deliberately adopted empiricism:

我们并不声称那些将经验主义带回来的语言学家一定是经验主义者，也不声称他们意识到自己的工作具有这种推动力，而只是声称他们的工作为经验主义的回归扫清了道路。（Katz and Bever，1976 [1974]：30）

We do not claim that the linguists who are bringing it back are necessarily empiricists or are aware that their work has this thrust, but only that their work clears the way for the return of empiricism. (Katz and Bever, 1976 [1974]:30)

生成语义学家似乎在不知不觉中为经验主义的复兴提供了媒介。卡茨和贝弗对生成语义学将引领语言学的发展方向敲响了警钟，而不是对其当前（七十年代中期）的立场。但他们认为，这是一个非常危险的方向。他们借用冷战时期美国外交政策的言论，在语言消费者心中制造恐惧，提出了一种多米诺骨牌理论，即经验主义正在侵蚀语言学，该理论建立在语法性概念的基础上：首先是放松；然后是修改；最终必须将其丢弃。他们辩称：“一旦它倒下，其他多米诺骨牌也会倒下：对话怪异；接下来是文化偏差，然后是感知复杂性，等等”（1976 [1974]：59）。

Generative semanticists, it seems, are unwittingly providing a medium for the reemergence of empiricism. Katz and Bever sound the alarm about the direction in which generative semantics will lead linguistics, not about its current (mid-seventies) stance. But, they believe, this is a very dangerous direction. Trotting out the rhetoric of cold-war American foreign policy to strike fear in the hearts of linguistic consumers, they propose a domino theory of encroaching empiricism in linguistics, built around the notion of grammaticality: first it is relaxed; then it is modified; eventually it must be discarded. “Once it fell,” they argue, “so would each other domino: conversational bizarreness; next cultural deviance, then, perceptual complexity, and so on” (1976 [1974]:59).

他们的案例比我们在这里需要探讨的更为详细，并且存在一些复杂因素——例如，相对语法性并不像他们所描绘的那么可怕（例如，乔姆斯基认为它与他自己的工作兼容——1972b [1969]：121），而卡茨的符号变体立场使讨论变得模糊——但毫无疑问，生成语义学代表着向经验主义的回归。例如，看看麦考利如何批评乔姆斯基在定义他的程序的中心焦点时所制作的著名图表（如图 7.3所示）。“这种解释的缺陷，”麦考利说，在于它让孩子看起来像“一个语言学家，从新几内亚的消息来源那里获取了十本写满数据的笔记本，但直到乘船返回美国才开始写下语法”（1976b [1968]：171）；也就是说，该模型不提供假设检验、实验和游戏玩法——简而言之，它不提供反馈——所有这些都不是通过接触数据（理性主义立场）来定义的，而是通过与数据的交互（经验主义立场）来定义的。McCawley 建议按照图 7.4的思路修改该图。

Their case is more detailed than we need explore here, and there are complications—relative grammaticality is not quite the terror they paint it to be, for instance (Chomsky, for one, finds it compatible with his own work—1972b [1969]:121), and Katz’s notational variants position clouds the discussion—but generative semantics unquestionably represents a return to empiricism. Look, for instance, at how McCawley criticizes a diagram Chomsky had made famous in defining the central focus of his program (given as figure 7.3). “The flaw in this account,” McCawley says, is that it makes the child look like “a linguist who elicits ten notebooks full of data from his informants in New Guinea and doesn’t start writing his grammar until he is on the boat back to the United States” (1976b [1968]:171); that is, the model doesn’t provide for hypothesis-testing, experimentation, and gameplaying—in a word, it doesn’t provide for feedback—all of which are defined not by exposure to data (the rationalist position) but interaction with data (the empiricist position). McCawley suggests the diagram be revised along the lines of figure 7.4.

图 7.3 . 乔姆斯基的“假设的语言习得装置”（改编自 McCawley，1976b [1968]：171 和 Chomsky，1966b：10）。

Figure 7.3. Chomsky’s “hypothetical language-acquisition device” (adapted from McCawley, 1976b [1968]:171, and Chomsky, 1966b:10).

麦考利的评论是对乔姆斯基的故意误读，乔姆斯基并不否认“原始语言数据”包括反馈，并且习得手段涉及在完全掌握之前制定和修改连续语法；事实上，他的评估指标概念是建立在选择性修改的基础上的。43但这两张图还是很有启发性的。乔姆斯基并不特别关注语言习得的过程，例如，他很少在他的著作中引用实证习得研究，而麦考利在这里修改的图表（即图 7.3）在他的著作中反复出现，基本上是相同的形式。他对认知机制“习得装置”的属性的兴趣远大于对其具体使用的兴趣——这是一种明确的理性主义关注。麦考利至少对这种机制的工作方式、它与通用学习策略的互动方式以及习得数据的特征感兴趣——这些都是经验主义关注的问题。他并不拒绝乔姆斯基关于语言习得的理性主义论点。他只是兴趣更广泛一些：

McCawley’s commentary is a willful misreading of Chomsky, who would not deny that “primary linguistic data” includes feedback, and that the acquisition device involves the formulation and modification of successive grammars before full competence is achieved; indeed, his notion of an evaluation metric is predicated on selective modification.43 But the two diagrams are nonetheless very revealing. Chomsky is not especially concerned with the process of language acquisition in any detailed way; he rarely cites empirical acquisition studies in his work, for instance, and the diagram McCawley modifies here (that is, figure 7.3) shows up recurrently in his work, essentially in the same form. He is interested far more in the properties of the cognitive mechanism, Acquisition Device, than in its specific employment—a definitively rationalist concern. McCawley is interested at least as much in the way the mechanism is put to work, and in the way it interacts with general-purpose learning strategies, and in the character of the acquisition data—empiricist concerns all. He doesn’t reject Chomsky’s rationalist arguments about language acquisition. He just has somewhat broader interests:

乔姆斯基的著名论点是，语言习得不能仅靠通用学习能力来完成，但这并不意味着得出通用学习机制在语言习得中不起作用的结论：通用学习能力显然是存在的……而认为它们在语言习得过程中关闭是荒谬的。（1980b：183）

Chomsky’s well-known arguments that language acquisition cannot be accomplished purely by general purpose learning faculties should not lead to the non sequitur of concluding that general purpose learning mechanisms play no role in language acquisition: General purpose learning faculties clearly exist… and it is absurd to suppose that they shut off while language is being acquired. (1980b:183)

然而，回到主要的批评，我们发现卡茨和贝弗几乎没有考虑麦考利。他们几乎只关注莱考夫，这说明了到 70 年代中期，生成语义学已经与莱考夫紧密相关，尤其是在解释者的眼中，44但他们也不看他对这个问题的任何言论。到 70 年代初，他说的话相当一致。他有点“我知道你是，但我是什么？”嘲讽经验主义，就像他在评论（还有谁？）乔姆斯基时说的那样：

Returning to the main critique, however, we find that Katz and Bever barely consider McCawley. They focus almost exclusively on Lakoff, which, among other things, illustrates how fully generative semantics had come to be associated with Lakoff by the mid-seventies, especially in interpretive eyes,44 but they don’t look at anything he said about the issue either. What he said was fairly consistent by the early seventies. There was a little I-know-you-are-but-what-am-I? taunting about empiricism, as in his remarks about (who else?) Chomsky:

图 7.4 . McCawley 对乔姆斯基“习得装置”的修改（改编自 McCawley，1976b[1968]：171）。

Figure 7.4. McCawley’s modification of Chomsky’s Acquisition Device (adapted from McCawley, 1976b [1968]:171).

我想说，在当代语言学家中，乔姆斯基是经验主义语言学家中比较有经验主义倾向的一位……因为他仍然对解释表层结构中构成词的分布感兴趣，而不考虑意义。（Parret，1974 [1972]：172；另见 McCawley 的评论，第 251 页）

I would say that, of contemporary linguists, Chomsky is among the more empiricist linguists… in the sense that he is still interested in accounting for distributions of formatives in surface structure without regard to meaning. (Parret, 1974 [1972]:172; see also McCawley’s comments, p. 251)

但在大多数情况下，莱考夫很乐意承认自己的兴趣——事实上，他称自己为“好人经验主义者”——并乐于与乔姆斯基的前辈们联系在一起，赞扬布卢姆菲尔德学派创造了“一个广泛、多样、有趣的领域，但这个领域恰好不太擅长处理乔姆斯基提出的句法问题，而且对形式化理论兴趣不大”(1973c)。此外，他声称“当转换语法取代结构语言学时，它也取代了许多此类关注，这对该领域造成了很大损害”(Parret, 1974 [1972]:172)。更明确地说，即使他对乔姆斯基著名的本土论证的解释也为经验主义留下了很大的空间，远远超出了麦考利的宽容和让别人宽容、不要忘记通用学习能力的解释。拉科夫用二元术语阐述了这一论点的含义，并强烈反对理性主义的一面：

But, for the most part, Lakoff was happy to admit his interests—he calls himself, in fact, a “Good Guy Empiricist”—and happy being associated with Chomsky’s immediate predecessors, celebrating the Bloomfieldians for their creation of “a broad, diverse, and interesting field, which happened not to be very good at dealing with the syntactical problems raised by Chomsky, and which showed little interest in formalized theories” (1973c). Further, he claimed that “when transformational grammar eclipsed structural linguistics, it also eclipsed many of these concerns, much to the detriment of the field” (Parret, 1974 [1972]:172). More explicitly, even his interpretation of Chomsky’s famous nativist arguments leaves a good deal of room for empiricism, going considerably beyond McCawley’s live-and-let-live, don’t-forget-general-purpose-learning-faculties interpretation. Lakoff puts the implications of the argument in binary terms, and lobbies heavily against the rationalist side of the coin:

乔姆斯基表明，要么存在一种特定的语言天赋，要么存在一种普遍的学习理论（尚未形成），语言普遍性的习得由此而来。前者很可能是正确的，但在我看来，后者是一个更有趣的结论[尽管参见 Lakoff，1968b：1-4，当时他认为前者更有趣]。如果我是一名心理学家，我会更有兴趣看看语言机制和其他认知机制之间是否存在联系，而不是简单地做出最不感兴趣的假设，即不存在任何联系。（Lakoff，1973c；斜体为他所加）。

What Chomsky has shown is that either there is a specifically linguistic innate faculty or there is a general learning theory (not yet formulated) from which the acquisition of language universals follows. The former may well turn out to be true, but in my opinion the latter would be a much more interesting conclusion [though see Lakoff, 1968b:1–4, when he found the former more interesting]. If I were a psychologist, I would be much more interested in seeing if there were connections between linguistic mechanisms and other cognitive mechanisms, than in simply making the assumption with the least possible interest, namely, that there are none. (Lakoff, 1973c; his italics).

或者，几年后，看看他对日常语法学家对待语言理论的方法的描述：

Or, a few years later, take his depiction of the workaday grammarian’s approach to linguistic theory:

实际上，你试图建立自己的语言理论，使语言能力最终尽可能地成为非语言能力的特例。以这种方式研究语言学是有充分理由的。语言能力与我们人类的其他方面毫无关系似乎非常不可信。对我来说，语言学中最有趣的结果是那些表明语言与我们人类的其他方面如何相关的结果。（Lakoff，1977a：238）

In practice, you try to set up your linguistic theory in such a way that linguistic abilities will ultimately turn out to be special cases of nonlinguistic abilities as much as possible. There is good reason for going about linguistics in this way. It seems highly implausible that linguistic ability has nothing whatsoever to do with any other aspect of our being human. For me the most interesting results in linguistics would be those showing how language is related to other aspects of our being human. (Lakoff, 1977a:238)

与此同时，罗斯开始越来越多地强调泽利格·哈里斯的影响——例如，在一篇以其奇怪的历史感而引人注目的论文中，罗斯引用了哈里斯作为现代语言学概念突破的标志。这篇论文是写给认知心理学家的，概述了语言学家可以对他们的领域做出的贡献，而哈里斯，作为一个彻底的反心理主义者，为这些贡献的实现获得了最大的赞誉；令人难以置信的是，直到文章的很后面才提到乔姆斯基，当时他被引人注目地介绍为哈里斯的学生（1974b:64, 68）。45为了追求同一主题，Lakoff将乔姆斯基学徒生涯的含义推向了更加荒谬的境地，表明他的作品是盲目模仿的：

Meanwhile, Ross began to emphasize Zellig Harris’s influence more and more—citing him, for instance, as marking the major conceptual break that led to modern linguistics, in a paper remarkable for its odd sense of history. The paper is addressed to cognitive psychologists, outlining the sorts of contributions linguists can make to their field, and Harris, as thoroughgoing an anti-mentalist as they come, gets the lion’s share of the credit for making these contributions possible; Chomsky, incredibly, is not even mentioned until well into the article, when he is conspicuously introduced as Harris’s student (1974b:64, 68).45 Pursuing the same theme, Lakoff takes the implications of Chomsky’s apprenticeship to even further absurdities, suggesting that his work is mindlessly derivative:

乔姆斯基在智力发展方面极其依赖老师。他早期的语言分析大部分都直接来自哈里斯，转化的思想也是如此。评估指标的思想则直接来自纳尔逊·古德曼。（Parret，1974 [1972]：172-73）。

Chomsky was extraordinarily dependent on his teachers for his intellectual development. Most of his early linguistic analyses are taken directly from Harris, as is the idea of the transformation. The idea of evaluation metrics was taken over directly from Nelson Goodman. (Parret, 1974 [1972]:172–73).

生成语义学与布隆菲尔德语言学之间的联系令人困惑不已。一方面，人们有一种标准反应，即追溯历史，拥抱敌人的敌人，就像乔姆斯基追溯洪堡和笛卡尔一样。另一方面，乔姆斯基也令人困惑，他无论如何都只是布隆菲尔德的衍生派。

There was a schizophrenia about the links generative semantics were reforging with Bloomfieldian linguistics. On the one hand, there was something of the standard reaction to reach back historically to embrace the enemy of your enemy, as Chomsky had reached back to Humboldt and Descartes. On the confused other hand, Chomsky was just a derivative Bloomfieldian anyway.

分手

Parting Company

当两个对手争论时，尽管他们最初的立场差异可能很小，但在他们戏剧性的“辩证压力”下，他们最终会在所有事情上发生冲突。无论他们中的一个人主张什么，另一个人（响应比赛的天才）都会强烈反对——反之亦然。

When two opponents have been arguing, though the initial difference in their positions may have been slight, they tend under the ‘dialectical pressure’ of their drama to become eventually at odds in everything. No matter what one of them happens to assert, the other (responding to the genius of the contest) takes violent exception to it—and vice versa.

肯尼斯伯克

Kenneth Burke

申克将波斯特尔在 70 年代早期的主要工作描述为“不断提出反对乔姆斯基教授理论的异议”（1972 年），这实际上很好地描述了双方在很大一部分争论中所做的事情。许多反对乔姆斯基教授著作的异议都是不集中的，从抽象句法中渗透出来——波斯特尔的动词-形容词混合、罗斯的辅助分析、麦考利对选择限制的语义而非句法的重新分析。当跨过生成语义的门槛时，异议变得更加具体，集中在深层结构上——麦考利的分别论证、波斯特尔的提醒论证、谓词引发论证、导致死亡论证。就乔姆斯基教授而言，他一开始的异议也有些松散和不集中。 “评论”提案蚕食了生成语义学的抽象句法基础，但它产生的例外却有些零散，一会儿追随抽象动词，一会儿追随范畴还原，一会儿追随“转换主义假设”。

Shenker describes Postal’s main occupation in the early seventies as “proliferating exceptions to Professor Chomsky’s theories” (1972), which is actually a pretty good phrase for what both sides were up to for a goodly portion of the dispute. A great many exceptions to Professor Chomsky’s work, of an unfocused sort, percolated out of abstract syntax—Postal’s verb-adjective conflation, Ross’s auxiliary analysis, McCawley’s reanalysis of selectional restrictions as semantic rather than syntactic. When the threshold to generative semantics was crossed, the exceptions became far more specific, zeroing in on deep structure—McCawley’s respectively argument, Postal’s remind argument, the Predicate-raising, CAUSE-TO-DIE argument. On Professor Chomsky’s part, he too started out with somewhat loose and unfocused exceptions. The “Remarks” proposals gnawed away at the abstract-syntax foundations of generative semantics, but the exceptions it spins out are somewhat scattered, going after abstract verbs here, category-reduction there, “the transformationalist hypothesis” somewhere else.

然而，在接下来的两年里，在乔姆斯基的领导下，整个麻省理工学院的项目只针对卡茨-波斯特尔假说提出了一类非常具体的例外。与此同时，生成语义学家们不再攻击深层结构，而是开始从左、右、中间三个角度对乔姆斯基教授的作品提出实用和语法方面的例外。

For the next two years, however, the whole MIT program, Chomsky at the helm, did little more than proliferate a class of very specific exceptions, directed at the Katz-Postal hypothesis. Meanwhile, the generative semanticists switched from their assault on deep structure and began proliferating pragmatic and grammaticality exceptions to Professor Chomsky’s work, left, right, and center.

此时，一个相当明显的区别浮现出来。生成语义学家热爱数据。数据给各种理论机制带来的问题越多，他们似乎就越热爱数据。整个 70 年代，他们埋头苦干，不断增加例外。解释学家热爱理论。数据越成问题，他们就越急切地将其转移到语法领域，而他们对此几乎不承担任何责任。而且，由于例外的激增是一项数据密集型活动，他们很快就厌倦了。他们对生成语义学的攻击主要集中在概念上。很快，他们就提出了以下论点：生成语义学只是同一旧语法的新名称（符号变体）；它滥用理论机制（不受限制）；它的哲学是错误的（倒退回布卢姆菲尔德经验主义）。有时，这些论点结合起来会使人难以置信；例如，乔姆斯基在一段话中说，全局规则“与杰肯多夫等人提出的解释规则非常相似，甚至完全相同”，但它们为语法理论增加了“巨大的描述潜力”，因此它们的引入“是一种非常不受欢迎的举动”（1979 [1976]：152）：全局规则是好规则类型的符号变体，但它们是一种坏规则类型。

At this point a rather clear difference surfaced. The generative semanticists loved data. And the more problems it caused for various bits of theoretical machinery, the more they seemed to love it. They kept their exception-proliferating noses to the grindstone throughout the seventies. The interpretivists loved theory. And the more problematic the data was, the more eagerly they shunted it off to grammatical provinces for which they felt little or no responsibility. And, since exception-proliferation is a data-heavy activity, they quickly tired of it. The brunt of their attack on generative semantics became conceptual. In fairly rapid succession, the arguments came: generative semantics is just a new name for the same old grammar (a notational variant); it is licentious in its use of theoretical mechanisms (unrestrictive); and it has the wrong philosophy (backsliding into Bloomfieldian empiricism).
