At times, the combination of these arguments strains credulity to the limits; for instance, in one paragraph Chomsky says that global rules “are quite similar, if not identical, to the interpretive rules proposed by Jackendoff and others,” but that they add “immense descriptive potential” to grammatical theory, and thus their introduction “constitutes a highly undesirable move” (1979 [1976]:152): global rules are notational variants of a good rule-type, but they are a bad rule-type.

生成语义学家不断提出异议，并对解释主义者的反应感到震惊，也就是乔姆斯基的反应。他们指责乔姆斯基对语法的概念过于狭隘，这种概念只是为了将他的理论与残酷的语言事实世界隔离开来。他们指责乔姆斯基将那些被排除的事实扫到表演或语义解释的地毯下，或者向他们挥舞着不成熟的、不明确的解决方案。然后，突然间，他们发现乔姆斯基根本不在乎。在 1969 年的德克萨斯论文《一些经验问题》中遭到一连串反驳之后，乔姆斯基就转身背对了他们。他仍然乐于在课堂上、采访中和其他非正式场合抨击生成语义学，并且仍然乐于这样做，但在德克萨斯论文发表之后，他在正式工作中很少得到哪怕一个轻蔑的脚注。 1971 年，他提出踪迹的论文《转换的条件》开始在地下流传（发表于 1973a；1977：81-162），这标志着他正式退出辩论。萨多克说，在那篇论文之前，乔姆斯基“仍在使用同样的术语”。之后，“出现了一种新的哲学”，一种限制性的哲学，完全忽视了推动生成语义学的任何问题。他的学生继续发起攻击，变得越来越野蛮，但乔姆斯基几乎没有对他的老对手留下任何嘲讽的暗示。他放弃了异议言论，转而从事积极的工作。

The generative semanticists kept proliferating their exceptions, and were stunned at the interpretivist reaction; that is, at Chomsky’s reaction. They accused him of an absurdly narrow conception of grammaticality, a conception invoked only to buffer his theory from the cruel world of linguistic facts. They accused him of sweeping those excluded facts under the performance or semantic interpretation carpet, or waving half-baked, inexplicit solutions at them. Then, suddenly, they found that he just didn’t care. After the barrage of counter-arguments in his 1969 Texas paper, “Some Empirical Issues,” he just turned his back on them. He was still happy to bash generative semantics in class, in interviews, and other informal settings, and remains happy to do so, but it rarely earned even a contemptuous footnote in his formal work after the Texas paper. In 1971, his trace-proposing paper, “Conditions on Transformations,” began circulating underground (published 1973a; 1977:81–162), and it marks his official withdrawal from the debate. Before that paper, Sadock says, Chomsky was “still talking the same lingo.” Afterwards, “there was a new philosophy,” a philosophy of restrictiveness, and a complete inattention to any of the issues that were driving generative semantics. His students continued to press the attack, becoming more and more savage, but Chomsky had barely a sneering allusion left for his old enemies. He gave up his rhetoric of dissent to pursue positive work.

然而，萨多克没有注意到，生成语义学使用的术语也和它最初使用的不一样。生成语义学家也走自己的路。到 70 年代中期，他们不再“从事‘生成语法’研究” (McCawley, 1982b [1973]:11)。46最简洁的转折点——或者说，也许是燃点，因为他们在身后点燃了桥梁——是关于语法的概念。但存在许多分歧。

What Sadock fails to notice, however, is that generative semantics wasn’t talking the same lingo it started with either. Generative semanticists had also gone their own way. By the mid-seventies, they were no longer “engaged in ‘generative grammar’” (McCawley, 1982b [1973]:11).46 The most succinct turning point—or, perhaps, burning point, as they torched their bridges behind them—was over the notion of grammaticality. But there were many, many divergences.

修辞上的失败已是彻底的。杰弗里·普勒姆 (Geoffrey Pullum) 回忆起他和戴尔德丽·威尔逊 (Deirdre Wilson) 在 70 年代中期撰写的一篇关于辅助武器的论文 (Pullum and Wilson, 1977) 时的反应：

The rhetorical breakdown was complete. Witness Geoffrey Pullum’s recollection of the reception for a paper about auxiliaries he and Deirdre Wilson wrote in the mid-seventies (Pullum and Wilson, 1977):

它拼命地试图将助动词是否是主动词（它们是）的问题与生成语义学是否正确的问题区分开来。几乎没有人听。我们还不如建议以色列人和巴勒斯坦人坐下来谈谈。

It tried desperately to separate the issue of whether auxiliaries are main verbs (they are) from the issue of whether generative semantics was right. Hardly anyone was listening. We might as well have suggested the Israelis and the Palestinians sit down together and talk.

双方各执一词。在生成语义学家看来，他们似乎已经胜利了。正如乔姆斯基回忆的那样，在 70 年代中期，““当时，绝大多数对转换语法感兴趣的语言学家都在做某种生成语义学”（1982a [1979–80]：43）。不仅麻省理工学院第一代语言学家对此着迷，他们的学生也是如此。大多数主要机构都在进行有影响力的生成语义学工作——德克萨斯大学奥斯汀分校、马萨诸塞大学阿默斯特分校、加州大学洛杉矶分校、伊利诺伊大学厄巴纳-纳分校、密歇根大学（莱考夫夫妇曾在此短暂任教），当然还有芝加哥大学。乔姆斯基实际上只有麻省理工学院，甚至在那里，波斯特尔、珀尔马特和罗斯也曾在那个时期站稳脚跟。七十年代的转换教科书几乎都包含一种前沿部分，宣称或暗示生成语义学是未来的语言学。最引人注目的例子是约翰·金博尔的《语法的形式理论》。金博尔于 1971 年毕业于麻省理工学院，他著作的最后一部分并没有暗示乔姆斯基对语义问题持有当代观点。生成语义学自然地继承了“标准理论”，就像标准理论自然地继承了《句法结构》（金博尔，1973：116-26）中提出的理论一样；几乎可以说，乔姆斯基在《方面》之后就退休了。四十七

Each side went its own way. To the generative semanticists, it looked pretty much like they were going off in victory. As Chomsky recalls, in the mid-seventies, “the overwhelming mass of linguists interested in transformational grammar were doing some kind of generative semantics” (1982a [1979–80]:43). Not only was the first generation of MIT linguists enamored of it, so were their students. Influential generative semantics work was being done at most of the major institutions—at the University of Texas-Austin, at the University of Massachusetts-Amherst, at the University of California-Los Angeles, at University of Illinois-Urbana, at the University of Michigan (where the Lakoffs taught briefly), and, of course, at the University of Chicago. Chomsky really had only MIT, and even there Postal, Perlmutter, and Ross had toeholds in the period. Transformational textbooks from the seventies virtually all include a sort of cutting-edge section that declares or suggests generative semantics to be the linguistics of the future. The most dramatic illustration is John Kimball’s The Formal Theory of Grammar. Kimball was a 1971 MIT graduate, and the final section of his book doesn’t so much as hint that Chomsky has a contemporary position on semantic questions. Generative semantics shows up as the natural successor to the “standard theory,” just as natural a successor to that theory as the standard theory was to the one presented in Syntactic Structures (Kimball, 1973:116–26); it’s almost as if Chomsky retired after Aspects.47

不仅仅是年轻的语言学家赞同生成语义学。许多前几代语言学家也发现该模型非常有吸引力。埃蒙·巴赫早期很有影响力，而李斯则热情地支持它。华莱士·查菲自己也独立提出了一种基于语义的转换语法（1967a、1970a、1970b），但他与生成语义学保持一致（尤其是 1970b：56、68）。甚至一些来自语言学坟场的布鲁姆菲尔德主义者也表示赞同。希尔的 LSA 回忆录捕捉到了 70 年代老派（或者可能是“非常老派”，因为乔姆斯基现在看起来像老派）的普遍情绪——希尔回忆起深情地收到了罗斯的抽象语法工作，对罗宾·莱考夫的论文感到高兴，因为论文揭露了乔姆斯基的笛卡尔主张，甚至称赞了另一位莱考夫的幽默句子。尤金·奈达 (Eugene Nida) 称其 70 年代中期的作品“依赖于生成语义学方法”(1975:8)，而豪斯霍尔德 (Householder) 则评论道：“罗斯、莱考夫、麦考利和莱考夫夫人对基础性质的看法……是我认为最合意的”(1970:35)。德怀特·博林格 (Dwight Bolinger) 更进一步，成为该运动的积极盟友，并广泛出现在生成语义学的脚注中，以提供深刻或鼓舞人心的帮助；罗斯在一篇文章中特别感谢他，因为他“一直在说我在本文中所说的那种东西，时间比我能听到的要长得多”(1973c:234)。即使是转型的鼻祖泽利格·哈里斯 (Zellig Harris) 也被他的支持者吹捧为发展了一种“类似于生成语义学理论”的理论 (Muntz, 1972:270)。四十八

Nor was it just the younger linguists who were signing up to generative semantics. Many linguists from earlier generations also found the model very attractive. Emmon Bach was influential early on, and Lees endorsed it with enthusiasm. Wallace Chafe had proposed a semantically-based transformational grammar himself, independently (1967a, 1970a, 1970b), but aligned himself with generative semantics (especially, 1970b:56, 68). Even some Bloomfieldians, from the linguistics boneyard, rattled in approval. Hill’s LSA memoir captures the general mood of the old guard (or maybe “the very old guard,” since Chomsky now looked like the old guard) in the seventies—Hill recalls receiving Ross’s abstract syntax work fondly, delighting at a Robin Lakoff paper for blowing the lid off Chomsky’s Cartesian claims, and even praises the other Lakoff for his humorous sentences. Eugene Nida painted his mid-seventies work as having “a dependence on the generative semantics approach” (1975:8), and Householder commented that “the views of Ross, Lakoff, McCawley, [and] Mrs. Lakoff on the nature of the base … are the ones which I find most congenial” (1970:35). Dwight Bolinger went a step further, becoming an active ally in the movement, and shows up widely in generative semantics footnotes for perceptive or inspiring assistance; Ross singles him out for “a special kind of thanks” in one article, because he “has been saying the kind of things I say in this paper for a lot longer than I have been able to hear them” (1973c:234). Even the transformational granddaddy, Zellig Harris, was being touted by his supporters as developing a theory “similar to a generative semantics theory” (Muntz, 1972:270).48

心理学家发现生成语义学很有吸引力，原因显而易见——“生成语义学对心理学家的吸引力在于，它更合理地假设说话者首先生成‘他想说的’基本语义内容，然后再将其转化为适当的句法形式”（Greene，1972：85）——领先的生成语义学家很容易就赢得了他们的青睐。例如，麦考利和罗斯是 1972 年认知和符号过程会议的特邀演讲者（McCawley，1974b；Ross, 1974b)。哲学家们也表现出了浓厚的兴趣，尤其欢迎 Lakoff 和 McCawley 对逻辑形式的探索。例如，Donald Davidson 和 Gilbert Harman 于 1969 年邀请他们参加“斯坦福大学一次温馨的跨文化座谈会”（Quine, 1985:357），然后将 Ross 的一篇论文收录在该座谈会的论文集中（Lakoff, 1972b；McCawley, 1972；Ross, 1972d。另见 Harman, 1972）。49

Psychologists found generative semantics appealing, for obvious reasons—“the attraction for psychologists of generative semantics is the greater plausibility of supposing that a speaker begins by generating the basic semantic content of ‘what he wants to say’, only then going on to cast it in an appropriate syntactic form” (Greene, 1972:85)—and the leading generative semanticists had no trouble gaining a hearing with them. McCawley and Ross, for instance, were featured presenters at the 1972 Conference on Cognition and Symbolic Processes (McCawley, 1974b; Ross, 1974b). Philosophers, too, showed considerable interest, welcoming in particular the explorations of logical form by Lakoff and McCawley. Donald Davidson and Gilbert Harman, for instance, invited them to “a cozy cross-cultural colloquium at Stanford” in 1969 (Quine, 1985:357), and then included a paper by Ross in the collection of work stemming out of that colloquium (Lakoff, 1972b; McCawley, 1972; Ross, 1972d. See also Harman, 1972).49

欧洲人大多在 20 世纪 60 年代末才开始对转换工作产生兴趣，他们也大量接受了生成语义学。Pieter Seuren、Rudolf de Rijk 和 Werner Abraham 都成为了有影响力的生成语义学家。该模型在瑞典、法国和德国拥有大量追随者，Herbert Brekle 的《生成语义学》在这些国家出版了两版（1970 [1968]、1978），重要的美国论文都得到了译本（Abraham and Binnick，1972；Lakoff，1971d；Vater，1971）。在捷克斯洛伐克，Petr Sgall 独立提出了基于语义的转换语法，该术语迅速获得认可。日本的追随者甚至越来越多，在澳大利亚，Frans Liefrink 提出了他的语义句法（1973）。

Europeans, most of whom only became interested in transformational work in the late sixties, also signed on to generative semantics in large numbers. Pieter Seuren, Rudolf de Rijk, and Werner Abraham all became influential generative semanticists. The model had notable followings in Sweden, France, and Germany, where Herbert Brekle’s Generative Satzsemantik went through two editions (1970 [1968], 1978), and where the important American papers all saw translations (Abraham and Binnick, 1972; Lakoff, 1971d; Vater, 1971). In Czechoslovakia, where Petr Sgall had independently proposed a semantically based transformational grammar, the term gained rapid acceptance. There was even a growing following in Japan, and in Australia, Frans Liefrink proposed his Semantico-Syntax (1973).

生成语义学似乎是语言学的未来，而乔姆斯基和他的解释学家则是过去。盖伊·卡登甚至还记得他的老老师对他 70 年代中期的一篇试图与解释学家保持对话的论文表示困惑：“盖伊，你为什么还在和那些人说话？”莱科夫问他。“你没注意到战争结束了吗？我们赢了。”莱科夫在大约同一时间说了一句他可能认为是最后一句话的话，他说辩论的“乐趣之一”是“胜利者可以对失败者说‘Nyaah，nyaah！’”当然，几页之后，论文以“Nyaah，nyaah！”结尾（1973b：286，290）。这条评论告诉我们一些关于争议动态的信息，一些关于生成语义论证风格的信息，以及很多关于莱科夫的信息。

Generative semantics, it seemed, was the future of linguistics; Chomsky and his interpretivists, the past. Guy Carden even remembers his old teacher expressing puzzlement over one of his mid-seventies papers that attempted to keep a dialogue open with the interpretivists: “Guy, why are you still talking to those people?” Lakoff asked him. “Haven’t you noticed the war is over? We’ve won.” Getting in what he may have taken to be the last word, Lakoff remarked at about the same time that “one of the joys” of debating is that “the winner gets to say ‘Nyaah, nyaah!’ to the loser,” a few pages later, of course, ending the paper with “Nyaah, nyaah!” (1973b:286, 290). The comment tells us something about the dynamics of the dispute, a little about the style of generative semantics argumentation, and a lot about Lakoff.

别挂断电话，乔治。故事还没有结束。

Hold the phone, George. The story’s not over yet.

第 8 章

生成语义学 3：精神

CHAPTER 8

Generative Semantics 3: The Ethos

那么，荒唐而友善不是比聪明而充满敌意更好吗？

Is it not, then, better to be ridiculous and friendly than clever and hostile?

苏格拉底

Socrates

委婉的生殖器缺失。

Euphemistic genital deletion.

（生成语义规则名称）Paul Postal

(A generative semantics rule name) Paul Postal

不是乔姆斯基

Not Being Chomsky

整个战争期间，生成语义学家们都玩得很开心，这种开心贯穿了他们与时代息息相关的工作。别忘了，我们正处于 60 年代末和 70 年代初，嬉皮士的疏离感对所有学术和大多数非学术事物都产生了普遍影响，而生成语义学家——“一群在会议上聚在一起讲双关语、玩虚构游戏、抽滑稽香烟的人”（R. Lakoff，1989：972）——就像珠子、炸弹威胁或水烟筒一样，是那个时期的代表。1他们的作品充斥着毒品、音乐、随意性行为以及政治等主题。

All through the war, the generative semanticists were having a lot of fun, fun that spilled into and all over their work, which had everything to do with the times. We are, don’t forget, in the late sixties and early seventies, when the cultivated alienation of the hippies had a pervasive influence on all things academic and most things non-academic, and the generative semanticists—“a bunch of people who got together at conferences to make puns and play Fictionary and smoke funny cigarettes” (R. Lakoff, 1989:972)—are as representative of that period as beads or bomb threats or bongs.1 Their work teems with the themes of drugs, music, casual sex, and, of course, politics.

生成语义学的风格倾向，就像那个时期的一般倾向一样，不仅仅是一种文化参考和典故的外衣，粘在一种原本传统的形式上。它们根深蒂固。嬉皮士（迫使这个词承担比它曾经短暂而狭隘地成为我在这里用它所指代的群体的首选标签时更多的责任）与上一代人之间的分歧非常严重，也许红色高棉是个例外。他们精神的早期术语是青年文化，这使得分界线清晰。它被反主流文化所取代，这同样清楚地表明了拒绝的范围。最后一个甚至更短暂的标签是伍德斯托克国家，它是在正式宣布独立并与“猪帝国”开战时创造的（霍夫曼，1971 年）。在被轻视和其他严重风险的情况下，尽管在类比的两端都存在着扭曲，我们不可能忽视它与生成语义学的相似之处，对于许多人来说，生成语义学的最终结果是完全拒绝了将他们赶出去的转型之家；乔治·莱考夫是这种拒绝的主要发言人，当他谴责乔姆斯基的作品是“空虚的缩影”时，他听起来就像杰里·鲁宾或艾比·霍夫曼 (1977a:284)。

The stylistic proclivities of generative semantics, like those of the period generally, were not just a veneer of cultural references and allusions glued onto an otherwise conventional form. They run deep. The hippies (forcing this word to carry much more freight than it did when it was, briefly and narrowly, the preferred label for the group I am gathering under it here) were as seriously at odds with the preceding generation as any group could be, with perhaps the exception of the Khmer Rouge. The early term for their ethos was youth culture, which makes the dividing line clear. It was replaced by counterculture, which makes the scope of the rejection equally clear. The final, even more transient, label was Woodstock Nation, which was coined in a formal declaration of independence from, and state of war with, “the Pig Empire” (Hoffman, 1971). At the major risk of trivialization and other distortions, at both ends of the analogy, it is impossible to miss the parallels with generative semantics, which ended, for many, in a total rejection of the transformational home that turned them out; George Lakoff, the chief spokesman of this rejection, sounds like Jerry Rubin or Abbie Hoffman when he decries Chomsky’s work as “the epitome of emptiness” (1977a:284).

正如嬉皮士在痛苦中将自己定义为反对“权威”，莱考夫认为生成语义学的核心原则是“不要像乔姆斯基那样”。生成语义学家认为乔姆斯基在处理数据时不诚实——为了满足临时目的而重新加工数据，丢弃无法重新加工的数据，完全忽略广大地区——与此形成鲜明对比的是，他们兴高采烈地庆祝各种数据，不仅是给解释主义者带来麻烦的数据，还有让他们自己的理论陷入困境的数据。

Just as the hippies defined themselves in pained relief against “the establishment,” a central tenet of generative semantics for Lakoff, was “the idea of not being like Chomsky.” The generative semanticists saw Chomsky as dishonest in his handling of data—reworking it to serve his temporary purposes, discarding what he couldn’t rework, ignoring vast regions altogether—and, in very sharp contrast, they jubilantly celebrated all kinds of data, not only data that gave the interpretivists trouble, but data that gave their own theory the fits as well.

理论机制也存在类似的模式：乔姆斯基的风格是重新定义并保留其有缺陷的提议的修改，通常用词是指出其新的和改进的能力，而不是其以前的不足之处，而生成语义学家则倾向于公开放弃理论创新，公开宣布其错误。至少在生成语义学家看来，这两种模式的社会延伸也存在类似的模式：他们发现乔姆斯基的学科政治具有排他性，用同心但丁式的愿景来定义其他语言学家——“有内圈”，正如罗宾·莱考夫所描述的那样，“有各种外圈、边缘地带和坏人”（1989:972）——但他们希望每个人都加入他们的队伍。好吧，几乎每个人。他们也有边缘地带和一群坏人，乔姆斯基是后者的头目。但是，乔姆斯基对那些从他的项目中离开的人迅速转身离开，而他个人认为这没有前途，而生成语义学家则鼓励多样性，欢迎任何和所有对未知数据的探索；他们的“边缘地带”里不是被误导的研究人员（乔姆斯基是这样看待社会语言学家的），而是在研究生成语义学家还没有涉足的领域的人。乔姆斯基研究的是一组相当狭隘、几乎是个人的语言问题——总是用孤立的形象来描述自己与该领域其他部分的关系——而生成语义学家则热切地寻找语言学其他领域的问题，包括心理学、哲学、逻辑学、文学，甚至医药柜里的问题。俄狄浦斯情结在科学中很少被发挥到如此极端；因为在分裂开始时，人们对乔姆斯基几乎抱有宗教般的狂热，所以他很快就被妖魔化了：“一旦人们不再将乔姆斯基视为偶像”，正如罗宾·莱考夫（Robin Lakoff）在第 4 章中告诉我们的那样，“他就被重塑为恶魔、敌人”（1989：970）。

A similar pattern holds for theoretical machinery: where Chomsky’s style is to redefine and retain modifications of his flawed proposals, usually in terms which point to their new and improved abilities, not their former inadequacies, generative semanticists tended to renounce theoretical innovations very publicly, to proclaim their errors from the rooftops. And a related pattern, at least in the eyes of the generative semanticists, holds for the social extensions of the two models: they found Chomsky exclusionary in his disciplinary politics, defining other linguists in a concentric Dantesque vision—“There were the inner circle,” as Robin Lakoff characterizes it, “the various outer circles, Limbo, and Bad Guys” (1989:972)—but they wanted everyone to join their party. Well, almost everyone. They, too, had a Limbo and a mob of Bad Guys, Chomsky riding at the head of the latter. But where Chomsky turns his back rapidly on people from his program who head off in directions he does not personally find promising, generative semanticists encouraged diversity, welcoming any and all forays into uncharted data; their Limbo wasn’t populated with hopelessly misguided researchers (the way Chomsky views, say, sociolinguists), but with people working on things generative semanticists just hadn’t got around to yet. Where Chomsky works on a rather narrow, almost individual, set of linguistic problems—always using images of isolation to describe his own relation to the rest of the field—generative semanticists eagerly looked for problems in other areas of linguistics, in psychology, in philosophy, in logic, in literature, even in the medicine cabinet. The Oedipal reflex has rarely been carried to such extremes in science; because Chomsky was regarded with almost religious fervor when the schism began, he was promptly demonized: “Once Chomsky was seen not to be an idol,” as Robin Lakoff told us in chapter 4, “he was recast as satanic, the Enemy” (1989:970).

然而，生成语义学风格的政治元素却对他们简单的反乔姆斯基式精神的描述造成了某种破坏。生成语义学家反对越南战争，而乔姆斯基是其最直言不讳的批评者之一。对俄狄浦斯故事中这一转折的简单分析可能会将许多生成语义学家的政治直白性置于试图超越乔姆斯基的范畴，就像对生成语义学起源的简单分析让拉科夫和罗斯比其领导者更深入地研究转换语法，他们比乔姆斯基更有勇气坚持自己的信念。但简单的分析在这两种情况下都不起作用。

The political elements of the generative semantics style, however, throw something of a monkeywrench into the simple anti-Chomskyan account of their ethos. The generative semanticists opposed the war in Vietnam, and Chomsky was one of its most outspoken critics. A simple analysis of this twist in the Oedipal story might put the political explicitness of many generative semanticists into the trying-to-out-Chomsky-Chomsky file, much as a simple analysis of the generative semanticist genesis has Lakoff and Ross going deeper into transformational grammar than its leader dared, having more courage in their convictions than he did. But simple analyses don’t work in either case.

首先，在政治问题上，乔姆斯基很难胜过乔姆斯基。他不像生成语义学家那样在文章中使用“从真正意义上讲，尼克松是个凶手”这样的例句（此句来自 Lakoff，1972a：210），但他曾多次有力地称约翰逊、尼克松、基辛格及其同类为“真正的战争罪犯”，与第三帝国和斯大林主义俄罗斯的暴徒处于同一水平——更具体、更尖刻、更彻底地表达了自己的观点。他曾经（现在仍然是）比任何生成语义学家都更不知疲倦、更专注的政治修辞家；事实上，说他比所有生成语义学家加起来更不知疲倦、更专注于政治问题，这只是略显夸张。甚至将乔姆斯基和生成语义学家各自的政治努力进行比较也是毫无意义和误导性的，就像说弥尔顿比大多数诗人写得好，帕瓦罗蒂比大多数广告歌手唱得好，格雷茨基比大多数小联盟球员打得好。规模上的差异是几个数量级。在语言学文章中，生成语义学家比乔姆斯基更明确地表达他们的政治关切，当然也更不敬。但他们甚至没有更政治化（例如，他们很容易被称为“更语义化”）。

It is, first, extremely difficult to out-Chomsky Chomsky on political issues. He does not use sample sentences like “In a real sense, Nixon is a murderer” in his articles, as the generative semanticists did (this one is from Lakoff, 1972a:210), but he is on record, repeatedly and forcefully, as calling Johnson, Nixon, Kissinger, and their ilk, “genuine war criminals,” on a level with the thugs of the Third Reich and Stalinist Russia—more specific, more caustic and far more thoroughly prosecuted sentiments. He was (and remains) a more tireless, dedicated political rhetor than any of the generative semanticists; in fact, it is only mildly hyperbolic to say he is more tireless and dedicated to political concerns than all the generative semanticists combined. Even the comparison between the respective political efforts of Chomsky and the generative semanticists is otiose and misleading, like saying Milton was a better writer than most poets, Pavarotti a better singer than most jingle-artists, Gretzky a better hockey player than most bush leaguers. The difference in scale is several orders of magnitude. The generative semanticists were more explicit than Chomsky, in linguistic articles, about their political concerns, and certainly more irreverent. But they were not, by even the wildest stretch of the term, more political (the way they might easily be called, for instance, “more semantic”).

其次，乔姆斯基和大多数生成语义学家（事实上，大多数解释语义学家）的政治观点是一致的，这并非巧合。他们一致反对战争，反对战争背后的政治人物。在积极问题上（比如应该做些什么来纠正越南的错误，谁来做，应该如何做），他们可能没有多少共识，甚至可能根本没有共识。

It is, second, not coincidental that the shared political outlook of Chomsky and most generative semanticists (and, indeed, most interpretive semanticists) was shared dissent. They were united in opposition to the war, and the political figures behind it. On positive issues (like what should be done to correct the mistakes of Vietnam, who should do it, how it should be carried out), there would have been far less agreement, maybe none at all.

第三，这场战争是无法形容的淫秽。幸运的是，面对美国在印度支那实施的邪恶恐怖计划和政府对该计划的一系列丑陋、赤裸裸的谎言，许多人都无法保持沉默。生成语义学家在这方面的突出之处就在于他们愿意将自己的愤怒融入语言学中。

And, third, the war was unspeakably obscene. It was, fortunately, impossible for many people to remain silent in the teeth of both America’s vicious program of terror in Indochina and the parade of ugly, blatant lies coming from the government about that program. What distinguished the generative semanticists on this count was their willingness to let their outrage into their linguistics.

识别生成语义学风格似乎有些离题，甚至有点转移话题，更不用说花一章来研究它了。例如，一位著名的反对该运动的人喜欢将其视为“一种非理性的邪教”和“一种时尚”，这只是 70 年代早期价值观崩溃的另一个症状，而我们在这里给予它的关注可能会导致这种否定。但是，事实就是事实：所有主要人物都以一种可识别的风格参与其中，而且方式非常明显。每个谈论那个时期的人都会记得这种风格，也会对它发表自己的看法。无论是好是坏（事实上，两者兼而有之），一种松散、荒诞、政治直接的风格充斥着生成语义学的大部分内容。2

It may seem digressive, even diversionary, to identify a generative semantics style at all, let alone to spend a chapter examining it. One prominent opponent of the movement, for instance, is fond of writing it off as “an irrational cult” and “a fad,” just another symptom of the early seventies collapse of values, and the kind of attention we’re giving it here can play into such dismissals. But, facts are facts: all the major figures partook in an identifiable style, in very identifiable ways. Everyone who talks of the period both remembers the style and has an opinion on it. For better or for worse (in fact, for both), a loose-jointed, absurdist, politically direct style suffused much of generative semantics.2

这种风格——采用枯燥、还原论、分析的方法，这种方法会毁掉任何风格，但至少会给我们一些事后分析结果——有三个主要表现：幽默、政治和数据崇拜。我们从幽默开始剖析。

That style—to take the dry, reductionist, analytic approach that is death to any style, but at least gives us some postmortem results—had three principal manifestations: humor, politics, and data-worship. We begin the autopsy with humor.

幽默

Humor

明天下午操我妹妹。

*明天下午操那些不规则动词。

在沙发上操我妹妹。

*在沙发上操共产主义。

小心地操我的妹妹。

*小心地操复杂的符号。

Fuck my sister tomorrow afternoon.

*Fuck those irregular verbs tomorrow afternoon.

Fuck my sister on the sofa.

*Fuck communism on the sofa.

Fuck my sister carefully.

*Fuck complex symbols carefully.

光福同

Quang Phuc Dong

嬉皮士的时代并不微妙，生成语义学的定义风格也不微妙。示例句子涉及反主流文化的所有三个最明显的元素，这些元素（就像六十年代的大部分精神一样）在接下来的十年里迅速退化，在这种情况下，变成了有史以来最愚蠢和最享乐主义的口号之一：

The age of the hippy was not a subtle age, and the defining style of generative semantics was not a subtle style. The sample sentences implicate all three of the most visible elements of the counterculture, elements which (like much of the spirit of the sixties) rapidly degenerated in the following decade, in this case, into one of the most mindless and hedonistic slogans of all time:

“性别，

“Sex,

1

1

a 马克斯对贝蒂的责骂并没有说服皮特去抚摸她的嘴唇。（Postal，1988a [1969]：74）

a The fact that Max plorbed Betty did not convince Pete to caress her on the lips. (Postal, 1988a [1969]:74)

 

 

b 主持人介绍说米克·贾格尔的阴茎大到足以让最厌倦的追星族感到惊奇。（Borkin，1984 [1974]：18）

b The M.C. introduced Mick Jagger’s penis as being large enough to amaze the most jaded of groupies. (Borkin, 1984 [1974]:18)

 

 

c 我们做爱吧。（R. Lakoff，1977:82）

c Let’s fuck. (R. Lakoff, 1977:82)

和毒品，

and Drugs,

2

2

嘿，如果约翰去了芝加哥，那就意味着我们很快就会有大量毒品供应。（Schmerling，1971：249）

a Hey, if John went to Chicago, that means we’ll soon have a big supply of dope. (Schmerling, 1971:249)

 

 

b 我的大麻藏匿处被警犬 Fido 发现了。（R. Lakoff，1971b：154）

b My cache of marijuana got found by Fido, the police dog. (R. Lakoff, 1971b:154)

 

 

c 弗雷德除了抽大麻和弹萨罗德琴外什么都不做；约翰也一样。（McCawley，1976b [1972]：304）

c Fred does nothing but smoke hashish and play the sarod; John is similar. (McCawley, 1976b [1972]:304)

和摇滚乐！”

and Rock ‘n’ Roll!”

3

3

a *萨姆偷拍了 10 张披头士乐队的唱片，只为获得特里西娅·尼克松的一张裸照。（McCawley，1982b [1973]：80）

a *Sam snarped 10 Beatle records for a nude photo of Tricia Nixon. (McCawley, 1982b [1973]:80)

 

 

b 保罗死了，但我不相信他死了。（Lakoff，1975）3

b Paul is dead and I do not believe he is dead. (Lakoff, 1975)3

 

 

c 她抛弃了太多男孩。他自杀了。（鲍勃·迪伦，引自 Zwicky，1976：683）

c She left one too many a boy behind. He committed suicide. (Bob Dylan, cited in Zwicky, 1976:683)

还有很多空间可以容纳其他突出的反主流文化特征——政治、猥亵和普遍的荒谬：

There was also plenty of room for other prominent counterculture characteristic—spolitics, scatology, and general absurdity:

4

4

美国声称很难控制越南人在越南的侵略行为，这并不让任何人感到惊讶。（Grinder，1970:300）。

a Amerika’s claim that it was difficult to control Vietnamese aggression in Vietnam surprised no one. (Grinder, 1970:300).

 

 

b *约翰拉的屎重600克。（Quang，1988[1971]：96）

b *The shit that John took weighed 600 grams. (Quang, 1988 [1971]:96)

 

 

c *我不想亲吻大猩猩。（Postal，1974：236）

c *I don’t want to kiss no gorillas. (Postal, 1974:236)

幽默是许多生成语义学家引以为豪的一点，很大程度上因为它与乔姆斯基的思想截然不同，是与大师在精神和智力上的分裂。乔姆斯基的散文具有亚里士多德所有的幽默。（20 世纪 60 年代后期的笑话模板之一是世界上最短的书名，如乔治华莱士的《种族和谐论》和崔姬的《肥胖问题》，当时语言学界最有可能与这个书名相媲美的还有《诺姆乔姆斯基的粗俗幽默》）。“我们觉得乔姆斯基太严肃了，”莱考夫回忆道。“我们认为人们能够嘲笑自己和他们所做的事情，以及获得乐趣是非常重要的。”

Humor was a point of pride with many generative semanticists, in large part because it was a very clear break from Chomsky, a declaration of the spiritual, in addition to the intellectual, schism with the master. Chomsky’s prose has all the humor of Aristotle. (One of the late sixties joke templates was title-of-the-world’s-shortest-book, like Theories of Racial Harmony, by George Wallace, and Problems of the Obese, by Twiggy, and a prime candidate for this title circulating linguistics at the time was The Bawdy Humor of Noam Chomsky.) “We felt Chomsky took himself too seriously,” Lakoff remembers. “We thought it was extremely important that people be able to laugh at themselves and what they were doing, as well as have fun.”

20 世纪 90 年代初期，年轻的学术观众非常乐意欣赏荒诞、突破界限和对自己文化遗产的庆祝，这并没有什么坏处。

It didn’t hurt that the youthful academic audiences around the turn of the decade were very well disposed to appreciate absurdity, boundary-pushing, and celebrations of their own cultural artifacts.

和生成语义学的其他文体倾向一样，这些倾向也是慢慢形成的，根源在于语义学的第一次转型尝试。卡兹和福多尔偶尔也会在句子中加入幽默元素（比如像“眼科医生的眼睛是金发女郎”这样的句子），卡兹和波斯特尔（他引入了技术术语“G 弦” —1964:57）也是如此。但这些特点是在抽象语法时期开始有规律地显现出来，第一个症状就是喜欢在例句中使用名字艳丽的主角，这是一种恰如其分的与乔姆斯基相反的症状。乔姆斯基的句子是出了名的乏味（从任何角度来看，除了严格的语言学角度）。他最喜欢的主角是约翰，甚至局外人也评论说这类句子平淡无奇，没有特色，比如“约翰很容易取悦” （直系继承了布卢姆菲尔德的“可怜的约翰跑了”等天马行空的想象）。4另一方面，抽象句法学家选择了Max和Seymour以及广受欢迎的Floyd；生成语义学家选择了Knucks McGonagle、Figmeister和Norbert the Nark。在抽象句法天才（即 Postal）的指导下，句子中也开始出现大猩猩、袋熊、企鹅、蟾蜍。在生成语义学中，情况变得更加奇怪，角色阵容扩大到包括 Willie Mays 和小野洋子等文化偶像。模式和主题反复出现。一个主旋律是理查德·尼克松在男厕所里徘徊。

Like other stylistic proclivities of generative semantics, these built slowly, and have their roots in the first transformational forays into semantics. Katz and Fodor include the occasional stab at humor (such as sentences like Occulists eye blondes), as do Katz and Postal (who introduced the technical term G-string—1964:57). But it was in the abstract syntax period that these traits began to show up with regularity, the first symptom being a penchant for flamboyantly named protagonists in sample sentences, an appropriately contra-Chomskyan symptom. Chomsky’s sentences are notoriously dull (from any but a strictly linguistic perspective). His favorite protagonist is John, and even outsiders have remarked on the flat, characterless quality of such sentences as John is easy to please (a lineal descendant of such flights of imagination as Bloomfield’s Poor John ran away).4 The abstract syntacticians, on the other hand, went for Max and Seymour and the ever-popular Floyd; generative semanticists, for Knucks McGonagle, Figmeister, and Norbert the Nark. Under the genius of abstract syntax—namely, Postal—the sentences also began to populate with gorillas, wombats, penguins, toads. With generative semantics the situations got weirder, the cast of characters expanding to include cultural icons like Willie Mays and Yoko Ono. Patterns and themes recurred. One leitmotif had Richard Nixon loitering in men’s rooms.

例句是怪异名称楔子的薄弱环节。波斯特尔将一种转换称为Flip。罗斯将另一种转换命名为Slifting ；然后，按照头韵主题，提出了Sluicing和Stuffing。卡登提出了Q-magic。这些名称至少与规则执行的操作有某种关联（Slifting 将句子节点，即 S 节点提升到更高的从句，因此其词源为S-lifting ； Flip 交换了名词短语；Q-magic 与量词有关）。后来，随着对转换语法描述机制的尊重逐渐消退，这些名称变得刻意随意；特别是，出现了一种为规则采用专有名称的时尚，如Irving 、 Ludwig和Richard。正如 Lakoff 所解释的那样，“一种 [ 记住你在何处捏造 ] 的方法是使用明显随意的名称，如CLYDE，而不是听起来很深奥但实际上并不深奥的随意名称，如 Definer” (1971a:iii；另见 Ross 对Do-Gobbling这个名称的论证—1973a:70)。其他名称则走向了另一个极端，变得极其具体，如 Grinder 的Apparel Pronoun Deletion（用于某些与脱衣有关的句子的句法行为）和 — 这一类别的绝对赢家 — Postal 的Euphemistic Genital Deletion（用于某些形象名词被巧妙地隐藏起来的句子，如John 对 Mary 来说太大了，或Max 又在玩自己了）。5

Sample sentences were the thin edge of the weird-name wedge. Postal called one transformation, Flip. Ross named another one Slifting; then, following an alliterative theme, proposed Sluicing and Stuffing. Carden proposed Q-magic. These names at least had some reference to the actions performed by the rule (Slifting raised a Sentence node, an S node, to a higher clause, so its etymology is S-lifting; Flip exchanged noun phrases; Q-magic concerned quantifiers). Later in the game, as respect for the descriptive machinery of transformational grammar declined, the names became deliberately arbitrary; in particular, there was a fad of adopting proper names for rules, like Irving, Ludwig, and Richard. As Lakoff explained it, “one way to [remember where you’re fudging] is to use obviously arbitrary names like CLYDE instead of arbitrary names that sound profound but aren’t, like Determiner” (1971a:iii; see also Ross’s justification for the name Do-Gobbling—1973a:70). Other names went in the opposite extreme, becoming absurdly specific, like Grinder’s Apparel Pronoun Deletion (for the syntactic behavior of certain sentences concerning disrobing) and—the hands-down winner in this category—Postal’s Euphemistic Genital Deletion (for sentences where certain graphic nouns are demurely spirited away, as in John is too big for Mary, or Max is playing with himself again).5

对于许多生成语义学家来说，这种风格从例句和规则名称中泄露出来，渗透到散文中。轶事、内部典故和校园表达，如“one swell foop”经常出现，尤其是在第二代论文中。例如，杰里·摩根 (Jerry Morgan) 对一些缺失的论点给出了这样的解释：

For many generative semanticists, this style leaked out of the sample sentences and rule names to permeate the prose. Anecdotes, inside allusions, and schoolyard expressions like “one swell foop” showed up regularly, most notably in the secondgeneration papers. Jerry Morgan, for instance, offers this account of some missing arguments:

[我之前的论文]包含了代词化、指称、身份问题的最终解决方案，以及一项压倒性的、无可辩驳的经验主义反对词汇主义立场的证据。不幸的是，这句话是手写在一包清教徒猪粮上的，在芝加哥一名饥饿的警察用催泪瓦斯袭击三名横穿马路的行人时，他从我手中夺走了这句话，从此这句话就失传了。（1976 [1968 或 1969]：340nl）

[My earlier paper] contained the ultimate solution to the problems of pronominalization, reference, identity, as well as an item of overwhelming and irrefutable empirical evidence against the lexicalist position. Unfortunately, it was handwritten on a package of Puritan Hog Chow, and was eaten by a hungry Chicago policeman who tore it from me during a tear-gas attack on three jaywalkers, thereby being lost to mankind. (1976 [1968 or 1969]:340nl)

但是，为了避免我们过于激动，我们必须注意到，大部分的幽默虽然远非微妙，但并非真正处于中心位置。生成语义学论文中很少有令人捧腹大笑的。除了一些更疯狂的地下论文（许多收录在《左翼研究：詹姆斯·麦考利的诽谤性论文集》 ——兹维基等人，1970 年）外，这些论文并不是为了讲笑话而存在的；严肃的研究围绕着幽默展开。即使是 Quang 的论文也有重要的语言学观点。笑话参与了论文——有时推动论文的发展，有时对作者对分析的信心发表评论——但大多数只是为作品增添了一种滑稽的基调，与乔姆斯基形成鲜明对比。用一个略显柔弱的词来形容这种做法，它更多的是异想天开，而不是幽默。它取决于奇特的情景、对其他语言学家或文化人物的内部引用，以及超现实主义的普遍态度，而不是妙语或极力维持的隐喻。随着观众的不同，奇思妙想的数量也呈现出非常明显的层次。例如，上面的狂暴猪引文来自核心生成语义学家中流传的一篇地下论文，其中有一篇关于“卡米洛特，1968 年”的文章。为了与同一位作者保持一致，摩根的 CLS 贡献仍然松散而异想天开，有“泡菜和草莓”这样的副标题和厄尼·班克斯的广泛参与，但它们明显不那么非正式。他更主流的出版物，如《语言》（1977 年），绝对是温和的（但肯定不是乔姆斯基式的）。6

But, lest we get carried away, it is important to note that most of the humor, while far from subtle, was not exactly center stage. There are few belly laughs in generative semantic papers. Aside from some of the wilder underground papers (many collected in Studies out in Left Field: Defamatory Essays Presented to James D. McCawley—Zwicky and others, 1970), the papers don’t exist to tell jokes; serious work goes on in and around the humor. Even the Quang papers have important linguistic points. The jokes participate in the papers—sometimes propelling them along, sometimes offering a commentary on the author’s confidence in the analysis—but mostly just contributing a general tone of goofiness to the work, in deliberate counterpoint to Chomsky. To use a slightly effete word for the practice, it is more whimsical than humorous. It depends on odd situations, insider references to other linguists or to cultural figures, and a general attitude of surrealism, not on punchlines or strenuously sustained metaphors. There is also a very clear gradation of the amount of whimsy as a function of audience. The rabid-hog quotation above, for instance, comes from an underground paper circulated amongst core generative semanticists, of a piece with “Camelot, 1968.” To stay with the same author, Morgan’s CLS contributions are still loose and whimsical, with subheads like “Pickles and Strawberries” and the extended participation of Ernie Banks, but they are markedly less informal. His more mainstream publications, as in Language (1977), are positively tame (though certainly not Chomskyan).6

第二代生成语义学家的存在提出了生成语义学论文轻浮的另一个因素，Hagège (1981 [1976]:21) 轻蔑地将这一因素斥为“业余主义的气息”：许多更离谱的生成语义学论文确实来自业余人士，研究生。主要的生成语义学学校（芝加哥、伊利诺伊-厄巴纳和密歇根）都遵循了乔姆斯基和哈勒在麻省理工学院开始的做法，敦促学生尽快投入战斗。但是，麻省理工学院学生的缺乏经验和热情往往表现为嗜血的辩论，而新生的生成语义学家则趋向于疯狂的幽默、政治题外话和对数据复杂性的敬畏。

The presence of second-generation generative semanticists here raises another factor in the levity of generative semantics papers, a factor Hagège (1981 [1976]:21) contemptuously dismisses as the “whiff of amateurism”: many of the more outrageous generative semanticist disquisitions did come from amateurs, graduate students. The chief generative semantics schools (Chicago, Illinois-Urbana, and Michigan) all followed the practice that Chomsky and Halle had begun in MIT of urging students out into the fray as soon as possible. But where inexperience and exuberance tended to manifest themselves among MIT students as bloodthirsty polemics, in nascent generative semanticists the trend was toward looney humor, political asides, and declarations of awe at the complexity of the data.

当然，风格是一种个人特质，就像说话方式一样；在生成语义学领域，有几位非常独特的人。纽梅尔 (1986a:137) 的幽默捕捉到了他们大部分的集体精神，但也有个人精神在起作用，而且并非所有的幽默都有相同的动机。对于莱科夫来说，幽默可能在某种程度上是阿诺德·兹维基 (Arnold Zwicky) 回忆该运动时所表现出来的“隐藏的智力攻击性”。莱科夫是一个咄咄逼人的人，习惯使用一些相当刺耳的修辞策略，很难否认这种攻击性在他的出版物中得到了发泄，请记住，其中一篇以“Nyaah, nyaah!”结尾 (1973b:290)。7

And, of course, style is a personal trait, like speech pattern; there were several very distinctive people at the helm of generative semantics. Newmeyer’s (1986a:137) rambunctious captures much of their collective spirit, but there was individual spirit at play as well, and not all the humor had the same motivations. With Lakoff, humor may well have been in some part the “concealed intellectual aggressiveness” that Arnold Zwicky recalls of the movement generally. Lakoff is an aggressive guy, given to some rather grating rhetorical tactics, and it would be difficult to deny that this aggressiveness had vent in his publications, one of which, remember, ends with “Nyaah, nyaah!” (1973b:290).7

对于以温和著称的麦考利来说，即使当面反驳别人的观点，他的幽默可能更具有庆祝性。罗斯介于两者之间；罗宾·莱考夫更接近麦考利；而 Postal 的幽默，将冷面无表情的学术散文与充斥着袋熊、大猩猩和金发孤儿的例句并列，更难捉摸。许多第二代生成语义学家也有自己的风格特征——一些更倾向于政治，另一些更倾向于荒谬——每一种都表明动机的配置略有不同，榜样的层次也不同。

For McCawley, who has a very widespread reputation for gentleness, even when directly challenging someone’s argument, the humor was probably more celebratory. Ross falls somewhere in the middle; Robin Lakoff a little closer to McCawley; and Postal’s humor, a juxtaposition of deadpan scholarly prose and sample sentences teeming with wombats and gorillas and anaphorically orphaned blondes, is more difficult to pin down. Many of the second-generation generative semanticists also had their own cluster of stylistic character traits—some leaning more toward politics, others toward absurdity—each one indicating a slightly different configuration of motives, and a different hierarchy of role models.

政治

Politics

谨将此历史献给那些英勇的年轻骑士，他们为了追寻圣杯，在 1968 年夏天，在林肯和格兰特森林以及密歇根捷克哥公国的石谷，在野猪的猛烈攻击下，流血牺牲，理查德·皮屁股，市长。

This History is humbly dedicated to those Valiant young Knights who, in quest of the Holy Grail, shed their Blood under the onslaught of Savage wild boars in the Forests of Lincoln and Grant, and in the Stone Valley of Michigan, in the Duchy of Czechago, Summer, 1968, Richard the Leatherbuttocked, Lord Mayor.

本威克的兰斯洛特爵士、摩根勒菲和绿衣骑士

Sir Lancelot of Benwick, Morgan le Fay, and The Green Knight

幽默和荒诞是反主流文化修辞的主要手段。当时确实有认真的异见人士——戴夫·德林格、塞萨尔·查韦斯、诺姆·乔姆斯基——但无论好坏（实际上，两者皆有），肯·克西、杰里·鲁宾和艾比·霍夫曼等不那么专注、更喧闹的人更充分地捕捉到了时代精神。主流社会精神是愤怒、解放和困惑的松散混合体，我将其归类为嬉皮士，即使在我广泛使用的情况下，这个保护伞也没有包括德林格、查韦斯或乔姆斯基。也不是所有年轻、蓬头垢面的激进分子，无论他们多么愤怒和困惑（汤姆·海登和马克·拉德首先浮现在我的脑海中），都能轻松地归类为嬉皮士。反主流文化是凯西用便携式酸性测试器诱惑年轻人、吓倒老年人，是鲁宾和霍夫曼率领一群衣着夸张的长发男子执行悬浮五角大楼的任务。是国际妇女组织“地狱恐怖阴谋”在芝加哥静坐期间对政府施咒；是巴黎青年激进分子的口号“我是马克思主义者，格劳乔的潮流”；是耶鲁大学一位身穿扎染 T 恤的年轻语言学家向古板的教授们讲述“卡拉马夫金动物园”等词语的理论后果。大部分能量是政治性的，但也有很大一部分只是对生命的纯粹、疯狂的庆祝。

Humor and absurdity were principal devices of counterculture rhetoric. There were certainly earnest dissidents at the time—Dave Dellinger, Cesar Chavez, Noam Chomsky—but, for better or worse (actually, for both), the temper of the times was caught more fully by less focused, more boisterous people, like Ken Kesey, Jerry Rubin, and Abbie Hoffman. The dominant social spirit was the loose mélange of anger, liberation, and confusion that I have collected under the umbrella, hippy, and, even in my broad usage, that umbrella does not cover Dellinger or Chavez or Chomsky. Nor do all the young, shaggy radicals, no matter how angry and confused (Tom Hayden and Mark Rudd spring to mind) fit comfortably under the umbrella. The counterculture is Kesey seducing the young and appalling the old with his portable acid tests, Rubin and Hoffman leading phalanxes of outrageously clad longhairs on a mission to levitate the Pentagon. It is the Women’s International Terrorist Conspiracy from Hell (WITCH) casting hexes on the administration during sit-ins at Chicago; the slogan of young Parisian radicals, “Je suis marxiste, tendance Groucho”; a young linguist in a tie-dyed T-shirt lecturing the staid professorate at Yale about the theoretical ramifications of words like Kalamafuckingzoo. Much of the energy was political, but much of it was also just the sheer, loopy celebration of life.

无论如何，在 20 世纪 70 年代之交，政治与荒诞并不是很容易区分的。当时的政治形势是卡罗尔和卡夫卡的结合。马丁·路德·金、肯尼迪家族和马尔科姆·艾克斯都遭到枪击；即将遭枪击的乔治·华莱士在全国巡回演讲，谴责“左翼理论家、手提公文包的官僚、象牙塔里的指南作家、大胡子无政府主义者、自作聪明的社论作家和尖头教授”（O'Neill，1971：389），而他的竞选搭档则主张用核手段解决越南问题；芝加哥七杰被捕后剪下的一小袋头发在共和党的筹款活动中被拍卖；政府对越南战争抗议活动日益增多的反应是攻打老挝和柬埔寨；罗纳德·里根命令两千多名国民警卫队队员“镇压”了一场反对加州大学伯克利分校扩建至人民公园的示威活动，导致一人死亡，128 人受伤；气象员组织了一场荒谬的占领工人阶级学校的行动来唤醒无产阶级，但通常被仇视嬉皮士的暴徒赶走；由于对权力结构的暴力、压制和充耳不闻感到愤怒，或者可能只是觉得无聊，各种集体和个人仅在 1970 年就轰炸了三千多座公共建筑，发出了五万多条炸弹威胁；肯特州立大学、杰克逊州立大学和伯克利分校的抗议者被杀害，在其他地方被殴打、殴打和逮捕；芝加哥警察在杀死弗雷德·汉普顿后，得意地抢劫摄影师；其他黑人异见人士和一些白人因轻度毒品指控被判入狱或流亡；通过将大部分地面战斗移交给南越，以便更专注于轰炸、落叶和凝固汽油弹袭击，减少了美国的伤亡，实际上减少了公众的强烈抗议；尼克松总统的脾气，或者更准确地说，他的脾气暴躁，甚至比加森在《麦克伯德！》中对其前任的臭名昭著的非百老汇讽刺作品还要逊色：

Politics and absurdity, in any case, are not very easy to disentangle at the turn of the decade. The political situation was a marriage of Carroll and Kafka. King, the Kennedys, and Malcolm X had all been shot; George Wallace, who was about to be, stumped around the country denouncing “left-wing theoreticians, briefcasetotin’ bureaucrats, ivory-tower guideline writers, bearded anarchists, smart-aleck editorial writers and pointy-headed professors” (O’Neill, 1971:389), while his running mate advocated a nuclear solution in Vietnam; little bags of hair from the Chicago 7, shorn after their arrest, were auctioned off at Republican fundraisers; the government’s response to increased protests over the Vietnam War was to attack Laos and Cambodia; Ronald Reagan ordered over two thousand National Guardsmen to “quell” a demonstration against the University of California-Berkeley’s expansion into what became People’s Park, resulting in one death, 128 wounded; the Weatherman staged ridiculous occupations of working-class schools to wake up the proletariat, usually being driven off by hippy-hating toughs; enraged at the violence, repression, and deafness of the power structure, or possibly just bored, various collectives and individuals bombed over three thousand public structures in 1970 alone, and made over fifty thousand bomb threats; protesters were killed at Kent State, Jackson State, and Berkeley, maced, clubbed, and arrested elsewhere; Chicago police mugged proudly for photographers after killing Fred Hampton; other black dissidents, and some whites, were jailed on weak drug charges or driven into exile; the reduction of American casualties by turning over much of the ground-fighting to the South Vietnamese in order to concentrate more fully on bombing, defoliation, and napalm attacks, actually reduced public outcry; the temper of President Nixon, or, more accurately, his distemper, paled even Garson’s notorious off-Broadway satire of his predecessor in MacBird!:

党羽：

CRONY:

和平游行队伍正在行进。

Peace paraders marching.

麦克伯德:

MACBIRD:

阻止他们！

Stop ‘em!

党羽：

CRONY:

垮掉的一代人焚烧征兵卡。

Beatniks burning draft cards.

麦克伯德:

MACBIRD:

把他们关进监狱！

Jail ‘em!

党羽：

CRONY:

黑人开始静坐。

Negroes starting sit-ins.

麦克伯德:

MACBIRD:

放毒气！

Gas’em!

党羽：

CRONY:

拉丁叛军崛起。

Latin rebels rising.

麦克伯德:

MACBIRD:

射击他们！

Shoot’em!

党羽：

CRONY:

亚洲农民正在武装。

Asian peasants are arming.

麦克伯德:

MACBIRD:

轰炸他们！

Bomb ‘em!

党羽：

CRONY:

国会议员们抱怨。

Congressmen complaining.

麦克伯德:

MACBIRD:

操他們！

Fuck’em!

 

 

清除这些肮脏的浮渣；消灭异议。

Flush out this filthy scum; destroy dissent.

 

 

违抗总统就是叛国行为。（Garson，1966：73-74）

It’s treason to defy your president. (Garson, 1966:73–74)

语言学家是最关心抗议的人之一。例如，在《时代》杂志的一张照片前景中，可以看到一个非常像“垮掉派”的哈伊·罗斯 (Háj Ross)，该照片附有陶氏化学实验室主任被困在哈佛会议室七个小时以抗议陶氏化学生产凝固汽油弹的报道 (1967 年 11 月 3 日：57)。麦考利是 1966 年芝加哥大学抗议让选拔服务机构获得班级排名的积极参与者；在他职业生涯中特别脆弱的时期，他偷偷溜进了一场针对该问题的终身教职员工会议，做了笔记，并向学生会议汇报了情况。杰里·摩根 (Jerry Morgan) 在芝加哥大会抗议活动中非常活跃。该时期最重要的语言学论文集之一是“献给越南儿童” (Jacobs and Rosenbaum, 1970)。当然，还有乔姆斯基。

Linguists were among the most concerned protesters. A very Beat looking Háj Ross, for instance, can be seen in the foreground of a picture in Time accompanying the story of Dow Chemical’s lab director being barricaded in a Harvard conference room for seven hours, in a protest against Dow’s napalm production (3 November 1967:57). McCawley was a vocal participant in the 1966 University of Chicago protests against allowing the Selective Service access to class rankings; at a particularly vulnerable time in his career, he snuck into a meeting for tenured-only faculty on the question, took notes, and reported back to a student meeting. Jerry Morgan was very active in the Chicago convention protests. One of the more important collections of linguistic papers from the period is dedicated “To the Children of Vietnam” (Jacobs and Rosenbaum, 1970). And, of course, there was Chomsky.

语言学家们的许多政治活动可能与乔姆斯基反对美国在印度支那的帝国主义的强硬、热情的立场间接相关。当时（以及现在）加入麻省理工学院语言学课程的许多学生的部分动机肯定是与乔姆斯基的政治亲和力，正如乔姆斯基在宾夕法尼亚大学学习的主要动机是他与泽利格·哈里斯的政治亲和力。更普遍地说，许多语言学家进入该领域，特别是转换语法领域的研究，部分动机是乔姆斯基的政治声誉。尽管当时他的政治观点和语言学观点相当鲜明，但他的政治情绪在语言学界却广为人知，并受到广泛赞誉。例如，麦考利在给乔姆斯基的一封长信的结尾处谈到了这两起争议，并附言道：“有谣言说中央情报局正在资助我的研究，希望以此分散你的战争精力，但这种谣言纯属谣言”（1968 年 1 月 18 日）。

Much of the political activity of linguists may have been indirectly related to the tough, impassioned stand Chomsky took against American imperialism in Indochina. Certainly a partial motivation for many students who joined the MIT linguistics program at the time (and at the present) was a political affinity with Chomsky, just as Chomsky’s principal motivation for studying at the University of Pennsylvania was his political affinity with Zellig Harris. More generally, a partial motivation for many linguists going into the field, and particularly into transformational grammar, was Chomsky’s political reputation. Although he kept his politics and linguistics fairly distinct at the time, his political feelings were extremely well known, and widely applauded, in the linguistics community. McCawley, for instance, ends one of his long letters to Chomsky about the respectively controversy with the postscript, “There is no truth to the nasty rumor going around that the CIA is subsidizing my research in hopes of thereby diverting your energies from the war” (18 January 1968).

生成语义学家虽然并不比解释语义学家更关心当时的社会和政治病态，但他们在语言学中对这些问题的关注却更为公开。这种差异无疑是每个阵营领导人物的作用。在语言战争期间，乔姆斯基很少将政治与语言学融合在一起。他最接近的一次是提到他的一个例句来自一位激进分子 (1972b [1969]:67)，或者讲述有关他拒绝纳税和反战演讲的话语情况 (1975b:61-62)——这些相当简单的例子取自他的一生，在上下文中没有明显的政治含义，尽管它们肯定为他的语言学工作增添了一些政治声誉，并有助于让人们意识到语言学是一个有社会良知的人的领域。8杰肯多夫在语言学著作中只是略微偏向政治，偶尔会加入一些句子，例如“总统疯了，有人怀疑，毫无希望了”（1972:97）。在辩论的另一方，情况最初看起来并没有太大不同。波斯特尔从未将政治和语言学混为一谈，罗斯和莱考夫只是偶尔和外围地进行，例如对共和党人进行几次抨击。但麦考利的情况则不同。他比其他人更积极参与政治——参与了征兵抗议活动，在密西西比州杰克逊市为民权示威，焚烧征兵卡，拒绝纳税——但还有两个因素比他的政治活动更为重要。首先，他毫无保留地将自己的政治观点融入语言学中——他以著名的笔名创立了 Pullum (1991 [1987]:101) 所说的“ Fuck Lyndon Johnson示例构建学派”，正如这一称谓所表明的那样，这是一种独特的反主流文化参与。其次，McCawley 也是最具影响力的生成语义学教师，FLJ 示例在第二代才真正开始蓬勃发展。

The generative semanticists, while no more deeply concerned about the social and political pathologies of the day than the interpretive semanticists, were far more overt about those concerns in their linguistics. This difference was undoubtedly a function of the leading figures in each camp. Chomsky did not engage much in blends of politics and linguistics during the linguistic wars. The closest he came was to mention that one of his sample sentences came from an activist associate (1972b [1969]:67), or to relate discourse situations concerning his refusal to pay taxes and his anti-war speeches (1975b:61–62)—fairly simple illustrations taken from his life, with no overt political meaning in the context, though they surely lent some of his political reputation to his linguistic work and helped contribute to the sense that linguistics was a field for people with social consciences.8 Jackendoff was only marginally more political in his linguistic work, occasionally incorporating sentences such as The president is insane, one suspects, beyond all hope (1972:97). On the other side of the debate, the picture initially doesn’t look much different. Postal never blended politics and linguistics, Ross and Lakoff only occasionally and peripherally, taking a few swipes at Republicans, for instance. But McCawley was a different story. He was more politically active than the others—getting involved in the Selective Service protests, demonstrating for civil rights in Jackson, Mississippi, burning his draft card, refusing to pay his taxes—but two other factors are considerably more important than his political activism. First, there was his complete lack of reserve about involving his political views in his linguistics—under his famous nom de guerre founding what Pullum (1991 [1987]:101) calls “the Fuck Lyndon Johnson school of example construction,” and, as that designation indicates, it was a distinctively counterculture sort of involvement. Second, McCawley was also the most influential generative semantics teacher, and it is with the second generation that the FLJ examples really began to flower.

此外，还有空间和时间的问题。生成语义学的官方发源地，也是其每年 CLS 节日的举办地，是芝加哥——它见证了民主党大会骚乱、警察骚乱、随后的阴谋审判及其随之而来的马戏团、弗雷德·汉普顿被杀、天气预报员的愤怒日、市长理查德·戴利的各种独裁怪异行为，以及 WITCH 等团体的各种无政府主义怪异行为。至于时间，生成语义学和反主流文化在完全相同的时期流行起来。必须有交叉影响。直到反主流文化的流行度开始减弱，解释语义学才完全起飞。

Too, there are the matters of space and time. The official home of generative semantics, the site of its yearly CLS festivals, was Chicago—which witnessed the Democratic convention riots, by the police; the subsequent conspiracy trial and its attendant circus; the killing of Fred Hampton; the Weatherman’s Days of Rage; assorted acts of autocratic weirdness by Lord Mayor Richard Daley, and assorted acts of anarchist weirdness by groups like WITCH. As for timing, generative semantics and the counterculture became popular in exactly the same period. There had to be cross-pollination. Interpretive semantics didn’t take off fully until the popularity of the counterculture began to wane.

生成语义学政治方面的一些有趣侧重点这是乔治亚·格林在麦考利指导下完成的论文的命运，由于剑桥大学出版社担心诽谤诉讼，该论文被搁置了一年（杰弗里·普勒姆的《战壕嘴来到特朗普顿街》——1991 [1987]：100-111 有趣地记录了这一过程）。这个过程近乎荒谬，因为法律顾问警告不要将第 5 句这样的句子作为对玛丽的诽谤：

Among the more interesting sidelights to the political aspect of generative semantics is the fate of Georgia Green’s McCawley-supervised thesis, which was held up for a year because of Cambridge University Press’s fear of libel suits (entertainingly documented by Geoffrey Pullum’s “Trench-mouth Comes to Trumpington Street”—1991 [1987]:100–111). The process bordered on the ludicrous, as legal advisors cautioned against including sentences like 5, as defamatory of Mary:

5 玛丽给约翰留下了吻痕。

5 Mary gave John a hickey.

但它揭示了生成语义学风格的另一个元素，比 FLJ 示例更微妙的一步——句子à clef，其中的名字或多或少间接地指代活着的人。5 中的 Mary 和 John 很可能是任意的，但找到 6 的指称并不需要太多想象力。

But it brings to light another element of the generative semanticist style, a subtle step beyond the FLJ examples—the sentence à clef, where the names refer, more or less obliquely, to living people. Mary and John in 5 are very likely arbitrary, but it doesn’t take much imagination to find referents for 6.

6

6

玛莎给了约翰一个口交，约翰又把它给了泰德。

Martha gave John trench-mouth, and he gave it to Ted.

正如 Pullum 所表达的出版商的担忧，“约翰可能是被起诉的司法部长约翰·米切尔吗？玛莎可能是他的妻子玛莎·米切尔吗？特德可能是参议员爱德华·肯尼迪吗？”（1991 [1987]：107）。很可能。生成语义学家在此类例句方面有着丰富的经验，其中涉及各种各样的人物，除了臭名昭著的米切尔和其他政治人物外，还包括文化偶像和其他人物：

As Pullum projects the publisher’s concerns, “Could the John be the indicted Attorney General John Mitchell? Could Martha be his wife Martha Mitchell? Was Ted perhaps Senator Edward Kennedy?” (1991 [1987]:107). Probably. The generative semanticists had a track record in sample sentences of this sort, with a wide cast of characters, including, in addition to the notorious Mitchells and other political figures, cultural icons, and one another:

7

7

玛莎知道在选举结束前，她必须表现得端庄得体。（诺伊鲍尔，1972：287）

a Martha knows that it will be necessary to behave herself until the election is over. (Neubauer, 1972:287)

 

 

b 约翰认为警方会说尼克松命令谁绑架了玛莎？（Morgan，1973：739）

b Who does John think the police will say Nixon ordered to kidnap Martha? (Morgan, 1973:739)

 

 

c 除了这个混蛋自己，没人同情林登。（McCawley，1976b [1970]：302）

c No one but the bastard himself pities Lyndon. (McCawley, 1976b [1970]:302)

 

 

d 只有穆里尔投票支持休伯特。（霍恩，1988[1969]：164）

d Only Muriel voted for Hubert. (Horn, 1988 [1969]:164)

 

 

当洋子打嗝的时候，约翰不会挠她痒痒。（Yamanashi，1972：388）

e John will not tickle Yoko when she belches. (Yamanashi, 1972:388)

 

 

f 我上周看到切还活着。（Green，1973：264）

f I saw Che alive last week. (Green, 1973:264)

 

 

g Jim 的口音与 Quang 相似。（Ross，1972a：162）

g Jim resembles Quang in accent. (Ross, 1972a:162)

 

 

h 乔治喜欢北京烤鸭，但所有的语言学家都喜欢中国菜。（R. Lakoff，1971a [1969]：138）

h George likes Peking Duck, but all linguists are fond of Chinese food. (R. Lakoff, 1971a [1969]:138)

甚至连解释主义阵营的成员也参与其中。考虑到 Lakoff 和 Jackendoff 之间的敌意，很难想象这句话是完全无辜的：

Even members of the interpretivist camp dabbled in the sport. Given the animosity between Lakoff and Jackendoff, it is hard to imagine that this sentence is entirely innocent:

7

7

尽管那个流浪汉试图打我，但我其实无法对乔治太生气。 (Jackendoff，1968：13)。

i Although the bum tried to hit me, I can’t really get too mad at George. (Jackendoff, 1968:13).

除了许多生成语义学工作更明显的政治内容之外，还有另外两种方式使该方法更有效地触及了当时的社会情绪。首先，社会语言学的影响力日益增强。虽然生成语义学家并没有特别参与社会语言学，但他们对这一领域始终抱有同情心。例如，莱考夫在他最著名的政策声明《论生成语义学》（1971b:280f）中引用了拉波夫关于美国黑人英语的一些研究，而罗宾·莱考夫则开始开创她自己独特的社会语言学和普通语言哲学的融合。更一般地说，生成语义学对语言使用和社会背景的关注确保了它们受益于当时社会良知的增长：

Beyond the more overt political content of much generative semantic work, there were two other ways in which the approach touched more effectively the social mood of the times. First, there was the growing influence of sociolinguistics. While generative semanticists were not particularly engaged in sociolinguistics, they were unflaggingly sympathetic toward the field. Lakoff, for instance, included some of Labov’s work on black American English in his most famous policy statement, “On Generative Semantics” (1971b:280f), and Robin Lakoff began to carve out her own unique blend of sociolinguistics and ordinary language philosophy. More generally, generative semantics’ concern for language use and social context ensured that they benefited from the growth of social conscience at the time:

20 世纪 60 年代末和 70 年代初的政治氛围加剧了这种不满情绪 [对乔姆斯基的方法]，也是吸引许多认真的语言学生采用生成语义学课程的主要因素，该课程将形式语法工作与对现实世界中语言使用的关注相结合，有望满足他们的智力兴趣以及社会良知的要求。乔治·莱考夫 [在 Parret，1974 [1972]：172] 无疑是正确的，他说：“如今，学生对生成语义学感兴趣，因为这是他们研究人类思想和社会互动本质的一种方式。”（Newmeyer，1986a：228）

The political atmosphere of the late 1960s and early 1970s contributed to this feeling of discontent [with Chomsky’s approach] and was a major factor in drawing many serious students of language into adopting the generative semantics program, which, by combining work on formal grammar with concern for the use of language in the real world, promised to satisfy their intellectual interests as well as the demands of their social conscience. George Lakoff [in Parret, 1974 [1972]:172] was undoubtedly correct when he [said] “Nowadays students are interested in generative semantics because it is a way for them to investigate the nature of human thought and social interaction.” (Newmeyer, 1986a:228)

生成语义学更有效地适应 20 世纪初政治气氛的第二个方式是其对异议的修辞强调。在 70 年代早期至中期，异议是一种非常有市场价值的资产。嬉皮士将代际不和推向了极端（Roszak，1969：1-41），几乎从定义上来说，任何对权威的攻击都具有吸引力。“把革命带回家：杀死你的父母”，气象员的信条是这样的。“俄狄浦斯冲突取代了马克思辩证法”，艾比·霍夫曼 (1971) 说。杰里·鲁宾用大写字母尖叫道：“杀死你的父母！”（1971：194）。

The second way that generative semantics more effectively fit the political temper at the turn of the decade was its rhetorical emphasis on dissent. Dissent was a very marketable property in the early-to-mid-seventies. The hippies took generational discord to extremes (Roszak, 1969:1–41), making any assault on authority attractive almost by definition. “Bring the revolution home: kill your parents,” went the Weatherman credo. “The Oedipal Conflict has replaced Marxian Dialectics,” said Abbie Hoffman (1971). Jerry Rubin, going upper case, screamed “KILL YOUR PARENTS!” (1971:194).

生成语义学家并不像《气象员》或嬉皮士那样极端。没有人要求乔姆斯基下台。但莱考夫并不介意将对解释主义的攻击描述为“反体制思维的实践”，或称转换语法“是知识体制的一部分，就像通用汽车是军事工业体制的一部分一样”(1971a:ii)。在采访中，他以较为温和的措辞讨论了异议数据的更广泛含义：

Generative semanticists were not as extreme as the Weatherman or the yippies. No one was demanding Chomsky’s head. But Lakoff was not above describing one assault on interpretivism as “an exercise in anti-establishment thinking,” or calling transformational grammar “as much a part of the intellectual establishment as General Motors is a part of the military-industrial establishment” (1971a:ii). In the more muted terms of an interview, he discussed the broader implications of dissensual data:

如今，教授语言学并非没有间接的——非常间接的——政治后果。在语言学中，就像在政治中一样，支持或反驳许多主张的许多相关数据对普通人来说都是可用的。在语言学中，它就在你的脑海中，你所要做的就是训练自己去识别它。在政治中，它就在你身边，在报纸和电视上。同样，你只需要接受训练就能识别它。几乎任何一个语言学初学者，只要仔细思考，就能在一个下午想出足够多的关键例子来表明我们目前最复杂的理论的不足之处。同样，任何一个智力一般的公民都能找出政府告诉他的许多谎言。思维过程并没有太大不同，尽管主题不同。任何语言学初学者只要稍加思考就会发现，学术界的伟大人物，甚至像乔姆斯基这样非常聪明的人，在几乎所有问题上都可能犯错。这让人对管理我们政府的“专家”感到疑惑。 （Parret，1974[1972]：170）9

Teaching linguistics these days is not without some indirect—very indirect—political consequences. In linguistics, as in politics, much of the relevant data to support or refute many claims are available to the average person. In linguistics, it is in your mind and all you have to do is train yourself to recognize it. In politics, it is all around you, in the newspapers and on TV. Again you just have to be trained to recognize it. Just about any beginning linguistics student, with some careful thought, can in an afternoon think up enough crucial examples to show the inadequacy of our most sophisticated current theories. Similarly any citizen of average intelligence can pick out many of the lies that his government tells him. The thought processes are not all that different, though the subject matter is. Any beginning linguistics student will discover with a little thought that men of great stature in the academic establishment, even very bright ones like Chomsky, can be wrong on just about every issue. It makes one wonder about the ‘experts’ who are running our governments. (Parret, 1974 [1972]:170)9

大多数用来描述生成语义学的数据收集论文实际上都严格遵循了拉科夫在这里提供的建议，只不过它们也常常对生成语义学的方向表示赞同：这里有一些事实，任何语言理论都应该解决；目前还没有哪种理论能够自然地处理这些事实；然而，生成语义学是最接近的；解释语义学则完全不合适。

Most data-gathering papers, which came to characterize generative semantics, in fact followed precisely the prescription Lakoff offers here, except that they also often nod favorably in the direction of generative semantics: here are some facts which any theory of language should address; no current theory comes anywhere near treating these facts naturally; generative semantics, however, comes the closest; interpretive semantics is completely out to lunch.

数据崇拜

Data-Worship

我忍不住再举一个例子。这个例子来自 Geoff Nunberg（上帝保佑他）。

I can’t resist giving one more example. This one is from Geoff Nunberg (God bless him).

乔治·莱考夫

George Lakoff

生成语义学的发展源于一种协同努力，即使Aspects模型能够处理越来越多的数据，包括类别成员、词汇构成、代词关系、转换条件、施事句、量词范围、符号逻辑的含义等等。这是一个扩展转换描述能力的研究项目。但它的主要副作用之一是增加了对转换语法描述能力的怀疑。对于每一个概括，都有一些事实无法把握。对于每条规则，都有例外列表（“受伤理论的鲜血”——Green，1974：4）。对于每一个理论原则，都有一些领域严重不足。

Generative semantics developed out of a concerted attempt to make the Aspects model work on a growing spectrum of data—including issues like category membership, lexical composition, pronominal relations, conditions on transformations, performative sentences, quantifier scope, the implications of symbolic logic, and considerably more. It was a research project to extend the power of transformational description. But one of its principal side effects was increased suspicion of the descriptive powers of transformational grammar. For every generalization, there were pockets of facts that slipped out of grasp. For every rule there were lists of exceptions (“the blood of a wounded theory”—Green, 1974:4). For every theoretical principle, there were areas in which it fell drastically short.

不可避免地，这种对转换机制的怀疑与对数据的日益崇敬密不可分，尤其是当日常语言工作和德怀特·博林格的研究发挥更大影响力时。乔姆斯基（尽管他的许多批评者否认这一点）对语言数据怀有健康的尊重，但他主要忠于语法的形式属性。他的态度是理论物理学。生成语义学家迅速发展出一种更像天文学等观察科学的态度，并开始表现出该领域特有的敬畏感。这两个概念——理论怀疑和数据崇敬——在风格上产生的产物也是双胞胎：对理论提议不足之处的不断讨论，以及面对自然语言浩瀚时的谦逊。10

Inevitably this suspicion of transformational machinery came hand in glove with an increased reverence for data, particularly when ordinary language work and Dwight Bolinger’s research came to exert more influence. Chomsky (although many of his detractors deny it) has a healthy respect for linguistic data, but his principal allegiance is to the formal properties of grammar. His is the attitude of theoretical physics. The generative semanticists rapidly developed an attitude more like that of an observational science, like astronomy, and began to display the same sense of awe characteristic of that field. The stylistic offsprings of these twin notions—theory-suspicion and data-reverence—were also twins: incessant discussion of the inadequacies of theoretical proposals, and humility in the face of vastness of natural language.10

密切关注数据的主要动机之一是教育，这本小册子（也许是关于后期生成语义学中普遍存在的态度的最具启发性的文件）很好地说明了这一动机，小册子名为《规则失效之处：学生指南。MK Burt 的《从深层到表层结构》的未经授权的附录》（Borkin 等人，1968 年）。甚至它的起源也足够另类，可以像扎染 T 恤一样适合生成主义的叙述。它最初是 Lakoff 给密歇根大学一年级研究生语法课布置的一项家庭作业：对一些关于Aspects模型的传统论点进行相当典型的解释，然后将其撕成碎片。莱考夫选择了麻省理工学院学生玛丽娜·伯特的一本练习册，她曾被短暂说服将这一攻击附在她的《从深层结构到表层结构》第二版中，“作为一种文本中的反文本”。然而，当她看到攻击的恶毒，并把它展示给“几个我非常尊重的人”（比如诺姆·乔姆斯基和莫里斯·哈勒；可能还有其他人）时，她改变了主意。在拒绝信中，她用非常合理的理由为自己的决定辩护：“虽然你提出了很好的反例，但没有对事实进行分析来取代现有的事实，尽管我们都知道这是不够的。感觉是，仅仅分析一个现有的理论是不够的而不提供某种替代方案。”如果你没有提供一些值得你接受的东西，那么大声喊“不”就没有什么价值了。11

One of the principal motives for close attention to the data was educational, a motive best illustrated by a small, peculiar, barely-above-the-ground pamphlet—perhaps the single most illuminating document for the attitudes that came to be pervasive in late generative semantics—called Where the Rules Fail: A Student’s Guide. An Unauthorized Appendix to M. K. Burt’s From Deep to Surface Structure (Borkin and others, 1968). Even its genesis is offbeat enough to fit the generativist narrative like a tie-dyed T-shirt. It started life as a homework assignment that Lakoff gave a first-year graduate syntax class at Michigan: take a rather typical explication of a number of the conventional arguments for the Aspects model and tear it to shreds. Lakoff chose a workbook by an MIT student, Marina Burt, who was briefly persuaded to appendicize this attack to the second edition of her From Deep to Surface Structure “as a kind of antitext within a text.” However, when she saw the virulence of the assault, and showed it to “several persons for whom I have great respect” (read Noam Chomsky and Morris Halle; possibly some others), she thought better of it. In her declining letter, she defended her decision with the very reasonable argument that “although you present excellent counterexamples, there is no analysis of the facts which replaces what exists even though we both know it’s not adequate. The feelings are that it is not enough to pick apart an existing theory without offering some kind of alternative.” There is little value in shouting no! when you don’t also offer something worth saying yes to.11

学生们对被剥夺了嘲笑伯特的机会感到愤怒，也对在某种程度上将伯特视为提喻的乔姆斯基感到愤怒。他们让反文本在印第安纳大学语言俱乐部中流传，并附上了一份由莱考夫撰写的前言，以及一份抱怨被当做“太不成熟而无法面对科学现实”的孩子对待的任性的序言。12 Lakoff 很可能参与了 IULC 的出版决定，无论如何，他的序言为这本小册子的魅力做出了很大贡献。它直接针对那些会使用 Burt 练习册的初学者，并很好地描绘了他在 60 年代末和 70 年代初的劝诫式教学风格。它明确地吸引了年轻人，尽管它采用了悲观乐观主义的奇怪语言：

The students were irate at being denied the opportunity to thumb their noses at Burt with her sanction, and at the person for whom she was, to some extent, a synecdoche, Chomsky. They had the antitext circulated, with a foreword by Lakoff, through the Indiana University Linguistic Club, along with a petulant preface that complained about being treated like children who “are too immature to be confronted with the realities of science.”12 Lakoff very likely had a hand in IULC’s decision to publish, and, in any case, his foreword contributes much to the pamphlet’s fascination. It is pitched directly at beginning students of the sort who would use Burt’s workbook, and gives a very good picture of his exhortative teaching style in the late sixties and early seventies. It is explicit in its appeal to youth, though it adopts the curious language of pessimistic optimism:

通过指出伯特书中规则的一些缺陷，我们希望让学生感受到语言学是一门活生生的学科，其中大多数分析都离他们的目标相去甚远，而编写一门语言完整语法的旧目标，在最好的情况下也只是未来几个世纪的希望，在最坏的情况下也只是一个笑话，(i–ii)

By pointing out some of the failures of the rules in Burt’s book, we hope to give students a feel of linguistics as a living discipline, where most analyses are hopelessly far away from their goals, and where the old goal of actually writing a complete grammar for a language has become at best a hope for the future centuries and at worst a joke, (i–ii)

发现很少有东西像大多数入门教科书作者让你相信的那样发挥作用，这可能是一种令人沮丧的经历。另一方面，它可以而且应该是一种令人兴奋的经历。毕竟，已知的越少，你要发现的东西就越多。如果你想在生活中做一些有趣的事情，并正在考虑从事语言学工作，那么发现有很多事情可以做，这绝对不是什么令人沮丧的事情。（v）

Finding out that very little works the way most introductory textbook writers would lead you to believe can be a frustrating experience. On the other hand, it can and should be an exhilarating one. After all, the less that is known, the more there is for you to find out. If you want to do something interesting with your life and are contemplating doing work in linguistics, it should be anything but frustrating to find that there is a lot for you to do. (v)

显然，问题在于老一辈人误解了语言的运作方式。伯特说，他的练习册“可以追溯到许多语言学家认为古典形式的转换语法基本正确的时代”。老一辈人不仅在这一点上是错的，而且在错误中还很傲慢，而伯特则犯了“摆出一副道貌岸然的姿态来展示可靠的结果”的错误。不过，莱考夫慷慨地补充道，伯特的书确实为初学者提供了一个非常宝贵的机会，因为如果以正确的教学精神使用，“它是一个很好的工具，可以告诉学生转换语法并不像人们所说的那么好”。重要的一点不是责怪伯特，尽管她成了一个方便的替罪羊，而是责怪新的生成语义学启蒙之前的整个转换事业。十三

The point, clearly, is that the old-timers were mistaken about how language works. Burt’s workbook, he says, “dates from the days when many linguists thought that transformational grammar in its classical form was basically correct.” The old-timers were not just wrong in this, they were arrogant in their wrongness, and Burt is guilty of adopting “the sanctimonious pose of presenting solid results.” Still, Lakoff generously adds, Burt’s book does present a very valuable opportunity for beginning students, since, if used in the right pedagogical spirit, “it is a good vehicle for teaching students that transformational grammar is not all that it is cracked up to be.” The important point is not to blame Burt, though she makes a convenient scapegoat, but to blame the entire transformational enterprise prior to the new generative semantics enlightenment.13

这种语言学方法的诸多讽刺之处之一是，它使莱考夫与他的论文相距甚远，而论文发表仅一年。他的论文是莱考夫对语言学的第一项重大贡献，它朝着生成语义学迈出了最具决定性的早期步伐，并且它充满了数据。莱考夫的论文项目本质上是找出Aspects理论的明显反例并驯服它们，以挽救带有转换的不规则现象。随着生成语义学计划的发展，莱考夫继续致力于驯服他能发现的最困难的数据，但很快就放弃了使用转换来做到这一点。他教他的学生通过参与反建制思想和贩卖反证来研究语言学。然而，在某个地方，保存现象被错误地理解，并且越来越多的生成语义能量仅仅用于庆祝异常现象。

Among the many ironies in this approach to linguistics is the distance it places Lakoff from his dissertation, only a year after its publication. His dissertation was Lakoff’s first major contribution to linguistics, and it took the most decisive early steps towards generative semantics, and it was data-happy. Lakoff’s thesis project was essentially to snoop out apparent counter-examples to the Aspects theory and tame them, to save irregular phenomena with transformations. As the generative semantics program grew, Lakoff continued to work on taming the most difficult data he could uncover, but soon gave up using transformations to do so. And he taught his students to approach linguistics by engaging in anti-establishment thinking and trafficking in counter-evidence. Somewhere, however, the imperative to save the phenomena was misplaced, and much generative semantics energy was increasingly devoted simply to celebrating anomalies.

失去耐心

Running Out of Patience

并非所有生成语义学家都会同意一位前党派人士的说法：“我们特意在论文中搞笑，这样一旦我们的观点被驳斥，我们就可以摆脱困境，说：‘哦，你认真对待我们了吗？难道你看不出来我们只是在开玩笑吗？’” [个人通信]。但我想，大多数人都会承认其中有一定道理。

Not all generative semanticists would agree with one ex-partisan that “we went out of our way to be funny in our papers so that once our ideas were refuted we could get ourselves off the hook by saying, ‘Oh, did you take us seriously? Couldn’t you see that we were just fooling around?’ [personal communication].” But most, I suspect, would acknowledge a kernel of truth in it.

弗雷德里克·纽迈尔

Frederick Newmeyer

纽迈耶关于生成语义幽默的评论让几乎每一位前党派人士都感到难以接受。14理由很充分。这实在太明显了，难以置信。

Newmeyer’s comment about generative semantics humor is a bone sticking in the craw of almost every ex-partisan.14 For good reason. It is far too bald to be true.

当然，生成语义学幽默也遭到过严厉批评；当时发表的少数评论指责生成语义学家“过分地为了自己的利益而培养怪异或冒险性”以及他们“幼稚的政治和性暗示”（Percival，1971：184；Sampson，1976：179），而利斯则以典型的直率说：“这是自作聪明的幽默。”解释学家们通常不以为然——拉斯尼克说：“你必须认真对待你的领域。你不能向世界传达它就像夜总会里的单口相声表演一样”——尽管乔姆斯基本人有些中立：

There are certainly harsh words for generative semantics humor; the few published comments about it at the time rebuked the generative semanticists for the “extreme of cultivating the bizarre or the risqué for its own sake” and for their “juvenile political and sexual references” (Percival, 1971:184; Sampson, 1976:179), and Lees, with typical bluntness, just says that “It was smartass humor.” The interpretivists were generally unimpressed—Lasnik says “You have to take your field seriously. You can’t convey to the world that it’s like a standup routine in a nightclub”—though Chomsky himself is somewhat neutral:

科学和其他人类活动一样。你不必给它套上束缚。如果人们喜欢在论文中讲笑话，那很好。这无所谓好坏。也许听他们的论文更有趣，我不知道。但这不应该影响人们对他们的成果的评价。

Science is like any other human activity. You don’t have to put a straightjacket on it. If people like to give papers with jokes, that’s fine. It’s neither good nor bad. Maybe it’s more fun to listen to their papers, I don’t know. But it shouldn’t [affect one’s evaluation of] their results.

然而，似乎没有人认同纽梅尔的观点，认为这是一场赌注对冲，提议者希望事后能以这全是玩笑来为自己辩解。核心生成语义学家认为他的观察即使不是恶意的，也是愚蠢至极的；拉科夫（表现出他与李斯共同的特点）称其为“彻头彻尾的谎言”，并称举报人为“混蛋”。

Nobody, however, seems to share Newmeyer’s feeling that there was bet-hedging going on, that the proposers wanted to be able to excuse themselves later with the claim that it was all a joke. The central generative semanticists regard his observation as flatly stupid, if not malicious; Lakoff (demonstrating a characteristic he shares with Lees) terms it “an utter falsehood,” and calls the informant “a jerk.”

然而，纽迈耶的观察背后却隐藏着一些不为人知的真相。

There is, though, some muted truth behind Newmeyer’s observation.

其背后的真相更多地与演讲的一般非正式性有关，幽默是其中的一个组成部分，而不是幽默本身。非正式性是许多生成语义学工作论文模式的一部分；其文献几乎从未试图隐藏提案的不确定性。许多生成语义学论文，尤其是 CLS 卷中的论文，充斥着对其提案的犹豫不决的表达（尽管他们几乎总是声称自己优于对同一现象的解释主义处理），而文体松散反映了这种犹豫，也许在心照不宣地请求观众宽容。它实际上表达了 Lakoff 在辩论后期更明确地表达的内容：

The truth behind it has more to do with the general informality of presentation, of which humor was an ingredient, than with humor per se. Informality was part of the working-paper mode of much generative semantics; its literature almost never made any attempt to hide the tentativeness of the proposals. Many generative semantics papers, particularly the ones in the CLS volumes, are rife with expressions of hesitancy about their proposals (though they almost always claim superiority over interpretivist treatments of the same phenomena), and stylistic looseness reflected this hesitancy, perhaps tacitly requesting some lenience from the audience. It expresses, in effect, what Lakoff put more explicitly very late in the debates:

我甚至没有接近充分的理论。我所拥有的，通过正式处理，是一些非常不充分但富有启发性的想法。……据我所知，它们只比目前各种版本的生成性理论好一点。语法——你知道它们有多糟糕！我希望你能以宽容的心对待[这些建议]。这些想法很年轻，需要得到重视。（1977a:259）

I do not have anything even close to an adequate theory. What I do have, by way of formal treatment, are some grossly inadequate but suggestive ideas. … So far as I can tell they are only slightly better than what is now available in various versions of generative grammar—and you know how bad they are! I hope you will approach [the proposals] with a charitable heart. The ideas are young and need to be cared for. (1977a:259)

拉科夫的陈述是对许多提议的试验性质的最全面陈述，但它远非独一无二。当出现更好的明确证据时，生成语义学家也不会羞于放弃他们的提议——尽管据我所知，没有人在这样的放弃中使用过“难道你看不出来我只是在胡闹吗？”这样的借口。

Lakoff’s statement is the fullest one on the tentative nature of many proposals, but it is very far from unique. Nor were generative semanticists shy about recanting their proposals when clear proof of something better came along—although no one, as far as I can determine, ever used the excuse “Couldn’t you see that I was just fooling around?” in such a recantation.

幽默与改口之间这种迂回联系的最明显例子来自 Postal，他提出（1970 [1969]）特征 [ DOOM ] 来标记在派生过程中面临淘汰的名词短语，但不久之后就放弃了它（1972a [1969]:140），因为全局规则出现了，似乎能更好地处理这种现象。DOOM 这个名字是一种风格上的认可，表明他的解决方案是人为的，它是变换理论中的本轮——它所做的正是 Lakoff 建议学生对CLYDE这样的名字所做的——但这是一个非常严肃的提议。后来，当他找到一种不那么人为地完成同样工作的机制时，Postal 很高兴放弃了这个特征。

The most obvious example of this circuitous connection between humor and recantation is from Postal, who proposed (1970 [1969]) the feature [DOOM] for marking noun phrases which faced elimination later in a derivation, and shortly thereafter renounced it (1972a [1969]:140), when global rules entered the picture and seemed to offer a superior treatment of the phenomena. The name DOOM was a stylistic recognition that his solution was artificial, that it was something of an epicycle on the theory of transformations—it was doing exactly what Lakoff advised students to do with names like CLYDE—but it was a perfectly serious proposal. Later, when he found a mechanism to do the same job less artificially, Postal was happy to let the feature go.

简言之，虽然双方明显存在回避态度，而幽默也助长了这种回避态度，但说幽默是故意为之的逃避现实之口却是不公平的。这些建议是认真提出的，但它们也带有警告标签，禁止无条件接受。这种广告中的真实性很少得到赞赏。转换生成语法几乎从一开始就处于变化之中——当然，从它不再是乔姆斯基的私人玩具开始就一直如此。1962 年，利斯在其《英语名词化》第二版的序言中（距第一版仅两年）为其撰写了序言，为其“早已过时”而道歉（1968，xxvii）。但这样的坦白在早年很少见，在与乔姆斯基关系最密切的著作中也一直很少见，因为它展现了信心和确定性。

In short, while there was clear hedging going on, and humor contributed to that hedging, it is unfair to say that humor was a deliberate escape hatch. The proposals were seriously advanced, but they came with a warning label against unqualified acceptance. This truth-in-advertising was rarely appreciated. Transformationalgenerative grammar had been in flux almost from the outset—certainly from as soon as it grew beyond Chomsky’s private toy. Lees’s 1962 preface to the second printing of his English Nominalizations, just two years after the first, apologizes that it “has long since become antiquated” (1968, xxvii). But such confessions were rare in the early years, and have always been rare in the work most closely associated with Chomsky, which projects confidence and certainty.

消费者——无论是理论还是洗衣机——都希望获得信心和确定性。他们不想将自己的智力资本投入到几年、几个月或几天后可能过时的东西上。听听这个关于立即传播部分消化的概念的抱怨：

Consumers—of theories just as of washing machines—want confidence and certainty. They don’t want to invest their intellectual capital in something that may be out of date in a few years, or a few months, or a few days. Listen to this complaint about the immediate dissemination of partially digested notions:

争论的焦点是，当思想的发展如此连续和迅速，以至于最新的推测在发表时就已经过时时，是否每一个新的推测，无论它是多么短暂，都应该在文献中传播。（O'Donnell（1974：79nl）

What is at issue is whether every new speculation, no matter how ephemeral, should be broadcast in the literature when the development of ideas is so continuous and rapid that the latest speculation is already out-of-date by the time it is published. (O’Donnell (1974:79nl)

更尖刻的是，至少在其所采用的角色中，沃尔对那些难以跟上句法的语言学家的建议是：

More acerbic, at least in its adopted persona, is Wall’s suggestion to linguists who have trouble keeping up with syntax:

瞧，也许应该做的是研究历史语言学，让句法暂时搁置一段时间——至少等到事情平息下来，这些混蛋不再印刷他们头脑中出现的每一个疯狂的幻觉。（Wall，1970：167nl5）

Look, maybe the thing to do would be to go into historical linguistics and let syntax go for a while—at least until things settle down a little and these assholes stop printing every hare-brained hallucination that afflicts their heads. (Wall, 1970:167nl5)

在这些批评中，奥唐纳和沃尔的观点截然不同。奥唐纳感到困惑和充满敌意，但他既不属于辩论的生成方，也不属于辩论的解释方，因此，他很好地衡量了七十年代中期，沃尔在语言界掀起了一场革命。从他的语气中可以清楚地看出，他正在创作一部讽刺作品。但他是圈内人，所以他的讽刺作品非常准确，对这场运动的看法非常尖锐（尽管沃尔当然不会放过乔姆斯基）；例如，幻觉并不是一个随机选择的术语。

O’Donnell and Wall come from very different perspectives in these critiques. O’Donnell is confused and hostile, but aligned to neither the generative nor the interpretive side of the debate, and is therefore a pretty good barometer of the over all linguistic community in the mid-seventies. Wall, as should be clear from the tone, is conducting a satire. But he was something of an insider, so the satire is deadly accurate, a terrifically biting view of the movement (though Wall certainly does not spare Chomsky); hallucination, for instance, is not a randomly chosen term.

生成语义学的情况开始变得糟糕，而精神是其健康状况不佳的原因之一。

Things were beginning to look bad for generative semantics, and ethos was one of the reasons for its failing health.

第 9 章

生成语义学 4：崩溃

CHAPTER 9

Generative Semantics 4: The Collapse

我的观点的超然真理一次又一次地得到支持，最近一次是进步（与退步相反，尽管当然没有暗示方向性）语义学方面的出色工作。我在这里指的不是麦夸里利的著作，他的思想并不总是教条地正确，而是考夫莱克的作品，他是生成力的丰富代表（参见考夫莱克的《出现 a》、《出现 b》、《出现 c》、《出现 No》等）。考夫莱克无可辩驳的、绝对有力的迹象表明，需要全新的语法装置形式——大约每周一次的理论革命，从安阿伯电影节冬季开始，《持续时间限制》——令人难以置信。没有什么比这些反复的证明更能令人信服地证明 ESP [Erector Set（英国 Meccano）提案] 的正确性，即所需的滑轮必须比我们倾向于相信的更大、更坚固。

The transcendent truth of my position has been buttressed time and again, most recently by the splendid work being accomplished in progressive (as opposed to regressive, although of course no directionality is implied) semantics. I refer here not so much to the writings of McQuarrelly, whose thought is not always sound dogmatically, but rather to the output of Coughlake, that prolific exponent of generative power (see, inter alia, Coughlake to appear a, to appear b, to appear c, to appear No). Coughlake’s irrefutable, nay absolutely crushing, indications of the necessity for wholly novel forms of grammatical apparatus—approximately one revolution in theory each week, beginning with the Ann Arbor Film Festival winter, Durational Constraints—quite boggle the mind. Nothing could prove the correctness of the ESP [Erector Set (British Meccano) Proposal] more convincingly than these repeated demonstrations that the required pulleys must be larger and stronger than we were inclined to believe.

埃宾克拉夫特

Ebbing Craft

（又名 Arnold Zwicky，多管齐下的模仿秀）

(a.k.a. Arnold Zwicky, in a multipronged parody)

毫不奇怪，我在这里无法提供任何解释。

Unsurprisingly, I have no explanations to offer here.

哈吉罗斯

Háj Ross

停止敌对行动

The Cessation of Hostilities

1974 年，朱迪思·莱维开始撰写《复杂名词的句法和语义学》 ，这是她在麦考利指导下对博士论文的广泛修改，其对生成语义学的影响相当于李斯的《英语名词化语法》，后者是他在乔姆斯基指导下对其博士论文的修改，对早期转换语法的影响。莱维的书证明了生成语义学是有效的，尽管任何试图对现实进行建模的科学尝试都存在各种变化、不确定性和争议，尤其是对像语言这样复杂的现实进行建模。1但当她完成写作，书付印（1978 年出版）时，莱维“环顾四周，发现没人感兴趣。没有一个社区。”

Judith Levi set to work on The Syntax and Semantics of Complex Nominals in 1974, an extensive reworking of her doctoral dissertation under McCawley that does for generative semantics what Lees’ The Grammar of English Nominalizations, a reworking of his doctoral dissertation under Chomsky, does for early transformational grammar. Levi’s book proves—within all the variations, uncertainties, and controversies that characterize any scientific attempt to model reality, especially a reality as mucky as language—that generative semantics works.1 But when she finished, and the book was in press (published 1978), Levi “looked around and found that nobody was interested. There was no community.”

在战场的另一边，一位新兴的诠释主义学者霍华德·拉斯尼克 (Howard Lasnik) 注意到，过去五年来最热门的问题一夜之间从麻省理工学院的走廊里消失了：“人们不再谈论它们。我有这种明显的印象。就像有人把头伸出窗外，雨就没了，就是这样。”

On the other side of the battlefield, an emerging interpretivist scholar, Howard Lasnik, noticed that the burning issues of the last five years had disappeared overnight from the MIT hallways: “People just stopped talking about them. I have this distinct impression. It was like someone put his head out the window and it wasn’t raining anymore, and that was that.”

辩论结束了。

The debate was over.

很快就清楚，乔姆斯基获胜了。

Chomsky, it very shortly became clear, had won.

这场胜利是压倒性的，乔姆斯基应该得到很多赞扬或指责，这取决于你的观点，因为生成语义学的消亡。但并非全部。他的一些反驳非常到位，但生成语义学也经常在非常公开的情况下自食其果，就在乔姆斯基的模型开始取得令人瞩目的进展的时候。

The victory was crushing, and Chomsky deserves a good deal of praise or blame, depending on your perspective, for the death of generative semantics. But not all. Some of his counter-argument bullets were very well placed, but generative semantics also shot itself in the foot, often, very publicly, just as Chomsky’s model began making impressive headway.

正是乔姆斯基的积极建议——为正经历信任危机的模型提供了一种替代方案——而不是他对生成语义学的负面攻击，使他的解释理论得以从火中拯救出来，尽管它被严重烧焦了。

It was Chomsky’s positive proposals—providing an alternative to a model undergoing a crisis of confidence—far more than his negative attacks on generative semantics, that pulled his interpretive bacon from the fire, albeit badly singed.

乔姆斯基主义的衰退

The Chomskyan Ebb

让我们面对现实吧。 《语言反思》 [Chomsky, 1975b]的出版毫无疑问地表明，转换生成语法已成为一种智力欺诈。

Let’s face it. The publication of Reflections on Language [Chomsky, 1975b] leaves little doubt that transformational-generative grammar has become an intellectual fraud.

本尼森·格雷

Bennison Gray

20 世纪 70 年代初期至中期，乔姆斯基似乎以兹维基尖刻的戏仿笔名埃宾·克拉夫特 (Ebbing Craft) 的身份出现。他被后继者包围，退缩到布鲁姆菲尔德的反意义立场，而不是接受他们的进步。他的反攻和攻击——被误解的词汇学和语法建议、模糊的后深层结构语义建议、特殊的符号变体立场——看起来都很无力。而这只是他麻烦的开始。

In the early-to-mid-seventies, Chomsky looked to be, in Zwicky’s biting parodic pseudonym, Ebbing Craft.
