He had been outflanked by his progeny, and had retrenched to a Bloomfieldian anti-meaning position rather than embracing their advances. His counteroffensives and attacks—the misunderstood lexicalist and -syntax proposals, the vaguely adumbrated post-deep structure semantic proposals, the peculiar notational variants position—all looked feeble. And that was just the start of his troubles.

他在心理学领域的声誉一落千丈。20 世纪 60 年代初，他被誉为认知革命之父；到了 70 年代初，尽管他之前的成就被写入教科书和普及读物，但心理学家们却迅速对他的计划失去了信心。首先，它没有在实验中取得成功。心理学家提出了一个非常漂亮的认知理论，即转换语法，该理论具有明显的经验后果：句子中涉及的转换越多，人们理解它所花的时间就越长。被动句应该比主动句花费更长的时间。否定句应该比肯定句花费更长的时间。否定被动句应该比肯定主动句花费更长的时间。你懂的。起初，这个被称为复杂性派生理论的模型似乎取得了惊人的成功，它为转换语法提供了心理上的推动力，为认知心理学提供了语法上的推动力，为刚刚起步的混合语言心理学提供了经验上的推动力。人们确实需要更长的时间来理解衍生变换较多的句子。但很快，当句子的长度和含义被考虑在内时（例如，被动语态比主动语态长），例如，在意义上有细微的差异；负数比正数略长，意义也大不相同），转换的重要性就下降了；充其量，它们现在似乎无法测试了。更糟糕的是，长度或意义没有差异的转换（关联句子，如Debbie called up Jeff和Debbie called Jeff up）对理解时间也没有明显的影响。2在验证深层结构的心理现实的实验尝试中也出现了类似的故事：最初获得成功，随后考虑其他因素对成功进行重新解释，最后彻底失败。3

His reputation in psychology was taking a beating. In the early sixties, he was hailed as a founding father of the cognitive revolution; by the early seventies, even as his previous accomplishments were making their way into textbooks and popularizations, working psychologists were rapidly losing faith in his program. For one thing, it wasn’t panning out experimentally. Psychologists had come up with a very pretty cognitive theory of transformational grammar that had clear empirical consequences: The more transformations involved in a sentence, the longer it should take for someone to understand it. A passive sentence should take longer than its active counterpart. A negative should take longer than a positive. A negative-passive should take proportionally longer than a positive-active. You get the picture. At first, this model—known as the derivational theory of complexity—seemed spectacularly successful, giving a psychological boost to transformational grammar, a grammatical boost to cognitive psychology, and an empirical boost to the hybrid fledgling, psycholinguistics. It did take people longer to understand sentences with more transformations in their derivation. But all too soon, when sentence length and meaning were factored in (passives are longer than actives, for instance, and have subtle differences in meaning; negatives are slightly longer than positives, and very different in meaning), transformations receded in importance; at best, they now seemed untestable. Worse, transformations which had no differences in length or meaning (relating sentences like Debbie called up Jeff and Debbie called Jeff up) also had no appreciable impact on comprehension time.2 A similar story unfolded for experimental attempts to confirm the psychological reality of deep structure: initial success, followed by reinterpretations of that success considering other factors, and then outright failure.3

更成问题的是，乔姆斯基在《方面》中所持的理论和方法论立场的后果开始让心理学家感到不安。特别是，三个因素的汇合——他的能力-表现区分、他坚持转换生成语法只直接涉及能力，以及他对理想结构的关注——似乎是一个阴谋，目的是让他的作品摆脱任何实证责任。埃里克·万纳回忆说：“对转换语法的探索，在许多心理学家看来已经“走进了死胡同”（1988:150）。

Even more problematically, the consequences of Chomsky’s theoretical and methodological positions in Aspects were beginning to make psychologists nervous. In particular, the confluence of three factors—his competence-performance distinction, his insistence that transformational-generative grammar directly concerned only competence, and his focus on ideal constructs—seemed like a conspiracy of sneaky maneuvers to relieve his work of any empirical responsibility. “The adventure into transformational grammar,” recalls Eric Wanner, looked to many psychologists to have “reached a dead end” (1988:150).

生成语义学和解释语义学之间的争吵也于事无补。一些心理学家，也就是那些设法保持兴趣的人，发现生成语义学与大多数语言学家最初发现的乔姆斯基早期著作一样，具有吸引力且是必然的产物，他们更喜欢生成语义学提供的更优雅、更直观的语言图景。但事实证明，生成语义学并不适合实验，因此他们几乎没有选择余地，大多数人只是觉得这场争论晦涩难懂、无礼。乔姆斯基的声誉受损最严重，正如媒体对这场争论的报道所遭受的损失一样。四五年前，乔姆斯基还是救世主，但现在他没有勇气坚持自己的信念，坚持从《Aspects》中发展出来的更明确的语义和心理主义计划，更不用说坚强的性格来留住他以前的信徒了。

And the generative-interpretive squabbling didn’t help. Some psychologists, the ones who managed to maintain their interest, found in generative semantics the same attractive and inevitable outgrowth of Chomsky’s early work that most linguists initially found in it, and preferred the more elegant, more intuitive picture of language it offered. But it proved no more amenable to experimentation, so there was little for them to choose between, and most just found the dispute arcane and ill-mannered. Chomsky’s reputation suffered the most, in exactly the way it suffered in the media accounts of the dispute. A savior only four or five years back, Chomsky now didn’t have the courage of his own convictions to follow through with the more explicitly semantic and mentalist program that grew out of Aspects, let alone the strength of character to keep his former devotees at his side.

乔姆斯基的符号变体论证对于局外人来说尤其具有破坏性。在最广泛传播的版本中，即卡茨在《纽约时报》上的评论中，该论证如下：

Chomsky’s notational-variants argument was especially destructive with outsiders. In the version that reached the broadest public, Katz’s New York Times comments, the argument looked like this:

你可以用码和英寸来测量，也可以使用公制，这两种方法都是正确的。这里我们在语言学中有一个相似之处。一种理论从单词的含义开始，然后将它们组合起来，得出句子的含义。另一种理论从句子的含义开始，然后将其分解，以获得单词的含义。这两种方法都采用相同的规则。（Shenker，1972）

You can measure things by yards and inches, or you can use the metric system, and both are correct. Here we have a parallel in linguistics. One theory starts with the meaning of words and combines them to arrive at the meaning of the sentence. The other starts with the meaning of the sentence and breaks it up to obtain the meanings of the words. Both methods employ the same rules. (Shenker, 1972)

像这样一场激烈的争论，如果最后落得如此地步，那么它只不过是一场关于量杆的混淆之类的小事，旁观者不可能把它当真。具有过程思维的心理学家也很容易把这两个模型看作完全相反的 — —解释性模型表明语法是针对听者的，而生成性模型表明语法是针对说者的。那么，为什么语言学家不能齐心协力呢？此外，对于任何读过乔姆斯基的畅销书（尤其是《笛卡尔语言学》或《语言与心智》）的无知旁观者来说，乔姆斯基所说的似乎与生成主义者所说的一模一样。在局外人看来，深层结构一直以来都是一种语义表征；为什么现在争论这么激烈呢？

A dispute involving as much heat as this one, but which reduces to something as trivial as a confusion over measuring rods could not possibly be taken seriously by its spectators. It was also easy for process-minded psychologists to view the two models as completely inverse—interpretive suggests a grammar for the hearer, generative suggests a grammar for the speaker. Why, then, couldn’t the linguists get their acts together? Moreover, for any innocent bystander who had read Chomsky’s popular books (especially Cartesian Linguistics or Language and Mind), it did look as though Chomsky was saying exactly what the generativists were saying. Deep structure had seemed to people on the outside to be a semantic representation all along; why so much strife now?

我见到的语言学家和心理学家越多，我就越喜欢我的老鼠；终于有人发表了一篇对乔姆斯基的《言语行为》评论的回应（MacCorquodale，1970），行为主义死亡的报道开始显得有些夸张。最糟糕的是，这些该死的理论不肯保持平静。最敬业、最勤奋的心理学家甚至无法跟上辩论一方的文献，更不用说双方了。4

The more linguists I see, psychologists were beginning to feel, the more I like my rats; someone finally published a response to Chomsky’s Verbal Behavior review (MacCorquodale, 1970), and reports of the death of behaviorism began to look somewhat exaggerated. Worst of all, the damn theories refused to keep still. The most dedicated, hardworking psychologist couldn’t keep up with the literature on even one side of the debate, let alone both.4

心理学家并不是唯一心怀不满的观察者。英语研究对乔姆斯基来说也同样糟糕，他所期待的作文和诗学灵丹妙药未能治愈任何疾病，反而使许多疾病更加复杂；从那里，语义之争显得晦涩难懂、粗鲁无礼；从那里，他们看到这些该死的理论不会停滞不前。英国人从欣喜到幻灭的速度比心理学家更快，到 70 年代中期，像“为什么转换语法在课堂上失败了”这样的文章很常见——歇斯底里地提请人们注意全国 ACT 分数与“语言革命的兴起”之间的负相关性，并使用新数学进行类比，后者曾经是推荐，现在遭到嘲笑（Luthy，1977）。虽然似乎没有人用这些术语表达过，但不满的主要原因之一是乔姆斯基越来越有力地表明他只关心语言的心理方面；英国人几乎只关心社交方面和交流。

Psychologists were not the only disaffected observers. Things were just as bad for Chomsky in English studies, where the hoped-for panaceas in composition and poetics failed to cure any ills, and complicated many; from where the semantics wars looked arcane and ill-mannered; and from where they could see that the damn theories wouldn’t keep still. English folk went from delight to disillusion even more rapidly than psychologists, and by the mid-seventies articles like “Why Transformational Grammar Fails in the Classroom” were common—hysterically drawing attention to the negative correlation between national ACT scores and “the rise of the linguistic revolution,” and using analogies to the New Math, once a recommendation, now with derision (Luthy, 1977). While nobody seems to have articulated it in these terms, one of the principal reasons for disaffection was the increasing forcefulness with which Chomsky made it clear he cared only about the mental aspects of language; English folk are almost exclusively concerned with the social aspects, with communication.

一位英语教授对此大为震惊，他发表了一篇极其恶毒的讽刺作品《哦的利润》，攻击乔姆斯基本土主义假说中物种特定模块。小说的主人公是一只大猩猩，名叫“哦”，能说一口流利的美国手语，因此激怒了伟大的伦纳德·桑德格兰德 (Leonard Sandground)。桑德格兰德是皮层承诺研究所所长、创世纪语法的发明者和主要支持者，同时也是一位著名的反战活动家。就连乔姆斯基那种现已臭名昭著的才能，即在理论或经验上一蹴而就地改变其理论依据，也遭到了尖锐的攻击。对于通过内心独白的桑德格兰德来说，哦的主要问题不是他的语言能力，而是他的时机把握：

One English professor was so aghast that he published a wonderfully malicious satire, Oh’s Profit, which attacked the species-specific module of Chomsky’s nativist hypothesis. The hero of the novel is a gorilla, the eponymous Oh, who speaks perfectly good American Sign Language, and hence raises the ire of the Great Leonard Sandground, director of the Institute of Cortextual Commitment, inventor and chief proponent of Genesis Grammar, and a prominent anti-war activist in the bargain. Even Chomsky’s by-now-notorious talent for shifting the grounds of his theory at the drop of a theoretical or empirical hat comes under biting attack. For Sandground, running through an internal monologue, the main problem with Oh is not his linguistic abilities, but his timing:

当下一只会说话的猿猴出现时，该研究所理论上已经做好了准备。适当的文章可以传播到相应的期刊。是的，具有讽刺意味的是，解决方案就在眼前。Genesis G.可以处理会说话的猿猴，可以为它们腾出空间。当然，优雅程度会有所下降……（Goulet，1975：154；Goulet 的斜体、缩写和尾随点）

When the next talking ape came down the road the Institute would have been theoretically prepared. The proper articles could be disseminated to the appropriate journals. Yes, the solution was, ironically, at hand. Genesis G. could handle talking apes, could make room for them. With a loss of elegance, of course … (Goulet, 1975:154; Goulet’s italics, abbreviation, and trailing dots)

不幸的是，桑德格兰德没有找到短期解决办法，因此他开始杀死这只猿猴。5

Unfortunately, no short-term solution presents itself to Sandground, and he sets out to murder the ape.5

甚至连乔姆斯基作品的道德含义（或者说缺乏道德含义）也受到了攻击，许多人注意到，美国首屈一指的社会批评家之一竟然像躲避荨麻疹一样回避语言的社会方面，这颇具讽刺意味。在乔姆斯基之前，美国语言学一直是一个具有社会良知的领域——从真正意义上讲，它诞生于社会良知——最明显的是它对土著语言的处理方式。在布卢姆菲尔德后期，这种良知有所萎缩。在乔姆斯基之后，它逐渐枯萎：如果语言学是认知心理学的一个分支，那么它与社会问题的相关性充其量也微不足道。但 20 世纪 60 年代和 70 年代，人们对​​语言的社会政治层面重新产生了兴趣，尽管现在它更倾向于关注城市贫民，因此焦点在于纽梅尔所称的对乔姆斯基语言学的“道德批判”。6批评的声音有很多种，但都集中在该项目对英语数据、内省以及将整个领域锁定在象牙塔中的强调上：

Even the moral implications of Chomsky’s work—or, rather, the lack of them—were under attack, many people noting the irony that one of America’s premier social critics avoided the social aspects of language like a case of the hives. American linguistics prior to Chomsky had long been a field with a social conscience—in a real sense, it was born out of a social conscience—most notably in its approach to indigenous languages. In the late Bloomfieldian period, this conscience had atrophied somewhat. With Chomsky, it withered away to nothing: If linguistics is a branch of cognitive psychology, its relevance for social issues is negligible at best. But the sixties and seventies saw a renewed interest in the sociopolitical dimensions of language, though now it tended to focus more on the urban poor, and with that focus came what Newmeyer calls “the moral critique” of Chomskyan linguistics.6 The criticism had a number of reflexes, but revolved around the program’s emphasis on English data, on introspection, and on the resultant ivory tower into which it locked the field:

世界上绝大多数语言学家几乎只研究自己的语言——英语，这在参与者看来是深入了解所有语言基本结构的源泉。撇开日益明显的方法论困难不谈，我们必须考虑到，对许多其他社区，包括美洲印第安人社区来说，这种集中研究充其量只是民族中心主义的表现，最坏的情况则是敌对的背弃。……许多形式语言学的参与者在社会观点上是自由派或激进派，但他们的方法论承诺使他们无法处理他们所关心的社区的部分问题。（Hymes，1974b：21-22；Hymes 并非巧合地是一位民族学语言学家，对前乔姆斯基主义抱有某种忠诚）。

The almost exclusive study of their own language, English, by so large a proportion of the world’s linguists, has seemed to the participants a source of deepening insight into the underlying structure of all languages. Leaving aside the methodological difficulties that have become increasingly apparent, we must consider that to many other communities, including those of American Indians, such a concentration may seem an expression of ethnocentrism at best, a hostile turning of the back at worst. … Many participants in formal linguistics are liberal or radical in social views, and yet their methodological commitments prevent them from dealing with part of the problems of the communities of concern to them. (Hymes, 1974b:21–22; Hymes, not coincidentally, is an ethnological linguist with some pre-Chomskyan allegiances).

二十世纪六七十年代的社会风气对这种对乔姆斯基的攻击方式极为接受，许多人发现它很有说服力，因为他们认为，转换语法最主要的资金来源——美国军方也为其提供了额外的支持。

The social climate of the sixties and seventies was extremely receptive to this style of attack on Chomsky, and many people found it very telling, seeing additional support for it in the overwhelmingly predominant funding source for transformational grammar, the U.S. military.

随后，阿斯莱夫又发起了更多攻击。他猛烈抨击乔姆斯基，指责他声称自己有笛卡尔思想根源，也抨击他的学识和诚实（1970；1971）。7格雷谴责乔姆斯基的理想化和形式主义中存在着“爱丽丝梦游仙境”的现象（1974:5），以及他的“优先次序颠倒”（1976:38）和他作品中的“智力欺诈”（1977:70）。马赫抨击乔姆斯基的学派——MITniks、MITnik 神话、MITnik 方法、一般 MITology 和各种 MITnikia（1973a:passim）。德温对乔姆斯基的修辞术发起了长达一本书的攻击，尤其对他的成功感到困惑，“尽管他的关键论点包括完全似是而非的、主要无关的，甚至是彻头彻尾的错误”（1973:222）。8其他书籍也纷纷加入进来：科尔纳（Koerner，1975 年）、罗宾逊（Robinson，1975 年）、哈热格（Hagège，1981 [1976]）和安蒂拉（Anttila）在一篇万能的反乔姆斯基长篇大论中，赞扬了这些不断增多的攻击：

There were more attacks. Aarsleff jumped all over Chomsky’s claims to Cartesian roots, and his scholarship, and his honesty (1970; 1971).7 Gray denounced the “Alice in Wonderland state of affairs” in Chomsky’s idealizations and formalisms (1974:5), and his “inversion of priorities” (1976:38), and the “intellectual fraud” of his work (1977:70). Maher railed against Chomsky’s school—MITniks, MITnik myths, MITnik methods, general MITology, and sundry MITnikia (1973a:passim). Derwing launched a book-length assault on Chomsky’s rhetoric, puzzling in particular over his success “despite key arguments which include the fully specious, the mainly irrelevant, and even the out-and-out false” (1973:222).8 Other books joined in: Koerner (1975), Robinson (1975), Hagège (1981 [1976]), and Anttila, in an all-purpose, anti-Chomskyan harangue, celebrated these proliferating assaults:

目前，许多批评都针对转换生成语法及其各种分支。这并不意味着无辜者遭到团伙的残酷攻击，而是他们确实是真正的罪犯，使学术讨论跌至历史最低点。（Antilla，1975：172）

So much of the current criticism is directed against transformational-generative grammar and its various offshoots. It does not mean that an innocent is brutally drawn under gang attack, but that they are indeed real offenders who have brought scholarly discourse to an all-time low. (Antilla, 1975:172)

但这些攻击几乎不能安慰生成语义学家。正如安蒂拉的喜悦所表明的那样，在 70 年代，受到攻击的不仅是乔姆斯基，还有乔姆斯基主义的一切，尤其是他以前关系密切的追随者之间爆发的争吵。马希尔抱怨说“每个 MITnik 都是修正主义者”（1973b:30），而塔尔米·吉翁则在幕后嘀咕着一门学科正在走向地狱，“充斥着时尚、派系斗争和兄弟相残”（1979:xiv）。

But there was little in these attacks to comfort generative semanticists. As Anttila’s joy indicates, it was not only Chomsky, but all things Chomskyan, coming under attack in the seventies, especially the squabble that had broken out among his formerly close-ranked followers. Maher complained that “every MITnik is a revisionist” (1973b:30), and Talmy Givón muttered from the wings about a discipline going to hell in a handcart, “rife with fads, factionalism, and fratricide” (1979:xiv).

一些观察者肯定对这场争论感到高兴。塞尔注意到，一些布卢姆菲尔德主义者“看到他们的对手互相争斗时高兴得搓着手”（1972:20），而且他们并不孤单。相当多的心理学家和哲学家对乔姆斯基失去昔日弟子青睐感到高兴。乔姆斯基谴责了斯金纳，但无法用任何适合构建问题的东西来取代他的研究计划（他拒绝了行为主义，但没有给心理学家一些他们可以轻易说是的东西乔姆斯基的革命影响深远，不禁在它所涉及的领域激起认知失调。除了这种自然的失调外，许多革命者还傲慢自大，因此不可避免地会有学者在幕后等待内部不和的迹象，而且他们会非常乐意为此而欢呼。

A few observers were surely pleased by the dispute. Searle noticed some of the Bloomfieldians “rubbing their hands in glee at the sight of their adversaries fighting each other” (1972:20), and they weren’t alone. A fair number of psychologists and philosophers were pleased at Chomsky’s fall from the graces of his erstwhile disciples. Chomsky had denounced Skinner, but had not been able to replace his research program with anything as expedient for framing problems (he had said no to behaviorism, but hadn’t given psychologists something they could easily say yes to), and disaffected behaviorists were happy to see the revolution founder. Chomsky had also alienated many philosophers by rejecting empiricism, and some of them were happy to see him in a less angelic light. The Chomskyan revolution was far-reaching in its implications, and could not help but stir up cognitive dissonance in the fields it impinges upon. Add to this natural dissonance the arrogance with which many of the revolutionaries plied their trade, and it was inevitable that there were pockets of scholars in the wings waiting for any sign of internal discord, and that they would be plenty happy to crow about it.

但大多数旁观者，即中立且充满希望的大多数人，只是对这场争论感到沮丧。他们希望乔姆斯基的工作能让他们的生活更轻松，或者至少他们不排除他的研究对他们有价值的可能性。语言学以外的语言学者曾被告知（通常是他们自己学科中的假先知，他们对乔姆斯基的工作只有模糊的概念），乔姆斯基的框架将彻底改变他们教授西班牙语、研究小说或研究论点的方式，看到那些本应引导他们走向光明的人之间发生激烈争执，他们感到失望。

But most bystanders, the neutral and hopeful majority, were just bummed out by the dispute. They wanted Chomsky’s work to make their lives easier, or, at the least, they had not ruled out the possibility that his research would have value for them. Language scholars outside of linguistics, who had been told (usually by false prophets in their own discipline who had only vague notions of Chomsky’s work) that Chomsky’s framework would revolutionize the way they taught Spanish, or studied the novel, or examined arguments, were disappointed at the sight of a bitter feud among the people who were supposed to lead them into the light.

也就是说，争吵对学科没有帮助。争吵通常对一个领域有益，解释性与生成性之争很好地说明了这一点——它搅动了大量的知识，促进了各种观点的产生——但争吵，一种明显琐碎的追求，并不那么健康，解释性与生成性之争再次很好地说明了这一点。争吵有两个一般影响：（1）它保持一种痛苦的状态，争吵者积累越来越多的个人包袱，这几乎保证他们永远不会和解。（2）它惹恼了旁观者。他们会离开。

The bickering, that is, did not help the discipline. Fights are usually healthy for a field, and the interpretive-generative dispute illustrates this point very well—it churned up a great deal of knowledge and promoted a diverse spectrum of perspectives—but bickering, a decidedly pettier pursuit, is not so healthy, and again the interpretive-generative dispute illustrates the point very well. Bickering has two general effects: (1) It maintains a state of bitterness, the squabblers accumulating more and more personal baggage, which virtually guarantees they will never reconcile. And (2) it annoys bystanders. They move away.

生成语义变得模糊

Generative Semantics Gets Fuzzy

[生成语义学家] 已经说过很多可能很有趣且具有启发性的事情……[但是] 如果在理论真空中提出，即使是最具启发性的建议也必然会失去很大的光彩，而且…… 如果没有连贯理论的约束影响，就必然会出现各种混合的建议，从非常有启发性的到彻头彻尾愚蠢的建议。

[Generative semanticists] have said a great many potentially interesting and illuminating things.…[But] even the most illuminating suggestions are bound to lose a great deal of their light if put forward in a theoretical vacuum, and, furthermore,… without the constraining influence of a coherent theory there is bound to be a mixture of proposals, going from the brilliantly illuminating to the downright silly.

外接手奥唐纳

W. R. O’Donnell

回到语言学，生成语义学的车轮开始脱落。首先它失去了方向，然后几乎立刻就分裂成许多松散的兴趣。同样迅速的是，信心大量流失，生成语义学失效了。

Back in linguistics, the wheels were falling off generative semantics. First it lost direction, then almost immediately it fractured into a number of loosely aligned interests. Just as quickly, there was a gushing hemorrhage of confidence, and generative semantics expired.

一旦人们清楚地认识到转换语法无法像《同质语法》一书所承诺的那样优雅地处理意义，即卡茨-波斯特尔原则的强形式无法成立，这场运动就同时朝着几个方向发展。到了 20 世纪 70 年代中期，无论对手还是朋友，都不可避免地认识到，不再有一个名为生成语义学的单一野兽。它已经成为了一种庞大的野兽。最初，他们承诺将出版权威的文本。首先，罗斯和莱考夫要写一本书，《抽象语法》。然后莱考夫要写另一本自己的文本，《生成语义学》。但是新的数据和新的理论手段不断打乱他们的计划。最后，最接近权威文本的是印第安纳大学语言俱乐部的准出版物，由麦考利的学生唐纳德·弗兰茨出版，他的《生成语义学：导论》在前言中限定，它并不完全满足广告真实性的要求，而“根据弗兰茨的说法，生成语义学”可能是对其内容更合适的标记方式（1974：2）。

Once it became clear that transformational grammar could not handle meaning as elegantly as Homogeneous I had promised—that the strong form of the Katz-Postal principle could not stand—the movement went in several directions at once, and by the mid-1970s it was inescapably clear, to friend and foe alike, that there was no longer a single beast called generative semantics. It was legion. Initially, there were promises for definitive texts. First, Ross and Lakoff were to write a text, Abstract Syntax. Then Lakoff was to write another text on his own, Generative Semantics. But new data and new theoretical devices kept derailing their plans. In the end, the closest thing to a definitive text was a quasi-publication from the Indiana University Linguistic Club by one of McCawley’s students, Donald Frantz, and his Generative Semantics: An Introduction carries the qualification in its preface that it doesn’t quite meet the demands of truth-in-advertising, that Generative Semantics According to Frantz would be a more appropriate way to label its contents (1974:2).

通过快速浏览四骑士所走的路径，可以最简洁地说明 20 世纪 70 年代早期至中期生成语义学的多样性。

The diversity of generative semantics in the early-to-mid-seventies is most concisely illustrated by a quick look at the paths taken by the four horsemen.

Postal 很早就退出了该领域（大约在 1972-73 年，尽管后来发表的一些作品仍然参与生成语义学），转而与 Perlmutter 一起研究另一种形式模型，即关系语法。9这种语法理论与生成语义学既存在部分竞争，又存在部分联盟，但它对该模型的命运的影响始终是有害的（请注意，这与说它对语言学的影响是有害的相去甚远；它对该领域产生了强大的有益影响）。看起来 Postal 正在逃离一艘正在下沉的船。

Postal dismounted quite early (around 1972–73, though some later published work still participates in generative semantics), to work on an alternate formal model with Perlmutter, relational grammar.9 This grammatical theory was in partial competition, partial alliance, with generative semantics, but its effects on the fortunes of that model were uniformly detrimental (which, please note, is a long way from saying its effects on linguistics were detrimental; it has had a powerfully beneficial impact on the field). It looked like Postal was deserting a sinking ship.

罗斯进入了越来越模糊的数据领域，并开始论证说，语法范畴和语法结构之间的区别并不是种类的区别，而仅仅是程度的区别，正如迄今为止几乎所有的语法理论所处理的那样。10因此，例如，他提出，与迄今为止转换语法和几乎所有其他形式的语言分析所采用的离散方法相比，下列连续体（他称之为挤压）更能真实地捕捉其类别之间的差异（Ross，1972c：316）：11

Ross drifted into murkier and murkier realms of data, and began to argue that the distinctions among grammatical categories and constructions were not, as virtually all grammatical theory had hitherto treated them, distinctions of kind, but rather only of degree.10 So, for instance, he proposed that the following continuum (which he calls a squish) more realistically captured the differences between its categories than did the discrete approaches typical heretofore of transformational grammar, and of virtually all other forms of linguistic analysis (Ross, 1972c:316):11

动词 > 分词 > 形容词 > 介词 > 名词

Verb > Participle > Adjective > Preposition > Noun

因此，有些词有点像动词；其他词有点像名词，在它们之间还有动词性名词（通常称为介词）和名词性动词（通常称为分词），以及一堆雌雄同体动词（称为形容词）。这些新的分类都嵌入在非常微妙的争论中，在很大程度上取决于个人直觉和非常非正式的调查，涉及有争议或探索不足的过程的相互作用，并依靠隐喻：

So, some words were sort-of, kind-of verbs; others were sort-of, kind-of nouns, and in between them were verby nouns, usually called prepositions, and nouny verbs, usually called participles, and a bunch of hermaphrodites called adjectives. These new sort-of classifications all came embedded in a mesh of very subtle arguments, depending heavily on personal intuition and extremely informal surveys, and involving the interaction of controversial or poorly explored processes, and leaning on metaphors:

从左到右（在动词到名词的连续体上）就是朝着句法惰性的方向前进，远离句法自由和易变性。打个比方，沿着层次前进就像下降到越来越低的温度，寒冷冻结了句法规则的生产力，直到最后到达名词，即这个空间的绝对零度。（1972c:317）

To pass from left to right [on the verb-to-noun continuum] is to move in the direction of syntactic inertness, and to move away from syntactic freedom and volatility. To wax metaphorical, proceeding along the hierarchy is like descending into lower and lower temperatures, where the cold freezes up the productivity of syntactic rules, until at last nouns, the absolute zero of this space, are reached. (1972c:317)

我们没有时间去研究这些由观察和隐喻组成的推理网格，尽管它们很吸引人，但模糊性并不突出。最大的问题是一个熟悉的问题：罗斯反复论证说，离散语法（就像所有当代的转换性工作一样，解释性和生成性语义学也一样）面临着非离散语法不会遇到的棘手问题，但他从未提出过非离散语法。事实上，罗斯从未超越关于这种语法可能是什么样子的最一般的建议。有人谈论“彻底背离以前的转换性[工作]”（1973c:138），也有人暗示冻结和“漏斗方向”（1972c:325），但没有具体的建议；Gazdar克莱因 (1978:666) 援引皮兰德娄 (Pirandello) 的话来描述他的一篇软论文，称其“不过是寻找理论的数据集合而已”。罗斯的好朋友莱考夫 (Lakoff) 比加兹达尔 (Gazdar) 和克莱因走得更远，他说“目前没有任何语法理论能够开始容纳罗斯观察到的事实”(1973b:271)。显然，莱考夫的意思是建议，但它助长了人们对罗斯知道自己要去哪里的某种不自信。没有人愿意跟随一个在黑暗中摸索的人。

We don’t have time to look at any of these reason-meshes of observation and metaphor, fascinating as they are, but squishiness was not a hit. The biggest problem was a familiar one: Ross argued repeatedly that a discrete grammar (like all contemporary transformational work, interpretive and generative semantics alike) faces intractable problems which a nondiscrete grammar would not face, but he never offered a nondiscrete grammar. Ross never, in fact, went beyond the most general suggestions about what such a grammar might look like. There is talk of a “radical departure from the previous transformational [work]” (1973c:138), and intimations of freezes and “funnel directions” (1972c:325), but no solid proposals; Gazdar and Klein (1978:666) invoke Pirandello to describe one of his squishy papers, calling it “little more than a collection of data in search of a theory.” Ross’s good buddy Lakoff went even further than Gazdar and Klein, saying “no current theory of grammar can even begin to accommodate the facts that Ross has observed” (1973b:271). Apparently, Lakoff meant this as a recommendation, but it helped breed a certain lack of confidence that Ross knew where he was going. No one is eager to follow someone who is groping around in the dark.

实际上，有一个人是这样的，但他并不太愿意追随罗斯，而是亲自带路，他就是莱考夫。他发起了一场运动，要将生成语义学改造成能够容纳挤压的东西。罗斯论点中的关键概念显然是程度的概念，莱考夫通过将来自平行学科的涉及可变性程度的思想拼接到他的程序中来进行研究；特别是，他深受埃莉诺罗施关于非离散表示心理学的工作以及洛特菲扎德在模糊集理论中的工作的影响，莱考夫从模糊集理论中为他的新方法取了模糊语法的标签。在本次讨论的背景下，这意味着我们需要简要但必然不充分地了解一个外部研究计划——实际上是两个——这种计划可以充分说明生成语义研究策略，尤其是与莱考夫相关的策略。

Actually, one person was, and he was not so much willing to follow Ross, as to lead the way himself, Lakoff. He launched a campaign to retool generative semantics into something capable of embracing squishes. The critical notion in Ross’s arguments is clearly the notion of degree, and Lakoff proceeded by way of splicing into his program ideas from parallel disciplines involving degrees of variability; in particular, he was strongly influenced by Eleanor Rosch’s work on the psychology of nondiscrete representation, and Lotfi Zadeh’s work in fuzzy set theory, from which Lakoff took the label for his new approach, fuzzy grammar. What this means, in the context of this discussion, is that we need a brief, necessarily inadequate, glance at an external research program—two, in fact—of the sort that says much about generative semantic research strategies, especially those associated with Lakoff.

Rosch 在心理表征方面的工作取决于两个相关的观察，即分类对于认知过程的首要性，以及原型在类别定义中的核心地位。简而言之，“鸟”类别有许多成员，标准生物分类法将它们区分开来。但此类分类法并没有根据“鸟类”来区分这些成员。在广泛的实验中，原型理论家已经证明了我们所有人只要稍加思考就能明白的事实，即人们认为某些鸟类（如知更鸟和麻雀）比该类别的其他成员（如鸵鸟和企鹅）更属于该类别的核心，更像鸟类。随着该类别的成员在大小、飞行能力和筑巢习惯等维度上远离原型，它们被认为越来越不像鸟类（尽管仍然是鸟类）。例如，原型效应就是为什么当被要求对橄榄进行分类时，我们大多数人会犹豫不决，但对苹果或胡萝卜却不会犹豫不决。12

Rosch’s work in mental representation hinges on two related observations, the primacy of categorization for cognitive processes, and the centrality of prototypes in the definition of categories. Briefly, the category “bird” has many members, which standard biological taxonomies distinguish among. But such taxonomies do not distinguish among those members in terms of “birdiness.” In a wide range of experiments, prototype theorists have demonstrated what is clear to all of us with a moment’s thought, that people regard some birds (like robins and sparrows) as more central to the category, more birdlike, than other members of the category (such as ostriches and penguins). As members of the category move away from the prototype on such dimensions as size, capacity for flight, and nesting habits, they are perceived as less and less birdlike (though still birds). Prototype effects are why, for instance, most of us hesitate when asked to categorize an olive, but not an apple or a carrot.12

Zadeh 的工作涉及正式的集合成员资格，而不是直接的心理类别，但显然使用了相同的程度概念。考虑一个像高个子人的集合这样的集合。身高显然是一个相对概念。有些人显然很高（比如，超过七英尺）；有些人显然不高（比如，五英尺以下）；许多人介于两者之间。此外，对身高的估计因性别、年龄、种族、职业以及其他几个变量而异；对于骑师来说很高的人的身高会比对于篮球中锋来说很高的人的身高低得多。因此，Zadeh 建议集合成员资格不是二元概念，而是按程度分配；比如，0 到 1 之间的实数。这样，​​Leila 很高这个命题在绝对意义上不是真或假，而是在某种定量程度上为真（比如，0.38）。讨论中的所有说法都使 Zadeh 的工作看起来非常不正式；事实上，它已经达到了很好的精度，代表了一个非常富有成果的研究项目，特别是在人工智能知识表示方面。十三

Zadeh’s work concerns formal set membership, rather than mental categories directly, but the same notion of degree is clearly at play. Consider a collection like the set of tall people. Tallness clearly is a relative notion. Some people are obviously tall (say, those over seven feet); some people are obviously not tall (say, those under five feet); many people fall in between. Moreover, estimations of tallness vary by gender, age, race, occupation, and perhaps several other variables; the height of someone who is tall for a jockey would be much lower than the height of someone who is tall for a basketball center. Zadeh proposes that set membership, accordingly, not be a binary notion, but be assigned by degrees; say, a real number between 0 and 1. In this way, the proposition that Leila is tall would not be true or false in an absolute sense, but true to some quantitative degree (say, 0.38). All of the says in this discussion make Zadeh’s work look very informal; in fact, it has achieved a good measure of precision, and represents a very fruitful research program, particularly in artificial knowledge representation.13

Lakoff 发表了许多融合了 Rosch 和 Zadeh 的研究成果——事实上，这些研究现在已成为他研究的重点（见 Lakoff，1987）——但这种方法的主要论文是对语言模糊限制语的分析，例如sort of和pretty much（1973d [1972]）。他对 1 中的陈述的真实性进行了分析，表明它们的真值从 la（绝对真实）移动到 le（绝对错误），经过几个中间程度：

Lakoff published a number of investigations blending Rosch and Zadeh’s work—and, in fact, such investigations have now become a focal point of his research (see Lakoff, 1987)—but the principal paper on this approach is an analysis of linguistic hedges, like sort of and pretty much (1973d [1972]). He offered analyses of the truth of such statements as those in 1, suggesting that their truth values move from la, which is absolutely true, to le, which is absolutely false, through several intermediate degrees:

1

1

a 知更鸟是一种鸟。

a A robin is a bird.

 

 

b 鸡是一种鸟。

b A chicken is a bird.

 

 

c 企鹅是一种鸟。

c A penguin is a bird.

 

 

d 蝙蝠是一种鸟。

d A bat is a bird.

 

 

e 牛是一只鸟。

e A cow is a bird.

 

 

（Lakoff，1973d[1972]：223）

(Lakoff, 1973d [1972]:223)

然后，他绘制了某些对冲词和强化词（有时称为程度词）对这些句子真值的影响的图表：

Then, he charted the interaction of certain hedges and intensifiers (sometimes called degree words) on the truth values of such sentences:

2

2

知更鸟是一种鸟（错误——毫无疑问，它是鸟）

a A robin is sort of a bird, (false—it is a bird, no question about it)

 

 

b 鸡是一种鸟，（正确，或非常接近正确）

b A chicken is sort of a bird, (true, or very close to true)

 

 

c 企鹅是一种鸟，（正确，或接近正确）

c A penguin is sort of a bird, (true, or close to true)

 

 

d 蝙蝠是一种鸟，（几乎是错误的）

d A bat is sort of a bird, (pretty close to false)

 

 

e 牛是一种鸟，（错误）

e A cow is sort of a bird, (false)

 

 

（Lakoff, 1973d[1972]:234；真理判断是他的）

(Lakoff, 1973d [1972]:234; the truth judgments are his)

拉科夫的引入练习的整个目的是研究如何将这些观察结果运用到语法理论中，部分是为了帮助理解罗斯的模糊材料。但他并没有取得很大进展。他提出了一个粗略的逻辑框架来处理模糊限制语的语义，并恰当地对其进行了实质性的模糊限制语处理（简而言之，他将模糊限制语视为谓词修饰语，它以原则性的方式影响命题的真实程度）。14

The whole point of Lakoff’s importing exercise is to investigate ways of putting such observations to work in grammatical theory, in part to help make sense out of Ross’s squishy material. But he doesn’t get very far. He proposes a rough sketch of logical apparatus for treating the semantics of hedges, and, appropriately, he hedges it substantially (briefly, he treats hedges as predicate modifiers which affect the degree of truth assigned to the proposition in principled ways).14

模糊性并不是 Lakoff 在 70 年代中期所研究的全部。他还在探索如何将 HP Grice 关于对话的非正式工作纳入正式语法，研究句法混合体和语言格式塔，并普遍研究语用学，并在“自然逻辑”的口号下扩展他对逻辑的研究，以至于他呼吁提出“数百甚至数千个”概念（Parret，1974 [1972]：162）。15拉科夫非常忙碌。

And fuzziness was not all Lakoff was up to in the mid-seventies. He was also exploring ways to incorporate H. P. Grice’s informal work on conversations into formal grammar, looking at syntactic amalgams, and linguistic gestalts, and generally investigating pragmatics, and expanding his investigations of logic, under the slogan of “natural logic” to the point where he was calling for “hundreds, perhaps thousands more” concepts (Parret, 1974 [1972]:162).15 Lakoff was very busy.

麦考利也很忙，但他的工作方式低调而清醒。在辩论初期，他提出了一些最有力的理论论点，主要围绕通过将句法和语义视为单一现象来降低复杂性这一主题。但麦考利在 70 年代初放弃了这种元理论方法，转而从事更具体的工作，这种方法的转变反映了他有意识地决定在科学上更加负责任（他是这场争论中最负责任的科学家，紧随其后的是杰肯多夫）：专注于对解释主义者的尖锐批评以及将生成语义学原理应用于具体现象。他在 70 年代的工作只是假设了生成语义学，而不是像他之前的波斯特尔那样支持它下马）或庆祝它（就像 Lakoff 一直做的那样），尽管直到 90 年代末他才明确表达了自己的动机：

McCawley was busy, too, but in a much more low-key and clearheaded way. Early in the debates, he advanced some of the strongest theoretical arguments, largely around the theme of reducing complexity by treating syntax and semantics as a unitary phenomenon. But McCawley dropped this meta-theoretical approach in the early seventies to pursue more specific work, a shift in approach reflecting his conscious decision to be more responsible scientifically (and he was, with Jackendoff a close second, the most responsible scientist of the dispute): to concentrate on trenchant critiques of the interpretivists and on the application of generative semantics principles to specific phenomena. His work in the seventies simply assumed generative semantics, rather than championing it (as Postal had before he dismounted) or celebrating it (as Lakoff always did), though he didn’t make his motives clear until the end of the decade:

我并不是想通过 [假设而不是明确推销生成语义学] 来表明我太傲慢了，以至于认为我和其他“生成语义学家”就句法和语义的统一性所提出的主张的所有争议都已经对我们有利地解决了。相反，我只是认为，为了使这些问题的进一步讨论富有成效，争论者需要对相关事实领域有比他们（包括我自己）在 1970 年左右所拥有的更广泛和更深入的理解。（1979：viii）

I do not mean to suggest by [assuming, rather than explicitly marketing, generative semantics] that I am so arrogant as to regard all the controversies over claims I and other ‘generative semanticists’ have made about the unity of syntax and semantics as having been settled in our favor. Rather, I simply think that for further discussion of these questions to be productive, the disputants need a much broader and deeper understanding of the relevant factual areas than any of them (myself included) had around 1970. (1979: viii)

他孜孜不倦地努力“用更详细、更少轶事依据的建议来取代我早期著作中关于语法与逻辑结构和词汇的关系的笼统而往往轻率的概括”（1979：viii）。

He worked assiduously to replace “the sweeping and often rash generalizations in my earlier work about the relationship of grammar to logical structure and the lexicon by more detailed proposals whose backing is less anecdotal” (1979:viii).

简而言之，麦考利在 70 年代的大部分时间里都在为句法语义学的争论而努力。特别是，他遵循波斯特尔的还原主义方案来寻找原子范畴；例如，他主张时态（1976b [1971]：257-72）和非（1976b [1971]：277-84）是基础动词，并为罗斯的情态动词分析辩护（1979 [1975]：96-100）。最终，这条路线非常接近现代原子的路径，麦考利最终认为，毕竟，最深层次的句法范畴是不存在的，它们是由更小的粒子组成的（1982b [1979]：200）。他这一时期最臭名昭著的主张是，英语的底层词序并非如哈里斯以来所假设的那样，是规范表面词序（主语-谓语-宾语）的反映，而更像是波兰符号符号逻辑（动词-主语-宾语）（1976b [1970]:211–28）。这一论点被许多反抽象主义者视为一种无意识的归谬法，它明确、合理地将简单性应用于转换语法的组织：

McCawley, in short, spent most of the seventies buttering syntactico-semantic parsnips. In particular, he followed Postal’s reductionist program to find the atomic categories; arguing, for instance, that tense (1976b [1971]:257–72) and not (1976b [1971]:277–84) were underlying verbs, and defending Ross’s analysis of modals (1979 [1975]:96–100). Eventually, this line followed the path of the modern atom very closely, and McCawley finally argued that there were no syntactic categories at the deepest level after all, that they were composites of smaller particles yet (1982b [1979] :200). His most notorious claim from this period was that the underlying word order of English, was not, as had been assumed since Harris, a reflection of the canonical surface order, subject-verb-object, but more like Polish-notation symbolic logic, verb-subject-object (1976b [1970]:211–28). The argument, regarded as something of an unwitting reductio by many anti-abstractionists, is a clear, well-reasoned application of simplicity to the organization of transformational grammar:

在我认为必须属于循环的 15 种英语变换中，有 10 种变换无论应用于谓语 [动词] 优先还是谓语次之的结构都没有显著差异……对于其余五种循环变换，底层成分顺序对变换适用条件的复杂性或其效果有显著影响。在每种情况下，假定谓语优先顺序的变换版本都明显更简单，因为它涉及的基本操作更少，或者适用于无需使用变换规则中出现的更奇特的符号设备即可表述的条件。（1976b [1970]：217）

Of the 15 transformations of English that I can argue must be in the cycle, there are ten for which it makes no significant difference whether they apply to structures with predicate [verb] first or predicate second…. For the remaining five cyclic transformations, the underlying constituent order makes a significant difference in the complexity of the conditions under which the transformation applies, or in its effect. In each case, the version of the transformation that assumes predicate-first order is significantly simpler in the sense of either involving fewer elementary operations or applying under conditions which can be stated without the use of the more exotic notational devices that have figured in transformational rules. (1976b [1970]:217)

采用深层的动词-主语-宾语顺序不会使转换复杂化，反而会完全简化三分之一的转换。VSO 假设被大多数生成论者采纳（尽管 Newmeyer 未采纳），并被所有解释论者拒绝：这是预期的模式。16

Adopting a deep verb-subject-object order complicates no transformations, and simplifies fully a third of them. The VSO hypothesis was adopted by most generativists (though not Newmeyer) and rejected by all interpretivists: the expected pattern.16

但是，当然，麦考利的 VSO 假设与生成语义无关。虽然它使乔姆斯基一些更受推崇的工作假设（特别是，存在一个潜在的动词短语）变得复杂，但它与解释性语义成分完全兼容——以及“不是动词”、“时态是动词”或“句法类别不是原始”的立场。McCawley 在 70 年代所做的分析工作，虽然是以生成语义学的名义进行的，但更确切地说，是抽象语法。抽象语法已不受欢迎。它几乎被解释主义者全盘否定，因为它与词汇主义假设不相容，但其他生成语义学家似乎也不太喜欢它。Lakoff 正在研究一切，但 Ross 则在研究模糊的数据。Robin Lakoff 出版了重要的早期著作《抽象语法和拉丁语补语》（1968 年），他已经基本变成了一名普通的语言哲学家。除了 McCawley 和他的一些学生（最著名的是 Judith Levi 和 Georgia Green），抽象转换分析已经走上了核心的道路。

But, of course, McCawley’s VSO hypothesis has nothing to do with generative semantics. While it complicates some of Chomsky’s more cherished working assumptions (in particular, that there is an underlying verb phrase), it is fully compatible with an interpretive semantic component—along with the position that not is a verb, or that tense is a verb, or that syntactic categories are not primitive. Much of McCawley’s analytical work in the seventies, although conducted under the flag of generative semantics, was, more properly, abstract syntax. And abstract syntax was out of favor. It had been rejected virtually wholesale by the interpretivists, since it was incompatible with the lexicalist hypothesis, but other generative semanticists appeared to have little use for it either. Lakoff was working on everything but. Ross was wading in squishy data. Robin Lakoff, who published the important early book, Abstract Syntax and Latin Complementation (1968), had pretty much evolved into an ordinary language philosopher. Aside from McCawley and a few of his students (most notably, Judith Levi and Georgia Green), abstract transformational analyses had gone the way of the kernel.

到了七十年代中期：Postal 消失了；罗斯深陷于模糊的数据中；莱考夫一如既往地富有创造力和大胆，但却不会静坐（无论是比喻还是字面意义上）让其他语言学家对他的工作进行修正；而麦考利已经跟不上时代的步伐。

By the mid-seventies: Postal was gone; Ross was hip-deep in murky data; Lakoff was as inventive and daring as ever, but wouldn’t sit still long enough (figuratively or literally) for other linguists to get a fix on his work; and McCawley was out of step with the times.

精神适得其反

The Ethos Backfires

我只向上帝祈祷过一次，而且是一次很短的祈祷：“主啊，让我的敌人变得可笑吧。”上帝答应了。

I have never made but one prayer to God, and a very short one: ‘O Lord, make my enemies ridiculous.’ And God granted it.

伏尔泰

Voltaire

由于没有一个明确的中心，而且随着时代的变迁（抗议被淘汰，迪斯科舞厅兴起），生成语义学的许多识别特征都成了负担，而乔姆斯基声誉的下滑并没有给他们带来好处。大多数评论家认为他们甚至比他们以前的大师还要糟糕。生成语义学和解释语义学之间的争吵当然伤害了双方，但吵闹的生成语义学家更容易成为攻击目标。对于格雷来说，“与年轻一代的逻辑语言学斯大林主义者相比，乔姆斯基听起来很像托洛茨基（特别是引用麦考利的话）”（1974:4），而哈热则​​抱怨说“生成语义学的倡导者只是延长了已经存在的程序，将其扩大到漫画的地步”，他发现乔姆斯基的作品令人厌恶（1981[1976]:83）。马希尔充分发泄了他对大写字母的迷恋，他认为最糟糕的 MITnik 是“在 LSA、CLS 和其他 TG 俱乐部会议上以学术论文形式发表的无数滑稽幼稚作品的作者”，尤其是“QPhD [Quang Phuc Dong] 的学生 Binnick、Morgan 和 Green”（1973b:30）。

Without a defining center, and with the times changing (protests were out, discotheques were in), many of generative semantics’ identifying traits became liabilities, and Chomsky’s reputational ebb did not benefit them. Most commentators found them to be even worse than their former master. The generative-interpretive squabble certainly hurt both sides, but the boisterous generative semanticists were a much easier target. For Gray, “Chomsky sounds quite Trotskyish compared to the logicolinguistic Stalinists of the younger generation [specifically citing McCawley]” (1974:4), and Hagège complained that “the promoters of generative semantics have only prolonged, extending them to the point of caricature, [the] already existing procedures” he found repugnant in Chomsky’s work (1981[1976]:83). Maher, giving full vent to his fetish for capital letters, identifies the worst MITniks as the authors of “innumerable facetious pieces of juvenilia presented as scholarly papers at LSA, CLS, and other TG club meetings,” particularly “QPhD’s [Quang Phuc Dong’s] pupils Binnick, Morgan, and Green” (1973b:30).

Maher 的抱怨中幼稚的部分主要与生成语义学工作中充斥的疯狂幽默有关，这导致许多语言学家得出结论，缺乏严肃性的原因比风格更深。例如，O'Donnell (1974:75) 就嗤之以鼻，“正如 [Lakoff] 所言，严肃的语法研究可能还处于起步阶段，但严肃的语法学家却并非如此。”但这种幽默还有另一个问题。它往往相当狭隘地针对其他生成语义学家。它不是邀请性的；Robin Lakoff 称她所在社区的典型风格为“一种秘密握手”(1989:977)。这种邀请性失败的最糟糕例子是 Lakoff (1971b) 的一篇重要文章，该文章是对 Chomsky 的“深层结构、表面结构和语义交互”的回应。解释。”出版环境非常紧张，拉科夫决定模仿乔姆斯基：

The juvenilia in Maher’s complaint had mostly to do with the loony humor infusing generative semantic work, which was leading many linguists to the conclusion that lack of seriousness ran deeper than style. O’Donnell (1974:75), for instance, sniffs “serious grammatical studies may, as [Lakoff] claims, be in their infancy: serious grammarians, however, are not.” But there was another problem with the humor. It tended to be directed, rather narrowly, toward other generative semanticists. It was not invitational; Robin Lakoff calls the characteristic style of her community “a kind of secret handshake” (1989:977). The most disastrous example of this invitational failing is in a major article by Lakoff (1971b), written as a reply to Chomsky’s “Deep Structure, Surface Structure, and Semantic Inter pretation.” The publication circumstances were very tight, and Lakoff decided to parody Chomsky:

乔姆斯基在 Steinberg 和 Jakobovits 合著的论文集《深层结构》中抨击了生成语义学。丹尼·斯坦伯格打电话给我，问我是否想写一篇回复。我说“当然可以”。他说“好吧，你有一个月的时间。”

Chomsky wrote this paper [“Deep Structure”] attacking generative semantics, for a collection by Steinberg and Jakobovits [1971]. Danny Steinberg called me up and asked me if I wanted to write a reply. I said “Sure.” And he said “Well, you have a month.”

我看了看这篇论文。这是一篇很长的论文。它充满了断章取义的言论，以及对我们立场的错误描述。我有一个月的时间来回复它。我不知道该如何处理它，所以我决定写一篇模仿文章。我采用了他自己的风格，并试图用这种风格来对付他。显然，他从未意识到这是一篇模仿文章。17

I looked at this thing. It was this huge paper. It was full of quotes taken out of context, and characterizations of our position that were really wrong. I had a month to reply to it. I didn’t know how to deal with it, so I decided to write a parody. I took his own style, and tried to turn the style against him. Apparently, he never realized that it was a parody.17

讽刺总是会忽略某些人——如果文学批评家有这样的人，这将是讽刺定律之一——毫无疑问，至少在这篇讽刺作品中，乔姆斯基就是其中之一。他完全没有意识到这是一篇戏仿作品，而是热烈欢迎莱科夫的论文，因为“只做了一些改动，就采用了[‘深层结构’]的总体框架和术语，这样[解释性]语义学和生成性语义学之间的差异就可以相对容易地识别出来”(1972b[1969]:134)。事实上，乔姆斯基没有注意到这个笑话，这成为一些生成语义学家笑料的来源，表明他们的对手是多么的缺乏幽默感。18但这个笑话很容易被忽视。一旦这篇论文被认定为对《深层结构》的恶搞，它就会变得非常有效。19然而，Lakoff 完全没有将他的论文标记为拙劣模仿。标题“论生成语义学”是严肃的，事实上，它承诺对 Lakoff 所倡导的运动进行相当明确的处理。文本中没有任何东西如此离谱以至于提供明确的线索。Lakoff 显然认为“句子的语义表示 SR”的以下定义明显是荒谬的（攻击 Jackendoff 在《语义解释》中发表的那种工作）：

Satire always misses some people—if literary critics had such things, this would be one of the Ironic Laws—and there is no question but that Chomsky, for this satire at least, was one of those people. He completely failed to recognize the parody, welcoming Lakoff’s paper warmly for having adopted, “with only a few changes, the general framework and terminology of [“Deep Structure”], so that the differences between [interpretive] and generative semantics, as so conceived, can be identified with relative ease” (1972b [1969]:134). Chomsky’s missing the joke, in fact, became the source of chuckles for some generative semanticists, showing just how irredeemably humorless their opponent was.18 But it was an easy joke to miss. Once the paper is identified as a parody of “Deep Structure,” it is extremely effective.19 Lakoff, however, completely fails to flag his paper as a parody. The title—“On Generative Semantics”—is serious, and, in fact, promises a rather definitive treatment of the movement Lakoff was advocating. Nothing in the text is so outrageous as to provide an unequivocal clue. Lakoff apparently regarded the following definition of “the semantic representation SR of a sentence” as patently absurd (attacking the sort of work Jackendoff published in Semantic Interpretation):

SR = (P 1 , PR, Top, F,…)，其中 [P 1是推导中的第一个短语标记，] PR 是预设的连词，Top 是句子主题的指示，F 是句子焦点的指示。我们暂不讨论是否还有其他元素或语义表征需要考虑[因此，公式末尾有省略号]（197lb:234–35）

SR = (P1, PR, Top, F,…), where [P1 is the first phrase marker in a derivation,] PR is a conjunction of presuppositions, Top is an indication of the topic of the sentence, and F is the indication of the focus of the sentence. We leave open the question of whether there are other elements or semantic representations that need to be accounted for [hence, the ellipses at the end of the formula] (197lb:234–35)

但是，如果不知道 Lakoff 的意图，这个定义只会让他看起来像一个狂热的语义帝国主义者，这是大多数解释语义学家对他的看法，也是许多旁观者对一般转换语法学家的看法。这个提议并不比 Lakoff 不久后认真提倡的提议奇怪多少。20这篇论文的大部分内容也写得非常冷淡，尤其是开篇几页，直到文章的后面，当 Lakoff 开始提出 [± PEDRO ] 这样的规则特征时，才有确凿的迹象表明作者不仅生来就平淡无奇，而且是故意平淡无奇；在此之前，将作者在风格上视为乔姆斯基的克隆人（无论他们有何不同）而不是戏仿者更为合理。即使是例句也非常克制，突出地突出了乔姆斯基的约翰。

But without knowing Lakoff’s intention, the definition just makes him look like a wild-eyed semantic imperialist, a conception most interpretive semanticists already held of him, and one that many spectators held of transformational grammarians in general. Nor is this proposal much stranger than the one that Lakoff was seriously advocating soon afterward.20 Much of the paper is also written utterly deadpan, particularly the opening pages, and it is not until late in the article, when Lakoff starts proposing rule features like [± PEDRO] that there is a solid hint the author is not simply drab by constitution, but drab by choice; until that point, it is more reasonable to regard the author stylistically as a clone of Chomsky, whatever their differences, than a parodist. Even the sample sentences are very restrained, prominently featuring Chomsky’s John.

更成问题的是，这篇论文没有直接表明它是对《深层结构》的具体回应，这至少会让读者注意到乔姆斯基论文中被嘲笑的段落和术语。而《论生成性“语义学” 包含一种比任何东西都更能掩盖讽刺的成分，即大量的严肃讨论，而这些讨论往往无法与假笑区分开来。例如，刚刚引用的段落包括一个脚注，讨论了将公式简化为 (P 1 , PR) 的可能性，这正是人们所希望的。同样，考虑一下 Lakoff 在介绍“基本理论”一词时加入的这种混合：

More problematically, the paper contains no direct indication that it is a specific reaction to “Deep Structure,” which would at least have alerted readers to the passages and terms in Chomsky’s paper that were under ridicule. And “On Generative Semantics” contains the one ingredient that muffles irony better than anything, a good deal of serious discussion, which is frequently impossible to disentangle from the smirking. The passage just quoted, for instance, includes a footnote discussing the possibility of reducing the formula to (P1, PR), precisely what one would desire. Similarly, consider this admixture in Lakoff’s introduction of the term, basic theory:

我将上述语法理论称为“基本理论”，这只是为了方便，无意暗示该理论在本体论、心理学或概念上有什么基本内容。生成语义学的大部分工作都采用了基本理论的框架。应该注意的是，基本理论允许多种以前理论所认为无法实现的选项。例如，不假设词汇插入转换适用于块，中间没有非词汇转换。词汇和非词汇转换可以交错的选项尚未确定。（1971b:236）

I will refer to the above theory of grammar as a ‘basic theory’, simply for convenience and with no intention of suggesting there is anything ontologically, psychologically, or conceptually basic about this theory. Most of the work in generative semantics has assumed the framework of the basic theory. It should be noted that the basic theory permits a variety of options that were assumed to be unavailable to previous theories. For example, it is not assumed that lexical insertion transformations apply in a block, with no intervening nonlexical transformations. The option that lexical and nonlexical transformations may be interspersed is left open. (1971b:236)

在某些方面，这段文字非常巧妙。它嘲笑乔姆斯基使用标签来贬低或抬高概念和理论（分类语言学、深层结构、标准理论、扩展标准理论），同时抗议标签只是解释的便利，完全没有评价含义。21本文对乔姆斯基对标准理论的“深层结构”定义进行了尖锐的批评，使得词汇学假说等相当激进的改变自然地落入其范围。也许甚至还对乔姆斯基在《一些经验问题》（1972b [1969]：130-36）中更为广泛的定义进行了嘲讽，他通过后门将输出条件偷偷带入标准理论。但它也包括一些关于生成语义学的重要信息；即词汇和非词汇转换是交织在一起的，因此不存在与Aspects的深层结构平行的分析层次。本文还充满了对合法生成语义学立场的论证：语义学和句法密不可分，全局规则是必要的理论工具，词汇插入必须遵循某些转换，乔姆斯基传统的元素是任意的，应该被废除。人们通常也不会从戏仿内部明确地攻击戏仿的对象——戏仿必须通过揭露潜在的荒谬性来间接地发挥作用，而不是通过直接攻击——而拉科夫的论文包含许多对乔姆斯基的直接攻击。

In some ways, the passage is very deft. It mocks Chomsky’s use of labels to disparage or elevate concepts and theories (taxonomic linguistics, deep structure, standard theory, extended standard theory), all the while protesting that the labels are mere expository conveniences, wholly without evaluative implications.21 It makes a barbed comment on Chomsky’s “Deep Structure” definition of the standard theory in such a way as to allow quite radical changes, like the lexicalist hypothesis, to fall naturally within its scope. Perhaps there is even a specific sneer at Chomsky’s still broader definition in “Some Empirical Issues” (1972b [1969]:130–36), where he sneaks output conditions into the standard theory through the back door. But it also includes some important information about generative semantics; namely, that lexical and nonlexical transformations are interspersed, and consequently that there is no level of analysis parallel to Aspects’ deep structure. The paper is also full of arguments for legitimate generative semantic positions: that semantics and syntax are inextricably intertwined, that global rules are necessary theoretical tools, that lexical insertion has to follow some transformations, that elements of the Chomskyan tradition are arbitrary and should be scrapped. Nor does one generally attack the object of the parody explicitly from within the parody—parody has to do its work indirectly, by exposing latent absurdities, not by direct attack—and Lakoff’s paper contains many direct assaults on Chomsky.

无论如何，除了内部生成语义学圈子之外，几乎没有人能理解这个笑话，它的影响同样是有害的，它对 70 年代早期争论中沟通不畅的贡献不亚于任何一篇论文。例如，霍华德·麦克雷 (Howard Maclay) 对乔姆斯基和莱科夫论文的介绍性讨论，对莱科夫的论文信以为真（暂停评论说“[莱科夫论文] 的论证结构模仿乔姆斯基的程度相当惊人”—1971:178），然后试图纠正莱科夫对乔姆斯基的错误表述，莱科夫实际上是在间接说明他认为是乔姆斯基的修辞狡猾。22争论的旁观者通常把《论生成语义学》看作是连贯性丧失的主要标志——最引人注目的是 Dubois-Charlier (1972:43) 对“这个问题的矛盾之处……”的评论。乔姆斯基和拉科夫最终都同时指出，这两种理论是相同的（符号变体），但对方的理论是错误的！”23

In any case, almost no one beyond the inner generative semantics circle appears to have gotten the joke, and its effect was uniformly deleterious, contributing as much as any individual paper could to the communication breakdown that characterized the dispute in the early seventies. Howard Maclay’s introductory discussion of Chomsky’s and Lakoff’s papers, for instance, takes Lakoff’s at face value (pausing to remark that “the extent to which the structure of argumentation in [Lakoff’s paper] is modeled on Chomsky is quite striking”—1971:178), and then attempts to straighten Lakoff out for misrepresenting Chomsky in a passage where Lakoff is in fact obliquely illustrating what he takes to be Chomsky’s rhetorical sneakiness.22 Spectators to the dispute generally took “On Generative Semantics” as a principal sign of the departure of coherence—illustrated most strikingly by Dubois-Charlier’s (1972:43) comments on “the paradoxical aspect of the matter … that both Chomsky and Lakoff end up by saying at the same time that the two theories are identical [notational variants], but that the other’s is wrong!”23

正如莱科夫所料，《论生成语义学》很快被视为“该方法的重要宣言”（Raskin，1975：462）。它是该运动的主要人物中唯一一篇在标题中包含生成语义学的出版物，并且出现在一本非常著名的选集中。该论文的早期版本（1969b）在 CLS 会议上发表，很可能引起了热烈的反响。大多数听众都会赞同它的目的和风格。每个人都熟悉莱科夫的个性和乔姆斯基的语气，以及围绕标准理论定义的问题。即使是那次演讲的出版版本，在一个因其滑稽感而闻名的会议记录中，也可能没有引起太多混乱。但是，在厚重、沉稳的书中，与格赖斯、斯特劳森、塞尔、奎因和乔姆斯基等人的论文一起，几乎所有论文的语气都非常严肃，很难将这篇戏仿看作是对生成语义学的专心推广，而且是令人困惑的推广。在这种情况下，麦考利的斥责相当温和：

As Lakoff should have expected, “On Generative Semantics” was soon taken to be “an important manifesto of the approach” (Raskin, 1975:462). It was the only publication from any of the leading figures in the movement to include generative semantics in the title and it appeared in a very prestigious anthology. An earlier version of the paper (1969b) was presented at a CLS session, where it very likely went over splendidly. Most of the audience would have been sympathetic to both its aims and its style. Everyone would have been familiar with Lakoff’s personality and Chomsky’s tone, as well as with the issues surrounding the definition of the standard theory. Even the published version of that talk, in the proceedings of a conference becoming famous for its sense of goofiness, may not have caused much confusion. But, in a thick, staid volume, alongside papers by Grice, Strawson, Searle, Quine, and Chomsky, among many others, almost all of them very serious in tone, it is extremely difficult to take the parody as anything but a singleminded promotion of generative semantics, and a befuddled one at that. McCawley’s rebuke is rather mild in these circumstances:

拉科夫犯了这样的错误……未能充分区分他所认真提出的正确语法理论与他（部分是开玩笑地）提出的用于讨论正确和不正确理论的一般框架。（1982b [1973]：75）

Lakoff is guilty of … [a] failure to distinguish adequately between what he would seriously propose as a correct theory of grammar and what he offered (partly in jest) as a general framework for the discussion of theories both correct and incorrect. (1982b [1973]:75)

拉泽茨基还负有其他罪责。据说，1848 年，拉泽茨基在为哈布斯堡王朝夺回撒丁岛时曾告诉他的部队：“饶恕敌方将领吧——他们对我们太有用了”（Robertson，1952：354）。拉科夫就是这样一位将军。

There is other guilt on his head, too. Radzetsky is reported to have told his troops, retaking Sardinia for the Hapsburgs in 1848, “Spare the enemy generals—they are too useful to our side” (Robertson, 1952:354). Lakoff was such a general.

几年后，当卡茨和贝弗整理出纽梅尔 (1980a: 169; 1986a: 134) 所说的“对后期生成语义学的哲学含义的完美批判”时，他们将注意力集中在“莱科夫风格的生成语义学” (1976 [1974]:30)，而奥唐纳则将生成语义学的领导者描述为“莱科夫及其相关人员” (1974:54)。24在某种程度上——随着 Postal 的离开，Ross 处于边缘地位，McCawley 回避强有力的理论主张——这个角色自然而然地就由他承担了。但 Lakoff 也追求这个角色。早在 1972 年，他就根据自己的（广泛的）个人兴趣非常清楚地定义了生成语义学，很少提及 Postal、Ross 或 McCawley 的工作，并引用了他 1963 年那篇不具影响力的论文作为起点（参见 Parret，1974 [1972]：151-78）。（在这方面，他的观点只会加强。参见他最近关于逻辑形式的讨论——在 McCawley 的纪念论文集里！——其中 McCawley 只是被最粗略地提及，他自己的工作被认为是权威的，逻辑启蒙始于 1963-1992 年。）

By the time Katz and Bever put together what Newmeyer (1980a:169; 1986a:134) calls “the consummate critique of the philosophical implications of late generative semantics,” a few years later, they zeroed in on “Generative Semantics, Lakoff Style” (1976 [1974]:30), and O’Donnell describes the leaders of generative semantics as “Lakoff and those associated with him” (1974:54).24 In some degree—with Postal gone, Ross on the fringe, and McCawley avoiding strong theoretical claims—the role was his by default. But Lakoff also courted it. As early as 1972 he was defining generative semantics very clearly in terms of his own (broad) personal interests, making little reference to the work of Postal, Ross, or McCawley, and citing his uninfluential 1963 paper as the starting point (see especially Parret, 1974 [1972]:151–78). (His sentiments have only strengthened in this regard. See his recent discussion of logical form—in a festschrift for McCawley!—where McCawley is mentioned in only the most cursory way, where his own work is considered definitive, and where the logical enlightenment begins in 1963–1992.)

因此，分裂的后期阶段通常被描述为乔姆斯基与莱科夫 (或莱科夫与乔姆斯基；当时和现在，大多数语言学家都有自己偏爱的团队)。这种对比再强烈不过了。乔姆斯基用与莱科夫最臭名昭著的理论提议“全球规则”截然相反的术语来定义他 70 年代中期的计划，到 1975 年，无论莱科夫如何称呼他的工作，无论如何都不能再被称为乔姆斯基式的了。

The late stages of the schism, accordingly, are often characterized as Chomsky vs. Lakoff (or Lakoff vs. Chomsky; most linguists, then as now, have a preferred home team). The contrast could not have been stronger. Chomsky defined his mid-seventies program in terms diametric to Lakoff’s most notorious theoretical proposal, global rules, and by 1975, whatever else Lakoff called his work, it could no longer be called Chomskyan by any stretch of the term.

在莱考夫的领导下，他推广了他非常广泛的语言理论概念，以及基于限制性优点的日益一致的解释主义攻击，人们普遍认为生成语义学在理论上是混乱的，不能说不。它向影响语言的任何现象敞开大门。它采用了越来越强大的形式机制：全局派生约束、跨派生约束，甚至元跨派生约束。它被赋予了可怕的天真和笼统的主张（“我们所做的是，在很大程度上，如果不是完全的话，消除了语用学，将其简化为普通的语义学”——Lakoff，1972b：655）。它不是从逻辑中借用，而是从头开始重新设计它。它将容纳

With Lakoff at the helm, promoting his very wide conception of linguistic theory, and a growing concerted interpretivist attack based on the virtues of restrictiveness, the general perception came to be that generative semantics was theoretically promiscuous, incapable of saying no. It opened its doors to any and all phenomena impinging upon language. It adopted increasingly powerful formal mechanisms: global derivational constraints, transderivational constraints, even meta-transderivational constraints. It was given to frighteningly naive and sweeping claims (“What we have done is to largely, if not entirely, eliminate pragmatics, reducing it to garden variety semantics”—Lakoff, 1972b:655). It was out, not to borrow from logic, but to redesign it from the ground up. It was going to accommodate

不仅包括句法语义学、语音音系学、历史语言学、人类语言学等构成这个国家大多数学术项目的核心，还包括语言在社会互动、文学、仪式和宣传中的作用，以及语言与思想、言语产生和感知、语言障碍等关系的研究。（Lakoff，在 Parrett，1974 [1972]：151）

not just syntax-semantics, phonetics-phonology, historical linguistics, anthropological linguistics, etc., which form the core of most academic programs in this country, but also the role of language in social interaction, in literature, in ritual, and in propaganda, and as well the study of the relationship between language and thought, speech production and perception, linguistic disorders, etc. (Lakoff, in Parrett, 1974 [1972]:151)

人们会觉得 Lakoff 停止写这份名单更多的是因为他喘不过气来，而不是因为他的视力不够，他小心翼翼地记得在大口喘气之前要把那个东西扔进去等等。这种推理认为，Lakoff 领导下的生成语义学试图做太多事情，结果它崩溃了。这个版本的事件有很多值得推荐的地方。当然，生成语义学试图做很多事情，Lakoff 无疑是推动它发展的主要力量之一，当然，它崩溃了。它非常公开地崩溃了：理所当然的是，绝大多数生成语义学论文都包含了一些评论，例如：

One gets the impression that Lakoff stopped the list more because he ran out of breath than because he ran out of vision, carefully remembering to throw in that etc. before gulping some air. Generative semantics under Lakoff tried to do too much, this reasoning goes, and it burst at the seams. There is much to recommend this version of events. Certainly, generative semantics tried to do a great deal, and certainly Lakoff was one of the prime forces pushing at the seams, and, certainly, it burst. It burst very publicly: as a matter of course, the great majority of generative semantics papers included several comments like:

我们不得不得出这样的结论：尽管这看起来有些奇怪，但两者的相似属性无法用我们现有理论中相同的形式机制来解释。对于可能存在的任何潜在规律的解释，都必须等待更聪明的语言学家。 （ Carden，1970：189n10）

We are forced to conclude that, awkward though it may seem, the similar properties of both and each cannot be accounted for by the same formal mechanisms in our existing theory. An explanation of whatever underlying regularity there may be will have to wait for a cleverer linguist. (Carden, 1970:189n10)

和：

And:

本文旨在阐明一些非常神秘的问题。我担心我所做的只是展示哪些灯的电线太短而无法到达插座，但希望这些信息最终有助于解释这些神秘的分布。（Green，1972：93）

This paper was undertaken as an attempt to shed light on some very mysterious problems. I fear I have done little more than show which lamps have cords too short to reach the outlets, but hopefully this information will be helpful eventually in finding explanations for these mysterious distributions. (Green, 1972:93)

最能说明问题的是：

And, most tellingly:

写完一篇论文却无法对所发现的现象提供任何像样的分析或解释，这可不是什么令人满意的经历。然而，这是一次启发性的体验，而且我相信，这是一次必要的体验。（Lawler，1972：255）

It is not a very satisfactory experience to write an entire paper without being able to offer any decent analyses or explanations for the phenomena I have discovered. It is, however, an enlightening one, and I believe, a necessary one. (Lawler, 1972:255)

最后两段引文属于一种将数据贩卖倾向推向极限的流派——Gene Gragg 称这种流派为“生物特征”，并将其定义为“旨在指出某种语言理论最终必须解决的怪异现象” (1972:75) 的文章类型，但目前看来，没有任何文章能够解决这种现象。用托马斯·库恩的话来说，这个词不是怪异现象，而是异常现象，他用这个词来表示那些可能将当前范式推向崩溃边缘的数据，以及这种流派中具有开创性的文献——Postal 极具腐蚀性的地下经典著作《语言无政府主义》注释”——非常清楚地表明，这些论文正是关于范式的。第一条注释是这样开头的：

These last two quotations belong to papers which participate in a genre that pushed this data-mongering tendency to the limit—a genre that Gene Gragg calls “creature features” and defines as a type of article that “is intended to point out some oddities which a theory of … speech will eventually have to come to grips with” (1972:75), but which nothing on the horizon appears capable of treating. In Thomas Kuhn’s terms, the word is not oddities but anomalies, his word for data that strains the current paradigm, potentially to its breaking point, and the seminal document in this genre—Postal’s highly corrosive underground classic, “Linguistic Anarchy Notes”—makes it very clear that straining the paradigm is exactly what these papers are about. The first note begins:

这是一系列随机的、可能无限的交流中的第一篇，旨在毫无疑问地表明根本不存在任何语言理论。显然有无数的事实类型无法纳入任何已知或可想象的框架中。特别是，所谓的转换语法理论似乎与语言现实只有最部分的关系。（1976 [1967-70]：203）

This is the first in a random, possibly nonfinite series of communications designed to show beyond any doubt that there exists no linguistic theory whatever. There are apparently endless numbers of fact types not incorporable within any known or imaginable framework. In particular, what has been called the theory of transformational grammar, seems to have only the most partial relation to linguistic reality. (1976 [1967–70]:203)

这些笔记最终被证明是有限的，但它们引发了越来越多类似的异议努力，这些论文的唯一目的是揭露数据，让所有理论家都毛骨悚然。这个周期的高潮出现在 70 年代的头几年，有像“半间接话语和相关的噩梦”（Gragg，1972）和“阅读风险自负：你可以在药箱中找到的句法和语义恐怖”（Sadock，1974b）这样的怪物特征。25这些论文只是当时普遍存在的生成语义学情绪最明显的表现，这种情绪在绝大多数论文的角落里都有体现。即使是波斯特尔的公众形象，无论他在私下里说了什么，还是在地下流传，通常都是自信满满、权威无比的，也在一篇直截了当的语言学研究论文中被打破了，这篇论文的结尾是“当然，这些[非常奇怪和神秘的性质]是有解释的，但信不信由你，本文作者并不知道它是什么”(1972d:400)。

The notes turned out to be finite, but they sparked an increasing number of similarly dissensual efforts, papers whose sole aim was bringing to light data that would give any and all pretenders to theoryhood the heebee-jeebees. The high point of the cycle came in the first few years of the seventies, with creature features like “Semi-indirect Discourse and Related Nightmares” (Gragg, 1972), and “Read at Your Own Risk: Syntactic and Semantic Horrors You Can Find in Your Medicine Chest” (Sadock, 1974b).25 These papers were only just the most overt symptoms of a mood pervading generative semantics of the period, one which shows up in the nooks and crannies of the overwhelming majority of papers. Even Postal’s public persona, which, whatever he said in private or circulated underground, was normally cocksure and authoritative, cracked in one straightforward Linguistic Inquiry paper, which ends “There is, of course, an explanation of these [very strange and mysterious properties] but, believe it or not, the present writer does not know what it is”(1972d:400).

他的《无政府主义笔记》引起了一些反响。特别是，据说哈勒认为这些笔记非常不明智，可能担心它们会激起他们所激起的那种态度——尽管也许更适合称之为粉丝——而黑田用他的《语言和谐笔记》（第一期是《身份的魅力》——1976 [1967]）温和地责备了他。但重要的是要注意，这种令人尴尬的数据流通背后的动机并不是要对整个转型事业的核心造成虚无主义的打击。波斯特尔在《笔记》中公开宣称的短期目标之一是尽可能生动地表明这项事业“不仅略有错误而且相当不完整”——这种态度是解释主义阵营的典型特征——“而且在深层次上与语言现实相去甚远”（1976 [1967-70]：215）；但他的最终目标要高得多。他说，他的目标“完全是积极的”。他试图将语法理论从其自身中拯救出来：

His Anarchy Notes raised something of a stink. In particular, it is said that Halle thought them very ill-advised, probably fearing that they would spark exactly the kind of attitude that they did spark—though, perhaps, fan is more appropriate—and Kuroda chided him gently with his “Linguistic Harmony Notes” (the first number being “Charms of Identity”—1976 [1967]). But it is important to notice that the motive behind this traffic with embarrassing data is not to deal a nihilistic blow to the heart of the entire transformational enterprise. One of Postal’s avowed short-term aims in the Notes, true, is to demonstrate in the most graphic way possible that the enterprise is “not just slightly in error and rather incomplete”—the attitude that characterized much of the interpretivist camp—“but in deep ways hopelessly far from linguistic reality” (1976 [1967–70]:215); his ultimate aims, though, are much higher. His goals, he says, “are entirely positive.” He is trying to save grammatical theory from itself:

如今，许多人都在尝试构建语言理论。我认为，所有这些尝试的一个重要困难是，没有一个好的先验陈述来描述理论必须处理的所有已知事实。如果理论是在没有明确意识到这些事实的情况下形成的，那么它们就像梦一样。（1976 [1967-70]：205）。

Many people today are engaged in the attempt to construct linguistic theories. My view is that an important difficulty with all such attempts is that there is not a good a priori statement of the full range of known facts which a theory must handle. To the extent that theories are formulated in the absence of explicit awareness of this range of facts, they are dreamlike. (1976 [1967–70]:205).

可以肯定地说，这种将语法理论从其自身的短视中拯救出来的愿望是促使生成语义学家专注于有问题的数据的最强烈的单一动机。

It is safe to say that this desire to save grammatical theory from its own shortsightedness was the strongest single motive fueling the generative-semanticists’ preoccupation with problematic data.

然而，无论这种对不充分理论的过度关注和对具有挑战性的数据的赞美背后的动机是什么，很明显，它对很多影响都源自CLS 论文集的存在。Chomsky 和 ​​Halle 的学生充满青春活力，激烈的辩论，主要都是口头的，印刷版，如果有的话，也只是通过油印，而且只在信徒中流传。McCawley、Zwicky 和 ​​Lakoffs 的学生充满青春活力，已经付印。这种冲动是值得赞赏的：迅速将关键思想发布出来以供批评和发展，并为研究生提供一个高调的论坛。但它有严重的缺点。

Whatever the motives behind this endemic fussing with inadequate theory and celebration of challenging data, however, it is clear that it had powerfully negative effects, many resulting from the existence of the CLS Proceedings. The youthful exuberance of Chomsky and Halle’s students, the vicious polemics, remained primarily oral, printed versions circulating, if at all, in mimeograph, and only among the faithful. The youthful exuberance of McCawley’s, Zwicky’s, and the Lakoffs’ students went to press. The impulse was admirable: to get the key ideas out rapidly for criticism and development, and give graduate students a high-profile forum. But it had serious drawbacks.

尤其是两个特点——它对广泛兴趣的包容和主要在异议言论中自我定义，即对乔姆斯基说“不”——可能是该运动崩溃的主要原因。对生成语义学衰落和衰落最常重复的（死后）诊断是“它试图吞噬世界，却被世界噎住了”。它试图将太多不同的现象纳入一个狭窄的乔姆斯基框架，但它们并不适合。它通过添加许多强大的设备来扩展该框架，最终停止尝试挽救这些现象并拒绝了该框架。这种评估当然抓住了衰落的一些方面。但许多生成语义学家保留了本质上是乔姆斯基的框架，只拒绝或修改了外围假设。事实上，可以有力地证明，乔姆斯基比波斯特尔或麦考利更偏离句法结构。崩溃的更具解释性的因素并不涉及数据和框架的冲突，而是缺乏重心。

In particular two traits—its embrace of a wide range of interests and its self-definition primarily in the rhetoric of dissent, in saying no to Chomsky—were perhaps the principal reasons the movement fell apart. The most frequently repeated (posthumous) diagnosis of the decline and fall of generative semantics is “it tried to swallow the world, and choked on it.” It tried to incorporate too many diverse phenomena within a narrow Chomskyan framework, and they wouldn’t fit. It stretched that framework by adding a number of powerful devices, and finally stopped trying to save the phenomena and rejected the framework. This assessment certainly captures some aspects of the demise. But many generative semanticists kept an essentially Chomskyan framework, rejecting or modifying only peripheral assumptions. A strong case can be made, in fact, that Chomsky has deviated further from Syntactic Structures than Postal or McCawley has. The more explanatory component of the collapse does not involve the clash of data and framework, so much as the absence of a center of gravity.

生成语义学家们像伍德斯托克音乐节后的人群一样四散开来，每个人都或成群结队地离开，去追求其他的兴趣。有些人在乔姆斯基的限制性论证的压力下，以及任何一位杰出的生成语义学家（尤其是呼吁全球语法的拉科夫）不愿接受这些论证的挑战而散去。生成语义学家并没有站起来，跨过擂台举起乔姆斯基的手臂庆祝胜利——或者说，很少有人这样做——但其他方法正在发展（最著名的是蒙塔古语法和关系语法），心怀不满的生成语义学家认为这些方法很有吸引力。这种吸引力部分是因为对乔姆斯基的反对更加集中，部分是因为语义更易于处理，部分是因为对有问题的数据的解决方案。26而且还有新的现象需要担心，因为没有一个模型能够很好地处理——例如，萨多克、格林、戴维森和摩根开始探索语用学；罗宾·莱考夫开始研究语言中的社会控制和权力问题。有些人，主要是莱考夫和罗斯，实际上从未离开，但他们的工作发生了变化，与最初的出发点越来越不相似。他们还为他们的工作起了新的标签。首先，莱考夫开始谈论整体语法，这显然是生成语义学的延续，但这个名称意味着向新事物的质的飞跃。随后，罗斯开始研究柔软语法，莱考夫则研究模糊语法，这些方法有共同的观点，但它们之间的差异足以有不同的名称。拉科夫还接受了诸如认知语法和体验语言学之类的标签，这些标签确定了一个不断发展的程序的不同元素，但这使得他看起来好像是根据那天早上上班路上听到的例句从一个理论跳到另一个理论。27罗斯最终对唱片公司产生了“几乎彻底的不信任”，并指出他的我在最近的研究中发现，“我曾经尝试过使用诸如人类的、整体的、生态的语言学修饰语，但每次它们听起来都越来越像时髦的、流行语、大事的混合物，而且越来越可怕”（1991：2）。

Generative semanticists dispersed like the crowd after Woodstock, everybody wandering off, individually or in clumps, to pursue other interests. Some straggled off under the force of Chomsky’s restrictiveness arguments, and the concomitant unwillingness of any prominent generative semanticist—in particular, the unwillingness of Lakoff, who had issued the call for global grammar—to meet the challenge of those arguments. Generative semanticists didn’t up and cross the ring to raise Chomsky’s arm in victory—or, very few did—but other approaches were developing (most notably, Montague grammar and relational grammar) that disaffected generative semanticists found attractive. In part the attraction was because of a more focused opposition to Chomsky, in part because of more tractable semantics, in part because of solutions to problematic data.26 And there were new phenomena to worry about that no model handled very well—Sadock, Green, Davison, and Morgan, for instance, began exploring pragmatics; Robin Lakoff started looking at social control and power issues in language. Some, principally Lakoff and Ross, never really left, but their work mutated in directions that bore less and less resemblance to their original starting point. They also adopted new labels for their work. First Lakoff began talking about global grammar, which was clear a continuation of generative semantics, but the name implied a qualitative leap to something new. Then Ross became associated with squishy grammar, Lakoff with fuzzy grammar, approaches that had shared perspectives, but which were different enough to have separate names. Lakoff also embraced labels like cognitive grammar and experiential linguistics, which identified different elements of one evolving program, but which made it look as if he was hopping from theory to theory depending on what sample sentences he heard on the way into work that morning.27 Ross eventually rounded to an “almost terminal distrust” for labels, noting of his more recent work that “I have already tried on modifiers for linguistics like human, holistic, ecological—and each time they tended to sound like some increasingly more horrific concoction of the trendy, the buzzword, the big deal” (1991:2).

麦考利坚持做他一直在做的事情，提出了敏锐而具有挑战性的句法、语义、词汇和音系分析，但就连他也放弃了“生成语义学”这个标签。到 1979 年的一次句法方法会议上，他只给自己所做的工作起了“非句法”的名字（Kac，1980；Moravcsik 和 Wirth，1980）。现在已经没有人使用生成语义学这个标签了，除了在为非语言学家撰写的时间延迟调查中，他们仍然将同质 I 模型誉为“最新发展”。每个接近这一场景的人都知道它已经完成了。劳勒（在麦考利讨论非句法的同一个会议上）哀叹自己能流利地说一种“死去的元语言”（1980：54、59n12），而埃尔金的《什么是语言学？》第二版（1979），删除了生成语义学的原始前沿调用（1973：34-35）。Gazdar 重新撰写了 1976 年的论文以供发表（1979），将所有现在时态的生成语义学引用都改为过去时态（并且，根据早期的主题，还将他的例句中令人毛骨悚然的尼克松改为狄克逊）。标签已贴在脚趾上，抽屉已关上。

McCawley kept doing what he always did, producing perceptive and challenging syntactic, semantic, lexical, and phonological analyses, but even he abandoned the label, generative semantics. By a 1979 conference on syntactic approaches, he gave only unsyntax as the name of the work he was doing (Kac, 1980; Moravcsik and Wirth, 1980). No one was using the label generative semantics at all anymore, except in time-delayed surveys written for nonlinguists, which were still hailing the Homogeneous I model as the “latest development.” Everyone close to the scene knew that it was finished. Lawler (at the same conference where McCawley was discussing unsyntax), lamented being a fluent speaker of a “dead metalanguage” (1980:54, 59n12), and Elgin’s second edition of her What Is Linguistics? (1979), excised the original cutting-edge invocation of generative semantics (1973:34–35). Gazdar, reworking his 1976 thesis for publication (1979), put all the present-tense references to generative semantics into past tense (and, apropos of an earlier topic, also changed the bathroom-haunting Nixon of his sample sentences to Dixon). The tag was on its toe, the drawer closed.

乔姆斯基流

The Chomskyan Flow

那么“生成语义学”这一表述从何而来？它来自一种普遍的态度或观点，例如，莱科夫在一篇题为“生成语义学”的文章中表达了这种态度或观点，波斯特尔在 1969 年的文章“最佳理论”中表达了这种态度或观点。但没有人——至少据我所知——真正接受过这一理论，它所呈现的形式实际上是空洞的。该理论断言的是，存在意义的表征、形式的表征以及两者之间的关系。此外，这两种表征之间的关系实际上是任意的……

Where then does the expression “generative semantics” come from? It is from a general attitude or point of view which was expressed, for example, by Lakoff in an article entitled “[On] Generative Semantics,” or by Postal in his 1969 article “The Best Theory.” But nobody—at least not to my knowledge—has actually accepted this theory, which in the form presented was virtually empty. What the theory asserted was that there exist representations of meaning, representations of form, and relations between the two. Furthermore, these relations between the two representations were virtually arbitrary.…

允许全局规则的理论具有巨大的描述潜力……为了接近“解释性”语言理论，或者——两者是一回事——为了解释语言习得的可能性，必须严重减少可访问语法的种类。假设全局规则会产生相反的效果，因此是一种非常不受欢迎的举动……

A theory that permits global rules has immense descriptive potential…. To approach an “explanatory” linguistic theory, or—which is the same thing—to account for the possibility of language acquisition, it is necessary to reduce severely the class of accessible grammars. Postulating global rules has just the opposite effect, and therefore constitutes a highly undesirable move….

[我自己的工作导致了这样的假设]：非常严格地限制了转换规则的表达能力，从而限制了可能的转换语法的类别。

[My own work has led to hypotheses which] restrict very severely the expressive power of transformational rules, thereby limiting the class of possible transformational grammars.

诺姆·乔姆斯基

Noam Chomsky

解释语义学开始蓬勃发展，尽管它也不是原来的旧模型。乔姆斯基的架构发生了几次变化。最引人注目的是，反对转换特异性的运动已经达到了极限：所有特定的转换都被消除了。有些转换被各种技术手段彻底取消。例如，删除被抛弃，取而代之的是基础生成的、音位上为零的代词。因此，Aspects模型通过删除someone和第二次出现的Tania，新模型只是将像 PRO 和e这样的空代词直接插入到深层结构中（如 3c），并使用表层结构语义规则确保e被解释为与Tania 共指。二十八

Interpretive semantics began to thrive, though it too was not the same old model. Chomsky’s architecture changed several times. Most dramatically, the campaign against the specificity of transformations was carried about as far as it could go: All specific transformations were eliminated. Some were axed outright by various technical moves. Deletions, for instance, were tossed out in favor of base-generated, phonologically null pronouns. So, where the Aspects model derived sentence like 3a from deep structures like 3b by deleting someone and the second occurrence of Tania, the new model just plugs empty pronouns like PRO and e directly into the deep structure (as in 3c), with surface structure semantic rules making sure that e is interpreted as coreferential with Tania.28

3

3

塔尼娅很容易取悦。

a Tania is easy to please.

 

 

b Tania 很容易被人取悦 Tania

b Tania is easy for someone to please Tania

 

 

c PRO 很容易取悦 Tania e

c Tania is easy for PRO to please e

但是，在最有趣的（也是一段时间内最具争议的）政策变化中，所有剩余的移动规则都被归结为一个非常普遍的转变。被动被淘汰，主题化被淘汰，Wh-fronting 被淘汰，而 Move - α被采用，其中α是一个代表任何成分的变量。现在，Move-α 本身只是为表层结构生成了词汇大杂烩，任何可以想象的词汇混乱。但丰富的过滤器和约束确保（理论上）只有语法序列才能浮出水面。

But, in the most interesting (and, for awhile, the most controversial) policy change, all the remaining movement rules were collapsed under one very general transformation. Passive was out, Topicalization was out, Wh-fronting was out, and Move-α was in, where α is a variable that stands for any constituent. Now, Move-α on its own just produces word salad for the surface structure, any conceivable scramble of words. But a rich array of filters and constraints ensured that (in theory) only the grammatical sequences made it to the surface.

他目前的模型——“有时被称为‘扩展的标准理论（EST）’”（Chomsky, 1986:67），尽管它与 1969 年的同名模型只有一丝相似之处——看起来大致如图 9.1所示。这幅图看似简单，因为所有的罗马数字都代表不同的规则系统：I代表短语结构规则；II代表转换；III代表音系规则；IV代表“LF 成分规则”，本质上是与量词范围和照应关系有关的语义解释规则。该模型的其他元素如下：PF 是“语音形式”；LF是“逻辑形式”；D 结构和S 结构是通过转换关联的抽象句法表示层次，无论 Chomsky 多么羞于将D和S视为任意字母，它们都不可避免地分别让人联想到深层结构和表层结构。29词汇插入无处可见。

His current model—“sometimes called ‘the Extended Standard Theory (EST)’” (Chomsky, 1986:67), though it has only a passing resemblance to the 1969 model with that name—looks roughly like figure 9.1. This picture is deceptively simple, since the Roman numerals all represent distinct rule systems: I represents phrase structure rules; II represents transformations; III represents phonological rules; and IV represents “rules of the LF component,” essentially semantic interpretation rules concerned with quantifier scope and anaphoric relations. The other elements of the model are, as follows: PF is “phonetic form”; LF is “logical form”; D-structure and S-structure are abstract levels of syntactic representation related by way of transformations, which, however coy Chomsky is in treating D and S as arbitrary letters, inescapably evoke deep structure and surface structure, respectively.29 Lexical insertion is nowhere to be seen.

乔姆斯基不再直接关注语义论证。事实上，他从未这样做过。语义学是一根胡萝卜，在 50 年代末和 60 年代初吸引了大量对他的模型的关注。他支持卡茨、福多尔和波斯特尔的工作，但他没有参与其中。当语义学在 60 年代末和 70 年代初成为打击生成语义学家的棍棒时，情况也是如此。他通过关注焦点和预设现象，以及讨论量词范围困难，提出了卡茨-波斯特尔原则的问题，并在适合他的时候支持这些问题的解决方案，但他从未提出任何自己的解决方案。一旦生成语义学基本被淘汰，他就不再讨论这些问题。他对显式语义学的兴趣一直很温和。

Chomsky no longer concerns himself very directly with semantic argumentation. In fact, he never did. Semantics was a carrot, attracting a good deal of attention to his model in the late fifties and early sixties. He endorsed the work of Katz, Fodor, and Postal, but he did not engage in it. When semantics became a stick with which to beat the generative semanticists in the late sixties and early seventies, the same was true. He raised problems for the Katz-Postal principle—by attending to focus and presupposition phenomena, and by discussing quantifier-scope difficulties—and he endorsed solutions to these problems when it suited him, but he never proposed any solutions on his own. Once generative semantics was pretty much dispatched, he stopped discussing these issues. His interest in explicit semantics has always been quite modest.

图 9.1 . 乔姆斯基当前语法模型的概述（源自 Chomsky, 1986c:68）。

Figure 9.1. An outline of Chomsky’s current grammatical model (From Chomsky, 1986c:68).

人们正确地称他为“句法动物”（Passmore，1985：39），而杰肯多夫将 70 年代中期麻省理工学院的态度描述为“让我们重新做些句法，现在整个事情都结束了。”整个事情到此时还没有完全结束——事实上，解释主义的攻击正在积聚力量——但威胁已经消失，乔姆斯基框架中的理论问题决定转向句法。

He has been called, rightly, a syntactic animal (Passmore, 1985:39), and Jackendoff characterizes the attitude around MIT in the mid-seventies as “Let’s do some syntax again, now that this whole schmeer is over.” The whole schmeer wasn’t quite over at this point—in fact, the interpretivist assault was building up a good head of steam—but the threat was gone, and the theoretical questions in Chomsky’s framework took a decided turn back toward syntax.

乔姆斯基放弃了生成语义学，开始研究他的计划的另一部分，这个部分有两个不同的标签——修订的扩展标准理论（表示修改增加）和踪迹理论（取自其最突出的修改）。其中一个标签主要被厌倦了乔姆斯基摆弄他的模型的语言学家使用，并且经常以嘲讽的缩写形式出现，例如“休息一下”。另一个标签的使用更为中性。但两者都不是特别有用。事实上，大约在这个时候，很明显，给乔姆斯基的作品贴上标签充其量是一件不确定的事情，即使是他自己认可的标签（政府约束理论一度让位于原则和参数，可能即将被极简主义计划取代）。更有效的方法可能是把他当作一位伟大而不安的艺术家——就像毕加索一样，有他的后印象派时期、蓝色时期、玫瑰时期、立体主义时期……

Chomsky turned his back on generative semantics, and started work on another strand of his program, alternatively known by a couple of different labels—the revised extended standard theory, signalling increased modification, and trace theory, taking the name of its single most prominent modification. One of them was used mostly by linguists tired of Chomsky fiddling with his model, and often took the form of a derisive acronym, as in “Give it a REST.” The other was used more neutrally. But neither is particularly useful. In fact, it became clear at about this point that putting labels on Chomsky’s work at all is an iffy business at best, even the ones he himself endorses (Government-Binding Theory for awhile, giving way to Principles-and-Parameters, possibly on the way to being displaced by The Minimalist Program). A more productive approach might be to treat him like a great and restless artist—like Picasso, with his postimpressionist period, his blue period, his rose period, his cubist period, …
