我们一直在越来越详细地研究乔姆斯基的哈里斯时期、反布卢姆菲尔德时期、阿斯派茨时期和反生成语义学时期；就像毕加索一样，一个时期与下一个时期融合在一起，积极情绪与消极情绪交替，元素和主题贯穿始终。下一个时期，他相当戏剧性地摆脱了反生成语义学的关注，专注于更积极的工作，以《转换的条件》（1973a [1971]）为标志，萨多克说，在这篇论文中，乔姆斯基开始使用一种新的术语。也就是说，1966 年至 1971 年间，乔姆斯基在形式语言学方面的大部分工作都是针对生成语义学的，而不是针对解释语义学的。即使是他的积极建议——例如语法和词汇假设——似乎也主要因为这些建议给生成语义学设置了障碍而引起了他的兴趣。随着条件时期的到来，他再次开始阐述一个有前景的、可行的语言模型。

We have been looking, in increasing detail, at Chomsky’s Harrisian period, his anti-Bloomfield period, his Aspects period, and his anti-generative semantics period; as with Picasso, one merges into the next, positive moods alternate with negative ones, elements and themes connect through them all. The next period, when he broke rather dramatically from his anti-generative semantics focus to concentrate on the more positive work, is marked by “Conditions on Transformations” (1973a [1971]), the paper in which, Sadock says, Chomsky began speaking a new lingo. The majority of Chomsky’s work in formal linguistics between 1966 and 1971, that is, was directed against generative semantics, rather than for interpretive semantics. Even his positive suggestions—-syntax, for instance, and the lexicalist hypothesis—seemed to interest him primarily for the obstacles they placed in front of generative semantics. With the conditions period, he began again to articulate a promising, workable linguistic model.

该模型中包含的建议迅速取得了成果：就在语言学家几乎不可能找到一个连贯的、以生成语义学为标签的程序时，解释语义学却正在大展身手。随着杰肯多夫（1972）和乔姆斯基（1973a [1971]）提出了真正的替代方案，而不是一些粗略而尖刻的建议，越来越多的学生、初级教授和中立者发现这个新方案很有说服力。这个方案不仅包括对词汇项目的更多关注，还包括一种优雅的新处理方式短语结构和丰富的转换成分，但强烈拒绝生成语义学。特别是，乔姆斯基和（特别是）他的前学生在很大程度上反对生成语义学的妖怪，从而定义了他更“严格”的理论。

The proposals contained in that model rapidly bore fruit: at exactly the time that it became almost impossible for linguists to find a coherent program under the label of generative semantics, interpretive semantics was getting its act very much together. With Jackendoff (1972) and Chomsky (1973a [1971]), offering a genuine alternative, rather than a few sketchy and barbed suggestions, increasing numbers of students, junior professors, and neutrals found the new package persuasive. The package included not only increased attention to lexical items, an elegant new treatment of phrase structure, and an enriched transformational component, but the forceful rejection of generative semantics. In particular, Chomsky and (especially) his former students defined his more “restrictive” theory largely against the bogey man of generative semantics.

分散的生成语义学家有一个共同点，那就是无论他们想做什么，他们都会坚持到最后一刻（好吧，他们中的一些人仍在坚持），拒绝乔姆斯基。即使是和蔼可亲、温和的麦考利，也只能选择称其作品为非语法，这再明显不过地对以句法为中心的乔姆斯基观点嗤之以鼻了。

The one common denominator among the scattering generative semanticists is that, whatever else they were up to, they continued, until the very last minute (well, some of them are still at it), rejecting Chomsky. Even the gracious, gentle McCawley couldn’t have thumbed his nose at the syntaxicentric Chomskyan vision any more explicitly than by choosing to call his work unsyntax.

显然，这个人，乔姆斯基，就是关键。他为解释语义学提供了不可抗拒的重心。在他的直接框架中，任何人如果开始研究与他不合拍甚至只是无趣的线索，那么根据定义，很快就会被排除在计划之外——不一定是出于愤怒或恶意，甚至可能不是故意的；只是因为乔姆斯基的关注自动为社区设定了议程。如果他支持涉及他的框架的研究，就像他支持 Katz 和 Postal 在Aspects 之前关于核心语义的提议一样，那么它就属于该计划。如果他停止谈论某人的工作，就像他在后 Aspects时期基本上停止谈论 Katz 的语义学一样，或者如果他拒绝工作，就像他在后 Aspects时期拒绝 Postal 的抽象语法一样，那么它就被排除在计划之外。卡茨确实提倡一种解释性的语义学，并花费了大量的精力与乔姆斯基的主要敌人作斗争，但从最适合辩论模式的角度来看，他不是一个解释主义者。语言学家很快意识到，卡茨并不比拉科夫或罗斯更能代表乔姆斯基。波斯特尔的情况更加明显。他是（现在仍然是）一个最纯粹的、句法结构意义上的乔姆斯基式语言学家，主要兴趣是建立“精确构造的语言结构模型”（Chomsky, 1957a:5），他是每个人都认为乔姆斯基非常珍视的研究背后的驱动力，寻找深层的词汇规律并用转换机制解释表面的多样性。但乔姆斯基拒绝了这项工作，波斯特尔迅速转变为他的对手的角色。

This man, Chomsky, obviously, is the key. He gave interpretive semantics an irresistible center of gravity. Anyone in his immediate framework who begins working on a strand that is uncongenial to him, or even just uninteresting, rapidly becomes, by definition, out of the program—not necessarily for reasons of pique or malice, perhaps not even by design; simply because Chomsky’s concerns automatically set the agenda for the community. If he supports research which involves his framework, as he supported Katz and Postal’s pre-Aspects proposals about kernel semantics, it is in the program. If he stops talking about someone’s work, as he largely stopped talking about Katz’s semantics in the post-Aspects period, or if he rejects work, as he rejected Postal’s abstract syntax in the post-Aspects period, it is out of the program. Katz certainly promoted an interpretive brand of semantics, and expended a good deal of energy doing battle against Chomsky’s principal enemies, but he was not, in the usage that best suits the pattern of the debate, an interpretivist. Linguists soon realized that Katz no more spoke for Chomsky than did Lakoff or Ross. With Postal, the case is even clearer. He was (and remains) a Chomskyan linguist in the most pristine, Syntactic Structures, sense of the term, interested primarily in building “precisely constructed models for linguistic structure” (Chomsky, 1957a:5), and he was the driving force behind research that everyone thought would have been very dear to Chomsky’s heart, seeking out deep lexical regularities and explaining surface diversity with transformational mechanisms. But Chomsky rejected the work and Postal rapidly moved into the role of his opponent.

生成语义学也存在一些这种既在运动中又在运动之外的分类；尤其是纽迈耶，当他拒绝麦考利的 VSO 提议时，他感到被排斥了，而拉科夫仍然闷闷不乐地坚持认为“纽迈耶从来都不是生成语义学家”。但这种现象并不那么普遍，也不那么明显。造成这种差异的主要原因可能是生成语义学不是围绕单个个体组织的。四位骑士都有自己的兴趣，他们的范围比乔姆斯基的要广得多。但这场运动也本质上比解释主义（或者乔姆斯基的任何其他框架）更开放、更无政府主义。如果某个对生成语义学有同情心的人开始研究某个特定的数据集或形式机制，通常假设他们会把这个理论带走。萨多克研究了药瓶标签的句法、语义和语用学（1974b）。 Green 研究了谚语（1975 年）。Ross 研究了其 squishes（1972 年）。Lakoff 研究了 Rosch 的类别工作、Zadeh 的模糊集理论、Grice 的会话准则。而这些现象或原则自然而然地就属于生成语义学的范畴了。

There was some of this in-the-movement, out-of-the-movement categorization to generative semantics as well; Newmeyer, in particular, felt ostracized when he rejected McCawley’s VSO proposal, and Lakoff still sullenly insists that “Newmeyer was never a generative semanticist.” But it was much less prevalent, and much less obvious. The major reason for this difference is probably that generative semantics was not organized around a single individual. All four of the horsemen had their own interests, and collectively their range was much broader than Chomsky’s. But the movement was also inherently more open and anarchic than interpretivism (or, for that matter, any of Chomsky’s other frameworks). If someone with generative semantics sympathies began working on a particular data set or formal mechanism, it was usually assumed that they took the theory with them. Sadock examined the syntax, semantics, and pragmatics of medicine bottle labels (1974b). Green looked at proverbs (1975). Ross looked at his squishes (1972d). Lakoff looked at Rosch’s category work, Zadeh’s fuzzy set theory, Grice’s conversational maxims. And, automatically, the phenomena or principles were within the province of generative semantics.

问题与谜团

Problems and Mysteries

我认为，如果我们去掉其中的“如果”，这个论点将得到最公平的检验。

I think the argument will be most fairly tested, if we take the ‘if’ out of it.

苏格拉底

Socrates

生成语义学的一位最顽固的敌人认为，生成语义学的消亡在很大程度上是精神气质的崩溃：“他们坚持采用 60 年代最疯狂的邪教之一的举止和风格，结果毁了自己。”这话不假，而且很难避免与青年文化兼反主流文化兼伍德斯托克民族进行类比，后者几乎每天都在换衣服。嬉皮士的问题是真实存在的，许多人致力于并努力实现巨大的社会和政治变革。但大多数人即使坚持了，也只坚持了很短的一段时间。这些问题是真实的，但它们也只是时髦的，长发和珠子已不再受欢迎。本书当然不是探讨它们失宠原因的地方，尽管它们的短暂性很大程度上肯定与完全缺乏对所攻击的制度和实践的积极替代方案的关注有关（在许多情况下，是完全缺乏）；罗斯扎克（Roszak，1969：34）说，在逃离的最激烈时期，“更多的是逃离而不是走向”。事实上，即使是被拒绝的东西也迅速发展，从对民权不平等和越南入侵的相当严格的关注，发展成为信仰、对象、人和文化的大杂烩。同样的趋势也出现在生成语义学中：逃离乔姆斯基；对一些特定技术问题的异议迅速扩大；要接受的现象范围不断扩大。但这些都是失败的深层原因，与一些绰号、一些荒诞的幽默和一两次政治讽刺截然不同。这些特点在一定程度上导致了生成语义学的衰落，但真正标志着该理论 [+ DOOM ] 的是生成语义学家对该理论缺点的非凡坦率，以及他们赞扬而不是边缘化异常的倾向，这两者都反映了深刻的方法论和哲学立场。

One of the more implacable foes of generative semantics analyzes its death, in large part, as the implosion of ethos: “They destroyed themselves by insisting on taking on the mannerisms, the style, of one of the crazier sixties cults.” There is truth here, and it is difficult to avoid analogies with the youth-culture-cum-counterculturecum-Woodstock-Nation, which changed its shirt almost daily. The issues of hippydom were real, and many people were committed, and worked very hard to bring about social and political changes of huge magnitude. But the majority of people were committed, if at all, for only a short period. The issues were real, but they were also faddish, falling out of favor with long hair and beads. This book is certainly not the place to explore why they fell out of favor, although much of their transience surely had to do with the complete lack of focus in (and, in many cases, outright lack of) positive alternatives to the institutions and practices under attack; it was, says Roszak (1969:34) in the thick of the flight, “much more a flight from than toward” Indeed, even what was being rejected grew rapidly, from a fairly tight set of concerns about civil rights inequities and the invasion of Vietnam, into a great amorphous stew of beliefs, objects, people, culture. The same trends are apparent in generative semantics: the flight from Chomsky; the rapid expansion of dissent from a few specific technical questions; the ever-widening range of phenomena to be embraced. But these are very deep reasons for failure, utterly distinct from a few epithets, some absurdist humor, and a political jab or two. These traits contributed in some measure to the decline of generative semantics, but it was the generative semanticists’ remarkable frankness about the shortcomings of the theory, and their tendency to celebrate rather than marginalize anomalies, both reflections of deep methodological and philosophical positions, that truly marked the theory [+ DOOM].

不幸的是，生成语义学的大部分风格都是排他性的。当然，它疏远了政治立场更为保守的人和对绰号更为敏感的人。Hagège 用一个显然意在一刀两断的形容词说，“那些已经认为业余主义并不止于形式的更严肃的学者，冒着在其他地方为他们的保留寻找理由的风险”（1981 [1976]：22）。30不赞同的学者会找到更多敌视的理由，这并不是什么大问题，也不应该成为大问题。无论他们遇到什么风格，他们的偏见都会得到满足。更令人担忧的是，中立的学者可能只是因为语言主张以外的原因而不愿意阅读他们认为令人反感的材料——因为普遍的不敬，或对毒品的暗示，或对公众人物的诽谤。例如，可敬的奎因似乎只是记得，在 1969 年的逻辑与语言会议上，莱科夫和麦考利“过于热衷于用异想天开的例子来取悦读者”，抱怨他们“喋喋不休，滑稽可笑”(1985:358)。当格林明确表示不会从手稿中删除对尼克松、阿格纽和团队的提及时，剑桥大学出版社的大学出版商向她发送了这些评论：

Much of the generative semantics style is, unfortunately, exclusionary. Certainly, it alienates people with more conservative politics, and people more squeamish about epithets. Hagège says, with an adjective that is clearly meant to cut two ways, “that more serious scholars, who already consider that amateurism does not stop with form, risk finding elsewhere a justification for their reservations” (1981 [1976]:22).30 That unsympathetic scholars would find more reasons for hostility is not, or should not be, much of a concern. Their predispositions would be satisfied no matter what style they encountered. More worrisome is that neutral scholars might simply be discouraged from reading material they found offensive for reasons other than its linguistic claims—because of general irreverence, or allusions to drugs, or aspersions on public figures. The Venerable Quine, for instance, seems only to recall that Lakoff and McCawley “were over-eager to amuse … with whimsical examples” at a 1969 conference on logic and language, complaining of their “chatter and clowning” (1985:358). And the university publisher for Cambridge University Press sent these comments to Green when it had become clear that she would not expunge references to Nixon, Agnew, and crew from her manuscript:

这些句子，即使不是诽谤，也肯定是令人反感的，而且是毫无根据的：语言学教科书不是用来对公众人物进行含沙射影的合适借口。将这本书用于此目的可能会损害作者和出版商的声誉。（RW Davis，引自 Pullum，1987：141）

The sentences, even if in the event they were not to be libelous, are certainly offensive, and quite gratuitously so: a textbook of linguistics is not an appropriate stalking-horse from which to issue innuendoes against public figures. To use the book for this purpose would be likely to cheapen the reputations of author and publisher alike. (R. W. Davis, quoted in Pullum, 1987:141)

至少对我来说，很难指责一个熟悉越南惨烈行径的人对罪责最重的人表示蔑视，一旦约翰逊和尼克松这样的人被允许进入美国，可怜的汉弗莱和滑稽的米切尔斯就成了显而易见的（也是容易的）攻击目标。但无论你是否指责这种性格，学术界不可否认的事实是，中立的散文是最安全的途径。学者们各有各的信仰，但他们中一个相对常见的性格就是尖刻，而恼怒并不是坚持的途径。

It is very difficult, at least for me, to fault someone familiar with the stunning brutality of Vietnam for expressing contempt of the men with the most guilt on their hands, and once the door was open on people like Johnson and Nixon, the sad-sack Humphrey and the buffoonish Mitchells were obvious (and easy) targets. But whether one faults this trait or not, it is undeniable fact of scholarship that neutral prose is the safest course. Scholars come in all persuasions, but a relatively common trait among them all is pricklishness, and annoyance is not the road to adherence.

然而，即使是这些特征——幽默和政治诽谤——单独来看也可能不会造成太大的损害。事实上，它们有助于该运动吸引足够多的年轻学者，以至于其他因素的激怒可能被抵消。真正的损害是由密切相关的特征造成的，拉科夫称之为诚实和数据热爱。

Even these traits, however—humor and political aspersion—might not have done much damage in isolation. In fact, they contributed to the movement’s attractiveness for enough young scholars that the aggravation of others might have been counterbalanced. The real damage was done by the closely related traits that Lakoff calls honesty and data-love.

尽管“诚实”一词显然是自私的，或许应该用“坦率”之类的词来代替，但生成主义者清楚地表明了他们的缺点，而很少有科学集体这样做。31尤其是，他们竭力避免他们认为的乔姆斯基的修辞手法。这些努力的另一个例子是归因。许多生成语义学家认为乔姆斯基在承认他的思想贡献方面非常挑剔，他们小心翼翼地避免陷入类似的模式。因为我们处理的是生成语义学，所以这种一丝不苟导致了一些相当奇怪的承认，如“句子 (1) 是 Haj Ross 引起我的注意的（他又是从 Avery Andrews 那里听说的）” (Lakoff, 1988 [1974] :25)，以及“我很感谢 JL Morgan 提出了这句话 [自从尼克松当选以来，我开始怀念林登·约翰逊]，从而让我开始了富有成效的思路” (Davison, 1970:199n3)，以及“我并不应感谢 John Lawler 让我注意到这类丑陋的事实” (Ross, 1974b:100n30)。和那个时期大多数过度类别的获胜者一样，这一类别的获胜者是乔治·莱考夫 (George Lakoff) 和他的“语言格式塔”，其主要归因注释开头是“这项工作源于与很多人的交谈和通信，我可能记不清了，更不用说列出了”，但接下来还是提到了 25 个人和两家餐馆 (1977a:236)。三十二

Although the term honesty is obviously self-serving, and perhaps should be replaced with one like frankness, the generativists were clearly explicit about their shortcomings in a way very few scientific collectives are.31 In particular, they were at pains to avoid what they took to be Chomsky’s rhetorical underhandedness. As one additional example of these pains, consider attribution. Many generative semanticists regarded Chomsky as extremely selective in the way he acknowledged his intellectual debts, and they tried scrupulously to avoid falling into similar patterns. Since we are dealing with generative semantics, this scrupulosity led to some rather odd acknowledgments, like “Sentence (1) was brought to my attention by Haj Ross (who in turn had heard it from Avery Andrews)” (Lakoff, 1988 [1974] :25), and “I am grateful to J. L. Morgan for producing this sentence [Since Nixon was elected, I’ve come to miss LBJ], thereby setting me off on a productive train of thought” (Davison, 1970:199n3), and “No thanks is due to John Lawler for calling my attention to this ugly class of facts” (Ross, 1974b:100n30). The winner in this category, as in most categories of excess from the period, is George Lakoff and his “Linguistic Gestalts,” whose main attributive note begins “This work has grown out of conversations and correspondence with more people than I can possibly remember, let alone list,” but goes on to mention twenty-five people anyway, and two restaurants (1977a:236).32

这种坦率有更为严肃的表现，特别是在频繁提醒“作者充分意识到，这里呈现的文本中存在许多不确定性、不清晰和错误” (Seuren, 1975:84)。毫无争议的是，这一时期的每一部变革性作品都充满了不确定性、不明确性和错误，大多数语言学家都以某种方式承认了它们。以下是乔姆斯基在《一些经验问题》的结尾所说的话：

This frankness had much more serious manifestations; in particular, in the frequent reminders that “the author is fully aware of the fact that there are many uncertainties, unclarities, and errors in the text as presented here” (Seuren, 1975:84). Uncontroversially, every transformational work of the period was full of uncertainties, unclarities, and errors, and most linguists acknowledged them in some way. Here is Chomsky at the end of “Some Empirical Issues”:

粗略地说，在我看来，这是对转换生成语法理论现状的公正评估——目前如此。显然，任何这样的评估在关键点上都必须是相当不确定和不精确的。如果几年后，或者也许下周，在类似的评论中，我不想呈现一幅截然不同的画面——惊讶，也有点失望，我会感到非常惊讶。（1972b[1969]：199）

Very roughly, this seems to me a fair assessment of the state of the theory of transformational generative grammar—at the moment. Obviously, any such assessment must be quite tentative and imprecise at crucial points. I will be very surprised if in a similar review several years from now, or perhaps next week, I will not want to present a rather different picture—surprised, and not a little disappointed as well. (1972b [1969]:199)

但是，在乔姆斯基和生成语义学家那里，这种承认的发生率和讨论的总体基调是截然不同的。乔姆斯基具有令人印象深刻的修辞才能，他提出的想法既是尝试性的，又是完全认可的，他似乎从他的论点中去掉了“如果”，但仍然安全地保留了“如果”。这种才能的其他价值之一是，它使他能够相当优雅地修剪那些枯萎的概念，同时保留那些结出果实的概念。这种才能最引人注目的例子是他在《方面》中对卡兹-波斯特尔原则的处理——从句和脚注表达了保留意见，但讨论的总体影响是，这个假设是十年研究的自然沉淀，是一个令人信服的能力模型的核心（当然，它确实是）。词汇主义是一个相反的例子。“评论”的分量强烈地支持词汇主义，因为词汇主义是引入句法特征所导致的自然进步。但该论证是作为一项抽象的案例研究进行的，研究了权衡不同组成部分的功能性可能产生的影响，并犹豫地得出结论：“根据这里调查的证据，似乎……词汇学假说对于派生名词是正确的，也许对于混合形式也是如此，尽管不那么明显”（1972b [1967]：60）。当 Katz-Postal 原则失败时，他毫不犹豫地撤回了他的支持；当词汇学假说被证明卓有成效时，他看起来很有远见（事实上他确实如此）。

But the incidence of such admissions, and the general tone of discussion, are vastly different in Chomsky and in the generative semanticists. Chomsky has the impressive rhetorical talent of offering ideas which are at once tentative and fully endorsed, of appearing to take the if out of his arguments while nevertheless keeping it safely around. Among the other values of this talent, it allows him to prune rather gracefully notions which wither on the vine, while retaining those that bear fruit. The most dramatic example of this talent is his treatment of the Katz-Postal principle in Aspects—subordinate clauses and footnotes express reservation, but the general impact of the discussion is that the hypothesis is the natural precipitate of a decade of research, and the centerpoint of a compelling competence model (which, of course, it was). Lexicalism is a case of the opposite type. The weight of “Remarks” is strongly behind lexicalism as a natural advance occasioned by the introduction of syntactic features. But the argument is conducted as an abstract case study in the possible effects of trading off the functionality of different components, and concludes hesitantly: “On the basis of the evidence surveyed here, it seems that … the lexicalist hypothesis [is correct] for the derived nominals and perhaps, though much less clearly so, for the mixed forms” (1972b [1967]:60). When the Katz-Postal principle failed, he had no trouble withdrawing his endorsement; when the lexicalist hypothesis proved fruitful, he looked visionary (as indeed he was).

很少有生成语义学家具备这种天赋（尽管 Lakoff 和 McCawley 都展现出这方面的天赋），或者他们可能没有这种倾向，但他们的犹豫和如果一直在持续。最极端的例子是罗斯的作品，尤其是 70 年代的作品。它包含了“令人尴尬的坦率和强烈的情感投入”，Holton 说这已经使开普勒在科学史上被边缘化了（1988 [1973]:54）。罗斯的论证没有开普勒那么疯狂，但同样引人注目——多层次、曲折而微妙，对数据波动非常敏感。它们包含数十条线索，在正文中互相循环，并附有冗长而扭曲的讨论注释，其中一些提供了反例，一些提供了替代分析，但几乎没有一个为注释的观点提供任何支持。它们由长长的子论证目录组成——有的强，有的弱，弱的总是被精心标记出来——中间穿插着神秘和敬畏的宣言。用巴门尼德的话来说，罗斯是“有两个脑袋的人”之一，他把辩证法发挥到了近乎病态的程度；据说兰根多恩曾总结罗斯的一次演讲，说“我们有十五个论证，他们有九个论证；所以我想我们赢了。”

Few of the generative semanticists had this talent (though both Lakoff and McCawley show flashes of it), or perhaps they did not have the inclination, and their hesitations, their ifs, are incessant. The most extreme examples are in Ross’s work, especially in the seventies. It contains the “embarrassing candor and intense emotional involvement” that Holton says has marginalized Kepler in the history of science (1988 [1973]:54). Ross’s arguments are not as wild as Kepler’s, but they are remarkable all the same—multilayered, tortuous, and subtle, very sensitive to fluctuations in the data. They contain dozens of threads, looping around one another in the main text and annotated with lengthy, contorted discussions, some of which offer counter-examples, some of which offer alternative analyses, virtually none of which offer any support for the annotated point. They consist of long catalogs of subarguments—some strong, some weak, the weak ones always painstakingly flagged as such—interspersed with declarations of mystification and awe. Ross is, in Parmenides’ term, one of “the men with two heads,” someone who has taken dialectic to virtually pathological levels; Langendoen is said to have summarized one of Ross’s presentations, with “It’s fifteen arguments for us and nine for them; so I guess we win.”

如果用诚实来形容罗斯的风格，而且确实如此，那么他就是痛苦的诚实。这种效果就像忏悔，也许会让人对他的计划的困难表示同情，但几乎没有人愿意加入。效果也很不和谐，争论不断，直到几乎不可能听到清晰的思路在噪音中浮现。以下评价很有说服力：“必须认真怀疑是否有一个连贯的观点可以传达。”

If honest is the appropriate descriptor for Ross’s style, and it does seem right, it is painfully honest. The effect is confessional, in a way that perhaps makes one empathetic to the difficulties of his program, but hardly kindles interest in joining it. The effect is also cacophonous, with argument countering argument until it is all but impossible to hear a clear line of thought rising above the noise. The following assessment is telling: “It must be seriously open to doubt whether there is a coherent point of view to communicate.”

但罗斯的评价是有症状的：这个评价不是针对他的作品。他甚至没有被引用。这个评价是针对生成语义学家作为一个群体的。分析者继续说：

But Ross is symptomatic: this assessment is not of his work. He isn’t even cited. The assessment is of generative semanticists as a group. The assayer continues:

再加上……他们中的一些人似乎几乎不断地改变想法，并且他们沉迷于发表一些带有倾向性的观点，而这些观点在发表时他们不再持有，这就造成了一种思想混乱，甚至可能吓倒最执着的真理追求者。（O'Donnell，1974：74）

Add … that some of them appear to change their minds almost continuously and that they are addicted to somewhat tendentious publication of views they no longer hold at the time of publication and you have a recipe for an intellectual confusion which might daunt even the most committed seeker-after-truth. (O’Donnell, 1974:74)

罗斯的论文不仅代表了许多生成主义者坦率而狂野的风格，而且是整个运动的缩影。

Ross’s papers are not only representatives of the frankness-run-amok style of many generativists, but microcosms of the entire movement.

奥唐纳对生成语义学的回应虽然不像他所说的那样中立（1974:53），但并不罕见；他对生成语义学阵营发表的数据颂扬论文的回应也并不罕见，那就是沉默。一个在职语言学家能对一篇充满事实的论文做些什么呢？这篇论文的存在理由是，在目前的理论中，这些事实是无法解释的。

O’Donnell’s response to generative semantics, though hardly as neutral as he makes out (1974:53), was not uncommon; nor was his response to the data-celebration papers issuing from the generative semantics camp, silence. What could a working linguist do with a paper full of facts whose raison d’être was that there was no conceivable explanation for them in current theory?

拉科夫 (Lakoff) 用“数据热爱”来描述生成语义学的这一方面，这似乎非常接近事实。将他在《讨论语言》中的访谈与乔姆斯基的访谈 (Parrett, 1974 [1972]:27–54, 151–78) 进行比较。后一篇访谈充满了例子、背景，以及对那些根除了特别棘手的语言事实的语言学家的称赞；而乔姆斯基的访谈几乎完全是抽象的，只有几次简短而零散的数据引用。或者考虑一下书名《副词、元音和其他奇妙的东西》 。没有多少解释学家会选择这个书名作为书名，而且与乔姆斯基的经典著作《句法结构》、《句法理论方面》、《治理理论的一些概念和后果》和《约束》相比，这个书名肯定会显得格格不入。事实上，这个标题是 McCawley (1979) 的，但这个标题出自几乎任何一位生成语义学家之口都是同样自然的，就像对某个特定数据集的赞扬一样：

Lakoff’s term for this aspect of generative semantics, data-love, seems pretty close to the mark. Compare his interview in Discussing Language with Chomsky’s (Parrett, 1974 [1972]:27–54, 151–78). It is full of examples, contexts, and compliments for linguists who have rooted out particularly troublesome linguistic facts; Chomsky’s is almost entirely abstract, with only a few brief and scattered invocations of data. Or consider the title Adverbs, Vowels, and Other Objects of Wonder. There are not many interpretivists of whom there is much danger they would choose that title for a book, and it would certainly stand out like a sore thumb against the titles in Chomsky’s canon—Syntactic Structures, Aspects of the Theory of Syntax, Some Concepts and Consequences of the Theory of Government and Binding. The title, in fact, is McCawley’s (1979), but it would be equally natural coming from almost any of the generative semanticists, as would this praise for a particular data set:

她（Borkin）的例子令人眼花缭乱，至今仍是深奥的谜团。这些谜团是我们对 20 世纪 80 年代及以后语言学应该解决的问题的看法的核心。我们感谢上帝赐予我们这些谜团，它们值得那些想要了解语言如何运作的人关注。（Lakoff 和 Ross，Borkin，1984：viii）

Her [Borkin’s] examples are dazzling and remain deep mysteries to this day. Such mysteries are central to our vision of what problems should be addressed by the linguistics of the 1980s and beyond. We are grateful for the gift of mysteries so worthy of the attention of those who would understand how language works. (Lakoff and Ross, in Borkin, 1984:viii)

再次，与乔姆斯基的对比极为鲜明：

Again, the contrast with Chomsky is extremely sharp:

我想粗略地区分一下语言和思维研究中出现的两类问题：一类问题似乎在人们能理解的方法和概念的范围内，我称之为“问题”；另一类问题，今天对我们来说仍然和最初提出时一样晦涩难懂，我称之为“谜团”。……[关于谜团：]虽然作为具有直觉和洞察力的人类，我们可以说很多东西，但我认为，作为科学家，我们能说的东西很少。……有些人会拒绝接受对我们理解状态的这种评估。我并不建议在这里，我不打算争论这个观点，而是转向那些我认为可以进行[科学]探究的问题。（1975b:137，138–39）33

I would like to distinguish roughly between two kinds of issues that arise in the study of language and mind: those that appear to be within the reach of approaches and concepts that are moderately well understood—what I will call “problems”; and others that remain as obscure to us today as when they were originally formulated—what I will call “mysteries.” … [About mysteries:] although there is much that we can say as human beings with intuition and insight, there is little, I believe, that we can say as scientists. … Some would reject this evaluation of the state of our understanding. I do not propose to argue the point here, but rather to turn to the problems that do seem to me amenable to [scientific] inquiry. (1975b:137, 138–39)33

生成语义学家赞美神秘，而乔姆斯基回避神秘，这两种策略对在职语言学家的影响同样截然相反。莱科夫和罗斯的计划为他们提供了一个研究令人眼花缭乱的数据的机会，这些数据在未来几个世纪内可能仍是一个深奥的谜团；乔姆斯基的计划为他们提供了一个研究易解问题的机会。大多数人接受乔姆斯基的提议的原因并不令人感到奇怪。

The generative semanticists celebrated mysteries, Chomsky avoided them, and the implications of these two strategies for working linguists are equally antithetical. Lakoff and Ross’s program offered them a chance to work on dazzling data that promises to remain a deep mystery, perhaps for centuries to come; Chomsky’s offered them a chance to work on amenable problems. There is little mystery as to why the majority accepted Chomsky’s offer.

第十章

从何而来，又将去往何处

CHAPTER 10

Whence and Whither

（胜利的）群体是否会说其胜利的结果不够进步？

Will [the victorious] group ever say that the result of its victory has been something less than progress?

托马斯·库恩

Thomas Kuhn

忘记过去是一回事，而封住它的嘴又是另一回事。

It’s one thing putting away the past, and quite another to tape its mouth shut.

利亚姆·莱西

Liam Lacey

争议从何而来

Whence the Dispute

那么，发生了什么？

So, what happened?

为什么一开始就会出现分裂？乔姆斯基没有足够快地走向应许之地。句法结构对语义学做出了适度的承诺，这有助于吸引一大批热切的新成员。方面加剧了这些承诺。笛卡尔语言学加剧了它们。语言和思维加剧了它们。但是，除了通过摆脱广义变换来丰富深层结构之外，乔姆斯基自己几乎没有做任何事情来兑现这些承诺。福多尔、卡茨和波斯特尔所做的更直接的工作很有启发性，但却非常不完整。人们对意义谈论了很多，但行动不够。某种形式的具有更充分、更明确的语义的程序是不可避免的，从乔姆斯基最早的著作中可以清楚地看出，他永远不会在他的模型中让意义占主导地位。从乔姆斯基所写的每一个字中可以更清楚地看出，乔姆斯基不会放弃。因此，有新的计划，也有阻力，这必然会导致分裂。无论如何，这些都是局部原因；更普遍的答案是 Raup 的观察，即“新思想滋生分歧”（1986:150）。

Why was there a split in the first place? Chomsky was not moving quickly enough to the promised land. Syntactic Structures made modest promises about semantics, which helped attract a phalanx of eager recruits. Aspects compounded these promises. Cartesian Linguistics compounded them. Language and Mind compounded them. But, aside from his enrichment of deep structure by getting rid of generalized transformations, Chomsky did very little himself to satisfy those promises. The more direct work that had been done—by Fodor, Katz, and Postal—was suggestive, but dreadfully incomplete. There had been plenty of talk about meaning, but not enough action. Some form of program with a fuller, more explicit, semantics was inevitable, and it is clear from Chomsky’s earliest writings that he was never going to give meaning the controlling vote in his model. It is even clearer, from every word Chomsky has ever penned, that Chomsky was not going to give up. So, there was a new program and there was resistance, a guarantee for a schism. These, at any rate, are the local reasons; the more general answer is Raup’s observation that “new ideas breed disagreement” (1986:150).

为什么会如此激烈？同样，也有本地和一般原因。在本地，最明显的触发因素是个人因素：乔姆斯基尖刻、莱科夫粗鲁、杰肯多夫脾气暴躁；波斯特尔的执着承诺、道尔蒂的蔑视、麦考利天生无法摆脱的威胁，奇怪的是，他们没有一大早就带着两人的手枪和一人喝咖啡到河上旅行。更普遍的是，科学家往往是固执己见、敏感的人，偶尔会自我陶醉，他们往往会经常引起火花四溅。科学是一项充满活力的活动；霍布斯称其为“精神欲望”，甚至比肉欲更引人注目，使“任何肉欲的短暂热情”黯然失色 1991[1651]:42。它需要非凡的个人投入。它所吸引和诱导的人物，尤其是那些最成功的人，表现出强烈而热情的投入，每当激情与分歧或误解共存时，就不会有和平。1

Why was it so acrimonious? Again, there are local and general answers. Locally, the most obvious triggers are personal: Chomsky is biting, Lakoff is abrasive, Jackendoff is hot-tempered; stir in Postal’s dogged commitment, Dougherty’s scorn, McCawley’s congenital inability to let flung gauntlets lie, and the wonder is that there were no early morning trips up the river with pistols for two and coffee for one. More generally, scientists are often opinionated, touchy characters, given to occasional bouts of ego besotment, who tend to set sparks flying quite regularly. Science is a full-blooded activity; Hobbes calls it “a Lust of the mind” even more compelling than the lust of the body, paling the “short vehemence of any carnall Pleasure” 1991[1651]:42. It demands an extraordinary level of personal investment. The personalities it both attracts and induces, especially among those who are most successful at it, exhibit intense, passionate commitment, and whenever passion is in the same room with disagreement or misunderstanding there will not be peace.1

生成语义学为何消亡？大多数解释学家及其支持者给出的答案是 Fodor 的直白答案：“它没有得到证实。”答案很简单，但范围太狭隘。Katz-Postal 原则并不符合早期生成语义学框架中产生的数据，这是事实——大多数解释学家说该程序没有得到证实时就是这个意思——但框架已经转变以适应这些数据，更重要的是，要考虑的问题远不止单个前 Aspects 原则的活力。大多数生成语义学家给出的答案更有趣、更完整：用 Levi 的话来说，“它做出了无法兑现的承诺。”当然，它在兑现许多具体的承诺方面遇到了麻烦。例如，Ross 从未将他的表演分析进行得很深入，而 Lakoff 在提出全局语法后几乎立即放弃了它。甚至还有一批承诺出版的出版物（大部分由罗斯和拉科夫出版，但有时也涉及邮政杂志），这些出版物经常被引用来支持各种观点，但从未在媒体上发表。2无法兑现相对较小的承诺只是无法兑现较大承诺的症状，而正是在这里，兑现的不足真正损害了这场运动。当乔姆斯基在 60 年代中期因承诺了比他能兑现的更多的语义学而陷入困境时，他干脆收回了承诺；或者更确切地说，他不再谈论它了。当生成语义学家在 70 年代初陷入同样的​​困境时，他们做出了更大的承诺。不仅语义学，而且现在的语用学，都将遵守规定。它不仅可以处理语言的认知方面，而且现在还可以处理社会方面。它不仅可以解释离散现象，而且现在还可以解释模糊现象。不仅语言学将得到恢复，而且现在还可以恢复逻辑学。3然而，它的顾客——新兴的、新手的、中立的语言学家和邻近的学者——却不太愿意接受这些更大的期票。

Why did generative semantics die? The answer that most interpretivists and their sympathizers give is Fodor’s straightforward: “It was disconfirmed.” The answer is straightforward, but far too narrow. The Katz-Postal principle did not fit the data churned up in and around the early generative semantics framework, true—which is what most interpretivists mean when they say the program was disconfirmed—but the framework shifted to accommodate that data, and, more to the point, there were far more issues on the table than the vitality of a single pre-Aspects principle. The answer most generative semanticists give is more interesting and more complete: in Levi’s terms, “it made promises it couldn’t keep.” Certainly it had trouble living up to many specific promises. Ross, for instance, never took his performative analysis very far, and Lakoff pretty much abandoned global grammar as soon as he suggested it. There was even a slate of promised publications (largely by Ross and Lakoff, though sometimes involving Postal) which were routinely cited to bolster various points, but which never saw the light of the press.2 This inability to follow through on relatively minor promises was just symptomatic of an inability to come through on the larger ones, and it was here that the lack of delivery really hurt the movement. When Chomsky got himself into trouble in the mid-sixties by promising more semantics than he could deliver, he simply retracted the promise; or, rather, he stopped talking about it. When the generative semanticists got into the same deep water in the early seventies, they made bigger promises. Not only semantics, but now pragmatics, was going to fall into line. Not only would it handle the cognitive aspects of language, but now the social aspects. Not only would it account for discrete phenomena, but now fuzzy phenomena. Not only would linguistics be rehabilitated, but now logic.3 Its customers, however—the nascent, neophyte, and neutral linguists, and neighboring scholars—showed little willingness to accept these grander promissory notes.

当你第一次看到早期生成语义学中不断增长的深邃之树时，你可能会觉得它有点像《戴高帽的猫》里的那条鱼：

You may have felt, when you first saw the deep, deep, growing deeper trees of early generative semantics a little like the fish in The Cat in the Hat:

这个混乱局面

And this mess is so big

如此深，如此高

And so deep and so tall

我们无法将其捡起

We cannot pick it up

根本没有办法啊！

There is no way at all!

但这些树带来了一大批句柄——表演句柄、逻辑句柄、转换句柄——语言学家可以使用它们来完成这类工作。到了后期生成语义学，情况就大不相同了。这场运动变得如此笨重，以至于句柄毫无价值。即使是同情的语言学家也只剩下对语言这个整体、混乱、混合、社会心理、符号化的东西有了全新的认识。

But those trees came with a whole army of handles—performative handles, logical handles, transformational handles—that linguists could use to pick up such work. By late generative semantics, the situation was very different. The movement had grown so unwieldy that the handles were worthless. Even sympathetic linguists were left with nothing but a vast new view of the whole, messy, commingling, socialmental, signifying thingamajig, language.

也就是说，生成语义学失败的原因与大多数研究项目失败的原因相同。如果不给科学家一些事情做，你就无法让他们的注意力持续太久。他们需要把柄。他们需要结果。产生生成语义学的动力从未消失，但蒙塔古语法、关系语法和非生成方法现在看起来更有希望了。此外，乔姆斯基为语言学家设计了另一种动机，限制了语法，并为他们提供了一套新的工具。

Generative semantics, that is, failed for the reason most research programs fail. You can’t keep scientists’ attention for too long without giving them something to do. They need handles. They need results. The motive forces that gave rise to generative semantics never went away, but Montague grammar, and relational grammar, and nongenerative approaches now looked much more promising. Too, Chomsky engineered another motivation for linguists, restricting the grammar, and provided them with a new set of tools.

后果

The Aftermath

1. 生成语义不够明确……

1. Generative semantics is not sufficiently explicit ….

2. 生成语义学是句法不规则性的滋生地……

2. Generative semantics is a breeding ground for syntactic irregularity ….

3. 生成语义学是前科学的……

3. Generative semantics is prescientific ….

4.生成语义学是反抽象主义的……

4. Generative semantics is antiabstractionist ….

5. 生成语义学放弃了对普遍性的追求……

5. Generative semantics gives up the quest for universals ….

除了这些观点之外，我认为可以准确地说，生成语义学几乎在它所提出的每一个用于分析英语语法片段的建议或建议上都失败了。

In addition to these points, I think it can be accurately said that generative semantics fails on almost every single proposal or suggestion for the analysis of a fragment of English grammar that it has advanced.

迈克尔·布雷姆

Michael Brame

乔姆斯基的第一代毕业生接受了以布卢姆菲尔德派为重点的“坏人”课程的灌输；下一批令人印象深刻的毕业生则接受了以生成语义学家为重点的“坏人”课程的灌输，他们一开始就带着和前辈一样的热情。七十年代中期并不是成为生成语义学家的好时机。

The first generation of Chomsky’s graduates had been indoctrinated with Bad Guys courses which focused on the Bloomfieldians; the next impressive crop went through Bad Guys courses which focused on the generative semanticists, and they came out of the gate with the same gusto that their predecessors had. The mid-seventies was not a good time to be a generative semanticist.

当时充斥着攻击生成语义学的文章。其主题不是“语言学家 y 的提议 × 是错误的”，而是“生成语义学完全破产、不科学、空洞，被误导的 y 的提议 x 的问题就说明了这一点”。许多这样的文章都是自觉地宣告生成语义学的死亡，而且它们并没有止步于对一两个或三个生成语义学立场的反驳。他们滔滔不绝地列举了一大堆失败的例子——将钉子钉入棺材，将其扔进坟墓，用铲子将泥土覆盖，并竖立墓碑，上面写着像 Brame 的“最终裁决” (1976:67) 那样的墓志铭。

Generative-semantics-bashing articles were the order of the day. The themes were not “proposal × from linguist y is wrong” so much as “generative semantics is totally bankrupt, unscientific, and vacuous, which is illustrated by problems with proposal x, from the misguided y.” Many of these articles were self-conscious proclamations of the death of generative semantics, and they didn’t stop with counterarguments to one or two or three generative semantic positions. They reeled off long catalogs of failures—driving nails into the coffin, chucking it into a grave, shoveling dirt over it, and erecting tombstones with epitaphs like Brame’s “Final Verdict” (1976:67).

事实上，布雷姆是这一趋势顶峰的代表人物，他的《句法和语义学中的猜想与反驳》就是墓志铭的来源。它很少能与道尔蒂的长篇大论（大多来自这一时期）的公开敌意相提并论，但它却无可救药地尖刻。例如，其中一部分以一句警句开头，将爱因斯坦比作变形虫，“变形虫无法对自己的期望和假设持批判态度”，随后是拉科夫的一句警句，布雷姆显然认为这体现了这种变形虫般的行为（1976:3）。4在其他地方，他诉诸学术上的自命不凡，比如在生成语义学的引文中偷偷地插入一个sic （“如果我们采用这种解释 [ sic ]”——1976:58），并称全球规则为“理论上的预防措施”（1976:45）。在其他地方，他直接侮辱了这本书，比如当他称莱考夫的一项分析“只不过是对无趣事实的曲折描述”（1976:15）。格林对这本书的评价是“如此不合理和一篇带有偏见的论文（我不称其为小册子）”（1981:704）——在其系统性的、症状性的尖刻批评面前显得十分温和。

Brame, in fact, is the epitome of the apogee of the trend, with his Conjectures and Refutations in Syntax and Semantics, whence the epitaph comes. It rarely matches the overt hostility of Dougherty’s diatribes (which mostly date from this period), but it is irredeemably snarky. One section, for instance, begins with an epigram contrasting Einstein to an amoeba, “which cannot be critical vis-à-vis its expectations and hypotheses,” followed by an epigraph from Lakoff which Brame clearly regards as demonstrating this amoeba-like behavior (1976:3).4 In other places he resorts to academic priggeries, like slipping a sic snidely into a generative semanticist quotation (“if we adopt this explanation [sic]”—1976:58) and calling global rules a “theoretical prophylactic” (1976:45). Elsewhere, he simply insults the work directly, as when he calls one of Lakoff’s analyses “no more than a tortuous description of uninteresting facts” (1976:15). Green’s appraisal of the book—“so unreasoned and prejudicial a treatise (I refrain from calling it a tract)” (1981:704)—is positively tame in the face of its systematic, symptomatic vitriol.

新解释主义者的攻击和讣告还受到一些老派支持者的攻击，其中一些人效忠乔姆斯基，另一些人效忠乔姆斯基 1965 年的立场。当然，卡茨是这支队伍的领头人（1970、1971、1972a、1976），但贝弗（Katz and Bever，1976 [1974]）和斯托克韦尔（1977:131）等人也加入了他的行列。表面上不结盟的语言学家也开始加入进来（Kuiper，1975；O'Donnell，1974；Sinha，1977b）。乔姆斯基在他的理论著作中没有提到生成语义学，除非是相当间接地提到（例如，在脚注中，甚至没有提到其支持者之一的名字——1975b:238n2），但他继续在非正式场合，特别是在访谈中，对它不屑一顾（例如，Parret，1974 [1972]；Chomsky，1979 [1976]；1982a [1979-80]）。一些幻灭的生成语义学家甚至还泼了几把脏水，比如 Sadock 的《生成语义学的软解释性弱点》（1975）。

The attacks and obituaries from the new interpretivist crop were augmented by several assaults from older loyalists, some with allegiances to Chomsky, others with allegiances to his 1965 position. Katz, of course, was at the head of this contingent (1970, 1971, 1972a, 1976), but he was joined by Bever (Katz and Bever, 1976 [1974]) and Stockwell (1977:131), among others. Ostensibly nonaligned linguists also began to chime in (Kuiper, 1975; O’Donnell, 1974; Sinha, 1977b). Chomsky did not address generative semantics in his theoretical work, except rather obliquely (for instance, in a footnote which does not so much as name one of its proponents—1975b:238n2), but continued, and continues, to dismiss it in more informal settings, particularly in interviews (for instance, Parret, 1974 [1972]; Chomsky, 1979 [1976]; 1982a [1979–80]). Some disillusioned generative semanticists even threw a few handfuls of dirt, as in Sadock’s “The Soft, Interpretive Underbelly of Generative Semantics” (1975).

这些出版物最有趣的特点是反复把乔治·莱考夫当替罪羊，这有两种截然相反的表现。一方面，人们经常暗示莱考夫对生成语义学的起源没有任何重大责任。生成语义学的起源“实际上”是波斯特尔的理论，他从乔姆斯基那里发展出了一些有意义的建议。另一方面，莱考夫几乎要为该理论的过度发展承担所有责任，主要是因为他提出了全球规则。也就是说，就生成语义学的自然发展、有希望的假设、发现任何有价值的东西等等而言，这要归功于波斯特尔，最终要归功于乔姆斯基；就生成语义学的错误、不科学、挥霍无度、马虎和总体上疯狂而言，莱考夫应该受到指责。莱科夫不过是一个大嘴巴的机会主义者，他破坏了一个可能有用的研究计划，这种说法有许多潜在的动机，但其中很大一部分肯定是源于乔姆斯基对莱科夫的极度漠视。例如，即使在炮轰基本停止之后，乔姆斯基仍然讨论了莱科夫的一些批评，并抨击他营养不良 (1980a:46)：

The most interesting feature of these publications is the recurrent scapegoating of George Lakoff, which had two quite contrary manifestations. On the one hand, it was routinely implied that Lakoff was not responsible in any significant way for the beginnings of generative semantics. It was “really” Postal’s theory, who had developed some pregnant suggestions from Chomsky. On the other hand, Lakoff was made to shoulder virtually all the blame for its excesses, largely on the basis of the sin of proposing global rules. That is, insofar as generative semantics had been a natural development, had been a promising hypothesis, had uncovered anything of value, and so on, this was due to Postal, and ultimately to Chomsky; insofar as it was wrong, unscientific, profligate, sloppy, and generally bonkers, Lakoff was to blame. The implication that Lakoff was little more than a loudmouthed opportunist, who perverted a potentially useful research program, has a number of underlying motives, but much of it surely stems from Chomsky’s extreme disregard for Lakoff. Even after the shelling had pretty much stopped, for instance, Chomsky discussed some of Lakoff’s criticisms and blasts him for a severely undernourished cranium (1980a:46):

[拉科夫]的言论暴露出一个非常严重的误解。

[Lakoff’s] remarks betray a very serious misunderstanding.

[他]没有表现出[对重要问题的]认识。

[He] shows no awareness [of important issues].

拉科夫似乎完全没有意识到他所指的技术工作的实际性质。

Lakoff seems totally unaware of the actual character of the technical work to which he refers.

[解释语义学的语义工作]是拉科夫从未理解的事情。

[The semantic work of interpretive semantics is] a matter Lakoff has never understood.

拉科夫对技术工作的误解是如此深远，以至于他对此的评论完全不相关。

Lakoff’s misunderstanding of the technical work is so far-reaching that his comments on it are completely irrelevant.

拉科夫没有意识到这些问题。

Lakoff shows no awareness of these issues.

乔姆斯基的态度肯定渗透到了他在麻省理工学院关于生成语义学的讨论中，并最终渗透到了他的学生中。5

Chomsky’s attitude must have permeated his discussions of generative semantics at MIT, and consequently permeated his students.5

拉科夫则不太喜欢乔姆斯基。在谈话中，这种不满表现在对他的政治观点、诚实和自负的担忧上（三在许多关于乔姆斯基的不利讨论中，莱考夫经常提到一些主题（这些主题在许多对乔姆斯基的不利讨论中占有突出地位），但在印刷品中他比乔姆斯基谨慎得多。尽管如此，莱考夫很少放弃热情攻击乔姆斯基立场的机会。例如，最后一段中引用的乔姆斯基的话来自《行为与脑科学》杂志，该杂志专门对个别思想家进行广泛批评，然后给他们回应的机会。这一期专门针对乔姆斯基。许多非常有能力的批评家，包括麦考利、莱考夫和丹尼特，都瞄准了乔姆斯基的总体纲领，其中一些人的批评非常尖锐；乔姆斯基对莱考夫的言论最为愤慨。这是有原因的。乔姆斯基很容易生气，莱考夫很可能在很多方面惹恼了他，但他直指乔姆斯基最敏感的领域，称他只说空话，没有科学。拉科夫关注的是乔姆斯基作品中“属于修辞学而非科学的领域”的部分。拉科夫说，乔姆斯基的很多作品对于实用目的而言都是空洞的，“但作为修辞学，它是有效的——至少就学术政治而言。”乔姆斯基尤其因“巧妙选择”一些术语而受到指责，乔姆斯基对此深感厌恶。

For his part, Lakoff is less than fond of Chomsky. In conversation, this disaffection takes the form of concerns about his politics, his honesty, and his ego (three subjects that figure prominently in many unfavorable discussions about Chomsky). But in print he is considerably more circumspect than Chomsky. Still, Lakoff rarely foregoes the chance to attack a Chomskyan stance, with enthusiasm. For instance, the quotations from Chomsky in the last paragraph come from a journal, The Behavioral and Brain Sciences, which devotes issues to extensive criticism of individual thinkers and then gives them a chance to respond. This particular issue was devoted to Chomsky. Many very able critics, including McCawley, Lakoff, and Dennett, took aim at Chomsky’s general program, some of them with very stinging blows; Chomsky took greatest umbrage at Lakoff’s comments. For good reason. Chomsky takes offense quite easily, and Lakoff could likely have annoyed him in any number of ways, but he goes right for Chomsky’s most sensitive area, calling him all talk and no science. Lakoff focuses on those aspects of Chomsky’s work where “we are in the realm of rhetoric, not science.” Much of Chomsky’s work, Lakoff says, is vacuous for practical purposes, “but as rhetoric, it is effective—at least so far as academic politics is concerned.” Chomsky is particularly guilty for having “artfully chosen” some of his terms, an accusation Chomsky finds deeply repugnant.

毫无疑问，尽管乔姆斯基不喜欢这种观察，但他是一位非常熟练的修辞家。他并不是一位特别令人印象深刻的散文家。他的作品可能像黑莓园一样密集、扭曲和令人生畏，满是你能看见但无法触及的果实，尽管乔姆斯基也能达到语言学中无与伦比的说服力。他最有影响力的是在口头上，以及最初为口头表达而写的书中（《句法结构、反思、语言和知识问题》）。所有这些都使得乔姆斯基版本的生成语义学故事成为公认的观点绝非巧合——它很早就被否定了，但它的实践者仍然荒谬地坚持它，把它变成了最糟糕的理论，结果他们因不合理和错误而被赶出该领域。他的观点往往会牢牢地印在听众的脑海中。

There is certainly no question—whatever Chomsky’s distaste for the observation—that he is a tremendously skilled rhetor. He isn’t an especially impressive prose stylist. His writing can be as dense, gnarled, and forbidding as a blackberry patch, full of fruit you can see but you just can’t get to, though Chomsky can also reach moments of persuasive lucidity unmatched in linguistics. He is at his most powerful orally and in books originally meant for oral presentation (Syntactic Structures, Reflections, Language and Problems of Knowledge). All of which makes it no coincidence that Chomsky’s version of the generative semantics story—that it was disconfirmed early, but its practitioners absurdly clung to it anyway by changing it into the worst possible theory, whereupon they were driven from the field for irrationality and error—is the received view. His opinions tend to stick fast in the minds of his audience.

首先，生成语义学通常被忽略。大多数当前的语法文本反映了库恩的观察，即科学“有一种持续的倾向，使[它们]自己的历史……看起来是线性的和累积的”(1970:139)，根本没有提到分裂。但最近两个异常现象表明，正统的、因非理性和错误而被赶出该领域的立场导致了这种沉默。范·里姆斯戴克和威廉姆斯的《语法理论导论》提到这场争论只是为了为忽视它提供借口，因为它“主要的历史作用一直是作为发展当前语义学概念的催化剂”(1986:88)。霍罗克斯的《生成语法》同样将其抛在一边，告诉我们生成语义学

Generative semantics is, first, usually ignored. Most current grammar texts, reflecting Kuhn’s observation that sciences have “a persistent tendency to make [their] own history … look linear and cumulative” (1970:139), simply do not mention the schism at all. But two recent anomalies suggest the orthodox, driven-from-the-field-for-irrationality-and-error position informing that silence. Van Riemsdijk and Williams’s Introduction to the Theory of Grammar mentions the dispute only to offer an excuse for ignoring it, since its “main historical role has been to serve as a catalyst in developing the current conception of semantics” (1986:88). Horrocks’s Generative Grammar, similarly sweeping it aside, tells us that generative semantics

被抛弃了，因为越来越明显的是，执行映射操作（从语义到语法）所需的规则系统必须非常复杂，并且充满例外情况。这肯定表明人们看待事物的方式是错误的。（1987：14-15）

was abandoned as it became increasingly clear that the rule systems necessary to carry out the mapping operation [from semantics to syntax] would have to be enormously complex and riddled with exceptions. This was a sure sign that things were being looked at in the wrong way. (1987:14–15)

当他们注意到生成语义学时，对乔姆斯基作品的推广也遵循了同样的轻蔑模式。例如，尼尔·史密斯 (Neil Smith) 的《推特机器》(Twitter Machine)标题奇怪，其中偶尔提到生成语义学，最突出的是题为“语言学作为一种宗教”的章节，它对生成语义学进行了惯常的污蔑语义学家们指责他们过度滥用描述性语言——其实践者们就像圣人一样，“他们用奇迹治愈头痛，也用奇迹使人起死回生：这无疑是一种有效的技术，但当不那么激烈的措施就足够时，这种技术似乎有点过度了。”不出所料，人们认为乔姆斯基拯救了语言学，使其免于这种有害的倾向：“生成语义学家们在扩大转换规则的领域和力量的同时，乔姆斯基却建议对任何语法规则进行严格的限制。”理性的力量导致了这场运动的消亡：“反例……导致了生成语义学的消亡”（1989:201）。拉斐尔·萨尔基的《乔姆斯基更新》同样指责生成语义学过度滥用科学（1990:116-19）。简而言之，生成语义学 (1) 是错误的；(2) 被证明是错误的；(3) 在最令人震惊的错误中，它变得描述性肆意；而且，顺便说一句，(4) 它的实践者太愚蠢，没有意识到他们错了。

Popularizations of Chomsky’s work follow the same dismissive pattern, when they notice generative semantics at all. Neil Smith’s oddly titled Twitter Machine, for instance, mentions generative semantics sporadically, most prominently in a chapter entitled “Linguistics as a Religion,” which spatters the usual mud on generative semanticists for descriptive profligacy—its practitioners were like saints who “used miracles to cure headaches as well as to raise people from the dead: an effective technique, no doubt, but one that seems a little excessive when less drastic measures would be adequate.” Chomsky, as expected, is credited with saving linguistics from this pernicious tendency: “At the same time as the Generative Semanticists were expanding the domain and power of transformational rules, Chomsky was suggesting stringent constraints on any rule of grammar.” And the power of rationality led to the movement’s death: “Counter example … led to the demise of Generative Semantics” (1989:201). Raphael Salkie’s The Chomsky Update similarly indicts generative semantics for unscientific excesses (1990:116–19). In brief, generative semantics (1) is wrong, (2) was proven wrong, (3) in the most egregious of its wrongs, became descriptively wanton, and, by the way, (4) its practitioners were too muttonheaded to see that they were wrong.

罗斯是这些傻瓜中最有趣的例子，因为语言学界对他有太多令人震惊的负面和误导性的看法。在枯燥的学术层面上，他只不过是一个好奇心强的人——例如，在范里姆斯戴克和威廉姆斯的《导言》中。罗斯关于岛屿约束的论文不仅是范里姆斯戴克和威廉姆斯在他们的书中倡导的语法理论的关键定义文本之一，而且在整个语言学中具有巨大的影响力；每个句法模型都必须与罗斯在他的论文中探讨的现象和原则相一致，否则就不会被认真对待。然而（正如约翰·戈德史密斯在一篇透彻的评论中所展示的那样），从他们的书中浮现出的罗斯形象是一个流氓官员，对自己偶然发现的东西只有最模糊的线索。最奇怪的是，在他们的导言中——这本书的本质就是为未来几代语言学家奠定基础——强烈暗示罗斯只关心英语的一些琐碎细节，而事实上“罗斯的论文是第一个（在当时是令人兴奋的）大规模跨语言研究抽象语法属性的研究，他的结论是在理论层面上陈述的，而不是语言特定属性的层面”（Goldsmith，1989：151）。6从个人角度来看，在许多解释学家和一些生成语义学家的回顾中，罗斯被不友好地视为一场思想悲剧，这位金发男孩在乔姆斯基的监督下做出了一些有前途的工作，但却与坏人为伍，误入歧途，这位冉冉升起的新星崛起得太快，最终精疲力竭，一场大脑皮层自杀。事实上，有时故事是这样说的：“他服用了太多的迷幻药，再也没有恢复过来。”

Ross is the most interesting case of these muttonheads, because there are so many appallingly negative and misinformed notions floating around linguistics about him. On the desiccated academic level, he shows up as little more than a curiosity—for instance, in van Riemsdijk and Williams’s Introduction. Ross’s thesis on island constraints is not only one of the critical defining texts of the grammatical theory van Riemsdijk and Williams champion in their book, it is hugely influential in linguistics generally; every syntactic model is forced to come to terms with the phenomena and principles Ross explored in his thesis, or it simply wouldn’t be taken seriously. Yet (as John Goldsmith shows in a penetrating review) the image of Ross that emerges from their book is of a lumpen functionary who had only the vaguest of clues about what he stumbled onto. Most curiously, there is a strong suggestion in their Introduction—a book which, by its very nature is meant to define future generations of linguists—that Ross was only concerned with a few petty details of English, when in fact “Ross’s thesis was the first (and, at the time, mind-blowing) massively crosslinguistic study of an abstract grammatical property, and his conclusions were stated at the level of theory, not that of [a] language-particular property” (Goldsmith, 1989:151).6 On a more personal level, in many interpretivists’ retrospections, and in some generative semanticists’ retrospections, Ross is regarded, unkindly, as an intellectual tragedy, the fair-haired boy who did some promising work under the watchful eye of Chomsky, but who fell into bad company and went astray, the rising star who rose too fast and burned out, a cortical suicide. Sometimes, in fact, the story goes, “He took too much acid and never recovered.”

然而，任何熟悉他、他目前的工作和大脑容量的人都知道，这些故事——至少就误入歧途、精疲力竭或变成化学诱导的芜菁而言——都是假的，而且，如果不是恶意的，就是无知的。他确实经历过一段智力低下的时期，试图在他所谓的“黑洞”——麻省理工学院语言学系——中生存下来。7他的研究不仅完全没能在那里的研究生中立足，而那里是科学界唯一真正有价值的思想市场，他还遭遇了一些令人不安的骚扰。例如，他的一名助教回忆道

Anyone familiar with him and his current work and his cortical capacity, however, knows that these stories—at least insofar as going astray or burning out or turning into a chemically induced rutabaga is concerned—are false and, where not malicious, ignorant. He certainly went through a period of intellectual depression, trying to survive in what he calls the “Black Hole,” the linguistics department at MIT.7 Not only did his research completely fail to get a toehold among the graduate students there, the only market for ideas that really counts in science, he also encountered some disquieting harassment. One of his teaching assistants, for instance, recalls that

每个学期至少三次，系主任会打电话到我家，问我 Háj 是否按时上课，是否教授课程，等等。等等。当然，他没有研究生课程，他们会“忘记”邀请他参加教职工会议，等等。关于他的笑话比比皆是。

at least three times a semester, the department head would call me up at home and ask me if Háj was showing up for classes on time, if he taught the curriculum, bla, bla, bla.… And of course, he got no graduate courses, and they’d “forget” to invite him to faculty meetings, and on and on. The jokes about him abounded.

当然，这种骚扰是出于不情愿的——罗斯在个人层面上深受大家喜爱，尽管只有肯尼斯·黑尔被单独挑出作为经常为他出头的人——但良好的意图可能并没有使情况变得不那么令人不快或令人衰弱。

The harassment was reluctant, surely—Ross was well liked on a personal level by everyone, though only Kenneth Hale is singled out as someone who regularly went to bat for him—but good intentions probably didn’t make the situation any less unpleasant, or debilitating.

问题在于，他的兴趣已经远离了麻省理工学院的重心，看起来他已经脱离了研究的边缘。离重心有多远？乔姆斯基对语言学的定义是，将顽固的数据留在最边缘，而罗斯是一个数据贩子，“一只可爱的熊，在语言树的空心部分发现了一个蜂蜜储藏处，并不断为它的奇妙而惊讶”(Bolinger，1991 [1974]：29)。乔姆斯基对语言学的定义是，将语言的美学元素留在理性探究星系中某个冷漠而遥远的地方，而罗斯确信“试图研究已经抽离了所有美学的语言学最终是毫无意义的。”乔姆斯基以文学批评作为反面例子来定义语言学，认为这种分析和思考方式是语言学家应该像对待患痘痘的求婚者一样避免的，而罗斯则主要转向诗学。最终，他在不愉快的情况下离开了麻省理工学院。

The problem was that his interests had moved so far from MIT’s center of gravity that he looked like he had just spun himself off into the outer reaches of research. How far from the center of gravity? Chomsky defines linguistics in a way that leaves recalcitrant data on the extreme periphery, and Ross is a data-monger, “a lovable bear who has found a cache of honey in a hollow part of the language tree and is continually astonished at the wonder of it” (Bolinger, 1991 [1974]:29). Chomsky defines linguistics in a way that leaves the aesthetic elements of language in some cold and distant stretch of the galaxy of rational inquiry, and Ross became convinced “that trying to do linguistics which has had all its aesthetics siphoned off is ultimately pointless.” Chomsky defines linguistics in a way that draws on literary criticism as a negative example, the style of analysis and thought that linguists should avoid like a poxed wooer, and Ross has moved largely into poetics. Eventually, he left MIT in unpleasant circumstances.

他的作品中再也没有明显的生成性，也没有什么与他在《阿斯派克特》之后的尝试相似之处——没有大树，没有变形，没有过滤器和限制（尽管他仍然完全掌握了这些材料）——但他从深度变形语义学到实用主义再到诗歌的进步有一定的必然性。形式语言学和语言的审美使用之间存在着连续性，而罗斯已经走过了这条路。

There is nothing recognizably generative in his work any longer, and nothing that much resembles his post-Aspects forays—no huge trees, no transformations, no filters and constraints (though he still has complete command of that material)—but there is a certain inevitability to his progression through deep transformational semantics into pragmantax into poetry. There is a continuum between formal linguistics and the aesthetic use of language, and Ross has traveled it.

莱考夫的进步也是可辨认的、合理的，这也使他进入了语言的美学维度（Lakoff and Turner，1989），但莱考夫从生成语义学出发的路径比罗斯的路径更容易追踪，这在很大程度上是因为莱考夫为其提供了路线图，目的地明确标明为“生成语义学更新”（Lakoff，1987：582）。事实上，他的立场可能更接近他在生成语义学方面的工作，而不是乔姆斯基目前的工作与他的后Aspects时期的工作；没有明确的方法来进行这种比较。当然——也许最相关的是——他的工作与乔姆斯基的工作之间的距离，就像他的机构伯克利分校与乔姆斯基的机构之间的距离一样（顺便说一句，罗斯在新加坡）。关于他的传言，至少在某些地方，是“他甚至不再做语言学了”，好像语言学是看待语言的唯一方式，或者，好像只有一种方式来研究语言学。

The progression for Lakoff, too, is a recognizable and rational one, one which has also landed him in the aesthetic dimensions of language (Lakoff and Turner, 1989), but Lakoff’s path from generative semantics is a good deal easier to trace than Ross’s, in large part because Lakoff has provided a road map for it, with the destination clearly labeled, “Generative Semantics Updated” (Lakoff, 1987:582). His position may, in fact, be closer to his work in generative semantics than Chomsky’s current work is to his post-Aspects period; there is no clear-cut way to make such comparisons. Certainly—what is perhaps most relevant—his work is about as far from Chomsky’s as his institution, Berkeley, is from Chomsky’s (Ross, by the way, is in Singapore). The hallway scuttlebutt about him, at least in some hallways, is that “he’s not even doing linguistics anymore,” as if linguistics was the only way to look at language or, for that matter, as if there was only one way to do linguistics.

麦考利目前的工作在早期生成语义学传统中比罗斯或莱考夫的作品更具辨识度；贝弗称他为“真正的生成语义学派中最真实的人”。但（继续地理主题）他处于剑桥和伯克利之间，仍然在芝加哥，从语言学上讲，他也处于乔姆斯基和莱考夫之间的某个中间点。他发展了一种奇妙的市场驱动的科学哲学，每一项提议都可以付费获得，无论它来自哪里或谁，也无论它的提议者认为采用它所必需的辅助信念或机制是什么。他非常高兴地采用了一种版本例如，他赞同埃蒙兹对结构保持转换、词根转换和局部转换的区分，同时又保留了转换的完整目录、最深层句法和语义之间的密切关系、对数据的尊重以及坚决拒绝承认语法概念的任何用处。对于这种工具、承诺和观点的混合体，他拒绝给出比语言学更具体的名字，人们认为他过于独特，无法对该领域产生任何系统性影响。每个人都读过他的作品，每个人都认可他的才华，每个人都能从他的见解中学到一些具有挑战性和回报性的东西，但没有人真正按照他的形象来做句法。和萨丕尔一样，他不是那种赞助学校的人。

McCawley’s current work is much more recognizably in the early generative semantics tradition than Ross’s or Lakoff’s; Bever calls him “the truest of the true GSers.” But (continuing with the geographic theme) he is midway between Cambridge and Berkeley, still in Chicago, and linguistically he is somewhere toward the midpoint between Chomsky and Lakoff as well. He has developed a wonderfully market-driven philosophy of science, where every proposal is available for a price, no matter where or who it comes from, or what auxiliary beliefs or mechanisms its proposer regards as essential to its adoption. He has quite cheerfully adopted a version of -syntax, for instance, and endorses Emonds’s distinction among structurepreserving, root, and local transformations, while maintaining a full catalog of transformations, an intimate relationship between the deepest syntactic level and semantics, a reverence for data, and a steadfast refusal to concede any usefulness to the notion, grammatical. This mélange of tools, commitments and perspectives, he refuses to give a name more specific than linguistics, and he is viewed as too idiosyncratic to have any systematic influence on the field. Everybody reads his work, everybody recognizes his brilliance, and everyone finds something challenging and rewarding they can take from his insights, but nobody really does syntax in his image. Like Sapir, he is not the sort to sponsor a school.

说到学校赞助，我们应该暂时回到一个非常适合赞助学校的人，Lakoff。他已成为过去十年发展最快的语言学方法——认知语法的领军人物。这个名字应该很熟悉。这是他与 Henry Thompson 一起参与的 70 年代中期项目之一的遗留成果（Lakoff 和 Thompson，1975a；1975b）。8但十年后罗纳德·兰盖克 (Ronald Langacker) 出版的《认知语法基础》(Foundations of Cognitive Grammar ) （1987 年；恰好 Lakoff 和 Thompson 提供了这个标签——兰盖克曾称他的框架为空间语法，现在有时仍这样称呼）。Lakoff 同年出版的著作《女人、火和危险事物》 (Women, Fire, and Dangerous Things) 使他迅速成为认知语法领域的领军人物，但关于他不再从事语言学的传言部分属实，因为他没有做任何类似形式语言建模的事情；甚至他与兰盖克框架的联系也只是边缘性的；他是与框架并行工作的，而不是框架内的工作。9他最出名的研究是意象簇研究（Lakoff and Johnson，1980；Lakoff and Turner，1989）——该研究与文学批评、语言学和修辞理论的关系比与语言学的关系更密切——而他对认知语法最引人注目的贡献是将这些意象簇作为意象图式进行研究。

Speaking of school-sponsoring, we should return for a moment to someone who is very much the sort to sponsor a school, Lakoff. He has become a leading figure in the most rapidly expanding linguistic approach of the last decade, cognitive grammar. The name should be familiar. It’s a holdover from one of the mid-seventies projects he was involved in, with Henry Thompson (Lakoff and Thompson, 1975a; 1975b).8 But a huge impetus came from Ronald Langacker’s decade-later Foundations of Cognitive Grammar (1987; it’s just as well that Lakoff and Thompson provide the label—Langacker wanted to call his framework, and still does on occasion, space grammar). Lakoff’s book of the same year, Women, Fire, and Dangerous Things, moved him very quickly to the forefront of cognitive grammar, but the not-doing-linguistics-anymore scuttlebutt about him is partially true, in that he is not doing anything resembling formal language modeling; even his association with Langacker’s framework is somewhat peripheral; he works alongside the framework, rather than within it.9 He is best known for his studies of image clusters (Lakoff and Johnson, 1980; Lakoff and Turner, 1989)—which have closer ties to literary criticism, philology, and rhetorical theory, than they do to linguistics—and his most noted contribution to cognitive grammar is the investigation of these clusters as image schemas.

Cliff's Notes 版本的拉科夫职业生涯是这样的：由于替罪羊运动、他自己的布朗运动理论风格，以及他如此公开地反对乔姆斯基和彼得斯-里奇发现引发的限制性潮流，他语言学界的声誉一度受到影响，但他现在又恢复了巅峰。

The Cliff’s Notes version of Lakoff’s career is that his reputation in linguistics suffered for a while as a result of the scapegoating campaign, of his own Brownianmotion style of theorizing, and of his thrashing so publicly against the restrictiveness tide initiated by Chomsky and the Peters-Ritchie findings, but he is back on top.

不同的语言学家有着不同的故事，但总的来说，当莱考夫向船上宣扬全球规则时，那些没有抛弃救生艇、离开生成语义学这艘好船的人，仍然在追求从这次航行中产生的兴趣。罗宾·莱考夫是她自己独特的社会语言学家和日常语言哲学家。盖伊·卡登仍然把他的工作视为抽象句法。乔治亚·格林最近出版了一本关于语用学的书 (1989)。劳伦斯·霍恩刚刚创作了《否定的自然史》，这是一部细致而灵活地讲述一个语义概念和数据贩子天堂的故事 (1989)。彼得·瑟伦在他的话语著作中仍然高举生成语义学火炬 (1985:120-26)。甚至杰罗德·萨多克（Jerrold Sadock）——他目前正在研究一个具有深刻的乔姆斯基指导原则的模型（1985b；1991）——也曾这样非正式地赞美我生成语义学：“这就是我成为生成语义学家的原因。是？是？我不知道。”而且几乎每一个生成语义学家，无论是现在还是过去，都有一种深刻而坚信如果不相信意义必然会影响任何分析，那么语言学研究就毫无意义：他们把这个教训视为生成语义学最重要的遗产。还有其他人。

The story is different for different linguists, but, in general, those who didn’t drop the life-boats and row away from the good ship Generative Semantics when Lakoff piped global rules aboard, are still pursuing interests that grew out of the voyage. Robin Lakoff is her own inimitable brand of sociolinguist and ordinary language philosopher. Guy Carden still regards his work as abstract syntax. Georgia Green has recently published a book on pragmatics (1989). Laurence Horn has just produced A Natural History of Negation, a meticulous and flexible tale of one semantic concept, and a data-monger’s heaven (1989). Pieter Seuren is still carrying a generative semantics torch in his discourse work (1985:120–26). Even Jerrold Sadock, who is currently up to his elbows in a model with some deeply Chomskyan guiding principles (1985b; 1991), ended one informal paean to me about generative semantics with “That’s why I am a generative semanticist. Am? Was? I don’t know.” And virtually every generative semanticist, of the is or the was variety, has a deep and abiding conviction that it is completely fruitless to do linguistics without faith in the ineluctability of meaning to horn in on any and every analysis: they take that lesson as the most important legacy of generative semantics. There are others.

简单来说（为什么现在就停下来？），生成语义学遗产有两大类，一类是完全反对乔姆斯基和大多数乔姆斯基主义的东西，另一类是坚持大多数乔姆斯基主义的东西（尽管有时这种坚持涉及反对乔姆斯基——最明显的例子是广义短语结构语法，它使乔姆斯基早期对精确建模的承诺与他背道而驰，以及词汇功能语法，它使他的词汇主义假设与他后期作品中残留的转换主义背道而驰）。在第一种情况下，生成语义学充当了楔子的薄边，将语境、变化和瞬时语言形成的狡猾、实用主义的猪带回了该领域。它在这方面的核心遗产是语用学和认知语言学，尽管它也帮助了社会语言学、功能主义和其他类型的体内语言学的出现。对于这些领域的工作者来说，当他们进行历史反思时，生成语义学就像是阿拉莫大屠杀，一场光荣的大屠杀。

To oversimplify (why stop now?), there are two general classes of generative semantics legacy, one defined in terms of wholesale opposition to Chomsky and most things Chomskyan, the other in terms of adherence to most things Chomskyan (though sometimes such adherence involves opposition to Chomsky—the clearest cases being generalized phrase structure grammar, which turns Chomsky’s early commitment to precise modeling against him, and lexical-functional grammar, which turns his lexicalist hypothesis against the residual transformationalism of his later work). In the first instance, generative semantics served as the thin edge of the wedge which brought context, variation, and the slippery, pragmatical pig of moment-to-moment language-making back into the field. Its central legacy on this front is pragmatics and cognitive linguistics, though it also helped the emergence of sociolinguistics, functionalism, and other varieties of in vivo linguistics. For workers in these fields, when they are given to historical reflection, generative semantics serves as something of an Alamo, the honorable massacre.

在第二个例子中，生成语义学对体外乔姆斯基语言学的贡献更加具体和技术性。因此，它们也更容易被描绘出来。例如，广义短语结构语法明确地采用了罗斯的辅助分析，并且具有明确的、受逻辑影响的语义表示水平，词汇功能语法也是如此。但这里有趣的问题是，治理和约束理论，乔姆斯基扩展标准理论的直接后代（就语言学或任何其他科学而言，直接后代有意义而言），也非常广泛地使用了生成语义学的技术提议，包括扩展标准理论家花费大量精力攻击的许多提议。对于这个群体来说，生成语义学如上所述代表着对非理性的克服，但是一旦他们攻占了错误的堡垒，攻城者就会发现掠夺和抢劫以及将他们的奖品（例如词汇分解或逻辑形式）带回家以帮助他们建立自己的真理并不矛盾。

In the second instance, the generative semantics legacy to in vitro Chomskyan linguistics, the contributions are more specific and technical. They are, consequently, also quite a bit easier to chart. Generalized phrase structure grammar, for instance, has unequivocally adopted Ross’s auxiliary analysis, and has an explicit, logic-influenced level of semantic representation, as does lexical-functional grammar. But the interesting wrinkle here, is that government-and-binding theory, the direct descendant (insofar as direct descendant makes sense in linguistics, or any other science) of Chomsky’s extended standard theory, also makes very liberal use of the technical proposals of generative semantics, including a good many proposals that extended standard theorists expended much energy attacking. For this group, generative semantics represents, as above, irrationality overcome, but once they had stormed that bastion of error, the stormers saw no contradiction in pillaging and looting and taking their prizes home—lexical decomposition, for instance, or logical form—to help build their own truths.

生成语义学的遗产1：语言学的绿色化

The Legacy of Generative Semantics 1: The Greening of Linguistics

我们与人打交道，在现实、模糊、经常冲突、棘手的情况下，很少有像黑与白这样的标准来指导我们。我们面对的是经过协商、即兴发挥、不断诞生的语言。

We are dealing with people, in real, murky, often conflictual, squishy situations, where there is rarely anything like black and white to guide us. We are dealing with negotiated, improvised, always-being-born language.

哈吉罗斯

Háj Ross

有些人喜欢将乔姆斯基对语言学的影响视为布隆菲尔德主义的最后喘息（例如，最能表达这一立场的是 Moore and Carling 1982:19-47）。这种观点过于狭隘，但就像其他狭隘观点一样，它只看到了问题的一面。在乔姆斯基的例子中，这只手臂附着在一只章鱼上，所以还有七只手臂在看不见的地方扭来扭去；尽管如此，即使他八分之一的影响也是 20 世纪下半叶语言学历史的重要组成部分。布隆菲尔德主义的延续性在乔姆斯基语言学中，即使术语有所变动，也是相当清晰的。

One of the ways some people prefer to look a Chomsky’s impact on linguistics is as the last gasp of Bloomfieldianism (for instance, in the best articulation of this position, Moore and Carling 1982:19–47). This perspective is far too narrow, but, like narrow perspectives everywhere, it sees one arm of the matter very well. In Chomsky’s case, the arm is attached to an octopus, so there are seven more wiggling around out of sight; still, even an eighth of his impact is a pretty big part of the story of linguistics in the second half of the twentieth century. The Bloomfieldian continuities in Chomskyan linguistics, even where there have been terminological shuffles, are fairly clear.

布隆菲尔德，尤其是被布洛赫、特雷格等人所冷嘲热讽的布隆菲尔德，将意义拒之门外。乔姆斯基对意义的把握比布隆菲尔德要乐观一些，而且在语义学方面取得了许多进展，但他保留了布隆菲尔德的谨慎，也保留了布隆菲尔德的一般信条，即意义永远不能占据主导地位。早在 1955 年，他就主张布隆菲尔德的安全语言学路线——意义不能污染形式的分析——此后四十年，他只是偶尔动摇了这一立场。如果形式能帮助他把握意义，他会为这个机会而欣喜若狂，但反过来则是不可想象的。他永远不会用意义来把握形式。

Bloomfield, particularly as vitrified by Bloch, Trager, and others, kept meaning at bay. Chomsky is a little more optimistic about getting at meaning than Bloomfield was, and has been responsible for a good deal of semantic headway, but he retains Bloomfield’s cautiousness and he retains the general Bloomfieldian dogma that meaning will never be allowed in the driver’s seat. He was arguing the Bloomfieldian party line on safe linguistics as early as 1955—that meaning can’t be allowed to contaminate analyses of form—and he has only occasionally wavered from that position in the four decades since. If form will help him get at meaning, he’s overjoyed at the opportunity, but the reverse is unthinkable. He will never use meaning to get at form.

布隆菲尔德学派在方法论上禁止“混合层次”，尤其是向下混合层次——音系学不应该影响语音分析，形态学不应该影响音系学，句法学应该避免触及形态学。乔姆斯基反对这种禁止，并乐于让所有这些较低层次以各种方式混合在一起。但较高层次，即更接近意义、语义学和语用学的层次，仍然被排除在外。语义学不应该污染句法学；语用学应该避免触及语义学。

The Bloomfieldians had a methodological proscription against “mixing levels,” especially mixing them downward—phonology wasn’t supposed to infect phonetic analyses, morphology wasn’t supposed to infect phonology, syntax was supposed to keep its mitts off morphology. Chomsky argued against the proscription, and happily let all these lower levels commingle in various ways. But the higher levels, the ones up closer to meaning, semantics and pragmatics, are still out in the cold. Semantics isn’t supposed to contaminate syntax; pragmatics is supposed to keep its mitts off of semantics.

布隆菲尔德摒弃了思想，使心灵主义成为语言中无法用科学方法研究的方面的一个总称。乔姆斯基打破了讨论思想的禁忌，但他也有一条非常类似的贞操带来保持语法的纯粹性，那就是表演。正如布隆菲尔德的心灵主义是一种将意义与形式分开的方法，将意义归于心理学和社会学，乔姆斯基的表演也是一种将意义和其他污染物与形式分开的方法，将意义和其他污染物归于“记忆限制、干扰、注意力和兴趣的转移”以及“语言使用的物理和社会条件”（1965 [1964]：3；1977：3）——归于心理学和社会学。

Bloomfield banished the mind, making mentalism an umbrella term for aspects of language that couldn’t be approached scientifically. Chomsky broke the taboo about discussing the mind, but he has a very similar sort of chastity belt for keeping his grammar pure, performance. Just as Bloomfield’s mentalism was one way of keeping meaning away from form, by consigning it to psychology and sociology, so Chomsky’s performance is a way to keep meaning and other contaminants away from form, by consigning them to “memory limitations, distractions, shifts of attention and interest” as well as to “the physical and social conditions of language use” (1965 [1964]:3; 1977:3)—to psychology and sociology.

那么，在这种濒临消亡的布隆菲尔德式喘息式解释中，六十年代兴起的乔姆斯基式霸权只是对意义和思想的旧恐惧的新面孔。这种解释认为，乔姆斯基不属于语言学的真正先锋，而是属于老派的进步分子；推翻布隆菲尔德式山峰的革命尚未结束，霍克特、豪斯霍尔德和其他为语言改革铺平道路的人也被扫地出门。乔姆斯基为重组的初始阶段做出了贡献，但他仍然是布隆菲尔德式偏见的受害者，注定要像其他残余分子一样，被丢进历史的耻辱垃圾桶里。回想一下，在 70 年代初期，许多观察家都认为乔姆斯基就是这样的，他像普朗克或爱因斯坦一样，可悲地退缩了，而生成语义学家则继续推进他所开创的意义与思维使命。这种判断显然为时过早，但语言学已经发生了变化。乔姆斯基在 70 年代末和 80 年代恢复了相当一部分日渐衰落的影响力，但他的市场份额远不及 1965 年。

In this dying-Bloomfieldian-wheeze interpretation, then, the Chomskyan hegemony that arose in the sixties was just a new face on the old fear of meaning and mind. Chomsky belongs, this interpretation goes, not to the true vanguard in linguistics, but to the progressive elements of the old guard; the revolution that blew the top off the Bloomfieldian mountain, clearing away Hockett and Householder and the others who had helped prepare the way for the linguistic perestroika, is not yet over. Chomsky contributed to the initial stages of the restructuring, but he remains a victim of his Bloomfieldian prejudices, and he is destined to follow the rest of the holdovers into the ignominious historical wastebasket of the Wrong. Recall that this was pretty much the way Chomsky looked to many observers in the early seventies, sadly retrenching, like Planck or Einstein, while the generative semanticists plowed ahead on the meaning-and-mind mission he had begun. That judgment was clearly premature, but linguistics has changed. Chomsky regained a considerable amount of his waning clout in the late seventies and the eighties, but his market share is nowhere near what it was in 1965.

其他正式的竞争对手也纷纷涌现（包括几个，同样，它们都是从一群吵闹地离开乔姆斯基巢穴的羽翼未丰的新手开始的，比如布雷斯南的词汇功能语法和布雷姆的基生成句法——两者都将乔姆斯基的词汇主义假设推向了超出他预期的境地。其他解释框架也得到了发展（特别是功能主义的多种版本，以及现在的认知语法），它们的定义主要在于与模糊的、语境化的、意义驱动的数据的对抗，而乔姆斯基却对此视而不见。曾经寻求他的工作进行研究和应用的语言学分支学科现在决定，它们没有乔姆斯基也可以很好地工作（心理语言学、社会语言学、第二语言习得）。语言学比以往任何时候都更加充满活力、多元化和大胆。用布鲁斯·弗雷泽的话来说，它经历了一次绿化。10很容易将生成语义学视为语言学绿化的主要角色。它当然值得回想起来，作为楔子上的薄边，为语言学带来了大量乔姆斯基乐于忽略的现象，以及一系列他不屑一顾或鄙视的方法和目标。

Other formal competitors have sprung up (including several, again, which began with groups of fledglings who noisily left the Chomskyan nest, like Bresnan’s lexical-functional grammar and Brame’s base-generated syntax—both taking Chomsky’s lexicalist hypothesis further than he wanted to go with it). Other explanatory frameworks have developed (in particular, the many versions of functionalism, and now cognitive grammar), defining themselves largely by their confrontations with the fuzzy, contextualized, meaning-driven data that Chomsky disregards. Linguistic subdisciplines that once sought out his work for investigation and application have decided they can get along without him now (psycholinguistics, sociolinguistics, second language acquisition). Linguistics is more vibrant, pluralistic, and daring than it has ever been. It has, in Bruce Fraser’s term, undergone a greening.10 and it is easy to assign generative semantics a major role in the greening. Certainly it deserves some retrospective credit as the thin edge of the wedge that brought into linguistics a good crop of phenomena which Chomsky was happy to ignore, and a range of methods and goals he discounted or despised.

以语用学为例。虽然将语用学的诞生归功于一个运动似乎有点奇怪，该运动最著名的发言人曾发表过臭名昭著的傲慢言论，称他已将整个领域（当时，这是一个几乎没有被研究过的领域）简化为普通的语义学，但莱考夫对语用学的极具感染力的傲慢态度可能比其他任何因素都更有助于打破语言学中语境和用法的障碍。语用学现在是一个蓬勃发展的分支学科；它主要源于罗斯早期的表演性工作；其中包括萨多克对言语行为理论的广泛探索、莱考夫对预设的研究以及格赖斯的会话研究；其主要里程碑是 Gazdar 的正式文本（1979），该文本以跨派生分析开始，以及 Levinson 的非正式文本，该文本明确将语言学的实用主义融入归功于生成语义学家（1983:36）。这两本书都引用了 Ross、Sadock、Lakoff、Davison、Green、McCawley、Horn 和其他各种生成语义学家；也就是说，他们以生成语义学作为他们的主要语言学起点（顺便说一句，他们也以大量的哲学著作作为另一个起点）。11

Take pragmatics. While it may seem a little peculiar to give credit for the birth of pragmatics to a movement whose most prominent spokesperson once made the notoriously arrogant pronouncement that he had reduced the whole field (and, at the time, it was a barely turned field) to garden variety semantics, Lakoff’s infectious arrogance about pragmatics probably did more to break down the barriers of context and use in linguistics than any other factor. Pragmatics is now a thriving subdiscipline; which dates largely from Ross’s early performative work; which includes Sadock’s extensive explorations of speech act theory and Lakoff’s investigations of presuppositions and of Grice’s conversational research; among whose chief landmarks is Gazdar’s formal text (1979), which began life with a transderivational analysis, and Levinson’s informal text, which specifically attributes the pragmatic infusion of linguistics to generative semanticists (1983:36). Both books bristle with references to Ross, Sadock, the Lakoff’s, Davison, Green, McCawley, Horn, and assorted other generative semanticists; that is, they take generative semantics as their chief linguistic starting point (they also, by the way, take a good deal of philosophical work as another starting point).11

以最具影响力的形式模型之一关系语法为例。它与生成语义学早期的分歧很大，当时一些语言学家认为，语法关系（如主语和宾语）直接属于理论原语的核心（在当时的所有生成研究中，这些概念都是派生的；Aspects从结构上衍生了它们，将主语定义为 S 的第一个 NP，将宾语定义为 VP 的第一个 NP）。它的根源很明显。例如，大多数早期关系语法参与者都来自生成语义学（Ross、Morgan 和 Keenan 都对它的发展起到了重要作用；Postal 和 Perlmutter 是推动力），而它的队伍在 70 年代中期因不满的生成语义学家而壮大（Cole、Dryer、Frantz、Lawler、Sadock）。更重要的是模型本身明显的发展联系。例如，抽象语法对 VP 的抛弃使得主语和宾语的结构定义变得更加复杂。人们对生成语义学的跨语言原则的关注度不断提高，导致人们开始从语法关系（跨语言相当稳定）的角度来解释被动句等现象，而不是像Aspects传统那样从词序（跨语言稳定性差得多）的角度来解释。跨语言研究还必须面对以下语言：威尔士语和宿务语，采用动词-主语-宾语的语序（即动词和宾语在物理上是分开的语言，因此没有自然的方式将宾语定义为动词下的名词短语）。同样，对普遍基础的关注导致了这样的结论：单靠秩序和主导地位是行不通的，语法关系必须是语言原始储备的一部分。12

Take, as one of the most influential formal models, relational grammar. It headed off on an early dogleg from generative semantics, when several linguists decided that grammatical relations like subject and object belonged directly among the core of theoretical primitives (in all generative research of the period, these notions were derivative; Aspects derives them structurally, defining subject as the first NP of an S, object as the first NP of a VP). Its roots are clear. Most of the early relational grammar players, for instance, came out of generative semantics (Ross, Morgan, and Keenan were all instrumental in its development; Postal and Perlmutter were the driving forces), and its ranks swelled with disaffected generative semanticists in the mid-seventies (Cole, Dryer, Frantz, Lawler, Sadock). More crucial are the obvious developmental connections in the model itself. The abstract syntax discarding of the VP, for instance, made structural definitions of both subject and object much more complicated. The increasing concern for cross-linguistic principles around generative semantics led to accounts of phenomena like passive sentences in terms of grammatical relations (which are quite stable across languages) rather than, as in the Aspects tradition, word order (which is much less stable cross-linguistically). Cross-linguistic work also had to confront languages like Welsh and Cebuano, with verb-subject-object word order (that is, languages where the verb and object are physically separated, so that there is no natural way to define the object as the NP under a VP). Similarly, concern with a universal base led to the conclusion that order and dominance alone couldn’t cut it, that grammatical relations had to be part of the primitive stock of languages.12

再举几个我们迄今几乎没有涉及的、内容丰富且相互渗透的发展，比如心理语言学、社会语言学、功能主义、格林伯格类型学，以及更多替代形式模型，它们都不是从生成语义学开始的，但大多数都得到了生成语义学的支持和招募，而且所有这些都极大地受益于乔姆斯基霸权的瓦解，而这种瓦解始于对卡兹-波斯特尔原则和深层结构的分歧。

Take, too, a thick and interpenetrating bunch of developments we have barely glanced at so far—psycholinguistics, sociolinguistics, functionalism, Greenbergian typology, and a bustling contingent of yet more alternate formal models—none of which began with generative semantics, but most of which received support and recruits from its ranks, and all of which benefited hugely by the break-up of the Chomskyan hegemony that began with the disagreements over the Katz-Postal principle and deep structure.

尤其是以热门的新语法框架——认知语法为例，许多人认为它遵循的方向可以“实现生成语义学无法实现的承诺”（Goldsmith，1987）。认知语法本身就是一本书（事实上它本身就是两本书，而且确实如此——参见 Langacker，1987；1991），13但简而言之，它是乔姆斯基语言学的真正而蓬勃发展的替代品，正是生成语义学在成长过程中想要成为的那种。与关系语法一样，它在分裂中也有明显的社会学根源；除了 Lakoff 的热情联系之外，主要设计者 Langacker 也是一位生成语义学家（尽管是一个相当边缘的人），我们故事中的许多其他名字在它的支持者或同行者中占有重要地位——例如，Bolinger、Chafe、Fillmore 和 Jackendoff 都被 Langacker 在他的第一本《认知语法基础》（1987:5）中单独列为灵感来源。但是，重要的联系是理论和方法论的，而不是社会学的，并且这些联系将认知语法与反乔姆斯基楔子的宽边联系起来，而不是与窄边联系起来，即与后期生成语义学联系起来，当语法性被抛弃时，对模糊类别、社会因素和比喻性语言的关注开始兴起。14

Take, especially, the hot new grammatical framework, cognitive grammar, which many people see as following a direction that can “fulfill the promises that generative semantics was not able to keep” (Goldsmith, 1987). Cognitive grammar would be a book in itself (in fact two books in itself, and it is—see Langacker, 1987; 1991),13 but, very briefly, it is a genuine and thriving alternative to Chomskyan linguistics of exactly the sort generative semantics wanted to be when it grew up. Like relational grammar, it also has clear sociological roots in the schism; beyond Lakoff’s enthusiastic association, the chief architect, Langacker, was a generative semanticist (albeit a fairly peripheral one), and a number of other names from our story figure prominently among its supporters or fellow travelers—Bolinger, Chafe, Fillmore, and Jackendoff, for instance, all get singled out for inspirational credit by Langacker in his first Foundations of Cognitive Grammar volume (1987:5). But again the important connections are theoretical and methodological, rather than sociological, and these connections link cognitive grammar more closely to the fat edge of the anti-Chomskyan wedge than the thin edge, to late generative semantics, when grammaticality was jettisoned, and concern for mushy categories, social factors, and figurative language came storming in.14

由于生成语义学是一场如此天主教式的运动，认知语法与生成语义学最明显的不同之处也源于这一方法。这些差异在语言普遍性方面最为明显。兰加克说：“语义结构不是普遍的；它在相当大的程度上是语言特有的”（1987:2）——完全拒绝了生成语义学的定义标准之一。但正是这种拒绝揭示了生成语义学中发起的趋势已经远离了乔姆斯基将语法理想化为一个僵化系统，其中有一些可以安全忽略的外围噪音。在 60 年代中期，任何语言学家只要暗示语言之间可能存在严重差异，就会成为怜悯和嘲笑的对象；回想一下，乔斯经常因为他的“语言可以无限且不可预测地存在差异”的言论而被吊死在转型文章的页面上。但生成语义学家开始认真对待乔姆斯基的普遍主义言论，这意味着要研究各种语言，这反过来又导致了对这种多样性的欣赏。麦考利甚至赞同赫尔曼·保罗比乔斯更强烈的言论：“严格地说，我们必须区分尽可能多的语言”（McCawley，1976b [1968]：204）。15

Since generative semantics was such a catholic movement, even the ways in which cognitive grammar seems most obviously to differ from generative semantics have roots in that approach. These differences are nowhere more obvious than in the area of language universals. Langacker says “semantic structure is not universal; it is language-specific to a considerable degree” (1987:2)—a complete rejection of one of generative semantics’ defining criteria. But it is a rejection that reveals how far the trend initiated in generative semantics has moved away from Chomsky’s idealization of grammar as a rigid system, with some peripheral noise that can safely be ignored. In the mid-sixties, any linguist who even hinted that there might be serious diversity among languages was an object of pity and ridicule; Joos, recall, was regularly hanged in effigy on the pages of transformational articles for his languages-can-differ-without-limit-and-in-unpredictable-ways remark. But generative semanticists began taking Chomsky’s universalist pronouncements to heart, which meant investigating a variety of languages, which, in turn, led to an appreciation for that variety. McCawley even endorsed Hermann Paul’s stronger-than-Joos remark that “we have, strictly speaking, to differentiate as many languages as there are individuals” (McCawley, 1976b [1968]:204).15

到目前为止，乔姆斯基的认知视角和兰盖克的认知视角之间最显著的区别在于心理结构各个方面的相对相互渗透；特别是语言与其他一切事物的相对相互渗透。这一差异实际上定义了生成-解释分裂的后期阶段，乔姆斯基在他的模型周围划定了严格的边界以将污染物挡在外面，生成语义学家用锤子砸倒他们能触及到的所有墙壁，让一切都涌入他们的分析中。乔姆斯基的方法和兰盖克的方法之间的所有其他差异都源于他们各自的认知模型以及它们背后的认识论（没错，就是我们熟悉的战马，理性主义和经验主义）的这些关键差异。 Langacker 模型之所以享有盛誉，很大程度上是因为它遵循了计算机科学的一种普遍路线，即联结主义（又称并行分布式处理，又称神经网络），联结主义是一种纯粹的经验主义，可以说是“披着计算机外衣的行为主义”（Papert，1988：9）。16

By far the sharpest difference between Chomsky’s cognitive perspective and Langacker’s is the relative interpenetration of various aspects of mental structure; in particular, the relative interpenetration of language with everything else. This difference virtually defined the late stages of the generative-interpretive schism, Chomsky drawing tight boundaries around his model to keep the contaminants out, generative semanticists smashing down all the walls they could reach with their hammers, to let everything pour into their analyses. Every other difference between Chomsky’s approach and Langacker’s follows from these crucial differences in their respective cognitive models, and the epistemologies behind them (that’s right, the familiar war-horses, rationalism and empiricism).
