Langacker’s model gains a good deal of its prestige from adherence to a general line of computer science known as connectionism (a.k.a. parallel distributed processing, a.k.a. neural nets), and connectionism is so flatly empiricist that it is “behaviorism in computer’s clothing” (Papert, 1988:9).16

再说一次，这种将乔姆斯基视为布隆菲尔德主义垂死挣扎的观点过于狭隘。首先，我们刚刚讨论了认知语法如何回归到乔姆斯基忽视或谴责的一些布隆菲尔德主义兴趣，即语言多样性和经验主义。其次，几乎没有证据表明乔姆斯基的呼吸短促或脉搏微弱。更重要的是，这种观点忽视了乔姆斯基的工作给心理语言学带来的巨大推动，随后心理语言学在其他方向得到了卓有成效的发展；它忽视了拉波夫对转化理论的运用，从而促进了社会语言学的接受；它忽视了乔姆斯基在语言学和哲学之间引发的交流以及他帮助人们对意义的关注，而这两者不可避免地导致了语言学中实用主义工作的激增；事实上，它忽略了乔姆斯基将焦点和预设引入了辩论，而这已成为实用主义研究的基石（当然，他除了展示它们如何破坏卡茨-波斯特尔假设之外，没有做任何其他事情，但他提出了它们）；它忽略了他对形式建模（包括关系语法）的巨大影响；它忽略了我们无法讨论的更多内容，这些内容都与乔姆斯基为语言学注入的大量能量、思想和强烈关注以及他为其他学科打开的大门有关。同样，这种最后喘息观点的补充，即生成语义学支持的语言学绿化，掩盖了对当前青翠的许多其他贡献；心理语言学、社会语言学、功能主义和森林中其他每一棵开花的树都有着深远的根源，其中只有一些可以追溯到生成语义学。但这两种观点都触及了过去 25 年语言学发展的关键因素，其中最重要的是：辩论才是关键。该领域的健康发展以及乔姆斯基研究目前有限的市场份额，更多地与存在分裂有关，而不是因为它始于深层结构的存在和卡茨-波斯特尔假设的可行性。修辞学是极其富有成效的。

Again, this Chomsky-as-the-dying-gasp-of-Bloomfieldianism view is far too narrow. For one thing, we have just been discussing how cognitive grammar returns to some Bloomfieldian interests that Chomsky has ignored or condemned, linguistic diversity and empiricism. For another, there’s very little evidence that Chomsky’s breath is short or his pulse weak. More importantly, this view ignores the huge boost that Chomsky’s work gave to psycholinguistics, which then developed fruitfully in other directions; it ignores the use to which Labov has put transformations, spurring the acceptance of sociolinguistics; it ignores the interchange Chomsky sparked between linguistics and philosophy and the attention he helped bring to bear on meaning, both of which led quite inevitably to the surge of pragmatic work in linguistics; it ignores, in fact, that Chomsky introduced focus and presupposition into the debates, which have become cornerstones of pragmatic research (he didn’t do anything more with them, of course, beyond showing how they wrought havoc with the Katz-Postal hypothesis, but he brought them up); it ignores his huge influence on formal modeling generally, including relational grammar; it ignores more than we have room to address, all concerning the massive infusion of energy, ideas, and burning focus Chomsky brought to linguistics, and the doors he blew open to other disciplines. Similarly, the complement of this last-wheeze view, the generativesemantics-sponsored greening of linguistics, obscures many other contributions to the current verdure; psycholinguistics, sociolinguistics, functionalism, and every other blooming tree in the forest has far-flung roots, only some of which reach back to generative semantics. But both views get at critical elements in the course of linguistics over the last two and a half decades, the most important of which is: debate’s the thing. The health of the field, and the currently restricted market share of Chomsky’s research has more to do with the fact that there was a schism than with the fact that it began over the existence of deep structure and the tenability of the Katz-Postal hypothesis. Rhetoric is extremely productive.

然而，我们完全忽略了当前活力的一个方面，这个方面最清楚地显示了生成语义学-解释语义学之争的重要作用，即过去十年中最成功的语法方法，即乔姆斯基的语法方法。

We have ignored one aspect of the current vibrancy completely, however, the one that shows the critical role of the generative-interpretive semantics debate most clearly, the grammatical approach that has been the most successful over the last decade, Chomsky’s.

生成语义学的遗产2：救助权

The Legacy of Generative Semantics 2: The Right of Salvage

你一定不会介意我的粗鲁。……我抗拒接受外在的东西。我会生气，会发誓，但如果它是对的，过一段时间我就会接受它。

You must not mind my being rude. … I have a resistance against accepting something from the outside. I get angry and swear but always accept [it] after a time if it is right.

马克斯·博恩

Max Born

随着 HMS生成语义学号的沉没，大量的思想、数据、机制和观点被抛入大海。其中一些消失了，可能是永远消失了，事实上，可能也是一种好现象。但其他很多东西却进入了其他理论的掌控之中；最臭名昭著的是，进入了乔姆斯基的服役护卫舰“政府与绑定”号的严密看守的掌控之中。这一命运是前生成语义学家反复提到的他们的模型遭遇的两场悲剧之一，即他们的工作被盗。

With the wreck of HMS Generative Semantics, huge amounts of ideas, data, mechanisms, and perspectives were cast to the seas. Some of it was lost, probably for good, probably, in fact, for the best. But much else made its way into the holds of other theories; most notoriously, into the closely guarded hold of Chomsky’s commissioned frigate, the Government and Binding. This fate is one of the two tragedies that ex-generative semanticists recurrently cite as having befallen their model, that their work has been stolen.

另一个所谓的悲剧是，他们的大量数据现在被完全和系统地忽略了，这是不准确的。一些材料确实消失了，但还有更多的材料对语言学家看待语言的方式产生了深远的影响；这正是语言学绿化的意义所在。生成语义学家的这种抱怨实际上似乎是说乔姆斯基和他的同僚们正在系统地忽略这些材料。但当然，情况不可能不是这样。乔姆斯基对语用学、比喻语言或功能解释的兴趣从未超过边缘；他对语言的社会学方面不屑一顾；他一直坚决反对语言学中的经验主义研究策略。几乎无法想象他或他的任何一位同志会写一篇关于你可以在药箱里找到的句法和语义恐怖的论文（Sadock，1974b）。因此，他和他的团队永远不会接受这种数据组合，无论生成语义学家认为它对他感兴趣的数据的影响有多大。简而言之，数据丢失的悲剧，不要喂牛头犬。

The other purported tragedy, that vast quantities of their data are now being completely and systematically ignored, is off the mark. It is certainly true that some material is gone, but there is a great deal more which has had a profound impact on the way linguists look at language; that, precisely, is what the greening of linguistics is all about. What generative semanticists seem to mean by this complaint, actually, is that Chomsky and his kith are systematically ignoring this material. But, of course, it could not be otherwise. Chomsky has never had more than a peripheral interest in pragmatics, figurative language, or functional explanations; he has been dismissive about sociological aspects of language; and he has been unrelentingly hostile to empiricist research strategies in linguistics. It is virtually inconceivable that he or any of his comrades would pen a paper on syntactic and semantic horrors you can find in your medicine chest (Sadock, 1974b). So, he and his are never going to accommodate this colligation of data, no matter how thoroughly generative semanticists think it impinges on the data that does interest him. The lost-data tragedy, in short, don’t feed the bulldog.

那么，让我们回到窃取思想的悲剧：结局如何？好多了。

Back, then, to the pilfered-ideas tragedy: how does it fare? Considerably better.

让我们从纽梅尔列出的生成语义学对形式语言学的贡献开始，这份清单经常被前生成语义学家嘲笑为过于简短。事实上，它非常简短，简短到可以全文引用，但它并不轻视：

Let’s start with Newmeyer’s list of generative semantic contributions to formal linguistics, a list that is often sneered at by ex-generative semanticists as dismissively brief. It is, in fact, very brief, brief enough to quote in full, but it is not dismissive:

虽然现在很少有语言学家认为生成语义学是一种可行的语法模型，但它在无数方面给其后继者留下了印记。最重要的是，它认为句子在某种层面上必须具有与符号逻辑同构的形式主义表示，这一观点现在被解释学家，尤其是乔姆斯基广泛接受。生成语义学家首先对句法现象进行了深入研究，这些句法现象无法通过当时理解的转换规则进行形式化，并导致了索引设备、踪迹和过滤器等大量机制的出现，这些机制现在已成为解释学家理论储备的一部分。正如 Wasow (1976:296) 指出的那样，甚至连词汇分解这一生成语义学家备受蔑视的思想也出现在几位解释学家的语义理论中。此外，许多提议最初由生成语义学家提出的论点，例如不存在外在规则排序、后循环词汇插入以及将回指代词视为约束变量，后来都出现在解释主义文献中，但几乎从未得到承认。（1980a：173；1986a：138）

While generative semantics now appears to few, if any, linguists to be a viable model of grammar, there are innumerable ways in which it has left its mark on its successors. Most importantly, its view that sentences must at one level have a representation in a formalism isomorphic to that of symbolic logic is now widely accepted by interpretivists, and in particular by Chomsky. It was generative semanticists who first undertook an intensive investigation of syntactic phenomena which defied formalization by means of transformational rules as they were then understood, and led to the plethora of mechanisms such as indexing devices, traces, and filters, which are now part of the interpretivists’ theoretical store. Even the idea of lexical decomposition, for which generative semanticists have been much scorned, has turned up in the semantic theories of several interpretivists, as Wasow (1976:296) has pointed out. Furthermore, many proposals originally mooted by generative semanticists, such as the nonexistence of extrinsic rule ordering, post-cyclic lexical insertion, and treating anaphoric pronouns as bound variables, have since turned up in the interpretivist literature, virtually always without acknowledgement. (1980a:173; 1986a:138)

很难看出前生成语义学家对这段话有何异议，除非他们读到这段话时，可能已经对书中的早期评论感到愤怒，无法看清真相。这是一份现实的影响评估陈述，说明了生成语义学如何影响了形式语言学；影响方式多种多样，但几乎总是没有得到承认。

It’s a little difficult to see what the ex-generative semanticists see as objectionable about this passage, except that they are probably so steamed at earlier comments in the book by the time they get to it that they can’t see straight. It is a realistic impactassessment statement of how generative semantics affected formal linguistics; in innumerable ways, virtually always without acknowledgment.

乔姆斯基对知识产权的态度充其量是漫不经心的——无论是他自己的还是别人的——这种态度很快就会影响到他的学生；有时，甚至影响到他学生的学生。他们自己的工作和彼此的工作才是最重要的。其他人不会得到太多的关注，更不用说讨论和认可了。这种轻视的最臭名昭著的例子是乔姆斯基对逻辑形式的采用，这在他目前的模型（即 LF）中占有重要地位。就乔姆斯基而言，逻辑形式似乎来自罗伯特·梅，他并非巧合地在乔姆斯基的指导下完成了一篇探讨这些想法的论文（后来对其进行了大量修改以供发表——1977 年 5 月；1985 年）。梅只引用了一次莱考夫的话，非常简短，以否认他们各自的建议之间存在任何联系（1985:158n4），他甚至根本没有提到麦考利，尽管他的量词降低规则在他的著作中发挥了核心作用——除了一些小瑕疵，基本上与麦考利更早提出的规则相同（1976b [1972]:294）。接下来在臭名昭著的借用名单上是词汇分解，它也开始出现在 70 年代中后期的解释主义著作中；然后是一系列小的发展，如踪迹惯例的全局属性和助动词的主要动词分析。

Chomsky’s attitude to intellectual property is cavalier at best—his own as well as others’—and it is an attitude that rubs off very quickly on his students; sometimes, even on the students of his students. Their own work, and each other’s work, is all that matters. No one else gets too much attention, let alone discussion and acknowledgment. The most notorious example of this slighting is Chomsky’s adoption of logical form, which occupies a critical place in his current model (that is, LF). As far as Chomsky appears to be concerned, logical form comes from Robert May, who, not coincidentally, completed a thesis under Chomsky exploring these ideas (later revising it substantially for publication—May, 1977; 1985). May cites Lakoff only once, very briefly, to deny that there is any connection between their respective suggestions (1985:158n4), and he doesn’t even mention McCawley at all, despite the central role played in his work by his rule of Quantifier-lowering—with minor wrinkles, essentially the same rule that McCawley proposed much earlier (1976b [1972]:294). Next on the list of notorious borrowings is lexical decomposition, which also started to show up in interpretivist work in the mid-to-late-seventies; then comes a host of small developments, like the global properties of the trace convention and the main-verb analysis of auxiliaries.

当然，有趣的问题不在于乔姆斯基是否“被允许”将生成语义学思想融入他的作品中——例如，麦考利在他的作品中融入了-syntax，当加兹达尔和普勒姆采用罗斯的助动词主要动词分析时，没有人抱怨——甚至不在于他是否应该承认这种融入。17有趣的是，他曾经如此强烈地谴责生成语义学，而现在他却同样热烈地拥护生成语义学的许多倾向和机制，他现在仍然坚持这种谴责，这越来越令人好奇。考虑一下他框架中的最新发展，马克·贝克的普遍 Theta 分配假说，该假说确保语义角色在深层结构中以统一的方式分配（Baker，1988：46ff）。正如乔姆斯基所指出的，贝克的提议类似于“在生成语义学中探索的”提议；即“深层结构相当广泛地、甚至可能是跨语言地代表语义结构”。然而，早期的提议，即普遍基础假说，“被证明是不可行的，事实上或多或少是空洞的”，因为生成语义学存在与其广泛的描述自由度有关的各种问题。现在，随着政府与约束理论中内置的巨大限制性，同样的提议“变得有意义，事实上极其有力”（1988b：66–67）。18想必他对词汇分解和谓词提升也有类似的看法——前者“经验内容很少”，后者在德克萨斯目标会议上（Chomsky, 1972b[1969]:142–43），乔姆斯基表示这“完全没有必要”，因为他的模型已经发生变化，可以适应这些变化。

The interesting issue, of course, is not whether Chomsky is “allowed” to incorporate generative semantics ideas into his work—McCawley, for instance, incorporates -syntax in his work, and nobody complained when Gazdar and Pullum adopted Ross’s main-verb analysis of auxiliaries—or even whether he should acknowledge that incorporation.17 The interesting issue is that he denounced generative semantics so warmly for many of the tendencies and mechanisms he now embraces equally warmly, a denunciation—curiouser and curiouser—he still maintains. Consider a recent development in his framework, Mark Baker’s Universal Theta Assignment Hypothesis, which ensures that semantic roles are assigned in a uniform way at D(eep)-structure (Baker, 1988:46ff). As Chomsky notes, Baker’s proposal is similar to one “explored within generative semantics”; namely, “that deep structures represent semantic structure quite broadly, perhaps cross-linguistically.” The earlier proposal, however, the Universal Base Hypothesis, “proved unfeasible, in fact, more or less vacuous” because of various problems with generative semantics having to do with its vast descriptive latitude. Now, with the tremendous restrictiveness built into government-and-binding theory, the same proposal “becomes meaningful, in fact extremely strong” (1988b:66–67).18 Presumably he has similar notions about lexical decomposition and Predicate-raising—the former of which had “little empirical content,” the latter of which was “quite unnecessary,” at the Texas Goals conference (Chomsky, 1972b [1969]:142–43)—now that his model has mutated in ways that accommodate them.

这种先谴责后采纳的政策是许多前生成语义学家的心头之刺。莱考夫对此抱怨不已，波斯特尔则写了一本讽刺性的指南《语言修辞学的进步》，本节的副标题为如何成功地采纳乔姆斯基思想提供建议：

This denounce-then-adopt policy is a thorn in the side of many ex-generative semanticists. Lakoff complains about it bitterly, and Postal has written an acid-keyboarded guide to “Advances in Linguistic Rhetoric,” whence the subhead for this section advising would-be Chomskyans on how to coopt ideas successfully:

假设某个像 McCawley 一样的毫无疑问是错误和愚蠢的基本语义学 (BS) 运动的支持者，偶然地提出了你需要使用的一两个想法，比如假设，表面量词通过对句法约束敏感的变换移动操作与类似逻辑的表示相连，或诸如此类的东西。

Suppose some proponent, like McCawley, of the unquestionably wrong and stupid Basic Semantics (BS) movement has, accidentally, hit on one or two ideas you need to use, say hypothetically, the notion that surface quantifiers are connected to logic-like representations by transformational movement operations sensitive to syntactic constraints, or something like that.

当你采纳这个想法时，假设你愿意这样做，引用任何 BS 的支持者都是一个明显的修辞错误。如果说服他们真正阅读这些误导性的东西，这不仅会浪费很多严肃的语言学家的时间，还可能会误导那些比你更不成熟的思想家，让他们认为 BS 的某些内容是正确的。

When adopting this idea, assuming that you wish to do so, it would be an obvious rhetorical error to cite any proponents of BS. Not only would this waste a lot of serious linguists’ time if they were persuaded to actually read such misguided stuff, it might mislead less sophisticated thinkers than you into thinking something about BS was right.

因此，正确的做法是长期多次地宣告并让其他人宣告 BS 是完全错误的、误导性的、不科学的等等。然后，悄悄地，简单地使用任何你想要的 BS 想法，无需警告，也不需要任何累人的引用或归因材料。学术法中一个众所周知的原则，即“救助权”，保证你不会为此承担责任。（1988b:136；Postal 的斜体字）19

So the correct procedure is to proclaim and get others to proclaim, over a long period, many times, that BS is totally wrong, misguided, unscientific, etc. Then, quietly, simply use whatever BS ideas you want without warning and without any tiring citational or attributional material. A well-known principle of scholarly law known as Right of Salvage guarantees that you cannot be held accountable for this. (1988b:136; Postal’s italics)19

可以预见的是，乔姆斯基对优先权之争的评价很低，他认为这只是语言学的一个特征，因为它还不是一门像物理学一样完全发展的科学：

Predictably, Chomsky has a low opinion of squabbles about priority, which he believes are a feature of linguistics only because it is not yet a fully developed science, like physics:

[在语言学等“欠发达领域”] 存在一种偏执。例如，[对优先权的关注] 是半成熟领域中常见的幼稚现象。事实上，在任何现实领域，人们都会在大约同一时间思考相同的事情，因为这些都是议程上的问题。如果你想担心这个人是否在我之前三个月就说过同样的话，那只是幼稚而已。

There’s a kind of paranoia [in “underdeveloped fields” like linguistics]. For example, [the concern for priority] is the kind of infantilism that you get in semi-existent fields. The fact of the matter is that in any real field, people are going to be thinking about the same kinds of things at about the same time, because those are the problems that are on the agenda. If you want to worry about looking and seeing if this guy said it three months before I said it, that’s just childishness.

当然，乔姆斯基认为优先权之争是不科学的，这是错的。它们是物理学等成熟科学的固有特征，科学家们经常就谁在什么时候说了什么而对簿公堂——例如，在当前围绕基因剪接或超导的专利之争中——而沃森著名的《双螺旋》（1968 年）几乎完全是关于争夺第一名的竞争。即使是极度真诚的达尔文，他经常为自己对自然选择父权的担忧而自责，也写信给莱尔和胡克，要求他们帮助他确定自己的优先权（达尔文，1958 年 [1892]：196-98）。但创意并不需要有获得巨额工业利润或诺贝尔奖或历史地位的潜力来激发保护欲，甚至偏执。创意是科学的常用手段，很少有科学家会欣赏创意的功劳归于他人。

Chomsky is wrong, of course, that priority squabbles are unscientific. They are such an endemic feature of established sciences like physics that scientists often go to court about who said what when—for example, in the current patent fights surrounding gene splicing or superconductivity—and Watson’s famous The Double Helix (1968) is almost entirely about the race for the trappings that go with being first. Even the desperately sincere Darwin, who flagellated himself constantly about his concerns over the paternity of natural selection, wrote Lyell and Hooker to press for their aid in establishing his priority (Darwin, 1958 [1892]:196–98). But ideas don’t require the potential to reap huge industrial profits or Nobel prizes or places in history to inspire protectiveness, even paranoia. Ideas are the stock-in-trade of science, and very few scientists appreciate it when the credit for them goes elsewhere.

乔姆斯基——应该清楚的是，他不是那种普通小偷式的思想吸收者；他真的对知识产权很漫不经心，因为他乐于提出想法尽管他可以随意挪用这些贡献，但他不得不预料到，他几乎完全无视一些人的贡献，尤其是当他可以非常小心地承认其他人的贡献时，这些人的理论核心与他更接近。这就引出了本书的最后一个问题。

Chomsky—who, it should be clear, is not the common-thief variety of idea-absorber; he genuinely is cavalier about intellectual property, as happy to give ideas away as he is to appropriate them—has to expect some flak for his virtually total disregard of some people’s contributions, particularly when he can be quite careful to acknowledge the contributions of other people, those a little closer to his theoretical heart. Which brings us to the final question of the book.

乔姆斯基何去何从？

Whither Chomsky?

为了到达天堂的港口，我们必须时而顺风航行，时而逆风航行——但我们必须航行，而不能随波逐流，更不能停泊。

To reach the port of heaven, we must sail sometimes with the wind and sometimes against it—but we must sail, and not drift, nor lie at anchor.

奥利弗·温德尔·霍姆斯

Oliver Wendell Holmes

在我们开始这一部分和结束这本书之前，有两个轶事，一个是个人轶事，一个不是个人轶事。

Two anecdotes before we get on with this section and off with this book, one personal, one not.

大约一年前，我写了一篇关于《反思乔姆斯基》的评论，其中有这样一句话：“尽管 [乔姆斯基] 并不温和（我们都希望，距离他职业生涯的暮色已经过去了几十年），但他不再积极地起诉过去的教条主义者或现在的鲁莽者。”我预料到编辑会对教条主义者和鲁莽者进行批评，尽管我有点乐观地认为上下文会清楚地表明这些术语是为了反映乔姆斯基的态度而选择的，而不是作为 Trager 和 Lakoff 或 Postal 和 Gazdar 等语言学家的客观标签。但上下文似乎发挥了作用，这些术语没有得到任何评论。

A year or so back I wrote a review of Reflections on Chomsky which included the line “Though hardly mellow (and, we can all hope, decades from the twilight of his career), [Chomsky] is no longer very active in prosecuting the dogmatists of the past or the hotheads of the present.” I expected some flak about dogmatists and hotheads from the editor, although I was mildly optimistic that the context would make it clear the terms were chosen to reflect Chomsky’s attitudes, not as objective labels for such linguists as Trager and Lakoff or Postal and Gazdar. But context seems to have done its job, and the terms passed without comment.

现在到了奇怪的部分：编辑强烈反对括号中的“我们都可以希望”的评论。“我不认为每个人都会同意，”他告诉我，“我们都希望乔姆斯基在几十年后才进入职业生涯的暮年，”并补充说“也许你是这样。”他暗示这句话必须去掉。不过，他显然重新考虑了删减策略，并将评论发送给其他人进行独立评估，后者建议根本不发表；在评论者的抱怨中，“第一段中的‘我们都可以希望’要么不诚实，要么是自欺欺人。”不幸的是，这种态度并不少见，表明有些人真的希望乔姆斯基死掉、退休或专心从事政治或哲学领域，而不要打扰那些可怜的小语言学家。敌意的程度确实令人震惊——毕竟，我们谈论的是语言学，是语言的研究，而不是贫穷、疾病或帝国主义侵略，我们谈论的是一位多次颠覆该学科的人，此外，他三十多年来一直是思想的源泉——但显然，有些人可能更喜欢本节的另一个标题，即“威瑟·乔姆斯基”。20

Now comes the strange part: the editor objected, strongly, to the parenthetical we-can-all-hope remark. “I don’t think that everyone would agree,” he told me, “that [we all hope Chomsky] will be ‘decades from the twilight of his career,’” and added the somehow accusatory, “maybe you do.” That phrase, he implied, would have to go. He apparently reconsidered the snipping strategy, though, and sent the review to someone else for an independent evaluation, who recommended that it not be published at all; among the reviewer’s complaints, “‘we can all hope’ in the first paragraph is either disingenuous or deluded.” Such attitudes, unfortunately far from uncommon, indicate that there are people who genuinely wish that Chomsky would die, or retire, or move exclusively into political or philosophical domains, and just leave poor little linguists alone. The level of enmity is truly stunning—we are, after all, talking about linguistics, about the study of language, not about poverty, or disease, or imperial aggression, and we are talking about a man who has turned the discipline on its head several times, who has been, further, an extraordinary fount of ideas for well over thirty years—but, clearly, there are people who would likely prefer another heading for this section, Wither Chomsky.20

另一则轶事，可能是杜撰的，但同样代表了一个重要的观点，涉及一位西方历史学家和一位中国历史学家。他们见面并开始聊天。“告诉我，”西方历史学家问他的同事，“你觉得法国大革命怎么样？它是好事还是坏事？”中国历史学家说这个问题为时过早。“现在下结论还为时过早。”

The other anecdote, probably apocryphal but representative of an important perspective all the same, involves a Western historian and a Chinese historian. They meet and start chatting. “Tell me,” the Western historian asks his colleague, “what do you think of the French Revolution? Was it a good thing, or was it a bad thing?” The Chinese historian says the question is premature. “It’s too soon to tell.”

尽管激起了人们的愤怒，但乔姆斯基几乎肯定不会在语言和思想的思想史上消亡，但现在判断他会变成什么样还为时过早。让我们暂时用天文学的类比来说，哥白尼革命花了近一个世纪才完全实现；乔姆斯基的即使还处于中途，如果五十年后，乔姆斯基的语言和思维模型遵循哥白尼的天体模型的轨迹，它看起来将与现在大不相同。事实上，尽管他在七十年代末和八十年代赢回了相当一部分领域，但目前乔姆斯基的前景并不特别光明。

Despite having inspired blood-boiling animosity, Chomsky will almost certainly not wither in the intellectual history of language and the mind, but it is far too soon to tell what will become of him. To retrieve our astronomy analogy for a moment, the Copernican revolution took almost a century to come off fully; Chomsky’s not even at the halfway mark yet, and if, fifty years hence, the Chomskyan model of language and mind follows the trajectory that Copernicus’s model of the heavens took, it will look quite different than it does at the moment. In fact, at the moment, despite his having won back a goodly portion of the field in the late seventies and the eighties, things don’t look especially bright for Chomsky.

当然，由于我们已经看到的许多原因，它们在心理学中看起来并不好。听听一位心理学家如何分析人们对乔姆斯基在该领域的贡献的看法：

Certainly they don’t look very good in psychology, for many of the reasons we have seen. Listen to one psychologist diagnose the mood surrounding Chomsky’s contributions to the field:

尽管转换语法在过去三十年中取得了进展，并且经历了三个主要发展阶段——初始理论、标准理论以及治理和约束理论——但还没有对任何自然语言的句法（更不用说语义）的完整描述，也没有普遍接受的权威语言理论——没有足够明确的理论可以转化为一种有效的程序，在给定该语言的句子语料库的情况下获取该语言的语法。以最严格的科学成就标准来判断，乔姆斯基的计划尚未成功；例如，将其进程与克里克和沃森的 DNA 结构理论进行比较。（Johnson-Laird，1987：147）21

Despite the developments in transformational grammar over the last thirty years, and three major stages in its evolution—the initial theory, the standard theory, and the theory of government and binding—there is no complete account of the syntax (and a fortiori the semantics) of any natural language, and no generally accepted and definitive linguistic theory—no theory sufficiently explicit to be translated into an effective procedure for acquiring a grammar for a language, given a corpus of sentences from that language. Judged by the strictest criteria of scientific achievement, the Chomskyan programme has yet to succeed; compare its course with, for instance, that of Crick and Watson’s theory of the structure of DNA. (Johnson-Laird, 1987:147)21

约翰逊-莱尔德很快指出，心理学家在大多数工作领域甚至无法指出乔姆斯基的计划所取得的成功水平，因此他们没有资格仅凭这些理由就对乔姆斯基的计划嗤之以鼻。但是，除了他的计划进展缓慢和曲折之外，“一群语法学家与另一群语法学家之间的争吵”和“随着一代又一代的生成语言学家与创始人分道扬镳，似乎永无休止的‘文员叛变’”（约翰逊-莱尔德，1987：148），更不用说认知心理学和转换语法蜜月期的全面和单相思的乐观主义，幻灭的程度很容易解释。而且情况只会变得更糟，至少在短期内是如此；随着认知语法的出现，心理学家和认知科学家有一个更适合探索的语言框架。22

Johnson-Laird is quick to point out that psychologists can’t, in most areas of their work, point even to the level of success that Chomsky’s program has achieved, so they aren’t in much of a position to turn up their noses on those grounds alone. But add to the slow and twisted progress of his program “the wranglings of one group of grammarians with another” and “the seemingly perpetual ‘treason of the clerks’ as successive generations of generative linguists part company with the founding father” (Johnson-Laird, 1987:148), not to mention the sweeping and unrequited optimism of the honeymoon years of cognitive psychology and transformational grammar, and the level of disillusionment is easy to explain. And things will only get worse, at least in the short haul; with the recent advent of cognitive grammar, psychologists and cognitive scientists have a much more amenable linguistic framework to explore.22

当然，哲学家们却不是这样。他们从来没有同样的乐观主义；他们自己的进步，如果算进步的话，也是缓慢的；他们习惯了争吵和背叛；而乔姆斯基总能给他们一个很好的论据；他们还能要求什么呢？他比该学科历史上几乎任何一位语言学家都更像一位哲学家。当然，他与芝诺和洪堡等对语言学有着积极、知情兴趣的散居哲学家在思想上的关系比与惠特尼和布卢姆菲尔德等对哲学感兴趣的语言学家更密切。因此，哲学家们以粗鲁和好斗的方式欢迎他来到他们的怀抱。他们攻击他，庆祝他，与他争论，也支持他。一位哲学家在评论乔姆斯基与杜梅特、奎因、普特南、塞尔以及其他一些哲学界大咖对峙的一本书时，将这一场面比作“观看大师蒙着眼睛与当地名流同时下 36 盘棋”（Hacking，1980：47）。乔姆斯基主义者（尤其是名义上的乔姆斯基主义者）与哲学家之间的互动一直持续不断，硕果累累，而且不太可能放缓。乔姆斯基在哲学界的地位是确定的。

Not so with philosophers, of course. They never had the same optimism; their own progress, if progress it be, is glacial; they’re used to wranglings and treason; and Chomsky never fails to give them a good argument; what more could they ask for? He is more of a philosopher than almost any linguist in the history of the discipline. Certainly he is a closer intellectual kin to the scattered philosophers like Zeno and Humboldt who have had an active, informed interest in linguistics, than to the linguists like Whitney and Bloomfield who have had an interest in philosophy. So, philosophers have welcomed him, in their rough and contentious way, to their hearth. They have attacked him, celebrated him, quibbled with him, and endorsed him. One philosopher, reviewing a book in which Chomsky confronts Dummet, Quine, Putnam, Searle, and assorted other formidable members of the profession, likens the spectacle to “watching the grandmaster play, blindfolded, 36 simultaneous chess matches against the local worthies” (Hacking, 1980:47). The interactions between Chomskyans, especially the titular one, and philosophers have been continuous and fruitful and are unlikely to slow down. Chomsky’s place in philosophy is assured.

那么他在语言学中的地位如何呢？这是最难预测的。20 世纪 80 年代，语言学似乎陷入了相当糟糕的境地，“有多少个语言学系，就有多少个派别”（Green，1981：703）。一些模型已经相当成熟——蒙塔古语法、关系语法、分层语法、标签语法、一个或两个版本的格语法和（修订的）扩展标准理论——但也有一些新兴模型，如共表征语法、等式语法、子依赖语法、角色和指称语法、几种功能语法，当然还有 Lakoff 的当下语法（1980 年的经验语言学）。23但是，尽管出现了其他几位挑战者，他们的方法与 Chomsky 1965、Chomsky 1975和 Chomsky 1985相悖，但乔姆斯基的当红派稳步夺回了正式市场。1986 年，伯纳德·康里 (Bernard Comrie) 哀叹道，“即将到来的形式句法学家中最优秀的人才”正倾向于乔姆斯基的模型 (1986:774)。这是一种熟悉的哀叹。新的竞争者仍在出现（例如，萨多克的自词法句法），而老的竞争者则继续衰落；治理和约束理论（或其他理论）仍在不断发展。

And his place in linguistics? That’s the diciest forecast to make. Linguistics looked to be in quite dire straits in the eighties, with “as many sects as there [were] departments of linguistics” (Green, 1981:703). Some models were fairly well established—Montague grammar, relational grammar, stratificational grammar, tagmemics, a version or two of case grammar, and the (revised) extended standard theory—but there were also emergent models, like corepresentational grammar, equational grammar, daughter-dependency grammar, role-and-reference grammar, several varieties of functional grammar, and, of course, Lakoff’s grammar-of-the-moment (in 1980, experiential linguistics).23 But, while several other challengers arose, defining their approach in opposition to Chomsky1965 and Chomsky1975 and Chomsky1985, the Chomsky-of-the-moment steadily retook the formal market. In 1986, Bernard Comrie lamented that “the best minds among the upcoming generation of formal syntacticians” were gravitating toward Chomsky’s model (1986:774). It is a familiar moan. New contenders still arise (Sadock’s autolexical syntax, for instance), and older ones continue to fade; government-and-binding theory (or whatever) just keeps growing.

他的声誉肯定还会经历几次跌宕起伏，然后才能在学科历史上占据一个稳定而深思熟虑的位置。而且，如果他的过去是一个有用的指导，如果他像我们都希望的那样，距离职业生涯的暮色还有几十年，他的计划也将同样经历几次跌宕起伏。只要看看乔姆斯基的具体模型的演变。从 50 年代末（然后，在 60 年代末）的孤立和防御地位开始，它获得了越来越多的影响力，但统一性是一种假象。仅使用他自己的术语，我们所拥有的阶段远不止约翰逊-莱尔德确定的三个阶段。从句法结构，乔姆斯基转向标准理论，到扩展标准理论（当“条件”工作进入画面时，它被称为修订的扩展标准理论），再到政府约束理论，这一名称在最近的工作中已经让位于原则和参数理论，现在有人谈论“极简主义计划”。名称的混乱也并非毫无征兆。技术提案和概念转变的数量远远超过名称的数量，模型人员的更替也相当频繁。未来肯定还会有更多。事实上，截至本文发稿时，麻省理工学院 (Chomsky, 1992) 的成果表明又出现了一次相当戏剧性的转变，而且又一次转向生成语义学的一些驱动思想。深层结构似乎最终步燃素、以太和渡渡鸟的后尘，进入了遗忘；表面结构也是如此。只有两种表述方式的同质理论的旧梦正在复活——一种是声音（PF，即语音形式），另一种是意义（LF，即逻辑形式）。将声音和意义联系起来的中介语法的目标正在重新成为焦点。而且……谁知道在才华横溢、不可思议的乔姆斯基的脑海中隐藏着什么奇迹？

His reputation is sure to see a few more hills and dales, before it settles into a steady and considered place in the history of the discipline. And, if his past is a useful guide, and if he is, as we can all hope, decades from the twilight of his career, his program will likewise see a few more hills and dales. Just look at the evolution of Chomsky’s specific model. From its isolated and defensive position in the late fifties (then, again, in the late sixties), it has gained more and more influence, but uniformity is something of an illusion. Just using his own terms, we have far more stages than the three Johnson-Laird identifies. From Syntactic Structures, Chomsky moved to the standard theory, to the extended standard theory (which, when the “Conditions” work entered the picture, became known as the revised extended standard theory), to government-binding theory, a designation that has been giving way in recent work to the principles and parameters theory, and now there is talk about a “minimalist program.” Nor is the welter of names asymptomatic. The number of technical proposals and conceptual shifts outweighs the number of designations quite substantially, and the personnel of the models has seen a rather constant turnover. There is surely more to come. Indeed, as we go to press, the work coming out of MIT (Chomsky, 1992) suggests another quite dramatic shift, and a shift again toward some of the driving ideas of generative semantics. D(eep)-structure seems finally to be following phlogiston and ether and the dodo into oblivion; S(urface)-Structure too. The old dream of a homogeneous theory with only two representations—one of sound (PF, or phonetic form) and the other of meaning (LF, or logical form)—is being revived. The goal of a mediational grammar that links sound and meaning is returning to the foreground. And … who knows what wonders lurk in the mind of the brilliant, impossible Chomsky?

他的声誉很可能再次下滑。变化似乎总是会疏远他的一些追随者。认知语法似乎是一个强大的竞争对手，期刊对它的兴趣日益增加（包括它自己的期刊）、一个专注的、快速发展的专业协会、自己的会议、在更一般的会议上的出席率不断上升，以及源源不断的重要研究生论文。当然，不管有没有认知语法，乔姆斯基批评者的市场总是活跃。然而，如果他的名声真的下滑，即使他的支持者也不必惊慌。乔姆斯基在逆境中成长，显然他需要成为某种弱者。他的工作受到的阻力越大，他就越有创造力。在生成语义学的喧嚣平息后，他在给 Riny Huybregts 和 Henk van Riemsdijk 的评论中说道：“当我回顾自己与语言学领域的关系时，我发现它在每一点上都是完全孤立的，或者几乎完全孤立的”(Chomsky, 1982a [1979–80]：42)，大多数语言学家都觉得这一观察完全令人费解。毫无疑问，这种说法有些夸大其词，但乔姆斯基确实曾多次成为少数派，背水一战，但他都出色地度过了难关；乔姆斯基对 Huybregts 和 van Riemsdijk 的评论发表之时，他刚刚重新发明了生成语法，有人说这是他迄今为止最丰富的一次发明，并开始浮出水面。1979 年 4 月，他在比萨发表了《政府与约束》讲座，并于 1980 年进行了修改（见 Chomsky，1981a [1979]；1982b [1979]）。

His reputation could well slip again. Changes always seem to alienate some of his followers. Cognitive grammar appears to be a formidable competitor, with increasing journal interest (including a journal of its own), a dedicated, rapidly growing professional society, conferences all its own, a growing presence at more general conferences, and a steady flow of all-important graduate theses. And, of course, with or without cognitive grammar, the market for Chomsky-bashers is always lively. If his reputation does slip, however, it won’t be cause for alarm, even among his proponents. Chomsky thrives on adversity, apparently having the need to be something of an underdog. The more resistance to his work there is, the more inventive he becomes. In some comments to Riny Huybregts and Henk van Riemsdijk after the generative semantics brouhaha had died down, he said “As I look back over my own relation to the field [of linguistics], at every point it has been completely isolated, or almost completely isolated” (Chomsky, 1982a [1979–80]:42), an observation that most linguists find completely baffling. It is unquestionably overstated, but Chomsky has certainly been in the minority, with his back to the wall, more than once, and he has come through magnificently; the remarks to Huybregts and van Riemsdijk came just as his most recent reinvention of generative grammar, and, some say, his richest to date, was making its way to the surface. His Lectures on Government and Binding were delivered in Pisa, April of 1979, and reworked through 1980 (see Chomsky, 1981a [1979]; 1982b [1979]).

孤立和战斗似乎是他重要的心理动力。24约翰·斯图尔特·密尔的许多精彩的绰号都可以作为他对待科学的口号，但似乎最适合的那个直接说明了偏执狂的智力优势：“只要战场上没有敌人，老师和学生都会在岗位上睡觉。”正如我们反复看到的那样，乔姆斯基非常高兴地把那些他本来可以非常有利可图的人赶到敌人那里（例如，他仍然高度评价波斯特尔的工作，钦佩麦考利的工作，并围绕罗斯的岛屿工作组织了大量研究）。

Isolation and embattlement appear to be important psychological motivators for him.24 Many of John Stuart Mill’s crackling epithets can stand as slogans for his approach to science, but the one that seems best suited speaks directly to the intellectual advantages of paranoia: “Both teachers and learners go to sleep at the post, as soon as there is no enemy in the field.” As we have seen, repeatedly, Chomsky quite cheerfully drives into enemydom people with whom he could otherwise work very profitably (he still speaks quite highly of Postal’s work, for instance, and admires McCawley’s, and has organized a great deal of his research around Ross’s island work).

暂且不谈重复，乔姆斯基的各种模型的共同点在于诺姆·乔姆斯基，而这些模型在其核心驱动主题上出现了相当惊人的变化范围，这一范围使得乔姆斯基语言学的历史可以通过一次著名的交流相当准确地描述出来：

Brooking tautology for a moment, what Chomsky’s various models have in common is Noam Chomsky, and those models have seen a rather staggering range of variations upon his core of driving themes, a range which permits the history of Chomskyan linguistics to be characterized rather nicely by a famous exchange:

哈姆雷特：

HAMLET:

你看到那边形状像骆驼的云了吗？

Do you see yonder cloud that’s almost in shape of a camel?

波洛涅斯：

POLONIUS:

从质量来看，它确实像一头骆驼。

By the mass, and ’tis like a camel, indeed.

哈姆雷特：

HAMLET:

我觉得它就像一只黄鼠狼。

Methinks it is like a weasel.

波洛涅斯：

POLONIUS:

它的背部像黄鼠狼一样。

It is backed like a weasel.

哈姆雷特：

HAMLET:

或者像鲸鱼？

Or like a whale?

波洛涅斯：

POLONIUS:

很像鲸鱼。

Very like a whale.

要看《哈姆雷特》，就读乔姆斯基的作品；要看《云》，就读语言或心灵；要看《波洛涅斯》，就读一群迅速变化的聪明而敬业的语言学家的作品；骆驼、黄鼠狼和鲸鱼都尚无定论，但在乔姆斯基的作品中，它们的化身比在莎士比亚的作品中要多。当然，乔姆斯基所报告的在云中看到的形状中，有两种是本书的核心 - 一种是深层结构是“决定句子意义”的语法特征（1966a:35），即生成语义学；另一种是深层结构与意义如此偶然有关，以至于它逐渐消失在 D 结构即解释语义学中。

For Hamlet, read Chomsky; for cloud, read language or mind; for Polonius, read a rapidly changing core of bright and dedicated linguists; camel, weasel, and whale are up for grabs, but there are more incarnations in Chomsky than in Shakespeare. Among the shapes that Chomsky has reported seeing in the clouds, of course, are the two at the heart of this book—the one in which deep structure was the grammatical feature that “determines the meaning of the sentence” (1966a:35), generative semantics, and the one in which deep structure was so incidental to meaning that it faded away into D-structure, interpretive semantics.

然而请注意，哈姆雷特-波洛涅斯对乔姆斯基语言学的描述恰恰是任何科学史的适当描述。亚里士多德和托勒密认为地球是宇宙的中心，他们的追随者也同意这一观点。哥白尼认为太阳是宇宙的中心，他的追随者也同意这一观点。最近对宇宙云的解释认为地球和太阳位于边缘，这一模型得到了广泛的认同。

Notice, however, that the Hamlet-Polonius characterization of Chomskyan linguistics is exactly the appropriate characterization for the history of any science. Aristotle and Ptolemy said the earth was at the center of the cosmos, and their followers agreed. Copernicus said that the sun was at the center of the cosmos, and his followers agreed. More recent interpretations of the cosmic cloud assign earth and its sun to the periphery, and this model has extremely wide assent.

乔姆斯基语言学的主要区别在于时间框架更加紧凑，而且始终以同一个喜怒无常的哈姆雷特为中心。这些差异深深影响了该学科的社会学。每次乔姆斯基经历一次小范式转变时，他都会留下杰肯多夫所说的“幻灭的库恩式残骸”。25因此，这个领域充满敌意，典型模型比大多数领域更短暂。但是，由于同样的原因，它也比其他许多领域更丰富。它使教师和学习者时刻保持警惕；无论语言学还有什么可说的，它都不是一个昏昏欲睡的领域。语言及其容器太复杂了，以至于无法由一个语言学家一下子泄露它们的秘密，无论他多么敏锐。就我个人而言，我非常感谢乔姆斯基思想的活力。我也很高兴他的主题在其他模型（如广义短语结构语法）中的变化产生了摩擦，也很高兴看到替代方法（如功能主义和认知语法）的激增。

The primary difference in Chomskyan linguistics is that the time frame is far more compressed, and that the same moody Hamlet is center stage throughout. These differences have affected the sociology of the discipline profoundly. Each time Chomsky goes through one of his mini-paradigm shifts, he leaves what Jackendoff terms “disillusioned Kuhnian debris” littering his wake.25 The field is consequently quite rancorous, and the paradigmatic models more ephemeral than most. But it is also richer than many others for exactly the same reasons. It keeps the teachers and the learners alert at the post; whatever else can be said for linguistics, it is not a sleepy field. Language and its container are far too complex to give up their secrets in one fell swoop by one fell linguist, however hawk-eyed. I, for one, am very grateful for the dynamism of Chomsky’s mind. I am also happy for the friction generated by variations on his themes in other models, like generalized phrase structure grammar, and for the proliferation of alternative approaches, like functionalism and cognitive grammar.

目前，在他孤立主义的另一面，他对自己的工作比以往任何时候都更加乐观，从他目前的研究结果（熟悉的主题，即深入了解语言的更基本结构）推断，将其与伽利略和牛顿的认识论爆炸联系起来，这实际上定义了西方文明过去三百年的发展：

He is at the moment, in the curious flip-side to his isolationism, more sanguine than ever about his work, extrapolating from the results of his current research (in the familiar theme of getting underneath language to its more fundamental structure) to align it with the Galilean and Newtonian epistemic explosions that have virtually defined the last three hundred years of Western civilization:

尽管人们已经对这些主题进行了数千年的研究，而且这些研究成果往往非常深入和富有成效，但我们开始真正地了解心灵的深层隐藏本质，并理解其运作方式，这在历史上尚属首次。在对心灵/大脑的研究中，我们可能正在接近与十七世纪物理科学相当的境况，当时发生了伟大的科学革命，为后来的非凡成就奠定了基础，并决定了此后文明的大部分进程。（1988a：91-92）

We are beginning to see into the deeper hidden nature of the mind and to understand how it works, really for the first time in history, though the topics have been studied for literally thousands of years, often intensely and productively. It is possible that in the study of the mind/brain we are approaching a situation that is comparable with the physical sciences in the seventeenth century, when the great scientific revolution took place that laid the basis for the extraordinary accomplishments of subsequent years and determined much of the course of civilization since. (1988a:91–92)

呼。这些主张和乐观令人叹为观止。对于那些指出他的愿景狭隘的句法中心焦点的反对者来说，这真是可笑。但激光也很狭隘，而且会伤人，20 世纪下半叶的语言学史使得对乔姆斯基得出一个不可避免的结论，尤其是对于许多布卢姆菲尔德主义者、生成语义学家和其他渴望笑到最后的受害者来说。不要打赌反对他。

Whew. The claims and the optimism are breathtaking. Laughably so for opponents who point to the narrow syntaxicentric focus of his vision. But lasers are narrow too, and they cut deeply, and the history of linguistics in the second half of the twentieth century makes one conclusion about Chomsky inescapable, especially for the many Bloomfieldians, generative semanticists, and assorted other victims eager to get the final laugh. Don’t bet against him.

笔记

Notes

第 2 章

Chapter 2

1. 语言文学在过去也曾有过这种联系，尽管从未在北美发生过。

1. Philology has also had this association in the past, though never in North America.

2.例如，Whitney (1910 [1867]:3)、Bloomfield (1933:16)和Hughes (1962)就使用了“前科学的”和“科学的”这些术语。

2. For instance, in Whitney (1910 [1867]:3), Bloomfield (1933:16), and Hughes (1962), who uses exactly these terms, pre-scientific and scientific.

3.值得注意的是，索绪尔并没有呼吁放弃历史语言学。他的《印欧语原始元音系统回忆录》是历时语言学的经典之作，它最引人注目地展示了历史重建的力量。索绪尔提出，原始印欧语必定有某一类声音（辅音系数，后来被称为“喉音”），尽管在其已知的任何后代中都没有这些声音的直接证据；五十年后，库里沃维奇在研究新发现的赫梯文献时发现了直接证据，并发现它恰好位于索绪尔所主张的语音位置上。布鲁姆菲尔德说，索绪尔工作的“要点”在于，它首次“绘制出历史印欧语法（上个世纪的伟大成就）仅仅是一个领域的世界； “他为我们提供了人类语言科学的理论基础”（1923:319；1970:108）。

3. Saussure, it is important to note, did not call for the abandonment of historical linguistics. His Memoir on the Original Vowel System of the Indo-European Languages is a classic of diachronic linguistics, responsible for one of the most spectacular demonstrations of the power of historical reconstruction. Saussure proposed that Proto-Indo-European must have had a certain class of sounds (sonant coefficients, later called “laryngeals”), despite the absence of direct evidence for these sounds in any of its known descendants; fifty years later, Kuryłowicz found that direct evidence when he examined freshly discovered Hittite texts, and found it in exactly the phonetic positions for which Saussure had argued. “The essential point” about Saussure’s work, said Bloomfield, is that it was the first to “[map] out the world in which historical Indo-European grammar (the great achievement of the last century) is merely a single province; he has given us the theoretic basis for a science of human speech” (1923:319; 1970:108).

4.欲了解本概述中的历史有多么突然，请参阅 Julie Tetel Andresen 的《1769–1924 年的美国语言学》（1990a），该书对本节有效起点之前两个世纪的北美语言学进行了相当全面的论述。

4. For one indication of how abrupt the history in this overview is, see Julie Tetel Andresen’s Linguistics in America 1769–1924 (1990a), which offers a quite comprehensive treatment of North American linguistics for the two centuries preceding the effective starting point in this section.

5.萨丕尔和布隆菲尔德是同一时代的人物，在某种意义上是竞争对手，在另一种意义上是同盟。霍克特转述查尔斯·沃格林的话称：“两人都深深地敬重对方，但也有一些保留。萨丕尔钦佩布隆菲尔德耐心地摘录资料、归档和整理纸条直至语言模式显现出来的能力，但对布隆菲尔德的幼稚心理学却不以为然。布隆菲尔德对萨丕尔的精湛技艺感到眼花缭乱，或许还有些嫉妒，但在语言之外的事情上（可能包括心理学），他称萨丕尔为‘巫医’”（布隆菲尔德，1970：539-40）。关于萨丕尔，见科尔纳（1984）、达内尔（1990）；关于布隆菲尔德，见霍尔（1987b；1990）。

5. Sapir and Bloomfield were overlapping contemporaries; competitors in a sense, confederates in another. Hockett, paraphrasing Charles Voegelin, says that “each had deep respect for the other, but with certain reservations. Sapir admired Bloomfield’s ability patiently to excerpt data and to file and collate slips until the patterns of the language emerged, but spoke deprecatingly of Bloomfield’s sophomoric psychology. Bloomfield was dazzled by Sapir’s virtuosity and perhaps a bit jealous of it, but in matters outside language [presumably including psychology] referred to Sapir as a ‘medicine man’” (Bloomfield, 1970:539–40). For Sapir, see Koerner (1984), Darnell (1990); for Bloomfield, see Hall (1987b; 1990).

6.语言之间的差异与思想和语言的密切相互依赖有关，其必然结果是“语言相对论假说”，这一假说至少可以追溯到洪堡，其支持者包括博厄斯、萨丕尔和本杰明·李·沃尔夫。它与莫迪斯泰的工作假说完全相反，莫迪斯泰的工作假说认为，思想对世界各地的所有人都具有统一的结构，语言反映了这一点，这一假说是在前比较主义时期提出的学者们认为拉丁语和希腊语的模式与他们的母语相似。语言相对论（也称萨丕尔-沃尔夫假说）源于对非印欧语系语言的严肃的、具有人类学头脑的研究，该假说认为，既然语言模式如此不同，思维模式也一定如此。该假说的最极端支持者是这样表述的：“我认为，认为只懂霍皮语的霍皮人……和我们有同样的时间和空间观念，这些观念通常被认为是直觉，而且一般被认为是普遍的，这种假设是毫无根据的”，他所说的毫无根据，实际上是指不正确（Whorf，1956 [1936]：57）。

6. A corollary of the differences among languages that involves the close interdependence of thought and language is the “linguistic relativity hypothesis,” which dates at least to Humboldt and includes Boas, Sapir, and Benjamin Lee Whorf among its subscribers. It is the virtual opposite of the Modistae’s working hypothesis, that thought had a uniform structure for all people everywhere, which language reflected, a hypothesis that arose among pre-comparativist scholars who could see Latin and Greek patterns in their native tongues. Linguistic relativity (also called the Sapir-Whorf hypothesis), which arose with the serious, anthropologically-minded study of non-Indo-European languages, claims that since language patterns are so different, thought patterns must be as well. Its most extreme proponent phrased it this way: “I find it gratuitous to assume that a Hopi who knows only the Hopi language … has the same notions, often supposed to be intuitions, of time and space that we have, and that are generally assumed to be universal,” and by gratuitious, he in fact meant incorrect (Whorf, 1956 [1936]:57).

Joos (1950:702–3) 提供了一个美妙的例子，说明这种语言控制的世界结构是如何在英语中发生的：考虑这个句子“语言学家都把眼镜放在鼻子上。”英语母语人士总是把这个句子理解为过去的动作或现在的动作，尽管put是一小类英语动词之一，它对活动时间有歧义：“他们现在戴上眼镜”；“他们昨天戴上眼镜。”从非常真实的意义上讲，我们的语言让我们从时间上思考；而 Kwakwala 则让其使用者从伦理上思考。

Joos (1950:702–3) provides a beautiful illustration of how this language-governed structuring of the world happens in English: consider the sentence “The linguists all put their glasses on their noses.” Native English speakers invariably take this sentence to refer either to a past action, or to a present action, despite the fact that put is one of a small class of English verbs which is ambiguous for time of activity: “They put their glasses on now”; “They put their glasses on yesterday.” In a very real sense, our language makes us think temporally; Kwakwala makes its speakers think ethically.

7.至少，强有力的假设是萨丕尔的结构主义是本土的。他并不是一个特别贪婪的学者，也不缺乏发展这种方法的智力，而且他在整理其大部分概念的《语言》一书中从未提到索绪尔。萨丕尔在写《语言》之前没有听说过《课程》也并不奇怪；即使在欧洲，“这本书的出现也并不是什么轰动事件（1916 年，即它出版的那一年，欧洲正遭受着隐喻性较小的爆炸的破坏）”（Lepschy，1986：189）。总的来说，索绪尔对北美语言学家的直接影响相对较小。《课程》直到 1959 年才被翻译成英文，大多数美国结构主义者认为他们的工作与博厄斯的人类学传统更接近，而不是欧洲的任何作品。例如，麦克戴维 (McDavid, 1947:30) 说，美国结构主义思想兴起于“当研究北美本土文化的人类学家意识到，作为这些文化载体的语言的结构和声音模式不能被扭曲成传统上被接受的西欧语言模式时”。

7. At least the strong assumption is that Sapir’s structuralism is homegrown. He was not a particularly covetous scholar, nor one short of the intellectual wherewithal to develop such an approach, and he never mentions Saussure in the book codifying most of his notions, Language. Nor would it have been unusual for Sapir not to have heard of the Course before writing Language; even in Europe, “the book’s appearance was not a bombshell (in 1916, the year of its publication, Europe was being devastated by less metaphorical explosions)” (Lepschy, 1986:189). In general, Saussure’s direct influence on North American linguists was relatively slight. The Course was not even translated into English until 1959, and most American structuralists saw their work as much more closely allied to the anthropological tradition of Boas than to anything from Europe. McDavid (1947:30), for instance, says that American structuralist thought arose “when anthropologists studying native cultures in North America realized that the structures and sound-patterns of the languages that were the vehicles of those cultures could not be distorted into the traditionally accepted patterns of Western European languages.”

8.我在某种程度上压缩了历史，忽略了一些非常重要的事件——比如第二次世界大战和 1939 年萨丕尔的去世——这些事件对布卢姆菲尔德和萨丕尔的影响产生了相当大的影响，但对于我们的目的而言，重要的一点是，布卢姆菲尔德成为了语言学的主导力量，他的方法（通过门徒折射出来）主导了乔姆斯基踏上的美国舞台。请看对他的语言的这种赞美：

8. I am collapsing history to some extent, and ignoring some very significant events—like the Second World War, and Sapir’s death in 1939—which affected the influence of Bloomfield and Sapir rather substantially, but the important point for our purposes is that Bloomfield became the dominant force in linguistics, and that his approach (refracted through disciples) dominated the American stage onto which Chomsky stepped. Consider just this celebration of his Language:

毫不夸张地说，自 1933 年以来，我们国家对分析方法的每一次重大改进都是布卢姆菲尔德的著作对语言研究的推动的直接结果。如果我们今天比他本人更清楚地了解他向我们揭示的某些结构方面，那是因为我们站在他的肩膀上。（Bloch，1949：92）

It is not too much to say that every significant refinement of analytic method produced in this country since 1933 has come as a direct result of the impetus given to linguistic research by Bloomfield’s book. If today we see more clearly than he did himself certain aspects of structure that he revealed to us, it is because we stand on his shoulders. (Bloch, 1949:92)

9.以下讨论更多的是意识形态方面的，而不是严格的历史性的。例如，在我认定的三个关键的学会创始人中，只有一个人（布卢姆菲尔德）发挥了重要的行政和政策制定作用，而其他在这些方面发挥了更重要作用的人（尤其是乔治·博林）则被完全忽略了。也就是说，我在这里只关心 LSA 的存在对语言学的意义，而不是该组织的历史。但请参阅 Joos (1986 [1976]) 和 Murray (1991) 的著作，其中有关于 LSA 及其重要机构语言和语言研究所的历史记载；Hill (1991) 讲述了 1950 年的故事，还收录了 Marckwardt 1962 年 LSA 主席的演讲，其中追溯了该组织的一些早期历史；Davis 和O'Cain (1980) 和 Koerner (1991) 收集了当时语言学家的简短回忆录，其中包含有关 LSA 的轶事和证言。

9. The following discussion is more ideological than strictly historical. Of the three people I identify as crucial founding members of the society, for instance, only one (Bloomfield) had an important administrative and policy-forming role, and others who had more important roles in those respects (especially George Bolling) are ignored altogether. That is, I am only interested here in what the existence of the LSA meant to linguistics, not in the history of the organization. But see Joos (1986 [1976]) and, especially, Murray (1991), for historical accounts of the LSA and its important organs, Language and the Linguistic Institute; Hill (1991) takes up the story in 1950, and also included Marckwardt’s 1962 LSA presidential address which traces some early history of the organization; virtually every essay in Davis and O’Cain (1980) and Koerner (1991)—collections of brief memoirs from linguists of the period—contain anecdotes about and testimonials for the LSA.

10.这些类比不是我所为：马丁·乔斯（Martin Joos）称布卢姆菲尔德为“美国语言学（萨丕尔）的牛顿、莱布尼茨”（1957：v），而布卢姆菲尔德的公设自觉地是欧几里得的。

10. The analogies are not mine: Martin Joos called Bloomfield “the Newton of American linguistics [Sapir,] its Leibniz” (1957:v), and Bloomfield’s postulates are self-consciously Euclidean.

11.布卢姆菲尔德对萨丕尔论点的“回答”是他在现代语言协会发表的演讲，题为《语言学作为一门科学》（1930；1970：227-230）。

11. Bloomfield’s “answer” to Sapir’s argument was an address delivered to the Modern Language Association, “Linguistics as a Science” (1930; 1970:227–30).

12.在这种严重删节的行为主义描述中，存在一些时代错误——影射了20世纪40年代和50年代发展起来的作品，主要是在沃森的思想继承者BF斯金纳的影响下——但这种混淆并没有对任何实质性内容产生影响，而斯金纳的行为主义品牌对于我们故事的后续章节很重要。

12. There is some anachronism in this severely truncated account of behaviorism—alluding to work that developed in the forties and fifties, chiefly under the influence of Watson’s intellectual successor, B. F. Skinner—but nothing material is affected by this conflation, and Skinner’s brand of behaviourism is important for a later chapter in our story.

13.参见 Hockett 在其编辑的 Bloomfield 论文中对这一点的补充，以及他所收录的 Diekhoff 对 Bloomfield 第一篇文章的评论（Bloomfield，1970：45-50）。

13. See Hockett’s interpolation on this point in his edition of Bloomfield’s papers, and the review he includes by Diekhoff of Bloomfield’s first text (Bloomfield, 1970:45–50).

14.该引文出自 Edgerton (1933:295; Bloomfield, 1970:258)，但Hockett 的 Bloomfield 选集中所有对《语言》的评论都围绕这一主题（Bloomfield, 1970:257–80）。

14. The quotation is from Edgerton (1933:295; Bloomfield, 1970:258), but all the reviews of Language in Hockett’s Bloomfield anthology play this theme (Bloomfield, 1970:257–80).

15.例如，他的《为什么要建立一个语言学会？》一文引起了人们对“美洲印第安语言的普遍关注，这些语言正在永远消失，其消失速度比记录的速度还要快”（1925:5，1970:112），而他对一种文化和语言的解体所表达的特殊悲痛在《梅诺米尼文本》（1928；保留了其凄美感的删节版在1970:210-11）的序言中有所体现。

15. His “Why a Linguistic Society?” for instance, drew general attention to the “American Indian languages which are disappearing forever, more rapidly than they can be recorded” (1925:5, 1970:112), and his specific anguish over the disintegration of a culture and language is apparent in the preface to Menomini Texts (1928; an abridged version which retains the poignancy is in 1970:210–11).

16.心灵论者当然不会闭上他们的耳朵，尽管他们的数量和他们所面临的途径都很有限——例如​​，莫里斯·斯瓦德什 (Morris Swadesh) 对心灵论的雄辩辩护（1948 年）发表在一份鲜为人知的马克思主义杂志上——所以更准确的口号应该是“机械论者：闭上你的耳朵！”

16. Mentalists, of course, didn’t shut their traps, though their numbers and the avenues open to them were both quite limited—Morris Swadesh’s eloquent defense of mentalism (1948), for instance, was published in an obscure Marxist journal—so a more accurate slogan would have been “Mechanists: Shut your ears!”

17.有人说受布卢姆菲尔德启发的语言学家对意义不感兴趣，这种说法在某些方面引起了一些争议，而且正如我们将看到的，这种概括有点太过分了。但在布卢姆菲尔德警告意义可能导致混乱之后，意义肯定不在那个时期语言学的主要研究范围内。因此，例如，希尔引用了乔斯的一篇晦涩难懂的论文（“迈向语义学第一定理”）来“作为对经常重复但错误的指控之一的驳斥（众多驳斥之一），即 20 世纪 40 年代和 50 年代的美国语言学是反语义和唯物主义的，据说这些特征应归功于伦纳德·布卢姆菲尔德”，但在希尔的论文中插入了乔斯的哀叹，即观众“几乎完全持负面反应”（Hill，1991：30）。

17. It is mildly controversial in some quarters to say that Bloomfield-inspired linguists were uninterested in meaning, and, as we will see, the generalization is a little too strong. But meaning was definitely out of the main purview of linguistics in that period, following Bloomfield’s warning that it has the potential to lead to chaos. So, for instance, Hill uses an obscure paper by Joos (“Towards a First Theorem in Semantics”) to serve “as one refutation (among many) to the oft-repeated but erroneous charge that American linguistics of the 1940’s and 1950’s was anti-semantic and materialist, characteristics which it supposedly owed to Leonard Bloomfield,” but interpolated into Hill’s paper is a lamentation by Joos that the audience “reacted almost entirely negatively” (Hill, 1991:30).

18.布隆菲尔德著作出版后，在美国从事这一职业的那代语言学家有不少可供选择的标签，比如常见的有描写主义者、美国结构主义者和分类学家，但出于多种原因，布隆菲尔德派最适合我们的目的。描写主义者这个标签最适合受博厄斯启发的语言学家（Harris，1973：252，将此传统称为“基于描写信息的语法”），包括布隆菲尔德及其追​​随者，也就是说，这个标签太宽泛了。美国结构主义者除其他外还意味着，取代布隆菲尔德的乔姆斯基语言学的纲领不是结构主义的，也就是说，它的含义狭隘得令人误解。而分类学家这个由乔姆斯基引入的术语则完全是贬义的，至少在乔姆斯基引入它的语境中是如此。所以，布隆菲尔德派才是最适合我们的。

18. There are quite a few alternate labels for the generation of linguists who plied their trade in the U.S. in the wake of Bloomfield’s book—descriptivists, American structuralists, and taxonomists, among the more common—but, for a number of reasons, Bloomfieldians is best suited for our purposes. Descriptivists is a label best suited to linguists inspired by Boas (the tradition Harris, 1973:252, calls “descriptive informant-based grammar”), including Bloomfield and his followers; that is, it is too broad. American structuralists implies, among other things, that the program which displaced Bloomfield’s, Chomskyan linguistics, is not structuralist; that is, its implications are misleadingly narrow. And taxonomists, a term introduced by Chomsky, is flatly derogatory, at least in the context in which Chomsky introduced it. So, Bloomfieldian it is.

其他评论者喜欢用诸如neo（新）或post（后）之类的前缀来限定Bloomfieldian，以认可其他人（如 Bernard Bloch、George Trager、Zellig Harris 和 Charles Hockett）对该计划的贡献，而这种前缀的另一个好处是承认 Bloomfield 在我们将要研究的几个问题上，特别是意义和心理主义，不像他的一些追随者那样教条主义。（特别是，请参阅 Fries，1961，其中讨论了 Bloomfield 及其影响，其中指出了一点“他的”学派的多样性；Mathews，1986，对布卢姆菲尔德的作品如何催生了布卢姆菲尔德学派进行了最精彩的讨论；Anderson，1985：277-80，特别简洁地捕捉了布卢姆菲尔德（1933）和乔姆斯基（1957a）之间美国语言学的一致性和多样性。这种方法最具代表性的文本可能是其盛行时期的最新文本，因为它们总结并综合了其发展和立场；特别是格里森的《描述语言学导论》（1956）、霍克特的《现代语言学教程》（1958）和（特别是）希尔的《语言结构导论》（1958）。

Other commentators prefer to qualify Bloomfieldian with prefixes like neo- or post- to recognize the contributions to this program by others (such as Bernard Bloch, George Trager, Zellig Harris, and Charles Hockett), and such prefixing has the additional virtue of acknowledging that Bloomfield was somewhat less dogmatic than some of his followers became on a few of the questions we will be looking at, particularly meaning and mentalism. (See, in particular, Fries, 1961, for some discussion of Bloomfield and his influence which notes a bit of the diversity in “his” school; and Mathews, 1986, for the best discussion of how Bloomfield’s work engendered the Bloomfieldian school; Anderson, 1985:277–80, is particularly succinct at capturing the uniformity and diversity in American linguistics between Bloomfield, 1933, and Chomsky, 1957a. The most representative texts of this approach are probably the ones that came latest in its reign, since they summarize and synthesize its developments and positions; in particular, Gleason’s Introduction to Descriptive Linguistics (1956), Hockett’s A Course in Modern Linguistics (1958), and (especially) Hill’s Introduction to Linguistic Structures (1958).

19.这里有必要就“乔姆斯基语言学”这个术语说几句，这个词可能比乔姆斯基更让任何人恼火。毫无疑问，乔姆斯基有自尊心，看到自己的名字与大思想联系在一起无疑会让他感到高兴，但他经常抨击使用某人的名字来表示研究领域或理论观点所暗示的个人崇拜。例如，他谴责使用“马克思主义”，尽管他钦佩马克思的“极其杰出和重要的思想”。他说，马克思主义和马克思主义者等术语更多地属于“有组织的宗教史”，而不是开放的探究。通过将这种用法与科学实践进行对比，他将马克思主义与假设的爱因斯坦主义对立起来，并要求人们将“大思想”——无论其来源如何——简单地视为“智力贡献，而不是神的灵感”。 （本段所有引文均来自 Chomsky，1988a：177–78。）至于乔姆斯基语言学，他说这个短语是“荒谬的”。尽管如此，这个标签还是恰当的，而且普遍喜欢的术语生成语法是不可用的，因为它可能导致与生成语义学混淆。所以，在以下简短的道歉之后，我将在本书的剩余部分继续（谨慎地）使用它。首先，虽然爱因斯坦主义从来都不是一个非常流行的术语，但它并非未经证实，相对论经常被称为“爱因斯坦相对论”。牛顿主义（以及诸如牛顿哲学之类的措辞）在几个世纪以来相当普遍，牛顿物理学仍然是古典物理学的常用同义词。达尔文主义在生物学中很流行（事实上，恩斯特·迈尔 (Ernst Mayr) 使用后缀“-ism”作为达尔文 (Darwin )名字的标志，因此证明了他是“人类历史上最伟大的思想革命者”——1988:162）。许多人用自己的名字命名了科学中的各种技术、仪器和现象——例如斐波那契数、冯·诺依曼机器和广受欢迎的哈雷彗星。乔姆斯基语言学以及乔姆斯基理论或乔姆斯基语法等变体也得到了证实（例如，Stout，1973）。乔姆斯基语言学也出现了，它似乎毫无疑问是狂热的和邪教式的（例如，Hall，1990:91-92），而这正是乔姆斯基语言学偶尔表现出来的方式。在他的批评者的文章中，也使用“嘲讽”一词，但后者也出现在他的一些崇拜者的评论中（如 Harman，1988：260）。无论如何，我的用法是完全中立的。

19. A few words are in order here about the term Chomskyan linguistics, which probably rankles no one so much as it rankles Chomsky. Chomsky has an ego, unquestionably, and it no doubt gives him some pleasure to see his name in print associated with Big Ideas, but he regularly inveighs against the cult of personality implied by using someone’s name to signal a field of inquiry or a theoretical perspective. He has, for instance, deplored the use of Marxism, despite his admiration for Marx’s “extremely brilliant and important ideas.” Terms like Marxism and Marxist, he says, belong more “to the history of organized religion” than to open inquiry. Contrasting this usage to practices in science, he opposes Marxism to the hypothetical Einsteinism and requires people to treat Big Ideas, whatever their source, simply “as intellectual contributions and not as divine inspiration.” (All quotations in this paragraph are from Chomsky, 1988a:177–78.) As for Chomskyan linguistics, he says the phrase is “absurd.” Still, the label is appropriate, and the generally preferred term, generative grammar, is unavailable because it could lead to confusion with generative semantics. So, with the following brief apologies, I will continue to employ it (sparingly) through the remainder of this book. First, although Einsteinism has never been a very popular term, it is not unattested, and the theory of relativity is quite regularly referred to as “Einstein’s theory of relativity.” Newtonianism (along with such locutions as the Newtonian philosophy) was quite common for several centuries, and Newtonian physics is still a frequent synonym for classical physics. Darwinism is popular in biology (indeed, Ernst Mayr uses the suffix -ism as a badge for the name Darwin, which therefore certifies him as “the greatest of all intellectual revolution[aries] in the history of mankind”—1988:162). And many individuals have lent their names to various techniques, instruments, and phenomena in science—for example, the Fibonacci numbers, von Neumann machines, and the ever-popular Halley’s comet. Chomskyan linguistics, too, along with variants like Chomskyan theory or Chomskyan grammar, is attested (e.g., Stout, 1973). Chomskyite linguistics, which also shows up, seems unequivocally fanatical and cultlike (e.g., Hall, 1990:91–92), and that is occasionally how Chomskyan is used as well, as something of a sneer in the writings of his detractors, but the latter term also occurs in the comments of some of his admirers (such as Harman, 1988:260). My usage, in any event, is intended to be completely neutral.

乔姆斯基也并非总是避免使用专有名词作为一般术语——例如，他称行为主义思想为“斯金纳模式”（1975b:199），并将他的其中一本书命名为笛卡尔语言学（而不是理性主义语言学或波特-罗亚尔语言学）。尽管他提出了温和的“鱼与熊掌兼得”抗议（1991a [1989]:4），但他还是引人注目地参加了一场名为“乔姆斯基转向”的会议（Kasher，1991）。

Nor has Chomsky always refrained from using proper nouns as general terms—calling, for instance, behaviorist thought “the Skinnerian pattern” (1975b:199), and entitling one of his books Cartesian Linguistics (rather than, say, Rationalist Linguistics or Port-Royal Linguistics). He has even, albeit under a mild, have-your-cake-and-eat-it-too protest (1991a [1989]:4), prominently participated in a conference with the label “The Chomskyan Turn” (Kasher, 1991).

20. Bloch 和 Trager 的书中，句法处理显然存在一些矛盾，而这项工作实际上由 Bloomfield 接手了：

20. There was evidently some tension over the handling of syntax in Bloch and Trager’s book, and the job in fact was taken over by Bloomfield:

Bloch 和 Trager 实际上受 LSA 委托（一般是受 Bloomfield 委托）撰写《语言分析大纲》。除了语法章节外，他们对其他所有方面都意见一致。Bloomfield 确信，如果本书的语法章节过于现代，那么它就无法达到其目的；在尝试让两位合作者或其中一人单独撰写一个足够传统的语法章节但徒劳无功之后，Bloomfield 撰写了这一章节特雷格亲自撰写了这本书。他成功说服布洛赫省略在标题页上添加第三个名字，但特雷格仍不甘心，直到今天， 《大纲》的多次重印都没有经过他的批准。（Joos，1967：9）

Bloch and Trager were in effect commissioned [by the LSA generally, Bloomfield specifically] to write the Outline of Linguistic Analysis. They were in agreement about everything but the syntax chapter. Bloomfield was sure that the book would not serve its purpose with a radically modern syntax chapter; and after fruitless efforts to get a sufficiently conventional syntax chapter written by the two collaborators or by either one of them alone, Bloomfield wrote that chapter himself. He was able to persuade Bloch to omit adding the third name to the title page, but Trager remained unreconciled, and the repeated reprintings of the Outline, even today, have been without his approval. (Joos, 1967:9)

21.博厄斯也提出了类似的观点，尽管他使用的术语不是句法和形态学，而是语法和词典学（nd [1911]:26–27）。然而，最清晰的陈述是在霍克特（1940:56）的简短评论中，他认为美洲印第安语言形态的复杂性和布隆菲尔德语言学的描述性要求使句法“几乎成为未知领域”。黑尔（1976:35）提出了布隆菲尔德主义句法贫乏的一个相关原因：句法对外行人来说比对母语人士来说要难得多，而且很少有语言学家以美洲印第安语言为母语。

21. Boas makes a similar point, though his terms are not syntax and morphology but grammar and lexicography (n.d. [1911]:26–27). The clearest statement, however, is in Hockett’s (1940:56) brief comment that the morphological intricacies of Amerindian languages and the descriptive mandate of Bloomfieldian linguistics rendered syntax “almost terra incognita.” Hale (1976:35) suggests a related reason for the syntactic poverty of Bloomfieldianism: syntax is much more difficult for an outsider to study than for a native speaker to study, and there have been very few linguists who spoke an Amerindian language as their first language.

22.然而，这一观察不应像通常那样被理解为暗示乔姆斯基发明了句法。在转换分析出现之前，有许多优秀的句法指南：对于英语，有 Onions（1911 年）、Wendt（1911 年）、Poutsma（1914 年）、Vechtman-Veth（1928 年、1942 年）、Jespersen（1937 年、1949 年 [1909–1940 年]）、Krüger（1914 年 [1897–1911 年]）、Curme（1931 年）；其中只有最后一本是由美国人撰写的。然而，几乎所有这些研究都是前结构主义的，即使不是在时间顺序上，也是在方法论上（或者，对于某些人来说，也许是准结构主义的，比如 Jespersen，他的方法处于风口浪尖）。乔姆斯基（在 Nida、Wells 和 Harris 的大量帮助下）几乎发明了结构主义句法。

22. However, this observation should not be taken, as it often is, to imply that Chomsky invented syntax. There were a number of good syntactic guidebooks before the advent of transformational analysis: for English, there were Onions (1911), Wendt (1911), Poutsma (1914), Vechtman-Veth (1928, 1942), Jespersen (1937, 1949 [1909–1940]), Krüger (1914 [1897–1911]), Curme (1931); only the last of these by an American. Virtually all of these investigations, though, were pre-structuralist, in methodology if not chronology (or, perhaps quasi-structuralist for some, such as Jespersen, whose methods were on the cusp). Chomsky (with considerable help from Nida, Wells, and, especially, Harris) pretty much invented structuralist syntax.

23.普朗克的故事可能是伪造的，但它的寓意——十九世纪后期普遍而错误的相信物理学即将完成——却并非如此。例如，开尔文勋爵在世纪之交向英国科学促进会发表演讲，他告诉他们“现在物理学中没有什么新发现。剩下的只是越来越精确的测量”（Davies and Brown，1988:4）。更普遍地说，完成场的故事是科学史上一个熟悉的主题；在开尔文发表言论几十年后，类似的评论在量子力学中很常见（霍金，1985 [1980]：132，引用了《20 世纪 20 年代的伯恩》中的一条这样的主张，而布斯，1974:69，引用了罗素的另一条主张）。最极端的版本来自小弗朗西斯·克里克，他小时候渴望成为一名科学家，但又绝望地认为将无事可做：“等我长大——那似乎还很遥远！——一切都会被发现。”（不过，他的妈妈安慰了他。“别担心，达奇，”她告诉他。“还有很多东西等着你去发现。”——克里克，1988：9。）

23. The Planck story may be aprocryphal, but its moral—the widespread and misplaced confidence in the later nineteenth century that physics was nearing completion—is not. Lord Kelvin, for instance, gave a speech right at the turn of the century to the British Association for the Advancement of Science, in which he told them that “there is nothing new to be discovered in physics now. All that remains is more and more precise measurement” (Davies and Brown, 1988:4). More generally, the finished-field story is a familiar leitmotif in the history of science; a few decades after Kelvin’s remarks, similar comments were common for quantum mechanics (Hawking, 1985 [1980]:132, quotes one such claim from Born in the 1920s, and Booth, 1974:69, quotes another from Russell). Its most extreme version comes from wee Francis Crick, who was impatient to become a scientist when he was a boy, but despaired there would be nothing left to do: “By the time I grew up—and how far away that seemed!—everything would have been discovered.” (His mum, however, provided solace. “Don’t worry, Ducky,” she told him. “There will be plenty left for you to find out.”—Crick, 1988:9.)

24.参见 Nida (1960 [1943])、Wells (1947b)、Bloch (1953)，尤其是 Trager 和 Smith (1957 [1951])。他们在直接成分分析的基础上运用了音系句法理论，这种分析在乔姆斯基出现之前，曾引起年轻语言学家对句法的极大热情。

24. See Nida (1960 [1943], Wells (1947b), Bloch (1953), and, especially, Trager and Smith (1957 [1951]), which put the phonological syntax spin on Immediate Constituent analysis that was responsible for much syntactic enthusiasm among younger linguists just before Chomsky came on the scene.

25.布洛赫的评论是在 1959 年 7 月 31 日写给罗伯特·利斯 (Robert Lees) 的一封信中，他是乔姆斯基语言学兴起的重要力量，该信被 Stephen Murray (1980:79) 引用。布洛赫——“可能是他们中最忠实的布洛姆菲尔德主义者”(Stark, 1972:387)，更重要的是，作为 LSA 语言学的专制编辑， “新布洛姆菲尔德主义的核心守门人”(Murray, 1980:73)——从一开始就鼓励乔姆斯基。他似乎对科学进步有着非常费耶阿本德式的看法，他的一个学生用毛泽东的隐喻“百花齐放”来描述这种看法，而他公开地滋养了这些具有生成性的植物。他将乔姆斯基的论文和他的《逻辑结构》放在耶鲁图书馆。他发表了李斯对《语言中的句法结构》的出色评论，并定期发表对布卢姆菲尔德作品的尖刻的变革性评价，甚至在一次攻击中插入了与波斯特尔团结一致的编辑表达（1966b）。纽梅尔说，布洛赫告诉“至少两位同事，‘乔姆斯基似乎真的走在正确的道路上。如果我如果我还年轻，我也会加入他的行列’”（1980a:47）。乔姆斯基曾经（现在仍然）非常感谢布洛赫的帮助；在早期攻击斯金纳（1959 [1957]）之后，他为《语言》杂志贡献的唯一一篇文章是布洛赫纪念版（1967a）。

25. Bloch’s comment is in a letter to Robert Lees, an important force in the rise of Chomskyan linguistics, dated 31 July 1959, cited in Stephen Murray (1980:79). Bloch—“probably the truest Bloomfieldian of them all” (Stark, 1972:387) and, more importantly, as the somewhat autocratic editor of the LSA’s Language, “the central neo-Bloomfieldian gatekeeper” (Murray, 1980:73)—encouraged Chomsky from the outset. He appears to have had a remarkably Feyerabendian view of scientific progress, which one of his students characterizes in the Maoist metaphor of letting a hundred flowers bloom, and he openly nourished the generative flora. He placed Chomsky’s theses, and his Logical Structure, in the Yale library. He published Lees’s remarkable review of Syntactic Structures in Language, and regularly published ill-tempered transformational appraisals of Bloomfieldian work, even inserting an editorial expression of solidarity with Postal in one of his attacks (1966b). Newmeyer says that Bloch told “at least two colleagues, ‘Chomsky really seems to be on the right track. If I were younger, I’d be on his bandwagon too’” (1980a:47). Chomsky was (and remains) very grateful for Bloch’s assistance; the only article he contributed to Language after his early assault on Skinner (1959 [1957]) was to the Bloch memoriam edition (1967a).

霍尔（对上述纽梅尔的引文提出异议）引用了布洛赫的一名学生的话，他说布洛赫“不鼓励TG [转换语法]”（1987a:108；原文重点），鉴于布洛赫直接鼓励乔姆斯基，在《语言》一书中间接鼓励乔姆斯基主义者，并有证据表明他表达了信仰，因此很难从表面上接受这一说法。霍尔没有透露消息来源；纽梅尔的消息来源在第一版中是匿名的，但在第二版中则称他们为唐纳德·福斯和索尔·萨波塔——1986a:38n8）。

Hall (disputing the Newmeyer quotation above) quotes one of Bloch’s students saying that Bloch “did NOT encourage TG [transformational grammar]” (1987a:108; emphasis in the original) which—given Bloch’s direct encouragement of Chomsky, indirect encouragement of Chomskyans in the pages of Language, and documented expressions of faith—is difficult to accept at face value. Hall leaves the informant anonymous; Newmeyer’s informants are anonymous in the first edition, but given in the second as Donald Foss and Sol Saporta—1986a:38n8).

26.这些引文分别来自Trager (1968:84)、Hall (1987a [1965]:5)、Hockett（引自Mehta (1971:175)）和Trager (1968:84)。

26. Respectively, these quotations are from Trager (1968:84), Hall (1987a [1965]:5), Hockett, quoted in Mehta (1971:175), and Trager (1968:84).

第三章

Chapter 3

1.因为这个说法有一定争议（有人认为，布卢姆菲尔德派从一开始就否定了乔姆斯基），所以可能需要一些额外的证据：布洛赫发表了李斯（1957）对《句法结构》的长篇大论和极力赞扬的评论；奈达在 1959 年为《英语句法概要》发表的前言中承认转换分析比他的直接成分分析有所进步（1960 [1943]:iv）；霍克特（1958:208）为其《现代语言学教程》中没有包括转换句法而道歉，而豪斯霍尔德的评论也抱怨了这一疏漏（1958:503、506-8）；格里森（1961）对其《描写语言学导论》的修订确实包括了转换句法。

1. Since this statement is mildly controversial—Bloomfieldians, some accounts suggest, rejected Chomsky from the git-go—some additional evidence may be in order: Bloch published Lees’ (1957) long and hugely laudatory review of Syntactic Structures; Nida’s 1959 preface to the publication of his Synopsis of English Syntax endorsed transformational analysis as an advance over his Immediate Constituent analysis (1960 [1943]:iv); Hockett (1958:208) apologized for not including transformational syntax in his A Course in Modern Linguistics, and Householder’s review complained about just this omission (1958:503, 506–8); Gleason’s (1961) revisions of his An Introduction to Descriptive Linguistics did include transformations.

至于与哈里斯的联系，它从一开始就弥漫在乔姆斯基的名声中。1958 年德克萨斯会议的会议记录明确地表明了这一点（Hill，1962c）。例如，乔姆斯基的论文开头写道：“我想在这里讨论的句法方法直接源于 ZS 哈里斯扩展语言分析方法的尝试”（124），并且在其他几个地方，特别是在讨论期间，他与哈里斯的作品有着密切的联系（例如，164、174、178）。更能说明问题的是，许多参与者都未能区分乔姆斯基和哈里斯的作品——例如，朗的评论“我同意乔姆斯基和哈里斯的观点”（167），关于乔姆斯基和哈里斯在心理现实主义问题上存在巨大分歧。

As for the Harris connection, it suffused Chomsky’s reputation from the very beginning. The proceedings of the 1958 Texas Conference are clear on this point (Hill, 1962c). Chomsky’s paper, for instance, begins “The approach to syntax that I want to discuss here developed directly out of the attempts of Z. S. Harris to extend methods of linguistic analysis” (124), and in several other places, particularly during the discussion sessions, he effects strong links with Harris’s work (e.g., 164, 174, 178). More tellingly, many of the participants reveal a failure to distinguish between Chomsky’s work and Harris’s—as in Long’s comment, “I agree with Chomsky and Harris here” (167), about an issue (psychological realism) on which Chomsky and Harris differed hugely.

2.但这两个定义都不是乔姆斯基的原创。布卢姆菲尔德在《公设》中对语言的定义是“一个言语社区中所能发出的全部话语”（有关乔姆斯基前因的讨论，请参见 PH Mathews，1986：260ff），而霍克特对语法的标准之一是“它必须是富有成效的：当应用于给定语言时，结果必须能够创造出无限数量的有效新话语”（有关乔姆斯基前因的讨论，请参见 Hymes and Fought，1981 [1974]：165–73）。参见 Teeter，1969；Steiner，1971 [1969]：102–25；Gray，1974； Hymes 和 Fought，1981 [1974]：165-85；Moore 和 Carling，1982：19-47；Huck 和 Goldsmith，即将出版，关于乔姆斯基与布隆菲尔德思想的历史联系的一般性讨论。乔姆斯基在这两个领域的贡献在于他将句子集定义和生成装置定义结合在一起，并围绕它们组织语言建模。

2. Neither of these definitions is original with Chomsky, however. Bloomfield’s definition of a language in the “Postulates” is “the totality of utterances that can be made in a speech-community” (see P. H. Mathews, 1986:260ff, for some discussion of Chomsky’s antecedents here), and one of Hockett’s criteria for a grammar is that “it must be productive: when applied to a given language, the results must make possible the creation of an indefinite number of valid new utterances” (see Hymes and Fought, 1981 [1974]:165–73 for some discussion of Chomsky’s antecedents here). See Teeter, 1969; Steiner, 1971 [1969]:102–25; Gray, 1974; Hymes and Fought, 1981 [1974]:165–85; Moore and Carling, 1982:19–47; Huck and Goldsmith, forthcoming, for general discussions of Chomsky’s historical connections to Bloomfieldian thought. Chomsky’s contribution in these two areas is the way in which he welded the set-of-sentences definition and the generating-device definition together and organized linguistic modeling around them.

3.三十年后，参见乔姆斯基（1988b:9）的相同论述。

3. See Chomsky (1988b:9) for much the same account, thirty years later.

4.我刚才概述的转变伴随着一个非常具体的论点，主要引起语言学家的兴趣。在乔姆斯基看来，布卢姆菲尔德理论关注的是找到一种语法发现程序——一套可以应用于文本语料库并产生该语料库的语法描述（即语法）的原则。一套较弱的标准乔姆斯基认为，方法论程序应该是查看语料库、查看针对该语料库提出的一些语法（语法的发现完全无关紧要），并确定它是否是该语言的最佳语法。一个更弱的要求是，一组原则查看语料库、查看针对该语料库提出的两个或更多个语法，并返回哪个语法更好的判决。

4. The shift I have just outlined came with a very specific argument, of interest primarily to linguists. Bloomfieldian theory, as Chomsky saw it, was concerned with locating a discovery procedure for grammars—a set of principles that could be turned on a corpus of texts and produce a grammatical description of that corpus, a grammar. A weaker criterion for a set of methodological procedures, Chomsky suggests, would be the capacity to look at the corpus, look at some proposed grammar for that corpus (the discovery of the grammar being wholly irrelevant), and determine if it was the best possible grammar of that language. An even weaker requirement would be that a set of principles look at the corpus, look at two or more proposed grammars for that corpus, and return a verdict as to which grammar was better.

现在，乔姆斯基已经用科学理论重新定义了语法，而在科学中，即使是这三种选择中最弱的一种，为相互竞争的理论制定一个普遍的评估程序，也是一个很难实现的目标。事实上，制定这样一个程序的难度是库恩讨论不可通约性和革命性变革的基础，乔姆斯基对这个问题的评论在《科学革命的结构》中非常贴切：

Now, Chomsky had redefined a grammar in terms of a scientific theory, and, in science, even the weakest of these three alternatives, formulating a general evaluation procedure for competing theories, is a very difficult goal to attain. In fact, the difficulty of formulating such a procedure is the basis of Kuhn’s discussion of incommensurability and revolutionary change, and Chomsky’s comment on this matter would be very much at home in The Structure of Scientific Revolutions:

在科学领域中，很少有人会认真考虑开发一种通用的、实用的、机械的方法来在几种理论中进行选择的可能性，每种理论都与现有数据兼容。（1957a:53）

There are few areas of science in which one would seriously consider the possiblity of developing a general, practical, mechanical method for choosing among several theories, each compatible with the available data. (1957a:53)

乔姆斯基建议将对语言方法论的期望从发现程序降级为评估程序——即在同一语料库的相互竞争的描述之间进行选择的程序。在提出这一建议时，乔姆斯基已经对其价值进行了详尽的阐述。尽管他没有提供明确的机械程序，但《句法结构》的第一部分清楚地权衡了三种语法的相对优缺点，并得出了对转换模型的有力评价。

Chomsky proposed downgrading expectations about linguistic methodology from the discovery procedure to the evaluation procedure—a procedure to choose between competing descriptions of the same corpus. By the point he makes this suggestion, Chomsky has already provided an extended illustration of its worth. Although he supplies no explicit mechanical procedure, the first part of Syntactic Structures clearly weighs the relative merits of three grammars and returns a compelling evaluation in favor of the transformational model.

有人质疑，乔姆斯基对布隆菲尔德理论追求发现程序的看法是否与布隆菲尔德理论家对自己的看法一致。当然，乔姆斯基的观点是解读他引用的文献的一种方式，这些文献说明了这种担忧（1957a:52n3）。例如，很容易将哈里斯的《方法》解读为追求这样的目标；理想情况下，书中的机械程序指向某种语言的足够大的语料库，然后它就能快速生成对该语料库的描述（进而对该语言的描述）。但“发现程序”这个术语是乔姆斯基的，他坦率地承认，它代表了对布隆菲尔德隐性目标的一种解释（“正如我对大多数更为细致的语言理论发展建议的解释一样……”—1957a:52）。海姆斯和福特（1981 [1974] 176–86）认为这是一种误解。他们的论证没有定论，因为布隆菲尔德和乔姆斯基的术语重叠，难以进行清晰的比较，但肯定有布隆菲尔德理论家明确对模型评估和比较感兴趣，就像乔姆斯基所倡导的一样（最著名的是霍克特，1954 年）。然而，至少就我们的目的而言，乔姆斯基的解释能力并不是一个特别有用的问题（而且，无论如何，竞争项目的成员很少以兼容的方式看待彼此的目标和理论；如果乔姆斯基和布隆菲尔德主义者对布隆菲尔德目标有相互矛盾的解释，这并不奇怪；如果乔姆斯基的解释更具启发性，也不会令人惊讶，因为局外人往往比局内人有更敏锐的眼光）。重要的是，无可争议的是，乔姆斯基的论点对许多语言学家来说是令人信服的，而且，很大程度上由于这一论点，他将语法评估带到了该领域的中心。

There is some question as to whether the way Chomsky saw Bloomfieldian theory on this count, chasing discovery procedures, is the way Bloomfieldian theorists saw themselves. Certainly Chomsky’s view is one way to read the literature he cites to illustrate this concern (1957a:52n3). It is easy to read Harris’s Methods, for instance, as pursuing such a goal; ideally, one points the mechanical routines in the book at a sufficiently large corpus from some language and it cranks out a description of that corpus (and, by extension, of that language). But the term, discovery procedure, is Chomsky’s, and he freely admits that it represents an interpretation of tacit Bloomfieldian aims (“as I interpret most of the more careful proposals for the development of linguistic theory, …”—1957a:52). Hymes and Fought (1981 [1974] 176–86) argue that it was a misinterpretation. Their argument is inconclusive, since Bloomfieldian and Chomskyan terminology overlap in ways that frustrate clear comparisons, but certainly there were Bloomfieldian theorists interested explicitly in model evaluation and comparison of the sort Chomsky champions (most notably, Hockett, 1954). However, for our purposes at least, Chomsky’s interpretive abilities are not an especially useful issue (and, in any case, members of competing programs rarely see each other’s goals and theories in compatible ways; it wouldn’t be very surprising if Chomsky and the Bloomfieldians had conflicting interpretations of Bloomfieldian goals; it also wouldn’t be surprising if Chomsky’s were more revealing, since outsiders often have sharper vision than insiders). What is important, and beyond dispute, is that Chomsky’s argument was compelling for a great many linguists, and that, largely as a result of this argument, he brought grammar evaluation to the center of the field.

5.在这里以及整本书中，我简化了技术材料，有时甚至进行了彻底的简化，以过滤掉与当前要点无关的形式主义或细节。我还在这里和那里引入了一些时代错误（如Aux），以简化当前或以后的讨论。同样，下面关于短语结构语法和转换语法的相对优点的讨论（这次是为了避免时代错误以及不必要的复杂性）完全忽略了 Gerald Gazdar 和受他影响的语言学家的短语结构创新（特别是参见 Gazdar 等人，1985 年）。我在此为这可能会给听众中的所有语言学家造成的不快表示歉意。

5. Here, and throughout the book, I have simplified the technical material, sometimes rather drastically, to filter off formalisms or details that aren’t germane to the point at hand. I have also introduced some anachronisms here and there (like Aux), to simplify current or later discussions. Similarly, the discussion below of the relative merits of phrase structure grammars and transformational grammars (this time to avoid anachronism, along with unnecessary complications) completely ignores the phrase-structure innovations of Gerald Gazdar and the linguists he has influenced (see, especially, Gazdar and others, 1985). I hereby apologize for all the ground teeth this will probably cause linguists in the audience.

6.乔姆斯基的主要目标也是布隆菲尔德式的，即分布性的。他进行被动语态转换的主要动机是使序列正确，说明be + -en复合词的分布。消除上述第 9 和第 10 点讨论中提到的“不雅重复”（Chomsky, 1957a:43）是次要的。但乔姆斯基清楚地认识到捕捉主动语态和被动语态之间系统关系的修辞价值：这是他在《句法结构》前言中提到的这种解决方案的唯一特点，也是他在一篇被广泛传播为导论作品的早期论文《句法转换方法》（1962a [1958]）中介绍的第一个特点。

6. Chomsky’s primary aims, here too, are Bloomfieldian; that is, distributional. His principal motive for the passive transformation is getting the sequences right, accounting for the distribution of the be + -en complex. Eliminating the “inelegant duplication” (Chomsky, 1957a:43) illustrated in the discussion of 9 and 10 above was secondary. But Chomsky clearly recognized the rhetorical virtues of capturing the systematic relations between actives and passives: that is the only feature of this solution he mentions in the preface to Syntactic Structures, and the first feature he introduces in an early paper, widely circulated as an introductory work, “A Transformational Approach in Syntax” (1962a [1958]).

7. 图 3.2经过简化，以便于以后的讨论，因此文法的描绘比实际要漂亮一些；特别是，转换框中发生的事情比图 3.2所示的要多一些。虽然 Newmeyer 的图 3.1（1980a:65，1986a:58）比它需要的要复杂一些，因为它的目的是专门说明早期模型中的一些复杂性，但它可以用作对我的图 3.2的吸引人的简单性的一种反制。

7. Figure 3.2 is simplified to make later discussions a little easier, and therefore paints the grammar in somewhat prettier tones than it actually had; in particular, there is a little more going on in the transformational box than Figure 3.2 indicates. While Newmeyer’s Figure 3.1 (1980a:65, 1986a:58) is a little more complicated than it need be, since its purpose is specifically to illustrate some complexities in the early model, it can be used as a sort of countermeasure to the attractive simplicity of my Figure 3.2.

8.事实上，问题会更加严重，因为广义变换会在这样的语法中失控，永不停歇地将句子拼接在一起；不仅不会产生简单的句子，而且根本不会产生任何句子，变换会无休止地迭代，以至于没有输入会变成输出。

8. Actually, the problem would be even worse, since the generalized transformations would run amok in such a grammar, and never stop splicing sentences together; not only would no simple sentences be produced, none at all would be produced, the transformations iterating endlessly so that no input ever becomes output.

9.比较一下乔姆斯基为评价《句法结构》中任何层次的语法分析而提出的标准：“根据这些层次所制定的语法是否使我们能够对‘理解’概念做出令人满意的分析”（1957a：87）。

9. Compare the criterion Chomsky suggests for evaluating any level of grammatical analysis in Syntactic Structures: “whether or not grammars formulated in terms of these levels enable us to provide a satisfactory analysis of the notion of ‘understanding’” (1957a:87).

10.尽管将哈里斯的作品称为结构语义学的开端大大高估了他对语义学的兴趣，但乔姆斯基利用句法结构来理解意义的观念显然继承自哈里斯，哈里斯认为，研究语言结构将导致“有趣的分布关系，这些关系告诉我们一些有关元素出现的信息，并与意义的某些方面相关”（Harris，1954：156；另见 Chomsky，1957a：102；1957b：290；1964b [1962]：936）。这些观念也在很大程度上归功于鲁道夫·卡尔纳普，他是《语言的逻辑句法》的作者，对乔姆斯基早期产生了重要影响。

10. Although calling Harris’s work a beginning in structural semantics vastly overestimates his interest in semantics, Chomsky’s notions of using syntactic structure to get at meaning are clearly inherited from Harris, who argued that investigating linguistic structure will lead to “interesting distributional relations, relations which tell us something about the occurrence of elements and which correlate with some aspect of meaning” (Harris, 1954:156; see also Chomsky, 1957a:102; 1957b:290; 1964b [1962]:936). They also owe a good deal to Rudolph Carnap, author of The Logical Syntax of Language, and an important early influence on Chomsky.

11.这不是修正主义：Hill (1958:3)表达了这样的愿望：未来几十年“将会看到语义学中真正有价值的成果”。

11. This is not revisionism: Hill (1958:3) expresses the wish that the next few decades “will see results of real value in semantics.”
