Into this cheerful dissensual stew of rhetoric, Lakoff throws a clear countercultural appeal, some humor, and the unmistakable theme that the generative semantics program is the road to salvation, in part because it embraces the sort of unflinching skepticism the old school can’t abide, and in part because it simply makes more sense than shallower brands of linguistics (“We know much more about the meaning of a sentence than we know about its surface structure”). More interestingly, all of it, from the snide preface to the urgent foreword, is informed by the attitude that true science involves embracing the artificiality of models and the muddiness of data. The preface demands the right “to be confronted with the realities of science.” The foreword calls for linguistic students to be responsible, like “any student of the physical sciences,” and recognize fudges for what they are.

14.没有人承认纽梅尔的“你看不出来我们在开玩笑吗？”这一描述有哪怕一丝真实性，而罗斯实际上早在他的论文中就谈到了这一点，他评论说，尽管他的一项技术建议（Pied-Piping 惯例）的“术语来自童话世界”，但这种用法不应被解释为“我对惯例的心理现实的免责声明”（1986 [1967]：126n3）。纽梅尔有机会收回或至少埋葬这一观察。他的书中生成语义学-语言学战争部分在第二版中被严重删减（1986a），因为他清楚地意识到对他和他的线人对喜剧性回避指控的尖刻反应，但这段话保留了下来（1986a：137）。 （然而，在讨论生成语义学时，风格处理是少数几个真正得到扩展的领域之一——表明他对关于他处理这一主题的抱怨很敏感）。另请参见这些平行评论——暗示开玩笑的立场具有某种“都市神话”的地位——这些评论都包含在 Raimo Anttila 对所有生成事物的咆哮中：“生成音系学的支持者说，McCawley 打算把他的生成音系学当作一个笑话，看看他那些愚昧的同事们多久会看穿它。另一位语言学家对 Lightner 的作品也表达了类似的看法”（Anttila，1975：174）。这句话后面的一句话揭示了安蒂拉焦虑的潜在动机之一：“照这样下去，工作肯定都给了那些爱开玩笑的人” （在哈热格引用的一封信中，他为自己的抱怨提供了一个量化的基础，他说“一个非性别认同障碍者必须发表大约三倍以上的文章，却仍然得不到‘正常’的加薪”—1981 [1976]：167）。

14. Nobody acknowledges even a kernel of truth to Newmeyer’s can’t-you-see-we-were-joking? characterization, and Ross in fact addressed it as early as his thesis, commenting that although one of his technical proposals (the Pied-Piping convention) got its “terminology from the realm of fairy tales,” this use should not be interpreted as “a disclaimer on my part of psychological reality” of the convention (1986 [1967]:126n3). Newmeyer has had the chance to recant, or at least bury, this observation. The generative semantics-linguistic war sections of his book were rather severely pruned for the second edition (1986a), after he was well aware of the vitriolic reaction to his, and his informant’s, accusation of comic hedging, but the passage survived the cuts (1986a:137). (One of the few areas in the discussion of generative semantics that was actually expanded, however, was the treatment of style—indicating that he was sensitive to complaints about his handling of the topic). See also these parallel comments—suggesting something of an “urban myth” status to the just-joking position—embedded in Raimo Anttila’s rant against all things generative: “a proponent of generative phonology says that McCawley intended his generative phonology as a joke to see how soon his benighted colleagues would see through it. A similar opinion has been expressed by another linguist concerning Lightner’s work” (Anttila, 1975:174). The sentence following this remark reveals one of the motives underlying Anttila’s angst: “As it is, the jobs certainly went to the jokesters” (and, in a letter quoted by Hagège, he gives a quantitative basis to his plaint, saying “a non-TG person has to publish about three times more and still not get the ‘normal’ raises”—1981 [1976]:167).

第九章

Chapter 9

1.然而，纽梅尔（1979）对这本书得出了完全相反的结论。他显然非常欣赏这本书，但认为它所阐述的框架严重不足。

1. Newmeyer (1979), however, draws exactly the opposite conclusion about the book. He apparently admires it a great deal, but finds the framework it articulates seriously wanting.

2.参见 Bever (1988:123–24) 和 Wanner (1988:149) 对成功的怀念。参见 McMahan (1963)、Mehler (1963)、Miller and McKean (1964)、Savin and Perchonock (1965) 和 Slobin (1966) 中关于复杂性派生理论的一些成功之处。参见 Fodor and Garrett (1966)、Bever (1970 [1968])、Glucksberg and Danks (1969)、Baker、Prideaux 和 Derwing (1973) 以及 Fodor、Bever 和 Garrett (1974) 中关于复杂性派生理论的一些失败之处。参见 Fodor and Garrett (1966) 和 Prideaux (1985:100–23) 中关于复杂性派生理论的一般性讨论。

2. See Bever (1988:123–24) and Wanner (1988:149) for wistful recollections of success. See McMahan (1963), Mehler (1963), Miller and McKean (1964), Savin and Perchonock (1965), and Slobin (1966) for some of the successes of the derivational theory of complexity. See Fodor and Garrett (1966), Bever (1970 [1968]), Glucksberg and Danks (1969), Baker, Prideaux, and Derwing (1973), and Fodor, Bever, and Garrett (1974) for some of the failures. See Fodor and Garrett (1966) and Prideaux (1985:100–23) for general discussions of the derivational theory of complexity.

3.例如，MacKay 和 Bever (1967) 研究了结构歧义，Aspects模型通过将一个表面结构分配到两个深层结构（每个代表不同的含义）来解释结构歧义，并发现受试者识别结构歧义的速度相对较慢，而词汇歧义则不然（例如在“超人很高”中，他可能处于高海拔或处于改变的意识状态，这取决于“高”的含义）。深层结构假设表明了这些结果，因为听众必须为第一种歧义重建两个不同的深层结构，而对于第二种歧义，只需做出词汇决定。然而，句子长度、表面从句复杂性和歧义位置都可能是这些结果的贡献者，事实上，当它们受到控制时，Prideaux 和 Baker (1976) 未能复制 MacKay 和 Bever 的发现。请参阅 Wanner (1974, 1988: 147–49) 关于检验深层结构假说的文章。

3. For instance, MacKay and Bever (1967) investigated structural ambiguity, which the Aspects model accounts for by assigning one surface structure two deep structures, each representing a different meaning, and found that subjects were relatively slow recognizing structural ambiguity with respect to lexical ambiguity (as in Superman was high, where he could be either at a great altitude or in an altered state of consciousness, depending on the meaning of high). The deep structure hypothesis suggests these results, since listeners would have to reconstitute two distinct deep structures for the first type of ambiguity, and only have to make a lexical decision for the second. However, sentence length, surface clausal complexity, and location of ambiguity were all possible contributors to these results as well, and indeed, when they were controlled, Prideaux and Baker (1976) failed to replicate MacKay and Bever’s findings. See Wanner (1974, 1988:147–49) on testing the deep structure hypothesis.

4.在一篇关于语言学对心理学影响的回顾性文章中，贝弗评论道

4. In a retrospective essay on the impact of linguistics on psychology, Bever comments

语言学之争凸显了另一个问题：语言理论瞬息万变。心理学家认为他们已经掌握了它，但它却漏网了。……开发一种现象的新句法分析需要一个月的时间；开发一种实验方法则需要一年的时间对此进行调查。心理学家常常完成一系列艰苦的实证研究，却发现其背后的语言理论不再有效。（Bever，1988：130）

The wars in linguistics highlighted another problem: Linguistic theory changes like quicksilver. Psychologists think they have their hands on it, but it slips through. … It takes a month to develop a new syntactic analysis of a phenomenon; it takes a year to develop an experimental investigation of it. All too often, the psychologist is in the position of completing an arduous series of empirical studies, only to discover that the linguistic theory underlying them is no longer operative. (Bever, 1988:130)

类似评论和对复杂性派生理论的评论，请参阅乔姆斯基 (1988b:18–19)。然而，有证据表明，这种不满至少可以追溯到抽象句法时代。例如，像罗杰·布朗和卡米尔·汉隆这样完全同情的心理学家对缺乏共识感到遗憾：“不幸的是，即使在 1965 年左右的转型出版中，也存在相当大的分歧”(Brown and Hanlon, 1970 [1968]:170)。

See Chomsky (1988b:18–19) for similar comments, and for comments on the derivational theory of complexity. There is, however, evidence the disgruntlement dates from at least the time of abstract syntax. Fully sympathetic psychologists like Roger Brown and Camille Hanlon, for instance, lamented the lack of consensus, in these terms: “Unluckily for us there is considerable disagreement even among transformational publishing around 1965” (Brown and Hanlon, 1970 [1968]:170).

5.这部小说给语言学家带来了很多乐趣，它提供了许多可供追寻的典故，其中一些似乎与生成语义学有关（但不能完全确定）。例如，桑德格朗德的前同事利德利希 (Liedlich) 主要受到反桑德格朗德情绪的驱使，支持了 Oh 的训练：Oh 和利德利希在“特殊语义学”中交流；利德利希写了《动物兄弟》，这个标题让人想起罗森的《动物兄弟》，后者描述了弗洛伊德对异端的处理，许多人认为这与乔姆斯基的著作有很强的相似之处。

5. The novel is a good deal of fun for linguists, providing a deer park of allusions to chase down, some of which seem to be (but one can’t be entirely sure) to generative semantics. For instance, a former colleague of Sandground’s, one Liedlich, motivated primarily by anti-Sandground sentiments, is behind Oh’s training: Oh and Liedlich commune in “special semantikaramas”; Liedlich has written Brother Creatures, a title recalling Roazen’s Brother Animal, a depiction of Freud’s treatment of heresies in which many saw strong Chomskyan parallels.

顺便说一句，当时有许多猿类实验者试图证明乔姆斯基的物种特异性假设，其中最著名的是加德纳夫妇对 Washoe 的尝试（Gardner and Gardner，1969；1975），普雷马克对 Sarah 的尝试（Premack and Premack，1972），特雷斯对 Nim 的尝试（Terrace，1979），以及帕特森对 Koko 的尝试（Patterson，1978；Patterson and Linden，1981）。没有一只猿类能与 Oh 相提并论（也就是说，没有一只猿类能接近乔姆斯基的弹性假设），他们立即受到语言学家的批评（Bronowski and Bellugi，1970；McNeill，1970；Sebeok，1982），但同样取得了一些显著的进展；乐观估计认为猿类的语言能力与三四岁儿童相当（例如，Brown，1970：224）。请参阅 Chomsky 对 Huybregts 和 van Riemsdijk 的评论（Chomsky，1982a [1979–80]）或 Rieber（1983：58–90）中关于他对这项研究的看法的简明说明，请参阅 Putnam（1983）中的一些反驳，以及 Chomsky（1983）中的补充评论。有关此材料的通俗说明，包括最近对神奇的 Kanzi 的研究，请参阅 Ingram（1992：218–37）。

There were, incidentally, a good many ape-experimenters gunning for Chomsky’s speciesspecific hypothesis in this period, the most famous being the Gardners’ attempts with Washoe (Gardner and Gardner, 1969; 1975), Premacks’ with Sarah (Premack and Premack, 1972), Terrace’s with Nim (Terrace, 1979), and Patterson’s with Koko (Patterson, 1978; Patterson and Linden, 1981). None of the apes were quite in Oh’s league (that is, none of them came close to compromising Chomsky’s resilient hypothesis) and they came under immediate criticism from linguists (Bronowski and Bellugi, 1970; McNeill, 1970; Sebeok, 1982), but some remarkable progress was gained all the same; optimistic estimates put the apes’ linguistic abilities in the range of a three-or four-year-old child (e.g., Brown, 1970:224). See Chomsky’s comments to Huybregts and van Riemsdijk (Chomsky, 1982a [1979–80]) or to Rieber (1983:58–90) for succinct accounts of his views on this research, Putnam (1983) for some counter-argument and Chomsky (1983) for additional remarks. For a popular account of this material, including recent work with the amazing Kanzi, see Ingram (1992:218–37).

6.参见 Newmeyer (1986b:120–26) 及其参考文献。

6. See Newmeyer (1986b:120–26), and the references therein.

7.关于乔姆斯基的笛卡尔主义及其相关问题的讨论很多。与 Aarsleff 的论点类似的论点（占绝大多数），请参阅 Zimmer (1968)、Breckle (1969a)、Salmon (1969)、Hall (1969) 或 R. Lakoff (1969b)；对于更有利的评价（通常仍包括对乔姆斯基傲慢学术的指责），请参阅 Prideaux (1967)、Kampf (1967)、Harman (1968)、Bracken (1970; 1972; 1984)。最彻底和最冷静的讨论可能是 Kretzmann (1975)。

7. There are many discussions of Chomsky’s Cartesianism and the issues surrounding it. For arguments parallel to Aarsleff’s (by far the majority), see Zimmer (1968), Breckle (1969a), Salmon (1969), Hall (1969), or R. Lakoff (1969b); for more favorable appraisals (which still usually include some finger-wagging at Chomsky’s cavalier scholarship), see Prideaux (1967), Kampf (1967), Harman (1968), Bracken (1970; 1972; 1984). The most thorough and dispassionate discussion is probably Kretzmann (1975).

8.我省略了德温在乔姆斯基著作中举出的这三种论证类型的例子，他在书中对这些论证都进行了记录：对于完全似是而非的论证，德温引用了乔姆斯基对发现程序的攻击；对于基本不相关的论证，德温引用了他和哈勒对音素的攻击；对于彻头彻尾的错误论证，德温引用了乔姆斯基和哈勒的论述（1968:49；斜体为德温所加）：“一个得到广泛证实的经验事实是，底层表征相当能抵抗历史变化。”

8. I have elided Derwing’s examples of these three argument types in Chomsky, all of which he documents in the book: for the fully specious, Derwing cites Chomsky’s attack on the discovery procedure; for the mainly irrelevant, his and Halle’s campaign against the phoneme; for the out-and-out false, Derwing quotes Chomsky and Halle’s (1968:49; Derwing’s italics) “It is a widely confirmed empirical fact that underlying representations are fairly resistant to historical change.”

9.有关该模型的历史（包括早期的 Ross、Morgan 和 Keenan，以及稍晚且较为边缘化的 Lakoff），请参阅 Johnson and Postal (1980:15–19)。Ross 真正涉及关系语法的唯一出版物是他的《认知心理学的三根指挥棒》，他在书中指出，规则的应用受语法关系层级的控制（1974b:106–10）；Keenan 直接参与关系语法计划的唯一一次是他对被动句普遍性的研究（1975a；另见 Keenan and Comrie, 1977 [1972]）。Morgan 从未在该框架下发表过任何文章。

9. For some of the history of this model—which includes Ross, Morgan, and Keenan in its early stages, Lakoff somewhat later and more peripherally—see Johnson and Postal (1980:15–19). Ross’s only real publication dealing with relational grammar is in his “Three Batons for Cognitive Psychology,” where he argued that rule application was controlled by a hierarchy of grammatical relations (1974b:106–10); Keenan’s only direct participation in the relational grammar program was his investigation of universals concerning passive sentences (1975a; see also Keenan and Comrie, 1977 [1972]). Morgan never published in the framework at all.

10.特别参见 Ross，1972c、1973b、1973c、1974a 和 1975。Ross 的工作源自“Zellig Harris 的随口评论”（Ross，1973c：231），自从十年前他跟随 Harris 上课以来，这些评论一直以各种方式困扰着他，并且是生成语义学家在尝试将转换语法中的语法性开或关概念应用于日益复杂的数据集时所积累的挫败感的结果。这一努力的主要力量（以及我们将在后面几段中看到的 Lakoff 的工作）是 Dwight Bolinger 的研究，他长期批评语言学中的离散性。

10. In particular, see Ross, 1972c, 1973b, 1973c, 1974a, and 1975. Ross’s work developed from “offhand remarks of Zellig Harris” (Ross, 1973c:231) that had been puzzling him in various ways since his classes with Harris ten years earlier, and was the result of frustration that generative semanticists had built up as they tried to get the on-or-off notions of grammaticality in transformational grammar to work with increasingly complex data sets. A major force on this endeavor (and on the work of Lakoff we will see a few paragraphs hence) was the research of Dwight Bolinger, a long-standing critic of discreteness in linguistics.

乔姆斯基早就意识到将语言的流动强行归入严格的二元范畴的困难。例如，在《逻辑结构》中，他曾对各种语法性和可接受性程度进行了大量的思考，最后才得出结论：语言学最有益的焦点应该是“语法性程度最高的句子”（1975a [1955]：154），乔姆斯基也多次重提这个话题，最著名的是在一篇题为“语法性的程度”的论文中（1964a [1961]）。在转换语义学中，卡茨（1964）详细讨论了他称之为半句的现象，即不符合语法的句子，比如“我对你过于自信” ，尽管如此，这些句子还是完全可以理解的。

Chomsky had been long aware of the difficulties of forcing the flux of language into strict binary categories. Logical Structures, for instance, contains a goodly amount of fretting about the various degrees of grammaticality and acceptability before settling on an argument that the most profitable focus of linguistics should be on “sentences of the highest degree (first order) of grammaticalness” (1975a [1955]:154), and Chomsky revisited the topic on several occasions, most notably in a paper entitled “Degrees of Grammaticalness” (1964a [1961]). In transformational semantics, Katz (1964) had discussed at length phenomena he called semi-sentences, ungrammatical sentences, like I have overconfidence in you, which are nonetheless perfectly intelligible.

但生成语义学家却将这一概念牢记在心，并开始使用分级语法性作为语言证据。McCawley 在为 Lakoff 所写的序言中 (1970a [1965]) 指出：(1) Postal-Lakoff 的相对语法性概念与 ChomskyKatz 的概念不同，(2) Lakoff 在其论文中使用这一概念对语法论证做出了“非常重要”的贡献。例如，Lakoff 使用语法性的差异来激发他的抽象动词提案 (1970a [1965]:62)，他认为 (i)-a 的语法性不如 (i)-b（因此，双星标记），就像 (ii)-a 的语法性不如 (ii)-b 一样：

But the generative semanticists took the notion to heart, and began to use graded grammaticality as linguistic evidence. McCawley argues in his foreword to Lakoff (1970a [1965]), that (1) the Postal-Lakoff notion of relative grammaticality is distinct from the ChomskyKatz notion, and (2) that Lakoff’s use of this notion in his thesis was a contribution to grammatical argumentation of “great importance.” Lakoff, for instance, used differences in grammaticality to motivate his abstract verb proposals (1970a [1965]:62), arguing that (i)-a is less grammatical than (i)-b (and, hence, double-starred), in precisely the same way that (ii)-a is less grammatical than (ii)-b:

(i) **割草机对这本书进行了批评。

(i) a **The lawnmower critiqued the book.

b*割草机对这本书的批评。

b *The lawnmower’s critique of the book.

(ii) a**大号侵略了印度。

(ii) a**The tuba aggressed against India.

b*大号对印度的侵略。

b *The tuba’s aggression against India.

拉科夫的双星号只是冰山一角。生成语义学家开发了一系列符号，麦考利称之为“圣痕”，用来表示句子语法不合格（这里的“语法”的含义比乔姆斯基的用法要广泛得多），其中包括问号（？），表示对某些人或某些情况来说可能合乎语法，但对其他人来说却不合乎语法的句子；感叹号，单独或成对使用，如“双重尖叫”（！！），表示极其糟糕的句子；百分号（%），表示方言差异；甚至还有大卫之星，麦考利发明了它，表示如果用意第绪语语调说出来，英语句子是合乎语法的。

Lakoff’s double asterisk was just the tip of the iceberg. Generative semanticists developed a whole array of signs, called stigmata by McCawley, to indicate that sentences weren’t up to grammatical snuff (where grammatical is much more widely construed than in Chomsky’s usage), including the question mark (?), for sentences that might be grammatical for some people, or some circumstances, but not for others; the exclamation mark, singly or in pairs, as the “double shriek” (!!), for screamingly bad sentences; the percentage sign (%), to signal dialectal variation; even the star of David , courtesy of McCawley, to signal English sentences which were grammatical if spoken with Yiddish intonation.

不过，罗斯在使用语法等级标记方面是最系统的。在他的论文中，他采用了一种结合问号和星号的方案来表示几个语法等级，他是变革语言学家中对语法二元概念最有抵抗力的，他根据语法优点的细微差别提出了相当有力的理论论证。然而，在 70 年代初期，罗斯开始以他模糊不清的工作来探索语法的这些维度，几乎是为了它们本身而探索，几乎没有提供任何解释。

Ross, though, was the most systematic in his use of grammatical gradation markers. In his thesis, he adopted a scheme of combining question marks and asterisks to signal several levels of grammaticality, and he was the transformational linguist most resistant to binary notions of grammaticality, basing quite forceful theoretical arguments on very subtle shades of grammatical goodness. In the early seventies, however, with his squishiness work Ross began to explore these dimensions of grammaticality virtually for their own sake, offering very little in the way of an account for them.

11.事实上，罗斯做出了一些更细微的区分，包括连续体现在时 > 完成时 > 被动时，以表明分词之间的挤压，并在​​介词和名词之间引入了形容词名词一词。他还在介词后面放置了一个括号问号，以表明其在连续体中的位置存在不确定性。所有这些细节都与当前的讨论无关。

11. In fact, Ross made several finer distinctions, including the continuum Present > Perfective > Passive to indicate the squish among participles, and introducing the term adjectival noun between Preposition and Noun. He also placed a parenthetical question mark after Preposition, to suggest some uncertainty about its place on the continuum. None of these details are relevant to the present discussion.

12.尽管当 Lakoff 开始引入其概念时，Rosch 的现在这方面的工作已经得到了相当广泛的发表；例如，参见Rosch和Lloyd（1978[1976]）的论文和参考文献。

12. Though it was just developing when Lakoff began importing its concepts, Rosch’s work is now quite extensively published; see, for example, the papers and references in Rosch and Lloyd (1978 [1976]).

13. Zadeh (1965) 是他关于模糊集理论和逻辑的第一篇论文。有关其后续工作的进展，另请参阅 Zadeh (1987) 及其参考文献。

13. Zadeh (1965) is his initial paper on fuzzy set theory and logic. See also Zadeh (1987), and the references therein, for subsequent developments in his work.

14. “我不想给人留下这样的印象：我认为第四部分的建议在全部或大部分细节上都是正确的。模糊限制语才刚刚开始被研究，我只讨论了其中的一小部分。我毫不怀疑，处理其余模糊限制语所需的设备将必须更加复杂。事实上，很容易证明，仅仅为了处理迄今为止讨论的模糊限制语，就需要更加复杂的设备”（Lakoff，1973d：246）。

14. “I don’t want to give the impression that I take the proposals in section IV to be correct in all or even most details. Hedges have barely begun to be studied and I have discussed only a handful. I have no doubt that the apparatus needed to handle the rest of them will have to be far more sophisticated. In fact, it is easy to show that far more sophisticated apparatus will be needed merely to handle the hedges discussed so far” (Lakoff, 1973d:246).

15.该术语首次出现，表明逻辑应该是一种经验主义追求，似乎是在 Lakoff (1971b:277) 中，但这种倾向至少可以追溯到 McCawley (1976b [1967]:106)。因此，自然逻辑并非 Lakoff 独有的项目，尽管他在这方面和在大多数方面一样，都表现出强烈的反对态度。例如，在一次会议上，McCawley 提出了一些温和的建议，以鼓励逻辑学家“研究他们通常忽略的事物的逻辑属性（例如，争论‘该死的帝国主义屠夫；尼克松是帝国主义屠夫；因此，该死的尼克松’是否有效？”）(1976b [1972]:319)。在同一个会议上，拉科夫发表了一篇长篇有力的布道 (1972c)，大意是，逻辑学家们允许他们的形式化主义缩小逻辑的主题，直到它只包含关于人类理性及其载体自然语言的最狭窄的事实子集，从而使自己陷入了困境；他认为，生成语义学将是他们的救赎。

15. The first appearance of this term, an invocation of the idea that logic should be an empirical pursuit, appears to be in Lakoff (1971b:277), but tendencies in this direction date back at least to McCawley (1976b [1967]:106). Natural logic, then, was not solely Lakoff’s project, though he was on this front, as on most fronts, the move vociferous. At one conference, for instance, McCawley made some modest suggestions to stimulate logicians “to study the logical properties of items [they] generally ignore (e.g., is it valid to argue ‘goddamn all imperialist butchers; Nixon is an imperialist butcher; therefore, goddamn Nixon’?)” (1976b [1972]:319). At the same conference, Lakoff delivered a long, forceful sermon (1972c) to the effect that logicians had painted themselves into a corner by allowing their formalisms to shrink the subject matter of logic until it contained only the narrowest subset of facts about human reason and its vehicle, natural language; generative semantics, he suggested, would be their salvation.

16. Newmeyer 的最初反应是含糊其辞的，他主要出于解释原因而避免使用 VSO 深层结构（1970:179n2），但后来明确拒绝了（1971）。另请参阅 Postal（1972e；回复 Newmeyer）、Berman（1974；回复 McCawley）以及 Anderson 和 Chung（1977；其中包括回复 Berman）中的一些讨论。McCawley 不再认为在表面以下的层次上需要任何词序（例如，1988.1:42），并认为他最初的 VSO 论证“非常薄弱”（1982b:7）。

16. Newmeyer’s first reaction was noncommittal, avoiding VSO deep structures mostly for expository reasons (1970:179n2), but later explicitly rejected (1971). See also Postal (1972e; a reply to Newmeyer), Berman (1974; a reply to McCawley), and Anderson and Chung (1977; which includes a reply to Berman) for some discussion. McCawley no longer sees the need for any word order at levels much below the surface (e.g., 1988.1:42), and regards his original VSO arguments as “very weak” (1982b:7).

17.很快你就会明白，这段引文有点误导人。也就是说，《论生成语义学》并不是对乔姆斯基的直截了当的模仿，但它确实包含了很多模仿元素，特别是在前几页。

17. As should become clear shortly, this quotation is slightly misleading. That is, “On Generative Semantics” is not a flat-out parody of Chomsky, but it does contain a good many parodic elements, particularly in the first few pages.

18.另一个更近的例子是，乔姆斯基因为没能理解笑话而受到责备，这是他对普勒姆讽刺作品《形式语言学遇上布胡姆》（1989；1991：48-55）的反应。普勒姆在文章中严厉批评乔姆斯基抛弃形式语言学，文章最后描述了“少数幸存下来的形式语言学家，由于与世隔绝和近亲繁殖而变得有些疯狂”的末日场景，他们“纷纷逃往蒙大拿州和爱达荷州北部等地的山上……也许，有时在 LSA 会议上，会发现一个孤独的老疯子，头发花白，眼神狂野，抓住人们的胳膊，滔滔不绝地讲解形式基础的精确定义，直到被酒店保安带走”（1989：43；1991：55）。简而言之，“文章最后会变得疯狂，这是Pullum 当时在《自然语言和语言理论》上发表的专栏文章的读者应该预料到的。但读者不应该预料到的是，有人会把这篇文章看作是极其严肃的文章，并对其做出严肃的回应，”几年后 Pullum 说道。“但不幸的是，随着诺姆·乔姆斯基的《论形式化和形式语言学》[1990] 的出现，这种情况确实发生了”（Pullum，1991：47）。

18. Another, more recent, example of Chomsky catching it on the chin for failing to get a joke is his reaction to Pullum’s satirical “Formal Linguistics Meets the Boojum” (1989; 1991:48–55), which berates Chomsky for his abandonment of formal linguistics and ends with a doomsday scenario for “the few formal linguists who survive, slightly crazed as a result of isolation and inbreeding,” with them “taking to the hills in places like Montana and northern Idaho. … Perhaps sometimes a lonely old madman with stringy gray hair and wild eyes will be found seizing people by the arm at an LSA meeting and haranguing them about precise definitions of formal underpinnings, until he is taken away by hotel security” (1989:43; 1991:55). In short, “it gets crazy at the end, as the reader of TOPIC … COMMENT [Pullum’s column at the time in Natural Language and Linguistic Theory] should expect. What the reader should not expect is that anyone should take the piece as stone-cold serious and write a serious response to it,” Pullum said a few years later. “But unfortunately, this has actually happened with the appearance of Noam Chomsky’s ‘On formalization and formal linguistics’ [1990]” (Pullum, 1991:47).

19.拉科夫建立了一个与乔姆斯基的“标准理论”平行的“基本理论”，并对其进行了广泛的定义，几乎涵盖了所有可以想到的语言理论，从而使每个理论都成为基本理论的符号变体。其大部分风格明显是模仿乔姆斯基的，语法相当曲折，变量、下标和上标很多，而且倾向于在提出具体建议或分析之前长时间地进行抽象交流。

19. Lakoff sets up a “basic theory” in parallel to Chomsky’s “standard theory,” and defines it so broadly as to encompass virtually any conceivable theory of language, thereby making every theory a notational variant of the basic theory. Much of the style is recognizably mock-Chomskyan, with rather tortuous syntax, numerous uppercase variables, subscripts, and superscripts, and the tendency to traffic for a long while in abstractions before offering specific proposals or analyses.

20.将所引公式与 Lakoff 在接受 Parret 采访时提供的公式进行比较：“[在生成语义学中] 生成的抽象对象不是句子，而是形式为 (S, LS, C, CM) 的四元组，其中 S 是句子，LS 是通过派生与 S 关联的逻辑结构，C 是一组有限的逻辑结构（描述话语的概念背景），CM 是一系列逻辑结构，表示句子在无限可能情况中传达的含义，在这些情况下 C 的逻辑结构为真。” Lakoff 还指出，与 1971 年公式的省略相呼应，“即使这样也不够”，因为“必须考虑的不仅仅是概念背景”（Parret，1974 [1972]：163）。然而，这种“占位符”并非 Lakoff 独有。例如，在较小的范围内，Jackendoff (1972:40–41)在他的词典中表示买卖的条目中包含了变量Y，将其定义为表示其余条目中“尚未表达的任何语义残留”。

20. Compare the quoted formula with the one Lakoff offers in his interview with Parret: “The abstract objects generated [in generative semantics] are not sentences but quadruples of the form (S, LS, C, CM) where S is a sentence, LS is a logical structure associated with S by a derivation, C is a finite set of logical structures (characterizing the conceptual context of the utterance), and CM is a sequence of logical structures, representing the conveyed meanings of the sentences in the infinite class of possible situations in which the logical structures of C are true.” Lakoff also suggests, in parallel with the ellipsis of the 1971 formulation, that “even this is inadequate,” since “one must take into account much more than conceptual contexts” (Parret, 1974 [1972]:163). Such “place holders” were not unique to Lakoff, however. On a smaller scale, for instance, Jackendoff (1972:40–41) includes the variable Y in his dictionary entries for buy and sell, defining it as representing “simply any semantic residue that has not yet been expressed” in the rest of the entries.

21.比较乔姆斯基的“我将把对这种语法理论的任何阐述称为‘标准理论’，这只是为了讨论方便，并不意味着它具有某种独特的概念或经验地位”（1972b [1968]:66）。关于乔姆斯基巧妙使用标签的评论有很多。与此讨论特别相关的是波斯特尔（1988b:136）对“毫无疑问错误和愚蠢的基本语义学（BS）运动”的讨论。波斯特尔对BS的使用非常明显，足以确保不会错过模仿；拉科夫的基本理论太微妙了。

21. Compare Chomsky’s “I will refer to any elaboration of this theory of grammar as a ‘standard theory’, merely for convenience of discussion and with no intention of implying that it has some unique conceptual or empirical status” (1972b [1968]:66). There are a number of commentaries on Chomsky’s deft use of labels. One that is particularly germane to this discussion is Postal’s (1988b:136) discussion of “the unquestionably wrong and stupid Basic Semantics (BS) movement.” Postal’s use of BS is obvious enough to ensure the parody is not missed; Lakoff’s basic theory is just too subtle.

22. Maclay 说 Lakoff

22. Maclay says Lakoff

错误地认为乔姆斯基希望区分这些立场 [标准理论和Aspects的语义立场]。他引用了乔姆斯基论文中的一段话，这段话似乎表明标准理论中的语义表征形式与Aspects中的语义表征形式不同。事实上，这段引文是乔姆斯基对他所拒绝的标准理论的替代方案的描述。（1971:177n）

mistakenly assumes that Chomsky wishes to differentiate these positions [the semantic positions of the standard theory and Aspects]. He presents a quotation from Chomsky’s paper which seems to indicate that the form of semantic representations in the standard theory is different from such representations in Aspects. In fact, this quotation is Chomsky’s description of an alternative to the standard theory which he rejects. (1971:177n)

引用自乔姆斯基（1972b [1968]:71–72）的论述，简要讨论了将语义表征重新表述为短语标记，该短语标记可以包含词汇分解，并发挥生成语义学家所声称的语义表征功能；乔姆斯基并未明确拒绝这种语义表征表述，但暗示它不是标准理论的“真正替代品”。拉科夫（1971c:268–70）的讨论试图表明，乔姆斯基在《深层结构》中对标准理论的定义足够广泛，可以作为生成语义学（某些方面）的符号变体，但乔姆斯基对语义表征进行的重新表述对于 Aspects 理论来说是不可能的——因此，标准理论和Aspects不是一回事。

The quotation from Chomsky (1972b [1968]:71–72) is a brief discussion of reformulating semantic representation as a phrase marker which can embrace lexical decomposition, and otherwise function as generative semanticists claim semantic representations function; Chomsky does not explicitly reject this formulation of semantic representation, but implies that it is not a “genuine alternative” to the standard theory. The discussion in Lakoff (1971c:268–70) is an attempt to show that Chomsky has defined the standard theory in “Deep Structure” expansively enough to be a notational variant of (some aspects of) generative semantics, but that the reformulation of semantic representation that Chomsky effects is not possible for an Aspects theory—hence, that the standard theory and Aspects are not one and the same.

23.引自 Hagège (1981 [1976]:33n29)；罗伯特·霍尔 (Robert Hall) 译；作者插入。

23. Cited in Hagège (1981 [1976]:33n29); translated by Robert Hall; my interpolation.

24.这是一个广泛但并非普遍的趋势。例如，Dowty (1979:18) 以几篇具有代表性的早期论文作为核心定义文献。他当然没有忽视 Lakoff，但他很少关注 Lakoff 70 年代中后期的作品，而是专注于早期的明确主张。

24. This was a widespread but not universal trend. Dowty (1979:18), for instance, takes several representative early papers as the central defining documents. He certainly doesn’t ignore Lakoff, but he pays very little attention to his mid-and late-seventies work, and focuses on the clear early claims.

25.波斯特的影响还延伸到书名上。他的《无政府主义笔记》使用了诸如“身份的恐怖”、“时间的怪物”和“协调思维捕捉器”等标题（1976 [1967–70]：203–4）。

25. Postal’s influence extends to the titles as well. His Anarchy Notes use titles like “Horrors of Identity,” “Temporal Monstrosities,” and “Coordinate Mind Snappers” (1976 [1967–70]:203–4).

26.蒙塔古语法始于 20 世纪 60 年代末的逻辑哲学家理查德·蒙塔古 (Richard Montague) 的工作，并在他去世后开始引起语言学家的关注，尤其是经过 (乔姆斯基派) 芭芭拉·帕蒂 (Barbara Partee) 的重新阐述 (参见 Partee, 1976)。在那些心怀不满的生成语义学家中，有卡特宁 (Karttunen)、道蒂 (Dowty) 和巴赫 (Bach) 参与研究蒙塔古的模型。关系语法始于 20 世纪 70 年代初的波斯特尔 (Postal) 和珀尔穆特 (Perlmutter) 的工作，在一次备受关注的语言学会议之后，关系语法获得了巨大的发展势头1974 年，他们在阿默斯特学院组队授课（参见 Perlmutter，1980 年；Perlmutter 和 Rosen，1984 年；Blake，1990 年）。其前生成语义学客户包括 Dryer、Cole 和 Frantz。加入 Chomsky 项目的生成语义学家似乎仅限于 Newmeyer、Baker 和 Lightfoot。

26. Montague grammar started in the late sixties with the work of logician-philosopher, Richard Montague, and began attracting the attention of linguists after his death, particularly as reworked by (the Chomskyan) Barbara Partee (see especially Partee, 1976). Among the disaffected generative semanticists who signed up to investigate Montague’s model were Karttunen, Dowty, and Bach. Relational grammar began with Postal and Perlmutter’s work in the early seventies and gained a great deal of momentum after a very well attended Linguistic Institute they team-taught in Amherst, 1974 (see especially Perlmutter, 1980; Perlmutter and Rosen, 1984; Blake, 1990). Among its ex-generative semantics customers were Dryer, Cole, and Frantz. The generative semanticists who joined Chomsky’s program seem to be limited to Newmeyer, Baker, and Lightfoot.

27. 认知语法源自他与亨利·汤普森在七十年代中期共同发展的一些论文（Lakoff and Thompson，1975a；1975b）；经验语言学源自 Lakoff（1977a）。纽梅尔还指出 Lakoff 喜欢新标签——“几乎每年都会提出一个新命名的理论……Lakoff 并没有向语言界展示自己是一位始终如一的理论家”（1980a：172）——尽管他引用的两个标签（全局跨派生格式良好语法和二元层次语法）来自地下。名义上的喜爱是一个有趣的问题，它与表现有很大关系，因为另一位具有相同倾向的主要语言学家乔姆斯基确实是一位始终如一的理论家。拉科夫将新的发展视为彻底改变我们看待语言方式的突破；乔姆斯基则将它们视为追寻真理的必然阶段。

27. Cognitive grammar comes from some papers he developed with Henry Thompson in the mid-seventies (Lakoff and Thompson, 1975a; 1975b); experiential linguistics, from Lakoff (1977a). Newmeyer also notes Lakoff’s fondness for new labels—“By coming out almost yearly with a newly named theory… Lakoff has not presented himself to the linguistic world as a consistent theoretician” (1980a:172)—though two of the labels he cites (global transderivational well-formedness grammar and dual-hierarchy grammar) are from underground sources. The matter of nominal fondness is an interesting one, which has much to do with presentation, since the other major linguist with the same proclivity, Chomsky, does come off as a consistent theoretician. Lakoff presents new developments as breakthroughs which dramatically change the way we now have to look at language; Chomsky presents them as inevitable stages in his march on truth.

28.如果这一讨论与第 4 章“体”中关于虚符号的论述相似，那也是有原因的。虚符号 Δ 是乔姆斯基语言学中许多音系零代词中的第一个；追随其无声脚步的更突出的手段包括踪迹 ( t ) 和 PRO。

28. If this discussion resembles the account of dummy symbols in the context of Aspects in chapter 4, it is for good reason. The dummy symbol, Δ, was the first of a good many phonologically null pronouns in Chomskyan linguistics; among the more prominent devices to follow in its noiseless footsteps are the trace (t) and PRO.

29.乔姆斯基否定了“深层结构”这个术语，但态度非常敷衍。1975 年，他在麦克马斯特大学发表的 Whidden 演讲中承诺避免使用这个术语，因为，除了其他原因之外，人们不幸地认为它必然具有深刻性（1975b：81-83）；更重要的是，当时他的研究正在用踪迹和专门的语义解释规则来加强Aspects派生模式的另一端，人们认为表层结构必然具有琐碎或肤浅的东西。他曾短暂地使用过初始短语标记，但很快又回到了他的老朋友身边，挑衅地隐藏在非常薄的面纱后面——D 结构（1980b [1978]：145）——几乎每个人都意识到，使用这个术语确实非常反常。例如，甚至连乔姆斯基的学生也采用“深层结构” (May, 1985:3) 这样的术语，而乔姆斯基本人也几乎总是提请人们注意深层结构这个术语；例如， 《政府与装订讲座》中的索引条目是“深层结构 (D-structure)” (1981 a [1979])，《概念与后果》中将其介绍为“D-结构('深层结构')” (1982b:5)， 《语言知识》中第一次提到它时，包括脚注“在早期著作中称为'深层结构'” (1986:205n8)。

29. Chomsky repudiated the term deep structure, but in an extremely halfhearted way. In his 1975 Whidden Lectures at McMaster University, he pledged to avoid the term, because, among other reasons, people were unfortunately thinking there was something necessarily profound about it (1975b:81–83); more importantly for his research at the time, which was beefing up the other end of the Aspects derivational schema with traces and dedicated semantic interpretation rules, people were thinking that there was something necessarily trivial or superficial about surface structure. He had a very brief fling with initial phrase marker, but he was soon back with his old friend, kept provocatively behind a very thin veil—D-Structure (1980b [1978]:145)—the use of which is really quite perverse, as almost everyone realizes. Even Chomsky’s students, for instance, adopt such terms as “D(eep)-Structure” (May, 1985:3), and Chomsky himself almost always draws attention to the term deep structure; the index entry in Lectures on Government and Binding, for instance, is “Deep-structure (D-structure)” (1981 a [1979]), Concepts and Consequences introduces it as “D-structures (‘deep structures’)” (1982b:5), and the first mention in Knowledge of Language includes the footnote “Called ‘deep structures’ in earlier work” (1986:205n8).

30.这个双刃剑式的形容词可能来自译者罗伯特·霍尔，他对整个乔姆斯基纲领的蔑视是众所周知的，远远超过了哈热格（例如，参见霍尔，1987a）；然而，我的观点不受侮辱的来源的影响。还请注意，奥唐纳在类似情况下使用的词是“严肃的” （1974:75）。

30. The double-edged adjective may have come from the translator, Robert Hall, whose contempt for the entire Chomskyan program is well known and vastly surpasses that of Hagège (see, for instance, Hall, 1987a); my point, however, is unaffected by the origin of the insult. Notice, too, that serious is the word O’Donnell uses in similar circumstances (1974:75).

31.坦率的提升是反主流文化的另一个特征。例如，参见鲁宾（1971:124-26）对芝加哥警察在法庭上作证的虚伪行为的讨论，他们坚称自己不能在女性陪审团成员面前重复被告的某些话，但在后屋里互相吹嘘他们如何打破了“该死的小同性恋”的头；另一方面，嬉皮士什么也不隐瞒。

31. This elevation of frankness was another counterculture trait. See, for instance, Rubin’s (1971:124–26) discussion of the hypocrisy of the Chicago police testifying in court, who insisted they could not repeat some of the defendants’ words in front of women jury members, but who boasted to one another in the back room about how they busted the heads of “the fucking little fagots”; yippies, on the other hand, don’t hide anything.

32.在转换语法中，将论据和数据归因于其他语言学家的做法由来已久，而且在当时的解释主义论文中也确实存在。我在这里要说的并不是只有生成主义者才这么做，而是他们将这种做法提升到了新的水平，而这种极端主义在一定程度上源于他们对乔姆斯基的归因实践的态度。

32. Attributing arguments and data to other linguists has a long history in transformational grammar, and was certainly present in interpretivist papers of the period. My point here is not that it was exclusive to generativists, but that they took the practice to new levels, and that, in part, the extremism followed from their attitudes toward Chomsky’s attributive practices.

33.乔姆斯基在这里与生成语义学的对比比这些引文所表明的还要直接，因为他特别指出生成语义学问题（如“使用......认知结构”—138）属于神秘主义阵营。

33. Chomsky’s contrast with generative semantics here is even more direct than these quotations indicate, since he specifically singles out generative semanticist issues (like the “use of … cognitive structures”—138), as falling in the mystery camp.

第十章

Chapter 10

1.请注意，这里的一般性回答部分否定了这个问题，推翻了它的主要前提；也就是说，就科学冲突而言，这场争论并不特别激烈。在非常公开的论坛上互相辱骂似乎是一种恶劣的行为，但在当时的背景下——特别是在 60 年代——这与维多利亚时代绅士之间“毫无顾忌地颠倒过来”的地质辩论（Edward Turner，在 Rudwick，1985：99-100）或居维叶革命后对拉马克的悼词（如此尖刻以至于直到居维叶死后才发表）或赫胥黎公开嘲笑主教或 _______（填空）没有什么不同。科学往往是一个非常激烈的过程，辱骂符合时代的风格。

1. Notice that the general answer here partially nullifies the question, revoking its chief presupposition; that is, the dispute was not especially acrimonious as scientific clashes go. Hurling obscenities at one another in very public forums may seem atrocious behavior, but within its context—in particular, within the sixties—it is no different than a geological debate among Victorian gentlemen turning “topsy turvy without scruple” (Edward Turner, in Rudwick, 1985:99–100), or Cuvier’s post-revolutionary eulogy of Lamarck, so vitriolic it wasn’t even published until after Cuvier’s death, or Huxley publicly ridiculing a bishop, or _______ (fill in the blank). Science is often a very agonistic process, and the vituperation follows the style of the times.

2.这种不发表引用出版物的倾向是如此突出，以至于它成为了生成语义自嘲的一个主题。例如，罗斯的致谢之一就是“致乔治·莱考夫，据说他和我（[不太可能]即将出版）正在写一本关于抽象语法的书”（1974b:123）。《Postal》（1972a [1969]:168）引用了“一篇毫无疑问永远不会写的论文，莱考夫、Postal 和罗斯（即将出版）”。但这样的评论并不总是针对作者：麦考利在将他的早期论文汇编成《语法和意义》（1976b）时，将许多引用从“莱考夫（即将出版）”格式改为“莱考夫（堕胎 a）”，一篇化名 Zwicky 的论文的参考文献包括多条带刺的条目：

2. This penchant for not delivering on cited publications was so prominent that it became something of a leitmotif in generative semantic self-mockery. One of Ross’s acknowledgments, for instance, goes “to George Lakoff, who and I ([improbably] forthcoming) are said to be writing a book about abstract syntax” (1974b:123). Postal (1972a [1969]:168) cites “a no doubt never-to-be-written paper, Lakoff, Postal, and Ross (forthcoming).” But such commentary was not always reflexive to the author: McCawley changed many of his citations when he collected his early essays into Grammar and Meaning (1976b) from the format “Lakoff (to appear a)” to “Lakoff (abortion a),” and the references for a pseudonymous Zwicky paper include the multibarbed entries:

考夫莱克，峡谷。（出处）自然逻辑与非自然语言学。

Coughlake, Gorge. (To appear a) Natural logic and unnatural linguistics.

考夫莱克，峡谷。（待发表 b）关于语言学中所有理论立场的事实不足，包括这一立场。

Coughlake, Gorge. (To appear b) On the factual inadequacy of all theoretical positions in linguistics, this one included.

Coughlake，Gorge。（待出版N 0）关于量词的直接事实，以及关于高级谓词的其他重要事实。（Zwicky，1970：149）

Coughlake, Gorge. (To appear N0) The straight truth about quantifiers, and other heavy facts about high predicates. (Zwicky, 1970:149)

3.但这并不是说没有兑现任何承诺。自 70 年代初以来，麦考利的工作很大程度上是为了兑现 60 年代末的承诺。例如，他对 70 年代的抽象分析很大程度上解决了早期生成语义学的简单性承诺；《语言学家一直想知道的一切逻辑》（1981）是迄今为止最详细的自然逻辑练习；《英语的句法现象》（1988）是生成语义学原理在语言描述的最全面应用。莱维的《复杂名词的句法和语义》（1978）满足了名词化转换分析的大部分承诺，生成主义者一直声称这是对乔姆斯基“言论”的回应。拉科夫的《女人、火和危险的东西》 （1987）解决了他后期的许多生成语义学承诺。但是，这些项目虽然不算太小，但肯定为时已晚。

3. This is not to say, however, that no promises were addressed and none fulfilled. McCawley’s work since the early seventies is largely an attempt to satisfy promises made in the late sixties. For instance, his abstract analyses of the seventies largely addressed the simplicity promises of early generative semantics; Everything That Linguists Have Always Wanted to Know about Logic (1981) is the most detailed exercise in natural logic, by far; and The Syntactic Phenomena of English (1988) is the most comprehensive application of generative semantics principles to linguistic description. Levi’s The Syntax and Semantics of Complex Nominals (1978) satisfies much of the promise of a transformational analysis of nominalization that generativists kept alleging was possible in response to Chomsky’s “Remarks.” Lakoff’s Women, Fire, and Dangerous Things (1987) addresses many of his late generative semantics promises. But, where these projects were not too little, they were certainly too late.

4.在 70 年代，人们常常称乔姆斯基为“语言学界的爱因斯坦”（Leber, 1975），而当时道尔蒂刚刚出版了《爱因斯坦和乔姆斯基论科学方法论》（1976b），因此布雷姆的题词显然是褒贬不一的。

4. It was fairly common in the seventies to call Chomsky the “Einstein of linguistics” (Leber, 1975), and Dougherty had just published “Einstein and Chomsky on Scientific Methodology” (1976b), so Brame’s epigraph was clearly meant to cut both ways.

5.拉科夫被宣布为头号公敌，这源于乔姆斯基的《评论》，在《评论》中，他被塑造为转型主义立场的主要支持者，而将生成语义学的罪责归咎于他，则成为乔姆斯基所有反生成语义学论文中的一个突出主题；在《一些经验问题》中，拉科夫是一个完整的替罪羊，而“莱科夫修正的生成语义学”（1972b [1969]:140）——即同质 II——是语言学的最低点，是最糟糕的理论。即使在他几乎不再讨论生成语义学论点之后，乔姆斯基仍然可以拿出几页来攻击莱科夫（1977 [1975]:52–54），他对莱科夫直接批评的回应充满了人身攻击。我并不是暗示（或排除）乔姆斯基煽动军队陷入对莱科夫的猛烈抨击，但至少，他的敌意有了一种向下趋于平缓的势头，就像卡尔·沃格特（Karl Vogt）在十九世纪中叶德国社会革命中所说的那样：“上层社会的残酷性会向下渗透，这种残酷性在上面只存在于思想中，在下面则以行动的形式表现出来”（Robertson，1952：413）。

5. The declaration of Lakoff as Public Enemy Number One has its roots in Chomsky’s “Remarks,” where he is set up as the chief proponent of the transformationalist position, and laying the sins of generative semantics at his feet continues as a prominent theme through all of Chomsky’s anti-generative semantics papers; by “Some Empirical Issues” Lakoff is a complete whipping boy, and “Lakoff’s revised generative semantics” (1972b [1969]:140)—that is, Homogeneous II—is the nadir of linguistics, the worst possible theory. Even after he had pretty much stopped addressing generative semantics arguments, Chomsky could still take a couple of pages out to attack Lakoff (1977 [1975]:52–54), and his responses to Lakoff’s direct criticism are rife with personal insults. I don’t mean to suggest (or, for that matter, preclude) that Chomsky stirred the troops into a Lakoff-bashing frenzy, but, at minimum, there was a gathering-momentum-on-the-downslope effect to his animosity, of the sort Karl Vogt remarked on in the midst of the social revolutions of mid-nineteenth-century Germany: “The brutality which is present in higher circles filters down, and this brutality which above lives only in thoughts, below takes the form of action” (Robertson, 1952:413).

6.罗斯的论文在跨语言特性方面不及格林伯格的论文，但从早期乔姆斯基的角度来看，它是卓越的——虽然它集中于英语，但它考虑了多种语言的数据，包括丹麦语、芬兰语、法语、德语、日语、拉丁语、俄语和塞尔维亚-克罗地亚语——而且罗斯非常清楚，他的工作涉及普遍原则，而不是英语特有的属性。

6. Ross’s thesis is not in the Greenbergian leagues in its cross-linguistic virtues, but in early-Chomskyan terms it is remarkable—while concentrating on English, it considers data from a variety of languages, including Danish, Finnish, French, German, Japanese, Latin, Russian, and Serbo-Croatian—and Ross is very clear that his work concerns universal principles, not English-specific properties.

7.这里一个有趣的对比是珀尔穆特，他和罗斯一样在麻省理工学院语言学系工作，也在那里的研究中遇到了很多麻烦。他很早就离开了，并且对该领域产生了强大的影响；罗斯留了下来，他对该领域的影响力几乎降到了零（当然，他早期的工作对乔姆斯基模型的发展仍然起到了重要作用）。

7. An interesting contrast here is Perlmutter, who, like Ross was in the MIT linguistics department, and who also had a great deal of trouble influencing research there. He left fairly early, and has had a powerful impact on the field; Ross stayed, and his influence on the field dwindled to almost nothing (though, of course, his earlier work continued to be quite instrumental in the development of Chomsky’s model).

8.参见 Lawler 对 Lakoff-Thompson 版认知语法的评论，他称其为“死的”和“胎死腹中的”，“只是从‘语言格式塔’（Lakoff，1977[a]）[到 Lakoff 与 Mark Johnson 合著的未出版的“经验语言学”] 的理论研究史上的一块垫脚石”（Lawler，1980：54，54，51）。Lawler 还援引了“死元语言”的隐喻，做出了一个非常糟糕但合理的预言：“现代希伯来语的奇迹似乎不会在 CG [认知语法] 中重演”（1980：54）。

8. See Lawler’s comments on the Lakoff-Thompson version of cognitive grammar, which he called “dead” and “stillborn” and “only a steppingstone in a history of theoretical research which proceeds through ‘Linguistic Gestalts’ (Lakoff, 1977[a]) [to unpublished work of Lakoff’s on “experiential linguistics” with Mark Johnson]” (Lawler, 1980:54, 54, 51). Lawler also says, invoking the metaphor of a “dead metalanguage” in a particularly poor but reasonable prophecy that “it does not look like the Miracle of Modern Hebrew will be repeated for CG [cognitive grammar]” (1980:54).

9.尽管 Kirsner (1991:171) 谈到了“认知语法的 Lakoff 派”，但实际上并不存在这样的派别。Langacker 有一个明确的、清晰的框架，而 Lakoff 并不像他在 70 年代那样热衷于将他广泛的关注嵌入一个明确的框架中。他是认知语法的同情者和同路人，是一个重要的思想家，但不是认知语法的共同表达者。正如 Kirsner 的引文（以及本书中的许多其他引文）所示，语言学家喜欢使用大写字母作为模型（转换语法在白话中是 TG，关系语法是 RG，生成语义学是 GS），他们谈论“做 RG”或“做 GS”，一位认知语法学家这样看待 Lakoff 的工作：毫无疑问，Lakoff 是一位认知语法学家，而且是一位杰出的、令人兴奋的认知语法学家，“但他不做大而全的认知语法。”有关这位大而全的认知语法学家对 Lakoff 角色的看法，请参阅 Langacker (1988a) 对《女人、火和危险事物》的评论。

9. Although Kirsner (1991:171) talks about “the Lakoff wing of Cognitive Grammar,” there really isn’t one. Langacker has a definite, articulated framework, and Lakoff is no more eager to embed his wide-ranging concerns in a definite framework than he was in the seventies. He is a sympathizer and fellow traveler, and an important idea man, but not a co-articulator, of cognitive grammar. As the Kirsner quotation (and many other quotations throughout this book) indicates, linguists are fond of using uppercase letters for models (transformational grammar is TG in the vernacular, relational grammar is RG, generative semantics is GS), and they talk about “doing RG” or “doing GS,” and one cognitive grammarian puts Lakoff’s work into perspective this way: Lakoff is, unquestionably, a cognitive grammarian, and a prominent, exciting one at that, “but he doesn’t do big-cee, big-gee, Cognitive Grammar.” See Langacker’s (1988a) review of Women, Fire, and Dangerous Things, for the biggest-cee, biggest-gee, Cognitive Grammarian’s view of Lakoff’s role.

10.布鲁斯·弗雷泽是麻省理工学院语言学系的一名早期毕业生，他设法比大多数人更好地避开了这场争论（尽管偶尔也会流露出他对生成语义学的同情）。1978 年，正当人们不可避免地意识到生成语义学在其为数不多的信徒眼中正在崩溃时，他在波士顿大学组织了一系列讲座，他自己对这个系列的贡献（仿照 70 年代的畅销书——Reich，1970 年）是“语言学的绿色化”。弗雷泽认为，乔姆斯基传统将语言缩小到过于抽象的关注点，并且这一传统正在分化为更加多样化、更加经验主义的关注点，例如社会语言学和功能研究。

10. Bruce Fraser, an early MIT linguistics graduate who managed to avoid the fray better than most (though occasionally letting his generative semantics sympathies show), organized a lecture series at Boston University in 1978, just as it was becoming unavoidably clear that generative semantics was collapsing around the ears of its few remaining adherents, and his own contribution to the series (patterned on a seventies bestseller—Reich, 1970) was “The Greening of Linguistics.” Fraser argued that the Chomskyan tradition had narrowed language to overly abstract concerns, and that the tradition was undergoing a fractionation into a more diverse group of more empirical concerns, such as sociolinguistic and functional research.

11.另一个很好的例证是科尔早期的论文集《句法和语义学》第 9 卷（1978 年），其中 12 篇文章中有 7 篇是由生成语义学家撰写的（其中四篇由哲学家撰写，剩下的一篇由吉翁撰写，他早期与生成语义学有联系，但是到 1969 年就放弃了这场争论）。

11. Another good indication is Cole’s early collection of essays in volume 9 of the Syntax and Semantics series (1978), seven of whose twelve articles are by generative semanticists (four are by philosophers, and the remaining one is by Givón, who had an early affiliation with generative semantics, but, by 1969 had turned his back on the dispute).

12.顺便说一句，关于关系语法的起源，波斯特尔的说法是，它与他参与生成语义学没有任何有趣的关系（不过，他也说，他并不是自己智力发展的权威，想法只是自己出现，他跟着它们走了一段时间，显然没有敏锐的感觉它们从何而来），而珀尔马特并没有说话。除了刚才勾勒出的明显相似之处之外，我自己的怀疑是，波斯特尔在生成语义学的边缘徘徊了一段时间，发现意义是一团未解的困惑，至少在短期内，它会导致比它解决的问题更多的问题，因此决定回到硬核语法。无论如何，他的版本的关系语法（弧对语法）在句法上是如此的严格，甚至连乔姆斯基都赞同它，并且在他和约翰逊的七百页的关系语法形式化（Johnson and Postal, 1980）中几乎没有任何语义讨论，除了对七十年代早期几个标准逻辑语法问题（如量词范围）的处理——相比其他生成语义学家的作品，或者 Jackendoff 的作品，或者像 Montague 语法这样的当代模型，讨论要少得多。

12. Postal’s word on the origin of relational grammar, by the way, is that there is no interesting way in which it grew out of his participation in generative semantics (he also says, however, that he is not a particularly good authority on his own intellectual development, that ideas just present themselves and he follows them for a while, without, apparently, any sharp sense of where they come from), and Perlmutter isn’t talking. My own suspicion, aside from the obvious parallels just sketched, is that Postal looked over the brink of generative semantics for a while, saw that meaning was such a morass of unsolved perplexities that it was going to cause more problems than it was going to solve, at least in the short run, and decided to go back to hardcore syntax. In any case, his version of relational grammar (arc pair grammar) is so hardcore syntactically that even Chomsky approves of it, and there is virtually no semantic discussion at all in his and Johnson’s seven-hundred-page formalization of relational grammar (Johnson and Postal, 1980), aside from some treatment of a few standard logical syntax problems of the early seventies, like quantifier scope—vastly less discussion than in the work of the remaining generative semanticists, for instance, or in the work of Jackendoff, or in contemporary models like Montague grammar.

13.另请参阅 Langacker (1986；1990；后者包含前者) 的更简洁的介绍、Rudzka-Ostyn (1988) 的关于该框架的探索性论文集（包括 Langacker—1988b 的另一篇简洁概述）以及新杂志《认知语言学》中的几乎所有内容。

13. See also, Langacker (1986; 1990; the latter containing the former) for more compact presentations, Rudzka-Ostyn (1988), for a collection of exploratory papers in the framework (including another succinct overview by Langacker—1988b), and virtually anything in the new journal, Cognitive Linguistics.

14. Langacker 就认知语法的根源所作的论述始于“认知语法在任何重要意义上都不是生成语义学的产物，但它与生成语义学一样，都关注明确处理意义，并提供统一的语法和词汇说明”（1987:4），这当然是准确的，但却大大低估了其影响力——也许是因为 Langacker 使用“生成语义学”来指代该理论的早期、更简洁的版本。当然，他热情地承认了 Lakoff 后期更模糊的研究的许多方面对其的影响。

14. Langacker’s words on the roots of cognitive grammar begins with “Cognitive grammar is not in any significant sense an outgrowth of generative semantics, but it does share with that conception a concern for dealing explicitly with meaning, and for providing a unified account of grammar and lexicon” (1987:4), which is certainly accurate, but understates the influence considerably—perhaps because Langacker is using “generative semantics” to refer to the early, neater version of the theory. Certainly he warmly acknowledges the influence of many aspects of Lakoff’s later and fuzzier research.

15. McCawley 引用了原文。译文由 HA Strong 翻译（Paul, 1891 [1886]:21）。当然，这种对语言多样性的强调，通过博阿斯-萨丕尔-沃尔夫的语言相对主义线索，让人回想起美洲印第安人的命令，而 Langacker 则对美洲印第安语言进行了广泛的研究，最初发现了各种生成语义学提议的一些证据（1973；1976a；1976b），后来采取了更直接的描述方法，就像他编辑的三卷犹他-阿兹特克研究（1977；1979；1982）一样。

15. McCawley quotes the original. The translation is by H. A. Strong (Paul, 1891 [1886]:21). This emphasis on language diversity, of course, harkens back to the Amerindian imperative by way of the Boas-Sapir-Whorf thread of linguistic relativism, and Langacker has worked extensively on Amerindian languages, initially finding some evidence for various generative semantics proposals (1973; 1976a; 1976b), and later taking a more straighforwardly descriptive approach, as in the three volumes of Uto-Aztecan studies he edited (1977; 1979; 1982).

16.关于这一点，请参阅安德森(1990b)的重新评价《斯金纳和乔姆斯基30年后》，该文最初在1989年LSA上发表，其精神分析副标题为《被压抑的回归》。

16. In this connection, see Andresen’s (1990b) reappraisal, “Skinner and Chomsky 30 Years Later,” originally presented to the 1989 LSA with the psychoanalytical subtitle, “The Return of the Repressed.”

17.无论如何，引用礼仪问题是一个非常复杂的问题，复杂到无法在此深入探讨，但很容易从生成语义学文献或几乎任何学术研究中找出类似的案例。一个有趣的近期例子是罗斯及其软性研究与认知语法的关系。在很多方面，认知语法都建立在罗斯在 70 年代中期苦苦挣扎的那种见解之上，如果该模型的影响力继续增长，那么罗斯在任何关注历史记录的人眼中都会显得绝对有远见卓识（其中还包括乔姆斯基、哈里斯、萨丕尔和博林格——他们都关注渐变），但他很少出现在认知语法文献中，甚至在拉科夫的著作中也是如此。请参阅 Pullum (1988; 1991:147–58) 中一些关于语言学引用的评论（无关，但与 Pullum 一样，令人着迷）。

17. The issue of citation etiquette, at any rate, is a very complex one, far too complex to delve into here, but it is quite easy to come up with parallel cases from the generative semantics literature, or from virtually any scholarly pursuit. One interesting recent example is Ross and the relation his squishiness work bears to cognitive grammar. In a great many ways, cognitive grammar is founded on the sorts of insights Ross was struggling with in the mid-seventies, and if that model continues to grow in influence, Ross will look absolutely visionary to anyone with any eye on the historical record (which also includes Chomsky, Harris, Sapir, and Bolinger—all of whom have been concerned with gradations), but he shows up rarely in the cognitive grammar literature, even in Lakoff’s work. See Pullum (1988; 1991:147–58) for some (unrelated but, as always with Pullum, fascinating) remarks on citation in linguistics.

从更普遍的角度来看，打捞是科学界广泛采用的做法。当两个程序发生冲突时，获胜的程序经常秘密地采用解决方案，数据和方法都来自失败者。即使在相对没有争议的情况下，科学提案也存在争议。例如，参见 Pullum (1991 [1983]:14)，关于 70 年代迅速从关系语法中吸收材料。

On a more general note, salvaging is a widely established practice in science. When two programs clash the victorious one frequently, and often covertly, incorporates solutions, data, and methods from the defeated one. Even in relatively uncontentious circumstances, proposals are up for grabs in science. See Pullum (1991 [1983]:14), for instance, on the rapid coopting of material from relational grammar in the seventies.

18.在其他有趣的方面，贝克的假设依赖于对最早的生成语义学理论之一——词汇主义假设的妥协，并采用了一种谓词提升版本来进行词汇合并。

18. In other interesting wrinkles, Baker’s hypothesis depends on compromising one of the earliest generative semantics beating-sticks, the lexicalist hypothesis, and adopts a version of Predicate-raising for lexical incorporation.

19.另见 Bach (1977:140–41)、Ruwet (1991:xxi-xxii)、Huck 和 Goldsmith (即将出版)，以及 Gazdar 的讽刺之作“正如人们经常指出的那样，语言的‘方面’观点不可避免地会导向生成语义学。REST [修订的扩展标准理论] 令人惊讶的是，乔姆斯基花了很长时间才到达那里”(1982:472)。除了前生成语义学家对乔姆斯基的模型与生成语义学越来越相似的抱怨和中立者的观察外，许多解释学家，尤其是那些听完他早期谴责的人，也感到非常困惑；特别参见 Brame (1979)。

19. See also Bach (1977:140–41), Ruwet (1991:xxi-xxii), Huck and Goldsmith (forthcoming), and Gazdar’s wonderfully snide “As has often been remarked, the ‘Aspects’ view of language leads inexorably to Generative Semantics. What is surprising about REST [the Revised Extended Standard Theory] is that is has taken Chomsky so long to get there” (1982:472). In addition to the complaints of ex-generative semanticists about the increasing resemblance of Chomsky’s model to generative semantics, and the observations of neutrals, many interpretivists, especially the ones who sat through his early condemnations, were very perplexed; see, in particular, Brame (1979).

20.如果有人关心的话，这篇评论（乔治，1989 年）是 Konrad Koerner 为他的Historiographia Linguistica所要求的。当他看到我的评论时，他改变了主意，并把它发给了一位同事征求意见，同事建议我拒绝。Koerner 随后写信给我，说我的评论不合适，原因多种多样，另一位读者也证实了这一点，并好心地建议我可以向其他一些期刊投稿。但他无意中附上了一封给这位读者的信的副本，泄露了一些内幕（特别是，这位读者是谁，Stephen Murray，正如 Koerner 所知，他对乔姆斯基的评价非常低；使事情复杂化的是，我的评论还包括对 Murray 早期作品的描述，这可能被视为敌意，而且确实如此）。当然，我们都交换了几封略带愤怒的信件，仅此而已。Word 的评论编辑（ Sheila Embleton）随后接受了它并发表，没有发表评论。文章发表了，但有人在编辑过程中删掉了令人反感的“我们都可以希望”（Harris，1991：328），因此现在的评论看起来更像是预测，而不是希望。总而言之，我认为，正义得到了伸张。“我们都可以希望”显然不合适，因为很多人会如此热情地选择不写“我们”。

20. If anyone cares, the review (of George, 1989) was requested by Konrad Koerner for his Historiographia Linguistica. He had second thoughts when he saw my review and sent it to a colleague for his advice, who recommended rejection. Koerner then wrote me that my review was unsuitable, for a variety of reasons that had all been confirmed for him by another reader, and kindly suggested some other journals to which I could submit it. But he inadvertently enclosed a copy of his letter to the reader which spilled some of the beans (in particular, who the reader was, Stephen Murray, someone whose opinion of Chomsky, as Koerner knew, is extremely low; complicating matters, my review also included a characterization of an earlier work of Murray’s which could have been, and was, taken as hostile). Of course, we all exchanged a few mildly incensed letters, and that was that. The review editor for Word (Sheila Embleton) subsequently accepted it for publication without comment. It came out, but someone somewhere along the editing chain snipped out the offending “we can all hope” (Harris, 1991:328), so that the comment now looks predictive rather than hopeful. All told, I suppose, justice was served. “We can all hope” clearly didn’t belong, since a good many people would so enthusiastically opt out of the we.

21.我省略了约翰逊-莱尔德为乔姆斯基理论演变的三个阶段所列举的范例：《句法结构》（1957a）代表初始理论，《方面》（1965 [1964]）代表标准理论， 《关于政府和约束的讲座》（1981a [1979]）以及《政府和约束理论的一些概念和后果》（1982b）代表政府和约束理论。

21. I have elided Johnson-Laird’s exemplars for each of the three stages of Chomskyan evolution he identifies—Syntactic Structures (1957a) for the initial theory, Aspects (1965 [1964]) for the standard theory, Lectures on Government and Binding (1981a [1979]) and Some Concepts and Consequences of the Theory of Government and Binding (1982b) for government-and-binding.

22.关于认知语法的一个相当激烈的争论是，它是否有权采用其名称的定义形容词，因为名称中隐含着其他语言框架（尤其是乔姆斯基的框架）不是认知的。这场争论中隐含的主张是，这两种框架中的研究对心理学家和其他认知研究人员的相关性。这场争论很有趣，但任何人都不应该忽视这样一个事实，即乔姆斯基的模型无疑是认知的；正如我们所见，主要是他的工作将认知问题引入了语言学。然而，与认知语法的主要区别在于，他的一般思维模型是模块化的，

22. One debate about cognitive grammar that has been fairly heated is its right to take the defining adjective of its name, since there is a barely covert implication in the name that other linguistic frameworks (especially Chomsky’s framework) are not cognitive. The submerged claim in this debate is the relevance of the research in either framework for psychologists and other cognitive researchers. The debate is interesting, but no one should lose sight of the fact that Chomsky’s model is unquestionably cognitive; as we have seen, it was largely his work that introduced cognitive concerns to linguistics. The principal difference from cognitive grammar, however, is that his general model of the mind is modular,

从某种意义上说，它由独立的、至少是部分独立的系统组成，每个系统都有自己的内在结构，每个系统都是专门为处理特定类型的问题而设计的，整个系统以某种方式相互作用，从而形成一个非常复杂的高度特殊结构的复合体。现在，根据我认为正确的观点，心灵或多或少类似于身体。我们如何看待人体？嗯，它基本上是一个器官复合体。人们不会指望找到涉及心脏作为特例、脾脏作为特例等的功能原理；它们都归于一个层次，即生物学层次，但如果你真的想研究大脑的结构，身体，你会问具体器官是如何运作的，它们的结构是什么，它们的原理是什么，它们的发育是如何由基因决定的，它们是如何相互作用的，等等。身体，即人体，是一个复杂而微妙的子系统，每个子系统都有非常特殊的特性和特殊的发展模式。那么，模块化方法对思维的看法基本上是相同的；它假设我们将在大脑中发现——大脑可能是我们所知道的宇宙中最复杂的系统，也可能是宇宙中最复杂的系统——我们将发现的东西在质量上与我们在任何其他已知的生物系统中发现的东西相似，即高度模块化和特定结构，并且将有一系列认知能力，如果你愿意的话可以称它们为心理器官——人们可能会认为它们类似于身体器官——并且这些认知能力中的每一个，这些心理器官中的每一个，都有自己非常特殊的属性，自己的特定结构属性，特定的物理表征，特定的发展模式。它会沿着预定的进程成熟。所有这些系统开花结果的结果将是高度丰富和复杂的心理表征，但彼此之间却截然不同，并且以系统基本遗传结构在生物学上决定的方式相互作用。（Chomsky 和 ​​Saporta，1978：308）

in the sense that it consists of separate, at least partially separate systems, each with its own intrinsic structure, each designed specifically to handle a particular kind of problem, with the whole system interacting in such a way as to create a very intricate complex of highly special structures. Now, on that … view, which I believe to be correct, the mind would be more or less analogous to the body. How do we think of the human body? Well, it is basically a complex of organs. One doesn’t expect to find principles of functioning which are going to involve the heart as a special case, the spleen as a special case, and so on; there is a level at which they all fall together, namely, the level of biology, but if you really want to study the structure of the body, you will ask how the specific organs function, what their structures are, what their principles are, how their development is genetically determined, how they interact with one another, and so on. The physical body, the human body, is an intricate and delicate system of interacting subsystems, each of which has very special characteristics and special modes of development. Well, the modular approach to the mind takes essentially the same view; it assumes that we are going to find in the brain—which is perhaps the most complicated system we know of in the universe, and maybe the most complicated system that exists in it—what we are going to find is qualitatively like what we find in any other biological system known to us, namely, a high degree of modularity and specific structure, and that there will be an array of cognitive faculties, call them mental organs if you like—one might think of them as analogous to the physical organs—and that each of these cognitive faculties, each of these mental organs, will have its own very specific properties, its own specific structural properties, its specific physical representation, specific mode of development. It’ll mature along a course that is predetermined. The result of the flowering of all these systems will be mental representations of a high degree of richness and intricacy, but quite different from one another and interacting in ways which are also biologically determined by the basic genetic structure of the system. (Chomsky and Saporta, 1978:308)

Langacker 的立场则截然不同：

Langacker’s position is very different:

语言是人类认知不可分割的一部分。因此，语言结构的解释应该与一般认知处理的知识相一致，无论人们假设一种特殊的语言“模块”（Fodor，1983）还是一种天生的语言能力。如果存在这种能力，它仍然嵌入在一般的心理矩阵中，因为它代表了起源不那么专业的结构的进化和固定。即使语言的蓝图在人类有机体中是遗传的，它们在语言习得过程中发展成一个完全指定的语言系统，以及在日常语言使用中的实施，显然取决于经验因素，并与不具有特定语言特征的心理现象密不可分。因此，我们没有理由预期语言能力和认知处理的其他方面之间存在尖锐的二分法。我们不应该抓住任何表面上的理由来断言语言的独特性和孤立性，而应该更认真地尝试整合语言学和认知心理学的研究成果。 … 有争议的是，语言之所以显得特殊，无法被更广泛的心理现象所吸收，主要是因为语言学家坚持以一种不恰当和极不自然的方式来分析它；一旦去除多层人工制品，语言就会开始显得更加自然，并且从我们对人类认知能力其他方面的了解来看，更容易学习。（1987：12-13）

Language is an integral part of human cognition. An account of linguistic structure should therefore articulate with what is known about cognitive processing in general, regardless of whether one posits a special language “module” (Fodor, 1983), or an innate faculté de langage. If such a faculty exists, it is nevertheless embedded in the general psychological matrix, for it represents the evolution and fixation of structures having a less specialized origin. Even if the blueprints for language are wired genetically into the human organism, their elaboration into a fully specified linguistic system during language acquisition, and their implementation in everyday language use, are clearly dependent on experiential factors and inextricably bound up with psychological phenomena that are not specifically linguistic in character. Thus we have no valid reason to anticipate a sharp dichotomy between linguistic ability and other aspects of cognitive processing. Instead of grasping at any apparent rationale for asserting the uniqueness and insularity of language, we should try more seriously to integrate the findings of linguistics and cognitive psychology. … To put it contentiously, language has appeared special and unassimilable to broader psychological phenomena mainly because linguists have insisted on analyzing it in an inappropriate and highly unnatural fashion; once the many layers of artifact are removed, language starts to look much more natural and learnable in terms of what we know about other facets of human cognitive ability. (1987:12–13)

你可以决定哪个论点更有分量（两者都很有说服力，但都依赖于一个隐性辅助前提网络），但很明显，朗盖克的通用模型使他的语言学品牌“更具认知性”，因为它建立在更广泛的心理机制和过程之上。哪一个更正确是一个经验问题，这个问题在一段时间内都不会得到解答，可能要很长时间。但现在问问自己，如果你是一名心理学家，这些论点会引导你采取什么行动。像乔姆斯基这样的孤立语言模型意味着，除其他事项外，你从探索其他心理结构中获得的任何结果或想法对于研究语言基本上都是无用的，你从研究语言中获得的任何见解对于你的其他工作基本上都是无用的。使用朗盖克高度集成的模型，获得可推广发现的可能性要大得多。

You can decide which argument carries more weight (both are pretty potent, but both depend on a network of tacit auxiliary premises), but there is a clear way in which Langacker’s general model makes his brand of linguistics “more cognitive,” since it builds on a wider array of mental mechanisms and processes. Which is more correct is an empirical question, one which won’t be answered for a while, possibly a very long while. But now ask yourself what action these arguments would lead you to if you were a psychologist. An insular model of language like Chomsky’s means, among other things, that any results or ideas you have from exploring other mental structures are essentially useless for looking at language, and any insights you come away with from looking at language are essentially useless for the rest of your work. The potential for generalizable findings is much greater with Langacker’s heavily integrated model.

23.这份清单主要取自 1979 年威斯康星大学密尔沃基分校举办的“当代句法方法”会议论文集，有时也被称为“句法抽奖” (Moravscik and Wirth, 1980; Kac, 1980)。Lakoff 的论文 (关于认知语法) 未发表 (但见 Lawler, 1980)；Brame 的论文发表在他的《现实句法论文集》 (1979:19-63) 中。

23. This list is taken pretty much from the proceedings of a 1979 conference on Current Approaches to Syntax at the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee, sometimes called the syntax sweepstakes (Moravscik and Wirth, 1980; Kac, 1980). Lakoff’s paper (on cognitive grammar) was not published (though see Lawler, 1980); Brame’s paper was published in his Essays toward Realistic Syntax (1979:19–63).

24.欲了解一个有趣的相似之处，请参见霍尔顿（1988[1973]：240）对马赫的评论；欲了解关于乔姆斯基与整个社会的关系的一些有趣的类似评论，这些评论可能暗示了他们在政治关注方面有一些重叠的动机，请参见奥特罗为乔姆斯基文集《语言与政治》所写的序言，其中转述了乔姆斯基在不同地方对自己青年时期的一些自传性评论：

24. For an interesting parallel, see Holton’s (1988 [1973]:240) comments on Mach, and for some intriguingly similar comments about Chomsky’s relation to society as a whole, perhaps suggesting some overlapping motivations for his political concerns, see Otero’s introduction to the Chomsky anthology, Language and Politics, paraphrasing some autobiographical remarks Chomsky has made in various places about his youth:

他总是感觉与周围的一切都格格不入……他总是孤独的，或者属于（政治信仰上的）极少数人……

He always felt completely out of tune with almost everything around him … he was always either alone or part of a tiny minority [in his political beliefs] …

他总是站在失败者一边……

He was always on the side of the losers …

[广岛原子弹爆炸后] 他独自走进树林，独自待了几个小时。他感到完全孤立无援。（Otero，1988：22）

[After the bombing of Hiroshima] he just walked off by himself into the woods and stayed alone for a couple of hours. He felt completely isolated. (Otero, 1988:22)

25. Newmeyer (1980a:206–7) 对这些碎片进行了一些分类，Wasow (1985) 也发表了一些类似的评论。我在之前的一篇文章中（Harris, 1989:106）有些过分，将一系列相关争论描述为“Chomsky 1 vs. Chomsky 2 vs. Chomsky 3 ……Chomsky n ”，但只是一点点。碎片主义最明显的症状之一是流行语的选择。Postal、Ross、Lakoffs、Gruber、McCawley 和许多其他人都是在 20 世纪 60 年代早期到中期出现的，当时 Chomsky 正在推动更深入、更抽象的分析，并且普遍宣扬抽象性的优点。下一波浪潮来自 Chomsky 浮出水面的时期，站在具体性和“现实主义”一边。因此，布雷姆在密尔沃基的论文是《现实主义语法》，其包含的选集（1979 年）是《走向现实主义句法论文集》；布雷斯南最著名的分离论文是《现实主义转换语法》（1978 年）。

25. Newmeyer (1980a:206–7) catalogs this debris somewhat, and Wasow (1985) makes some similar remarks. I went a little overboard in an earlier paper (Harris, 1989:106), characterizing the series of related disputes as “Chomsky1 vs. Chomsky2 vs. Chomsky3 … Chomskyn,” but only a little. Among the most obvious symptoms of debrisdom is the choice of buzzword. Postal, Ross, the Lakoffs, Gruber, McCawley, and many others came out of the early-to-mid-sixties, when Chomsky was pushing for deeper and more abstract analyses, and generally trumpeting the virtues of abstractness. The next wave, from the period when Chomsky was surfacing, came out on the side of concreteness and “realism.” So, Brame’s Milwaukee paper was “Realistic Grammar,” and its containing anthology (1979) was Essays toward Realistic Syntax; Bresnan’s best-known breakaway paper was “A Realistic Transformational Grammar” (1978).

Ross, John Robert [Háj]. 1973a. Slifting. In Gross, Halle, and Schützenberger (1973:133–72).
